Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(b): (2)(a) after complying with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(c): (4) having the training described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(d): directly supervising the patient;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(e): if the patient is a minor, having a current pediatric advanced life support certification;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(f): if the patient is an adult, having a current advanced cardiovascular life support certification;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(g): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(g)(i): having at least one individual in the procedure room who has advanced airway training and the knowledge and skills to recognize and treat airway complications and rescue a patient who entered a deeper than intended level of sedation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(g)(ii): if the anesthesia or sedation provider is administering ketamine for a non-anesthetic purpose, having at least one individual on site and available who has advanced airway training and the knowledge and skills to recognize and treat airway complications and rescue a patient who entered a deeper than intended level of sedation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(h): having access during the procedure to an advanced cardiac life support crash cart in the office with equipment that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(h)(i): is regularly maintained according to guidelines established by the American Heart Association; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(h)(ii): includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(h)(ii)(A): a defibrillator;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(h)(ii)(B): administrable oxygen;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(h)(ii)(C): age appropriate airway equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(h)(ii)(D): positive pressure ventilation equipment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(h)(ii)(E): unexpired emergency and reversal medications including naloxone for opioid sedation and flumazenil for benzodiazepine sedation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(i): using monitors that meet basic standards set by the American Society of Anesthesiologists and continually monitoring ventilatory function with capnography unless precluded or invalidated by the nature of the patient, procedure, or equipment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(j): entering appropriate information into the patient's chart or medical record, which shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(j)(i): the patient's name;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(j)(ii): the route and site the anesthesia or sedation was administered;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(j)(iii): the time of anesthesia or sedation administration and the dosage;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(j)(iv): the patient's periodic vital signs during the procedure; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(2)(j)(v): the name of the individual who monitored the patient's oxygenation and ventilation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(3): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(3)(a): (2) An anesthesia or sedation provider who violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(3)(b): An individual commits unprofessional conduct if the individual administers anesthesia or sedation for which the individual is not appropriately trained.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(4): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(a); (4)(a); 58-67-201; 58-68-201; 58-69-201
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(4)(a): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(a) In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(4)(a)(i): (1)(a) for each license described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(4)(a)(ii): that are based on standards created by nationally recognized organizations, such as the American Society of Anesthesiologists, the American Dental Association, or the American Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(4)(a)(iii): that include safety standards for general anesthetic use that are consistent with federal Food and Drug Administration guidance.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(4)(b): (4)(a); 58-67-201; 58-68-201; 58-69-201 For making rules described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(5): (2) The requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(6): An employer may not take an adverse employment action against an employee if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(6)(a): the employee notifies the division of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(6)(a)(i): a violation of this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(6)(a)(ii): a violation of any rule created by the division to implement this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-510(6)(b): the employment action is based on the individual notifying the division of the violation.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511 Prohibition on providing conversion therapy to a minor.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(1): Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act; Chapter 60, Mental Health Professional Practice Act; Chapter 61, Psychologist Licensing Act; Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act; 34A-5-102; 80-1-102 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(1)(a): "Conversion therapy" means a practice or treatment by which a health care professional intends to change a minor client's sexual orientation or gender identity, or to impose a different sexual orientation or gender identity upon a minor client, including a practice or treatment that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(1)(a)(i): subjects a minor client to physical discomfort through aversive treatment that causes nausea, vomiting, or other unpleasant physical sensation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(1)(a)(ii): provides electric shock or other electrical therapy, including electroconvulsive therapy or transcranial magnetic stimulation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(1)(a)(iii): subjects a minor client to touching themself or another individual as part of the therapy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(1)(a)(iv): causes the minor client to engage in physical self-harm or physical self-inflicted pain.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(1)(b): Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act; Chapter 60, Mental Health Professional Practice Act; Chapter 61, Psychologist Licensing Act; Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act "Health care professional" means an individual who is licensed, or an individual who provides mental health therapy as part of the individual's training for a profession that is licensed, under:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(1)(b)(i): Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(1)(b)(ii): Chapter 60, Mental Health Professional Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(1)(b)(iii): Chapter 61, Psychologist Licensing Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(1)(b)(iv): Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(1)(b)(v): Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(1)(b)(vi): Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(1)(c): "Minor client" means an individual who is younger than 18 years old and who consults, is examined or interviewed by, or receives services, care, or treatment from a health care professional who is acting in their professional capacity.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(1)(d): "Religious advisor" means an individual who is designated by a religious organization or association as clergy, minister, pastor, priest, rabbi, imam, bishop, stake president, or other spiritual advisor.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(1)(e): 34A-5-102; 80-1-102
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(1)(e)(i): 34A-5-102 "Sexual orientation" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(1)(e)(ii): 80-1-102 "Sexual orientation" does not include an action that would constitute sexual abuse or sexual exploitation as those terms are defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(2): A health care professional who is acting in their professional capacity may not provide conversion therapy to a minor client.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(3): A health care professional who is not intending to change a minor client's sexual orientation or gender identity, or to impose a different sexual orientation or gender identity upon a minor client, may engage in any professional and lawful conduct, including a practice or treatment by which the health care professional:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(3)(a): is neutral with respect to sexual orientation and gender identity;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(3)(b): provides a minor client with acceptance, support, and understanding;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(3)(c): provides treatment to a minor client who is considering a gender transition in any direction, including exploration of the timing thereof;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(3)(d): facilitates a minor client's social support, ability to cope, or the exploration and development of the minor client's identity, including sexual orientation or gender identity;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(3)(e): addresses unlawful, unsafe, premarital, or extramarital sexual activities in a manner that is neutral with respect to sexual orientation and gender identity;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(3)(f): discusses moral, philosophical, or religious beliefs or practices;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(3)(g): addresses body-image issues, social pressure, or sex or gender stereotypes;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(3)(h): addresses co-occurring mental health, neurological, developmental, trauma, or family issues;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(3)(i): helps a minor client to understand and assess the stages and timing of identity development;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(3)(j): consistent with other applicable laws, rules, orders, and ethical standards, discusses with a minor client's parent or guardian the mental health or development of a minor client; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(3)(k): assists the minor client to understand the medical, social, or other implications of decisions related to sexual orientation or gender identity.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(4): (2) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(4)(a): an individual who is both a health care professional and a religious advisor, when the individual is acting substantially in the capacity of a religious advisor and not in the capacity of a health care professional; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(4)(b): an individual who is both a health care professional and a parent or grandparent, when the individual is acting substantially in the capacity of a parent or grandparent and not in the capacity of a health care professional.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(5): A violation of this section is unprofessional conduct.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(6): A rule adopted under this title that defines "unprofessional conduct" shall be consistent with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-511(7): If any provision of this section or the application of any provision to any person or circumstance is held invalid by a final decision of a court of competent jurisdiction, the invalidity does not affect other provisions or applications of this section which can be given effect without the invalid provision or application, and to this end the provisions of this section are severable.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-601 Suicide prevention video -- Primary care providers.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-601(1): Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act; Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-601(1)(a): Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act "Nurse practitioner" means an individual who is licensed to practice as an advanced practice registered nurse under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-601(1)(b): Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act "Physician" means an individual licensed to practice as a physician or osteopath under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-601(1)(c): Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act "Physician assistant" means an individual who is licensed to practice as a physician assistant under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-601(1)(d): "Primary care provider" means a nurse practitioner, physician, or physician assistant.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-601(2): 26B-1-204 The division, in conjunction with the Division of Integrated Healthcare created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-601(2)(a): create a series of suicide prevention videos that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-601(2)(a)(i): are web-accessible;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-601(2)(a)(ii): are each no longer than 20 minutes in length; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-601(2)(a)(iii): include information about:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-601(2)(a)(iii)(A): individuals at-risk for suicide; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-601(2)(a)(iii)(B): suicide prevention and intervention; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-601(2)(b): provide, on the division's website, educational materials or courses that relate to suicide prevention that a primary care provider may complete at no cost and apply toward continuing competency requirements required by division rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-601(3): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (2) The division shall, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-601(3)(a): (2) producing the suicide prevention videos described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-601(3)(b): providing access to the videos to each primary care provider.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-602 Auricular detoxification certification.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-602(1): 58-31b-301(2)(a); (b); (d); (e); Chapter 60, Mental Health Professional Practice Act; Chapter 61, Part 3, Licensing; Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-602(1)(a): 58-31b-301(2)(a); (b); (d); (e); Chapter 60, Mental Health Professional Practice Act; Chapter 61, Part 3, Licensing; Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act "Health care provider" means an individual who is licensed under:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-602(1)(a)(i): 58-31b-301(2)(a); (b); (d); (e) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-602(1)(a)(ii): Chapter 60, Mental Health Professional Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-602(1)(a)(iii): Chapter 61, Part 3, Licensing
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-602(1)(a)(iv): Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-602(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-602(1)(b)(i): "NADA protocol" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-602(1)(b)(i)(A): a protocol developed by the National Acupuncture Detoxification Association; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-602(1)(b)(i)(B): an adjunctive therapy using one to five invariant ear acupuncture or acupressure points for the adjunctive treatment and prevention of substance use disorders or to provide support for individuals who have experienced physical or emotional trauma.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-602(1)(b)(ii): "NADA protocol" does not include the stimulation of other auricular or distal acupuncture points.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-602(2): A health care provider may perform the NADA protocol if the health care provider:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-602(2)(a): obtains a certification from the National Acupuncture Detoxification Association to perform the NADA protocol; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-602(2)(b): provides the division proof of obtaining the certification.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-602(3): A health care provider may perform a protocol substantially similar to the NADA protocol if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-602(3)(a): the division has determined the protocol is substantially similar to the NADA protocol; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-602(3)(b): the individual has met each requirement the division has created to perform the protocol.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-602(4): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (3) In accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603 Hormonal transgender treatment on minors -- Requirements.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1): Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act; 58-31b-301(2)(e); (1)(e)(i); Chapter 61, Psychologist Licensing Act; Chapter 60, Part 2, Social Worker Licensing Act; Chapter 60, Part 3, Marriage and Family Therapist Licensing Act; Chapter 60, Part 4, Clinical Mental Health Counselor Licensing Act; Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; (2) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(a): "Approved organization" means an organization with expertise regarding transgender health care for minors that is approved by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(b): "Biological sex at birth" means an individual's sex, as being male or female, according to distinct reproductive roles as manifested by sex and reproductive organ anatomy, chromosomal makeup, and endogenous hormone profiles.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(c): "Disorder of sexual development" means a sexual development disorder where an individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(c)(i): is born with external biological sex characteristics that are irresolvably ambiguous;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(c)(ii): is born with 46, XX chromosomes with virilization;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(c)(iii): is born with 46, XY chromosomes with undervirilization;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(c)(iv): has both ovarian and testicular tissue; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(c)(v): has been diagnosed by a physician, based on genetic or biochemical testing, with abnormal:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(c)(v)(A): sex chromosome structure;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(c)(v)(B): sex steroid hormone production; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(c)(v)(C): sex steroid hormone action for a male or female.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(d): Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act; 58-31b-301(2)(e) "Health care provider" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(d)(i): a physician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(d)(ii): Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act a physician assistant licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(d)(iii): 58-31b-301(2)(e) an advanced practice registered nurse licensed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(e): (1)(e)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(e)(i): "Hormonal transgender treatment" means administering, prescribing, or supplying for effectuating or facilitating an individual's attempted sex change:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(e)(i)(A): to an individual whose biological sex at birth is female, a dose of testosterone or other androgens at levels above those normally found in an individual whose biological sex at birth is female;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(e)(i)(B): to an individual whose biological sex at birth is male, a dose of estrogen or a synthetic compound with estrogenic activity or effect at levels above those normally found in an individual whose biological sex at birth is male; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(e)(i)(C): a puberty inhibition drug.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(e)(ii): (1)(e)(i) "Hormonal transgender treatment" does not include administering, prescribing, or supplying a substance described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(e)(ii)(A): precocious puberty;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(e)(ii)(B): endometriosis;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(e)(ii)(C): a menstrual, ovarian, or uterine disorder;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(e)(ii)(D): a sex-hormone stimulated cancer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(e)(ii)(E): a disorder of sexual development.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(f): Chapter 61, Psychologist Licensing Act; Chapter 60, Part 2, Social Worker Licensing Act; Chapter 60, Part 3, Marriage and Family Therapist Licensing Act; Chapter 60, Part 4, Clinical Mental Health Counselor Licensing Act "Mental health professional" means any of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(f)(i): a physician who is board certified for a psychiatry specialization recognized by the American Board of Medical Specialists or the American Osteopathic Association's Bureau of Osteopathic Specialists;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(f)(ii): Chapter 61, Psychologist Licensing Act a psychologist licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(f)(iii): Chapter 60, Part 2, Social Worker Licensing Act a clinical social worker licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(f)(iv): Chapter 60, Part 3, Marriage and Family Therapist Licensing Act a marriage and family therapist licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(f)(v): Chapter 60, Part 4, Clinical Mental Health Counselor Licensing Act a clinical mental health counselor licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(g): "Minor" means an individual who is less than 18 years old.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(h): Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act "Physician" means an individual licensed under:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(h)(i): Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(h)(ii): Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(i): "Puberty inhibition drug" means any of the following alone or in combination with aromatase inhibitors:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(i)(i): gonadotropin-releasing hormone agonists; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(i)(ii): androgen receptor inhibitors.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(1)(j): (2) "Transgender treatment certification" means a certification described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(2)(a): The division shall create a transgender treatment certification on or before July 1, 2023.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(2)(b): The division may issue the transgender treatment certification to an individual if the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(2)(b)(i): is a health care provider or a mental health professional; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(2)(b)(ii): has completed at least 40 hours of education related to transgender health care for minors from an approved organization.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(2)(c): The division may renew a transgender treatment certification:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(2)(c)(i): at the time an individual renews the individual's license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(2)(c)(ii): if the individual has completed at least 20 hours of continuing education related to transgender health care for minors from an approved organization during the individual's continuing education cycle.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(2)(d): Beginning January 1, 2024, providing a hormonal transgender treatment to a minor without a transgender treatment certification is unprofessional conduct.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3): (3)(a); (3)(b)(i); (ii); (3)(b)(v)(B); (3)(b)(vi)(B); (C); (3)(b)(viii); (ix); (1)(e)(i)(A); (B); (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(a): A health care provider may provide a hormonal transgender treatment to a minor only if the health care provider has been treating the minor for gender dysphoria for at least six months.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b): (3)(a); (3)(b)(i); (ii); (3)(b)(v)(B); (3)(b)(vi)(B); (C); (3)(b)(viii); (ix); (1)(e)(i)(A); (B); (4) Beginning July 1, 2023, before providing a hormonal transgender treatment to a minor described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(i): determine if the minor has other physical or mental health conditions, identify and document any condition, and consider whether treating those conditions before treating the gender dysphoria would provide the minor the best long-term outcome;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(ii): consider whether an alternative medical treatment or behavioral intervention to treat the minor's gender dysphoria would provide the minor the best long-term outcome;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(iii): (3)(b)(i); (ii) document in the medical record that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(iii)(A): (3)(b)(i); (ii) the health care provider has complied with Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(iii)(B): providing the hormonal transgender treatment will likely result in the best long-term outcome for the minor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(iv): obtain written consent from:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(iv)(A): the minor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(iv)(B): the minor's parent or guardian unless the minor is emancipated;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(v): (3)(b)(v)(B) discuss with the minor:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(v)(A): the risks of the hormonal transgender treatment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(v)(B): the minor's short-term and long-term expectations regarding the effect that the hormonal transgender treatment will have on the minor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(v)(C): (3)(b)(v)(B) the likelihood that the hormonal transgender treatment will meet the short-term and long-term expectations described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(vi): (3)(b)(vi)(B); (C) unless the minor is emancipated, discuss with the minor's parent or guardian:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(vi)(A): the risks of the hormonal transgender treatment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(vi)(B): the minor's short-term and long-term expectations regarding the effect that the hormonal transgender treatment will have on the minor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(vi)(C): the parent or guardian's short-term and long-term expectations regarding the effect that the hormonal transgender treatment will have on the minor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(vi)(D): (3)(b)(vi)(B); (C) the likelihood that the hormonal transgender treatment will meet the short-term and long-term expectations described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(vii): (3)(b)(viii); (ix) document in the medical record that the health care provider has provided the information described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(viii): provide the minor the following information if providing the minor a puberty inhibition drug:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(viii)(A): puberty inhibition drugs are not approved by the FDA for the treatment of gender dysphoria;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(viii)(B): possible adverse outcomes of puberty blockers are known to include diminished bone density, pseudotumor cerebri and long term adult sexual dysfunction;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(viii)(C): research on the long-term risks to children of prolonged treatment with puberty blockers for the treatment of gender dysphoria has not yet occurred; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(viii)(D): the full effects of puberty blockers on brain development and cognition are unknown;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(ix): (1)(e)(i)(A); (B) provide the minor the following information if providing a cross-sex hormone as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(ix)(A): the use of cross-sex hormones in males is associated with risks that include blood clots, gallstones, coronary artery disease, heart attacks, tumors of the pituitary gland, strokes, elevated levels of triglycerides in the blood, breast cancer, and irreversible infertility; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(ix)(B): the use of cross-sex hormones in females is associated with risks of erythrocytosis, severe liver dysfunction, coronary artery disease, hypertension, and increased risk of breast and uterine cancers; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(3)(b)(x): (4) upon the completion of any relevant information privacy release, obtain a mental health evaluation of the minor as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(4): The mental health evaluation shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(4)(a): be performed by a mental health professional who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(4)(a)(i): beginning January 1, 2024, has a current transgender treatment certification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(4)(a)(ii): is not the health care provider that is recommending or providing the hormonal transgender treatment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(4)(b): contain a determination regarding whether the minor suffers from gender dysphoria in accordance with the fifth edition of the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(4)(c): confirm that the minor and the mental health professional have had at least three therapy sessions; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(4)(d): document all of the minor's mental health diagnoses and any significant life events that may be contributing to the diagnoses.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603(5): (3) A violation of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603.1 Hormonal transgender treatment moratorium.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603.1(2)(a): 58-1-603 is a minor as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-1-603.1(2)(b): is not diagnosed with gender dysphoria before January 27, 2023.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 3a - Architects Licensing Act
**********************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Architects Licensing Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(1): "Architect" means a person licensed under this chapter as an architect.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(2): 58-3a-201 "Board" means the Architects Licensing Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(3): Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act "Building" means a structure which has human occupancy or habitation as its principal purpose, and includes the structural, mechanical, and electrical systems, utility services, and other facilities required for the building, and is otherwise governed by the State Construction Code or an approved code under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(4): "Complete construction plans" means a final set of plans and specifications for a building that normally includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(4)(a): floor plans;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(4)(b): elevations;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(4)(c): site plans;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(4)(d): foundation, structural, and framing detail;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(4)(e): electrical, mechanical, and plumbing design;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(4)(f): information required by the energy code;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(4)(g): specifications and related calculations as appropriate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(4)(h): all other documents required to obtain a building permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(5): 58-3a-103 "Fund" means the Architects Education and Enforcement Fund created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(6): 58-22-102
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(6)(a): "Practice of architecture" means rendering or offering to render the following services in connection with the design, construction, enlargement, or alteration of a building or group of buildings, and the space within and surrounding such buildings:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(6)(a)(i): planning;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(6)(a)(ii): facility programming;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(6)(a)(iii): preliminary studies;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(6)(a)(iv): preparation of designs, drawings, and specifications;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(6)(a)(v): preparation of technical submissions and coordination of any element of technical submissions prepared by others including, as appropriate and without limitation, professional engineers, and landscape architects; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(6)(a)(vi): administration of construction contracts.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(6)(b): 58-22-102 "Practice of architecture" does not include the practice of professional engineering as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(7): "Principal" means a licensed architect having responsible charge of an organization's architectural practice.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(8): "Supervision of an employee, subordinate, associate, or drafter of an architect" means that a licensed architect is responsible for and personally reviews, corrects when necessary, and approves work performed by any employee, subordinate, associate, or drafter under the direction of the architect, and may be further defined by rule by the division in collaboration with the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(9): 58-1-501; 58-3a-501 "Unlawful conduct" as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-102(10): 58-1-501 "Unprofessional conduct" as defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-103 Education and enforcement fund.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-103(1): There is created an expendable special revenue fund known as the "Architects Education and Enforcement Fund."
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-103(2): 63J-1-504 The fund consists of money from:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-103(2)(a): 63J-1-504 a surcharge fee placed on initial, renewal, and reinstatement licensure fees under this chapter in accordance with the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-103(2)(a)(i): 63J-1-504 the surcharge fee shall be determined by the department in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-103(2)(a)(ii): the surcharge fee shall not exceed 50% of the respective initial, renewal, or reinstatement licensure fee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-103(2)(b): administrative penalties collected pursuant to this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-103(3): The fund shall earn interest and all interest earned on fund money shall be deposited into the fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-103(4): The director may, with concurrence of the board, make distributions from the fund for the following purposes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-103(4)(a): education and training of licensees under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-103(4)(b): education and training of the public or other interested persons in matters concerning architectural laws and practices; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-103(4)(c): enforcement of this chapter by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-103(4)(c)(i): investigating unprofessional or unlawful conduct; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-103(4)(c)(ii): providing legal representation to the division when the division takes legal action against a person engaging in unprofessional or unlawful conduct.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-103(5): If the balance in the fund exceeds $100,000 at the close of any fiscal year, the excess shall be transferred to the General Fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-103(6): The division shall report annually to the appropriate appropriations subcommittee of the Legislature concerning the fund.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-105 Surcharge fee.
----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-105(1): 63J-1-504 In addition to any other fees authorized by this chapter or by the division in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-105(2): The surcharge fee shall be deposited in the General Fund as a dedicated credit to be used by the division to provide each licensee under this chapter with access to an electronic reference library that provides web-based access to national, state, and local building codes and standards.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-201 Board.
--------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-201(1): There is created the Architects Licensing Board consisting of four architects and one member of the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-201(2): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed and serve in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-201(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203 The duties and responsibilities of the board shall be in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-201(3)(a): assist the division in reviewing complaints concerning the unlawful or unprofessional conduct of a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-201(3)(b): advise the division in its investigation of these complaints.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-201(4): (3) A board member who has, under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-301 Licensure required -- License classifications.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-301(1): 58-3a-304; 58-1-307 A license is required to engage in the practice of architecture, except as specifically provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-301(2): The division shall issue a license in the classification of architect to a person who qualifies under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-302 Qualifications for licensure.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-302(1): (2); 63J-1-504 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-302(1)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-302(1)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-302(1)(c): have graduated and received an earned bachelors or masters degree from an architecture program meeting criteria established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-302(1)(d): have successfully completed a program of diversified practical experience established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-302(1)(e): have successfully passed examinations established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-302(1)(f): meet with the board or representative of the division upon request for the purpose of evaluating the applicant's qualifications for license.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-302(2): 63J-1-504 Each applicant for licensure as an architect by endorsement shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-302(2)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-302(2)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-302(2)(c): submit satisfactory evidence of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-302(2)(c)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-302(2)(c)(i)(A): current licensure in good standing in a jurisdiction recognized by rule by the division in collaboration with the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-302(2)(c)(i)(B): current certification from the National Council of Architectural Registration Boards; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-302(2)(c)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-302(2)(c)(ii)(A): current license in good standing in a jurisdiction recognized by rule by the division in collaboration with the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-302(2)(c)(ii)(B): full-time employment as a licensed architect as a principal for at least five of the last seven years immediately preceding the date of the application;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-302(2)(d): have successfully passed an examination established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-302(2)(e): meet with the board or representative of the division upon request for the purpose of evaluating the applicant's qualifications for license.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-303 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-303(1): The division shall issue each license under this chapter in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.  The division may by rule extend or shorten a renewal period by as much as one year to stagger the renewal cycles it administers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-303(2): 58-1-308 Each license automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless the licensee renews it in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-303.5 Continuing education.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-303.5(1): As a condition for renewal of a license under this chapter, each licensee shall, during each two-year licensure cycle or other cycle defined by rule, complete continuing professional education in accordance with standards defined by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-303.5(2): 58-3a-303 If a renewal period is extended or shortened under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-304 Exemptions from licensure.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-304(1): 58-1-307; Title 58, Chapter 22, Professional Engineers and Professional Land Surveyors Licensing Act In addition to the exemptions from licensure in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-304(1)(a): a person offering to render architectural services in this state when not licensed under this chapter if the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-304(1)(a)(i): holds a current and valid architect license issued by a licensing authority recognized by rule by the division in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-304(1)(a)(ii): discloses in writing to the potential client the fact that the architect:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-304(1)(a)(ii)(A): is not licensed in the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-304(1)(a)(ii)(B): may not provide architectural services in the state until the architect is licensed in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-304(1)(a)(ii)(C): that such condition may cause a delay in the ability of the architect to provide architectural services in the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-304(1)(a)(iii): notifies the division in writing of his intent to offer to render architectural services in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-304(1)(a)(iv): does not provide architectural services or engage in the practice of architecture in this state until licensed to do so;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-304(1)(b): a person preparing a plan and specification for one or two-family dwellings, including townhouses;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-304(1)(c): Title 58, Chapter 22, Professional Engineers and Professional Land Surveyors Licensing Act a person licensed to practice professional engineering under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-304(1)(d): unlicensed employees, subordinates, associates, or drafters of a person licensed under this chapter while preparing plans and specifications under the supervision of an architect;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-304(1)(e): a person preparing a plan or specification for, or supervising the alteration of or repair to, an existing building affecting an area not exceeding 3,000 square feet when structural elements of a building are not changed, such as foundations, beams, columns, and structural slabs, joists, bearing walls, and trusses; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-304(1)(f): an organization engaged in the practice of architecture, provided that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-304(1)(f)(i): the organization employs a principal; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-304(1)(f)(ii): all individuals employed by the organization, who are engaged in the practice of architecture, are licensed or exempt from licensure under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-304(2): (1)(b) Nothing in this section shall be construed to restrict a person from preparing plans for a client under the exemption provided in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-401 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for refusing to issue a license to an applicant, for refusing to renew the license of a licensee, for revoking, suspending, restricting, or placing on probation the license of a licensee, for issuing a public or private reprimand to a licensee, assessing an administrative penalty, and for issuing a cease and desist order shall be in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-501 Unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------
"Unlawful conduct" includes:Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-501(1): 58-3a-304(1) using the title "architect" or any other words, letters, or abbreviations indicating that the person using them is an architect if the person has not been licensed under this chapter, except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-501(2): 58-1-307; 58-3a-304 engaging in or representing itself as engaging in the practice of architecture as a corporation, proprietorship, partnership, or limited liability company unless exempted from licensure under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502 Penalty for unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(1): 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-3a-501; 58-3a-501; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-3a-501; 58-3a-501; (1); 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-3a-501; 58-3a-401; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; (1)(a); (1)(a); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(1)(a): 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-3a-501; 58-3a-501; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-3a-501; 58-3a-501; (1); 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-3a-501; 58-3a-401 If upon inspection or investigation, the division concludes that a person has violated Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(1)(a)(i): 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-3a-501; 58-3a-501; (1); 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-3a-501 A person who violates Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(1)(a)(ii): 58-3a-401 Except for a cease and desist order, the licensure sanctions cited in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(1)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act A citation shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(1)(b)(i): be in writing;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(1)(b)(ii): describe with particularity the nature of the violation, including a reference to the provision of the chapter, rule, or order alleged to have been violated;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(1)(b)(iii): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act clearly state that the recipient must notify the division in writing within 20 calendar days of service of the citation if the recipient wishes to contest the citation at a hearing conducted under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(1)(b)(iv): clearly explain the consequences of failure to timely contest the citation or to make payment of any fines assessed by the citation within the time specified in the citation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(1)(c): The division may issue a notice in lieu of a citation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(1)(d): Each citation issued under this section, or a copy of each citation, may be served upon a person upon whom a summons may be served in accordance with the Utah Rules of Civil Procedure and may be made personally or upon the person's agent by a division investigator or by any person specially designated by the director or by mail.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(1)(e): If within 20 calendar days from the service of the citation, the person to whom the citation was issued fails to request a hearing to contest the citation, the citation becomes the final order of the division and is not subject to further agency review.  The period to contest a citation may be extended by the division for cause.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(1)(f): The division may refuse to issue or renew, suspend, revoke, or place on probation the license of a licensee who fails to comply with a citation after it becomes final.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(1)(g): The failure of an applicant for licensure to comply with a citation after it becomes final is a ground for denial of license.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(1)(h): No citation may be issued under this section after the expiration of one year following the date on which the violation that is the subject of the citation is reported to the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(1)(i): (1)(a); (1)(a); (1)(a) The director or the director's designee shall assess fines according to the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(1)(i)(i): (1)(a) for a first offense handled pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(1)(i)(ii): (1)(a) for a second offense handled pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(1)(i)(iii): (1)(a) for any subsequent offense handled pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(2): An action initiated for a first or second offense which has not yet resulted in a final order of the division shall not preclude initiation of any subsequent action for a second or subsequent offense during the pendency of any preceding action.  The final order on a subsequent action shall be considered a second or subsequent offense, respectively, provided the preceding action resulted in a first or second offense, respectively.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(3)(a): The director may collect a penalty that is not paid by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(3)(a)(i): referring the matter to a collection agency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(3)(a)(ii): bringing an action in the district court of the county where the person against whom the penalty is imposed resides or in the county where the office of the director is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(3)(b): A county attorney or the attorney general of the state shall provide legal assistance and advice to the director in an action to collect a penalty.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-502(3)(c): A court shall award reasonable attorney fees and costs to the prevailing party in an action brought by the division to collect a penalty.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-601 Seal -- Design and implementation.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Every architect shall have a seal, the design and implementation of which shall be established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-602 Plans and specifications to be sealed.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-602(1): 58-3a-304; Title 58, Chapter 22, Professional Engineers and Professional Land Surveyors Licensing Act; Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act Any final plan and specification of a building erected in this state shall bear the seal of an architect licensed under this chapter, except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-602(2): 58-3a-304 Any final plan and specification of a building prepared by or under the supervision of the licensed architect shall bear the seal of the architect when submitted to a client, or when submitted to a building official for the purpose of obtaining a building permit, even if the practice is exempt from licensure under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-603 Seal -- Authorized use.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-603(1): An architect may only affix the architect's seal to a plan and a specification when the plan and the specification:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-603(1)(a): was personally prepared by the architect;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-603(1)(b): was prepared by an employee, subordinate, associate, or drafter under the supervision of a licensee, provided the licensee or a principal affixing his seal assumes responsibility;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-603(1)(c): was prepared by a licensed architect, professional engineer, or professional structural engineer in this state or any other state provided:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-603(1)(c)(i): the licensee in this state affixing the seal performs a thorough review of all work for compliance with all applicable laws and rules and the standards of the profession; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-603(1)(c)(ii): makes any necessary corrections before submitting the final plan and specification:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-603(1)(c)(ii)(A): to a building official for the purpose of obtaining a building permit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-603(1)(c)(ii)(B): to a client who has contracted with an architect for the design of a building, when the architect represents, or could reasonably expect the client to consider, the plans and a specification to be complete and final;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-603(1)(d): was prepared in part by a licensed architect, professional engineer, or professional structural engineer in this state or any other state provided:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-603(1)(d)(i): the licensee in this state clearly identifies that portion of the plans and specification for which the licensee is responsible;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-603(1)(d)(ii): the licensee in this state affixing the seal performs a thorough review of that portion of the plan and specification for which the licensee is responsible for compliance with the standards of the profession; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-603(1)(d)(iii): makes any necessary corrections before submitting the final plan and specification for which the licensee is responsible:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-603(1)(d)(iii)(A): to a building official for the purpose of obtaining a building permit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-603(1)(d)(iii)(B): to a client who has contracted with an architect for the design of a building, when the architect represents, or could reasonably expect the client to consider, the plans and specifications to be complete and final;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-603(1)(e): was prepared by a person exempt from licensure as an architect, professional engineer, or professional structural engineer provided that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-603(1)(e)(i): the licensee in this state affixing the seal performs a thorough review for compliance with all applicable laws and rules and the standards of the profession; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-603(1)(e)(ii): makes any necessary corrections before submitting the final plan and specification:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-603(1)(e)(ii)(A): to a building official for the purpose of obtaining a building permit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-603(1)(e)(ii)(B): to a client who has contracted with an architect for the design of a building, when the architect represents, or could reasonably expect the client to consider, the plan and specification to be complete and final; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-3a-603(1)(f): meet any additional requirements established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 4a - Utah Professionals Health Program
*******************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Utah Professionals Health Program."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-102(1): "Diversion agreement" means a written agreement entered into by a licensee and the division that describes the requirements of the licensee's monitoring regimen and that was entered into before May 12, 2020.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-102(2): Title 58, Chapter 5a, Podiatric Physician Licensing Act; Title 58, Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 28, Veterinary Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 69, Dentist and Dental Hygienist Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act "Licensee" means an individual licensed to practice under:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-102(2)(a): Title 58, Chapter 5a, Podiatric Physician Licensing Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-102(2)(b): Title 58, Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-102(2)(c): Title 58, Chapter 28, Veterinary Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-102(2)(d): Title 58, Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-102(2)(e): Title 58, Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-102(2)(f): Title 58, Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-102(2)(g): Title 58, Chapter 69, Dentist and Dental Hygienist Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-102(2)(h): Title 58, Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-102(3): "Program" means the Utah Professionals Health Program.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-102(4): "Program contract" means a written agreement entered into by a licensee and the division that allows the licensee to participate in the program.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-102(5): 26B-5-501 "Substance use disorder" means the same as that term is defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-103 Program established.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-103(1): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The division, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-103(2): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-103(2)(a): entry into and participation of licensees in the program;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-103(2)(b): successful completion of the program;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-103(2)(c): expulsion from the program; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-103(2)(d): disqualifying a licensee from participation in the program.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-103(3): The division shall promote the program by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-103(3)(a): engaging in wellness education and outreach to licensees, students, and the community in order to make them aware of the existence and purpose of the program;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-103(3)(b): partnering with health care organizations, universities, trade associations, and other stakeholder groups to promote professional awareness and wellness; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-103(3)(c): providing guidance to employers, colleagues, and family members on initiating conversations with licensees about substance use.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-104 Committees.
-------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-104(1): 58-1-203 In accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-104(1)(a): the executive director of the Department of Commerce, or the designee of the executive director of the Department of Commerce, who shall serve as chair;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-104(1)(b): the director of the Division of Substance Abuse and Mental Health or the director's designee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-104(1)(c): the following members appointed by the director of the division:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-104(1)(c)(i): one member of the public; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-104(1)(c)(ii): six licensees.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-104(2): The executive advisory committee shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-104(2)(a): advise the division and make recommendations to the division on policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-104(2)(b): serve without compensation, travel costs, or per diem for their services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-104(2)(c): perform other duties as directed by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-104(3): Members of the executive advisory committee are immune from civil liability for any actions or judgments made in the execution of duties performed in service of the executive committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-104(4): 58-1-203 In accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-104(5): The clinical advisory committee shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-104(5)(a): advise the division and make recommendations to the division on actions regarding specific program contracts;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-104(5)(b): perform duties as assigned by the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-104(5)(c): serve without compensation, travel costs, or per diem for their services.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-104(6): (1); (4) The committees described in Subsections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-105 Program contract.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-105(1): 63G-4-206 A licensee may enter into a program contract:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-105(1)(a): 63G-4-206 any time before the conclusion of a hearing under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-105(1)(b): if the licensee who enters into the program contract has a substance use disorder.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-105(2): A licensee may enter into a program contract to replace a diversion agreement the licensee previously entered into with the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-105(3): A licensee who does not have a substance use disorder may not enter into a program contract with the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-105(4): 58-4a-104 The committees described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-105(5): A decision by the program not to permit a licensee to participate in the program is not subject to appeal, agency review, or judicial review.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-106 Effect on other disciplinary proceedings.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-106(1): Findings of fact stipulated to in a program contract are binding admissions on the licensee in any proceeding to terminate the program contract or any other division disciplinary administrative proceeding.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-106(2): If the program contract is entered into after an adjudicative proceeding has commenced, the adjudicative proceeding shall be stayed pending successful completion of the program contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-106(3): Acceptance of a licensee into the program does not preclude the division from investigating or taking disciplinary action against the licensee for other misconduct that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-106(3)(a): is not included in the program contract; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-106(3)(b): was committed at any time before or after the licensee entered into the program contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-106(4): 58-1-401(6) The period described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-106(5): Title 58, Chapter 1, Part 4, License Denial In any proceedings to determine disciplinary sanctions under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-106(5)(a): successful completion of the program;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-106(5)(b): failure to complete the program; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-106(5)(c): the contents of the program contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-106(6): A licensee terminated from the program may have disciplinary action taken against the licensee for misconduct committed before, during, or after the licensee's participation in the program.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-107 Violation of a program contract -- Adjudicative proceedings -- Penalties.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-107(1): The division shall serve an order to show cause on the licensee if the licensee:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-107(1)(a): violates any term or condition of the program contract or diversion agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-107(1)(b): makes an intentional, material misrepresentation of fact in the program contract or diversion agreement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-107(1)(c): violates any rule or law governing the licensee's profession.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-107(2): (1); 63G-4-201(2) The order to show cause described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-107(2)(a): describe the alleged misconduct;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-107(2)(b): set a time and place for a hearing before an administrative law judge to determine whether the licensee's program contract should be terminated; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-107(2)(c): 63G-4-201(2) contain all of the information required by a notice of agency action in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-107(3): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; (2) Proceedings to terminate a program contract shall comply with the rules for a formal proceeding described in
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-107(4): 63G-4-205(1) In accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-107(5): During a proceeding to terminate a program contract, the licensee, the licensee's legal representative, and the division shall have access to information contained in the division's program file as permitted by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-107(6): (3) The director shall terminate the program contract and place the licensee on probation for a period of five years, with probationary terms matching the terms of the program contract, if, during the administrative proceedings described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-107(6)(a): violated the program contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-107(6)(b): made an intentional material misrepresentation of fact in the program contract; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-107(6)(c): violated a law or rule governing the licensee's profession.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-107(7): (3) If, during the proceedings described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-4a-107(8): Title 58, Chapter 1, Part 4, License Denial A licensee who is terminated from the program may have disciplinary action taken under

Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 5a - Podiatric Physician Licensing Act
*******************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Podiatric Physician Licensing Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions under SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(1): 58-5a-201 "Board" means the Podiatric Physician Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(2): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Indirect supervision" means the same as that term is defined by the division by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(3): "Medical assistant" means an unlicensed individual working under the indirect supervision of a licensed podiatric physician and engaging in specific tasks assigned by the licensed podiatric physician in accordance with the standards and ethics of the podiatry profession.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(4): 58-5a-103 "Practice of podiatry" means the diagnosis and treatment of conditions affecting the human foot and ankle and their manifestations of systemic conditions by all appropriate and lawful means, subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(5): 58-1-501 "Unlawful conduct" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(5)(a): 58-1-501 the conduct that constitutes unlawful conduct under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(5)(b): for an individual who is not licensed under this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(5)(b)(i): using the title or name podiatric physician, podiatrist, podiatric surgeon, foot doctor, foot specialist, or D.P.M.; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(5)(b)(ii): implying or representing that the individual is qualified to practice podiatry.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(6): 58-1-501; 58-5a-306; 58-37-2; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (6)(a)(i); (xi); 58-1-501(1); Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 2, Cannabinoid Research and Medical Cannabis; Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 2, Cannabinoid Research and Medical Cannabis; 26B-4-201
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(6)(a): 58-1-501; 58-5a-306; 58-37-2; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (6)(a)(i); (xi); 58-1-501(1); Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 2, Cannabinoid Research and Medical Cannabis "Unprofessional conduct" includes, for an individual licensed under this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(6)(a)(i): 58-1-501 the conduct that constitutes unprofessional conduct under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(6)(a)(ii): communicating to a third party, without the consent of the patient, information the individual acquires in treating the patient, except as necessary for professional consultation regarding treatment of the patient;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(6)(a)(iii): allowing the individual's name or license to be used by an individual who is not licensed to practice podiatry under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(6)(a)(iv): 58-5a-306 except as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(6)(a)(v): using alcohol or drugs, to the extent the individual's use of alcohol or drugs impairs the individual's ability to practice podiatry;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(6)(a)(vi): 58-37-2 unlawfully prescribing, selling, or giving away any prescription drug, including controlled substances, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(6)(a)(vii): gross incompetency in the practice of podiatry;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(6)(a)(viii): willfully and intentionally making a false statement or entry in hospital records, medical records, or reports;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(6)(a)(ix): willfully making a false statement in reports or claim forms to governmental agencies or insurance companies with the intent to secure payment not rightfully due;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(6)(a)(x): willfully using false or fraudulent advertising;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(6)(a)(xi): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act conduct the division defines as unprofessional conduct by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(6)(a)(xii): (6)(a)(i); (xi); 58-1-501(1) falsely making an entry in, or altering, a medical record with the intent to conceal:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(6)(a)(xii)(A): a wrongful or negligent act or omission of an individual licensed under this chapter or an individual under the direction or control of an individual licensed under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(6)(a)(xii)(B): (6)(a)(i); (xi); 58-1-501(1) conduct described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(6)(a)(xiii): Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 2, Cannabinoid Research and Medical Cannabis violating the requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-102(6)(b): Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 2, Cannabinoid Research and Medical Cannabis; 26B-4-201 "Unprofessional conduct" does not include, in accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103 Scope of practice.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(1): Subject to the provisions of this section, an individual licensed as a podiatric physician under this chapter may perform a surgical procedure on a bone of the foot or ankle.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(2): (3); (4) Except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(2)(a): an ankle fusion;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(2)(b): a massive ankle reconstruction; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(2)(c): a reduction of a trimalleolar ankle fracture.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(3): (4) An individual licensed as a podiatric physician under this chapter who meets the requirements described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(3)(a): treat a fracture of the tibia if at least one portion of the fracture line enters the ankle joint;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(3)(b): treat a foot or ankle condition using hardware, including screws, plates, staples, pins, and wires, if at least one portion of the hardware system is attached to a bony structure at or below the ankle mortise; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(3)(c): place hardware for the treatment of soft tissues in the foot or ankle no more proximal than the distal 10 centimeters of the tibia.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(4): (3); (2); (4)(c)(i); (4)(c)(i) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(4)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(4)(a)(i): graduated on or after June 1, 2006, from a three-year residency program in podiatric medicine and surgery that was accredited, at the time of graduation, by the Council on Podiatric Medical Education; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(4)(a)(ii): is board certified in reconstructive rearfoot and ankle surgery by the American Board of Foot and Ankle Surgery;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(4)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(4)(b)(i): graduated on or after June 1, 2006, from a three-year residency program in podiatric medicine and surgery that was accredited, at the time of graduation, by the Council on Podiatric Medical Education;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(4)(b)(ii): is board qualified in reconstructive rearfoot ankle surgery by the American Board of Foot and Ankle Surgery; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(4)(b)(iii): provides the division documentation that the podiatric physician has completed training or experience, which the division determines is acceptable, in standard or advanced rearfoot and ankle procedures; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(4)(c): (4)(c)(i); (4)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(4)(c)(i): graduated before June 1, 2006, from a residency program in podiatric medicine and surgery that was at least two years in length and that was accredited, at the time of graduation, by the Council on Podiatric Medical Education;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(4)(c)(ii): (4)(c)(i); (4)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(4)(c)(ii)(A): is board certified in reconstructive rearfoot ankle surgery by the American Board of Foot and Ankle Surgery;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(4)(c)(ii)(B): (4)(c)(i) if the residency described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(4)(c)(ii)(C): (4)(c)(i) in addition to the residency described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(4)(c)(iii): provides the division documentation that the podiatric physician has completed training and experience, which the division determines is acceptable, in standard or advanced rearfoot and ankle procedures.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(5): An individual licensed as a podiatric physician under this chapter may not perform an amputation proximal to Chopart's joint.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(6): 26B-2-201 An individual licensed as a podiatric physician under this chapter may not perform a surgical treatment on an ankle, on a governing structure of the foot or ankle above the ankle, or on a structure related to the foot or ankle above the ankle, unless the individual performs the surgical treatment:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(6)(a): 26B-2-201 in an ambulatory surgical facility, a general acute hospital, or a specialty hospital, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-103(6)(b): subject to review by a quality care review body that includes qualified, licensed physicians and surgeons.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-201 Podiatric Physician Board.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-201(1): There is created the Podiatric Physician Board consisting of four podiatric physicians and one member of the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-201(2): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed and serve in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-201(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203 The duties and responsibilities of the board are in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-201(4): In addition, the board shall designate one of its members on a permanent or rotating basis to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-201(4)(a): assist the division in reviewing complaints concerning the unlawful or unprofessional conduct of a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-201(4)(b): advise the division in its investigation of these complaints.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-201(5): (4) A board member who has, under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-301 License required -- License classifications.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-301(1): The division shall issue to persons qualified under this chapter a license in the classification of podiatric physician.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-301(2): A person may not practice podiatry unless licensed or exempted from licensure under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-302 Qualifications to practice podiatry.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
An applicant for licensure to practice podiatry shall:Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-302(1): submit an application in a form as prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-302(2): 63J-1-504 pay a fee as determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-302(3): provide satisfactory documentation of having successfully completed a program of professional education preparing an individual as a podiatric physician, as evidenced by having received an earned degree of doctor of podiatric medicine from a podiatry school or college accredited by the Council on Podiatric Medical Education;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-302(4): (3); Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act if licensed on or after July 1, 2015, satisfy the division and board that the applicant:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-302(4)(a): has successfully completed 24 months of resident training in a program approved by the Council on Podiatric Medical Education; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-302(4)(b): (3); Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-302(4)(b)(i): (3) has successfully completed 12 months of resident training in a program approved by the Council on Podiatric Medical Education after receiving a degree of doctor of podiatric medicine as required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-302(4)(b)(ii): has been accepted in, and is successfully participating in, progressive resident training in a Council on Podiatric Medical Education approved program within Utah, in the applicant's second or third year of postgraduate training; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-302(4)(b)(iii): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act has agreed to surrender to the division the applicant's license as a podiatric physician without any proceedings under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-302(5): pass examinations required by rule.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-303 Terms of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-303(1): The division shall issue all licenses under this chapter in accordance with the two-year renewal cycle established by rule.  A renewal period for a license may be extended or shortened by as much as one year to maintain established renewal cycles or to change an established renewal cycle.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-303(2): At the time of renewal the licensee shall show satisfactory evidence of renewal requirements established by rule, including completion of continuing education as required under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-303(3): 58-1-308 A license issued under this chapter expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless renewed prior to that date by the licensee in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-304 Continuing education.
-----------------------------------------------------
