Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-304(1): The division may require each person holding a license under this chapter to complete in each two-year period not more than 40 hours of qualified continuing professional education in accordance with standards defined by rule as a requirement prior to license renewal under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-304(2): In establishing continuing education requirements under this section the division shall in collaboration with the board recognize the existing educational methods, procedures, devices, and programs in use among the various podiatry specialty organizations.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-304(3): The division shall give licensees credit toward continuing education requirements for participation in and completion of continuing education programs of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-304(3)(a): the American Podiatric Medical Association;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-304(3)(b): the Utah Podiatric Medical Association;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-304(3)(c): all colleges of podiatric medicine accredited by the Council on Education of the American Podiatric Medical Association; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-304(3)(d): similar programs of other organizations that are approved by the division in collaboration with the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-304(4): If a renewal period is shortened or extended to effect a change of the renewal cycle, the continuing education hours required for that renewal period shall be increased or decreased accordingly, as a pro rata amount of the requirements of a two-year period.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-306 Exemptions from licensure.
----------------------------------------------------------
The following persons may practice podiatry, subject to stated circumstances and limitations, without being licensed under this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-306(1): a podiatric physician serving in the armed forces of the United States, the United States Public Health Service, the United States Department of Veterans Affairs, or other federal agencies while engaged in activities regulated under this chapter as a part of his employment with that federal agency if the individual holds a valid license to practice podiatry issued by any other state or jurisdiction recognized by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-306(2): a student engaged in activities that constitute the practice of podiatry while in training in a recognized school approved by the division to the extent the activities are under the supervision of qualified faculty or staff and the activities are a defined part of the training program;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-306(3): a person engaged in an internship, residency, preceptorship, postceptorship, fellowship, apprenticeship, or on-the-job training program approved by the division while under the supervision of qualified persons;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-306(4): a person residing in another state and licensed to practice podiatry there, who is called in for a consultation by a person licensed in this state and services provided are limited to that consultation or who is invited by a recognized school, association, society, or other body approved by the division to conduct a lecture, clinic, or demonstration of the practice of podiatry so long as that individual does not establish a place of business or regularly engage in the practice of podiatry in the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-306(5): a person licensed under the laws of this state to practice or engage in any other occupation or profession while engaged in the lawful, professional, and competent practice of that occupation or profession;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-306(6): persons who fit or sell corrective shoes, arch supports, or similar devices, to the extent their acts and practices involve only the fitting and selling of these items; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-306(7): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act a medical assistant working under the indirect supervision of a licensed podiatric physician, if the medical assistant:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-306(7)(a): engages only in tasks appropriately delegated by the licensed podiatric physician in accordance with the standards and ethics of the practice of podiatry, and consistent with this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-306(7)(b): does not perform surgical procedures;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-306(7)(c): does not prescribe prescription medications;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-306(7)(d): does not administer anesthesia, except for a local anesthetic; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-306(7)(e): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act does not engage in other practices or procedures defined by the division by rule made in accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-307 Consumer access to provider charges.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Beginning January 1, 2011, a podiatric physician licensed under this chapter shall, when requested by a consumer:Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-307(1): make a list of professional charges available for the consumer which includes the podiatric physician's 25 most frequently performed:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-307(1)(a): clinical procedures or clinical services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-307(1)(b): out-patient procedures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-307(1)(c): in-patient procedures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-307(2): provide the consumer with information regarding any discount available for:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-307(2)(a): services not covered by insurance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-307(2)(b): prompt payment of billed charges.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-401 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-401(1): The division shall refuse to issue a license to an applicant and shall refuse to renew or shall revoke, suspend, or place on probation the license of a licensee who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-401(1)(a): does not meet the qualifications for licensure or renewal of licensure under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-401(1)(b): is guilty of a crime which, when considered with the functions and duties of a licensee under this chapter, demonstrates a threat or potential threat to the public health, safety, or welfare.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-401(2): 58-1-501 The division may refuse to issue a license to an applicant and shall refuse to renew or shall revoke, suspend, or place on probation the license of a licensee who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-401(2)(a): 58-1-501 is guilty of unlawful conduct related to practice under this chapter or unprofessional conduct as defined in this chapter, Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-401(2)(b): has obtained or attempted to obtain a license under this title by fraud or willful misrepresentation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-401(2)(c): has had a license or certification to practice in any profession or occupation subjected to disciplinary action which demonstrates a threat or potential threat to the public health, safety, or welfare, when considered with the activities regulated under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-5a-501 Unlawful conduct -- Penalties.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Any person who engages in unlawful conduct as defined in this chapter is guilty of a third degree felony, except that a violation of Subsection

Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 9 - Funeral Services Licensing Act
***************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-101 Title.
-------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Funeral Services Licensing Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102 Definitions.
-------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(1): "Alkaline hydrolysis" means a water-based dissolution process using alkaline chemicals, heat, and sometimes agitation or pressure that reduces human remains to a liquid and to dry bone residue and includes the disposal of the liquid and the processing and pulverization of the dry bone residue.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(2): "Alkaline hydrolysis chamber" means the enclosed space within which the alkaline hydrolysis process takes place and that is used exclusively for alkaline hydrolysis of human remains.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(3): "Alkaline hydrolysis container" means a container:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(3)(a): in which human remains are transported to a funeral service establishment and placed in an alkaline hydrolysis chamber for resomation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(3)(b): that meets substantially all of the following standards:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(3)(b)(i): able to be closed in order to provide a complete covering for the human remains;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(3)(b)(ii): resistant to leakage or spillage;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(3)(b)(iii): rigid enough for handling with ease; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(3)(b)(iv): able to provide protection for the health, safety, and personal integrity of crematory personnel.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(4): "Authorizing agent" means a person legally entitled to authorize the cremation or the alkaline hydrolysis process of human remains.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(5): "Beneficiary" means the individual who, at the time of the individual's death, is to receive the benefit of the property and services purchased under a preneed funeral arrangement.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(6): 58-9-201 "Board" means the Board of Funeral Service created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(7): "Body part" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(7)(a): a limb or other portion of the anatomy that is removed from a person or human remains for medical purposes during treatment, surgery, biopsy, autopsy, or medical research; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(7)(b): a human body or any portion of a body that has been donated to science for medical research purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(8): "Buyer" means a person who purchases a preneed funeral arrangement.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(9): "Calcination" means a process in which a dead human body is reduced by intense heat to a residue that is not as substantive as the residue that follows cremation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(10): "Cremated remains" means all the remains of a cremated body recovered after the completion of the cremation process, including pulverization which leaves only bone fragments reduced to unidentifiable dimensions and may possibly include the residue of foreign matter including casket material, bridgework, or eyeglasses that were cremated with the human remains.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(11): "Cremation" means the technical process, using direct flame and heat, or a chemical process, that reduces human remains to bone fragments through heat and evaporation, or a chemical process, and includes the processing and usually the pulverization of the bone fragments.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(12): "Cremation chamber" means the enclosed space within which the cremation process takes place and which is used exclusively for the cremation of human remains.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(13): "Cremation container" means the container:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(13)(a): in which the human remains are transported to the crematory and placed in the cremation chamber for cremation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(13)(b): that meets substantially all of the following standards:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(13)(b)(i): composed of readily combustible or consumable materials suitable for cremation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(13)(b)(ii): able to be closed in order to provide a complete covering for the human remains;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(13)(b)(iii): resistant to leakage or spillage;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(13)(b)(iv): rigid enough for handling with ease; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(13)(b)(v): able to provide protection for the health, safety, and personal integrity of crematory personnel.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(14): "Crematory" means the building or portion of a building that houses the cremation chamber and the holding facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(15): "Direct disposition" means the disposition of a dead human body:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(15)(a): as quickly as law allows;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(15)(b): without preparation of the body by embalming; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(15)(c): without an attendant funeral service or graveside service.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(16): "Disposition" means the final disposal of a dead human body by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(16)(a): earth interment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(16)(b): above ground burial;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(16)(c): cremation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(16)(d): calcination;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(16)(e): alkaline hydrolysis;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(16)(f): burial at sea;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(16)(g): delivery to a medical institution; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(16)(h): other lawful means.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(17): "Embalming" means replacing body fluids in a dead human body with preserving and disinfecting chemicals.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(18): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(18)(a): "Funeral merchandise" means any of the following into which a dead human body is placed in connection with the transportation or disposition of the body:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(18)(a)(i): a vault;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(18)(a)(ii): a casket; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(18)(a)(iii): other personal property.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(18)(b): "Funeral merchandise" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(18)(b)(i): a mausoleum crypt;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(18)(b)(ii): an interment receptacle preset in a cemetery; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(18)(b)(iii): a columbarium niche.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(19): "Funeral service" means a service, rite, or ceremony performed:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(19)(a): with respect to the death of a human; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(19)(b): with the body of the deceased present.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(20): "Funeral service director" means an individual licensed under this chapter who may engage in all lawful professional activities regulated and defined under the practice of funeral service.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(21): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(21)(a): "Funeral service establishment" means a place of business at a specific street address or location licensed under this chapter that is devoted to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(21)(a)(i): the embalming, care, custody, shelter, preparation for burial, and final disposition of dead human bodies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(21)(a)(ii): the furnishing of services, merchandise, and products purchased from the establishment as a preneed provider under a preneed funeral arrangement.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(21)(b): "Funeral service establishment" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(21)(b)(i): all portions of the business premises and all tools, instruments, and supplies used in the preparation and embalming of dead human bodies for burial, cremation, alkaline hydrolysis, and final disposition as defined by division rule; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(21)(b)(ii): a facility used by the business in which funeral services may be conducted.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(22): "Funeral service intern" means an individual licensed under this chapter who is permitted to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(22)(a): assist a funeral service director in the embalming or other preparation of a dead human body for disposition;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(22)(b): assist a funeral service director in the cremation, calcination, alkaline hydrolysis, or pulverization of a dead human body or its remains; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(22)(c): perform other funeral service activities under the supervision of a funeral service director.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(23): "Graveside service" means a funeral service held at the location of disposition.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(24): "Memorial service" means a service, rite, or ceremony performed:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(24)(a): with respect to the death of a human; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(24)(b): without the body of the deceased present.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(25): "Practice of funeral service" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(25)(a): supervising the receipt of custody and transportation of a dead human body to prepare the body for:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(25)(a)(i): disposition; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(25)(a)(ii): shipment to another location;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(25)(b): entering into a contract with a person to provide professional services regulated under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(25)(c): embalming or otherwise preparing a dead human body for disposition;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(25)(d): supervising the arrangement or conduct of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(25)(d)(i): a funeral service;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(25)(d)(ii): a graveside service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(25)(d)(iii): a memorial service;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(25)(e): cremation, calcination, alkaline hydrolysis, or pulverization of a dead human body or the body's remains;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(25)(f): supervising the arrangement of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(25)(f)(i): a disposition; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(25)(f)(ii): a direct disposition;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(25)(g): facilitating:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(25)(g)(i): a disposition; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(25)(g)(ii): a direct disposition;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(25)(h): supervising the sale of funeral merchandise by a funeral establishment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(25)(i): managing or otherwise being responsible for the practice of funeral service in a licensed funeral service establishment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(25)(j): supervising the sale of a preneed funeral arrangement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(25)(k): contracting with or employing individuals to sell a preneed funeral arrangement.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(26): (26)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(26)(a): "Preneed funeral arrangement" means a written or oral agreement sold in advance of the death of the beneficiary under which a person agrees with a buyer to provide at the death of the beneficiary any of the following as are typically provided in connection with a disposition:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(26)(a)(i): goods;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(26)(a)(ii): services, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(26)(a)(ii)(A): embalming services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(26)(a)(ii)(B): funeral directing services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(26)(a)(iii): real property; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(26)(a)(iv): personal property, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(26)(a)(iv)(A): a casket;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(26)(a)(iv)(B): another primary container;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(26)(a)(iv)(C): a cremation, alkaline hydrolysis, or transportation container;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(26)(a)(iv)(D): an outer burial container;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(26)(a)(iv)(E): a vault;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(26)(a)(iv)(F): a grave liner;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(26)(a)(iv)(G): funeral clothing and accessories;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(26)(a)(iv)(H): a monument;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(26)(a)(iv)(I): a grave marker; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(26)(a)(iv)(J): a cremation or alkaline hydrolysis urn.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(26)(b): (26)(a) "Preneed funeral arrangement" does not include a policy or product of life insurance providing a death benefit cash payment upon the death of the beneficiary which is not limited to providing the products or services described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(27): "Processing" means the reduction of identifiable bone fragments after the completion of the cremation or the alkaline hydrolysis process to unidentifiable bone fragments by manual means.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(28): "Pulverization" means the reduction of identifiable bone fragments after the completion of the cremation or alkaline hydrolysis and processing to granulated particles by manual or mechanical means.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(29): "Resomation" means the alkaline hydrolysis process.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(30): "Sales agent" means an individual licensed under this chapter as a preneed funeral arrangement sales agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(31): "Temporary container" means a receptacle for cremated or alkaline hydrolysis remains usually made of cardboard, plastic, or similar material designed to hold the cremated remains until an urn or other permanent container is acquired.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(32): 58-1-501; 58-9-501 "Unlawful conduct" means the same as that term is defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(33): 58-1-501; 58-9-502 "Unprofessional conduct" means the same as that term is defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-102(34): "Urn" means a receptacle designed to permanently encase cremated or alkaline hydrolysis remains.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-201 Board.
-------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-201(1): There is created the Board of Funeral Service consisting of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-201(1)(a): four funeral service directors who own, have an ownership interest in, or have management responsibilities for a funeral service establishment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-201(1)(b): one preneed funeral arrangement sales agent, who does not have an ownership interest in a funeral service establishment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-201(1)(c): two members from the general public who have no association with the funeral service profession.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-201(2): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed and serve in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-201(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-201(3)(a): 58-1-202; 58-1-203 The duties and responsibilities of the board shall be in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-201(3)(b): The board shall designate one of its members on a permanent or rotating basis to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-201(3)(b)(i): assist the division in reviewing complaints concerning the unlawful or unprofessional conduct of a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-201(3)(b)(ii): advise the division in its investigation of these complaints.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-201(4): (3) A board member who has, under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-301 Licensure required -- License classifications.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-301(1): 58-1-307; 58-9-305 A license is required to engage in the practice of funeral service, except as specifically provided in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-301(2): The division shall issue to a person who qualifies under this chapter a license in the classification of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-301(2)(a): funeral service director;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-301(2)(b): funeral service intern;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-301(2)(c): funeral service establishment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-301(2)(d): preneed funeral arrangement sales agent.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302 Qualifications for licensure.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(1): 63J-1-504 Each applicant for licensure as a funeral service director shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(1)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(1)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee as determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(1)(c): have obtained a high school diploma or its equivalent or a higher education degree;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(1)(d): have obtained an associate degree, or its equivalent, in mortuary science from a school of funeral service accredited by the American Board of Funeral Service Education or other accrediting body recognized by the U.S. Department of Education;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(1)(e): have completed not less than 2,000 hours and 50 embalmings, over a period of not less than one year, of satisfactory performance in training as a licensed funeral service intern under the supervision of a licensed funeral service director; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(1)(f): obtain a passing score on examinations approved by the division in collaboration with the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(2): 63J-1-504 Each applicant for licensure as a funeral service intern shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(2)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(2)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee as determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(2)(c): have obtained a high school diploma or its equivalent or a higher education degree; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(2)(d): obtain a passing score on an examination approved by the division in collaboration with the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(3): 63J-1-504; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act Each applicant for licensure as a funeral service establishment and each funeral service establishment licensee shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(3)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(3)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee as determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(3)(c): have in place:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(3)(c)(i): an embalming room for preparing dead human bodies for burial or final disposition, which may serve one or more facilities operated by the applicant;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(3)(c)(ii): a refrigeration room that maintains a temperature of not more than 40 degrees fahrenheit for preserving dead human bodies prior to burial or final disposition, which may serve one or more facilities operated by the applicant; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(3)(c)(iii): maintain at all times a licensed funeral service director who is responsible for the day-to-day operation of the funeral service establishment and who is personally available to perform the services for which the license is required;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(3)(d): affiliate with a licensed preneed funeral arrangement sales agent or funeral service director if the funeral service establishment sells preneed funeral arrangements;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(3)(e): file with the completed application a copy of each form of contract or agreement the applicant will use in the sale of preneed funeral arrangements;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(3)(f): provide evidence of appropriate licensure with the Insurance Department if the applicant intends to engage in the sale of any preneed funeral arrangements funded in whole or in part by an insurance policy or product to be sold by the provider or the provider's sales agent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(3)(g): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act if the applicant intends to offer alkaline hydrolysis in a funeral service establishment, provide evidence that in accordance with rules made by the division in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(3)(g)(i): the funeral service establishment meets the minimum standards for the handling, holding, and processing of deceased human remains in a safe, clean, private, and respectful manner; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(3)(g)(ii): all operators of the alkaline hydrolysis equipment have received adequate training.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(4): 63J-1-504 Each applicant for licensure as a preneed funeral arrangement sales agent shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(4)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(4)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee as determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(4)(c): have obtained a high school diploma or its equivalent or a higher education degree;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(4)(d): have obtained a passing score on an examination approved by the division in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(4)(e): affiliate with a licensed funeral service establishment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-302(4)(f): provide evidence of appropriate licensure with the Insurance Department if the applicant intends to engage in the sale of any preneed funeral arrangements funded in whole or in part by an insurance policy or product.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-303 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-303(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-303(1)(a): The division shall issue each license under this chapter in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-303(1)(b): The division may by rule extend or shorten a renewal cycle by as much as one year to stagger the renewal cycles it administers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-303(2): (1) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-303(3): 58-9-304 At the time of renewal, the funeral service director licensee shall show satisfactory evidence of completion of continuing education as required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-303(4): 58-1-308 Each license automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless the licensee renews it in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-303(5): (5)(b); (c); (5)(b)(i); (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-303(5)(a): (5)(b); (c) Except as otherwise provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-303(5)(b): (5)(b)(i) If a licensed funeral service director dies and leaves the funeral service establishment as part of the assets of the funeral service director's estate:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-303(5)(b)(i): the personal representative of the funeral service director's estate may operate the funeral service establishment under the license, or renewals of the license, for not more than two years from the date of the funeral service director's death without meeting the qualifications of an applicant and without having a licensed funeral service director; but
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-303(5)(b)(ii): (5)(b)(i) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-303(5)(c): (5)(a) If the funeral service director of a licensed funeral service establishment terminates employment with the establishment, the establishment has 90 days to hire a new licensed funeral service director before action may be taken against the license under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-304 Continuing education.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-304(1): As a condition precedent for license renewal, each funeral service director shall, during each two-year licensure cycle or other cycle defined by rule, complete 20 hours of qualified continuing professional education in accordance with standards defined by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-304(2): 58-9-303 If a renewal cycle is extended or shortened under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-305 Exemptions from licensure.
---------------------------------------------------------
In addition to the exemptions from licensure in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-9-305(1): transportation of a dead human body in accordance with other applicable state and federal laws;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-305(2): ambulance or other emergency transportation of a dead human body;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-305(3): the sale of any of the following that is delivered to the buyer or the buyer's designee within 90 days after the day of the sale:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-305(3)(a): funeral merchandise;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-305(3)(b): headstones; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-305(3)(c): other memorial merchandise;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-305(4): the performance of funeral, graveside, or memorial services by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-305(4)(a): a member of the clergy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-305(4)(b): a member of the decedent's family; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-305(4)(c): any other recognized individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-305(5): assisting a Utah licensed funeral service director regarding disasters or special emergencies by individuals licensed in other states as funeral service directors or embalmers;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-305(6): activities of an unlicensed individual employed by a funeral service establishment involving arrangement for a funeral service or the sale of funeral merchandise if the binding contract is reviewed, approved, and signed in behalf of the funeral service establishment by a licensed funeral service director; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-305(7): nonprofessional tasks or activities which:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-305(7)(a): do not require independent professional judgment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-305(7)(b): are required of persons employed by a funeral service establishment under the supervision of a funeral service director.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-306 License by endorsement.
------------------------------------------------------
The division may issue a license by endorsement under this chapter to a person who:Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-306(1): provides documentation that the funeral service director's current licensure is active, in good standing, and free from any disciplinary action;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-306(2): submits an application on a form provided by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-306(3): pays a fee determined by the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-306(4): has not been convicted of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-306(4)(a): a first or second degree felony; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-306(4)(b): crime that when considered with the duties and responsibilities of the license for which the person is applying is considered by the division and the board to indicate that the best interests of the public are not served by granting the applicant a license;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-306(5): has completed five years of lawful and active practice as a licensed funeral service director and embalmer within the 10 years immediately preceding the application for licensure by endorsement;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-306(6): has passed a national examination determined by the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-306(7): has demonstrated competency of the laws and the rules of the state as determined by the division.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-307 Supervision of funeral service intern.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-307(1): A person seeking licensure as a funeral service intern shall submit as a part of the application for a license:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-307(1)(a): the name of the licensed funeral service director who has agreed to supervise all duties performed by the applicant as an intern; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-307(1)(b): the name of the licensed funeral service establishment at which the training and supervision shall take place.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-307(2): A licensed funeral service director may supervise only one licensed funeral service intern at one time.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-307(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-307(3)(a): Within 30 days after the day on which the supervisor-supervisee relationship between a licensed funeral service director and a licensed funeral service intern terminates, the funeral service director shall furnish to the division a report of the performance of the funeral service intern.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-307(3)(b): The report shall be in form and content as prescribed by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-307(4): (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-307(4)(a): A licensed funeral service intern shall notify the division of any change in the intern's supervising funeral service director.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-307(4)(b): (3) The supervising funeral service director shall submit to the division, in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-307(5): The licensed funeral service director is responsible for supervision of all of the duties and functions performed by the funeral service intern throughout the entire internship period.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-401 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for refusing to issue a license to an applicant, for refusing to renew the license of a licensee, for revoking, suspending, restricting, or placing on probation the license of a licensee, for issuing a public or private reprimand to a licensee, and for issuing a cease and desist order shall be in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-501 Unlawful conduct.
------------------------------------------------
"Unlawful conduct" includes:Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-501(1): doing any of the following to prepare a dead human body for disposition unless licensed as a funeral service director or a funeral service intern:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-501(1)(a): embalming;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-501(1)(b): calcinating;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-501(1)(c): pulverizing;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-501(1)(d): cremating; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-501(1)(e): using any method that invades a dead human body;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-501(2): using the title "funeral service director," "funeral service intern," "preneed funeral service sales agent," or "funeral service establishment" unless licensed under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-501(3): engaging in, providing, or agreeing to provide funeral arrangements to be provided under a preneed funeral arrangement without first obtaining a license as a funeral service establishment under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-501(4): engaging in selling, representing for sale, or in any other way offering to sell any contract under which preneed funeral arrangements are to be provided without first obtaining a license under this chapter as:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-501(4)(a): a preneed funeral arrangement sales agent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-501(4)(b): a funeral service director; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-501(5): 58-9-702 failing to comply with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502 Unprofessional conduct.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(1): "Unprofessional conduct" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(1)(a): the failure of a funeral service director to accurately document, report, and supervise the activities of a funeral service intern;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(1)(b): knowingly soliciting the sale of any funeral service or funeral merchandise for a person whose death occurred or was imminent prior to the solicitation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(1)(c): paying or offering to pay a commission or anything of value to secure deceased human remains for a funeral service or disposition to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(1)(c)(i): medical personnel;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(1)(c)(ii): a nursing home;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(1)(c)(iii): a nursing home employee;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(1)(c)(iv): a hospice;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(1)(c)(v): a hospice employee;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(1)(c)(vi): clergy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(1)(c)(vii): a government official; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(1)(c)(viii): any other third party; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(1)(d): failure to provide the following current information to the division:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(1)(d)(i): a licensee's business address;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(1)(d)(ii): a licensee's primary residence;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(1)(d)(iii): a funeral service establishment's funeral service director; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(1)(d)(iv): a supervising funeral service director's funeral service intern's name.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(2): "Unprofessional conduct" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(2)(a): general advertising directed to the public at large; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(2)(b): responding to a notification of death from:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(2)(b)(i): medical personnel;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(2)(b)(ii): a nursing home;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(2)(b)(iii): a nursing home employee;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(2)(b)(iv): a hospice;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(2)(b)(v): a hospice employee;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(2)(b)(vi): clergy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(2)(b)(vii): a government official; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-502(2)(b)(viii): any authorized representative of the family of the deceased person.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-503 Penalty for unlawful conduct.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-503(1): 58-9-501(1); (4) A person who violates the unlawful conduct provisions defined in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-503(2): 58-9-501(5); Title 76, Chapter 6, Part 4, Theft A person who violates the unlawful conduct provision defined in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-504 Authority to promulgate rules.
-------------------------------------------------------------
In addition to the authority granted under SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-9-504(1): the minimum requirements for a licensed funeral establishment for the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-504(1)(a): physical facilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-504(1)(b): equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-504(1)(c): instruments; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-504(1)(d): supplies;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-504(2): 58-9-303 license cycles under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-504(3): 58-9-701 standards to protect the interests of buyers and potential buyers of preneed funeral arrangements under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-504(4): standards for preneed funeral arrangement trusts.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-505 Disclosure requirements.
-------------------------------------------------------
A licensee under this chapter shall disclose information in accordance with regulations of the Federal Trade Commission and rules adopted by the division pursuant to this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-506 Inspection -- Right to access.
-------------------------------------------------------------
A licensed funeral service establishment is subject to inspection during normal business hours to determine compliance with the laws of Utah by:Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-506(1): any authorized representative of the division; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-506(2): any authorized representative of a local or state health department.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-601 Advance directions.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-601(1): 75-2-502 A person may provide written directions, acknowledged before a notary public or executed with the same formalities required of a will under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-601(1)(a): designating a funeral service establishment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-601(1)(b): providing directions for burial arrangements;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-601(1)(c): providing directions for cremation arrangements; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-601(1)(d): providing directions for alkaline hydrolysis arrangements.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-601(2): A funeral service director shall carry out the written directions of the decedent prepared under this section to the extent that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-601(2)(a): the directions are lawful; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-601(2)(b): the decedent has provided resources to carry out the directions.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-601(3): (2) Directions for disposition contained in a will shall be carried out pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-601(3)(a): the validity of other aspects of the will; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-601(3)(b): the fact that the will may not be offered or admitted to probate until a later date.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-601(4): 75-1-201 A person may change or cancel written directions prepared under this section at any time prior to the person's death by providing written notice to all applicable persons, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-601(4)(a): if the written directions designate a funeral service establishment or funeral service director, the funeral service establishment or funeral service director designated in the written directions; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-601(4)(b): 75-1-201 if the written directions are contained in a will, the personal representative as defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-602 Determination of control of disposition.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
The right and duty to control the disposition of a deceased person, which may include cremation as well as the location, manner and conditions of the disposition, and arrangements for funeral goods and services to be provided, vests in the following degrees of relationship in the order named, provided the person is at least 18 and is mentally competent:Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-602(1): 75-9-110; 75-2-502 the person designated:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-602(1)(a): 75-9-110; 75-2-502 in a written instrument, excluding a power of attorney that terminates at death under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-602(1)(b): by a service member while serving in a branch of the United States Armed Forces as defined in 10 U.S.C. Sec. 1481 in a federal Record of Emergency Data, DD Form 93 or subsequent form;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-602(2): the surviving, legally recognized spouse of the decedent, unless a personal representative was nominated by the decedent subsequent to the marriage, in which case the personal representative shall take priority over the spouse;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-602(3): 75-2-502 the person nominated to serve as the personal representative of the decedent's estate in a will executed with the formalities required in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-602(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-602(4)(a): the sole surviving child of the decedent, or if there is more than one child of the decedent, the majority of the surviving children;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-602(4)(b): less than one-half of the surviving children are vested with the rights of this section if they have used reasonable efforts to notify all other surviving children of their instructions and are not aware of any opposition to those instructions on the part of more than one-half of all surviving children;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-602(5): the surviving parent or parents of the decedent, however:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-602(5)(a): if one of the surviving parents is absent, the remaining parent is vested with the rights and duties of this section after reasonable efforts have been unsuccessful in locating the absent surviving parent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-602(5)(b): if the parents are divorced or separated and the decedent was an incapacitated adult, the parent who was designated as the guardian of the decedent is vested with the rights and duties of this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-602(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-602(6)(a): the surviving brother or sister of the decedent, or if there is more than one sibling of the decedent, the majority of the surviving siblings;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-602(6)(b): less than the majority of surviving siblings, if they have used reasonable efforts to notify all other surviving siblings of their instructions and are not aware of any opposition to those instructions on the part of more than one-half of all surviving siblings;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-602(7): the person in the classes of the next degree of kinship, in descending order, under the laws of descent and distribution to inherit the estate of the decedent, and if there is more than one person of the same degree, any person of that degree may exercise the right of disposition;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-602(8): (1); (7) in the absence of any person under Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-602(9): any public official charged with arranging the disposition of deceased persons; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-602(10): (1); (9); (1); (9) in the absence of any person under Subsections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-603 Loss of right of disposition.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-603(1): As used in this section, "estranged" means a physical and emotional separation from the decedent at the time of death which has existed for a period of time that clearly demonstrates an absence of affection, trust, and regard for the decedent.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-603(2): 58-9-602; 58-9-605 A person who has a right of disposition under this chapter forfeits that right and the right is passed on to the next qualifying person as listed in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-603(2)(a): the person is charged with first or second degree murder or voluntary manslaughter in connection with the decedent's death, and the charges are known by the funeral service director, except that if the charges against the person are dropped or if the person is acquitted of the charges, the right of disposition is returned to the person;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-603(2)(b): the person does not exercise the person's right of disposition within three days of notification of the decedent's death or within five days of the decedent's death, whichever is earlier; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-603(2)(c): 58-9-605 if a probate court under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-604 Control by funeral service director.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
A funeral service director may control the disposition of the decedent and recover reasonable charges if:Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-604(1): 58-9-602; 58-9-602
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-604(1)(a): 58-9-602 the funeral service director has actual knowledge that none of the persons described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-604(1)(b): 58-9-602 after reasonable efforts the funeral service director is not able to contact any of the persons described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-604(2): the appropriate public official charged with arranging the disposition of deceased persons fails to assume responsibility for disposition of the decedent within 36 hours after receiving written notice from the funeral service director.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605 Disputes.
----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(1): 58-9-601; 58-9-604 Notwithstanding Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(1)(a): award the right of disposition to the person determined by the court to be the most fit and appropriate to carry out the right of disposition; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(1)(b): make decisions regarding the decedent's remains if those sharing the right of disposition cannot agree.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(2): The following provisions apply to the probate court's determinations under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(2)(a): if the persons holding the right of disposition are two or more persons with the same relationship to the decedent, and they cannot, by majority vote, make a decision regarding the disposition of the decedent's remains, any of those persons or a funeral service director with custody of the remains may petition the probate court to make the decision;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(2)(b): in making a determination the probate court shall consider:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(2)(b)(i): the reasonableness and practicality of the proposed funeral arrangements and disposition;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(2)(b)(ii): the degree of the personal relationship between the decedent and each of the persons claiming the right of disposition;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(2)(b)(iii): the desires of the person or persons who are ready, able, and willing to pay the cost of the funeral arrangements and disposition;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(2)(b)(iv): the convenience and needs of other families and friends wishing to pay their respects;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(2)(b)(v): the desires of the decedent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(2)(b)(vi): the degree to which the funeral arrangements would allow maximum participation by all who wish to pay their respects.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(3): (3)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(3)(a): In a dispute regarding the right of disposition, until the funeral service director receives a court order or other written agreement signed by the parties to the dispute that decides the final disposition of the remains, the funeral service director is not liable for refusing to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(3)(a)(i): accept the decedent's remains;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(3)(a)(ii): inter or otherwise dispose of the decedent's remains; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(3)(a)(iii): complete the arrangements for the final disposition of the decedent's remains.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(3)(b): (3)(b)(i) If, during a dispute, a funeral service director retains a decedent's remains for final disposition, the director may:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(3)(b)(i): embalm or refrigerate and shelter the body, or both, to preserve it while awaiting the final decision of the probate court; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(3)(b)(ii): (3)(b)(i) add the costs incurred under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(4): (2)(a) The legal fees and court costs incurred by a funeral service director for petitioning the probate court under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(5): (2)(a); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(5)(a): (2)(a) This section does not require or impose a duty upon a funeral service director to bring an action under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(5)(b): (2)(a) A funeral service director may not be held criminally or civilly liable for failing to bring an action under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(6): (2)(b)(iii) Except to the degree that it may be considered by the probate court under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-605(7): The personal representative of the decedent's estate does not, by virtue of being the personal representative, have a greater claim to the right of disposition than the personal representative would otherwise have.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-606 Right to rely -- Immunity.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-606(1): A person signing a funeral service agreement, cremation authorization form, alkaline hydrolysis authorization form, or other authorization for a decedent's disposition warrants the truthfulness of the facts set forth in the document, including the identity of the decedent and the person's authority to order the disposition.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-606(2): (1) A funeral service establishment has the right to rely on a contract or authorization executed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-606(3): A funeral service director incurs no civil or criminal liability for failure to contact or independently investigate the existence of any next-of-kin or relative of the decedent.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-606(4): If there are at least two persons in the nearest class of the next-of-kin who are equal in priority and a funeral service director has no knowledge of an objection by other members of the class, the funeral service director may rely on and act according to the instructions of the first person in the class to make funeral and disposition arrangements.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-606(5): A funeral service establishment or funeral service director who relies in good faith on the instructions of a person claiming the right of disposition under this part is immune from civil and criminal liability and disciplinary action in carrying out the disposition of a decedent's remains in accordance with that person's instructions.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607 Authorization to cremate -- Penalties for removal of items from human remains.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(1): 58-9-619 Except as otherwise provided in this section and Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(1)(a): a cremation authorization form signed by an authorizing agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(1)(b): a completed and executed burial transit permit or similar document, as provided by state law, indicating that human remains are to be cremated; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(1)(c): any other documentation required by the state, county, or municipality.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2): (2)(a)(xiii); (2)(b)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2)(a): The cremation authorization form shall contain, at a minimum, the following information:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2)(a)(i): the identity of the human remains and the time and date of death, including a signed declaration of visual identification of the deceased or refusal to visually identify the deceased;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2)(a)(ii): the name of the funeral director and funeral service establishment that obtained the cremation authorization;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2)(a)(iii): notification as to whether the death occurred from a disease declared by the department of health to be infectious, contagious, communicable, or dangerous to the public health;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2)(a)(iv): the name of the authorizing agent and the relationship between the authorizing agent and the decedent;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2)(a)(v): a representation that the authorizing agent has the right to authorize the cremation of the decedent and that the authorizing agent is not aware of any living person with a superior or equal priority right to that of the authorizing agent, except that if there is another living person with a superior or equal priority right, the form shall contain a representation that the authorizing agent has:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2)(a)(v)(A): made reasonable efforts to contact that person;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2)(a)(v)(B): been unable to do so; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2)(a)(v)(C): no reason to believe that the person would object to the cremation of the decedent;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2)(a)(vi): authorization for the funeral service establishment to cremate the human remains;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2)(a)(vii): a representation that the human remains do not contain a pacemaker or other material or implant that may be potentially hazardous or cause damage to the cremation chamber or the person performing the cremation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2)(a)(viii): the name of the person authorized to receive the cremated remains from the funeral service establishment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2)(a)(ix): the manner in which the final disposition of the cremated remains is to take place, if known;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2)(a)(x): a listing of each item of value to be delivered to the funeral service establishment along with the human remains, and instructions as to how each item should be handled;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2)(a)(xi): the signature of the authorizing agent, attesting to the accuracy of all representations contained on the authorization form;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2)(a)(xii): if the cremation authorization form is being executed on a preneed basis, the form shall contain the disclosure required for preneed programs under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2)(a)(xiii): except for a preneed cremation authorization, the signature of the funeral director of the funeral service establishment that obtained the cremation authorization.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2)(b): (2)(a)(xiii); (2)(b)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2)(b)(i): (2)(a)(xiii) The individual described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2)(b)(ii): The funeral director or the funeral service establishment shall warrant to the crematory that the human remains delivered to the funeral service establishment have been positively identified as the decedent listed on the cremation authorization form by the authorizing agent or a designated representative of the authorizing agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(2)(b)(iii): (2)(b)(ii) The authorizing agent or the agent's designee may make the identification referred to in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(3): 58-9-619
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(3)(a): 58-9-619 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(3)(b): If a funeral service establishment takes custody of a cremation container subsequent to the human remains being placed within the container, it can rely on the identification made before the remains were placed in the container.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(3)(c): The funeral service establishment shall place appropriate identification on the exterior of the cremation container based on the prior identification.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(4): 76-6-404; 76-6-404.5; (4)(a)(i); (ii); (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(4)(a): 76-6-404; 76-6-404.5; (4)(a)(i); (ii) A person who removes or possesses dental gold or silver, jewelry, or mementos from human remains:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(4)(a)(i): 76-6-404 with purpose to deprive another over control of the property is guilty of an offense and subject to the punishments provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(4)(a)(ii): 76-6-404.5 with purpose to exercise unauthorized control and with intent to temporarily deprive another of control over the property is guilty of an offense and subject to the punishments provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(4)(a)(iii): (4)(a)(i); (ii) under circumstances not amounting to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-607(4)(b): (4)(a) The fact that residue or any unavoidable dental gold or dental silver or other precious metals remain in a cremation chamber or other equipment or a container used in a prior cremation is not a violation of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608 Recordkeeping.
---------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(1)(a): A funeral service establishment shall furnish to the person who delivers human remains to the establishment for cremation a receipt signed by a representative of the establishment and the person making the delivery, showing:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(1)(a)(i): the date and time of the delivery;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(1)(a)(ii): the type of casket or alternative container delivered;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(1)(a)(iii): the name of the person from whom the human remains were received;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(1)(a)(iv): the name of the funeral establishment or other entity with whom the person making the delivery is affiliated;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(1)(a)(v): the name of the person who received the human remains on behalf of the funeral service establishment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(1)(a)(vi): the name of the decedent.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(1)(b): The funeral service establishment shall keep a copy of the receipt in its permanent records for a period of seven years.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(2)(a): Upon release of cremated remains, a funeral service establishment shall furnish to the person who receives the cremated remains a receipt signed by a representative of the funeral service establishment and the person who receives the remains, showing:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(2)(a)(i): the date and time of the release;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(2)(a)(ii): the name of the person to whom the cremated remains were released; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(2)(a)(iii): if applicable:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(2)(a)(iii)(A): the name of the funeral establishment, cemetery, or other entity with whom the person receiving the cremated remains is affiliated;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(2)(a)(iii)(B): the name of the person who released the cremated remains on behalf of the funeral service establishment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(2)(a)(iii)(C): the name of the decedent.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(2)(b)(i): The receipt shall contain a representation from the person receiving the cremated remains confirming that the remains will not be used for any improper purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(2)(b)(ii): Upon release of the cremated remains, the person to whom the remains were released may transport them in any manner in the state, without a permit, and dispose of them in accordance with this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(2)(c): The funeral service establishment shall retain a copy of the receipt in its permanent records for a period of seven years.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(3)(a): The funeral service establishment shall maintain at its place of business a permanent record of each cremation that took place at its crematory.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(3)(b): The permanent record shall contain:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(3)(b)(i): the name of the decedent;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(3)(b)(ii): the date of cremation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(3)(b)(iii): the final disposition of the cremated remains; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-608(3)(b)(iv): any other document required by this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-609 Cremation containers.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-609(1): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-609(1)(a): (2) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-609(1)(a)(i): placed in a casket before cremation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-609(1)(a)(ii): cremated in a casket.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-609(1)(b): A funeral service establishment may not refuse to accept human remains for cremation because they are not in a casket.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-609(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-609(2)(a): Human remains must be delivered to a crematory in a casket or cremation container.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-609(2)(b): Human remains may not be removed from a casket or cremation container once delivered to the crematory, and the casket or cremation container shall be cremated with the human remains, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-609(2)(b)(i): the funeral service establishment has been provided with written instructions to the contrary by the authorizing agent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-609(2)(b)(ii): the funeral service establishment does not accept metal caskets for cremation.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610 Cremation procedures.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(1): 26B-8-230 A funeral service establishment may not cremate human remains until the funeral service establishment:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(1)(a): completes and files a death certificate with the office of vital statistics and the county health department as indicated on the regular medical certificate of death or the coroner's certificate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(1)(b): 26B-8-230 complies with the provisions of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(2): (2)(b)(ii)(B); (2)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(2)(a): A funeral service establishment may not cremate human remains with a pacemaker or other battery-powered, potentially hazardous implant in place.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(2)(b): (2)(b)(ii)(B); (2)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(2)(b)(i): An authorizing agent for the cremation of human remains is responsible for informing the funeral service establishment in writing on the cremation authorization form about the presence of a pacemaker or other battery-powered, potentially hazardous implant in the human remains to be cremated.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(2)(b)(ii): (2)(b)(ii)(B); (2)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(2)(b)(ii)(A): (2)(b)(ii)(B) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(2)(b)(ii)(B): (2)(b)(i) If the authorizing agent informs the funeral service establishment of the presence of a pacemaker or other battery-powered, potentially hazardous implant under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(3): Only authorized persons are permitted in the crematory while human remains are in the crematory area awaiting cremation, being cremated, or being removed from the cremation chamber.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(4): (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(4)(a): Simultaneous cremation of the human remains of more than one person within the same cremation chamber or processor is not allowed, unless the funeral service establishment has received specific written authorization to do so from the authorizing agent of each person to be cremated.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(4)(b): (4)(a) The written authorization, described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(5): A funeral service establishment shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(5)(a): verify the identification of human remains as indicated on a cremation container immediately before placing the human remains in the cremation chamber;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(5)(b): attach a metal identification tag to the cremation container;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(5)(c): remove the identification tag from the cremation container; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(5)(d): place the identification tag near the cremation chamber control where the identification tag shall remain until the cremation process is complete.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(6): Upon completion of a cremation, the funeral service establishment shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(6)(a): in so far as is possible, remove all of the recoverable residue of the cremation process from the cremation chamber;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(6)(b): separate all other residue from the cremation process from remaining bone fragments, in so far as possible, and process the bone fragments so as to reduce them to unidentifiable particles; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(6)(c): remove anything other than the unidentifiable bone particles from the cremated residuals, as far as is possible, and dispose of that material.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(7): (5)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(7)(a): (5) A funeral service establishment shall pack cremated remains, including the identification tag described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(7)(b): The container or urn shall be packed in clean packing materials and not be contaminated with any other object, unless otherwise directed by the authorizing agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(7)(c): If the cremated remains cannot fit within the designated temporary container or urn, the funeral service establishment shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(7)(c)(i): return the excess to the authorizing agent or the agent's representative in a separate container; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(7)(c)(ii): mark both containers or urns on the outside with the name of the deceased person and an indication that the cremated remains of the named decedent are in both containers or urns.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(8)(a): If the cremated remains are to be shipped, then the funeral services establishment shall pack the designated temporary container or urn in a suitable, sturdy container.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(8)(b): The funeral service establishment shall have the remains shipped only by a method that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(8)(b)(i): has an available internal tracing system; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-610(8)(b)(ii): provides a receipt signed by the person accepting delivery.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-611 Disposition of cremated remains.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-611(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-611(1)(a): An authorizing agent shall provide the person with whom cremation arrangements are made with a signed statement specifying the final disposition of the cremated remains, if known.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-611(1)(b): The funeral services establishment shall retain a copy of the statement.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-611(2): (2)(b); (2)(d)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-611(2)(a): The authorizing agent is responsible for the disposition of the cremated remains.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-611(2)(b): If the authorizing agent or the agent's representative has not specified the ultimate disposition of or claimed the cremated remains within 60 days from the date of the cremation, the funeral service establishment may dispose of the remains in any manner permitted by law, except scattering.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-611(2)(c): (2)(b) The authorizing agent shall reimburse the funeral services establishment for all reasonable costs incurred in disposing of the cremated remains under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-611(2)(d): The person or entity disposing of cremated remains under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-611(2)(d)(i): shall make and keep a record of the disposition of the remains; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-611(2)(d)(ii): is discharged from any legal obligation or liability concerning the remains once the disposition has been made.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-611(2)(e): (2)(d)(ii) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-611(3): (3)(a)(ii); (iii)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-611(3)(a): An authorizing agent may direct a funeral service establishment to dispose of or arrange for the disposition of cremated remains:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-611(3)(a)(i): in a crypt, niche, grave, or scattering garden located in a dedicated cemetery;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-611(3)(a)(ii): by scattering the cremated remains over uninhabited public land, the sea, or other public waterways subject to health and environmental laws and regulations; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-611(3)(a)(iii): in any manner on the private property of a consenting owner.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-611(3)(b): If cremated remains are to be disposed of on private property, other than dedicated cemetery property, the authorizing agent shall provide the funeral service establishment with the written consent of the property owner prior to disposal of the remains.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-611(3)(c): (3)(a)(ii); (iii) In order to scatter cremated remains under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-611(4): A funeral service establishment may not release cremated remains for scattering under this section to the authorizing agent or the agent's designated representative until the funeral service establishment is given a receipt that shows the proper filing has been made with the local registrar of births and deaths.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-612 Limitation of liability.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-612(1): An authorizing agent who signs a cremation authorization form warrants the truthfulness of the facts set forth on the form, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-612(1)(a): the identity of the deceased whose remains are to be cremated; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-612(1)(b): the authorizing agent's authority to order the cremation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-612(2): (1) A funeral service establishment may rely upon the representations made by an authorizing agent under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-612(3): (1) The authorizing agent is personally and individually liable for all damage resulting from a misstatement or misrepresentation made under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-612(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-612(4)(a): A funeral service establishment may arrange for the cremation of and cremate human remains upon receipt of a cremation authorization form signed by an authorizing agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-612(4)(b): A funeral service establishment that arranges a cremation, cremates human remains, or releases or disposes of cremated human remains pursuant to a cremation authorization form is not liable for an action it takes pursuant to that authorization.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-612(5): A funeral service establishment is not responsible or liable for any valuables delivered to the establishment with human remains to be cremated.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-612(6): A funeral service establishment may refuse to arrange for a cremation, to accept human remains for cremation, or to perform a cremation:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-612(6)(a): if the establishment is aware of a dispute concerning the cremation of the human remains and it has not received a court order or other suitable confirmation that the dispute has been resolved;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-612(6)(b): if the establishment has a reasonable basis for questioning any of the representations made by an authorizing agent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-612(6)(c): for any other lawful reason.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-612(7): (7)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-612(7)(a): If a funeral service establishment is aware of a dispute concerning the release or disposition of cremated remains in its possession, the establishment may refuse to release the remains until:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-612(7)(a)(i): the dispute has been resolved; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-612(7)(a)(ii): it has received a court order authorizing the release or disposition of the remains.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-612(7)(b): (7) A funeral service establishment is not liable for its refusal to release or dispose of cremated remains in accordance with this Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613 Authorization for alkaline hydrolysis -- Penalties for removal of items from human remains.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(1): Except as otherwise provided in this section, a funeral service establishment may not perform alkaline hydrolysis on human remains until the funeral service establishment has received:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(1)(a): an alkaline hydrolysis authorization form signed by an authorizing agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(1)(b): a completed and executed burial transit permit or similar document, as provided by state law, indicating that disposition of the human remains is to be by alkaline hydrolysis; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(1)(c): any other documentation required by the state, county, or municipality.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(2): (2)(a)(xii); (2)(b)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(2)(a): The alkaline hydrolysis authorization form shall contain, at a minimum, the following information:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(2)(a)(i): the identity of the human remains and the time and date of death, including a signed declaration of visual identification of the deceased or refusal to visually identify the deceased;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(2)(a)(ii): the name of the funeral director and funeral service establishment that obtained the alkaline hydrolysis authorization;
