Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(2)(a)(iii): notification as to whether the death occurred from a disease declared by the Department of Health to be infectious, contagious, communicable, or dangerous to the public health;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(2)(a)(iv): the name of the authorizing agent and the relationship between the authorizing agent and the decedent;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(2)(a)(v): a representation that the authorizing agent has the right to authorize the disposition of the decedent by alkaline hydrolysis and that the authorizing agent is not aware of any living person with a superior or equal priority right to that of the authorizing agent, except that if there is another living person with a superior or equal priority right, the alkaline hydrolysis authorization form shall contain a representation that the authorizing agent has:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(2)(a)(v)(A): made reasonable efforts to contact that person;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(2)(a)(v)(B): been unable to do so; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(2)(a)(v)(C): no reason to believe that the person would object to the disposition of the decedent by alkaline hydrolysis;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(2)(a)(vi): authorization for the funeral service establishment to use alkaline hydrolysis for the disposition of the human remains;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(2)(a)(vii): the name of the person authorized to receive the human remains from the funeral service establishment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(2)(a)(viii): the manner in which the final disposition of the human remains is to take place, if known;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(2)(a)(ix): a listing of each item of value to be delivered to the funeral service establishment along with the human remains, and instructions as to how each item should be handled;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(2)(a)(x): the signature of the authorizing agent, attesting to the accuracy of all representations contained on the alkaline hydrolysis authorization form;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(2)(a)(xi): if the alkaline hydrolysis authorization form is being executed on a preneed basis, the disclosure required for preneed programs under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(2)(a)(xii): except for a preneed alkaline hydrolysis authorization, the signature of the funeral director of the funeral service establishment that obtained the alkaline hydrolysis authorization.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(2)(b): (2)(a)(xii); (2)(b)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(2)(b)(i): (2)(a)(xii) The person referred to in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(2)(b)(ii): The funeral director or the funeral service establishment shall warrant that the human remains delivered to the funeral service establishment have been positively identified by the authorizing agent or a designated representative of the authorizing agent as the decedent listed on the alkaline hydrolysis authorization form.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(2)(b)(iii): (2)(b)(ii) The authorizing agent or the agent's designee may make the identification referred to in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(3)(a): A funeral service establishment may not accept unidentified human remains for alkaline hydrolysis.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(3)(b): If a funeral service establishment takes custody of an alkaline hydrolysis container subsequent to the human remains being placed within the container, the funeral service establishment can rely on the identification made before the remains were placed in the container.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(3)(c): The funeral service establishment shall place appropriate identification on the exterior of the alkaline hydrolysis container based on the prior identification.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(4): 76-6-404; 76-6-404.5; (4)(a)(i); (ii); (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(4)(a): 76-6-404; 76-6-404.5; (4)(a)(i); (ii) A person who removes or possesses dental gold or silver, jewelry, or mementos from human remains:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(4)(a)(i): 76-6-404 with purpose to deprive another over control of the property is guilty of an offense and subject to the punishments provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(4)(a)(ii): 76-6-404.5 with purpose to exercise unauthorized control and with intent to temporarily deprive another of control over the property is guilty of an offense and subject to the punishments provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(4)(a)(iii): (4)(a)(i); (ii) under circumstances not amounting to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-613(4)(b): (4)(a) The fact that residue or any unavoidable dental gold or dental silver or other precious metals remain in alkaline hydrolysis equipment or a container used in a prior alkaline hydrolysis process is not a violation of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614 Recordkeeping.
---------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(1)(a): A funeral service establishment shall furnish to the person who delivers human remains to the establishment for alkaline hydrolysis a receipt signed by a representative of the establishment and the person making the delivery, showing:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(1)(a)(i): the date and time of the delivery;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(1)(a)(ii): the type of casket or alternative container delivered;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(1)(a)(iii): the name of the person from whom the human remains were received;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(1)(a)(iv): the name of the funeral establishment or other entity with whom the person making the delivery is affiliated;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(1)(a)(v): the name of the person who received the human remains on behalf of the funeral service establishment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(1)(a)(vi): the name of the decedent.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(1)(b): The funeral service establishment shall keep a copy of the receipt in the funeral service establishment's permanent records for a period of seven years.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(2)(a): Upon release of human remains after alkaline hydrolysis, a funeral service establishment shall furnish to the person who receives the human remains a receipt signed by a representative of the funeral service establishment and the person who receives the human remains, showing:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(2)(a)(i): the date and time of the release;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(2)(a)(ii): the name of the person to whom the human remains were released; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(2)(a)(iii): if applicable:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(2)(a)(iii)(A): the name of the funeral establishment, cemetery, or other entity with whom the person receiving the human remains is affiliated;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(2)(a)(iii)(B): the name of the person who released the human remains on behalf of the funeral service establishment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(2)(a)(iii)(C): the name of the decedent.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(2)(b)(i): The receipt shall contain a representation from the person receiving the human remains confirming that the remains will not be used for any improper purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(2)(b)(ii): Upon release of the human remains, the person to whom the human remains were released may transport the human remains in any manner in the state, without a permit, and dispose of the human remains in accordance with this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(2)(c): The funeral service establishment shall retain a copy of the receipt in the funeral service establishment's permanent records for a period of seven years.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(3)(a): The funeral service establishment shall maintain at the funeral service establishment's place of business a permanent record of each disposition by alkaline hydrolysis that took place at the funeral service establishment.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(3)(b): The permanent record shall contain:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(3)(b)(i): the name of the decedent;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(3)(b)(ii): the date of disposition by alkaline hydrolysis;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(3)(b)(iii): the final disposition of the human remains; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-614(3)(b)(iv): any other document required by this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-615 Accepting remains for alkaline hydrolysis.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-615(1): A funeral service establishment may not make or enforce a rule requiring that human remains be placed in a casket before alkaline hydrolysis.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-615(2): A funeral service establishment may not refuse to accept human remains for alkaline hydrolysis because the human remains are not in a casket.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616 Procedure for alkaline hydrolysis.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(1): 26B-8-230 A funeral service establishment may not perform alkaline hydrolysis on human remains until the funeral service establishment:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(1)(a): completes and files a death certificate with the Office of Vital Records and Statistics and the county health department as indicated on the regular medical certificate of death or the coroner's certificate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(1)(b): 26B-8-230 complies with the provisions of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(2): While human remains are in the area where alkaline hydrolysis takes place, both before and during the alkaline hydrolysis process and while being removed from the alkaline hydrolysis chamber, only authorized persons are permitted in the area.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(3): Simultaneous alkaline hydrolysis of the human remains of more than one person within the same alkaline hydrolysis chamber is not allowed.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(4): A funeral service establishment shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(4)(a): verify the identification of human remains as indicated on an alkaline hydrolysis container immediately before performing alkaline hydrolysis;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(4)(b): attach an identification tag to the alkaline hydrolysis container;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(4)(c): remove the identification tag from the alkaline hydrolysis container; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(4)(d): place the identification tag near the alkaline hydrolysis chamber where the identification tag shall remain until the alkaline hydrolysis process is complete.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(5): Upon completion of the alkaline hydrolysis process, the funeral service establishment shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(5)(a): dispose of liquid remains in accordance with state and local requirements;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(5)(b): to the extent possible, remove all of the recoverable residue of the remains of the alkaline hydrolysis process from the alkaline hydrolysis chamber;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(5)(c): separate all other residue from the alkaline hydrolysis process from remaining bone fragments, to the extent possible, and process the bone fragments so as to reduce them to unidentifiable particles; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(5)(d): remove anything other than the unidentifiable bone particles from the remains of the alkaline hydrolysis process, to the extent possible, and dispose of that material.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(6): (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(6)(a): (4) A funeral service establishment shall pack the remains of the alkaline hydrolysis process, which consist of the unidentifiable bone particles and the identification tag described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(6)(b): The urn or temporary container shall be packed in clean packing materials and not be contaminated with any other object, unless otherwise directed by the authorizing agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(6)(c): If the remains of the alkaline hydrolysis process cannot fit within the designated urn or temporary container, the funeral service establishment shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(6)(c)(i): return the excess remains to the authorizing agent or the agent's representative in a separate urn or temporary container; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(6)(c)(ii): mark both urns or temporary containers on the outside with the name of the decedent and an indication that the remains of the named decedent are in both urns or temporary containers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(7)(a): If the remains are to be shipped, the funeral service establishment shall pack the designated temporary container or urn in a suitable, sturdy container.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(7)(b): The funeral service establishment shall have the remains shipped only by a method that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(7)(b)(i): has an available tracking system; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-616(7)(b)(ii): provides a receipt signed by the person accepting delivery.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-617 Final disposition of remains from the alkaline hydrolysis process.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-617(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-617(1)(a): An authorizing agent shall provide the person with whom alkaline hydrolysis arrangements are made with a signed statement specifying the final disposition of the remains from the alkaline hydrolysis process, if known.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-617(1)(b): The funeral service establishment shall retain a copy of the statement.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-617(2): (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-617(2)(a): The authorizing agent is responsible for the final disposition of the remains from the alkaline hydrolysis process.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-617(2)(b): If the authorizing agent or the agent's representative has not specified the ultimate disposition of or claimed the remains from the alkaline hydrolysis process within 60 days from the date of the alkaline hydrolysis process, the funeral service establishment may dispose of the remains in any manner permitted by law, except scattering.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-617(2)(c): (2)(b) The authorizing agent shall reimburse the funeral service establishment for all reasonable costs incurred in disposing of the remains from the alkaline hydrolysis process under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-617(2)(d): The person or entity disposing of remains from the alkaline hydrolysis process under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-617(2)(d)(i): shall make and keep a record of the final disposition of the remains; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-617(2)(d)(ii): is discharged from any legal obligation or liability concerning the remains once the final disposition has been made.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-617(3): (3)(a)(ii); (iii)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-617(3)(a): An authorizing agent may direct a funeral service establishment to dispose of or arrange for the final disposition of remains from the alkaline hydrolysis process:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-617(3)(a)(i): in a crypt, niche, grave, or scattering garden located in a dedicated cemetery;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-617(3)(a)(ii): by scattering the remains over uninhabited public land, the sea, or other public waterways subject to health and environmental laws and regulations; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-617(3)(a)(iii): in any manner on the private property of a consenting owner.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-617(3)(b): If remains from the alkaline hydrolysis process are to be disposed of on private property, other than dedicated cemetery property, the authorizing agent shall provide the funeral service establishment with the written consent of the property owner before disposal of the remains.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-617(3)(c): (3)(a)(ii); (iii) In order to scatter remains from the alkaline hydrolysis process under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-617(4): Under this section, a funeral service establishment may not release remains from the alkaline hydrolysis process to the authorizing agent or the agent's designated representative for scattering until the funeral service establishment is given a receipt that shows the proper filing has been made with the local registrar of births and deaths.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-618 Limitation of liability.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-618(1): An authorizing agent who signs an alkaline hydrolysis authorization form warrants the truthfulness of the facts set forth on the form, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-618(1)(a): the identity of the deceased whose remains are to undergo the alkaline hydrolysis process; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-618(1)(b): the authorizing agent's authority to order the alkaline hydrolysis process.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-618(2): (1) A funeral service establishment may rely upon the representations made by an authorizing agent under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-618(3): (1) The authorizing agent is personally and individually liable for all damage resulting from a misstatement or misrepresentation made under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-618(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-618(4)(a): A funeral service establishment may arrange for the alkaline hydrolysis process upon receipt of an alkaline hydrolysis authorization form signed by an authorizing agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-618(4)(b): A funeral service establishment that arranges the alkaline hydrolysis process or releases or disposes of human remains from the alkaline hydrolysis process pursuant to an alkaline hydrolysis authorization form is not liable for an action the funeral service establishment takes pursuant to that authorization.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-618(5): A funeral service establishment is not responsible or liable for any valuables delivered to the establishment with human remains.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-618(6): A funeral service establishment may refuse to arrange for the alkaline hydrolysis process of a decedent, to accept human remains for the alkaline hydrolysis process, or to perform the alkaline hydrolysis process:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-618(6)(a): if the establishment is aware of a dispute concerning the disposition of the human remains and the funeral service establishment has not received a court order or other suitable confirmation that the dispute has been resolved;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-618(6)(b): if the establishment has a reasonable basis for questioning any of the representations made by an authorizing agent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-618(6)(c): for any other lawful reason.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-618(7): (7)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-618(7)(a): If a funeral service establishment is aware of a dispute concerning the release or disposition of remains from the alkaline hydrolysis process in the funeral service establishment's possession, the establishment may refuse to release the remains until:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-618(7)(a)(i): the dispute has been resolved; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-618(7)(a)(ii): the funeral service establishment has received a court order authorizing the release or disposition of the remains.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-618(7)(b): (7) A funeral service establishment is not liable for its refusal to release or dispose of remains from the alkaline hydrolysis process in accordance with this Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-619 Exception for disposition of fetal remains.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-619(1): 26B-8-101 As used in this section, "fetal remains" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-619(2): Notwithstanding any other provision in this part, a funeral service establishment:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-619(2)(a): is exempt from any requirement to name the miscarried fetus or the aborted fetus:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-619(2)(a)(i): for the purpose of identifying the fetal remains; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-619(2)(a)(ii): for any record keeping requirements under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-619(2)(b): is not required to obtain a death certificate or fetal death certificate for the cremation or disposition of fetal remains that are less than 20 weeks in gestational age.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701 Preneed contract requirements.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(1)(a): A preneed funeral arrangement sold in Utah shall be evidenced by a written contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(1)(b): The funeral service establishment shall maintain a copy of the contract until five years after all of the establishment's obligations under the contract have been executed.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(2): (1); 58-9-702; Title 31A, Insurance Code; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The form for a written contract of a preneed funeral arrangement under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(2)(a): be written in clear and understandable language printed in an easy-to-read type size and font;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(2)(b): bear the preprinted name, address, telephone number, and license number of the funeral service establishment obligated to provide the services under the contract terms;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(2)(c): clearly identify that the contract is a guaranteed product contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(2)(d): 58-9-702 provide that a trust is established in accordance with the provisions of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(2)(e): Title 31A, Insurance Code if the contract is funded by an insurance policy or product, provide that the insurance policy or product is filed with the Insurance Department and meets the requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(2)(f): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act conform to other standards created by rules made by division under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(3): A preneed funeral arrangement contract shall provide for payment by the buyer in a form which may be liquidated by the funeral service establishment within 30 days after the day the funeral service establishment or sales agent receives the payment.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(4): A preneed funeral arrangement contract may not be revocable by the funeral service establishment except:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(4)(a): in the event of nonpayment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(4)(b): under terms and conditions clearly set forth in the contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(5)(a): A preneed funeral arrangement contract may not be revocable by the buyer or beneficiary except:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(5)(a)(i): in the event of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(5)(a)(i)(A): a substantial contract breach by the funeral service establishment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(5)(a)(i)(B): substantial evidence that the funeral service establishment is or will be unable to provide the personal property or services to the beneficiary as provided under the contract; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(5)(a)(ii): under terms and conditions clearly set forth in the contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(5)(b): The preneed funeral arrangement contract shall contain a clear statement of the manner in which payments made on the contract shall be refunded to the buyer or beneficiary upon revocation by the beneficiary.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(6)(a): A preneed funeral arrangement contract shall provide the buyer the option to require the funeral service establishment to furnish a written disclosure to a person who does not live at the same residence as the buyer.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(6)(b): The preneed funeral arrangement buyer may choose:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(6)(b)(i): a full disclosure containing a copy of the entire preneed funeral arrangement contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(6)(b)(ii): a partial disclosure informing the recipient of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(6)(b)(ii)(A): the existence of a preneed funeral arrangement contract; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(6)(b)(ii)(B): the name, address, telephone number, and license number of the funeral service establishment obligated to provide the services under the preneed funeral arrangement contract; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-701(6)(b)(iii): not to require the funeral service establishment to furnish a written disclosure to another person.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-702 Payments to be held in trust -- Trustee qualifications.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-702(1): All money representing payments for the purchase of a preneed funeral arrangement shall be deposited by the provider or sales agent receiving the payment:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-702(1)(a): within 10 business days after the day on which the provider or sales agent receives the payment in the form of cash or cash equivalent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-702(1)(b): within 35 calendar days after the day on which the provider or sales agent receives the payment in the form of a negotiable instrument.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-702(2): (1); Title 7, Chapter 5, Trust Business All money received under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-703 Trust agreement.
-----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-703(1): Title 75, Chapter 7, Utah Uniform Trust Code Each trust established by a funeral service establishment shall be administered in accordance with a trust agreement conforming with:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-703(1)(a): the requirements of this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-703(1)(b): rules adopted with respect to this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-703(1)(c): Title 75, Chapter 7, Utah Uniform Trust Code the provisions of
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-703(1)(d): all other state and federal laws applicable to trusts and trust agreements.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-703(2): Each trust agreement shall require that the funeral service establishment maintain a copy of the trust agreement until five years after all of its obligations under the trust agreement have been executed or transferred.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-703(3): Each trust agreement shall require that the trustee:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-703(3)(a): separately account for each contract; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-703(3)(b): separately record payments with respect to each contract made into the corpus of the trust.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-703(4): Each trust agreement shall provide for distributions from the trust in accordance with the provisions of this chapter upon:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-703(4)(a): the death of the beneficiary;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-703(4)(b): revocation of the contract by the funeral service establishment upon nonpayment by the buyer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-703(4)(c): revocation of the contract by the beneficiary or buyer.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-704 Interest earned on trust funds.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Interest earned on trust funds shall be available for expenditure according to the following priority:Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-704(1): to pay the reasonable trustee expenses of administering the trust within a maximum amount established by rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-704(2): 58-9-504 to pay within a maximum amount established by rule under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-704(2)(a): the sale of the plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-704(2)(b): administering the collection, remittance, and accounting of the amount of payments made into the corpus of the trust; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-704(2)(c): reporting required with respect to those contracts:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-704(2)(c)(i): that have been sold; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-704(2)(c)(ii): under which the provider is obligated;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-704(3): to pay the costs of providing any of the following for which the provider is obligated under a specific outstanding preneed funeral arrangement contract:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-704(3)(a): personal property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-704(3)(b): services at need; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-704(4): to pay the provider available funds left in the individual trust account after:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-704(4)(a): all costs of providing personal property and services for which the provider is obligated under the contract underlying the trust; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-704(4)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-704(4)(b)(i): the contract is canceled as provided under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-704(4)(b)(ii): all amounts payable to the buyer, beneficiary, or any other person have been paid in full.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-705 Distribution of funds.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-705(1): 58-9-704 Interest earned on trust funds shall be available to the provider according to the priority set forth in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-705(2): The amount of payments made into the corpus of the trust and any other amount which has been paid into the corpus of the trust shall be paid to the provider in the amount credited to a specific account upon the event of one of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-705(2)(a): the death of the beneficiary which shall be demonstrated to the trustee by the provider by furnishing to the trustee:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-705(2)(a)(i): a request for payment from the trust; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-705(2)(a)(ii): a certified copy of the death certificate of the beneficiary; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-705(2)(b): revocation of the preneed funeral arrangement contract by either the provider or the buyer according to the terms and conditions of the contract, which shall be demonstrated to the trustee by the provider by furnishing to the trustee satisfactory evidence that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-705(2)(b)(i): the contract has been revoked; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-705(2)(b)(ii): the provider has paid all funds due to the buyer or beneficiary.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-705(3): Upon an order of a court having jurisdiction, all amounts that have been paid into the corpus of the trust shall be paid to the buyer or beneficiary in the event of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-705(3)(a): a judgment to the benefit of a buyer or beneficiary upon a finding that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-705(3)(a)(i): the provider is in substantial breach of the contract; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-705(3)(a)(ii): there is substantial evidence that the provider is or will be unable to provide the personal property or services to the beneficiary under the contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-705(3)(b): a judgment of bankruptcy against the provider; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-705(3)(c): a finding by the court that determines the funds should be rightfully returned to the buyer or beneficiary.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-706 Trust funds and insurance reports.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-706(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-706(1)(a): Each funeral service establishment shall maintain an annual report of preneed trust funds and insurance.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-706(1)(b): The report shall contain:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-706(1)(b)(i): the name of the trustees with which the funeral service establishment has trust funds on deposit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-706(1)(b)(ii): the amount remaining on deposit in the trust fund on:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-706(1)(b)(ii)(A): December 31 of the preceding year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-706(1)(b)(ii)(B): another annual reporting period as the division may establish.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-706(2): Each funeral service establishment may be audited by the division at any time.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-707 Records of trustee -- Contents.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-707(1): The trustee shall keep an orderly record of all agreements.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-707(2): The record shall contain:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-707(2)(a): the name and address of the person making a payment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-707(2)(b): the date and the amount of each payment made;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-707(2)(c): the date and amount of each withdrawal and to whom paid; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-707(2)(d): the name of the bank or trust company depository.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-708 Audits.
--------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-708(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-708(1)(a): The division may at any time:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-708(1)(a)(i): audit records of the provider; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-708(1)(a)(ii): inspect records of the provider.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-708(1)(b): The provider or trustee shall make available to the division for examination, inspection, or auditing all records pertaining to the accounts relating to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-708(1)(b)(i): any contract sold under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-708(1)(b)(ii): any trust established under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-708(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-708(2)(a): The director may employ experts from outside the division if special need exists to perform examinations, inspections, and audits under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-9-708(2)(b): The provider shall be responsible for payment to the division of all reasonable and necessary costs related to the employment of experts under this section.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 11a - Cosmetology and Associated Professions Licensing Act
***************************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the  "Cosmetology and Associated Professions  Licensing Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(1): 58-11a-306(1); 58-11a-306(2); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Approved barber or cosmetologist/barber apprenticeship" means an apprenticeship that meets the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(2): 58-11a-306(4); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Approved esthetician apprenticeship" means an apprenticeship that meets the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(3): 58-11a-306(3); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Approved hair designer apprenticeship" means an apprenticeship that meets the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(4): 58-11a-306(5); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Approved master esthetician apprenticeship" means an apprenticeship that meets the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(5): 58-11a-306(6); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Approved nail technician apprenticeship" means an apprenticeship that meets the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(6): "Barber" means a person who is licensed under this chapter to engage in the practice of barbering.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(7): "Barber instructor" means a barber who is licensed under this chapter to engage in the practice of barbering instruction.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(8): 58-11a-201 "Board" means the Cosmetology and Associated Professions Licensing Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(9): 58-67-102 "Cosmetic laser procedure" includes a nonablative procedure as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(10): 58-1-505 "Cosmetic supervisor" means a supervisor as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(11): "Cosmetologist/barber" means a person who is licensed under this chapter to engage in the practice of cosmetology/barbering.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(12): "Cosmetologist/barber instructor" means a cosmetologist/barber who is licensed under this chapter to engage in the practice of cosmetology/barbering instruction.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(13): "Direct supervision" means that the supervisor of an apprentice or the instructor of a student is immediately available for consultation, advice, instruction, and evaluation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(14): "Electrologist" means a person who is licensed under this chapter to engage in the practice of electrology.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(15): "Electrologist instructor" means an electrologist who is licensed under this chapter to engage in the practice of electrology instruction.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(16): "Esthetician" means a person who is licensed under this chapter to engage in the practice of esthetics.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(17): "Esthetician instructor" means a master esthetician who is licensed under this chapter to engage in the practice of esthetics instruction.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(18): 58-11a-103 "Fund" means the Cosmetology and Associated Professions Education and Enforcement Fund created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(a): "Hair braiding" means the twisting, weaving, or interweaving of a person's natural human hair.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(b): "Hair braiding" includes the following methods or styles:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(b)(i): African-style braiding;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(b)(ii): box braids;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(b)(iii): cornrows;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(b)(iv): dreadlocks;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(b)(v): french braids;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(b)(vi): invisible braids;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(b)(vii): micro braids;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(b)(viii): single braids;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(b)(ix): single plaits;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(b)(x): twists;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(b)(xi): visible braids;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(b)(xii): the use of lock braids;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(b)(xiii): the use of decorative beads, accessories, and extensions; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(b)(xiv): the use of wefts if applied without the use of glue or tape.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(c): "Hair braiding" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(c)(i): the use of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(c)(i)(A): wefts if applied with the use of glue or tape;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(c)(i)(B): synthetic tape;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(c)(i)(C): synthetic glue;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(c)(i)(D): keratin bonds;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(c)(i)(E): fusion bonds; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(c)(i)(F): heat tools;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(c)(ii): the cutting of human hair; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(c)(iii): the application of heat, dye, a reactive chemical, or other preparation to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(c)(iii)(A): alter the color of the hair; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(19)(c)(iii)(B): straighten, curl, or alter the structure of the hair.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(20): "Hair designer" means a person who is licensed under this chapter to engage in the practice of hair design.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(21): "Hair designer instructor" means a hair designer who is licensed under this chapter to engage in the practice of hair design instruction.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(22): "Licensed barber or cosmetology/barber school" means a barber or cosmetology/barber school licensed under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(23): "Licensed electrology school" means an electrology school licensed under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(24): "Licensed esthetics school" means an esthetics school licensed under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(25): "Licensed hair design school" means a hair design school licensed under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(26): "Licensed nail technology school" means a nail technology school licensed under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(27): "Master esthetician" means an individual who is licensed under this chapter to engage in the practice of master-level esthetics.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(28): "Nail technician" means an individual who is licensed under this chapter to engage in the practice of nail technology.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(29): "Nail technician instructor" means a nail technician licensed under this chapter to engage in the practice of nail technology instruction.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(30): (30) "Practice of barbering" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(30)(a): cutting, clipping, or trimming the hair of the head of any person by the use of scissors, shears, clippers, or other appliances;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(30)(b): draping, shampooing, scalp treatments, basic wet styling, and blow drying;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(30)(c): removing hair from the face or neck of a person by the use of shaving equipment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(30)(d): (30) when providing other services described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(31): "Practice of barbering instruction" means teaching the practice of barbering at a licensed barber school, at a licensed cosmetology/barber school, or for an approved barber apprenticeship.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(32): (32)(f)(i) "Practice of basic esthetics" means any one of the following skin care procedures done on the body for cosmetic purposes and not for the treatment of medical, physical, or mental ailments:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(32)(a): cleansing, stimulating, manipulating, exercising, applying oils, antiseptics, clays, or masks, manual extraction, including a comedone extractor, depilatories, waxes, tweezing, the application of eyelash or eyebrow extensions, natural nail manicures or pedicures, or callous removal by buffing or filing;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(32)(b): limited chemical exfoliation as defined by rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(32)(c): removing superfluous hair by means other than electrolysis, except that an individual is not required to be licensed as an esthetician to engage in the practice of threading;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(32)(d): other esthetic preparations or procedures with the use of the hands, a high-frequency or galvanic electrical apparatus, or a heat lamp for cosmetic purposes and not for the treatment of medical, physical, or mental ailments;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(32)(e): arching eyebrows, tinting eyebrows or eyelashes, perming eyelashes, or applying eyelash or eyebrow extensions; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(32)(f): (32)(f)(i) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(32)(f)(i): superfluous hair removal which shall be under indirect supervision;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(32)(f)(ii): anti-aging resurfacing enhancements;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(32)(f)(iii): photo rejuvenation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(32)(f)(iv): tattoo removal.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(33): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(33)(a): "Practice of cosmetology/barbering" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(33)(a)(i): styling, arranging, dressing, curling, waving, permanent waving, cleansing, singeing, bleaching, dyeing, tinting, coloring, or similarly treating the hair of the head of a person;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(33)(a)(ii): cutting, clipping, or trimming the hair by the use of scissors, shears, clippers, or other appliances;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(33)(a)(iii): arching eyebrows, tinting eyebrows or eyelashes, perming eyelashes, applying eyelash or eyebrow extensions;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(33)(a)(iv): removing hair from the body of a person by the use of depilatories, waxing, or shaving equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(33)(a)(v): cutting, curling, styling, fitting, measuring, or forming caps for wigs or hairpieces or both on the human head; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(33)(a)(vi): practicing hair weaving or hair fusing or servicing previously medically implanted hair.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(33)(b): The term "practice of cosmetology/barbering" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(33)(b)(i): the practice of barbering;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(33)(b)(ii): the practice of basic esthetics; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(33)(b)(iii): the practice of nail technology.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(33)(c): An individual is not required to be licensed as a cosmetologist/barber to engage in the practice of threading.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(34): "Practice of cosmetology/barbering instruction" means teaching the practice of cosmetology/barbering:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(34)(a): at a licensed cosmetology/barber school, a licensed barber school, or a licensed nail technology school; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(34)(b): for an approved cosmetologist/barber apprenticeship.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(35): "Practice of electrology" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(35)(a): the removal of superfluous hair from the body of a person by the use of electricity, waxing, shaving, or tweezing; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(35)(b): cosmetic laser procedures under the supervision of a cosmetic supervisor limited to superfluous hair removal.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(36): "Practice of electrology instruction" means teaching the practice of electrology at a licensed electrology school.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(37): "Practice of esthetics instruction" means teaching the practice of basic esthetics or the practice of master-level esthetics:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(37)(a): at a licensed esthetics school or a licensed cosmetology/barber school; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(37)(b): for an approved esthetician apprenticeship or an approved master esthetician apprenticeship.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(38): "Practice of hair design" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(38)(a): styling, arranging, dressing, curling, waving, permanent waving, cleansing, singeing, bleaching, dyeing, tinting, coloring, or similarly treating the hair of the head of a person;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(38)(b): barbering, cutting, clipping, shaving, or trimming the hair by the use of scissors, shears, clippers, or other appliances;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(38)(c): cutting, curling, styling, fitting, measuring, or forming caps for wigs, hairpieces, or both on the human head; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(38)(d): practicing hair weaving, hair fusing, or servicing previously medically implanted hair.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(39): "Practice of hair design instruction" means teaching the practice of hair design at a licensed cosmetology/barber school, a licensed hair design school, or a licensed barber school.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(40): 58-1-506; 58-1-506(3)(a); (40)(a); (40)(a)(i)(H)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(40)(a): 58-1-506; 58-1-506(3)(a) "Practice of master-level esthetics" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(40)(a)(i): 58-1-506; 58-1-506(3)(a) any of the following when done for cosmetic purposes on the body and not for the treatment of medical, physical, or mental ailments:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(40)(a)(i)(A): body wraps as defined by rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(40)(a)(i)(B): hydrotherapy as defined by rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(40)(a)(i)(C): chemical exfoliation as defined by rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(40)(a)(i)(D): advanced pedicures as defined by rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(40)(a)(i)(E): sanding, including microdermabrasion;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(40)(a)(i)(F): advanced extraction;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(40)(a)(i)(G): other esthetic preparations or procedures with the use of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(40)(a)(i)(G)(I): the hands; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(40)(a)(i)(G)(II): a mechanical or electrical apparatus which is approved for use by division rule for beautifying or similar work performed on the body for cosmetic purposes and not for the treatment of a medical, physical, or mental ailment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(40)(a)(i)(H): 58-1-506; 58-1-506(3)(a) cosmetic laser procedures under the supervision of a cosmetic supervisor with a physician's evaluation before the procedure, as needed, unless specifically required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(40)(a)(i)(H)(I): superfluous hair removal;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(40)(a)(i)(H)(II): anti-aging resurfacing enhancements;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(40)(a)(i)(H)(III): photo rejuvenation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(40)(a)(i)(H)(IV): 58-1-506(3)(a) tattoo removal with a physician's, advanced practice nurse's, or physician assistant's evaluation before the tattoo removal procedure, as required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(40)(a)(ii): lymphatic massage by manual or other means as defined by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(40)(b): (40)(a); (40)(a)(i)(H) Notwithstanding the provisions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(40)(c): The term "practice of master-level esthetics" includes the practice of esthetics, but an individual is not required to be licensed as an esthetician or master-level esthetician to engage in the practice of threading.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(41): "Practice of nail technology" means to trim, cut, clean, manicure, shape, massage, or enhance the appearance of the hands, feet, and nails of an individual by the use of hands, mechanical, or electrical preparation, antiseptic, lotions, or creams, including the application and removal of sculptured or artificial nails.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(42): "Practice of nail technology instruction" means teaching the practice of nail technology at a licensed nail technician school, at a licensed cosmetology/barber school, or for an approved nail technician apprenticeship.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(43): "Recognized barber school" means a barber school located in a state other than Utah, whose students, upon graduation, are recognized as having completed the educational requirements for licensure in that state.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(44): "Recognized cosmetology/barber school" means a cosmetology/barber school located in a state other than Utah, whose students, upon graduation, are recognized as having completed the educational requirements for licensure in that state.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(45): "Recognized electrology school" means an electrology school located in a state other than Utah, whose students, upon graduation, are recognized as having completed the educational requirements for licensure in that state.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(46): "Recognized esthetics school" means an esthetics school located in a state other than Utah, whose students, upon graduation, are recognized as having completed the educational requirements for licensure in that state.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(47): "Recognized hair design school" means a hair design school located in a state other than Utah, whose students, upon graduation, are recognized as having completed the educational requirements for licensure in that state.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(48): "Recognized nail technology school" means a nail technology school located in a state other than Utah, whose students, upon graduation, are recognized as having completed the educational requirements for licensure in that state.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(49): "Salon" means a place, shop, or establishment in which cosmetology/barbering, esthetics, electrology, or nail technology is practiced.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(50): 58-1-501; 58-11a-502 "Unlawful conduct" is as defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-102(51): 58-1-501; 58-11a-501; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Unprofessional conduct" is as defined in Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-103 Education and enforcement fund.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-103(1): There is created an expendable special revenue fund known as the "Cosmetology and Associated Professions Education and Enforcement Fund."
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-103(2): The fund consists of money from administrative penalties collected pursuant to this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-103(3): The fund shall earn interest and all interest earned on fund money shall be deposited into the fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-103(4): The director may, with concurrence of the board, make distributions from the fund for the following purposes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-103(4)(a): education and training of licensees under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-103(4)(b): education and training of the public or other interested persons in matters concerning the laws governing the practices licensed under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-103(4)(c): enforcement of this chapter by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-103(4)(c)(i): investigating unprofessional or unlawful conduct; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-103(4)(c)(ii): providing legal representation to the division when the division takes legal action against a person engaging in unprofessional or unlawful conduct.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-103(5): The division shall report annually to the appropriate appropriations subcommittee of the Legislature concerning the fund.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201 Board.
---------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(1): There is created the Cosmetology and Associated Professions Licensing Board consisting of  the following  nine members:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(1)(a): one barber or cosmetologist/barber;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(1)(b)(i): one barber or cosmetologist/barber instructor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(1)(b)(ii): one representative of a licensed barber or cosmetology/barber school;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(1)(c): one master esthetician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(1)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(1)(d)(i): one esthetician instructor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(1)(d)(ii): one representative of a licensed esthetics school;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(1)(e): one nail technician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(1)(f): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(1)(f)(i): one nail technician instructor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(1)(f)(ii): one representative of a licensed nail technician school;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(1)(g): one electrologist; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(1)(h): two members from the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(2): 58-1-201; (1)(b); (d); (f); (1)(b); (d); (f)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(2)(a): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed and serve in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(2)(b): (1)(b); (d); (f); (1)(b); (d); (f)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(2)(b)(i): (1)(b); (d); (f) At least one of the members of the board appointed under Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(2)(b)(ii): (1)(b); (d); (f) At least one of the members of the board appointed under Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203 The duties and responsibilities of the board are in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(3)(a): assist the division in reviewing complaints concerning the unlawful or unprofessional conduct of a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(3)(b): advise the division in its investigation of these complaints.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-201(4): (3) A board member who has, under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-301(1): 58-1-307; 58-11a-304 Except as specifically provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-301(1)(a): engage in the practice of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-301(1)(a)(i): barbering;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-301(1)(a)(ii): barbering instruction;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-301(1)(a)(iii): cosmetology/barbering;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-301(1)(a)(iv): cosmetology/barbering instruction;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-301(1)(a)(v): electrology;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-301(1)(a)(vi): electrology instruction;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-301(1)(a)(vii): esthetics;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-301(1)(a)(viii): master-level esthetics;

Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-301(1)(b)(iv): an esthetics school;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-301(1)(b)(v): a hair design school; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-301(1)(b)(vi): a nail technology school.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-301(2): The division shall issue to a person who qualifies under this chapter a license in the following classifications:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-301(2)(a): barber;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-301(2)(b): barber instructor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-301(2)(c): barber school;

Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302 Qualifications for licensure.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(1): 63J-1-504; (1)(c)(ii)(A); (1)(c) Each applicant for licensure as a barber shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(1)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(1)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(1)(c): (1)(c)(ii)(A) provide satisfactory documentation of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(1)(c)(i): graduation from a licensed or recognized barber school, or a licensed or recognized cosmetology/barber school, whose curriculum consists of a minimum of 1,000 hours of instruction, or the equivalent number of credit hours, over a period of not less than 25 weeks;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(1)(c)(ii): (1)(c)(ii)(A)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(1)(c)(ii)(A): graduation from a recognized barber school located in a state other than Utah whose curriculum consists of less than 1,000 hours of instruction or the equivalent number of credit hours; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(1)(c)(ii)(B): (1)(c)(ii)(A) practice as a licensed barber in a state other than Utah for not less than the number of hours required to equal 1,000 total hours when added to the hours of instruction described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(1)(c)(iii): completion of an approved barber apprenticeship; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(1)(d): (1)(c) meet one of the following requirements established by rule:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(1)(d)(i): pass an examination that consists of a written theory portion and a practical portion; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(1)(d)(ii): (1)(c) pass a practical examination and provide the written attestation of a licensed barber or cosmetologist/barber instructor who participated in the school or training under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(2): (24); 63J-1-504 Each applicant for licensure as a barber instructor shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(2)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(2)(b): (24); 63J-1-504 subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(2)(c): provide satisfactory documentation that the applicant is currently licensed as a barber;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(2)(d): provide satisfactory documentation of completion of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(2)(d)(i): an instructor training program conducted by a licensed or recognized school, as defined by rule, consisting of a minimum of 250 hours or the equivalent number of credit hours;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(2)(d)(ii): on-the-job instructor training conducted by a licensed instructor at a licensed or recognized school, as defined by rule, consisting of a minimum of 250 hours or the equivalent number of credit hours; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(2)(d)(iii): a minimum of 2,000 hours of experience as a barber; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(2)(e): meet the examination requirement established by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(3): 63J-1-504; (22) Each applicant for licensure as a barber school shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(3)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(3)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(3)(c): (22) provide satisfactory documentation:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(3)(c)(i): of appropriate registration with the Division of Corporations and Commercial Code;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(3)(c)(ii): of business licensure from the city, town, or county in which the school is located;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(3)(c)(iii): that the applicant's physical facilities comply with the requirements established by rule; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(3)(c)(iv): (22) that the applicant meets:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(3)(c)(iv)(A): the standards for barber schools, including staff and accreditation requirements, established by rule; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(3)(c)(iv)(B): (22) the requirements for recognition as an institution of postsecondary study as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(4): 63J-1-504; (4)(c)(ii)(A) Each applicant for licensure as a cosmetologist/barber shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(4)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(4)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(4)(c): (4)(c)(ii)(A) provide satisfactory documentation of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(4)(c)(i): graduation from a licensed or recognized cosmetology/barber school whose curriculum consists of a minimum of 1,600 hours of instruction, or the equivalent number of credit hours, with full flexibility within those hours;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(4)(c)(ii): (4)(c)(ii)(A)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(4)(c)(ii)(A): graduation from a recognized cosmetology/barber school located in a state other than Utah whose curriculum consists of less than 1,600 hours of instruction, or the equivalent number of credit hours, with full flexibility within those hours; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(4)(c)(ii)(B): (4)(c)(ii)(A) practice as a licensed cosmetologist/barber in a state other than Utah for not less than the number of hours required to equal 1,600 total hours when added to the hours of instruction described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(4)(c)(iii): completion of an approved cosmetology/barber apprenticeship; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(4)(d): meet the examination requirement established by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(5): (24); 63J-1-504 Each applicant for licensure as a cosmetologist/barber instructor shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(5)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(5)(b): (24); 63J-1-504 subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(5)(c): provide satisfactory documentation that the applicant is currently licensed as a cosmetologist/barber;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(5)(d): provide satisfactory documentation of completion of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(5)(d)(i): an instructor training program conducted by a licensed or recognized school, as defined by rule, consisting of a minimum of 400 hours or the equivalent number of credit hours;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(5)(d)(ii): on-the-job instructor training conducted by a licensed instructor at a licensed or recognized school, as defined by rule, consisting of a minimum of 400 hours or the equivalent number of credit hours; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(5)(d)(iii): a minimum of 3,000 hours of experience as a cosmetologist/barber; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(5)(e): meet the examination requirement established by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(6): 63J-1-504; (22) Each applicant for licensure as a cosmetologist/barber school shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(6)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(6)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(6)(c): (22) provide satisfactory documentation:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(6)(c)(i): of appropriate registration with the Division of Corporations and Commercial Code;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(6)(c)(ii): of business licensure from the city, town, or county in which the school is located;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(6)(c)(iii): that the applicant's physical facilities comply with the requirements established by rule; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(6)(c)(iv): (22) that the applicant meets:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(6)(c)(iv)(A): the standards for cosmetology schools, including staff and accreditation requirements, established by rule; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(6)(c)(iv)(B): (22) the requirements for recognition as an institution of postsecondary study as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(7): 63J-1-504 Each applicant for licensure as an electrologist shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(7)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(7)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(7)(c): provide satisfactory documentation of having graduated from a licensed or recognized electrology school after completing a curriculum of 600 hours of instruction or the equivalent number of credit hours; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(7)(d): meet the examination requirement established by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(8): (24); 63J-1-504 Each applicant for licensure as an electrologist instructor shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(8)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(8)(b): (24); 63J-1-504 subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(8)(c): provide satisfactory documentation that the applicant is currently licensed as an electrologist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(8)(d): provide satisfactory documentation of completion of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(8)(d)(i): an instructor training program conducted by a licensed or recognized school, as defined by rule, consisting of a minimum of 150 hours or the equivalent number of credit hours;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(8)(d)(ii): on-the-job instructor training conducted by a licensed instructor at a licensed or recognized school, as defined by rule, consisting of a minimum of 150 hours or the equivalent number of credit hours; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(8)(d)(iii): a minimum of 1,000 hours of experience as an electrologist; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(8)(e): meet the examination requirement established by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(9): 63J-1-504; (22) Each applicant for licensure as an electrologist school shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(9)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(9)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(9)(c): (22) provide satisfactory documentation:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(9)(c)(i): of appropriate registration with the Division of Corporations and Commercial Code;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(9)(c)(ii): of business licensure from the city, town, or county in which the school is located;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(9)(c)(iii): that the applicant's facilities comply with the requirements established by rule; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(9)(c)(iv): (22) that the applicant meets:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(9)(c)(iv)(A): the standards for electrologist schools, including staff, curriculum, and accreditation requirements, established by rule; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(9)(c)(iv)(B): (22) the requirements for recognition as an institution of postsecondary study as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(10): 63J-1-504; (10)(c)(iii)(A) Each applicant for licensure as an esthetician shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(10)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(10)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(10)(c): (10)(c)(iii)(A) provide satisfactory documentation of one of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(10)(c)(i): graduation from a licensed or recognized esthetic school or a licensed or recognized cosmetology/barber school whose curriculum consists of not less than 15 weeks of esthetic instruction with a minimum of 600 hours or the equivalent number of credit hours;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(10)(c)(ii): completion of an approved esthetician apprenticeship; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(10)(c)(iii): (10)(c)(iii)(A)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(10)(c)(iii)(A): graduation from a recognized cosmetology/barber school located in a state other than Utah whose curriculum consists of less than 1,600 hours of instruction, or the equivalent number of credit hours, with full flexibility within those hours; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(10)(c)(iii)(B): (10)(c)(iii)(A) practice as a licensed cosmetologist/barber for not less than the number of hours required to equal 1,600 total hours when added to the hours of instruction described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(10)(d): meet the examination requirement established by division rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(11): 63J-1-504 Each applicant for licensure as a master esthetician shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(11)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(11)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(11)(c): provide satisfactory documentation of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(11)(c)(i): completion of at least 1,200 hours of training, or the equivalent number of credit hours, at a licensed or recognized esthetics school, except that up to 600 hours toward the 1,200 hours may have been completed:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(11)(c)(i)(A): at a licensed or recognized cosmetology/barbering school, if the applicant graduated from the school and its curriculum consisted of at least 1,600 hours of instruction, or the equivalent number of credit hours, with full flexibility within those hours; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(11)(c)(i)(B): at a licensed or recognized cosmetology/barber school located in a state other than Utah, if the applicant graduated from the school and its curriculum contained full flexibility within its hours of instruction; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(11)(c)(ii): completion of an approved master esthetician apprenticeship;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(11)(d): if the applicant will practice lymphatic massage, provide satisfactory documentation to show completion of 200 hours of training, or the equivalent number of credit hours, in lymphatic massage as defined by division rule; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(11)(e): meet the examination requirement established by division rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(12): (24); 63J-1-504 Each applicant for licensure as an esthetician instructor shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(12)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(12)(b): (24); 63J-1-504 subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(12)(c): provide satisfactory documentation that the applicant is currently licensed as a master esthetician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(12)(d): provide satisfactory documentation of completion of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(12)(d)(i): an instructor training program conducted by a licensed or recognized school, as defined by rule, consisting of a minimum of 300 hours or the equivalent number of credit hours;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(12)(d)(ii): on-the-job instructor training conducted by a licensed instructor at a licensed or recognized school, as defined by rule, consisting of a minimum of 300 hours or the equivalent number of credit hours; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(12)(d)(iii): a minimum of 1,000 hours of experience in esthetics; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(12)(e): meet the examination requirement established by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(13): 63J-1-504; (22) Each applicant for licensure as an esthetics school shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(13)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(13)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(13)(c): (22) provide satisfactory documentation:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(13)(c)(i): of appropriate registration with the Division of Corporations and Commercial Code;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(13)(c)(ii): of business licensure from the city, town, or county in which the school is located;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(13)(c)(iii): that the applicant's physical facilities comply with the requirements established by rule; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(13)(c)(iv): (22) that the applicant meets:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(13)(c)(iv)(A): the standards for esthetics schools, including staff, curriculum, and accreditation requirements, established by division rule made in collaboration with the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(13)(c)(iv)(B): (22) the requirements for recognition as an institution of postsecondary study as described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(14)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(14)(c): (14)(c)(ii)(A) provide satisfactory documentation of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(14)(c)(i): graduation from a licensed or recognized cosmetology/barber, hair design, or barbering school whose curriculum consists of a minimum of 1,200 hours of instruction, or the equivalent number of credit hours, with full flexibility within those hours;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(14)(c)(ii): (14)(c)(ii)(A)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(14)(c)(ii)(A): graduation from a recognized cosmetology/barber, hair design, or barbering school located in a state other than Utah whose curriculum consists of less than 1,200 hours of instruction, or the equivalent number of credit hours, with full flexibility within those hours; and

Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(14)(c)(iv): completion of an approved hair designer apprenticeship; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(14)(d): meet the examination requirements established by rule.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(15)(c): provide satisfactory documentation that the applicant is currently licensed as a hair designer or as a cosmetologist/barber;

Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(15)(d)(i): an instructor training program conducted by a licensed or recognized school, as defined by rule, consisting of a minimum of 300 hours or the equivalent number of credit hours;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(15)(d)(ii): on-the-job instructor training conducted by a licensed instructor at a licensed or recognized school, as defined by rule, consisting of a minimum of 300 hours or the equivalent number of credit hours; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(15)(d)(iii): a minimum of 2,500 hours of experience as a hair designer or as a cosmetologist/barber; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(15)(e): meet the examination requirement established by rule.
