Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(20): Each applicant for licensure under this chapter whose education in the field for which a license is sought was completed at a foreign school may satisfy the educational requirement for licensure by demonstrating, to the satisfaction of the division, the educational equivalency of the foreign school education with a licensed school under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(21): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (21)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(21)(a): A licensed or recognized school under this section shall accept credit hours towards graduation for documented, relevant, and substantially equivalent coursework previously completed by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(21)(a)(i): a student that did not complete the student's education while attending a different school; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(21)(a)(ii): a licensee of any other profession listed in this section, based on the licensee's schooling, apprenticeship, or experience.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(21)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (21)(a) In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(22): Title 53G, Chapter 6, Part 2, Compulsory Education A school licensed or applying for licensure under this chapter shall maintain recognition as an institution of postsecondary study by meeting the following conditions:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(22)(a): Title 53G, Chapter 6, Part 2, Compulsory Education the school shall admit as a regular student only an individual who has earned a recognized high school diploma or the equivalent of a recognized high school diploma, or who is beyond the age of compulsory high school attendance as prescribed by
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(22)(b): the school shall be licensed by name, or in the case of an applicant, shall apply for licensure by name, under this chapter to offer one or more training programs beyond the secondary level.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(23): 58-11a-306 A person seeking to qualify for licensure under this chapter by apprenticing in an approved apprenticeship shall register with the division as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(24): The department may only charge a fee to a person applying for licensure as any type of instructor under this chapter if the person is not a licensed instructor in any other profession under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302(25): In order to encourage economic development in the state, the department may offer any required examination under this section, which is prepared by a national testing organization, in languages in addition to English.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-302.5 Online curriculum for a licensed school.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
A barber school, cosmetology/barber school, electrologist school, esthetics school, hair design school, or nail technology school licensed under this chapter may offer up to 50% of the school's total per program curriculum online in accordance with standards adopted by an applicable nationally recognized accrediting organization.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-303 Terms of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-303(1): 58-11a-302
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-303(1)(a): 58-11a-302 The division shall issue each license under this chapter in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule, except that an instructor license is a one-time certificate and does not expire unless the licensee fails to keep current the license that qualified the licensee to be an instructor under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-303(1)(b): The division may by rule extend or shorten a renewal period by as much as one year to stagger the renewal cycles it administers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-303(2): At the time of renewal, a licensed school shall show satisfactory evidence that the school meets the standards for that type of school, including staff, curriculum, and accreditation requirements, established by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-303(3): 58-1-308 Each license expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless the licensee renews it in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304 Exemptions from licensure.
-----------------------------------------------------------
In addition to the exemptions from licensure in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(1): a person licensed under the laws of this state to engage in the practice of medicine, surgery, osteopathy, or chiropractic when engaged in the practice of the profession for which they are licensed;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(2): a commissioned physician or surgeon serving in the armed forces of the United States or another federal agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(3): a registered nurse, undertaker, or mortician licensed under the laws of this state when engaged in the practice of the profession for which the person is licensed;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(4): a person who visits the state to engage in instructional seminars, advanced classes, trade shows, or competitions of a limited duration;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(5): a person who engages in the practice of barbering, cosmetology/barbering, hair design, esthetics, master-level esthetics, electrology, or nail technology without compensation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(6): a person instructing an adult education class or other educational program directed toward persons who are not licensed under this chapter and that is not intended to train persons to become licensed under this chapter, provided:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(6)(a): an attendee receives no credit toward educational requirements for licensure under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(6)(b): the instructor informs each attendee in writing that taking such a class or program will not certify or qualify the attendee to perform a service for compensation that requires licensure under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(6)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(6)(c)(i): the instructor is properly licensed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(6)(c)(ii): the instructor receives no compensation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(7): a person providing instruction in workshops, seminars, training meetings, or other educational programs whose purpose is to provide continuing professional development to licensed barbers, cosmetologists/barbers, hair designers, estheticians, master estheticians, electrologists, or nail technicians;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(8): a person enrolled in a licensed barber, cosmetology/barber, or hair design school when participating in an on the job training internship under the direct supervision of a licensed barber, cosmetologist/barber, or hair designer upon completion of a basic program under the standards established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(9): 58-11a-306 a person enrolled in an approved apprenticeship pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(10): an employee of a company that is primarily engaged in the business of selling products used in the practice of barbering, cosmetology/barbering, hair design, esthetics, master-level esthetics, electrology, or nail technology when demonstrating the company's products to a potential customer, provided the employee makes no representation to a potential customer that attending such a demonstration will certify or qualify the attendee to perform a service for compensation that requires licensure under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(11): a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(11)(a): is qualified to engage in the practice of barbering, cosmetology/barbering, hair design, esthetics, master-level esthetics, electrology, or nail technology in another jurisdiction as evidenced by licensure, certification, or lawful practice in the other jurisdiction;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(11)(b): is employed by, or under contract with, a motion picture company; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(11)(c): engages in the practice of barbering, cosmetology/barbering, hair design, esthetics, master-level esthetics, electrology, or nail technology in the state:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(11)(c)(i): solely to assist in the production of a motion picture; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(11)(c)(ii): for no more than 120 days per calendar year;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(12): 58-1-307 a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(12)(a): engages in hair braiding; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(12)(b): 58-1-307 unless it is expressly exempted under this section or Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(13): 58-1-307; (13)(f) a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(13)(a): dries, styles, arranges, dresses, curls, hot irons, shampoos, or conditions hair;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(13)(b): does not cut the hair;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(13)(c): does not apply dye to alter the color of the hair;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(13)(d): does not apply reactive chemicals to straighten, curl, or alter the structure of the hair;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(13)(e): 58-1-307 unless it is expressly exempted under this section or Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(13)(f): provides evidence to the division that the person has received a hair safety permit from completing a hair safety program that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(13)(f)(i): is approved by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(13)(f)(ii): consists of no more than two hours of instruction;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(13)(f)(iii): is offered by a provider approved by the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(13)(f)(iv): includes an examination that requires a passing score of 75%; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(13)(g): (13)(f) displays in a conspicuous location in the person's place of business:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(13)(g)(i): (13)(f) a valid hair safety permit as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-304(13)(g)(ii): a sign notifying the public that the person's services are not provided by an individual who has a license under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-305 Requirement to display license.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Each licensee under this chapter shall prominently display the licensee's license at the location where the licensee engages in the practice for which that license is issued under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306 Apprenticeship.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(1): An approved barber apprenticeship shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(1)(a): consist of not less than 1,250 hours of training; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(1)(b): be conducted by a supervisor who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(1)(b)(i): is licensed under this chapter as a barber instructor or a cosmetology/barber instructor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(1)(b)(ii): provides one-on-one direct supervision of the barber apprentice during the apprenticeship program.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(2): An approved cosmetologist/barber apprenticeship shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(2)(a): consist of not less than 2,500 hours of training; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(2)(b): be conducted by a supervisor who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(2)(b)(i): is licensed under this chapter as a cosmetologist/barber  instructor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(2)(b)(ii): provides one-on-one direct supervision of the cosmetologist/barber  apprentice during the apprenticeship program.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(3): An approved hair designer apprenticeship shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(3)(a): consist of not less than 1,600 hours of training; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(3)(b): be conducted by a supervisor who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(3)(b)(i): is licensed under this chapter as a hair designer instructor or a cosmetologist/barber instructor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(3)(b)(ii): provides one-on-one direct supervision of the hair designer apprentice during the apprenticeship program.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(4): An approved esthetician apprenticeship shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(4)(a): consist of not less than 800 hours of training; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(4)(b): be conducted by a supervisor who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(4)(b)(i): is licensed under this chapter as an esthetician instructor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(4)(b)(ii): provides one-on-one direct supervision of the esthetician apprentice during the apprenticeship program.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(5): An approved master esthetician apprenticeship shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(5)(a): consist of not less than 1,500 hours of training; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(5)(b): be conducted by a supervisor who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(5)(b)(i): is licensed under this chapter as a master-level esthetician instructor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(5)(b)(ii): provides one-on-one direct supervision of the master esthetician apprentice during the apprenticeship program.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(6): An approved nail technician apprenticeship shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(6)(a): consist of not less than 375 hours of training; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(6)(b): be conducted by a supervisor who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(6)(b)(i): is licensed under this chapter as a nail technician instructor or a cosmetology/barber instructor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(6)(b)(ii): provides direct supervision of the nail technician apprentice during the apprenticeship program; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(6)(b)(iii): provides direct supervision to no more than two nail technician apprentices during the apprentice program.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(7): 63J-1-504 A person seeking to qualify for licensure by apprenticing in an approved apprenticeship under this chapter shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(7)(a): 63J-1-504 register with the division before beginning the training requirements by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(7)(a)(i): submitting a form prescribed by the division, which includes the name of the licensed supervisor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(7)(a)(ii): 63J-1-504 paying a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(7)(b): complete the apprenticeship within five years of the date on which the division approves the registration; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(7)(c): notify the division within 30 days if the licensed supervisor changes after the registration is approved by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-306(8): (7) Notwithstanding Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-401 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for refusing to issue a license to an applicant, for refusing to renew the license of a licensee, for revoking, suspending, restricting, or placing on probation the license of a licensee, for issuing a public or private reprimand to a licensee, and for issuing a cease and desist order shall be in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501 Unprofessional conduct.
--------------------------------------------------------
Unprofessional conduct includes:Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(1): failing as a licensed school to obtain or maintain accreditation as required by rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(2): failing as a licensed school to comply with the standards of accreditation applicable to such schools;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(3): failing as a licensed school to provide adequate instruction to enrolled students;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(4): failing as an apprentice supervisor to provide direct supervision to the apprentice;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(5): failing as an instructor to provide direct supervision to students who are providing services to an individual under the instructor's supervision;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(6): failing as an apprentice supervisor to comply with division rules relating to apprenticeship programs under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(7): keeping a salon or school, its furnishing, tools, utensils, linen, or appliances in an unsanitary condition;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(8): Title 26B, Utah Health and Human Services Code failing to comply with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(9): 58-11a-305 failing to display licenses or certificates as required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(10): failing to comply with physical facility requirements established by rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(11): failing to maintain mechanical or electrical equipment in safe operating condition;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(12): failing to adequately monitor patrons using steam rooms, dry heat rooms, baths, showers, or saunas;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(13): prescribing or administering prescription drugs;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(14): failing to comply with all applicable state and local health or sanitation laws;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(15): engaging in any act or practice in a professional capacity that is outside the applicable scope of practice;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(16): engaging in any act or practice in a professional capacity which the licensee is not competent to perform through education or training;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(17): in connection with the use of a chemical exfoliant, unless under the supervision of a licensed health care practitioner acting within the scope of his or her license:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(17)(a): using any acid, concentration of an acid, or combination of treatments which violates the standards established by rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(17)(b): removing any layer of skin deeper than the stratum corneum of the epidermis; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(17)(c): using an exfoliant that contains phenol, TCA acid of over 15%, or BCA acid;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(18): in connection with the sanding of the skin, unless under the supervision of a licensed health care practitioner acting within the scope of his or her license, removing any layer of skin deeper than the stratum corneum of the epidermis;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(19): using as a barber, cosmetologist/barber, or nail technician any laser procedure or intense, pulsed light source, except that nothing in this chapter precludes an individual licensed under this chapter from using a nonprescriptive laser device; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-501(20): failing to comply with a judgment order from a court of competent jurisdiction resulting from the failure to pay outstanding tuition or education costs incurred to comply with this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-502 Unlawful conduct.
--------------------------------------------------
Unlawful conduct includes:Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-502(1): 58-1-307; 58-11a-304 practicing or engaging in, or attempting to practice or engage in activity for which a license is required under this chapter unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-502(1)(a): the person holds the appropriate license under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-502(1)(b): 58-1-307; 58-11a-304 an exemption in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-502(2): touching, or applying an instrument or device to the following areas of a client's body:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-502(2)(a): the genitals or the anus, except in cases where the patron states to a licensee that the patron requests a hair removal procedure and signs a written consent form, which must also include the witnessed signature of a legal guardian if the patron is a minor, authorizing the licensee to perform a hair removal procedure; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-502(2)(b): the breast of a female patron, except in cases in which the female patron states to a licensee that the patron requests breast skin procedures and signs a written consent form, which must also include the witnessed signature of a parent or legal guardian if the patron is a minor, authorizing the licensee to perform breast skin procedures;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-502(3): using or possessing a solution composed of at least 10% methyl methacrylete on a client;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-502(4): 58-67-102 performing an ablative procedure as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-502(5): when acting as an instructor regarding a service requiring licensure under this chapter, for a class or education program where attendees are not licensed under this chapter, failing to inform each attendee in writing that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-502(5)(a): taking the class or program without completing the requirements for licensure under this chapter is insufficient to certify or qualify the attendee to perform a service for compensation that requires licensure under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-502(5)(b): the attendee is required to obtain licensure under this chapter before performing the service for compensation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-502(6): Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act failing as a salon or school where nail technology is practiced or taught to maintain a source capture system required under

Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-503(4)(b)(i): Each citation shall be in writing and describe with particularity the nature of the violation, including a reference to the provision of the chapter, rule, or order alleged to have been violated.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-503(4)(b)(ii): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act The citation shall clearly state that the recipient must notify the division in writing within 20 calendar days of service of the citation if the recipient wishes to contest the citation at a hearing conducted under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-503(4)(b)(iii): The citation shall clearly explain the consequences of failure to timely contest the citation or to make payment of a fine assessed by the citation within the time specified in the citation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-503(4)(c): Each citation issued under this section, or a copy of each citation, may be served upon a person upon whom a summons may be served in accordance with the Utah Rules of Civil Procedure and may be made personally or upon the person's agent by a division investigator or by a person specially designated by the director or by mail.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-503(4)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-503(4)(d)(i): If within 20 calendar days from the service of a citation, the person to whom the citation was issued fails to request a hearing to contest the citation, the citation becomes the final order of the division and is not subject to further agency review.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-503(4)(d)(ii): The period to contest a citation may be extended by the division for cause.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-503(4)(e): The division may refuse to issue or renew, suspend, revoke, or place on probation the license of a licensee who fails to comply with a citation after it becomes final.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-503(4)(f): The failure of an applicant for licensure to comply with a citation after it becomes final is a ground for denial of license.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-503(4)(g): No citation may be issued under this section after the expiration of one year following the date on which the violation that is the subject of the citation is reported to the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-503(4)(h): (4)(a); (4)(a); (4)(a) Fines shall be assessed by the director or the director's designee according to the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-503(4)(h)(i): (4)(a) for a first offense under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-503(5)(b): A penalty which is not paid may be collected by the director by either:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-503(5)(b)(i): referring the matter to a collection agency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-503(5)(b)(ii): bringing an action in the district court of the county in which the person against whom the penalty is imposed resides or in the county where the office of the director is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-503(5)(c): A county attorney or the attorney general of the state shall provide legal assistance and advice to the director in an action to collect a penalty.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-11a-503(5)(d): A court shall award reasonable attorney fees and costs to the prevailing party in an action brought by the division to collect a penalty.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-1 Title.
------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Health Care Providers Immunity from Liability Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.5 Standard of proof for emergency care when immunity does not apply.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.5(1): 78B-3-403; 58-13-2; 78B-5-817 A person who is a health care provider as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.5(2): (1); 31A-1-301 For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.5(3): This section does not apply to emergency care provided by a physician if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.5(3)(a): the physician has a previously established physician/patient relationship with the patient outside of the emergency room;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.5(3)(b): the patient has been seen in the last three months by the physician for the same condition for which emergency care is sought; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.5(3)(c): the physician can access and consult the patient's relevant medical care records while the physician is making decisions about and providing the emergency care.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.5(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.5(4)(a): Nothing in this section may be construed as:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.5(4)(a)(i): altering the applicable standard of care for determining fault; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.5(4)(a)(ii): applying the standard of proof of clear and convincing evidence to care outside of emergency care and the mandatory legal duty to treat.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.5(4)(b): This section applies to emergency care given after June 1, 2009.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.5(5): 63I-1-258 This section sunsets in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.6 Emergency care rendered by a person or health care facility.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.6(1): 26B-2-201(18) For purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.6(1)(a): "Emergency" means an unexpected occurrence involving injury, the threat of injury, or illness to a person or the public due to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.6(1)(a)(i): a natural disaster;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.6(1)(a)(ii): bioterrorism;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.6(1)(a)(iii): an act of terrorism;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.6(1)(a)(iv): a pandemic; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.6(1)(a)(v): other event of similar nature.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.6(1)(b): "Emergency care" includes actual assistance or advice offered to avoid, mitigate, or attempt to mitigate the effects of an emergency.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.6(1)(c): 26B-2-201(18) "Person" means the same as that term is defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.6(2): (2)(b); (2)(a); Title 26A, Chapter 1, Local Health Departments; Title 26B, Chapter 7, Part 4; 26B-7-301; (2)(a)

Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.6(2)(a)(ii): caused the emergency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.6(2)(a)(iii): has engaged in criminal conduct.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7 Limited immunity during a declared major public health emergency.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(1): 58-85-106; 78B-3-403; 78B-3-403; 58-17b-102; 58-17b-102; (1)(f)(ii) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(1)(a): 58-85-106 "Declared major public health emergency" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(1)(b): 78B-3-403 "Health care" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(1)(c): 78B-3-403 "Health care provider" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(1)(d): 58-17b-102 "Prescription device" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(1)(e): 58-17b-102 "Prescription drug" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(1)(f): (1)(f)(ii) "Qualified treatment" means the use of a prescription drug or prescription device:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(1)(f)(i): during a declared major public health emergency;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(1)(f)(ii): to treat a patient who has been diagnosed with the illness or condition that resulted in the declared major public health emergency; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(1)(f)(iii): (1)(f)(ii) that has been approved for sale but not indicated by the United States Food and Drug Administration to treat the illness or condition described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(2)(a): A health care provider is immune from civil liability for any harm resulting from any act or omission in the course of providing health care during a declared major public health emergency if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(2)(a)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(2)(a)(i)(A): the health care is provided in good faith to treat a patient for the illness or condition that resulted in the declared major public health emergency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(2)(a)(i)(B): the act or omission was the direct result of providing health care to a patient for the illness or condition that resulted in the declared major public health emergency; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(2)(a)(ii): the acts or omissions of the health care provider were not:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(2)(a)(ii)(A): grossly negligent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(2)(a)(ii)(B): intentional or malicious misconduct.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(2)(b): (2)(a) The immunity in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(2)(b)(i): even if the health care provider has a duty to respond or an expectation of payment or remuneration; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(2)(b)(ii): in addition to any immunity protections that may apply under state or federal law.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(2)(c): During a declared major public health emergency, it is not a breach of the applicable standard of care for a health care provider to provide health care that is not within the health care provider's education, training, or experience, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(2)(c)(i): the health care is within the applicable scope of practice for the type of license issued to the health care provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(2)(c)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(2)(c)(ii)(A): the health care is provided in good faith to treat a patient for the illness or condition that resulted in the declared major public health emergency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(2)(c)(ii)(B): there is an urgent shortage of health care providers as a direct result of the declared major public health emergency; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(2)(c)(iii): providing the health care is not:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(2)(c)(iii)(A): grossly negligent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(2)(c)(iii)(B): intentional or malicious misconduct.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(3): (3)(a)(iii)(A); (3)(a)(ii); (3)(a)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(3)(a): (3)(a)(iii)(A) A health care provider is not subject to civil liability, criminal liability, or sanctions against the health care provider's license for providing a qualified treatment to a patient if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(3)(a)(i): the qualified treatment is within the scope of the health care provider's license;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(3)(a)(ii): if written recommendations have been issued by a federal government agency regarding the use of the qualified treatment for treatment of the illness or condition that resulted in the declared major public health emergency, the health care provider provides the qualified treatment in accordance with the most current written recommendations issued by the federal government agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(3)(a)(iii): (3)(a)(iii)(A) the health care provider:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(3)(a)(iii)(A): describes to the patient or the patient's representative, based on the health care provider's knowledge of the qualified treatment, the possible positive and negative outcomes the patient could experience if the health care provider treats the patient with the qualified treatment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(3)(a)(iii)(B): (3)(a)(iii)(A) documents in the patient's medical record the information provided to the patient or the patient's representative under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(3)(a)(iv): the acts or omissions of the health care provider were not:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(3)(a)(iv)(A): grossly negligent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(3)(a)(iv)(B): intentional or malicious misconduct.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-2.7(3)(b): (3)(a)(ii); (3)(a)(ii) If two or more written recommendations described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3 Qualified immunity -- Health professionals -- Charity care.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(1)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(1)(a)(i): The Legislature finds many residents of this state do not receive medical care and preventive health care because they lack health insurance or because of financial difficulties or cost.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(1)(a)(ii): The Legislature also finds that many physicians, charity health care facilities, and other health care professionals in this state would be willing to volunteer medical and allied services without compensation if they were not subject to the high exposure of liability connected with providing these services.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(1)(b): The Legislature therefore declares that its intention in enacting this section is to encourage the provision of uncompensated volunteer charity health care in exchange for a limitation on liability for the health care facilities and health care professionals who provide those volunteer services.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2): (2)(c); Chapter 5a, Podiatric Physician Licensing Act; Chapter 16a, Utah Optometry Practice Act; Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act; Chapter 24b, Physical Therapy Practice Act; Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act; Chapter 40, Recreational Therapy Practice Act; Chapter 41, Speech-Language Pathology and Audiology Licensing Act; Chapter 42a, Occupational Therapy Practice Act; Chapter 44a, Nurse Midwife Practice Act; Chapter 49, Dietitian Certification Act; Chapter 60, Mental Health Professional Practice Act; Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; Chapter 69, Dentist and Dental Hygienist Practice Act; Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act; Chapter 71, Naturopathic Physician Practice Act; Chapter 72, Acupuncture Licensing Act; Chapter 73, Chiropractic Physician Practice Act As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(a): (2)(c) "Continuing education requirement" means the requirement for hours of continuing education, established by the division, with which a health care professional must comply to renew the health care professional's license under the applicable chapter described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(b): "Health care facility" means any clinic or hospital, church, or organization whose primary purpose is to sponsor, promote, or organize uncompensated health care services for people unable to pay for health care services.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(c): Chapter 5a, Podiatric Physician Licensing Act; Chapter 16a, Utah Optometry Practice Act; Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act; Chapter 24b, Physical Therapy Practice Act; Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act; Chapter 40, Recreational Therapy Practice Act; Chapter 41, Speech-Language Pathology and Audiology Licensing Act; Chapter 42a, Occupational Therapy Practice Act; Chapter 44a, Nurse Midwife Practice Act; Chapter 49, Dietitian Certification Act; Chapter 60, Mental Health Professional Practice Act; Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; Chapter 69, Dentist and Dental Hygienist Practice Act; Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act; Chapter 71, Naturopathic Physician Practice Act; Chapter 72, Acupuncture Licensing Act; Chapter 73, Chiropractic Physician Practice Act "Health care professional" means a person licensed under:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(c)(i): Chapter 5a, Podiatric Physician Licensing Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(c)(ii): Chapter 16a, Utah Optometry Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(c)(iii): Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(c)(iv): Chapter 24b, Physical Therapy Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(c)(v): Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(c)(vi): Chapter 40, Recreational Therapy Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(c)(vii): Chapter 41, Speech-Language Pathology and Audiology Licensing Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(c)(viii): Chapter 42a, Occupational Therapy Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(c)(ix): Chapter 44a, Nurse Midwife Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(c)(x): Chapter 49, Dietitian Certification Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(c)(xi): Chapter 60, Mental Health Professional Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(c)(xii): Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(c)(xiii): Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(c)(xiv): Chapter 69, Dentist and Dental Hygienist Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(c)(xv): Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(c)(xvi): Chapter 71, Naturopathic Physician Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(c)(xvii): Chapter 72, Acupuncture Licensing Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(c)(xviii): Chapter 73, Chiropractic Physician Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(d): "Remuneration or compensation":
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(d)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(d)(i)(A): means direct or indirect receipt of any payment by a health care professional or health care facility on behalf of the patient, including payment or reimbursement under Medicare or Medicaid, or under the state program for the medically indigent on behalf of the patient; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(d)(i)(B): compensation, salary, or reimbursement to the health care professional from any source for the health care professional's services or time in volunteering to provide uncompensated health care; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(d)(ii): does not mean:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(d)(ii)(A): any grant or donation to the health care facility used to offset direct costs associated with providing the uncompensated health care such as:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(d)(ii)(A)(I): medical supplies;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(d)(ii)(A)(II): drugs; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(d)(ii)(A)(III): a charitable donation that is restricted for charitable services at the health care facility; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(d)(ii)(B): incidental reimbursements to the volunteer such as:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(d)(ii)(B)(I): food supplied to the volunteer;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(d)(ii)(B)(II): clothing supplied to the volunteer to help identify the volunteer during the time of volunteer services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(d)(ii)(B)(III): mileage reimbursement to the volunteer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(2)(d)(ii)(B)(IV): other similar support to the volunteer.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(3): A health care professional who provides health care treatment at or on behalf of a health care facility is not liable in a medical malpractice action if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(3)(a): the treatment was within the scope of the health care professional's license under this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(3)(b): neither the health care professional nor the health care facility received compensation or remuneration for the treatment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(3)(c): the acts or omissions of the health care professional were not grossly negligent or willful and wanton; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(3)(d): prior to rendering services:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(3)(d)(i): the health care professional disclosed in writing to the patient, or if a minor, to the patient's parent or legal guardian, that the health care professional is providing the services without receiving remuneration or compensation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(3)(d)(ii): the patient consented in writing to waive any right to sue for professional negligence except for acts or omissions which are grossly negligent or are willful and wanton.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(4): (3)(b) A health care facility which sponsors, promotes, or organizes the uncompensated care is not liable in a medical malpractice action for acts and omissions if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(4)(a): (3)(b) the health care facility meets the requirements in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(4)(b): the acts and omissions of the health care facility were not grossly negligent or willful and wanton; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(4)(c): the health care facility has posted, in a conspicuous place, a notice that in accordance with this section the health care facility is not liable for any civil damages for acts or omissions except for those acts or omissions that are grossly negligent or are willful and wanton.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(5): A health care professional who provides health care treatment at a federally qualified health center, as defined in Subsection 1905(1)(2)(b) of the Social Security Act, or an Indian health clinic or Urban Indian Health Center, as defined in Title V of the Indian Health Care Improvement Act, is not liable in a medical malpractice action if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(5)(a): the treatment was within the scope of the health care professional's license under this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(5)(b): the health care professional:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(5)(b)(i): does not receive compensation or remuneration for treatment provided to any patient that the provider treats at the federally qualified health center, the Indian health clinic, or the Urban Indian Health Center; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(5)(b)(ii): is not eligible to be included in coverage under the Federal Tort Claims Act for the treatment provided at the federally qualified health center, the Indian health clinic, or the Urban Indian Health Center;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(5)(c): the acts or omissions of the health care professional were not grossly negligent or willful and wanton; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(5)(d): prior to rendering services:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(5)(d)(i): the health care professional disclosed in writing to the patient, or if a minor, to the patient's parent or legal guardian, that the health care professional is providing the services without receiving remuneration or compensation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(5)(d)(ii): the patient consented in writing to waive any right to sue for professional negligence except for acts or omissions that are grossly negligent or are willful and wanton.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(6): Title 26B, Chapter 2, Part 2, Health Care Facility Licensing and Inspection Immunity from liability under this section does not extend to the use of general anesthesia or care that requires an overnight stay in a general acute or specialty hospital licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(7): (5) The provisions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(8): (8)(b); (3); (5); (8)(a) A health care professional:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(8)(a): (8)(b); (3); (5) may, in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-3(8)(b): (8)(a) subject to Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-4 Liability immunity for health care providers on committees -- Evaluating and approving medical care.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-4(1): 78B-3-403 As used in this section, "health care provider" has the same meaning as in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-4(2): (2); Title 58, Occupations and Professions Health care providers serving in the following capacities and the organizations or entities sponsoring these activities are immune from liability with respect to deliberations, decisions, or determinations made or information furnished in good faith and without malice:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-4(2)(a): (2) serving on committees:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-4(2)(a)(i): established to determine if hospitals and long-term care facilities are being used properly;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-4(2)(a)(ii): established to evaluate and improve the quality of health care or determine whether provided health care was necessary, appropriate, properly performed, or provided at a reasonable cost;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-4(2)(a)(iii): functioning under Pub. L. No. 89-97 or as professional standards review organizations under Pub. L. No. 92-603;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-4(2)(a)(iv): that are ethical standards review committees; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-4(2)(a)(v): (2) that are similar to committees listed in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-4(2)(b): Title 58, Occupations and Professions members of licensing boards established under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-4(2)(c): health care providers or other persons furnishing information to those committees, as required by law, voluntarily, or upon official request.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-4(3): This section does not relieve any health care provider from liability incurred in providing professional care and treatment to any patient.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-4(4): Health care providers serving on committees or providing information described in this section are presumed to have acted in good faith and without malice, absent clear and convincing evidence to the contrary.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-5 Information relating to adequacy and quality of medical care -- Immunity from liability.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-5(1): 78B-3-403 As used in this section, "health care provider" has the same meaning as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-5(2): Title 58, Occupations and Professions; Title 58, Occupations and Professions
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-5(2)(a): The division, and the boards within the division that act regarding the health care providers defined in this section, shall adopt rules to establish procedures to obtain information concerning the quality and adequacy of health care rendered to patients by those health care providers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-5(2)(b): Title 58, Occupations and Professions; Title 58, Occupations and Professions It is the duty of an individual licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-5(3): 26B-2-201 A health care facility as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-5(3)(a): terminating employment of an employee for cause related to the employee's practice as a licensed health care provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-5(3)(b): terminating or restricting privileges for cause to engage in any act or practice related to practice as a licensed health care provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-5(3)(c): terminating, suspending, or restricting membership or privileges associated with membership in a professional association for acts of unprofessional, unlawful, incompetent, or negligent conduct related to practice as a licensed health care provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-5(3)(d): subjecting a licensed health care provider to disciplinary action for a period of more than 30 days;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-5(3)(e): a finding that a licensed health care provider has violated professional standards or ethics;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-5(3)(f): a finding of incompetence in practice as a licensed health care provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-5(3)(g): a finding of acts of moral turpitude by a licensed health care provider; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-5(3)(h): a finding that a licensed health care provider is engaged in abuse of alcohol or drugs.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-5(4): This section does not prohibit any action by a health care facility, or professional society comprised primarily of licensed health care providers to suspend, restrict, or revoke the employment, privileges, or membership of a health care provider.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-5(5): Title 63G, Chapter 2, Government Records Access and Management Act The data and information obtained in accordance with this section is classified as a "protected" record under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-5(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-5(6)(a): Any person or organization furnishing information in accordance with this section in response to the request of the division or a board, or voluntarily, is immune from liability with respect to information provided in good faith and without malice, which good faith and lack of malice is presumed to exist absent clear and convincing evidence to the contrary.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-5(6)(b): The members of the board are immune from liability for any decisions made or actions taken in response to information acquired by the board if those decisions or actions are made in good faith and without malice, which good faith and lack of malice is presumed to exist absent clear and convincing evidence to the contrary.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-5(7): An individual who is a member of a hospital administration, board, committee, department, medical staff, or professional organization of health care providers, and any hospital, other health care entity, or professional organization conducting or sponsoring the review, is immune from liability arising from participation in a review of a health care provider's professional ethics, medical competence, moral turpitude, or substance abuse.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-13-5(8): Title 58, Occupations and Professions This section does not exempt a person licensed under


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 15 - Health Facility Administrator Act
*******************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-101 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-15-101(1): "Administrator" means a person who is charged with the general administration of a health facility, regardless of whether:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-101(1)(a): the person has an ownership interest in the facility; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-101(1)(b): the person's functions and duties are shared with one or more persons.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-101(2): 58-15-201 "Board" means the Health Facility Administrators Licensing Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-101(3): "Health facility" means a skilled nursing facility, an intermediate care facility, or an intermediate care facility for individuals with an intellectual disability.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-101(4): "Intermediate care facility" means an institution that provides, on a regular basis, health care and services to individuals who do not require the degree of care and treatment a hospital or skilled nursing facility provides, but who require health care and services in addition to room and board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-101(5): 68-3-12.5 "Intermediate care facility for people with an intellectual disability" means an institution that provides, on a regular basis, health-related care and service to individuals with intellectual disabilities as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-101(6): "Skilled nursing facility" means an institution primarily providing inpatients with skilled nursing care and related services on a continuing basis for patients who require mental, medical, or nursing care, or service for the rehabilitation of an injured individual, a sick individual, or an individual with a disability.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-101(7): 58-1-501 "Unprofessional conduct" as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-101(7)(a): intentionally filing a false report or record, intentionally failing to file a report or record required by state or federal law, or willfully impeding or obstructing the filing of a required report.  These reports or records only include those which are signed in the capacity of a licensed health facility administrator; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-101(7)(b): acting in a manner inconsistent with the health and safety of the patients of the health facility in which he is the administrator.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-201 Health Facility Administrators Licensing Board.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-201(1): There is created a Health Facility Administrators Licensing Board consisting of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-201(1)(a): one administrator from a skilled nursing facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-201(1)(b): two administrators from intermediate care facilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-201(1)(c): one administrator from an intermediate care facility for people with an intellectual disability; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-201(1)(d): one member from the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-201(2): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed and serve in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-201(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-201(3)(a): 58-1-202; 58-1-203 The duties and responsibilities of the board shall be in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-201(3)(b): The board, in collaboration with the division, may establish continuing education requirements by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-201(3)(c): Board members may not receive compensation for their involvement in continuing education programs.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-301 Licensure requirements.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-301(1): An applicant for a license under this chapter shall submit to the division a written application in a form prescribed by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-301(2): After July 1, 1985, all new applicants are required to have the education or experience requirements as established by rule and as approved by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-301(3): 63J-1-504 The applicant shall pay to the department a fee in an amount determined by the department in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-301(3)(a): admission to the examination;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-301(3)(b): an initial license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-301(3)(c): a renewal license.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-301(4): (4)(a); (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-301(4)(a): The applicant shall pass a written examination in subjects determined by the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-301(4)(b): (4)(a); (3) Upon the applicant passing the examination described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-301(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-301(5)(a): A temporary license may be issued without examination to a person who meets the requirements established by statute and by rule for an administrator.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-301(5)(b): A temporary license may be issued only:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-301(5)(b)(i): to fill a position of administrator that unexpectedly becomes vacant; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-301(5)(b)(ii): for a single period of six months or less.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-302 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-302(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-302(1)(a): Each license issued under this chapter shall be issued in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-302(1)(b): (1)(a) A renewal period described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-302(2): 58-1-308 Each license automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless renewed by the licensee in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-303 Exemptions to chapter.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-303(1): 58-1-307; 26B-6-502 In addition to the exemptions described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-303(1)(a): a facility of a recognized church or denomination that cares for the sick and suffering by mental or spiritual means if no drug or material remedy is used in the care provided; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-303(1)(b): 26B-6-502 the superintendent of the Utah State Developmental Center described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-303(2): Any facility or person exempted under this section shall comply with each statute and rule on sanitation and life safety.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-401 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for refusal to issue a license to an applicant, for refusal to renew the license of a licensee, to revoke, suspend, restrict, or place on probation the license of a licensee, to issue a public or private reprimand to a licensee, and to issue cease and desist orders shall be in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-15-501 Penalty for unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------------------
A person who violates the unlawful conduct provisions defined in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 16a - Utah Optometry Practice Act
**************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-101 Short title.
---------------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Utah Optometry Practice Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(1): 58-16a-201 "Board" means the Optometrist Licensing Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(2): "Contact lens" means any lens that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(2)(a): has a spherical, cylindrical, or prismatic power or curvature;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(2)(b): is made pursuant to a current prescription; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(2)(c): is intended to be worn on the surface of the eye.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(3)(a): "Contact lens prescription" means a written or verbal order for contact lenses that includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(3)(a)(i): the commencement date of the prescription;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(3)(a)(ii): the base curve, power, diameter, material or brand name, and expiration date;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(3)(a)(iii): for a written order, the signature of the prescribing optometrist or physician; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(3)(a)(iv): for a verbal order, a record maintained by the recipient of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(3)(a)(iv)(A): the name of the prescribing optometrist or physician; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(3)(a)(iv)(B): the date when the prescription was issued or ordered.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(3)(b): A prescription may include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(3)(b)(i): a limit on the quantity of lenses that may be ordered under the prescription if required for medical reasons documented in the patient's files; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(3)(b)(ii): the expiration date of the prescription, which shall be two years from the commencement date, unless documented medical reasons require otherwise.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(3)(c): When a provider prescribes a private label contact lens for a patient the prescription shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(3)(c)(i): the name of the manufacturer;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(3)(c)(ii): the trade name of the private label brand; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(3)(c)(iii): if applicable, the trade name of the equivalent national brand.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(4): "Contact lens prescription verification" means a written request from a person who sells or provides contact lenses that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(4)(a): is sent to the prescribing optometrist or physician; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(4)(b): seeks the confirmation of the accuracy of a patient's prescription.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(5): "Eye and its adnexa" means the human eye and all structures situated within the orbit, including the conjunctiva, lids, lashes, and lacrimal system.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(6): "Fitting of a contact lens" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(6)(a): the using of a keratometer to measure the human eye;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(6)(b): utilizing refractive data provided by a licensed optometrist or ophthalmologist; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(6)(c): trial fitting of contact lenses, which includes a period of time for evaluation for fit and performance, to determine a tentative contact lens prescription for a patient if the patient:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(6)(c)(i): has not worn contact lenses before; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(6)(c)(ii): has changed to a different type or base curve.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(7): "Laser surgery" means surgery in which human tissue is cut, burned, or vaporized by means of laser or ionizing radiation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(8): "Ophthalmic lens" means any lens used to treat the eye and that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(8)(a): has a spherical, cylindrical, or prismatic power;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(8)(b): is made pursuant to an unexpired prescription; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(8)(c): is intended to be used in eyeglasses or spectacles.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(9): "Optometric assistant" means an unlicensed individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(9)(a): working under the direct and immediate supervision of a licensed optometrist; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(9)(b): engaged in specific tasks assigned by the licensed optometrist in accordance with the standards and ethics of the profession.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(10): "Optometrist" or "optometric physician" means an individual licensed under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(11): "Optometry" and "practice of optometry" mean any one or any combination of the following practices:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(11)(a): examination of the human eye and its adnexa to detect and diagnose defects or abnormal conditions;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(11)(b): determination or modification of the accommodative or refractive state of the human eye or its range or power of vision by administration and prescription of pharmaceutical agents or the use of diagnostic instruments;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(11)(c): prescription, ordering, administration, or adaptation of ophthalmic lenses, contact lenses, ophthalmic devices, pharmaceutical agents, laboratory tests, or ocular exercises to diagnose and treat diseases, defects, or other abnormal conditions of the human eye and its adnexa;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(11)(d): display of any advertisement, circular, sign, or device offering to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(11)(d)(i): examine the eyes;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(11)(d)(ii): fit glasses or contact lenses; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(11)(d)(iii): adjust frames;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(11)(e): removal of a foreign body from the eye or its adnexa, that is not deeper than the anterior 1/2 of the cornea; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(11)(f): consultation regarding the eye and its adnexa with other appropriate health care providers, including referral to other appropriate health care providers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(12): "Pharmaceutical agent" means any diagnostic or therapeutic drug or combination of drugs that has the property of assisting in the diagnosis, prevention, treatment, or mitigation of abnormal conditions or symptoms of the eye and its adnexa.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(13): 58-67-102; 58-68-102 "Physician" has the same meaning as defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(14): 58-17b-102 "Prescription drug" has the same definition as in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(15): (3) "Unexpired" means a prescription that was issued:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(15)(a): for ophthalmic lenses which does not expire unless the optometrist or physician includes an expiration date on the prescription based on medical reasons that are documented in the patient's file; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-102(15)(b): (3) in accordance with Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-201 Creation of board -- Board duties and functions.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-201(1): There is created an Optometrist Licensing Board consisting of five optometrists and two members from the general public who do not provide eye care services.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-201(2): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed and serve in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-201(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203; (3) The board's duties and responsibilities shall be in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-201(4): The board shall designate one of its members on a permanent or rotating basis to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-201(4)(a): assist the division in reviewing complaints concerning the unlawful or unprofessional conduct of a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-201(4)(b): advise the division in its investigation of these complaints.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-201(5): (4) A board member who has, under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-201(5)(a): on his own motion, due to actual or perceived bias or lack of objectivity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-201(5)(b): upon challenge for cause raised on the record by any party to the adjudicative proceeding.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-301 Licensure required -- License classifications.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-301(1): 58-1-307; 58-16a-305 A license is required to engage in the practice of optometry, except as specifically provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-301(2): The division shall issue to a person who qualifies under this chapter a license in the classification of optometrist.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-302 Qualifications for licensure.
--------------------------------------------------------------
An applicant for licensure as an optometrist shall:Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-302(1): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-302(2): 63J-1-504 pay a fee as determined by the division under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-302(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-302(3)(a): be a doctoral graduate of a recognized school of optometry accredited by the American Optometric Association's Accreditation Council on Optometric Education; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-302(3)(b): (3)(a) be a graduate of a school of optometry located outside the United States that meets the criteria that would qualify the school for accreditation under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-302(4): if the applicant graduated from a recognized school of optometry prior to July 1, 1996, have successfully completed a course of study satisfactory to the division, in consultation with the board, in general and ocular pharmacology and emergency medical care;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-302(5): have passed examinations approved by the division in consultation with the board that include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-302(5)(a): a standardized national optometry examination;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-302(5)(b): a standardized clinical examination; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-302(5)(c): a standardized national therapeutics examination; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-302(6): meet with the board and representatives of the division, if requested by either party, for the purpose of evaluating the applicant's qualifications for licensure.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-303 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-303(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-303(1)(a): Each license issued under this part shall be issued in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-303(1)(b): A renewal period may be extended or shortened by as much as one year to maintain established renewal cycles or to change an established renewal cycle.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-303(2): 58-16a-304 At the time of renewal the licensee shall show satisfactory evidence of completion of continuing education as required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-303(3): 58-1-308 Each license automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless renewed by the licensee in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-304 Continuing education.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-304(1): As a condition precedent for license renewal, each licensee shall, during each two-year licensure cycle or other cycle defined by rule, complete 30 hours of qualified continuing professional education in accordance with standards defined by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-304(2): 58-16a-303 If a renewal period is extended or shortened under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305 License -- Exemptions.
-------------------------------------------------------
In addition to the exemptions from licensure in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(1): 58-16a-801 a person who sells contact lenses on prescription provided by a person authorized under state law to practice either optometry or medicine and surgery if the person complies with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(2): 58-16a-801(2); 13-26-2 a person who sells eyeglasses or spectacles as articles of merchandise or who fabricates them from a prescription if the person complies with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(2)(a): does so in the ordinary course of trade from a permanently located and established place of business;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(2)(b): does not traffic or attempt to traffic upon assumed skill in testing the eye and adapting lenses according to the test;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(2)(c): does not duplicate, replace, or accept for replacement any ophthalmic lens, except in the case of an emergency;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(2)(d): does not use in the testing of the eyes any lenses or instruments other than the lenses actually sold; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(2)(e): 13-26-2 does not give or offer eyeglasses or spectacles as premiums as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(3): (3); 58-16a-306; (3)(i); (3)(i); 58-16a-306 a person who fits contact lenses under the following conditions:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(3)(a): he has a current certification from both the American Board of Opticianry and the National Contact Lens Examiners;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(3)(b): he does not give or offer contact lenses as premiums;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(3)(c): he does not perform a refraction, over-refraction, or attempt to traffic upon assumed skill in testing the eye;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(3)(d): he operates in the ordinary course of trade from a permanently located and established place of business;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(3)(e): (3) he performs the work involved in fitting contact lenses himself and does not delegate the contact lens fitting to any other individual who is not qualified under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(3)(f): he does not use in the testing of the eye any lenses or instruments other than the lenses he actually will sell;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(3)(g): 58-16a-306 he provides services only to a patient who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(3)(g)(i): presents an unexpired contact lens prescription; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(3)(g)(ii): 58-16a-306 has had an eye examination within the prior six months by an optometrist or ophthalmologist meeting the requirements under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(3)(h): he maintains a copy of the patient's contact lens prescription for not less than seven years;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(3)(i): he enters into a written agreement with an optometrist or an ophthalmologist before July 1, 2000, to fit contact lenses prescribed by that optometrist or ophthalmologist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(3)(j): (3)(i) he fits contact lenses for at least two years under the direct supervision of the optometrist or ophthalmologist identified in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(3)(k): (3)(i); 58-16a-306 the optometrist or ophthalmologist described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(3)(k)(i): ensures that the final contact lens is accurate;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(3)(k)(ii): presents a written copy of the prescription to the person fitting the contact lens; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-305(3)(k)(iii): 58-16a-306 ensures that a copy of the prescription is provided to the patient, except as provided in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-306 Contact lens prescription -- Qualifications.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-306(1): An optometrist or physician issuing a contact lens prescription shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-306(1)(a): be licensed under this title to practice in Utah;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-306(1)(b): ensure the final contact lens prescription is accurate;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-306(1)(c): present a written copy of the prescription to the patient after fitting; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-306(1)(d): provide a copy of the patient's contact lens prescription to a person who sells contact lenses upon the request of the patient or the person selling the contact lenses.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-306(2): (1) An optometrist or physician may not be held liable as a result of providing a prescription to a patient as required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-306(3): Application of the provisions of this section shall be consistent with 45 C.F.R. Parts 160 and 164, Standards for Privacy of Individually Identifiable Health Information.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-307 Licenses held on effective date.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
An individual holding a current license as an optometrist that was issued under any prior state law is considered to hold a current license in the same scope of practice under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-401 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for refusal to issue a license to an applicant, for refusal to renew the license of a licensee, to revoke, suspend, restrict, or place on probation the license of a licensee, to issue a public or private reprimand to a licensee, and to issue cease and desist orders shall be in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-501 Unlawful conduct.
--------------------------------------------------
"Unlawful conduct" includes, in addition to the definition in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-16a-501(1): buying, selling, or fraudulently obtaining, any optometry diploma, license, certificate, or registration;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-501(2): 58-16a-801 selling or providing contact lenses or ophthalmic lenses in a manner inconsistent with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-501(3): representing oneself as or using the title of "optometrist," "optometric physician," "doctor of optometry," or "O.D.," unless currently licensed under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-502 Unprofessional conduct.
--------------------------------------------------------
"Unprofessional conduct" includes, in addition to the definition in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-16a-502(1): using or employing the services of an optometric assistant to assist a licensee in any manner not in accordance with:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-502(1)(a): the generally recognized practices and standards of ethics of the profession; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-502(1)(b): applicable state law or division rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-502(2): failure to refer a patient to an appropriate licensed practitioner when:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-502(2)(a): the patient's condition does not respond to treatment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-502(2)(b): the treatment is not within the scope of competence or licensure of the licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-502(3): providing confidential information regarding a patient to any third party who does not have a legal and professional ground for obtaining the information;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-502(4): 58-17b-309 knowingly prescribing, selling, giving away, or administering any prescription drug unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-502(4)(a): for a legitimate medical purpose;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-502(4)(b): upon a proper diagnosis indicating the use of the drug in the amount prescribed or provided; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-502(4)(c): 58-17b-309 in compliance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-502(5): giving or receiving directly or indirectly any fee, commission, rebate, or other compensation for professional services not actually and personally rendered, except as part of a legal relationship within a lawful professional partnership, corporation, or association;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-502(6): failure to transfer pertinent and necessary information from a patient's medical records to another optometrist or physician when so requested by the patient or his representative, as designated in writing;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-16a-502(7): 58-16a-306 failure to provide a contact lens prescription to a person who sells contact lenses in accordance with Section
