Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-621 Automated pharmacy systems.
------------------------------------------------------------
Automated pharmacy systems can be utilized in licensed pharmacies, remote locations under the jurisdiction of the Utah State Board of Pharmacy, and licensed health care facilities where legally permissible, as approved by the division in collaboration with the board, and described in rule.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622 Pharmacy benefit management services -- Auditing of pharmacy records -- Appeals.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(1): 31A-1-301; (1)(c)(i); (iv); 31A-1-301; Title 49, Chapter 20, Public Employees' Benefit and Insurance Program Act For purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(1)(a): "Audit" means a review of the records of a pharmacy by or on behalf of an entity that finances or reimburses the cost of health care services or pharmaceutical products.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(1)(b): "Audit completion date" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(1)(b)(i): for an audit that does not require an on-site visit at the pharmacy, the date on which the pharmacy, in response to the initial audit request, submits records or other documents to the entity conducting the audit, as determined by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(1)(b)(i)(A): postmark or other evidence of the date of mailing; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(1)(b)(i)(B): the date of transmission if the records or other documents are transmitted electronically; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(1)(b)(ii): for an audit that requires an on-site visit at a pharmacy, the date on which the auditing entity completes the on-site visit, including any follow-up visits or analysis which shall be completed within 60 days after the day on which the on-site visit begins.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(1)(c): 31A-1-301; (1)(c)(i); (iv) "Entity" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(1)(c)(i): a pharmacy benefits manager or coordinator;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(1)(c)(ii): a health benefit plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(1)(c)(iii): 31A-1-301 a third party administrator as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(1)(c)(iv): a state agency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(1)(c)(v): (1)(c)(i); (iv) a company, group, or agent that represents, or is engaged by, one of the entities described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(1)(d): "Fraud" means an intentional act of deception, misrepresentation, or concealment in order to gain something of value.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(1)(e): 31A-1-301; Title 49, Chapter 20, Public Employees' Benefit and Insurance Program Act "Health benefit plan" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(1)(e)(i): 31A-1-301 a health benefit plan as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(1)(e)(ii): Title 49, Chapter 20, Public Employees' Benefit and Insurance Program Act a health, dental, medical, Medicare supplement, or conversion program offered under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(2): (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(2)(a): (2)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(2)(a)(i): a contract for the audit of a pharmacy entered into, amended, or renewed on or after July 1, 2012; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(2)(a)(ii): an entity that conducts an audit of the pharmacy records of a pharmacy licensed under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(2)(b): This section does not apply to an audit of pharmacy records:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(2)(b)(i): for a federally funded prescription drug program, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(2)(b)(i)(A): the state Medicaid program;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(2)(b)(i)(B): the Medicare Part D program;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(2)(b)(i)(C): a Department of Defense prescription drug program; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(2)(b)(i)(D): a Veterans Affairs prescription drug program; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(2)(b)(ii): when fraud or other intentional and willful misrepresentation is alleged and the pharmacy audit entity has evidence that the pharmacy's actions reasonably indicate fraud or intentional and willful misrepresentation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(3)(a): An audit that involves clinical or professional judgment shall be conducted by or in consultation with a pharmacist who is employed by or working with the auditing entity and who is licensed in the state or another state.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(3)(b): If an audit is conducted on site at a pharmacy, the entity conducting the audit:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(3)(b)(i): shall give the pharmacy 10 days advanced written notice of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(3)(b)(i)(A): the audit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(3)(b)(i)(B): the range of prescription numbers or a date range included in the audit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(3)(b)(ii): may not audit a pharmacy during the first five business days of the month, unless the pharmacy agrees to the timing of the audit.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(3)(c): An entity may not audit claims:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(3)(c)(i): submitted more than 18 months prior to the audit, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(3)(c)(i)(A): required by federal law; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(3)(c)(i)(B): the originating prescription is dated in the preceding six months; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(3)(c)(ii): that exceed 200 selected prescription claims.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(4): 58-17b-608.1
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(4)(a): 58-17b-608.1 An entity may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(4)(a)(i): include dispensing fees in the calculations of overpayments unless the prescription is considered a misfill;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(4)(a)(ii): recoup funds for prescription clerical or recordkeeping errors, including typographical errors, scrivener's errors, and computer errors on a required document or record unless the audit entity is alleging fraud or other intentional or willful misrepresentation and the audit entity has evidence that the pharmacy's actions reasonably indicate fraud or intentional and willful misrepresentation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(4)(a)(iii): 58-17b-608.1 recoup funds for refills dispensed in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(4)(a)(iv): collect any funds, charge-backs, or penalties until the audit and all appeals are final, unless the audit entity is alleging fraud or other intentional or willful misrepresentation and the audit entity has evidence that the pharmacy's actions reasonably indicate fraud or intentional and willful misrepresentation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(4)(a)(v): recoup funds or collect any funds, charge-backs, or penalties from a pharmacy in response to a request for audit unless the pharmacy confirms to the entity the date on which the pharmacy received the request for audit.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(4)(b): Auditors shall only have access to previous audit reports on a particular pharmacy if the previous audit was conducted by the same entity except as required for compliance with state or federal law.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(5): 26B-2-201 A pharmacy subject to an audit:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(5)(a): 26B-2-201 may use one or more of the following to validate a claim for a prescription, refill, or change in a prescription:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(5)(a)(i): electronic or physical copies of records of a health care facility, or a health care provider with prescribing authority;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(5)(a)(ii): any prescription that complies with state law;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(5)(a)(iii): the pharmacy's own physical or electronic records; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(5)(a)(iv): 26B-2-201 the physical or electronic records, or valid copies of the physical or electronic records, of a practitioner or health care facility as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(5)(b): may not be required to provide the following records to validate a claim for a prescription, refill, or change in a prescription:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(5)(b)(i): if the prescription was handwritten, the physical handwritten version of the prescription; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(5)(b)(ii): a note from the practitioner regarding the patient or the prescription that is not otherwise required for a prescription under state or federal law.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(6): (6)(a)(i)(A); (6)(a)(i)(A); (B); (6)(b); (6)(a)(i)(B); (6)(c)(ii); (6)(c)(i); (6)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(6)(a): (6)(a)(i)(A); (6)(a)(i)(A); (B); (6)(b)

Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(6)(a)(i)(B): (6)(a)(i)(A) a maximum time for the entity to provide the pharmacy with a preliminary audit report following submission of records under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(6)(c)(iv): If a dispute exists between the records of the auditing entity and the pharmacy, the records maintained by the pharmacy shall be presumed valid for the purpose of the audit.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(7): If an audit results in the dispute or denial of a claim, the entity conducting the audit shall allow:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(7)(a): the pharmacy to resubmit a claim using any commercially reasonable method, including fax, mail, or electronic claims submission provided that the period of time when a claim may be resubmitted has not expired under the rules of the plan sponsor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(7)(b): the health benefit plan or other entity that finances or reimburses the cost of health care services or pharmaceutical products to rerun the claim if the health benefit plan or other entity chooses to rerun the claim at no cost to the pharmacy.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(9)(a): An entity that audits a pharmacy shall establish a written appeals process for appealing a preliminary audit report and a final audit report, and shall provide the pharmacy with notice of the written appeals process.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-622(9)(b): (9) If the pharmacy benefit manager's contract or provider manual contains the information required by this Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-623 Disposal of unused prescription drugs.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-623(1): A pharmacy may accept unused prescription drugs for disposal in accordance with administrative rules adopted by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-623(2): The division shall adopt administrative rules regarding a pharmacy accepting unused prescription drugs for disposal as permitted by federal law and regulation relating to the disposal of unused prescription drugs.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-624 Prescription drugs -- Sale to a practitioner for office use.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-624(1): Title 58, Chapter 17b, Part 8, Dispensing Medical Practitioner and Dispensing Medical Practitioner Clinic Pharmacy A pharmacy licensed under this chapter may, subject to rules established by the division, repackage or compound a prescription drug for sale to a practitioner if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-624(1)(a): the prescription drug:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-624(1)(a)(i): does not include a compounded drug; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-624(1)(a)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-624(1)(a)(ii)(A): includes a compounded drug; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-624(1)(a)(ii)(B): is not a controlled substance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-624(1)(b): the pharmacy labels the prescription drug "for office use only";
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-624(1)(c): the practitioner administers the drug to a patient in the practitioner's office or facility; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-624(1)(d): Title 58, Chapter 17b, Part 8, Dispensing Medical Practitioner and Dispensing Medical Practitioner Clinic Pharmacy except in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-624(2): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The division shall establish, in accordance with

Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627 Prescription of drugs or devices by a pharmacist.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(1): (3)(a); 58-37-4 Beginning January 1, 2022, a pharmacist may prescribe a prescription drug or device if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(1)(a): prescribing the prescription drug or device is within the scope of the pharmacist's training and experience;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(1)(b): (3)(a) the prescription drug or device is designated by the division by rule under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(1)(c): 58-37-4 the prescription drug or device is not a controlled substance that is included in Schedules I, II, III, or IV of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(1)(c)(i): 58-37-4 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(1)(c)(ii): the federal Controlled Substances Act, Title II, P.L. 91-513.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(2): Nothing in this section requires a pharmacist to issue a prescription for a prescription drug or device.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(3): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The division shall make rules in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(3)(a): designate the prescription drugs or devices that may be prescribed by a pharmacist under this section, beginning with prescription drugs or devices that address a public health concern that is designated by the Department of Health and Human Services, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(3)(a)(i): post-exposure HIV prophylaxis;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(3)(a)(ii): pre-exposure HIV prophylaxis;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(3)(a)(iii): self-administered hormonal contraceptives;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(3)(a)(iv): smoking cessation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(3)(a)(v): naloxone;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(3)(b): create guidelines that a pharmacist must follow when prescribing a prescription drug or device, including guidelines:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(3)(b)(i): for notifying the patient's primary care or other health care provider about the prescription; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(3)(b)(ii): to prevent the over-prescription of drugs or devices including but not limited to antibiotics;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(3)(c): address when a pharmacist should refer the patient to an appropriate health care provider or otherwise encourage the patient to seek further medical care; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(3)(d): implement the provisions of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(4): (3); 26B-1-203(4); 26B-1-203 The division shall make rules under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(4)(a): individuals representing pharmacies and pharmacists;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(4)(b): individuals representing physicians and advanced practice clinicians; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(4)(c): 26B-1-203(4); 26B-1-203
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(4)(c)(i): if the executive director of the Department of Health and Human Services is a physician, the executive director of the Department of Health and Human Services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(4)(c)(ii): 26B-1-203(4) if the executive director of the Department of Health and Human Services is not a physician, a deputy director who is a physician in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-627(4)(c)(iii): 26B-1-203 a designee of the individual described in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701 Mentally incompetent or incapacitated pharmacist -- Division action and procedures.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(1): 75-1-201; 26B-5-301 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(1)(a): 75-1-201 "Incapacitated person" is a person who is incapacitated, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(1)(b): 26B-5-301 "Mental illness" is as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(2): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act If a court of competent jurisdiction determines a pharmacist is an incapacitated person, or that the pharmacist has a mental illness and is unable to safely engage in the practice of pharmacy, the director shall immediately suspend the license of the pharmacist upon the entry of the judgment of the court, without further proceedings under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(3): 58-1-109; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(3)(a): If the division and a majority of the board find reasonable cause to believe a pharmacist, who is not determined judicially to be an incapacitated person or to have a mental illness, is incapable of practicing pharmacy with reasonable skill regarding the safety of patients, because of illness, excessive use of drugs or alcohol, or as a result of any mental or physical condition, the board shall recommend that the director file a petition with the division, and cause the petition to be served upon the pharmacist with a notice of hearing on the sole issue of the capacity of the pharmacist to competently and safely engage in the practice of pharmacy.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(3)(b): 58-1-109; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; (4) The hearing shall be conducted under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(4): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(4)(a): Every pharmacist who accepts the privilege of being licensed under this chapter gives consent to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(4)(a)(i): submitting at the pharmacist's own expense to an immediate mental or physical examination when directed in writing by the division, with the consent of a majority of the board, to do so; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(4)(a)(ii): the admissibility of the reports of the examining practitioner's testimony or examination in any proceeding regarding the license of the pharmacist, and waives all objections on the ground the reports constitute a privileged communication.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(4)(b): The examination may be ordered by the division, with the consent of a majority of the board, only upon a finding of reasonable cause to believe:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(4)(b)(i): the pharmacist has a mental illness, is incapacitated or otherwise unable to practice pharmacy with reasonable skill and safety; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(4)(b)(ii): immediate action by the division and the board is necessary to prevent harm to the pharmacist's patients or the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(4)(c): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(4)(c)(i): Failure of a pharmacist to submit to the examination ordered under this section is a ground for the division's immediate suspension of the pharmacist's license by written order of the director.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(4)(c)(ii): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act The division may enter the order of suspension without further compliance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(5): (2); (4); (5); 58-1-108; 58-1-109
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(5)(a): (2); (4) A pharmacist whose license is suspended under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(5)(b): (5); 58-1-108; 58-1-109 The hearing held under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(6): A pharmacist whose license is revoked, suspended, or in any way restricted under this section may request the division and the board to consider, at reasonable intervals, evidence presented by the pharmacist, under procedures established by division rule, regarding any change in the pharmacist's condition, to determine whether:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(6)(a): the pharmacist is or is not able to safely and competently engage in the practice of pharmacy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-701(6)(b): the pharmacist is qualified to have the pharmacist's licensure to practice under this chapter restored completely or in part.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-801 Title.
---------------------------------------
This part is known as "Dispensing Medical Practitioner and Dispensing Medical Practitioner Clinic Pharmacy."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(1)(a): "Cosmetic drug" means a prescription drug that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(1)(a)(i): is for the purpose of promoting attractiveness or altering the appearance of an individual; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(1)(a)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(1)(a)(ii)(A): is listed as a cosmetic drug subject to the exemption under this section by the division by administrative rule; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(1)(a)(ii)(B): has been expressly approved for online dispensing, whether or not it is dispensed online or through a physician's office.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(1)(b): "Cosmetic drug" does not include a prescription drug that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(1)(b)(i): a controlled substance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(1)(b)(ii): compounded by the physician; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(1)(b)(iii): prescribed for or used by the patient for the purpose of diagnosing, curing, or preventing a disease.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(2): 58-67-102; 49-20-413 "Employer sponsored clinic" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(2)(a): 58-67-102 an entity that has a medical director who is licensed as a physician as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(2)(b): 49-20-413 a clinic designated as a clinic for state employees and their dependents by the Public Employees' Benefit and Insurance Program under the pilot program created by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(3): 31A-1-301 "Health care" is as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(4)(a): "Injectable weight loss drug" means an injectable prescription drug:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(4)(a)(i): prescribed to promote weight loss; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(4)(a)(ii): listed as an injectable prescription drug subject to exemption under this section by the division by administrative rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(4)(b): "Injectable weight loss drug" does not include a prescription drug that is a controlled substance.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(5): "Prepackaged drug" means a prescription drug that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(5)(a): is not listed under federal or state law as a Schedule I, II, III, IV, or V drug; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(5)(b): is packaged in a fixed quantity per package by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(5)(b)(i): the drug manufacturer;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(5)(b)(ii): a pharmaceutical wholesaler or distributor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-802(5)(b)(iii): a pharmacy licensed under this title.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803 Qualifications for licensure as a dispensing medical practitioner -- Scope of practice.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(1): 58-17b-102(23)(a) An applicant for a license as a dispensing medical practitioner shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(1)(a): 58-17b-102(23)(a) be licensed in good standing under at least one of the chapters listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(1)(b): submit an application for a license as a dispensing medical practitioner in a form prescribed by the division and pay a fee established by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(2): (1); 58-17b-303; 58-17b-307 The division shall accept the licensing in good standing under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(3): 58-17b-802; 58-17b-805 A dispensing medical practitioner may dispense, in accordance with this part:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(3)(a): 58-17b-802 a cosmetic drug and an injectable weight loss drug if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(3)(a)(i): the drug was prescribed by the dispensing medical practitioner to the dispensing medical practitioner's patient; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(3)(a)(ii): 58-17b-802 the dispensing medical practitioner complies with administrative rules adopted by the division under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(3)(b): 58-17b-805 a cancer drug treatment regimen if the dispensing medical practitioner complies with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(3)(c): a pre-packaged drug to an employee or a dependent of an employee at an employer sponsored clinic if the dispensing medical practitioner:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(3)(c)(i): treats an employee, or the dependent of an employee, of one of an exclusive group of employers at an employer sponsored clinic;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(3)(c)(ii): prescribes a prepackaged drug to the employee or the employee's dependent;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(3)(c)(iii): dispenses the prepackaged drug at the employer sponsored clinic; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(3)(c)(iv): complies with administrative rules adopted by the division in consultation with the Board of Pharmacy that establish labeling, record keeping, patient counseling, purchasing and distribution, operating, treatment, quality of care, and storage requirements.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(4): 58-37f-203 A dispensing medical practitioner:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(4)(a): shall inform the patient:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(4)(a)(i): that the drug dispensed by the practitioner may be obtained from a pharmacy unaffiliated with the practitioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(4)(a)(ii): of the directions for appropriate use of the dispensed drug;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(4)(a)(iii): of potential side effects to the use of the dispensed drug; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(4)(a)(iv): how to contact the dispensing medical practitioner if the patient has questions or concerns regarding the drug;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(4)(b): 58-37f-203 shall report to the controlled substance database in the same manner as required in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(4)(c): may delegate the dispensing of the drug if the individual to whom the dispensing was delegated is:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(4)(c)(i): employed by the dispensing medical practitioner or the outpatient clinic setting in which the dispensing medical practitioner works; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(4)(c)(ii): acting under the direction of a dispensing medical practitioner who is immediately available on site for any necessary consultation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-803(5): 58-17b-102(23); Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act If the chapter that governs the license of a dispensing medical practitioner, as listed in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-804 Qualifications for licensure as a dispensing medical practitioner clinic pharmacy.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-804(2): 58-17b-302; 58-17b-102(23)(a); 58-17b-306(1)(e); 58-17b-102(23)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-804(2)(a): 58-17b-302; 58-17b-102(23)(a) Notwithstanding Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-804(2)(a)(i): the pharmacy has designated a dispensing medical practitioner as responsible for all activities of the pharmacy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-804(2)(a)(ii): 58-17b-102(23)(a) the pharmacy complies with administrative rules adopted by the division in consultation with the Board of Pharmacy and the governing bodies of the practitioners described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-805 Dispensing medical practitioner -- Cancer drug treatment regimen.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-805(1): For purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-805(1)(a): "Cancer drug treatment regimen" means a prescription drug used to treat cancer, manage its symptoms, or provide continuity of care for a cancer patient.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-805(1)(b): "Cancer drug treatment regimen" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-805(1)(b)(i): a chemotherapy drug administered intravenously, orally, rectally, or by dermal methods; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-805(1)(b)(ii): a drug used to support cancer treatment, including a drug used to treat, alleviate, or minimize physical and psychological symptoms or pain, to improve patient tolerance of cancer treatments, or to prepare a patient for a subsequent course of therapy.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-805(1)(c): "Cancer drug treatment regimen" does not mean a drug listed under federal law as a Schedule I, II, or III drug.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-805(2): 58-17b-102(23)(a)(i); (ii) An individual may be licensed as a dispensing medical practitioner with a scope of practice that permits the dispensing medical practitioner to prescribe and dispense a cancer drug treatment regimen if the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-805(2)(a): 58-17b-102(23)(a)(i); (ii) is licensed as described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-805(2)(b): is certified or eligible to be certified by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-805(2)(b)(i): the American Board of Internal Medicine in medical oncology; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-805(2)(b)(ii): the American Board of Urology.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-805(3): A dispensing medical practitioner authorized to prescribe and dispense a cancer drug treatment regimen under this section may prescribe and dispense a cancer drug treatment regimen:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-805(3)(a): to the practitioner's patient who is currently undergoing chemotherapy in an outpatient clinic setting; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-805(3)(b): if the practitioner determines that providing the cancer drug treatment regimen to the patient in the outpatient clinic setting is in the best interest of the patient or provides better access to care for the patient.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-806 Enforcement of dispensing medical practitioner and dispensing medical practitioner clinic pharmacy compliance with Pharmacy Practice Act.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-806(1): 58-17b-102(23)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-806(1)(a): 58-17b-102(23)(a) The division shall consult with the dispensing medical practitioner's appropriate licensing board as designated in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-806(1)(b): the Pharmacy Board shall, if requested by the licensing board of the dispensing medical practitioner, assist the licensing board for the dispensing medical practitioner with reviewing the violations of the provisions of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-806(2): 58-17b-102(23)(a) The division may take appropriate action against a dispensing medical practitioner, in accordance with this chapter, if the licensing board designated in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-806(3): 58-17b-804 The division, in consultation with the board is the primary enforcer under this chapter for a dispensing medical practitioner clinic pharmacy licensed under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-901 Title.
---------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Charitable Prescription Drug Recycling Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(1): 26B-2-201 "Assisted living facility" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(2): "Cancer drug" means a drug that controls or kills neoplastic cells and includes a drug used in chemotherapy to destroy cancer cells.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(3): "Charitable clinic" means a charitable nonprofit corporation that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(3)(a): holds a valid exemption from federal income taxation issued under Section 501(a), Internal Revenue Code;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(3)(b): is exempt from federal income taxation under Section 501(c)(3), Internal Revenue Code;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(3)(c): provides, on an outpatient basis, for a period of less than 24 consecutive hours, to an individual not residing or confined at a facility owned or operated by the charitable nonprofit corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(3)(c)(i): advice;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(3)(c)(ii): counseling;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(3)(c)(iii): diagnosis;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(3)(c)(iv): treatment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(3)(c)(v): surgery; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(3)(c)(vi): care or services relating to the preservation or maintenance of health; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(3)(d): has a licensed outpatient pharmacy.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(4): "Charitable pharmacy" means an eligible pharmacy that is operated by a charitable clinic.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(5): 26A-1-102 "County health department" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(6): "Donated prescription drug" means a prescription drug that an eligible donor or individual donates to an eligible pharmacy under the program.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(7): "Eligible donor" means a donor that donates a prescription drug from within the state and is:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(7)(a): a nursing care facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(7)(b): an assisted living facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(7)(c): a licensed intermediate care facility for people with an intellectual disability;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(7)(d): a manufacturer;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(7)(e): a pharmaceutical wholesale distributor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(7)(f): an eligible pharmacy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(7)(g): a physician's office.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(8): 26B-1-201 "Eligible pharmacy" means a pharmacy that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(8)(a): is registered by the division as eligible to participate in the program; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(8)(b): 26B-1-201
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(8)(b)(i): is licensed in the state as a Class A retail pharmacy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(8)(b)(ii): 26B-1-201 is operated by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(8)(b)(ii)(A): a county;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(8)(b)(ii)(B): a county health department;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(8)(b)(ii)(C): a pharmacy under contract with a county health department;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(8)(b)(ii)(D): 26B-1-201 the Department of Health and Human Services created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(8)(b)(ii)(E): a charitable clinic.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(9): 58-17b-904; (9)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(9)(a): 58-17b-904; (9)(b) "Eligible prescription drug" means a prescription drug, described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(9)(a)(i): (9)(b) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(9)(a)(ii): a drug that can only be dispensed to a patient registered with the drug's manufacturer in accordance with federal Food and Drug Administration requirements.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(9)(b): "Eligible prescription drug" includes a medication-assisted treatment drug that may be accepted, transferred, and dispensed under the program in accordance with federal law.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(10): 58-17b-503 "Licensed intermediate care facility for people with an intellectual disability" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(11): "Medically indigent individual" means an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(11)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(11)(a)(i): does not have health insurance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(11)(a)(ii): lacks reasonable means to purchase prescribed medications; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(11)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(11)(b)(i): has health insurance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(11)(b)(ii): lacks reasonable means to pay the insured's portion of the cost of the prescribed medications.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(12): "Medication-assisted treatment drug" means buprenorphine prescribed to treat substance use withdrawal symptoms or an opiate use disorder.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(13): 26B-2-201 "Nursing care facility" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(14): "Physician's office" means a fixed medical facility that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(14)(a): is staffed by a physician, physician's assistant, nurse practitioner, or registered nurse, licensed under this title; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(14)(b): treats an individual who presents at, or is transported to, the facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(15): 58-17b-903 "Program" means the Charitable Prescription Drug Recycling Program created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(16): 58-17b-503 "Unit pack" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(17): 58-1-501; 58-17b-501 "Unlawful conduct" means the same as that term is defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-902(18): 58-1-501; 58-17b-502 "Unprofessional conduct" means the same as that term is defined in Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-903 Charitable Prescription Drug Recycling Program -- Creation -- Requirements.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-903(1): There is created the Charitable Prescription Drug Recycling Program.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-903(2): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The division, in consultation with the board, shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-903(2)(a): implement the program, on a statewide basis, to permit:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-903(2)(a)(i): an individual or an eligible donor to transfer an eligible prescription drug to an eligible pharmacy for dispensing to a medically indigent individual; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-903(2)(a)(ii): an individual to transfer an eligible prescription drug to a physician's office:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-903(2)(a)(ii)(A): that is an eligible donor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-903(2)(a)(ii)(B): for transfer to an eligible pharmacy for dispensing to a medically indigent individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-903(2)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-903(2)(c): provide technical assistance to entities that desire to participate in the program.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-904 Criteria for eligible prescription drugs.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
An eligible pharmacy may not accept or dispense an unused prescription drug under the program unless the unused prescription drug:Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-904(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-904(1)(a): is in a unit pack or the manufacturer's sealed container; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-904(1)(b): is an injectable medication;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-904(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-904(2)(a): is unopened; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-904(2)(b): is a cancer drug packaged in an unopened single-unit dose that has been removed from a multi-dose package;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-904(3): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (3)(a); (3)(b) is accepted and dispensed by the eligible pharmacy before:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-904(3)(a): a beyond use date that appears on the label;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-904(3)(b): the expiration date recommended by the manufacturer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-904(3)(c): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (3)(a); (3)(b) a date, established by division rule for a specific prescription drug, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-904(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-904(4)(a): is not adulterated or mislabeled; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-904(4)(b): the pharmacist or licensed pharmacist technician accepting or dispensing the prescription drug does not have reason to believe that the prescription drug is adulterated or mislabeled.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-905 Participation in program -- Requirements -- Fees.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-905(1): An eligible donor, an individual, or an eligible pharmacy may participate in the program.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-905(2): 63J-1-504 An eligible pharmacy:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-905(2)(a): shall comply with all applicable federal and state laws related to the storage, disposal, and distribution of a prescription drug;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-905(2)(b): shall comply with all applicable federal and state laws related to the acceptance and transfer of a prescription drug, including 21 U.S.C. Chapter 9, Subchapter V, Part H, Pharmaceutical Distribution Supply Chain;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-905(2)(c): shall, before accepting or dispensing a prescription drug under the program, inspect each prescription drug to determine whether the prescription drug is an eligible prescription drug;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-905(2)(d): may dispense an eligible prescription drug to a medically indigent individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-905(2)(d)(i): is located in the state when the drug is dispensed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-905(2)(d)(ii): has a prescription issued by a practitioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-905(2)(e): 63J-1-504 may charge a handling fee, adopted by the division under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-905(2)(f): may not accept, transfer, or dispense a prescription drug in violation of the federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, 21 U.S.C. Sec. 301 et seq.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-906 Liability of participating organizations and manufacturers.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
In the absence of bad faith or gross negligence, a person is not criminally or civilly liable for injury, death, or loss of property based solely on the fact that the person manufactured, provided, donated, accepted, or dispensed an eligible prescription drug under this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907 Rules made by the division.
------------------------------------------------------------
The rules made by the division under SubsectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(1): registration requirements to establish the eligibility of a pharmacy to participate in the program;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(2): a formulary that includes all eligible prescription drugs approved by the federal Food and Drug Administration;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3): 58-17b-903(2); 58-17b-903(2)(a) standards and procedures for:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(a): verifying whether a pharmacy or pharmacist participating in the program is licensed and in good standing with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(b): 58-17b-903(2) handling of an eligible prescription drug transferred in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(b)(i): acceptance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(b)(ii): identification, including redundant criteria for verification;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(b)(iii): documentation, under 21 U.S.C. Sec. 360eee-1, of transaction information, history, and statements;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(b)(iv): safe storage;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(b)(v): security;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(b)(vi): inspection;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(b)(vii): transfer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(b)(viii): dispensing;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(c): a pharmacist, pharmacy intern, or licensed pharmacy technician:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(c)(i): working in or consulting with a participating eligible donor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(c)(ii): assisting an individual donating the eligible prescription drug;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(d): disposition of a donated prescription drug that is a controlled substance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(e): 58-17b-903(2)(a) record keeping regarding:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(e)(i): 58-17b-903(2)(a) the individual or eligible donor that transferred an eligible prescription drug under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(e)(ii): the identification and evaluation of a donated prescription drug by a pharmacist or licensed pharmacy technician; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(e)(iii): the dispensing or disposition of a prescription drug;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(f): determining the status of a medically indigent individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(g): labeling requirements to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(g)(i): ensure compliance with patient privacy laws relating to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(g)(i)(A): an individual who receives an eligible prescription drug; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(g)(i)(B): patient information that may appear on a donated prescription drug;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(g)(ii): clearly identify an eligible prescription drug dispensed under the program; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(g)(iii): communicate necessary information regarding the manufacturer's recommended expiration date or the beyond use date; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(3)(h): ensuring compliance with the requirements of this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(4): 26B-1-201 a process for seeking input from the Department of Health and Human Services created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(4)(a): establish program standards and procedures for assisted living facilities and nursing care facilities; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(4)(b): establish program standards and procedures for mental health and substance abuse clients; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-907(5): the creation of a special training program that a pharmacist and a licensed pharmacy technician at an eligible pharmacy must complete before participating in the program.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1001 Title.
----------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Epinephrine Auto-Injector and Stock Albuterol Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1002 Definitions.
----------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1002(1): 26B-4-401 "Epinephrine auto-injector" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1002(2): 26A-1-102 "Local health department" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1002(3): 58-67-102 "Physician" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1002(4): 26B-4-401 "Qualified adult" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1002(5): 26B-4-401 "Qualified epinephrine auto-injector entity" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1002(6): 26B-4-401 "Qualified stock albuterol entity" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1002(7): 26B-4-401 "Stock albuterol" means the same as that term is defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1003 Voluntary participation.
----------------------------------------------------------
This part does not create a duty or standard of care for a person to prescribe or dispense an epinephrine auto-injector or stock albuterol.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1004 Authorization to dispense an epinephrine auto-injector and stock albuterol pursuant to a standing order.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1004(1): Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 4, School Health; Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 4, School Health; 58-17b-1005; 58-17b-1006 Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter, a pharmacist or pharmacy intern may dispense an epinephrine auto-injector:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1004(1)(a): Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 4, School Health; Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 4, School Health
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1004(1)(a)(i): Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 4, School Health to a qualified adult for use in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1004(1)(a)(ii): Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 4, School Health to a qualified epinephrine auto-injector entity for use in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1004(1)(b): 58-17b-1005 pursuant to a standing prescription drug order made in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1004(1)(c): without any other prescription drug order from a person licensed to prescribe an epinephrine auto-injector; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1004(1)(d): 58-17b-1006 in accordance with the dispensing guidelines in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1004(2): Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 4, School Health; Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 4, School Health; 58-17b-1005; 58-17b-1006 Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter, a pharmacist or pharmacy intern may dispense stock albuterol:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1004(2)(a): Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 4, School Health; Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 4, School Health
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1004(2)(a)(i): Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 4, School Health to a qualified adult for use in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1004(2)(a)(ii): Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 4, School Health to a qualified stock albuterol entity for use in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1004(2)(b): 58-17b-1005 pursuant to a standing prescription drug order made in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1004(2)(c): without any other prescription drug order from a person licensed to prescribe stock albuterol; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1004(2)(d): 58-17b-1006 in accordance with the dispensing guidelines in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1005 Standing prescription drug orders for epinephrine auto-injectors and stock albuterol.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1005(1): 58-17b-1004; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 58-67-201 A physician acting in the physician's capacity as an employee of the Department of Health or as a medical director of a local health department may issue a standing prescription drug order authorizing the dispensing of an epinephrine auto-injector under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1005(1)(a): requires the physician to specify the persons, by professional license number, authorized to dispense the epinephrine auto-injector;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1005(1)(b): requires the physician to review at least annually the dispensing practices of those authorized by the physician to dispense the epinephrine auto-injector;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1005(1)(c): requires those authorized by the physician to dispense the epinephrine auto-injector to make and retain a record of each dispensing, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1005(1)(c)(i): the name of the qualified adult or qualified epinephrine auto-injector entity to whom the epinephrine auto-injector is dispensed;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1005(1)(c)(ii): a description of the epinephrine auto-injector dispensed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1005(1)(c)(iii): other relevant information; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1005(1)(d): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 58-67-201 is approved by the division by administrative rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1005(2): 58-17b-1004; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 58-67-201 A physician acting in the physician's capacity as an employee of the Department of Health or as a medical director of a local health department may issue a standing prescription drug order authorizing the dispensing of stock albuterol under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1005(2)(a): requires the physician to specify the persons, by professional license number, authorized to dispense the stock albuterol;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1005(2)(b): requires the physician to review at least annually the dispensing practices of those authorized by the physician to dispense the stock albuterol;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1005(2)(c): requires those authorized by the physician to dispense the stock albuterol to make and retain a record of each dispensing, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1005(2)(c)(i): the name of the qualified adult or qualified stock albuterol entity to whom the stock albuterol is dispensed;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1005(2)(c)(ii): a description of the stock albuterol dispensed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1005(2)(c)(iii): other relevant information; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1005(2)(d): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 58-67-201 is approved by the division by administrative rule made in accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1006 Guidelines for dispensing an epinephrine auto-injector and stock albuterol.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1006(1): A pharmacist or pharmacy intern who dispenses an epinephrine auto-injector under this part shall, at a minimum, provide patient counseling to the qualified adult or qualified epinephrine auto-injector entity to whom the epinephrine auto-injector is dispensed regarding:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1006(1)(a): the appropriate administration and storage of the epinephrine auto-injector;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1006(1)(b): potential side effects and risks of the epinephrine auto-injector; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1006(1)(c): when to seek emergency medical attention.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1006(2): A pharmacist or pharmacy intern who dispenses stock albuterol under this part shall, at a minimum, provide patient counseling to the qualified adult or qualified stock albuterol entity to whom the stock albuterol is dispensed regarding:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1006(2)(a): the appropriate administration and storage of the stock albuterol;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1006(2)(b): potential side effects and risks of the stock albuterol; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1006(2)(c): when to seek emergency medical attention.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1007 Limited civil liability.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1007(1): 58-17b-1005(1) A physician who issues a standing prescription drug order in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-17b-1007(2): 58-17b-1005(2) A physician who issues a standing prescription drug order in accordance with Subsection


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 20b - Environmental Health Scientist Act
*********************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Environmental Health Scientist Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(1): "Accredited program" means a degree-offering program from:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(1)(a): an institution, college, or university that is accredited by the Department of Education or the Council for Higher Education Accreditation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(1)(b): a non-accredited institution, college, or university that offers education equivalent to Department of Education-accredited programs, as determined by a third party selected by the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(2): 58-20b-201 "Board" means the Environmental Health Scientist Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(3): "General supervision" means the supervising environmental health scientist is available for immediate voice communication with the person he or she is supervising.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(4): "Practice of environmental health science" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(4)(a): the enforcement of, the issuance of permits required by, or the inspection for the purpose of enforcing state and local public health laws in the following areas:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(4)(a)(i): air quality;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(4)(a)(ii): food safety;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(4)(a)(iii): solid, hazardous, and toxic substances disposal;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(4)(a)(iv): consumer product safety;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(4)(a)(v): housing;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(4)(a)(vi): noise control;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(4)(a)(vii): radiation protection;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(4)(a)(viii): water quality;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(4)(a)(ix): vector control;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(4)(a)(x): drinking water quality;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(4)(a)(xi): milk sanitation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(4)(a)(xii): rabies control;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(4)(a)(xiii): public health nuisances;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(4)(a)(xiv): indoor clean air regulations;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(4)(a)(xv): institutional and residential sanitation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(4)(a)(xvi): recreational facilities sanitation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(4)(b): representing oneself in any manner as, or using the titles "environmental health scientist," "environmental health scientist-in-training," or "registered sanitarian."
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(5): 58-1-501 "Unlawful conduct" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-102(6): 58-1-501; 58-20b-501 "Unprofessional conduct" means the same as that term is defined in Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-201 Board.
---------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-201(1): There is created the Environmental Health Scientist Board consisting of four environmental health scientists in good standing and one member of the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-201(2): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed and serve in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-201(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203 The duties and responsibilities of the board shall be in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-201(3)(a): assist the division in reviewing complaints concerning the unlawful or unprofessional conduct of a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-201(3)(b): advise the division in its investigation of these complaints.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-201(4): (3) A board member who has, under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-301 Licensure required -- License classifications.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-301(1): 58-20b-305; 58-1-307 A person shall hold a license under this chapter in order to engage in the practice of environmental health science while employed by any of the following, except as specifically exempted in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-301(1)(a): a local health department;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-301(1)(b): the state Department of Health;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-301(1)(c): the state Department of Human Services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-301(1)(d): the Department of Agriculture and Food as a food and dairy compliance officer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-301(1)(e): a local health department as its director of environmental health services.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-301(2): (1) Any other individual not subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-301(3): The division shall issue to persons who qualify under this chapter a license in the classification:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-301(3)(a): environmental health scientist; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-301(3)(b): environmental health scientist-in-training.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-302 Qualifications for licensure.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-302(1): (2); 63J-1-504 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-302(1)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-302(1)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-302(1)(c): hold, at a minimum, a bachelor's degree from an accredited program in a university or college, which degree includes completion of specific course work as defined by rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-302(1)(d): pass an examination as determined by division rule in collaboration with the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-302(1)(e): pass the Utah Law and Rules Examination for Environmental Health Scientists administered by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-302(2): 63J-1-504 An applicant for licensure as an environmental health scientist-in-training shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-302(2)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-302(2)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-302(2)(c): hold, at a minimum, a bachelor's degree from an accredited program in a university or college, which degree includes completion of specific course work as defined by rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-302(2)(d): pass the Utah Law and Rules Examination for Environmental Health Scientists administered by the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-302(2)(e): present evidence acceptable to the division and the board that the applicant, when licensed, will practice as an environmental health scientist-in-training only under the general supervision of a supervising environmental health scientist licensed under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-303 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-303(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-303(1)(a): The division shall issue each license for an environmental health scientist in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-303(1)(b): The division may by rule extend or shorten a renewal period by as much as one year to stagger the renewal cycles it administers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-303(2): Each license for an environmental health scientist-in-training shall be issued for a term of two years and may not be renewed.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-303(3): 58-1-308 Each license issued under this chapter automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless the licensee renews it in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-304 Continuing education.
------------------------------------------------------
Each person holding a license under this chapter as an environmental health scientist or an environmental health scientist-in-training shall complete in each two-year period of licensure not fewer than 30 hours of professional continuing education in accordance with standards defined by division rule.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-305 Exemptions from licensure.
-----------------------------------------------------------
In addition to the exemptions from licensure in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-20b-305(1): 41-6a-1642 the person's practice of environmental health science is limited to inspecting in order to enforce compliance with an inspection and maintenance program established pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-305(2): the person is a laboratory staff person employed by the Department of Agriculture and Food or the Department of Health, and in the person's employment inspects, permits, certifies, or otherwise enforces laboratory standards in laboratories regulated by state or local public health laws; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-305(3): the person is the local health officer of a local public health department, which employs a director of environmental health services licensed under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-401 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for refusing to issue a license to an applicant, for refusing to renew the license of a licensee, for revoking, suspending, restricting, or placing on probation the license of a licensee, for issuing a public or private reprimand to a licensee, and for issuing a cease and desist order shall be in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-501 Unprofessional conduct.
--------------------------------------------------------
"Unprofessional conduct" includes:Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-501(1): acting dishonestly or fraudulently in the performance of professional duties as an environmental health scientist or environmental health scientist-in-training;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-501(2): intentionally filing a false report or record in the performance of professional duties as an environmental health scientist or environmental health scientist-in-training; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-20b-501(3): willfully impeding or obstructing another person from filing a report in the performance of professional duties as an environmental health scientist or environmental health scientist-in-training.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 22 - Professional Engineers and Professional Land Surveyors Licensing Act
******************************************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Professional Engineers and Professional Land Surveyors Licensing Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(1): 58-22-201 "Board" means the Professional Engineers and Professional Land Surveyors Licensing Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(2): Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act "Building" means a structure which has human occupancy or habitation as its principal purpose, and includes the structural, mechanical, and electrical systems, utility services, and other facilities required for the building, and is otherwise governed by the State Construction Code or an approved code under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(3): "Complete construction plans" means a final set of plans, specifications, and reports for a building or structure that normally includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(3)(a): floor plans;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(3)(b): elevations;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(3)(c): site plans;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(3)(d): foundation, structural, and framing detail;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(3)(e): electrical, mechanical, and plumbing design;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(3)(f): information required by the energy code;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(3)(g): specifications and related calculations as appropriate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(3)(h): all other documents required to obtain a building permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(4): "EAC/ABET" means the Engineering Accreditation Commission/Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(5): 58-22-103 "Fund" means the Professional Engineer, Professional Structural Engineer, and Professional Land Surveyor Education and Enforcement Fund created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(6): "NCEES" means the National Council of Examiners for Engineering and Surveying.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(7): "Principal" means a licensed professional engineer, professional structural engineer, or professional land surveyor having responsible charge of an organization's professional engineering, professional structural engineering, or professional land surveying practice.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(8): "Professional engineer" means a person licensed under this chapter as a professional engineer.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(9): 58-3a-102
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(9)(a): "Professional engineering," "the practice of engineering," or "the practice of professional engineering" means a service or creative work, the adequate performance of which requires engineering education, training, and experience in the application of special knowledge of the mathematical, physical, and engineering sciences to the service or creative work as consultation, investigation, evaluation, planning, design, and design coordination of engineering works and systems, planning the use of land and water, facility programming, performing engineering surveys and studies, and the review of construction for the purpose of monitoring compliance with drawings and specifications; any of which embraces these services or work, either public or private, in connection with any utilities, structures, buildings, machines, equipment, processes, work systems, projects, and industrial or consumer products or equipment of a mechanical, electrical, hydraulic, pneumatic, or thermal nature, and including other professional services as may be necessary to the planning, progress, and completion of any engineering services.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(9)(b): 58-3a-102 "The practice of professional engineering" does not include the practice of architecture as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(10): "Professional engineering intern" means a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(10)(a): has completed the education requirements to become a professional engineer;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(10)(b): has passed the fundamentals of engineering examination; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(10)(c): is engaged in obtaining the four years of qualifying experience for licensure under the supervision of a licensed professional engineer.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(11): "Professional land surveying" or "the practice of land surveying" means a service or work, the adequate performance of which requires the application of special knowledge of the principles of mathematics, the related physical and applied sciences, and the relevant requirements of law for adequate evidence to the act of measuring and locating lines, angles, elevations, natural and man-made features in the air, on the surface of the earth, within underground workings, and on the beds of bodies of water for the purpose of determining areas and volumes, for the monumenting or locating of property boundaries or points controlling boundaries, and for the platting and layout of lands and subdivisions of lands, including the topography, alignment and grades of streets, and for the preparation and perpetuation of maps, record plats, field notes records, and property descriptions that represent these surveys and other duties as sound surveying practices could direct.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(12): "Professional land surveyor" means an individual licensed under this chapter as a professional land surveyor.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(13): "Professional structural engineer" means a person licensed under this chapter as a professional structural engineer.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14): (9); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(a): "Professional structural engineering" or "the practice of structural engineering" means a service or creative work providing structural engineering services for significant structures, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(a)(i): buildings and other structures representing a substantial hazard to human life, which include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(a)(i)(A): buildings and other structures whose primary occupancy is public assembly with an occupant load greater than 300;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(a)(i)(B): buildings and other structures with elementary school, secondary school, or day care facilities with an occupant load greater than 250;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(a)(i)(C): buildings and other structures with an occupant load greater than 500 for colleges or adult education facilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(a)(i)(D): health care facilities with an occupant load of 50 or more resident patients, but not having surgery or emergency treatment facilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(a)(i)(E): jails and detention facilities with a gross area greater than 3,000 square feet; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(a)(i)(F): buildings and other structures  with an occupant load greater than 5,000;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(a)(ii): buildings and other structures designated as essential facilities, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(a)(ii)(A): hospitals and other health care facilities having surgery or emergency treatment facilities with a gross area greater than 3,000 square feet;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(a)(ii)(B): fire, rescue, and police stations and emergency vehicle garages with a mean height greater than 24 feet or a gross area greater than 5,000 square feet;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(a)(ii)(C): designated earthquake, hurricane, or other emergency shelters with a gross area greater than 3,000 square feet;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(a)(ii)(D): designated emergency preparedness, communication, and operation centers and other buildings required for emergency response with a mean height more than 24 feet or a gross area greater than 5,000 square feet;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(a)(ii)(E): power-generating stations and other public utility facilities required as emergency backup facilities with a gross area greater than 3,000 square feet;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(a)(ii)(F): structures with a mean height more than 24 feet or a gross area greater than 5,000 square feet containing highly toxic materials as defined by the division by rule, where the quantity of the material exceeds the maximum allowable quantities set by the division by rule; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(a)(ii)(G): aviation control towers, air traffic control centers, and emergency aircraft hangars at commercial service and cargo air services airports as defined by the Federal Aviation Administration with a mean height greater than 35 feet or a gross area greater than 20,000 square feet; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(a)(iii): buildings and other structures requiring special consideration, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(a)(iii)(A): structures or buildings that are  normally occupied by human beings and are five stories or more in height;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(a)(iii)(B): structures or buildings that are normally occupied by human beings and have an average roof height more than 60 feet above the average ground level measured at the perimeter of the structure; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(a)(iii)(C): buildings that are over 200,000 aggregate gross square feet in area.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(b): (9); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Professional structural engineering" or "the practice of structural engineering":
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(b)(i): (9) includes the definition of professional engineering or the practice of professional engineering as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(14)(b)(ii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act may be further defined by rules made by the division in collaboration with the board in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(15): Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act "Structure" means that which is built or constructed, an edifice or building of any kind, or a piece of work artificially built up or composed of parts joined together in a definite manner, and as otherwise governed by the State Construction Code or an approved code under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(16): "Supervision" means that a licensed professional engineer, professional structural engineer, or professional land surveyor is responsible for and personally reviews, corrects when necessary, and approves work performed by an employee, subordinate, associate, or drafter under the direction of the licensee, and may be further defined by rule by the division in collaboration with the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(17): "TAC/ABET" means the Technology Accreditation Commission/Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(18): 58-1-501; 58-22-501 "Unlawful conduct"  means the same as that term is  defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-102(19): 58-1-501; 58-22-502.5 "Unprofessional conduct"  means the same as that term is defined in Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-103 Education and enforcement fund.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-103(1): There is created an expendable special revenue fund known as the "Professional Engineer, Professional Structural Engineer, and Professional Land Surveyor Education and Enforcement Fund."
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-103(2): 63J-1-504 The fund consists of money from:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-103(2)(a): 63J-1-504 a surcharge fee placed on initial, renewal, and reinstatement licensure fees under this chapter in accordance with the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-103(2)(a)(i): 63J-1-504 the surcharge fee shall be established by the department in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-103(2)(a)(ii): the surcharge fee shall not exceed 50% of the respective initial, renewal, or reinstatement licensure fee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-103(2)(b): administrative penalties collected pursuant to this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-103(3): The fund shall earn interest and all interest earned on fund money shall be deposited into the fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-103(4): The director may, with concurrence of the board, make distributions from the fund for the following purposes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-103(4)(a): education and training of licensees under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-103(4)(b): education and training of the public or other interested persons in matters concerning engineering, structural engineering, and land surveying laws and practices; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-103(4)(c): enforcement of this chapter by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-103(4)(c)(i): investigating unprofessional or unlawful conduct; and
