Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-103(4)(c)(ii): providing legal representation to the division when the division takes legal action against a person engaging in unprofessional or unlawful conduct.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-103(5): If the balance in the fund exceeds $100,000 at the close of any fiscal year, the excess shall be transferred to the General Fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-103(6): The division shall report annually to the appropriate appropriations subcommittee of the Legislature concerning the fund.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-104 Surcharge fee.
----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-104(1): 63J-1-504 In addition to any other fees authorized by this chapter or by the division in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-104(2): The surcharge fee shall be deposited in the General Fund as a dedicated credit to be used by the division to provide each licensee under this chapter with access to an electronic reference library that provides web-based access to national, state, and local building codes and standards.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-201 Board.
--------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-201(1): There is created a Professional Engineers and Professional Land Surveyors Licensing Board.  The board shall consist of four licensed professional engineers, one licensed professional structural engineer, one licensed professional land surveyor, and one member from the general public.  The composition of the four professional engineers on the board shall be representative of the various professional engineering disciplines.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-201(2): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed and shall serve in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-201(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203 The duties and responsibilities of the board shall be in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-201(3)(a): assist the division in reviewing complaints concerning the unlawful or unprofessional conduct of a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-201(3)(b): advise the division in its investigation of these complaints.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-201(4): (3) A board member who has, under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-301 License required -- License classifications.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-301(1): 58-1-307; 58-22-305 A license is required to engage in the practice of professional engineering, professional structural engineering, or professional land surveying, except as specifically provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-301(2): The division shall issue licenses to individuals qualified under the provisions of this chapter in the following classifications:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-301(2)(a): professional engineer;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-301(2)(b): professional structural engineer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-301(2)(c): professional land surveyor.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-301(3): The division may issue a license in a specific engineering discipline or disciplines as defined by rule by the division in collaboration with the board.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302 Qualifications for licensure.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(1): 63J-1-504 Each applicant for licensure as a professional engineer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(1)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(1)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(1)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(1)(c)(i): have graduated and received a bachelors or masters degree from an engineering program meeting criteria established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(1)(c)(ii): have completed the Transportation Engineering Technology and Fundamental Engineering College Program before July 1, 1998, under the direction of the Utah Department of Transportation and as certified by the Utah Department of Transportation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(1)(d): have successfully completed a program of qualifying experience established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(1)(e): have successfully passed examinations established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(1)(f): meet with the board or representative of the division upon request for the purpose of evaluating the applicant's qualification for licensure.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(2): 63J-1-504 Each applicant for licensure as a professional structural engineer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(2)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(2)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(2)(c): have graduated and received an earned bachelors or masters degree from an engineering program meeting criteria established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(2)(d): have successfully completed three years of licensed professional engineering experience established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board, except that prior to January 1, 2009, an applicant for licensure may submit a signed affidavit in a form prescribed by the division stating that the applicant is currently engaged in the practice of structural engineering;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(2)(e): have successfully passed examinations established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board, except that prior to January 1, 2009, an applicant for licensure may submit a signed affidavit in a form prescribed by the division stating that the applicant is currently engaged in the practice of structural engineering; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(2)(f): meet with the board or representative of the division upon request for the purpose of evaluating the applicant's qualification for licensure.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(3): 63J-1-504; 53B-2a-105 Each applicant for licensure as a professional land surveyor shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(3)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(3)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(3)(c): 53B-2a-105
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(3)(c)(i): 53B-2a-105 have graduated and received an associates, bachelors, or masters degree from a land surveying program, or an equivalent land surveying program, such as a program offered by a technical college described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(3)(c)(ii): have successfully completed a program of qualifying experience in land surveying prior to January 1, 2007, in accordance with rules established by the division in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(3)(d): have successfully passed examinations established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(3)(e): meet with the board or representative of the division upon request for the purpose of evaluating the applicant's qualification for licensure.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(4): 63J-1-504 Each applicant for licensure by endorsement shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(4)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(4)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(4)(c): submit satisfactory evidence of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(4)(c)(i): current licensure in good standing in a jurisdiction recognized by rule by the division in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(4)(c)(ii): having successfully passed an examination established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(4)(c)(iii): full-time employment as a principal for at least five of the last seven years immediately preceding the date of the application as a:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(4)(c)(iii)(A): licensed professional engineer for licensure as a professional engineer;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(4)(c)(iii)(B): licensed professional structural engineer for licensure as a structural engineer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(4)(c)(iii)(C): licensed professional land surveyor for licensure as a professional land surveyor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(4)(d): meet with the board or representative of the division upon request for the purpose of evaluating the applicant's qualifications for license.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-302(5): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The rules made to implement this section shall be in accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-303 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-303(1): The division shall issue each license under this chapter in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.  The division may by rule extend or shorten a renewal period by as much as one year to stagger the renewal cycles it administers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-303(2): 58-22-304 At the time of renewal the licensee shall show satisfactory evidence of completion of continuing education as may be required by rules enacted pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-303(3): 58-1-308 Each license automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless renewed by the licensee in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-304 Continuing professional education.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-304(1): Each individual licensed as a professional land surveyor shall be required to complete a program of qualifying continuing professional education in accordance with standards defined by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-304(2): Each individual licensed as a professional engineer or professional structural engineer may be required to complete a program of qualifying continuing professional education in accordance with standards defined by rule.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305 Exemption from licensure.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1): 58-1-307; Title 58, Chapter 3a, Architects Licensing Act In addition to the exemptions from licensure in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(a): a person offering to render professional engineering, professional structural engineering, or professional land surveying services in this state when not licensed under this chapter if the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(a)(i): holds a current and valid professional engineer, professional structural engineer, or professional land surveyor license issued by a licensing authority recognized by rule by the division in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(a)(ii): discloses in writing to the potential client the fact that the professional engineer, professional structural engineer, or professional land surveyor:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(a)(ii)(A): is not licensed in the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(a)(ii)(B): may not provide professional engineering, professional structural engineering, or professional land surveying services in the state until licensed in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(a)(ii)(C): that such condition may cause a delay in the ability of the professional engineer, professional structural engineer, or professional land surveyor to provide licensed services in the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(a)(iii): notifies the division in writing of the person's intent to offer to render professional engineering, professional structural engineering, or professional land surveying services in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(a)(iv): does not provide professional engineering, professional structural engineering, or professional land surveying services, or engage in the practice of professional engineering, professional structural engineering, or professional land surveying in this state until licensed to do so;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(b): a person preparing a plan and specification for a one or two-family residence not exceeding two stories in height;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(c): Title 58, Chapter 3a, Architects Licensing Act a person licensed to practice architecture under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(d): unlicensed employees, subordinates, associates, or drafters of a person licensed under this chapter while preparing plans, maps, sketches, drawings, documents, specifications, plats, and reports under the supervision of a professional engineer, professional structural engineer, or professional land surveyor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(e): a person preparing a plan or specification for, or supervising the alteration of or repair to, an existing building affecting an area not exceeding 3,000 square feet when structural elements of a building are not changed, such as foundations, beams, columns, and structural slabs, joists, bearing walls, and trusses;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(f): an employee of a communications, utility, railroad, mining, petroleum, or manufacturing company, or an affiliate of such a company, if the professional engineering or professional structural engineering work is performed solely in connection with the products or systems of the company and is not offered directly to the public;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(g): an organization engaged in the practice of professional engineering, structural engineering, or professional land surveying, provided that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(g)(i): the organization employs a principal; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(g)(ii): all individuals employed by the organization, who are engaged in the practice of professional engineering, structural engineering, or land surveying, are licensed or exempt from licensure under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(h): a person licensed as a professional engineer, a professional structural engineer, or a professional land surveyor in a state other than Utah serving as an expert witness, provided the expert testimony meets one of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(h)(i): oral testimony as an expert witness in an administrative, civil, or criminal proceeding; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(h)(ii): written documentation included as part of the testimony in a proceeding, including designs, studies, plans, specifications, or similar documentation, provided that the purpose of the written documentation is not to establish specifications, plans, designs, processes, or standards to be used in the future in an industrial process, system, construction, design, or repair;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(i): a person certified by the National Institute for Certification in Engineering Technologies at level III or IV in Water-Based System Layout, who submits a fire sprinkler system to the authority having jurisdiction, the fire code official, or the building official for approval;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(j): a person certified by the National Institute for Certification in Engineering Technologies at level III or IV in Fire Alarm Systems, who submits a fire alarm system layout to the authority having jurisdiction, the fire code official, or the building official for approval;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(k): a fire code or building official reviewing construction documents for code compliance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(1)(l): a fire code or building official conducting an inspection for code compliance.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-305(2): (1)(b); (1)(i); (1)(j) Nothing in this section shall be construed to restrict a person from preparing plans for a client under the exemptions provided in Subsections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-306 Admission criteria to take the Fundamentals of Engineering Examination.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The admission criteria to take the NCEES Fundamentals of Engineering Examination shall be enrollment in or graduation from one of the following accredited curriculums, or other curriculums as may be established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board:Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-306(1): EAC/ABET curriculum; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-306(2): TAC/ABET curriculum.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-401 Grounds for denial of license and disciplinary proceedings.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The division may refuse to issue a license to an applicant, refuse to renew the license of a licensee, revoke, suspend, restrict, or place on probation the license of a licensee, issue a public or private reprimand to a licensee, and issue cease and desist orders in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-501 Unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------
"Unlawful conduct" includes:Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-501(1): 58-22-305(1) using the title "professional engineer," "professional land surveyor," "land surveyor," "professional structural engineer," "structural engineer," or any other words, letters, abbreviations, or designations which represent recognized professional engineering disciplines indicating that the person using them is a professional engineer, professional land surveyor, or professional structural engineer if the person has not been licensed under this chapter, except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-501(2): 58-22-305(1) using the terms "engineering," "structural engineering," or "surveying" or any similar words, letters, or abbreviations to describe the type of activity performed or offered to be performed if the person has not been licensed under this chapter, except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-501(3): 58-22-305(1) engaging in or representing itself as engaging in the practice of professional engineering, professional structural engineering, or professional land surveying as a corporation, proprietorship, partnership, or limited liability company, except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-501(4): 58-22-102(9); (11); (14); 58-1-307; 58-3a-304(1)(b); (f) engaging in the practice of engineering, structural engineering, or surveying as set forth in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-501(5): 58-22-102(14)(a) a professional engineer engaging in the practice of structural engineering as defined in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-502.5 Unprofessional conduct.
---------------------------------------------------------
Unprofessional conduct includes unprofessional conduct that is defined by rules made by the division in accordance with

Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503 Penalties and administrative actions for unlawful or unprofessional conduct.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(1): 58-1-501; 58-22-501; 58-22-502.5; 58-22-501; 58-22-502.5; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; 58-1-501; 58-22-501; 58-22-502.5; 58-22-501; 58-22-502.5; (1); 58-1-501; 58-22-501; 58-22-502.5; 58-22-401; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; (1)(a); (1)(a); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(1)(a): 58-1-501; 58-22-501; 58-22-502.5; 58-22-501; 58-22-502.5; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; 58-1-501; 58-22-501; 58-22-502.5; 58-22-501; 58-22-502.5; (1); 58-1-501; 58-22-501; 58-22-502.5; 58-22-401 If upon inspection or investigation, the division concludes that a person has violated Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(1)(a)(i): 58-1-501; 58-22-501; 58-22-502.5; 58-22-501; 58-22-502.5; (1); 58-1-501; 58-22-501; 58-22-502.5 A person who violates Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(1)(a)(ii): 58-22-401 Except for a cease and desist order, the licensure sanctions cited in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(1)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act A citation shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(1)(b)(i): be in writing;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(1)(b)(ii): describe with particularity the nature of the violation, including a reference to the provision of the chapter, rule, or order alleged to have been violated;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(1)(b)(iii): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act clearly state that the recipient must notify the division in writing within 20 calendar days of service of the citation if the recipient wishes to contest the citation at a hearing conducted under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(1)(b)(iv): clearly explain the consequences of failure to timely contest the citation or to make payment of any fines assessed by the citation within the time specified in the citation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(1)(c): The division may issue a notice in lieu of a citation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(1)(d): Each citation issued under this section, or a copy of each citation, may be served upon a person upon whom a summons may be served in accordance with the Utah Rules of Civil Procedure and may be made personally or upon the person's agent by a division investigator or by any person specially designated by the director or by mail.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(1)(e): If within 20 calendar days from the service of the citation, the person to whom the citation was issued fails to request a hearing to contest the citation, the citation becomes the final order of the division and is not subject to further agency review.  The period to contest a citation may be extended by the division for cause.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(1)(f): The division may refuse to issue or renew, suspend, revoke, or place on probation the license of a licensee who fails to comply with a citation after it becomes final.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(1)(g): The failure of an applicant for licensure to comply with a citation after it becomes final is a ground for denial of license.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(1)(h): No citation may be issued under this section after the expiration of one year following the date on which the violation that is the subject of the citation is reported to the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(1)(i): (1)(a); (1)(a); (1)(a) The director or the director's designee shall assess fines according to the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(1)(i)(i): (1)(a) for a first offense handled pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(1)(i)(ii): (1)(a) for a second offense handled pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(1)(i)(iii): (1)(a) for any subsequent offense handled pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(2): An action initiated for a first or second offense which has not yet resulted in a final order of the division shall not preclude initiation of any subsequent action for a second or subsequent offense during the pendency of any preceding action.  The final order on a subsequent action shall be considered a second or subsequent offense, respectively, provided the preceding action resulted in a first or second offense, respectively.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(3)(a): The director may collect a penalty that is not paid by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(3)(a)(i): referring the matter to a collection agency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(3)(a)(ii): bringing an action in the district court of the county where the person against whom the penalty is imposed resides or in the county where the office of the director is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(3)(b): A county attorney or the attorney general of the state shall provide legal assistance and advice to the director in an action to collect a penalty.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-503(3)(c): A court shall award reasonable attorney fees and costs to the prevailing party in an action brought by the division to collect a penalty.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-601 Seal -- Design and implementation.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Every professional engineer, professional land surveyor, or professional structural engineer shall have a seal, the design and implementation of which shall be established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-602 Plans, specifications, reports, maps, sketches, surveys, drawings, documents, and plats to be sealed.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-602(1): 58-22-305; Title 58, Chapter 3a, Architects Licensing Act; Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act Any final plan, specification, and report of a building or structure erected in this state shall bear the seal of a professional engineer or professional structural engineer licensed under this chapter, except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-602(2): 58-22-305 Any final plan, specification, and report prepared by, or under the supervision of, the professional engineer or professional structural engineer shall bear the seal of the professional engineer or professional structural engineer when submitted to a client, when filed with public authorities, or when submitted to a building official for the purpose of obtaining a building permit, even if the practice is exempt from licensure under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-602(3): Any final plan, map, sketch, survey, drawing, document, plat, and report shall bear the seal of the professional land surveyor licensed under this chapter when submitted to a client or when filed with public authorities.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603 Seal -- Authorized use.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(1): A professional engineer or professional structural engineer may only affix the licensee's seal to a plan, specification, and report when the plan, specification, and report:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(1)(a): was personally prepared by the licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(1)(b): was prepared by an employee, subordinate, associate, or drafter under the supervision of a licensee, provided the licensee or a principal affixing his seal assumes responsibility;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(1)(c): was prepared by a licensed professional engineer, professional structural engineer, or architect in this state or any other state provided:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(1)(c)(i): the licensee in this state affixing the seal performs a thorough review of all work for compliance with all applicable laws and rules and the standards of the profession; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(1)(c)(ii): makes any necessary corrections before submitting the final plan, specification, or report:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(1)(c)(ii)(A): to a building official for the purpose of obtaining a building permit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(1)(c)(ii)(B): to a client who has contracted with a professional engineer or professional structural engineer for the design of a building or structure, when the licensee represents, or could reasonably expect the client to consider, the plan, specification, or report to be complete and final;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(1)(d): was prepared in part by a licensed professional engineer, professional structural engineer, or architect in this state or any other state provided:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(1)(d)(i): the licensee in this state clearly identifies that portion of the plan, specification, or report for which the licensee is responsible;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(1)(d)(ii): the licensee in this state affixing the seal performs a thorough review of that portion of the plan, specification, or report for which the licensee is responsible for compliance with the standards of the profession; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(1)(d)(iii): makes any necessary corrections before submitting the final plan, specification, or report for which the licensee is responsible:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(1)(d)(iii)(A): to a building official for the purpose of obtaining a building permit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(1)(d)(iii)(B): to a client who has contracted with a professional engineer or professional structural engineer for the design of a building or structure, when the licensee represents, or could reasonably expect the client to consider, the plans, specifications, or reports to be complete and final;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(1)(e): was prepared by a person exempt from licensure as a professional engineer, professional structural engineer, or architect provided that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(1)(e)(i): the licensee in this state affixing the seal performs a thorough review for compliance with all applicable laws and rules and the standards of the profession; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(1)(e)(ii): makes any necessary corrections before submitting the final plan, specification, or report:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(1)(e)(ii)(A): to a building official for the purpose of obtaining a building permit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(1)(e)(ii)(B): to a client who has contracted with a professional engineer, professional structural engineer, or architect for the design of a building or structure, when the licensee represents, or could reasonably expect the client to consider, the plan, specification, or report to be complete and final; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(1)(f): meet any additional requirements established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(2): A professional land surveyor may only affix the licensee's seal to a plan, map, sketch, survey, drawing, document, plat, and report when the plan, map, sketch, survey, drawing, document, plat, and report:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(2)(a): was personally prepared by the licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-22-603(2)(b): was prepared by an employee, subordinate, associate, or drafter under the supervision of a professional land surveyor, provided the professional land surveyor or a principal affixing his seal assumes responsibility.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 24b - Physical Therapy Practice Act
****************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Physical Therapy Practice Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(1): "Animal physical therapy" means practicing physical therapy or physiotherapy on an animal.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(2): 58-24b-201 "Board" means the Utah Physical Therapy Licensing Board, created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(3): "Consultation by telecommunication" means the provision of expert or professional advice by a physical therapist who is licensed outside of Utah to a licensed physical therapist or a health care provider by telecommunication or electronic communication.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(4): "General supervision" means supervision and oversight of a person by a licensed physical therapist when the licensed physical therapist is immediately available in person, by telephone, or by electronic communication to assist the person.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(5): "Licensed physical therapist" means a person licensed under this chapter to engage in the practice of physical therapy.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(6): 58-24b-401(2)(a) "Licensed physical therapist assistant" means a person licensed under this chapter to engage in the practice of physical therapy, subject to the provisions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(7): "Licensing examination" means a nationally recognized physical therapy examination that is approved by the division, in consultation with the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(8): "On-site supervision" means supervision and oversight of a person by a licensed physical therapist or a licensed physical therapist assistant when the licensed physical therapist or licensed physical therapist assistant is:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(8)(a): continuously present at the facility where the person is providing services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(8)(b): immediately available to assist the person; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(8)(c): regularly involved in the services being provided by the person.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(9): "Physical impairment" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(9)(a): a mechanical impairment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(9)(b): a physiological impairment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(9)(c): a developmental impairment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(9)(d): a functional limitation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(9)(e): a disability;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(9)(f): a mobility impairment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(9)(g): a bodily malfunction.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(10): 58-24b-403; 58-28-307(12)(b); (10)(a)(i); (ix); 58-24b-405; (10)(a); 58-37-2
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(10)(a): 58-24b-403; 58-28-307(12)(b); (10)(a)(i); (ix); 58-24b-405; (10)(a) "Physical therapy" or "physiotherapy" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(10)(a)(i): examining, evaluating, and testing an individual who has a physical impairment or injury;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(10)(a)(ii): identifying or labeling a physical impairment or injury;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(10)(a)(iii): formulating a therapeutic intervention plan for the treatment of a physical impairment, injury, or pain;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(10)(a)(iv): assessing the ongoing effects of therapeutic intervention for the treatment of a physical impairment or injury;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(10)(a)(v): treating or alleviating a physical impairment by designing, modifying, or implementing a therapeutic intervention;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(10)(a)(vi): reducing the risk of an injury or physical impairment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(10)(a)(vii): providing instruction on the use of physical measures, activities, or devices for preventative and therapeutic purposes;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(10)(a)(viii): promoting and maintaining health and fitness;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(10)(a)(ix): 58-24b-403 the administration of a prescription drug pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(10)(a)(x): 58-28-307(12)(b); (10)(a)(i); (ix); 58-24b-405 subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(10)(a)(xi): (10)(a) engaging in administration, consultation, education, and research relating to the practices described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(10)(b): 58-37-2 "Physical therapy" or "physiotherapy" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(10)(b)(i): diagnosing disease;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(10)(b)(ii): performing surgery;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(10)(b)(iii): performing acupuncture;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(10)(b)(iv): taking x-rays; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(10)(b)(v): 58-37-2 prescribing or dispensing a drug, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(11): "Physical therapy aide" means a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(11)(a): is trained, on-the-job, by a licensed physical therapist; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(11)(b): provides routine assistance to a licensed physical therapist or licensed physical therapist assistant, while the licensed physical therapist or licensed physical therapist assistant practices physical therapy, within the scope of the licensed physical therapist's or licensed physical therapist assistant's license.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(12): "Recognized accreditation agency" means an accreditation agency that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(12)(a): grants accreditation, nationally, in the United States of America; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(12)(b): is approved by the division, in consultation with the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(13): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(13)(a): "Testing" means a standard method or technique used to gather data regarding a patient that is generally and nationally accepted by physical therapists for the practice of physical therapy.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(13)(b): "Testing" includes measurement or evaluation of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(13)(b)(i): muscle strength, force, endurance, or tone;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(13)(b)(ii): cardiovascular fitness;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(13)(b)(iii): physical work capacity;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(13)(b)(iv): joint motion, mobility, or stability;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(13)(b)(v): reflexes or autonomic reactions;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(13)(b)(vi): movement skill or accuracy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(13)(b)(vii): sensation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(13)(b)(viii): perception;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(13)(b)(ix): peripheral nerve integrity;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(13)(b)(x): locomotor skills, stability, and endurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(13)(b)(xi): the fit, function, and comfort of prosthetic, orthotic, or other assistive devices;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(13)(b)(xii): posture;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(13)(b)(xiii): body mechanics;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(13)(b)(xiv): limb length, circumference, and volume;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(13)(b)(xv): thoracic excursion and breathing patterns;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(13)(b)(xvi): activities of daily living related to physical movement and mobility;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(13)(b)(xvii): functioning in the physical environment at home or work, as it relates to physical movement and mobility; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(13)(b)(xviii): neural muscular responses.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(14): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(14)(a): "Trigger point dry needling" means the stimulation of a trigger point using a dry needle to treat neuromuscular pain and functional movement deficits.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(14)(b): "Trigger point dry needling" does not include the stimulation of auricular or distal points.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15): 58-24b-505 "Therapeutic intervention" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(a): therapeutic exercise, with or without the use of a device;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(b): functional training in self-care, as it relates to physical movement and mobility;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(c): community or work integration, as it relates to physical movement and mobility;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(d): manual therapy, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(d)(i): soft tissue mobilization;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(d)(ii): therapeutic massage; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(d)(iii): joint mobilization, as defined by the division, by rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(e): prescribing, applying, or fabricating an assistive, adaptive, orthotic, prosthetic, protective, or supportive device;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(f): airway clearance techniques, including postural drainage;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(g): integumentary protection and repair techniques;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(h): wound debridement, cleansing, and dressing;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(i): the application of a physical agent, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(i)(i): light;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(i)(ii): heat;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(i)(iii): cold;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(i)(iv): water;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(i)(v): air;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(i)(vi): sound;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(i)(vii): compression;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(i)(viii): electricity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(i)(ix): electromagnetic radiation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(j): mechanical or electrotherapeutic modalities;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(k): positioning;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(l): instructing or training a patient in locomotion or other functional activities, with or without an assistive device;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(m): manual or mechanical traction;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(n): correction of posture, body mechanics, or gait; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-102(15)(o): 58-24b-505 trigger point dry needling, under the conditions described in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-201 Physical Therapy Licensing Board -- Creation -- Membership -- Duties.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-201(1): There is created the Physical Therapy Licensing Board, consisting of three licensed physical therapists, one physical therapist assistant, and one member of the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-201(2): 58-1-201 Members of the board shall be appointed and serve in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-201(3): (4); 58-1-201; 58-1-203 The duties and responsibilities of the board are described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-201(4): (4)(a) The board shall designate a member of the board, on a permanent or rotating basis, to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-201(4)(a): assist the division in reviewing complaints of unlawful or unprofessional conduct of a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-201(4)(b): (4)(a) advise the division during the division's investigation of the complaints described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-201(5): (4) A board member who has reviewed a complaint or been involved in an investigation under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-301 Authority to practice physical therapy.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
A person may not engage in the practice of physical therapy, unless the person is:Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-301(1): licensed under this chapter and practices within the scope of that license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-301(2): 58-1-307; 58-24b-304 exempted from the licensing requirements of this chapter under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302 Licensure.
-------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(1): (1)(b); 58-24b-302.1; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act An applicant for a license as a physical therapist shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(1)(a): complete the application process, including payment of fees;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(1)(b): submit proof of graduation from a professional physical therapist education program that is accredited by a recognized accreditation agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(1)(c): (1)(b) pass a licensing examination:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(1)(c)(i): (1)(b) after complying with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(1)(c)(ii): if the applicant is in the final term of a professional physical therapist education program that is accredited by a recognized accreditation agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(1)(d): be able to read, write, speak, understand, and be understood in the English language and demonstrate proficiency to the satisfaction of the board if requested by the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(1)(e): 58-24b-302.1; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act consent to a criminal background check in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(1)(f): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act meet any other requirements established by the division, by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(2): 63J-1-504; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (2)(b); 58-24b-302.1; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act An applicant for a license as a physical therapist assistant shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(2)(a): 63J-1-504 complete the application process, including payment of fees set by the division, in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(2)(b): submit proof of graduation from a physical therapist assistant education program that is accredited by a recognized accreditation agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(2)(c): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (2)(b) pass a licensing examination approved by division rule made in collaboration with the board and in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(2)(c)(i): (2)(b) after the applicant complies with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(2)(c)(ii): if the applicant is in the final term of a physical therapist assistant education program that is accredited by a recognized accreditation agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(2)(d): be able to read, write, speak, understand, and be understood in the English language and demonstrate proficiency to the satisfaction of the board if requested by the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(2)(e): 58-24b-302.1; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act submit to, and pass, a criminal background check, in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(2)(f): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act meet any other requirements established by the division, by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(3): (3)(b)(ii)(A); (3)(b); 58-24b-302.1; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act An applicant for a license as a physical therapist who is educated outside of the United States shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(3)(a): complete the application process, including payment of fees;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(3)(b): (3)(b)(ii)(A)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(3)(b)(i): provide satisfactory evidence that the applicant graduated from a professional physical therapist education program that is accredited by a recognized accreditation agency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(3)(b)(ii): (3)(b)(ii)(A)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(3)(b)(ii)(A): provide satisfactory evidence that the applicant graduated from a physical therapist education program that prepares the applicant to engage in the practice of physical therapy, without restriction;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(3)(b)(ii)(B): (3)(b)(ii)(A) provide satisfactory evidence that the education program described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(3)(b)(ii)(C): pass a credential evaluation to ensure that the applicant has satisfied uniform educational requirements;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(3)(c): (3)(b) after complying with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(3)(d): be able to read, write, speak, understand, and be understood in the English language and demonstrate proficiency to the satisfaction of the board if requested by the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(3)(e): 58-24b-302.1; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act consent to a criminal background check in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(3)(f): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act meet any other requirements established by the division, by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(4): 58-24b-302.1; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The division shall issue a license to a person who holds a current unrestricted license to practice physical therapy in a state, district, or territory of the United States of America, other than Utah, if the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(4)(a): completes the application process, including payment of fees;

Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(5)(a)(ii): 58-24b-304 exempt from licensure under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302(5)(b): (5)(a) The provisions of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302.1 Criminal background check.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302.1(1): An applicant for licensure under this chapter who requires a criminal background check shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302.1(1)(a): submit fingerprint cards in a form acceptable to the division at the time the license application is filed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302.1(1)(b): consent to a fingerprint background check conducted by the Bureau of Criminal Identification and the Federal Bureau of Investigation regarding the application.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302.1(2): 53-10-108; (2)(a); 53-10-108 The division shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302.1(2)(a): 53-10-108 in addition to other fees authorized by this chapter, collect from each applicant submitting fingerprints in accordance with this section the fee that the Bureau of Criminal Identification is authorized to collect for the services provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302.1(2)(b): (2)(a) submit from each applicant the fingerprint card and the fees described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302.1(2)(c): 53-10-108 obtain and retain in division records a signed waiver approved by the Bureau of Criminal Identification in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302.1(3): 53-10-108; (2)(b) The Bureau of Criminal Identification shall, in accordance with the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302.1(3)(a): (2)(b) check the fingerprints submitted under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302.1(3)(b): forward the fingerprints to the Federal Bureau of Investigation for a national criminal history background check; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302.1(3)(c): provide the results from the state, regional, and nationwide criminal history background checks to the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302.1(4): Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 2, Bureau of Criminal Identification For purposes of conducting a criminal background check required under this section, the division shall have direct access to criminal background information maintained under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302.1(5): The division may not disseminate outside of the division any criminal history record information that the division obtains from the Bureau of Criminal Identification or the Federal Bureau of Investigation under the criminal background check requirements of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302.1(6): 58-24b-302(2); Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; 58-24b-302(2); (6)(b); Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302.1(6)(a): 58-24b-302(2) A new physical therapist assistant license issued under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302.1(6)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; 58-24b-302(2) Notwithstanding
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302.1(6)(c): (6)(b) A person whose conditional license has been revoked under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302.1(6)(d): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act The division shall conduct a postrevocation hearing in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-302.1(7): The division may not issue a letter of qualification to participate in the Physical Therapy Licensure Compact until the criminal background check described in this section is completed.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-303 Term of license -- Renewal -- Temporary license for physical therapist assistant.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-303(1): A license issued under this chapter shall be issued in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.  The division may, by rule, extend or shorten a license renewal process by one year in order to stagger the renewal cycles that the division administers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-303(2): At the time of license renewal, the licensee shall provide satisfactory evidence that the licensee completed continuing education competency requirements, established by the division, by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-303(3): (1) If a license renewal cycle is shortened or extended under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-303(4): A license issued under this chapter expires on the expiration date indicated on the license, unless the license is renewed under this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304 Exemptions from licensure.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1): 58-1-307; 58-24b-302(5); (1)(d)(ii)(A); (1)(c)(ii); Title 58, Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 73, Chiropractic Physician Practice Act In addition to the exemptions from licensure described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(a): the person is licensed under another law of the state to engage in acts that constitute the practice of physical therapy if that person does not:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(a)(i): claim to be a physical therapist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(a)(ii): claim to be a provider of any type of physical therapy that is outside of the scope of practice of the license that is issued to the person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(a)(iii): engage in any acts that constitute the practice of physical therapy that are outside of the scope of practice of the license that is issued to the person;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(b): the person practices physical therapy, under federal law, in:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(b)(i): the United States armed services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(b)(ii): the United States Public Health Service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(b)(iii): the Veterans Administration;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(c): the person is:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(c)(i): licensed as a physical therapist in:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(c)(i)(A): a state, district, or territory of the United States, other than Utah; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(c)(i)(B): a country other than the United States; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(c)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(c)(ii)(A): teaching, demonstrating, or providing physical therapy in connection with an educational seminar, if the person engages in this conduct in Utah no more than 60 days per calendar year;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(c)(ii)(B): practicing physical therapy directly related to the person's employment with, or contract with, an established athletic team, athletic organization, or performing arts company that plays, practices, competes, or performs in Utah no more than 60 days per calendar year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(c)(ii)(C): providing consultation by telecommunication to a physical therapist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(d): (1)(d)(ii)(A); (1)(c)(ii) the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(d)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(d)(i)(A): is licensed as a physical therapist assistant under federal law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(d)(i)(B): practices within the scope of practice authorized by federal law for a physical therapist assistant; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(d)(ii): (1)(d)(ii)(A); (1)(c)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(d)(ii)(A): is licensed as a physical therapist assistant in:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(d)(ii)(A)(I): a state, district, or territory of the United States, other than Utah; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(d)(ii)(A)(II): a country other than the United States; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(d)(ii)(B): (1)(d)(ii)(A); (1)(c)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(d)(ii)(B)(I): (1)(d)(ii)(A) practices within the scope of practice authorized for a physical therapist assistant by the jurisdiction described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(d)(ii)(B)(II): (1)(c)(ii) within the limitations for the practice of physical therapy described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(e): Title 58, Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 73, Chiropractic Physician Practice Act the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(e)(i): Title 58, Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act is a physician, licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(e)(ii): Title 58, Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act is a physician, licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(1)(e)(iii): Title 58, Chapter 73, Chiropractic Physician Practice Act is a chiropractic physician, licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(2): (1)(b) A person who is exempted from licensure under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(2)(a): is authorized to practice animal physical therapy under federal law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(2)(b): practices animal physical therapy within the scope of practice authorized by federal law.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(3): (1)(c); (3)(a); (1)(c)(ii) A person who is exempted from licensure under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(3)(a): is authorized to practice animal physical therapy in:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(3)(a)(i): a state, district, or territory of the United States, other than Utah; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(3)(a)(ii): a country other than the United States; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(3)(b): (3)(a); (1)(c)(ii) practices animal physical therapy:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(3)(b)(i): (3)(a) within the scope of practice for the jurisdiction described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-304(3)(b)(ii): (1)(c)(ii) within the limitations for the practice of physical therapy described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-305 License denial -- Discipline -- Cease and desist order.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
In accordance with SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-24b-305(1): refuse to issue a license to an applicant;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-305(2): refuse to renew a license;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-305(3): revoke, suspend, or restrict a license;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-305(4): place a license on probation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-305(5): issue a public or private reprimand to a licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-305(6): issue a cease and desist order.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-401 Authority and ethical standards of a licensed physical therapist and licensed physical therapist assistant -- Function of a physical therapy aide.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-401(1): A licensed physical therapist:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-401(1)(a): is fully authorized to practice physical therapy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-401(1)(b): shall adhere to the standards of ethics described in:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-401(1)(b)(i): the American Physical Therapy Association's Code of Ethics and Guide for Professional Conduct; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-401(1)(b)(ii): rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-401(2): A licensed physical therapist assistant:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-401(2)(a): is authorized to practice physical therapy:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-401(2)(a)(i): under the on-site supervision or general supervision of a licensed physical therapist; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-401(2)(a)(ii): within the scope of practice of a licensed physical therapist assistant, as described in this chapter and by rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-401(2)(b): shall adhere to the standards of ethics described in:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-401(2)(b)(i): the American Physical Therapy Association's Code of Ethics and Guide for Professional Conduct; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-401(2)(b)(ii): rule; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-401(2)(c): may not be supervised by any person other than a licensed physical therapist.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-401(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-401(3)(a): A physical therapy aide may not engage in the practice of physical therapy.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-401(3)(b): (3)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-401(3)(b)(i): a licensed physical therapist while the licensed physical therapist engages in the practice of physical therapy, if the physical therapy aide is under the on-site supervision of the licensed physical therapist; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-401(3)(b)(ii): a licensed physical therapist assistant while the licensed physical therapist assistant engages in the practice of physical therapy, within the scope of the licensed physical therapist assistant's license, if the physical therapy aide is:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-401(3)(b)(ii)(A): under the general or on-site supervision of a licensed physical therapist; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-401(3)(b)(ii)(B): under the on-site supervision of the licensed physical therapist assistant.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-402 Patient care and management.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-402(1): In practicing physical therapy, a licensed physical therapist shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-402(1)(a): manage all aspects of the physical therapy of a patient under the licensed physical therapist's care;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-402(1)(b): perform the initial evaluation and documentation for each patient;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-402(1)(c): perform periodic reevaluation and documentation for each patient;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-402(1)(d): perform physical therapy interventions that require immediate and continuous examination and evaluation throughout the intervention;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-402(1)(e): perform all therapeutic intervention on a patient that is outside of the standard scope of practice of a licensed physical therapist assistant or a physical therapy aide;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-402(1)(f): determine the therapeutic intervention to be performed by a licensed physical therapist assistant under the on-site supervision or general supervision of the licensed physical therapist to ensure that the therapeutic intervention is safe, effective, efficient, and within the scope of practice of the licensed physical therapist assistant;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-402(1)(g): conduct the discharge of each patient and document for each patient, at the time of discharge, the patient's response to therapeutic intervention; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-402(1)(h): provide accurate documentation of the billing and services provided.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-402(2): A physical therapist assistant or a physical therapy aide may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-402(2)(a): perform a physical therapy evaluation or assessment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-402(2)(b): identify or label a physical impairment or injury;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-402(2)(c): design a plan of care for a patient;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-402(2)(d): perform the joint mobilization component of manual therapy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-402(2)(e): perform the sharp selective debridement component of wound management.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-402(3): (2)(d) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-402(3)(a): simple joint distraction techniques or stretching; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-402(3)(b): a stretch or mobilization that can be given as part of a home exercise program.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-403 Administration of a prescription drug.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-403(1): A licensed physical therapist may purchase, store, and administer topical and aerosol medications that require a prescription only as provided in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-403(2): A licensed physical therapist may purchase, store, and administer:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-403(2)(a): topically applied medicinal agents, including steroids and analgesics, for wound care and for musculoskeletal treatment, using iontophoresis or phonorphoresis; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-403(2)(b): aerosols for pulmonary hygiene in an institutional setting, if a licensed respiratory therapist is not available in, or within a 10 mile radius of, the institution.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-403(3): A licensed physical therapist may only purchase, store, or administer a medication described in this section pursuant to a written prescription issued by a practitioner who is licensed to prescribe that medication.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-403(4): This section does not authorize a licensed physical therapist to dispense a prescription drug.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-404 Supervision of a licensed physical therapist assistant or a physical therapy aide.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The division shall make rules that describe the circumstances under which general supervision or on-site supervision of a physical therapist assistant or a physical therapy aide is required.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-405 Animal physical therapy.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-405(1): 58-28-307(12)(b) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-405(1)(a): 50 hours of on-the-job training under the supervision of a licensed veterinarian;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-405(1)(b): completion of a quadruped anatomy course; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-405(1)(c): continuing education for the required hours remaining.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-405(2): 58-28-307(12)(b); (1) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-405(2)(a): (1) is under the on-site supervision or general supervision of a physical therapist who has complied with the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-405(2)(b): completes at least 100 hours of animal physical therapy training and education, which shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-405(2)(b)(i): 50 hours of on-the-job training under the supervision of a licensed veterinarian;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-405(2)(b)(ii): completion of a quadruped anatomy course; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-405(2)(b)(iii): continuing education for the required hours remaining.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-501 Unlawful conduct.
--------------------------------------------------
In addition to the conduct described in SubsectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-24b-501(1): 58-24b-304 practicing physical therapy, unless the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-501(1)(a): is licensed under this chapter to practice physical therapy and practices within the scope of that license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-501(1)(b): 58-24b-304 is exempt from licensure under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-501(2): 58-24b-405; 58-24b-304(1)(a); (2); (3) practicing animal physical therapy, unless the person is:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-501(2)(a): 58-24b-405 authorized to practice animal physical therapy under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-501(2)(b): 58-24b-304(1)(a); (2); (3) authorized to practice animal physical therapy under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-501(3): 58-24b-304 representing oneself as, or using the title of, a physical therapist, unless the person is:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-501(3)(a): a licensed physical therapist; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-501(3)(b): 58-24b-304
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-501(3)(b)(i): licensed as a physical therapist in a jurisdiction other than Utah;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-501(3)(b)(ii): does not represent oneself as being a physical therapist licensed in Utah; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-501(3)(b)(iii): 58-24b-304 exempt from licensure under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-501(4): 58-24b-304 representing oneself as, or using the title of, a physical therapist assistant, unless the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-501(4)(a): is a licensed physical therapist assistant; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-501(4)(b): 58-24b-304
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-501(4)(b)(i): is licensed as a physical therapist assistant in a jurisdiction other than Utah;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-501(4)(b)(ii): does not represent oneself as being a physical therapist assistant licensed in Utah; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-501(4)(b)(iii): 58-24b-304 is exempt from licensure under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-501(5): conduct designated as "unlawful conduct" by the division, by rule.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-502 Unprofessional conduct.
--------------------------------------------------------
In addition to the conduct described in SubsectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-24b-502(1): using or employing the services of an individual to assist a person licensed under this chapter in a manner that is not in accordance with:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-502(1)(a): generally recognized practices, standards, or ethics of the profession for which the person is licensed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-502(1)(b): the requirements of this chapter or rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-502(2): failure by a person licensed under this chapter to confine the person's conduct to that which:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-502(2)(a): the person is competent to perform, by education, training, and experience; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-502(2)(b): is within the scope of practice permitted under this chapter or rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-502(3): failure to supervise a licensed physical therapist assistant or a physical therapy aide in accordance with the requirements of this chapter or rule; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-502(4): other conduct defined as "unprofessional conduct" by the division, by rule.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503 Lawful and unlawful use of titles and terms -- Unlawful advertising or promotion.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(1): A person who is a licensed physical therapist shall use the letters "PT" in connection with the person's name or business in order to indicate that the person is a licensed physical therapist.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(2): A person who is a licensed physical therapist assistant shall use the letters "PTA" in connection with the person's name or business in order to indicate that the person is a licensed physical therapist assistant.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(3): 58-24b-304(1)(e) It is unlawful for a person who is not a licensed physical therapist, a licensed physical therapist assistant, or a person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(3)(a): use, in connection with the person's name or business, any of the following words or abbreviations:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(3)(a)(i): physical therapy, except to the extent that the word is used to describe conduct that a person is licensed to engage in under another law of the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(3)(a)(ii): physiotherapy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(3)(a)(iii): any other word, abbreviation, or insignia, indicating or implying, directly or indirectly, that the person practices physical therapy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(3)(b): offer, provide, or bill a person for:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(3)(b)(i): physical therapy services or anything that is characterized as physical therapy services; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(3)(b)(ii): physiotherapy services or anything that is characterized as physiotherapy services.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(4): (6) It is unlawful for a person who is not a licensed physical therapist to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(4)(a): (6) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(4)(a)(i): physical therapist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(4)(a)(ii): physiotherapist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(4)(a)(iii): PT;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(4)(a)(iv): DPT;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(4)(a)(v): MPT; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(4)(a)(vi): any other word, abbreviation, or insignia, indicating or implying, directly or indirectly, that the person is a physical therapist or physiotherapist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(4)(b): advertise that a person who is not a licensed physical therapist is a physical therapist or physiotherapist; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(4)(c): promote a person who is not a licensed physical therapist as a physical therapist or physiotherapist.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(5): It is unlawful for a person who is not a licensed physical therapist assistant to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(5)(a): use, in connection with the person's name or business, any of the following words or abbreviations:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(5)(a)(i): physical therapist assistant;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(5)(a)(ii): physiotherapist assistant;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(5)(a)(iii): PTA; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(5)(a)(iv): any other word, abbreviation, or insignia, indicating or implying, directly or indirectly, that the person is a physical therapist assistant or a physiotherapist assistant;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(5)(b): advertise that a person who is not a licensed physical therapist assistant is a physical therapist assistant or a physiotherapist assistant; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(5)(c): promote a person who is not a licensed physical therapist assistant as a physical therapist assistant or physiotherapist assistant.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-503(6): (4)(a); (4)(a) Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-504 Reporting unlawful or unprofessional conduct -- Immunity -- Confidentiality.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-504(1): A person who is aware that a person who is licensed under this chapter has violated a provision of this chapter, or a rule made pursuant to this chapter, shall report the violation to the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-504(2): (1) A person who makes a good faith report under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-504(3): The division, the board, or a member of the division or the board, may not disclose the identity of a person who makes a report under this section, unless the disclosure is:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-504(3)(a): essential to the conduct of an investigation or hearing; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-504(3)(b): ordered by a court of competent jurisdiction.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-505 Trigger point dry needling -- Experience required -- Registration.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-505(1): (1)(b) A physical therapist may practice trigger point dry needling if the physical therapist:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-505(1)(a): has held a license to practice physical therapy under this chapter, and has actively practiced physical therapy, for two years;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-505(1)(b): has successfully completed a course in trigger point dry needling that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-505(1)(b)(i): is approved by the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-505(1)(b)(ii): includes at least 300 total course hours, including at least:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-505(1)(b)(ii)(A): 54 hours of in-person instruction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-505(1)(b)(ii)(B): 250 supervised patient treatment sessions;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-505(1)(c): (1)(b) files a certificate of completion of the course described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-505(1)(d): registers with the division as a trigger point dry needling practitioner; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-505(1)(e): meets any other requirement to practice trigger point dry needling established by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-505(2): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(b); (1)(e) The division shall make rules, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-505(2)(a): (1)(b) the criteria for approving a course described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-505(2)(b): (1)(e) the requirements described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-24b-505(3): 63J-1-504; (1)(d) The division may charge, in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-24c-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Physical Therapy Licensure Compact."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-24c-104 Physical therapy licensing board.
