As used in the compact, with reference to this state, "physical therapy licensing board" or "licensing board" means the physical therapy licensing board created in Section

Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 26a - Certified Public Accountant Licensing Act
****************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Certified Public Accountant Licensing Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(1): "Accounting experience" means applying accounting and auditing skills and principles that are taught as a part of the professional education qualifying a person for licensure under this chapter and generally accepted by the profession, under the supervision of a licensed certified public accountant.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(2): "AICPA" means the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(3): (3)(a)(iii); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(3)(a): (3)(a)(iii) "Attest and attestation engagement" means providing any or all of the following financial statement services:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(3)(a)(i): an audit or other engagement to be performed in accordance with the Statements on Auditing Standards (SAS);
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(3)(a)(ii): a review of a financial statement to be performed in accordance with the Statements on Standards for Accounting and Review Services (SSARS);
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(3)(a)(iii): an examination of prospective financial information to be performed in accordance with the Statements on Standards for Attestation Engagements (SSAE);
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(3)(a)(iv): (3)(a)(iii) an examination, review, or agreed upon procedures engagement to be performed in accordance with the Statements on Standards for Attestation Engagements (SSAE), other than an examination described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(3)(a)(v): an engagement to be performed in accordance with the standards of the PCAOB.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(3)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The standards specified in this definition shall be adopted by reference by the division under its rulemaking authority in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(4): 58-26a-201 "Board" means the Utah Board of Accountancy created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(5): "Certified Public Accountant" or "CPA" means an individual currently licensed by this state or any other state, district, or territory of the United States of America to practice public accountancy or who has been granted a license as a certified public accountant under prior law or this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(6): "Certified Public Accountant firm" or "CPA firm" means a qualified business entity holding a valid registration as a Certified Public Accountant firm under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(7): "Client" means the person who retains a licensee for the performance of one or more of the services included in the definition of the practice of public accountancy.  "Client" does not include a CPA's employer when the licensee works in a salaried or hourly rate position.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(8): "Compilation" means providing a service to be performed in accordance with Statements on Standards for Accounting and Review Services (SSARS) that is presenting, in the form of financial statements, information that is the representation of management or owners, without undertaking to express any assurance on the statements.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(9): "Experience" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(9)(a): accounting experience; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(9)(b): professional experience.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(10): "Licensee" means the holder of a current valid license issued under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(11): "NASBA" means the National Association of State Boards of Accountancy.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(12): "PCAOB" means the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(13): "Practice of public accounting" means, while holding oneself out as a certified public accountant, offering to perform or performing one or more kinds of services involving the use of auditing or accounting skills, including issuing reports or opinions on financial statements, performing attestation engagements, performing one or more kinds of advisory or consulting services, preparing tax returns, or furnishing advice on tax matters for a client.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(14): "Peer review" means a board approved study, appraisal, or review of one or more aspects of the attest and compilation services rendered by a licensee in the practice of public accounting, performed by a licensee holding an active license in this or another state who is not affiliated with the licensee being reviewed.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(15): "Principal place of business" means the office location designated by the licensee for purposes of substantial equivalency and licensure by endorsement.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(16): "Professional experience" means experience lawfully obtained while licensed as a certified public accountant in another state, recognized by rule, in the practice of public accountancy performed for a client, which includes expression of assurance or opinion.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(17): "Qualified business entity" means a sole proprietorship, corporation, limited liability company, or partnership engaged in the practice of public accountancy.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(18): "Qualified continuing professional education" means a formal program of education that contributes directly to the professional competence of a certified public accountant.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(19): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Qualifying examinations" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(19)(a): the AICPA Uniform CPA Examination;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(19)(b): the AICPA Examination of Professional Ethics for CPAs;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(19)(c): the Utah Laws and Rules Examination; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(19)(d): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act any other examination approved by the board and adopted by the division by rule in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(20): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(20)(a): "Report," when used with reference to financial statements, means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(20)(a)(i): an opinion, report, or other form of language that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(20)(a)(i)(A): states or implies assurance as to the reliability of the attested information or compiled financial statements; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(20)(a)(i)(B): implies that the person or firm issuing the report has special knowledge or competence in accounting or auditing and specifically includes compilations and reviews; such an implication of special knowledge or competence may arise from use by the issuer of the report of names or titles indicating that the person or firm is a public accountant or auditor, or from the language of the report itself; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(20)(a)(ii): any disclaimer of opinion when it is conventionally understood to imply any positive assurance as to the reliability of the attested information or compiled financial statements referred to or language suggesting special competence on the part of the person or firm issuing such language; and the report includes any other form of language that is conventionally understood to imply such assurance or such special knowledge or competence.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(20)(b): "Report" does not include a financial statement prepared by an unlicensed person if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(20)(b)(i): that financial statement has a cover page which includes essentially the following language: "I (we) have prepared the accompanying financial statements of (name of entity) as of (time period) for the (period) then ended.  This presentation is limited to preparing, in the form of financial statements, information that is the representation of management (owners).  I (we) have not audited or reviewed the accompanying financial statements and accordingly do not express an opinion or any other form of assurance on them."; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(20)(b)(ii): the cover page and any related footnotes do not use the terms "compilation," "review," "audit," "generally accepted auditing standards," "generally accepted accounting principles," or other similar terms.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(21): "Review of financial statements" means providing a service in accordance with the Statements on Standards for Accounting and Review Services (SSARS) in which the accountant obtains limited assurance as a basis for reporting whether the accountant is aware of any material modifications that should be made to the financial statements for them to be in accordance with the applicable financial reporting framework, primarily through the performance of inquiry and analytical procedures.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(22): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(22)(a): "Substantial equivalency" means a determination by the division in collaboration with the board or the board's designee that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(22)(a)(i): the education, examination, and experience requirements set forth in the statutes and administrative rules of another state are comparable to or exceed the education, examination, and experience requirements set forth in the Uniform Accountancy Act; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(22)(a)(ii): an individual CPA's education, examination, and experience qualifications are comparable to or exceed the education, examination, and experience requirements set forth in the Uniform Accountancy Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(22)(b): In ascertaining whether an individual's qualifications are substantially equivalent as used in this chapter, the division in collaboration with the board shall take into account the qualifications without regard to the sequence in which the education, examination, and experience requirements were attained.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(23): "Uniform Accountancy Act" means the model public accountancy legislation developed and promulgated by national accounting and regulatory associations that contains standardized definitions and regulations for the practice of public accounting as recognized by the division in collaboration with the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(24): 58-1-501; 58-26a-501 "Unlawful conduct" is as defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(25): 58-1-501; 58-26a-502 "Unprofessional conduct" is as defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(26): "Year of experience" means 2,000 hours of experience:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(26)(a): generally accepted by the profession; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-102(26)(b): under the supervision of a licensed certified public accountant.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-201 Board.
---------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-201(1): There is created the Utah Board of Accountancy consisting of four licensed certified public accountants and one member of the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-201(2): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed and shall serve in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-201(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203 The duties and responsibilities of the board shall be in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-201(3)(a): assist the division in reviewing complaints concerning the unlawful or unprofessional conduct of a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-201(3)(b): advise the division in its investigation of these complaints.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-201(4): (3) A board member who has, under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-301(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-301(2)(a): The division shall issue to an individual who qualifies under this chapter a license in the classification of Certified Public Accountant.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-301(2)(b): The division shall issue to a qualified business entity which qualifies under this chapter a registration in the classification of Certified Public Accountant Firm.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-302 Qualifications for licensure and registration -- Licensure by endorsement.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-302(1): 63J-1-504; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 58-26a-306 Each applicant for licensure under this chapter as a certified public accountant shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-302(1)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-302(1)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-302(1)(c)(i): successful completion of a total of 150 semester hours or 225 quarter hours of collegiate level education with a concentration in accounting, auditing, and business;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-302(1)(c)(ii): a baccalaureate degree or its equivalent at a college or university approved by the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-302(1)(c)(iii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act compliance with any other education requirements established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-302(1)(d): submit evidence of one year of accounting experience in a form prescribed by the division;

Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-302(1)(f): submit to an interview by the board, if requested, for the purpose of examining the applicant's competence and qualifications for licensure.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-302(2)(a)(iv)(B): (1) shows evidence that the applicant's education, examination record, and experience are substantially equivalent to the requirements of Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-303 Term of license and registration -- Expiration -- Renewal.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-303(1): The division shall issue each license and registration under this chapter in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.  The division may by rule extend or shorten a renewal cycle by as much as one year to stagger the renewal cycles it administers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-303(2): 58-26a-304 At the time of renewal a licensee shall show satisfactory evidence of each of the following renewal requirements:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-303(2)(a): 58-26a-304 completion of qualified continuing education as required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-303(2)(b): successful completion of a peer review meeting the requirements established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-303(3): 58-1-308 Each license or registration automatically expires on the date shown on the license or registration unless it is renewed in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-304 Continuing education.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-304(1): (2); (4) Except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-304(2): 58-26a-302(2); (2)(a); (1) A person practicing as a certified public accountant in the state under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-304(2)(a): meeting the continuing professional education requirements for license renewal in the state in which the licensee's principal place of business is located;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-304(2)(b): (2)(a) demonstrating compliance with the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-304(2)(c): (1) complying with all continuing professional education requirements described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-304(2)(d): completing at least one hour of continuing professional education that covers:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-304(2)(d)(i): this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-304(2)(d)(ii): Utah Administrative Code, R156-26a, Utah Certified Public Accountant Licensing Act Rule; and
