Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-304(4)(c): A licensee who is granted a waiver under this section shall complete 30 hours of continuing professional education within the six months immediately following the expiration of the waiver that includes at least 16 hours of continuing professional education focusing on auditing and accounting.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305 Exemptions from licensure.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(1): 58-1-307; 58-26a-302(1)(c)(i); (1)(a) In addition to the exemptions from licensure in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(1)(a): 58-26a-302(1)(c)(i) a person licensed by any other state, district, or territory of the United States as a certified public accountant or its equivalent under any other title while practicing in this state if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(1)(a)(i): 58-26a-302(1)(c)(i) the person's principal place of business is not in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(1)(a)(i)(A): the person's license as a certified public accountant is from any state which the National Association of State Boards of Accountancy (NASBA) National Qualification Appraisal Service has verified to be substantially equivalent to the CPA licensure requirements of the Uniform Accountancy Act; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(1)(a)(i)(B): 58-26a-302(1)(c)(i) the person's license as a certified public accountant is from a state which the NASBA National Qualification Appraisal Service has not verified to be substantially equivalent to the CPA licensure requirements of the Uniform Accountancy Act and the person obtains from the NASBA National Qualification Appraisal Service verification that the person's CPA qualifications are substantially equivalent to the CPA licensure requirements of the Uniform Accountancy Act and Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(1)(a)(ii): the person consents, as a condition of the grant of this privilege:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(1)(a)(ii)(A): to personal and subject matter jurisdiction and disciplinary authority of the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(1)(a)(ii)(B): to comply with this chapter and the rules made under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(1)(a)(ii)(C): that in the event the license from the state of the person's principal place of business becomes invalid, the person shall cease offering or rendering professional services in this state both individually and on behalf of the firm; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(1)(a)(ii)(D): to the appointment of the state board which issued the person's license as the person's agent upon whom process may be served in an action or proceeding brought by the division against the licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(1)(b): (1)(a) through December 31, 2012, a person licensed by any other state, district, or territory of the United States as a certified public accountant or its equivalent under another title while practicing in this state if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(1)(b)(i): (1)(a) the person does not qualify for a practice privilege under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(1)(b)(ii): the practice is incidental to the person's regular practice outside of this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(1)(b)(iii): the person's temporary practice within the state is in conformity with this chapter and the rules established under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(1)(c): an officer, member, partner, or employee of any entity or organization who signs any statement or report in reference to the financial affairs of the entity or organization with a designation of that person's position within the entity or organization;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(1)(d): a public official or employee while performing his official duties;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(1)(e): a person using accounting or auditing skills, including the preparation of tax returns, management advisory services, and the preparation of financial statements without the issuance of reports; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(1)(f): an employee of a CPA firm registered under this chapter or an assistant to a person licensed under this chapter, working under the supervision of a licensee, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(1)(f)(i): neither the employee or assistant nor the licensed employer or registered CPA firm represents that the unlicensed person is a certified public accountant; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(1)(f)(ii): no accounting or financial statements are issued over the unlicensed person's name.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(2): (1)(a); (1)(a); (b); 58-1-401(2)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(2)(a): (1)(a) Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a person who qualifies under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-305(2)(b): (1)(a); (b); 58-1-401(2) The division may revoke, suspend, or restrict an exemption granted under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-306 Examination requirements.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-306(1): 63J-1-504; 58-26a-302(1)(c) Before taking the qualifying examinations, an applicant shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-306(1)(a): submit an application in a form approved by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-306(1)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-306(1)(c): 58-26a-302(1)(c) demonstrate completion of at least 120 semester hours or 180 quarter hours of the education requirement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-306(1)(d): be approved by the board, or an organization designated by the board, to take the qualifying examinations.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-306(2): A person must sit for and meet the conditioning requirements of the AICPA Uniform CPA Examination as established by the AICPA.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-307 CPA emeritus status -- Renewal of license.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-307(1): 63J-1-504 A person currently licensed as a certified public accountant may, on any renewal date of that license, apply for and obtain a transfer of that license to a status of CPA emeritus registration if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-307(1)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-307(1)(a)(i): the licensee is at least 60 years of age as of the date of renewal;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-307(1)(a)(ii): the licensee has a disability; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-307(1)(a)(iii): the board finds other good cause for believing that the licensee will not return to the practice of public accountancy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-307(1)(b): 63J-1-504 the licensee makes an application for transfer of status and registration and pays a registration fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-307(1)(c): the licensee, on application for transfer, certifies that the licensee will not engage in the practice of public accountancy while in the status of CPA emeritus registration; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-307(1)(d): the licensee is in good standing as a CPA and not subject to any order of revocation, suspension, or probation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-307(2): Each CPA emeritus registration shall be issued in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-307(3): CPA emeritus registrants may not engage in the practice of public accountancy.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-307(4): CPA emeritus registrants are not required to fulfill the continuing professional education or peer review provisions of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-307(5): 58-1-308 Each CPA emeritus registrant is responsible for renewing the registration, according to procedures that the division establishes by rule in collaboration with the board in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-307(6): 63J-1-504 A CPA emeritus registrant may reinstate the CPA license by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-307(6)(a): submitting an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-307(6)(b): 63J-1-504 paying a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-307(6)(c): showing evidence of having completed the continuing professional education requirement established by rule.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-401 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for refusing to issue a license to an applicant, for refusing to renew the license of a licensee, for revoking, suspending, restricting, or placing on probation the license of a licensee, for issuing a public or private reprimand to a licensee, and for issuing a cease and desist order shall be in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-501 Unlawful conduct.
--------------------------------------------------
"Unlawful conduct" includes:Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-501(1): 58-26a-305(1)(a) using "certified public accountant," "public accountant," "CPA," or any other title, designation, words, letters, abbreviation, sign, card, or device tending to indicate that the person is a certified public accountant, unless that person:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-501(1)(a): has a current license as a certified public accountant issued under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-501(1)(b): 58-26a-305(1)(a) qualifies for a practice privilege as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-501(2): 58-26a-302(3)(a)(iii); (iv) a firm assuming or using "certified public accountant," "CPA," or any other title, designation, words, letters, abbreviation, sign, card, or device tending to indicate that the firm is composed of certified public accountants unless each office of the firm in this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-501(2)(a): is registered with the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-501(2)(b): 58-26a-302(3)(a)(iii); (iv) meets the requirements of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-501(3): signing or affixing to any accounting or financial statement the person's name or any trade or assumed name used in that person's profession or business, with any wording indicating that the person is an auditor, or with any wording indicating that the person has expert knowledge in accounting or auditing, unless that person is licensed under this chapter and all of the person's offices in this state for the practice of public accountancy are maintained and registered as provided in this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-501(4): 58-26a-305 except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-501(4)(a): issuing a report on financial statements of any other person, firm, organization, or governmental unit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-501(4)(b): issuing a report using any form of language substantially similar to conventional language used by licensees respecting:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-501(4)(b)(i): a review of financial statements; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-501(4)(b)(ii): a compilation of financial statements.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502 Unprofessional conduct.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(1): "Unprofessional conduct" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(1)(a): undertaking an engagement when the licensee knows or should know that the licensee could not reasonably expect to complete it with professional competence;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(1)(b): making unauthorized disclosures of confidential information obtained in the practice of public accountancy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(1)(c): engaging in any business or activity that creates a conflict of interest with a licensee's practice in the profession when the licensee knows or should know that it is a conflict of interest and the licensee does not fully disclose the conflict of interest in writing to all affected parties;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(1)(d): failing to meet the requirements for continuing professional education or peer review required under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(1)(e): issuing a report on financial statements of a client, other than a report in which a lack of independence is disclosed, or performing an attest engagement subject to the attestation standards of the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants when the licensee is not independent, in fact and appearance, to the client.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(2): (2)(a); (2)(a); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(2)(a): A licensee may not, for a commission, recommend or refer to a client a product or service, or for a commission recommend or refer a product or service to be supplied by a client, or receive a commission, when the licensee also performs for that client:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(2)(a)(i): an audit or review of a financial statement;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(2)(a)(ii): a compilation of a financial statement when the licensee expects, or reasonably might expect, that a third party will use the financial statement and the licensee's compilation report does not disclose a lack of independence; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(2)(a)(iii): an examination of prospective financial information.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(2)(b): (2)(a); (2)(a) The prohibition under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(2)(b)(i): (2)(a) the period in which the licensee is engaged to perform any of the services listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(2)(b)(ii): the period covered by any historical financial statements involved in any such listed services.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(2)(c): (2)(a) A licensee who is not prohibited under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(2)(d): A licensee who accepts a referral fee for recommending or referring a service of a licensee to a person or entity or who pays a referral fee to obtain a client shall disclose the acceptance or payment to the client.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(3): (3)(a); (3)(a); (3)(d); (e); (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(3)(a): A licensee may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(3)(a)(i): perform for a contingent fee a professional service for, or receive a contingent fee from a client for whom the licensee or the licensee's firm performs:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(3)(a)(i)(A): an audit or review of a financial statement;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(3)(a)(i)(B): a compilation of a financial statement when the licensee expects, or reasonably might expect, that a third party will use the financial statement and the licensee's compilation report does not disclose a lack of independence; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(3)(a)(i)(C): an examination of prospective financial information; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(3)(a)(ii): prepare an original or amended tax return or claim for a tax refund for a contingent fee for a client.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(3)(b): (3)(a); (3)(a) The prohibition in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(3)(b)(i): (3)(a) the period in which the licensee is engaged to perform any of the services listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(3)(b)(ii): the period covered by any historical financial statements involved in the listed services.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(3)(c): (3)(d); (e) Except as stated in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(3)(d): (3) Solely for the purposes of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-502(3)(e): A licensee's fee may vary depending, for example, on the complexity of service rendered.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-601 Ownership of statements, records, schedules, working papers, and memoranda made by licensee.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-601(1): All statements, records, schedules, working papers, and memoranda made by a licensee under this chapter, incident to or in the course of professional service to a client, are the property of the licensee, in the absence of any express agreement between the licensee and the client to the contrary.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-601(2): A licensee may not sell, trade, or bequeath statements, records, schedules, working papers, or memoranda without the consent of the client or the client's personal representative or assignee to anyone other than another licensee or one or more surviving partners or shareholders or new partners or shareholders of the licensee or any combined or merged CPA firm or successors-in-interest to the CPA firm.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-602 Privity.
-----------------------------------------
A licensee, a CPA firm registered under this chapter, and any employee, partner, member, officer, or shareholder of a licensee or CPA firm are not liable to persons with whom they are not in privity of contract for civil damages resulting from acts, omissions, decisions, or other conduct in connection with professional services performed by that person, except for:Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-602(1): acts, omissions, decisions, or conduct that constitute fraud or intentional misrepresentations; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-602(2): other acts, omissions, decisions, or conduct, if the person performing the professional services:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-602(2)(a): knew that a primary intent of the client was for the professional services to benefit or influence the particular person seeking to establish liability; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-26a-602(2)(b): identified in writing to the client that the professional services performed on behalf of the client were intended to be relied upon by the particular person seeking to establish liability.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 28 - Veterinary Practice Act
*********************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-101 Short title.
--------------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Veterinary Practice Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(1): "Abandonment" means to forsake entirely or to refuse to provide care and support for an animal placed in the custody of a licensed veterinarian.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(2): "Administer" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(2)(a): the direct application by a person of a prescription drug or device by injection, inhalation, ingestion, or by any other means, to the body of an animal that is a patient or is a research subject; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(2)(b): a veterinarian providing to the owner or caretaker of an animal a prescription drug for application by injection, inhalation, ingestion, or any other means to the body of the animal by the owner or caretaker in accordance with the veterinarian's written directions.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(3): "Animal" means any animal other than a human.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(4): "AVMA" means American Veterinary Medical Association.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(5): 58-28-201 "Board" means the Veterinary Board established in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(6): "Client" means the patient's owner, the owner's agent, or other person responsible for the patient.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(7): "Direct supervision" means a veterinarian licensed under this chapter is present and available for face-to-face contact with the patient and person being supervised, at the time the patient is receiving veterinary care.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(8): "Extra-label use" means actual use or intended use of a drug in an animal in a manner that is not in accordance with approved labeling.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(9): "Immediate supervision" means the veterinarian licensed under this chapter is present with the individual being supervised, while the individual is performing the delegated tasks.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(10): "Indirect supervision" means a veterinarian licensed under this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(10)(a): has given either written or verbal instructions for veterinary care of a patient to the person being supervised; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(10)(b): is available to the person being supervised by telephone or other electronic means of communication during the period of time in which the veterinary care is given to the patient.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(11): "Practice of veterinary medicine, surgery, and dentistry" means to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(11)(a): diagnose, prognose, or treat any disease, defect, deformity, wound, injury, or physical condition of any animal;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(11)(b): administer, prescribe or dispense any drug, medicine, treatment, method, or practice, perform any operation or manipulation, apply any apparatus or appliance for the cure, relief, or correction of any animal disease, deformity, defect, wound, or injury, or otherwise practice any veterinary medicine, dentistry, or surgery on any animal;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(11)(c): represent by verbal or written claim, sign, word, title, letterhead, card, or any other manner that one is a licensed veterinarian or qualified to practice veterinary medicine, surgery, or dentistry;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(11)(d): hold oneself out as able to practice veterinary medicine, surgery, or dentistry;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(11)(e): solicit, sell, or furnish any parenterally administered animal disease cures, preventions, or treatments, with or without the necessary instruments for the  administration of them, or any and all worm and other internal parasitic remedies, upon any agreement, express or implied, to administer these cures, preventions, treatments, or remedies; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(11)(f): assume or use the title or designation, "veterinary," "veterinarian," "animal doctor," "animal surgeon," or any other title, designation, words, letters, abbreviations, sign, card, or device tending to indicate that such person is qualified to practice veterinary medicine, surgery, or dentistry.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(12): "Practice of veterinary technology" means to perform tasks that are:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(12)(a): related to the care and treatment of animals;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(12)(b): delegated by a veterinarian licensed under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(12)(c): performed under the direct or indirect supervision of a veterinarian licensed under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(12)(d): permitted by administrative rule and performed in accordance with the standards of the profession.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(13): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(13)(a): "State certification" means a designation granted by the division on behalf of the state to an individual who has met the requirements for state certification as a veterinary technician related to the practice of veterinary technology.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(13)(b): "State certification" does not grant a state certified veterinary technician the exclusive right to practice veterinary technology.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(14): "State certified" means, when used in conjunction with the occupation of veterinary technician, a title that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(14)(a): may be used by a person who has met state certification requirements related to the occupation of veterinary technician as described in this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(14)(b): may not be used by a person who has not met the state certification requirements related to the occupation of veterinary technician as described in this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(15): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(15)(a): "Teeth floating" means the removal of enamel points and the smoothing, contouring, and leveling of dental arcades and incisors of equine and other farm animals.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(15)(b): "Teeth floating" does not include a dental procedure on a canine or feline.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(16): 58-1-501; 58-28-501 "Unlawful conduct" is defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(17): "Unlicensed assistive personnel":
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(17)(a): means any unlicensed person, regardless of title, to whom tasks are delegated by a veterinarian licensed under this chapter as permitted by administrative rule and in accordance with the standards of the profession; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(17)(b): includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(17)(b)(i): a veterinary assistant, if working under immediate supervision;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(17)(b)(ii): a state certified veterinary technician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(17)(b)(iii): a veterinary technician who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(17)(b)(iii)(A): has graduated from a program of veterinary technology accredited by the AVMA that is at least a two-year program; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(17)(b)(iii)(B): is working under direct supervision; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(17)(b)(iv): a veterinary technologist who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(17)(b)(iv)(A): has graduated from a four-year program of veterinary technology accredited by the AVMA; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(17)(b)(iv)(B): is working under indirect supervision.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(18): 58-1-501; 58-28-502 "Unprofessional conduct" is as defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(19): "Veterinarian-client-patient relationship" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(19)(a): a veterinarian licensed under this chapter has assumed responsibility for making clinical judgements regarding the health of an animal and the need for medical treatment of an animal, and the client has agreed to follow the veterinarian's instructions;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(19)(b): the veterinarian has sufficient knowledge of the animal to initiate at least a general or preliminary diagnosis of the medical condition of the animal, including knowledge of the keeping and care of the animal as a result of recent personal examination of the animal or by medically appropriate visits to the premises where the animal is housed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-102(19)(c): the veterinarian has arranged for emergency coverage for follow-up evaluation in the event of adverse reaction or the failure of the treatment regimen.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-103 Rulemaking.
-------------------------------------------
When exercising rulemaking authority under this chapter, the division shall comply with the requirements of

Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-201 Veterinary Board created -- Duties.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-201(1): There is created a Veterinary Board consisting of four veterinarians who have practiced in the state for not less than five years and one member of the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-201(2): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed and serve in accordance with the provisions of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-201(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203 The duties and responsibilities of the board shall be in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-201(4): (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-201(4)(a): The board shall designate one of its members to assist and advise the division with reviewing complaints concerning unlawful or unprofessional conduct under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-201(4)(b): (4)(a) A board member shall be recused from any adjudicative proceeding held by the board concerning a complaint for which the board member advised the division under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-301 Licensure required.
---------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-301(1): 58-1-307; 58-28-307; 58-1-307(1)(c); 58-28-302(1)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-301(1)(a): 58-1-307; 58-28-307 A license is required to engage in the practice of veterinary medicine, except as specifically provided in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-301(1)(b): 58-1-307(1)(c); 58-28-302(1)(c) Notwithstanding the provisions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-301(2): The division shall issue to a person who qualifies under this chapter a license in the classification of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-301(2)(a): veterinarian; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-301(2)(b): veterinarian intern.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-302 License qualifications.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-302(1): (1)(c)(i); 63J-1-504 Every applicant for a license to practice veterinary medicine, surgery, and dentistry shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-302(1)(a): pass an examination approved by the board on the theory and practice of the science of veterinary medicine, surgery, dentistry, and other subjects determined by the board, knowledge of which is generally required of veterinarians;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-302(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-302(1)(b)(i): graduate from a veterinary college accredited by the AVMA; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-302(1)(b)(ii): obtain a certificate issued by the Educational Commission for Foreign Veterinary Graduates issued by the AVMA;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-302(1)(c): (1)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-302(1)(c)(i): have practiced under the supervision of a veterinarian licensed to practice in this state for a period of at least six months;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-302(1)(c)(ii): (1)(c)(i) have participated in veterinary investigational, educational, or sanitary control work of a nature and duration as to be the equivalent of the experience of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-302(1)(c)(iii): have practiced as a licensed veterinarian outside Utah for a period of at least six months; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-302(1)(c)(iv): have practiced as a veterinarian while employed by the United States government, its agencies, or the state or its political subdivisions for a period of at least six months; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-302(1)(d): 63J-1-504 pay a fee to the Department of Commerce determined in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-302(2): (1)(b); (1)(c); (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-302(2)(a): (1)(b) An applicant for licensure as a veterinary intern shall comply with the provisions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-302(2)(b): (1)(c); (2)(b) An applicant's license as a veterinary intern is limited to the period of time necessary to complete clinical training as described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-303 License -- Display -- Revocation for nondisplay or nonrenewal.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A licensed veterinarian shall display the veterinarian's license in a conspicuous place in the veterinarian's principal place of business.  The division may revoke any license which is not displayed in accordance with this section.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-304 Temporary license -- License reciprocity.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-304(1): 58-1-302; 58-28-302; 58-28-302(1)(a); (c) The division may issue a temporary license to practice veterinary medicine, surgery, and dentistry to any person not qualified for licensure under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-304(2): The temporary license shall permit the holder to practice under the indirect supervision of a veterinarian licensed to practice in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-304(3): The division may extend the expiration date of the temporary license until the following examination date if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-304(3)(a): the applicant shows to the board good cause for failing to take or pass the examination; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-304(3)(b): the majority of the board members recommend the extension.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-305 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-305(1): A license as a veterinarian issued under this chapter shall be issued in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.  A renewal period may be extended or shortened by as much as one year to maintain established renewal cycles or to change an established renewal cycle.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-305(2): 58-28-302(2)(b) A license as a veterinarian intern issued under this chapter shall be issued for a term established by the division by rule and consistent with the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-305(3): 58-1-308 Each license under this chapter automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless renewed by the licensee in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-306 Continuing education.
-----------------------------------------------------
The division may, by rule, in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307 Exemptions from chapter.
--------------------------------------------------------
In addition to the exemptions from licensure in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(1): an individual who practices veterinary medicine, surgery, or dentistry upon any animal owned by the individual, and the employee of that individual when the practice is upon an animal owned by the employee's employer, and incidental to employment, except:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(1)(a): this exemption does not apply to an individual, or the individual's employee, when the ownership of an animal was acquired for the purpose of circumventing this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(1)(b): this exemption does not apply to the administration, dispensing, or prescribing of a prescription drug, or nonprescription drug intended for off label use, unless the administration, dispensing, or prescribing of the drug is obtained through an existing veterinarian-patient relationship;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(2): an individual who as a student at a veterinary college approved by the board engages in the practice of veterinary medicine, surgery, and dentistry as part of the individual's academic training and under the direct supervision and control of a licensed veterinarian, if that practice is during the last two years of the college course of instruction and does not exceed an 18-month duration;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(3): a veterinarian who is an officer or employee of the government of the United States, or the state, or its political subdivisions, and technicians under the veterinarian's supervision, while engaged in the practice of veterinary medicine, surgery, or dentistry for that government;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(4): an individual while engaged in the vaccination of poultry, pullorum testing, typhoid testing of poultry, and related poultry disease control activity;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(5): an individual who is engaged in bona fide and legitimate medical, dental, pharmaceutical, or other scientific research, if that practice of veterinary medicine, surgery, or dentistry is directly related to, and a necessary part of, that research;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(6): a veterinarian licensed under the laws of another state rendering professional services in association with licensed veterinarians of this state for a period not to exceed 90 days;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(7): a registered pharmacist of this state engaged in the sale of veterinary supplies, instruments, and medicines, if the sale is at the registered pharmacist's regular place of business;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(8): an individual in this state engaged in the sale of veterinary supplies, instruments, and medicines, except prescription drugs which must be sold in compliance with state and federal regulations, if the supplies, instruments, and medicines are sold in original packages bearing adequate identification and directions for application and administration and the sale is made in the regular course of, and at the regular place of business;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(9): an individual rendering emergency first aid to animals in those areas where a licensed veterinarian is not available, and if suspicious reportable diseases are reported immediately to the state veterinarian;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(10): an individual performing or teaching nonsurgical bovine artificial insemination;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(11): an individual affiliated with an institution of higher education who teaches nonsurgical bovine embryo transfer or any technician trained by or approved by an institution of higher education who performs nonsurgical bovine embryo transfer, but only if any prescription drug used in the procedure is prescribed and administered under the direction of a veterinarian licensed to practice in Utah;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(12): Chapter 73, Chiropractic Physician Practice Act; Chapter 24b, Physical Therapy Practice Act; Chapter 47b, Massage Therapy Practice Act; Chapter 72, Acupuncture Licensing Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(12)(a): Chapter 73, Chiropractic Physician Practice Act the practice of animal chiropractic by a chiropractic physician licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(12)(b): Chapter 24b, Physical Therapy Practice Act upon written referral by a licensed veterinarian, the practice of animal physical therapy by a physical therapist licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(12)(c): Chapter 47b, Massage Therapy Practice Act upon written referral by a licensed veterinarian, the practice of animal massage therapy by a massage therapist licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(12)(d): Chapter 72, Acupuncture Licensing Act upon written referral by a licensed veterinarian, the practice of acupuncture by an acupuncturist licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(13): 58-28-502 unlicensed assistive personnel performing duties appropriately delegated to the unlicensed assistive personnel in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(14): an animal shelter employee who is:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(14)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(14)(a)(i): acting under the indirect supervision of a licensed veterinarian; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(14)(a)(ii): performing animal euthanasia in the course and scope of employment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(14)(b): acting under the indirect supervision of a veterinarian who is under contract with the animal shelter, administering a rabies vaccine to a shelter animal in accordance with the Compendium of Animal Rabies Prevention and Control;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(15): an individual providing appropriate training for animals; however, this exception does not include diagnosing any medical condition, or prescribing or dispensing any prescription drugs or therapeutics;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(16): 58-28-502(2)(a)(iv) an individual who performs teeth floating if the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(16)(a): has a valid certification from the International Association of Equine Dentistry, or an equivalent certification designated by division rule made in collaboration with the board, to perform teeth floating;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(16)(b): 58-28-502(2)(a)(iv) administers or uses a sedative drug only if the individual is under the direct supervision of a veterinarian in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(17): an individual testing a bovine for pregnancy if the individual has:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(17)(a): obtained a masters degree or higher in animal reproductive physiology; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-307(17)(b): completed at least eight hours of continuing education on animal reproductive physiology within the previous two-year period.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-308 Provisions for current practitioners.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
An individual who, as of August 1, 2006, is practicing as a veterinarian intern under supervision of a veterinarian licensed under this chapter shall receive a temporary license to practice in the state as a veterinary intern:Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-308(1): if, prior to August 1, 2006, the individual submits an application and any required fees to the division to obtain licensure under this chapter as a veterinary intern; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-308(2): while the application for licensure is pending with the division.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-309 Qualifications for state certification.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-309(1): The division shall grant state certification to a person who qualifies under this section to engage in the practice of veterinary technology as a state certified veterinary technician.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-309(2): 63J-1-504 Each applicant for state certification as a state certified veterinary technician shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-309(2)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division in consultation with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-309(2)(b): submit evidence of graduation from an AVMA-accredited program in veterinary technology that is at least two years, or an equivalent program as determined by division rule in consultation with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-309(2)(c): submit evidence of achieving a passing score, as determined by the division in consultation with the board, on the Veterinary Technician National Examination, or an equivalent examination as determined by division rule in consultation with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-309(2)(d): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-309(2)(e): provide satisfactory documentation that the applicant meets other criteria determined by division rule in consultation with the board.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-310 Term of state certification.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-310(1): The division shall grant state certification under this chapter in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established in rule by the division in consultation with the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-310(2): At the time of renewal, an applicant for renewal shall provide proof of completion of any continuing education requirements established by the division in consultation with the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-310(3): If a state certified veterinary technician is placed on probation, the state certification is expired, or if the division revokes or suspends the state certification for an individual, the individual shall cease:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-310(3)(a): using the title state certified veterinary technician in connection with the individual's name or business; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-310(3)(b): representing to others that the individual is a state certified veterinary technician.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-310(4): (3); 58-28-309 An individual whose certification ceases as described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-311 Limitation of state certification.
------------------------------------------------------------------
This chapter does not prevent a person from lawfully engaging in the practice of veterinary technology without state certification under the direct supervision of a veterinarian licensed under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-401 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for refusal to issue a license to an applicant, for refusal to renew the license of a licensee, to revoke, suspend, restrict, or place on probation the license of a licensee, to issue a public or private reprimand to a licensee, and to issue cease and desist orders shall be in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-501 Unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------
Unlawful conduct includes, in addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-28-501(1): fraudulently issuing or using any health certificate, inspection certificate, vaccination certificate, test chart, or any other certificate relating to the existence of animal diseases or the sale of animal products for human consumption;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-501(2): willfully misrepresenting any findings in the inspection of foodstuffs of animal origin;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-501(3): fraudulently misapplying or reporting any intradermal, cutaneous, subcutaneous, serological, or chemical test;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-501(4): for an individual who is not a state certified veterinary technician, using the title state certified veterinary technician, or representing that the individual is a state certified veterinary technician, in connection with the individual's name or business; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-501(5): for a state certified individual whose state certification is suspended, placed on probation, revoked, or has expired for any reason, using the title state certified veterinary technician in connection with the individual's name or business.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502 Unprofessional conduct.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(1): 58-1-501; Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act; (2) "Unprofessional conduct" includes, in addition to the definitions in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(1)(a): applying unsanitary methods or procedures in the treatment of any animal, contrary to rules adopted by the board and approved by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(1)(b): procuring any fee or recompense on the assurance that a manifestly incurable diseased condition of the body of an animal can be permanently cured;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(1)(c): selling any biologics containing living or dead organisms or products or such organisms, except in a manner which will prevent indiscriminate use of such biologics;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(1)(d): swearing falsely in any testimony or affidavit, relating to, or in the course of, the practice of veterinary medicine, surgery, or dentistry;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(1)(e): willful failure to report any dangerous, infectious, or contagious disease, as required by law;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(1)(f): willful failure to report the results of any medical tests, as required by law, or rule adopted pursuant to law;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(1)(g): Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act violating
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(1)(h): (2) delegating tasks to unlicensed assistive personnel in violation of standards of the profession and in violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(1)(i): making any unsubstantiated claim of superiority in training or skill as a veterinarian in the performance of professional services.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(2): 58-28-307(16); 4-41-102; 26B-4-201; (2)(a)(i); (v)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(2)(a): 58-28-307(16); 4-41-102; 26B-4-201 "Unprofessional conduct" does not include the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(2)(a)(i): delegating to a veterinary technologist, while under the indirect supervision of a veterinarian licensed under this chapter, patient care and treatment that requires a technical understanding of veterinary medicine if written or oral instructions are provided to the technologist by the veterinarian;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(2)(a)(ii): delegating to a state certified veterinary technician, while under the direct or indirect supervision of a veterinarian licensed under this chapter, patient care and treatment that requires a technical understanding of veterinary medicine if the veterinarian provides written or oral instructions to the state certified veterinary technician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(2)(a)(iii): delegating to a veterinary technician, while under the direct supervision of a veterinarian licensed under this chapter, patient care and treatment that requires a technical understanding of veterinary medicine if written or oral instructions are provided to the technician by the veterinarian;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(2)(a)(iv): delegating to a veterinary assistant, under the immediate supervision of a licensed veterinarian, tasks that are consistent with the standards and ethics of the profession;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(2)(a)(v): 58-28-307(16) delegating to an individual described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(2)(a)(vi): 4-41-102; 26B-4-201 discussing the effects of the following on an animal with the owner of an animal:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(2)(a)(vi)(A): 4-41-102 a cannabinoid or industrial hemp product, as those terms are defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(2)(a)(vi)(B): 26B-4-201 THC or medical cannabis, as those terms are defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(2)(b): (2)(a)(i); (v) The delegation of tasks permitted under Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(2)(b)(i): diagnosing;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(2)(b)(ii): prognosing;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(2)(b)(iii): surgery; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(2)(b)(iv): prescribing drugs, medicines, or appliances.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-502(3): (2)(a)(vi) Notwithstanding any provision of this section, a veterinarian licensed under this chapter is not prohibited from engaging in a discussion described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-503 Penalty for unlawful or unprofessional conduct.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-503(1): 58-28-501 Any person who violates the unlawful conduct provisions of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-503(2): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; Chapter 1, Division of Professional Licensing Act After proceeding pursuant to
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-503(3): Assessment of a penalty under this section does not affect any other action the division is authorized to take regarding a license issued under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-503(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-503(4)(a): The director may collect a penalty that is not paid by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-503(4)(a)(i): referring the matter to a collection agency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-503(4)(a)(ii): bringing an action in the district court of the county where the person against whom the penalty is imposed resides or in the county where the office of the director is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-503(4)(b): A county attorney or the attorney general of the state shall provide legal assistance and advice to the director in an action to collect a penalty.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-503(4)(c): A court shall award reasonable attorney fees and costs to the prevailing party in an action brought by the division to collect a penalty.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-601 Animal abandonment.
---------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-601(1): Any animal which suffers abandonment for a period of five days may be sold or placed in the custody of the nearest humane society or county dog pound if the animal is not picked up within seven days after mailing a notification, by certified mail, to the last known address of the person placing the animal in the veterinarian's custody.  If no humane society or dog pound is located in the county, the animal may be disposed of in a humane manner.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-601(2): A veterinarian who complies with this section is relieved from liability for the disposal or sale of abandoned animals.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-602 Cruelty to animals -- Immunity for reporting.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
A licensed veterinarian who in good faith and in the normal course of business, reports a suspected case of animal cruelty to law enforcement or the proper authorities is immune from liability in any civil or criminal action brought against the veterinarian for reporting the suspected cruelty.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-603 Medical records.
------------------------------------------------
Medical records maintained by a person licensed under this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-603(1): shall meet the standards and ethics of the profession;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-603(2): shall be maintained in accordance with administrative rules adopted by the division in consultation with the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-603(3): may be maintained in electronic format.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-604 Veterinarian-client-patient relationship.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-604(1): 58-28-102 A licensee under this chapter may only practice under a veterinarian-client-patient relationship as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-604(2): A veterinarian-client-patient relationship may not be established solely by telephone or other electronic means.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-605 Veterinarian-client-patient confidentiality.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-605(1): 58-28-102 A licensee under this chapter may not disclose information about the licensee's care of an animal to anyone other than the client, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-605(1)(a): the client consents to the disclosure in writing;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-605(1)(b): disclosure to public health officials, animal health or welfare officials, agricultural authorities, or federal, state, or local officials is required, or necessary to protect the animal or to protect public health;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-605(1)(c): disclosure is required by court order or subpoena; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-605(1)(d): the client has placed the veterinarian's care or treatment of the animal or the nature or extent of injuries to the animal at issue in a civil or criminal proceeding.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-605(2): A licensee who releases medical records under the provisions of this section is not liable to the client or any other person for the release of the records.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-606 Veterinary corporations, partnerships, and limited liability companies -- Unlicensed individuals -- Ownership of capital stock -- Service as officer or director.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-606(1): Title 16, Chapter 11, Professional Corporation Act; Title 48, Chapter 3a, Utah Revised Uniform Limited Liability Company Act; Title 48, Chapter 1d, Utah Uniform Partnership Act; Title 48, Chapter 2e, Utah Uniform Limited Partnership Act As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-606(1)(a): Title 16, Chapter 11, Professional Corporation Act "Veterinary corporation" means a professional corporation organized to render veterinary services under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-606(1)(b): Title 48, Chapter 3a, Utah Revised Uniform Limited Liability Company Act "Veterinary limited liability company" means a limited liability company organized to render veterinary services under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-606(1)(c): Title 48, Chapter 1d, Utah Uniform Partnership Act; Title 48, Chapter 2e, Utah Uniform Limited Partnership Act "Veterinary partnership" means a partnership or limited liability partnership organized to render veterinary services under:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-606(1)(c)(i): Title 48, Chapter 1d, Utah Uniform Partnership Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-606(1)(c)(ii): Title 48, Chapter 2e, Utah Uniform Limited Partnership Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-606(2): A veterinary corporation may issue or transfer shares of the veterinary corporation's capital stock to a person that is not licensed to practice veterinary medicine, surgery, and dentistry under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-606(3): An individual who is not licensed to practice veterinary medicine, surgery, and dentistry under this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-606(3)(a): may not serve as an officer or director of a veterinary corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-606(3)(b): may serve as secretary or treasurer of a veterinary corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-28-606(4): A veterinary limited liability company or a veterinary partnership may include an individual who is not licensed to practice veterinary medicine, surgery, and dentistry under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 31b - Nurse Practice Act
*****************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Nurse Practice Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(1): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act "Administrative penalty" means a monetary fine or citation imposed by the division for acts or omissions determined to be unprofessional or unlawful conduct in accordance with a fine schedule established by division rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(2): "Applicant" means an individual who applies for licensure or certification under this chapter by submitting a completed application for licensure or certification and the required fees to the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(3): "Approved education program" means a nursing education program that is accredited by an accrediting body for nursing education that is approved by the United States Department of Education.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(4): 58-31b-201 "Board" means the Board of Nursing created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(5): "Diagnosis" means the identification of and discrimination between physical and psychosocial signs and symptoms essential to the effective execution and management of health care.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(6): "Examinee" means an individual who applies to take or does take any examination required under this chapter for licensure.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(7): "Licensee" means an individual who is licensed or certified under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(8): Title 26B, Chapter 2, Part 2, Health Care Facility Licensing and Inspection "Long-term care facility" means any of the following facilities licensed by the Department of Health and Human Services pursuant to
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(8)(a): a nursing care facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(8)(b): a small health care facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(8)(c): an intermediate care facility for people with an intellectual disability;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(8)(d): an assisted living facility Type I or II; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(8)(e): a designated swing bed unit in a general hospital.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(9): "Medication aide certified" means a certified nurse aide who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(9)(a): has a minimum of 2,000 hours experience working as a certified nurse aide;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(9)(b): has received a minimum of 60 hours of classroom and 40 hours of practical training that is approved by the division in collaboration with the board, in administering routine medications to patients or residents of long-term care facilities; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(9)(c): is certified by the division as a medication aide certified.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(10): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(10)(a): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Practice as a medication aide certified" means the limited practice of nursing under the supervision, as defined by the division by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(10)(a)(i): is ill, injured, infirm, has a physical, mental, developmental, or intellectual disability; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(10)(a)(ii): is in a regulated long-term care facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(10)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Practice as a medication aide certified":
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(10)(b)(i): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(10)(b)(i)(A): providing direct personal assistance or care; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(10)(b)(i)(B): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act administering routine medications to patients in accordance with a formulary and protocols to be defined by the division by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(10)(b)(ii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act does not include assisting a resident of an assisted living facility, a long term care facility, or an intermediate care facility for people with an intellectual disability to self administer a medication, as regulated by the Department of Health and Human Services by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11): (11)(d); (11)(d) "Practice of advanced practice registered nursing" means the practice of nursing within the generally recognized scope and standards of advanced practice registered nursing as defined by rule and consistent with professionally recognized preparation and education standards of an advanced practice registered nurse by a person licensed under this chapter as an advanced practice registered nurse. "Practice of advanced practice registered nursing" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(a): maintenance and promotion of health and prevention of disease;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(b): diagnosis, treatment, correction, consultation, and referral;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(c): prescription or administration of prescription drugs or devices including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(c)(i): local anesthesia;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(c)(ii): Schedule III-V controlled substances; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(c)(iii): Schedule II controlled substances; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(d): (11)(d); (11)(d) the provision of preoperative, intraoperative, and postoperative anesthesia care and related services upon the request of a licensed health care professional by an advanced practice registered nurse specializing as a certified registered nurse anesthetist, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(d)(i): preanesthesia preparation and evaluation including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(d)(i)(A): performing a preanesthetic assessment of the patient;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(d)(i)(B): ordering and evaluating appropriate lab and other studies to determine the health of the patient; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(d)(i)(C): selecting, ordering, or administering appropriate medications;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(d)(ii): anesthesia induction, maintenance, and emergence, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(d)(ii)(A): selecting and initiating the planned anesthetic technique;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(d)(ii)(B): selecting and administering anesthetics and adjunct drugs and fluids; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(d)(ii)(C): administering general, regional, and local anesthesia;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(d)(iii): (11)(d) postanesthesia follow-up care, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(d)(iii)(A): evaluating the patient's response to anesthesia and implementing corrective actions; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(d)(iii)(B): (11)(d) selecting, ordering, or administering the medications and studies listed in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(d)(iv): other related services within the scope of practice of a certified registered nurse anesthetist, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(d)(iv)(A): emergency airway management;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(d)(iv)(B): advanced cardiac life support; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(d)(iv)(C): the establishment of peripheral, central, and arterial invasive lines; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(d)(v): (11)(d) for purposes of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(d)(v)(A): means a health care professional practicing within the scope of the health care professional's license, requests anesthesia services for a specific patient; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(11)(d)(v)(B): does not require an advanced practice registered nurse specializing as a certified registered nurse anesthetist to obtain additional authority to select, administer, or provide preoperative, intraoperative, or postoperative anesthesia care and services.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(12): (12)(g) "Practice of nursing" means assisting individuals or groups to maintain or attain optimal health, implementing a strategy of care to accomplish defined goals and evaluating responses to care and treatment, and requires substantial specialized or general knowledge, judgment, and skill based upon principles of the biological, physical, behavioral, and social sciences. "Practice of nursing" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(12)(a): initiating and maintaining comfort measures;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(12)(b): promoting and supporting human functions and responses;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(12)(c): establishing an environment conducive to well-being;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(12)(d): providing health counseling and teaching;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(12)(e): collaborating with health care professionals on aspects of the health care regimen;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(12)(f): performing delegated procedures only within the education, knowledge, judgment, and skill of the licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(12)(g): delegating nursing tasks that may be performed by others, including an unlicensed assistive personnel; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(12)(h): (12)(g) supervising an individual to whom a task is delegated under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(13): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (13); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Practice of practical nursing" means the performance of nursing acts in the generally recognized scope of practice of licensed practical nurses as defined by division rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(13)(a): contributing to the assessment of the health status of individuals and groups;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(13)(b): participating in the development and modification of the strategy of care;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(13)(c): implementing appropriate aspects of the strategy of care;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(13)(d): maintaining safe and effective nursing care rendered to a patient directly or indirectly; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(13)(e): participating in the evaluation of responses to interventions.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(14): (14); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Practice of registered nursing" means performing acts of nursing as provided in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(14)(a): assessing the health status of individuals and groups;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(14)(b): identifying health care needs;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(14)(c): establishing goals to meet identified health care needs;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(14)(d): planning a strategy of care;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(14)(e): prescribing nursing interventions to implement the strategy of care;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(14)(f): implementing the strategy of care;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(14)(g): maintaining safe and effective nursing care that is rendered to a patient directly or indirectly;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(14)(h): evaluating responses to interventions;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(14)(i): teaching the theory and practice of nursing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(14)(j): managing and supervising the practice of nursing.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(15): 58-31b-301(2)(b); 58-31b-301(2)(c); (e); (f); Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act "Registered nurse apprentice" means an individual licensed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(15)(a): 58-31b-301(2)(c); (e); (f) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(15)(b): Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(15)(c): Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(16): "Routine medications":
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(16)(a): means established medications administered to a medically stable individual as determined by a licensed health care practitioner or in consultation with a licensed medical practitioner; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(16)(b): is limited to medications that are administered by the following routes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(16)(b)(i): oral;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(16)(b)(ii): sublingual;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(16)(b)(iii): buccal;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(16)(b)(iv): eye;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(16)(b)(v): ear;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(16)(b)(vi): nasal;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(16)(b)(vii): rectal;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(16)(b)(viii): vaginal;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(16)(b)(ix): skin ointments, topical including patches and transdermal;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(16)(b)(x): premeasured medication delivered by aerosol/nebulizer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(16)(b)(xi): medications delivered by metered hand-held inhalers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(17): 58-1-501; 58-31b-501 "Unlawful conduct" means the same as that term is defined in Sections
