Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-102(19): 58-1-501; 58-31b-502; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Unprofessional conduct" means the same as that term is defined in Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-103 Nurse Education and Enforcement Account.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-103(1): There is created a restricted account within the General Fund known as the "Nurse Education and Enforcement Account."
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-103(2): 58-31b-503 The restricted account shall consist of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-103(2)(a): 58-31b-503 administrative penalties imposed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-103(2)(b): interest earned on money in the account.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-103(3): Money in the account may be appropriated by the Legislature for the following purposes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-103(3)(a): education and training of licensees or potential licensees under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-103(3)(b): enforcement of this chapter by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-103(3)(b)(i): investigating unprofessional or unlawful conduct;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-103(3)(b)(ii): providing legal representation to the division when legal action is taken against a person engaging in unprofessional or unlawful conduct; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-103(3)(b)(iii): monitoring compliance of renewal requirements;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-103(3)(c): survey nursing education programs throughout the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-103(3)(d): education and training of board members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-103(3)(e): review and approve nursing education programs and medication aide certified training programs.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-201 Board.
---------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-201(1): There is created the Board of Nursing that consists of the following 11 members:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-201(1)(a): nine nurses in a manner as may be further defined in division rule; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-201(1)(b): two members of the public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-201(2): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed and serve in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-201(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203; (3)(a)(iii) The board shall carry out the duties and responsibilities in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-201(3)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-201(3)(a)(i): recommend to the division minimum standards for educational programs qualifying a person for licensure or certification under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-201(3)(a)(ii): recommend to the division denial, approval, or withdrawal of approval regarding educational programs that meet or fail to meet the established minimum standards; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-201(3)(a)(iii): designate one of its members on a permanent or rotating basis to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-201(3)(a)(iii)(A): assist the division in reviewing complaints concerning the unlawful or unprofessional conduct of a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-201(3)(a)(iii)(B): advise the division in its investigation of these complaints.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-201(3)(b): (3)(a)(iii) A board member who has, under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-301 License or certification required -- Classifications.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-301(1): 58-1-307; 58-31b-308 A license is required to engage in the practice of nursing, except as specifically provided in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-301(2): The division shall issue to an individual who qualifies under this chapter a license or certification in the classification of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-301(2)(a): licensed practical nurse;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-301(2)(b): registered nurse apprentice;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-301(2)(c): registered nurse;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-301(2)(d): advanced practice registered nurse intern;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-301(2)(e): advanced practice registered nurse;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-301(2)(f): advanced practice registered nurse - CRNA without prescriptive practice; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-301(2)(g): medication aide certified.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-301(3): An individual holding an advanced practice registered nurse license as of July 1, 1998, who cannot document the successful completion of advanced course work in patient assessment, diagnosis and treatment, and pharmacotherapeutics, may not prescribe and shall be issued an "APRN - without prescriptive practice" license.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-301(4): The division shall grant an advanced practice registered nurse license to any licensed advanced practice registered nurse currently holding prescriptive authority under any predecessor act.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-301(5): An individual holding a certified registered nurse anesthetist license as of July 1, 2007, shall be issued an "APRN - CRNA - without prescriptive practice" license.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302 Qualifications for licensure or certification -- Criminal background checks.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(1): 63J-1-504 An applicant for certification as a medication aide shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(1)(a): submit an application to the division on a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(1)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee to the division as determined under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(1)(c): have a high school diploma or its equivalent;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(1)(d): have a current certification as a nurse aide, in good standing, from the Department of Health and Human Services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(1)(e): have a minimum of 2,000 hours of experience within the two years prior to application, working as a certified nurse aide in a long-term care facility or another health care facility that is designated by the division in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(1)(f): obtain letters of recommendation from a health care facility administrator and one licensed nurse familiar with the applicant's work practices as a certified nurse aide;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(1)(g): be in a condition of physical and mental health that will permit the applicant to practice safely as a medication aide certified;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(1)(h): have completed an approved education program or an equivalent as determined by the division in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(1)(i): have passed the examinations as required by division rule made in collaboration with the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(1)(j): meet with the board, if requested, to determine the applicant's qualifications for certification.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(2): 63J-1-504 An applicant for licensure as a licensed practical nurse shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(2)(a): submit to the division an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(2)(b): 63J-1-504 pay to the division a fee determined under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(2)(c): have a high school diploma or its equivalent;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(2)(d): be in a condition of physical and mental health that will permit the applicant to practice safely as a licensed practical nurse;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(2)(e): have completed an approved practical nursing education program or an equivalent as determined by the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(2)(f): have passed the examinations as required by division rule made in collaboration with the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(2)(g): meet with the board, if requested, to determine the applicant's qualifications for licensure.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(3): 63J-1-504 An applicant for a registered nurse apprentice license shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(3)(a): submit to the division an application form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(3)(b): 63J-1-504 pay to the division a fee determined under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(3)(c): have a high school diploma or its equivalent;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(3)(d): be in a condition of physical and mental health that will allow the applicant to practice safely as a registered nurse apprentice;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(3)(e): as determined by an approved registered nursing education program, be:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(3)(e)(i): in good standing with the program; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(3)(e)(ii): in the last semester, quarter, or competency experience;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(3)(f): have written permission from the program in which the applicant is enrolled; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(3)(g): meet with the board, if requested, to determine the applicant's qualifications for licensure.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(4): 63J-1-504 An applicant for licensure as a registered nurse shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(4)(a): submit to the division an application form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(4)(b): 63J-1-504 pay to the division a fee determined under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(4)(c): have a high school diploma or its equivalent;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(4)(d): be in a condition of physical and mental health that will allow the applicant to practice safely as a registered nurse;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(4)(e): have completed an approved registered nursing education program;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(4)(f): have passed the examinations as required by division rule made in collaboration with the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(4)(g): meet with the board, if requested, to determine the applicant's qualifications for licensure.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(5): 63J-1-504; (5)(f)(ii) Applicants for licensure as an advanced practice registered nurse shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(5)(a): submit to the division an application on a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(5)(b): 63J-1-504 pay to the division a fee determined under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(5)(c): be in a condition of physical and mental health which will allow the applicant to practice safely as an advanced practice registered nurse;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(5)(d): hold a current registered nurse license in good standing issued by the state or be qualified at the time for licensure as a registered nurse;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(5)(e): (5)(f)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(5)(e)(i): have earned a graduate degree in:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(5)(e)(i)(A): an advanced practice registered nurse nursing education program; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(5)(e)(i)(B): a related area of specialized knowledge as determined appropriate by the division in collaboration with the board; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(5)(e)(ii): (5)(f)(ii) have completed a nurse anesthesia program in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(5)(f): have completed:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(5)(f)(i): course work in patient assessment, diagnosis and treatment, and pharmacotherapeutics from an education program approved by the division in collaboration with the board; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(5)(f)(ii): a nurse anesthesia program which is approved by the Council on Accreditation of Nurse Anesthesia Educational Programs;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(5)(g): to practice within the psychiatric mental health nursing specialty, demonstrate, as described in division rule, that the applicant, after completion of a doctorate or master's degree required for licensure, is in the process of completing the applicant's clinical practice requirements in psychiatric mental health nursing, including in psychotherapy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(5)(h): have passed the examinations as required by division rule made in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(5)(i): be currently certified by a program approved by the division in collaboration with the board and submit evidence satisfactory to the division of the certification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(5)(j): meet with the board, if requested, to determine the applicant's qualifications for licensure.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(6): 58-31b-301(2)(b); 53-10-108; (6)(b); 53-10-108; 53-10-108; (6)(b) For each applicant for licensure or certification under this chapter except an applicant under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(6)(a): the applicant shall:

Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(6)(a)(ii): consent to a fingerprint background check conducted by the Bureau of Criminal Identification and the Federal Bureau of Investigation regarding the application;

Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(6)(b)(ii): (6)(b) submit from each applicant the fingerprint card and the fees described in this Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(6)(c): 53-10-108; (6)(b) the Bureau of Criminal Identification shall, in accordance with the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(6)(c)(i): (6)(b) check the fingerprints submitted under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(6)(c)(ii): forward the fingerprints to the Federal Bureau of Investigation for a national criminal history background check; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(6)(c)(iii): provide the results from the state, regional, and nationwide criminal history background checks to the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-302(7): (6); Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 2, Bureau of Criminal Identification For purposes of conducting the criminal background checks required in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-303 Qualifications for licensure -- Graduates of nonapproved nursing programs.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
An applicant for licensure as a practical nurse or registered nurse who is a graduate of a nursing education program not approved by the division in collaboration with the board must comply with the requirements of this section.Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-303(1): 58-31b-302(2); 58-31b-302(2)(e) An applicant for licensure as a licensed practical nurse shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-303(1)(a): 58-31b-302(2); 58-31b-302(2)(e) meet all requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-303(1)(b): produce evidence acceptable to the division and the board that the nursing education program completed by the applicant is equivalent to the minimum standards established by the division in collaboration with the board for an approved licensed practical nursing education program.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-303(2): 58-31b-302(4); 58-31b-302(4)(e) An applicant for licensure as a registered nurse shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-303(2)(a): 58-31b-302(4); 58-31b-302(4)(e) meet all requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-303(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-303(2)(b)(i): pass the Commission on Graduates of Foreign Nursing Schools (CGFNS) Examination; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-303(2)(b)(ii): produce evidence acceptable to the division and the board that the applicant is currently licensed as a registered nurse in one of the states, territories, or the District of Columbia of the United States or in Canada and has passed the NCLEX-RN examination in English.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-305 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-305(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-305(1)(a): The division shall issue each license or certification under this chapter in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-305(1)(b): The division may by rule extend or shorten a renewal period by as much as one year to stagger the renewal cycles the division administers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-305(2): 63J-1-504; 58-1-601 The division shall renew the license of a licensee who, at the time of renewal:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-305(2)(a): completes and submits an application for renewal in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-305(2)(b): 63J-1-504 pays a renewal fee established by the division under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-305(2)(c): 58-1-601 views a suicide prevention video described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-305(2)(d): meets continuing competency requirements as established by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-305(3): (2) In addition to the renewal requirements under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-305(4): (2); (3) In addition to the requirements described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-305(4)(a): if renewing less than two years after the day on which the division originally issued the license, demonstrate satisfactory progress toward completing the clinical practice requirements; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-305(4)(b): have completed the clinical practice requirements.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-305(5): 58-1-308 Each license or certification automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the license or certification unless renewed in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-305(6): (2)(d); 26B-4-204 The division shall accept and apply toward an hour requirement that the division establishes under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-306 APRN intern license.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-306(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-306(1)(a): The division may issue an APRN intern license to a person who meets all qualifications for a license as an advanced practice registered nurse under this chapter, except for the passing of required examinations, if the applicant:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-306(1)(a)(i): is a graduate of an approved nursing education program within the year immediately preceding application for an intern license;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-306(1)(a)(ii): has never before taken the examinations; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-306(1)(a)(iii): submits to the division evidence of having secured employment conditioned upon issuance of the APRN intern license, and the employment is under the supervision of an advanced practice registered nurse or physician as defined by division rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-306(1)(b): (1)(a) An APRN intern license issued under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-306(1)(b)(i): a date following a period established by division rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-306(1)(b)(ii): the date upon which the division receives notice from the examination agency that the individual failed to take or pass the examinations upon notification to the applicant; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-306(1)(b)(iii): the date upon which the division issues the individual an APRN license.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-306(2): An applicant specializing in psychiatric mental health nursing may be issued an APRN intern license upon completion of all licensure requirements, except for the passing of required examinations and completion of required clinical practice hours.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-306(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-306(3)(a): The division may issue an APRN intern license to a person who meets all qualifications for a license as an advanced practice registered nurse under this chapter, except course work in patient assessment or pharmacotherapeutics, if that applicant:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-306(3)(a)(i): is licensed in good standing as an advanced practice registered nurse in another state or jurisdiction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-306(3)(a)(ii): submits to the division evidence of having secured employment conditioned upon issuance of the APRN intern license, and the employment is under the supervision of an advanced practice registered nurse or physician as defined by division rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-306(3)(b): (3)(a) An APRN intern license issued under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-306(3)(b)(i): a date following a period established by division rule; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-306(3)(b)(ii): the date upon which the division issues the individual a regular license.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-308 Exemptions from licensure.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-308(1): 58-1-307; 58-31e-102 In addition to the exemptions from licensure in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-308(1)(a): friends, family members, foster parents, or legal guardians of a patient performing gratuitous nursing care for the patient;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-308(1)(b): persons providing care in a medical emergency;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-308(1)(c): persons engaged in the practice of religious tenets of a church or religious denomination; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-308(1)(d): 58-31e-102 after July 1, 2000, a person licensed to practice nursing by a jurisdiction that has joined the Nurse Licensure Compact - Revised to the extent permitted by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-308(2): (1)(d); 58-31e-102 Notwithstanding Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-308.1 Delegation of nursing care by a responsible caregiver.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-308.1(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-308.1(1)(a): "Patient" means an individual who is receiving nursing care from a responsible caregiver.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-308.1(1)(b): "Responsible caregiver" means a patient's spouse, adult child, parent, foster parent, or legal guardian who is primarily responsible for providing nursing care to the patient.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-308.1(1)(c): "Unlicensed direct care worker" means any unlicensed individual, regardless of title, who is 18 years of age or older and to whom a responsible caregiver delegates under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-308.1(2): A responsible caregiver may delegate to an unlicensed direct care worker the performance of nursing care for a patient if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-308.1(2)(a): the nursing care is provided to the patient at the residence in which the patient and responsible caregiver regularly reside;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-308.1(2)(b): the patient's condition is stable;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-308.1(2)(c): the responsible caregiver routinely provides the nursing care for the patient;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-308.1(2)(d): the nursing care is considered routine care for the patient; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-308.1(2)(e): performance of the nursing care:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-308.1(2)(e)(i): poses little potential hazard for the patient; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-308.1(2)(e)(ii): is generally expected to produce a predictable outcome for the patient.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-308.1(3): (2) Before an unlicensed direct care worker may perform nursing care delegated under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-309 Continuing education.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-309(1): The division in collaboration with the board may establish continuing education requirements for each classification of nurse licensure.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-309(2): The division may discriminate between classifications of licensure with respect to continuing education requirements upon finding the continuing education requirements are necessary to reasonably protect the public health, safety, or welfare.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401 Grounds for denial of licensure or certification and disciplinary proceedings.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(1)(a): As used in this section, "licensed" or "license" includes certified or certification under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(1)(b): A term or condition applied to the word "nurse" under this section applies to a medication aide certified.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(2): 58-1-401 Grounds for refusal to issue a license to an applicant, for refusal to renew the license of a licensee, to revoke, suspend, restrict, or place on probation the license of a licensee, to issue a public or private reprimand to a licensee, and to issue cease and desist orders shall be in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(3): (7); 75-1-201; 26B-5-301; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; (3)(a)(i); (7); (4); (3)(b)(i); 58-1-109; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act

Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(3)(a)(i): (7); 75-1-201; 26B-5-301; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act Subject to Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(4): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(4)(a): Every nurse who accepts the privilege of being licensed under this chapter gives consent to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(4)(a)(i): submitting to an immediate mental or physical examination, at the nurse's expense and by a division-approved practitioner selected by the nurse when directed in writing by the division and a majority of the board to do so; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(4)(a)(ii): the admissibility of the reports of the examining practitioner's testimony or examination, and waives all objections on the ground the reports constitute a privileged communication.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(4)(b): The examination may be ordered by the division, with the consent of a majority of the board, only upon a finding of reasonable cause to believe:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(4)(b)(i): the nurse has a mental illness, is incapacitated, or otherwise unable to practice nursing with reasonable skill and safety; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(4)(b)(ii): immediate action by the division and the board is necessary to prevent harm to the nurse's patients or the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(4)(c): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(4)(c)(i): Failure of a nurse to submit to the examination ordered under this section is a ground for the division's immediate suspension of the nurse's license by written order of the director.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(4)(c)(ii): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act The division may enter the order of suspension without further compliance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(5): (3); (4)(c); (5); 58-1-108; 58-1-109
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(5)(a): (3); (4)(c) A nurse whose license is suspended under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(5)(b): (5); 58-1-108; 58-1-109 The hearing held under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(6): A nurse whose license is revoked, suspended, or in any way restricted under this section may request the division and the board to consider, at reasonable intervals, evidence presented by the nurse, under procedures established by division rule, regarding any change in the nurse's condition, to determine whether:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(6)(a): the nurse is or is not able to safely and competently engage in the practice of nursing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(6)(b): the nurse is qualified to have the nurse's license to practice under this chapter restored completely or in part.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-401(7): The division may not refuse, revoke, suspend, or in any way restrict an applicant or licensee's license under this chapter solely because the applicant or licensee seeks or participates in mental health or substance abuse treatment.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-501 Unlawful conduct.
--------------------------------------------------
"Unlawful conduct" includes:Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-501(1): using the following titles, names or initials, if the user is not properly licensed or certified under this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-501(1)(a): nurse;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-501(1)(b): licensed practical nurse, practical nurse, or L.P.N.;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-501(1)(c): medication aide certified, or M.A.C.;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-501(1)(d): registered nurse or R.N.;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-501(1)(e): registered nurse practitioner, N.P., or R.N.P.;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-501(1)(f): registered nurse specialist, N.S., or R.N.S.;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-501(1)(g): registered psychiatric mental health nurse specialist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-501(1)(h): advanced practice registered nurse;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-501(1)(i): nurse anesthetist, certified nurse anesthetist, certified registered nurse anesthetist, or C.R.N.A.; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-501(1)(j): other generally recognized names or titles used in the profession of nursing;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-501(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-501(2)(a): using any other name, title, or initials that would cause a reasonable person to believe the user is licensed or certified under this chapter if the user is not properly licensed or certified under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-501(2)(b): (2)(a) for purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-501(3): 58-31b-601 conducting a nursing education program in the state for the purpose of qualifying individuals to meet requirements for licensure under this chapter without the program having been approved under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502 Unprofessional conduct.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1): (1)(c); 58-31b-801; 58-17b-309; Chapter 17b, Part 8, Dispensing Medical Practitioner and Dispensing Medical Practitioner Clinic Pharmacy; 76-7-302; 76-7a-201; (1)(a); (n); 58-1-501(1); Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 2, Cannabinoid Research and Medical Cannabis "Unprofessional conduct" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(a): failure to safeguard a patient's right to privacy as to the patient's person, condition, diagnosis, personal effects, or any other matter about which the licensee is privileged to know because of the licensee's or person with a certification's position or practice as a nurse or practice as a medication aide certified;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(b): failure to provide nursing service or service as a medication aide certified in a manner that demonstrates respect for the patient's human dignity and unique personal character and needs without regard to the patient's race, religion, ethnic background, socioeconomic status, age, sex, or the nature of the patient's health problem;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(c): engaging in sexual relations with a patient during any:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(c)(i): period when a generally recognized professional relationship exists between the person licensed or certified under this chapter and the patient; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(c)(ii): extended period when a patient has reasonable cause to believe a professional relationship exists between the person licensed or certified under the provisions of this chapter and the patient;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(d): (1)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(d)(i): (1)(c) as a result of any circumstance under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(d)(ii): exploiting the patient by use of the licensee's or person with a certification's knowledge of the patient obtained while acting as a nurse or a medication aide certified;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(e): unlawfully obtaining, possessing, or using any prescription drug or illicit drug;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(f): unauthorized taking or personal use of nursing supplies from an employer;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(g): unauthorized taking or personal use of a patient's personal property;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(h): unlawful or inappropriate delegation of nursing care;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(i): failure to exercise appropriate supervision of persons providing patient care services under supervision of the licensed nurse;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(j): employing or aiding and abetting the employment of an unqualified or unlicensed person to practice as a nurse;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(k): failure to file or record any medical report as required by law, impeding or obstructing the filing or recording of such a report, or inducing another to fail to file or record such a report;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(l): breach of a statutory, common law, regulatory, or ethical requirement of confidentiality with respect to a person who is a patient, unless ordered by a court;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(m): failure to pay a penalty imposed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(n): 58-31b-801 violating Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(o): 58-17b-309; Chapter 17b, Part 8, Dispensing Medical Practitioner and Dispensing Medical Practitioner Clinic Pharmacy violating the dispensing requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(p): 76-7-302; 76-7a-201 performing or inducing an abortion in violation of the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(q): (1)(a); (n); 58-1-501(1) falsely making an entry in, or altering, a medical record with the intent to conceal:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(q)(i): a wrongful or negligent act or omission of an individual licensed under this chapter or an individual under the direction or control of an individual licensed under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(q)(ii): (1)(a); (n); 58-1-501(1) conduct described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(1)(r): Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 2, Cannabinoid Research and Medical Cannabis violating the requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(2): Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 2, Cannabinoid Research and Medical Cannabis; 26B-4-201 "Unprofessional conduct" does not include, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-502(3): (2); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (2) Notwithstanding Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(5): 58-31b-501 If a licensee has been convicted of violating Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(6)(a)(i): promptly issue a citation to the person according to this chapter and any pertinent administrative rules;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(6)(a)(ii): attempt to negotiate a stipulated settlement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(6)(a)(iii): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act notify the person to appear before an adjudicative proceeding conducted under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(6)(b): (6)(a); (6); (6)(b)(i); 58-31b-501; 58-31b-502; Chapter 1, Division of Professional Licensing Act; Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act Any person who is in violation of a provision described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(6)(b)(i): (6) pursuant to this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(6)(b)(ii): (6)(b)(i); 58-31b-501; 58-31b-502; Chapter 1, Division of Professional Licensing Act; Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act in addition to or in lieu of the fine imposed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(6)(c): 58-31b-401 Except for an administrative fine and a cease and desist order, the licensure sanctions cited in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(6)(d): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act Each citation issued under this section shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(6)(d)(i): be in writing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(6)(d)(ii): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act clearly describe or explain:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(6)(d)(ii)(A): the nature of the violation, including a reference to the provision of the chapter, rule, or order alleged to have been violated;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(6)(d)(ii)(B): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act that the recipient must notify the division in writing within 20 calendar days of service of the citation in order to contest the citation at a hearing conducted under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(6)(d)(ii)(C): the consequences of failure to timely contest the citation or to make payment of any fines assessed by the citation within the time specified in the citation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(6)(d)(iii): be served upon any person upon whom a summons may be served:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(6)(d)(iii)(A): in accordance with the Utah Rules of Civil Procedure;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(6)(d)(iii)(B): personally or upon the person's agent by a division investigator or by any person specially designated by the director; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(6)(d)(iii)(C): by mail.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(6)(e): If within 20 calendar days from the service of a citation, the person to whom the citation was issued fails to request a hearing to contest the citation, the citation becomes the final order of the division and is not subject to further agency review.  The period to contest the citation may be extended by the division for cause.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(6)(f): The division may refuse to issue or renew, suspend, revoke, or place on probation the license of a licensee who fails to comply with the citation after it becomes final.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(6)(g): The failure of an applicant for licensure to comply with a citation after it becomes final is a ground for denial of license.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(6)(h): No citation may be issued under this section after the expiration of one year following the date on which the violation that is the subject of the citation is reported to the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(7)(a): The director may collect a penalty that is not paid by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(7)(a)(i): referring the matter to a collection agency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(7)(a)(ii): bringing an action in the district court of the county where the person against whom the penalty is imposed resides or in the county where the office of the director is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(7)(b): A county attorney or the attorney general of the state shall provide legal assistance and advice to the director in an action to collect a penalty.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-503(7)(c): A court shall award reasonable attorney fees and costs to the prevailing party in an action brought by the division to collect a penalty.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-701 Immunity from liability.
---------------------------------------------------------
A person licensed, registered, or certified under this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-701(1): 78B-4-501 who provides emergency care in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-701(2): Chapter 13, Health Care Providers Immunity from Liability Act is considered a health care provider under


Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-702 Reporting of disciplinary action -- Immunity from liability.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-702(1): A licensed health care facility or organization or a professional society of nurses in the state that takes disciplinary action against a person licensed under this chapter relating to any of the following shall report the action in writing to the division within 30 days after the action is taken:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-702(1)(a): that person's professional acts or omissions as a licensed nurse;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-702(1)(b): that person's nursing competence or ability to practice nursing safely; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-702(1)(c): that person's use of alcohol or drugs in an unlawful manner or to the extent the person is impaired in his ability to practice nursing safely.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-702(2): Any person or organization furnishing information in accordance with this section is immune from liability to the extent that the information is furnished in good faith and without malice.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-801 Practice within limits of competency.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-801(1): Each person licensed under this chapter is responsible for confining his practice as a nurse to those acts and practices permitted by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-801(2): A person licensed under this act may not engage in any act or practice for which he is not competent.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-802 Consumer access to provider charges.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Beginning January 1, 2011, a nurse whose license under this chapter authorizes independent practice shall, when requested by a consumer:Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-802(1): make a list of prices charged by the nurse available for the consumer which includes the nurse's 25 most frequently performed:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-802(1)(a): clinic procedures or clinic services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-802(1)(b): out-patient procedures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-802(1)(c): in-patient procedures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-802(2): provide the consumer with information regarding any discount available for:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-802(2)(a): services not covered by insurance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-802(2)(b): prompt payment of billed charges.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-803 Advanced practice registered nurse prescriptive authority. 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 58-31b-803(2): 58-31b-102(11)(d) This section does not apply to an advanced practice registered nurse specializing as a certified registered nurse anesthetist under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 37 - Utah Controlled Substances Act
****************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-1 Short title.
------------------------------------------
This act shall be known and may be cited as the "Utah Controlled Substances Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2 Definitions.
------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1): (1)(c); Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; Chapter 37d, Clandestine Drug Lab Act; 58-37-3; 58-37-4; 58-37-4.2; Title 32B, Alcoholic Beverage Control Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 58-37-4; 58-37-4.2; 58-37-4; 58-37-4.2; 58-37-4; 58-37-4.2; 58-37-4; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; Chapter 37d, Clandestine Drug Lab Act; Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; Chapter 37d, Clandestine Drug Lab Act; (1)(i)(i)(A); (1)(i)(i); 58-1-103; (1)(r)(i)(A); (B); (C); (1)(aa)(i); 58-37-4; (1)(cc)(i); (ii); (iii) As used in this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(a): "Administer" means the direct application of a controlled substance, whether by injection, inhalation, ingestion, or any other means, to the body of a patient or research subject by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(a)(i): a practitioner or, in the practitioner's presence, by the practitioner's authorized agent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(a)(ii): the patient or research subject at the direction and in the presence of the practitioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(b): "Agent" means an authorized person who acts on behalf of or at the direction of a manufacturer, distributor, or practitioner but does not include a motor carrier, public warehouseman, or employee of any of them.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(c): (1)(c) "Consumption" means ingesting or having any measurable amount of a controlled substance in a person's body, but this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(d): Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; Chapter 37d, Clandestine Drug Lab Act "Continuing criminal enterprise" means any individual, sole proprietorship, partnership, corporation, business trust, association, or other legal entity, and any union or groups of individuals associated in fact although not a legal entity, and includes illicit as well as licit entities created or maintained for the purpose of engaging in conduct which constitutes the commission of episodes of activity made unlawful by
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(e): 58-37-3 "Control" means to add, remove, or change the placement of a drug, substance, or immediate precursor under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(f): 58-37-4; 58-37-4.2; Title 32B, Alcoholic Beverage Control Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(f)(i): 58-37-4; 58-37-4.2 "Controlled substance" means a drug or substance:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(f)(i)(A): 58-37-4 included in Schedules I, II, III, IV, or V of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(f)(i)(B): included in Schedules I, II, III, IV, or V of the federal Controlled Substances Act, Title II, P.L. 91-513;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(f)(i)(C): that is a controlled substance analog; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(f)(i)(D): 58-37-4.2 listed in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(f)(ii): Title 32B, Alcoholic Beverage Control Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Controlled substance" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(f)(ii)(A): Title 32B, Alcoholic Beverage Control Act distilled spirits, wine, or malt beverages, as those terms are defined in
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(f)(ii)(B): any drug intended for lawful use in the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment, or prevention of disease in human or other animals, which contains ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, norpseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine if the drug is lawfully purchased, sold, transferred, or furnished as an over-the-counter medication without prescription; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(f)(ii)(C): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act dietary supplements, vitamins, minerals, herbs, or other similar substances including concentrates or extracts, which:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(f)(ii)(C)(I): are not otherwise regulated by law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(f)(ii)(C)(II): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act may contain naturally occurring amounts of chemical or substances listed in this chapter, or in rules adopted pursuant to
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(g): 58-37-4; 58-37-4.2; 58-37-4; 58-37-4.2; 58-37-4; 58-37-4.2; 58-37-4; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(g)(i): 58-37-4; 58-37-4.2; 58-37-4; 58-37-4.2; 58-37-4; 58-37-4.2 "Controlled substance analog" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(g)(i)(A): 58-37-4; 58-37-4.2 a substance the chemical structure of which is substantially similar to the chemical structure of a controlled substance listed in Schedules I and II of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(g)(i)(B): 58-37-4; 58-37-4.2 a substance which has a stimulant, depressant, or hallucinogenic effect on the central nervous system substantially similar to the stimulant, depressant, or hallucinogenic effect on the central nervous system of controlled substances listed in Schedules I and II of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(g)(i)(C): 58-37-4; 58-37-4.2 A substance which, with respect to a particular individual, is represented or intended to have a stimulant, depressant, or hallucinogenic effect on the central nervous system substantially similar to the stimulant, depressant, or hallucinogenic effect on the central nervous system of controlled substances listed in Schedules I and II of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(g)(ii): 58-37-4; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Controlled substance analog" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(g)(ii)(A): 58-37-4 a controlled substance currently scheduled in Schedules I through V of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(g)(ii)(B): a substance for which there is an approved new drug application;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(g)(ii)(C): a substance with respect to which an exemption is in effect for investigational use by a particular person under Section 505 of the Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, 21 U.S.C. 355, to the extent the conduct with respect to the substance is permitted by the exemption;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(g)(ii)(D): any substance to the extent not intended for human consumption before an exemption takes effect with respect to the substance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(g)(ii)(E): any drug intended for lawful use in the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment, or prevention of disease in man or other animals, which contains ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, norpseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine if the drug is lawfully purchased, sold, transferred, or furnished as an over-the-counter medication without prescription; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(g)(ii)(F): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act dietary supplements, vitamins, minerals, herbs, or other similar substances including concentrates or extracts, which are not otherwise regulated by law, which may contain naturally occurring amounts of chemical or substances listed in this chapter, or in rules adopted pursuant to
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(h): Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; Chapter 37d, Clandestine Drug Lab Act; Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; Chapter 37d, Clandestine Drug Lab Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(h)(i): Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; Chapter 37d, Clandestine Drug Lab Act "Conviction" means a determination of guilt by verdict, whether jury or bench, or plea, whether guilty or no contest, for any offense proscribed by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(h)(i)(A): Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(h)(i)(B): Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(h)(ii): Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; Chapter 37d, Clandestine Drug Lab Act for any offense under the laws of the United States and any other state which, if committed in this state, would be an offense under:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(h)(ii)(A): Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(h)(ii)(B): Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(i): (1)(i)(i)(A); (1)(i)(i) "Counterfeit substance" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(i)(i): (1)(i)(i)(A) any controlled substance or container or labeling of any controlled substance that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(i)(i)(A): without authorization bears the trademark, trade name, or other identifying mark, imprint, number, device, or any likeness of them, of a manufacturer, distributor, or dispenser other than the person or persons who in fact manufactured, distributed, or dispensed the substance which falsely purports to be a controlled substance distributed by any other manufacturer, distributor, or dispenser; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(i)(i)(B): (1)(i)(i)(A) a reasonable person would believe to be a controlled substance distributed by an authorized manufacturer, distributor, or dispenser based on the appearance of the substance as described under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(i)(ii): (1)(i)(i) any substance other than under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(i)(ii)(A): is falsely represented to be any legally or illegally manufactured controlled substance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(i)(ii)(B): a reasonable person would believe to be a legal or illegal controlled substance.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(j): "Deliver" or "delivery" means the actual, constructive, or attempted transfer of a controlled substance or a listed chemical, whether or not an agency relationship exists.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(k): "Department" means the Department of Commerce.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(l): "Depressant or stimulant substance" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(l)(i): a drug which contains any quantity of barbituric acid or any of the salts of barbituric acid;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(l)(ii): a drug which contains any quantity of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(l)(ii)(A): amphetamine or any of its optical isomers;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(l)(ii)(B): any salt of amphetamine or any salt of an optical isomer of amphetamine; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(l)(ii)(C): any substance which the Secretary of Health and Human Services or the Attorney General of the United States after investigation has found and by regulation designated habit-forming because of its stimulant effect on the central nervous system;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(l)(iii): lysergic acid diethylamide; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(l)(iv): any drug which contains any quantity of a substance which the Secretary of Health and Human Services or the Attorney General of the United States after investigation has found to have, and by regulation designated as having, a potential for abuse because of its depressant or stimulant effect on the central nervous system or its hallucinogenic effect.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(m): "Dispense" means the delivery of a controlled substance by a pharmacist to an ultimate user pursuant to the lawful order or prescription of a practitioner, and includes distributing to, leaving with, giving away, or disposing of that substance as well as the packaging, labeling, or compounding necessary to prepare the substance for delivery.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(n): "Dispenser" means a pharmacist who dispenses a controlled substance.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(o): "Distribute" means to deliver other than by administering or dispensing a controlled substance or a listed chemical.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(p): "Distributor" means a person who distributes controlled substances.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(q): 58-1-103 "Division" means the Division of Professional Licensing created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(r): (1)(r)(i)(A); (B); (C)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(r)(i): (1)(r)(i)(A); (B); (C) "Drug" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(r)(i)(A): a substance recognized in the official United States Pharmacopoeia, Official Homeopathic Pharmacopoeia of the United States, or Official National Formulary, or any supplement to any of them, intended for use in the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment, or prevention of disease in humans or animals;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(r)(i)(B): a substance that is required by any applicable federal or state law or rule to be dispensed by prescription only or is restricted to administration by practitioners only;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(r)(i)(C): a substance other than food intended to affect the structure or any function of the body of humans or other animals; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(r)(i)(D): (1)(r)(i)(A); (B); (C) substances intended for use as a component of any substance specified in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(r)(ii): "Drug" does not include dietary supplements.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(s): "Drug dependent person" means any individual who unlawfully and habitually uses any controlled substance to endanger the public morals, health, safety, or welfare, or who is so dependent upon the use of controlled substances as to have lost the power of self-control with reference to the individual's dependency.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(t): "Food" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(t)(i): any nutrient or substance of plant, mineral, or animal origin other than a drug as specified in this chapter, and normally ingested by human beings; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(t)(ii): foods for special dietary uses as exist by reason of a physical, physiological, pathological, or other condition including but not limited to the conditions of disease, convalescence, pregnancy, lactation, allergy, hypersensitivity to food, underweight, and overweight; uses for supplying a particular dietary need which exist by reason of age including but not limited to the ages of infancy and childbirth, and also uses for supplementing and for fortifying the ordinary or unusual diet with any vitamin, mineral, or other dietary property for use of a food.  Any particular use of a food is a special dietary use regardless of the nutritional purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(u): "Immediate precursor" means a substance which the Attorney General of the United States has found to be, and by regulation designated as being, the principal compound used or produced primarily for use in the manufacture of a controlled substance, or which is an immediate chemical intermediary used or likely to be used in the manufacture of a controlled substance, the control of which is necessary to prevent, curtail, or limit the manufacture of the controlled substance.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(v): "Indian" means a member of an Indian tribe.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(w): "Indian religion" means any religion:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(w)(i): the origin and interpretation of which is from within a traditional Indian culture or community; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(w)(ii): which is practiced by Indians.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(x): "Indian tribe" means any tribe, band, nation, pueblo, or other organized group or community of Indians, including any Alaska Native village, which is legally recognized as eligible for and is consistent with the special programs, services, and entitlements provided by the United States to Indians because of their status as Indians.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(y): "Manufacture" means the production, preparation, propagation, compounding, or processing of a controlled substance, either directly or indirectly by extraction from substances of natural origin, or independently by means of chemical synthesis or by a combination of extraction and chemical synthesis.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(z): "Manufacturer" includes any person who packages, repackages, or labels any container of any controlled substance, except pharmacists who dispense or compound prescription orders for delivery to the ultimate consumer.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(aa): (1)(aa)(i); 58-37-4
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(aa)(i): "Marijuana" means all species of the genus cannabis and all parts of the genus, whether growing or not, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(aa)(i)(A): seeds;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(aa)(i)(B): resin extracted from any part of the plant, including the resin extracted from the mature stalks;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(aa)(i)(C): every compound, manufacture, salt, derivative, mixture, or preparation of the plant, seeds, or resin;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(aa)(i)(D): any synthetic equivalents of the substances contained in the plant cannabis sativa or any other species of the genus cannabis which are chemically indistinguishable and pharmacologically active; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(aa)(i)(E): any component part or cannabinoid extracted or isolated from the plant, including extracted or isolated tetrahydrocannabinols.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(aa)(ii): (1)(aa)(i); 58-37-4 "Marijuana" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(aa)(ii)(A): the mature stalks of the plant;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(aa)(ii)(B): fiber produced from the stalks;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(aa)(ii)(C): oil or cake made from the seeds of the plant;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(aa)(ii)(D): (1)(aa)(i) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(aa)(ii)(E): the sterilized seed of the plant which is incapable of germination; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(aa)(ii)(F): 58-37-4 any compound, mixture, or preparation approved by the federal Food and Drug Administration under the federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, 21 U.S.C. Sec. 301 et seq. that is not listed in a schedule of controlled substances in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(bb): "Money" means officially issued coin and currency of the United States or any foreign country.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(cc): (1)(cc)(i); (ii); (iii) "Narcotic drug" means any of the following, whether produced directly or indirectly by extraction from substances of vegetable origin, or independently by means of chemical synthesis, or by a combination of extraction and chemical synthesis:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(cc)(i): opium, coca leaves, and opiates;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(cc)(ii): a compound, manufacture, salt, derivative, or preparation of opium, coca leaves, or opiates;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(cc)(iii): opium poppy and poppy straw; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(cc)(iv): (1)(cc)(i); (ii); (iii) a substance, and any compound, manufacture, salt, derivative, or preparation of the substance, which is chemically identical with any of the substances referred to in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(dd): "Negotiable instrument" means documents, containing an unconditional promise to pay a sum of money, which are legally transferable to another party by endorsement or delivery.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(ee): "Opiate" means any drug or other substance having an addiction-forming or addiction-sustaining liability similar to morphine or being capable of conversion into a drug having addiction-forming or addiction-sustaining liability.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(ff): "Opium poppy" means the plant of the species papaver somniferum L., except the seeds of the plant.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(gg): "Person" means any corporation, association, partnership, trust, other institution or entity or one or more individuals.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(hh): "Poppy straw" means all parts, except the seeds, of the opium poppy, after mowing.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(ii): "Possession" or "use" means the joint or individual ownership, control, occupancy, holding, retaining, belonging, maintaining, or the application, inhalation, swallowing, injection, or consumption, as distinguished from distribution, of controlled substances and includes individual, joint, or group possession or use of controlled substances.  For a person to be a possessor or user of a controlled substance, it is not required that the person be shown to have individually possessed, used, or controlled the substance, but it is sufficient if it is shown that the person jointly participated with one or more persons in the use, possession, or control of any substances with knowledge that the activity was occurring, or the controlled substance is found in a place or under circumstances indicating that the person had the ability and the intent to exercise dominion and control over it.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(jj): "Practitioner" means a physician, dentist, naturopathic physician, veterinarian, pharmacist, scientific investigator, pharmacy, hospital, or other person licensed, registered, or otherwise permitted to distribute, dispense, conduct research with respect to, administer, or use in teaching or chemical analysis a controlled substance in the course of professional practice or research in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(kk): "Prescribe" means to issue a prescription:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(kk)(i): orally or in writing; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(kk)(ii): by telephone, facsimile transmission, computer, or other electronic means of communication as defined by division rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(ll): "Prescription" means an order issued:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(ll)(i): by a licensed practitioner, in the course of that practitioner's professional practice or by collaborative pharmacy practice agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(ll)(ii): for a controlled substance or other prescription drug or device for use by a patient or an animal.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(mm): "Production" means the manufacture, planting, cultivation, growing, or harvesting of a controlled substance.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(nn): "Securities" means any stocks, bonds, notes, or other evidences of debt or of property.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(oo): "State" means the state of Utah.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(1)(pp): "Ultimate user" means any person who lawfully possesses a controlled substance for the person's own use, for the use of a member of the person's household, or for administration to an animal owned by the person or a member of the person's household.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2(2): Title 76, Utah Criminal Code If a term used in this chapter is not defined, the definition and terms of


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-2.5 Restricted applicability.
---------------------------------------------------------
This chapter does not restrict the sale and use of herbs, herbal products, or food supplements that are not scheduled in this chapter as controlled substances.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3 Controlled substances.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3(1): 58-37-4; 58-37-4.2 All substances listed in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3(2): All substances listed in the federal Controlled Substances Act, Title II, P.L. 91-513, are controlled.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.6 Exemption for possession or distribution of a cannabinoid product or expanded cannabinoid product pursuant to an approved study.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.6(1): 58-37a-3; 58-37-4(2)(a)(iii)(AA) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.6(1)(a): "Cannabinoid product" means a product intended for human ingestion that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.6(1)(a)(i): contains an extract or concentrate that is obtained from cannabis;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.6(1)(a)(ii): is prepared in a medicinal dosage form; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.6(1)(a)(iii): contains at least 10 units of cannabidiol for every one unit of tetrahydrocannabinol.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.6(1)(b): "Cannabis" means any part of the plant cannabis sativa, whether growing or not.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.6(1)(c): 58-37a-3 "Drug paraphernalia" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.6(1)(d): "Expanded cannabinoid product" means a product intended for human ingestion that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.6(1)(d)(i): contains an extract or concentrate that is obtained from cannabis;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.6(1)(d)(ii): is prepared in a medicinal dosage form; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.6(1)(d)(iii): contains less than 10 units of cannabidiol for every one unit of tetrahydrocannabinol.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.6(1)(e): "Medicinal dosage form" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.6(1)(e)(i): a tablet;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.6(1)(e)(ii): a capsule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.6(1)(e)(iii): a concentrated oil;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.6(1)(e)(iv): a liquid suspension;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.6(1)(e)(v): a transdermal preparation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.6(1)(e)(vi): a sublingual preparation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.6(1)(f): 58-37-4(2)(a)(iii)(AA) "Tetrahydrocannabinol" means a substance derived from cannabis that meets the description in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.6(2): Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 2, Cannabinoid Research and Medical Cannabis Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter an individual who possesses or distributes a cannabinoid product or an expanded cannabinoid product is not subject to the penalties described in this title for the possession or distribution of marijuana or tetrahydrocannabinol to the extent that the individual's possession or distribution of the cannabinoid product or expanded cannabinoid product complies with

-------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(1)(g): 26B-4-201 "Nonresident patient" means the same as that term is defined in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(1)(i): 58-37-3.9 "Tetrahydrocannabinol" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(2): Before July 1, 2021, including during the period between January 1, 2021, and March 17, 2021, an individual is not guilty under this chapter for the use or possession of marijuana, tetrahydrocannabinol, or marijuana drug paraphernalia if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(2)(a): at the time of the arrest or citation, the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(2)(a)(i): for possession, was a medical cannabis cardholder; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(2)(a)(ii): for use, was a medical cannabis patient cardholder or a minor with a provisional patient card under the supervision of a medical cannabis guardian cardholder; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(2)(b)(i): for use or possession of marijuana or tetrahydrocannabinol, the marijuana or tetrahydrocannabinol is one of the following in an amount that does not exceed the legal dosage limit:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(2)(b)(i)(A): unprocessed cannabis in a medicinal dosage form; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(2)(b)(i)(B): a cannabis product in a medicinal dosage form; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(2)(b)(ii): for use or possession of marijuana drug paraphernalia, the paraphernalia is a medical cannabis device.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(3): A nonresident patient is not guilty under this chapter for the use or possession of marijuana, tetrahydrocannabinol, or marijuana drug paraphernalia under this chapter if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(3)(a): for use or possession of marijuana or tetrahydrocannabinol, the marijuana or tetrahydrocannabinol is one of the following in an amount that does not exceed the legal dosage limit:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(3)(a)(i): unprocessed cannabis in a medicinal dosage form; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(3)(a)(ii): a cannabis product in a medicinal dosage form; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(3)(b): for use or possession of marijuana drug paraphernalia, the paraphernalia is a medical cannabis device.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(4): (4)(a); 4-41-402; Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 2, Cannabinoid Research and Medical Cannabis
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(4)(a): There is a rebuttable presumption against an allegation of use or possession of marijuana or tetrahydrocannabinol if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(4)(a)(i): an individual fails a drug test based on the presence of tetrahydrocannabinol in the sample; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(4)(a)(ii): the individual provides evidence that the individual possessed or used cannabidiol or a cannabidiol product.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(4)(b): (4)(a); 4-41-402; Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 2, Cannabinoid Research and Medical Cannabis The presumption described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(4)(b)(i): 4-41-402 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(4)(b)(ii): Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 2, Cannabinoid Research and Medical Cannabis
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(5): Title 4, Chapter 41a, Cannabis Production Establishments and Pharmacies; Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 2, Cannabinoid Research and Medical Cannabis
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(5)(a): An individual is not guilty under this chapter for the use or possession of marijuana drug paraphernalia if the drug paraphernalia is a medical cannabis device.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-3.7(5)(b): Nothing in this section prohibits a person, either within the state or outside the state, from selling a medical cannabis device within the state.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4 Schedules of controlled substances -- Schedules I through V -- Findings required -- Specific substances included in schedules.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(1): There are established five schedules of controlled substances known as Schedules I, II, III, IV, and V which consist of substances listed in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2): (2)(a)(iii); 58-37-2(1)(aa)(i)(E); (2)(b)(i)(A) Schedules I, II, III, IV, and V consist of the following drugs or other substances by the official name, common or usual name, chemical name, or brand name designated:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(a): (2)(a)(iii); 58-37-2(1)(aa)(i)(E) Schedule I:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(a)(i): Unless specifically excepted or unless listed in another schedule, any of the following opiates, including their isomers, esters, ethers, salts, and salts of isomers, esters, and ethers, when the existence of the isomers, esters, ethers, and salts is possible within the specific chemical designation:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(a)(i)(A): Acetyl-alpha-methylfentanyl (N-[1-(1-methyl-2-phenethyl)-4-piperidinyl]-N-phenylacetamide);
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(a)(i)(B): Acetyl fentanyl:  (N-(1-phenethylpiperidin-4-yl)-N-phenylacetamide);
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(a)(i)(C): Acetylmethadol;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(a)(i)(D): Acryl fentanyl (N-(1-Phenethylpiperidin-4-yl)-N-phenylacrylamide);
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(a)(i)(E): Allylprodine;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(a)(i)(F): Alphacetylmethadol, except levo-alphacetylmethadol also known as levo-alpha-acetylmethadol, levomethadyl acetate, or LAAM;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(a)(i)(G): Alphameprodine;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(a)(i)(H): Alphamethadol;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(a)(i)(I): Alpha-methylfentanyl (N-[1-(alpha-methyl-beta-phenyl)ethyl-4-piperidyl] propionanilide; 1-(1-methyl-2-phenylethyl)-4-(N-propanilido) piperidine);
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(a)(i)(J): Alpha-methylthiofentanyl (N-[1-methyl-2-(2-thienyl)ethyl-4- piperidinyl]-N-phenylpropanamide);

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(a)(i)(S): Butyryl fentanyl (N-(1-(2-phenylethyl)-4-piperidinyl)-N-phenylbutyramide);

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(a)(i)(U): Cyclopropyl fentanyl (N-(1-Phenethylpiperidin-4-yl)-N-phenylcyclopropanecarboxamide);

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(c)(v)(F): Not more than 300 milligrams of ethylmorphine per 100 milliliters or not more than 15 milligrams per dosage unit, with one or more active, non-narcotic ingredients in recognized therapeutic amounts;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(c)(v)(G): Not more than 500 milligrams of opium per 100 milliliters or per 100 grams, or not more than 25 milligrams per dosage unit, with one or more active, non-narcotic ingredients in recognized therapeutic amounts; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(c)(v)(H): Not more than 50 milligrams of morphine per 100 milliliters or per 100 grams with one or more active, non-narcotic ingredients in recognized therapeutic amounts.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(c)(vi): Unless specifically excepted or unless listed in another schedule, anabolic steroids including any of the following or any isomer, ester, salt, or derivative of the following that promotes muscle growth:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(c)(vi)(A): Boldenone;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(c)(vi)(B): Chlorotestosterone (4-chlortestosterone);
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(c)(vi)(C): Clostebol;

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(c)(vi)(Z): Testosterone; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(c)(vi)(AA): Trenbolone.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(c)(vii): Anabolic steroids expressly intended for administration through implants to cattle or other nonhuman species, and approved by the Secretary of Health and Human Services for use, may not be classified as a controlled substance.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(c)(viii): A drug product or preparation that contains any component of marijuana, including tetrahydrocannabinol, and is approved by the United States Food and Drug Administration and scheduled by the Drug Enforcement Administration in Schedule III of the federal Controlled Substances Act, Title II, P.L. 91-513.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(c)(ix): Nabiximols.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(d)(iv): Unless specifically excepted or unless listed in another schedule, any material, compound, mixture, or preparation which contains any quantity of the following substances having a stimulant effect on the central nervous system, including its salts, isomers whether optical, position, or geometric isomers, and salts of the isomers when the existence of the salts, isomers, and salts of isomers is possible within the specific chemical designation:
