Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(d)(vi): A drug product or preparation that contains any component of marijuana and is approved by the United States Food and Drug Administration and scheduled by the Drug Enforcement Administration in Schedule IV of the federal Controlled Substances Act, Title II, P.L. 91-513.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(e): Schedule V:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(e)(i): Any compound, mixture, or preparation containing any of the following limited quantities of narcotic drugs, or their salts calculated as the free anhydrous base or alkaloid, which includes one or more non-narcotic active medicinal ingredients in sufficient proportion to confer upon the compound, mixture, or preparation valuable medicinal qualities other than those possessed by the narcotic drug alone:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(e)(i)(A): not more than 200 milligrams of codeine per 100 milliliters or per 100 grams;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(e)(i)(B): not more than 100 milligrams of dihydrocodeine per 100 milliliters or per 100 grams;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(e)(i)(C): not more than 100 milligrams of ethylmorphine per 100 milliliters or per 100 grams;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(e)(i)(D): not more than 2.5 milligrams of diphenoxylate and not less than 25 micrograms of atropine sulfate per dosage unit;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(e)(i)(E): not more than 100 milligrams of opium per 100 milliliters or per 100 grams;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(e)(i)(F): not more than 0.5 milligram of difenoxin and not less than 25 micrograms of atropine sulfate per dosage unit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(e)(i)(G): unless specifically exempted or excluded or unless listed in another schedule, any material, compound, mixture, or preparation which contains Pyrovalerone having a stimulant effect on the central nervous system, including its salts, isomers, and salts of isomers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-4(2)(e)(ii): A drug product or preparation that contains any component of marijuana, including cannabidiol, and is approved by the United States Food and Drug Administration and scheduled by the Drug Enforcement Administration in Schedule V of the federal Controlled Substances Act, Title II, P.L. 91-513.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-5.5 Recognized controlled substance analogs.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-5.5(1): (2); 58-37-2(1)(g) A substance listed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-5.5(1)(a): any product manufactured, distributed, or possessed for the purpose of human consumption; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-5.5(1)(b): any product, the use or administration of which results in human consumption.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-5.5(2): (1) Substances referred to in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-5.5(2)(a): gamma butyrolactone (GBL);
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-5.5(2)(b): butyrolactone;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-5.5(2)(c): 1,2 butanolide;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-5.5(2)(d): 2-oxanolone;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-5.5(2)(e): tetrahydro-2-furanone;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-5.5(2)(f): dihydro-2 (3H)-furanone;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-5.5(2)(g): tetramethylene glycol;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-5.5(2)(h): 1,4 butanediol; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-5.5(2)(i): gamma valerolactone.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6 License to manufacture, produce, distribute, dispense, administer, or conduct research -- Issuance by division -- Denial, suspension, or revocation -- Records required -- Prescriptions.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(1): 63J-1-504
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(1)(a): The division may adopt rules relating to the licensing and control of the manufacture, distribution, production, prescription, administration, dispensing, conducting of research with, and performing of laboratory analysis upon controlled substances within this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(1)(b): 63J-1-504 The division may assess reasonable fees to defray the cost of issuing original and renewal licenses under this chapter pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(2)(a)(i): Every person who manufactures, produces, distributes, prescribes, dispenses, administers, conducts research with, or performs laboratory analysis upon any controlled substance in Schedules I through V within this state, or who proposes to engage in manufacturing, producing, distributing, prescribing, dispensing, administering, conducting research with, or performing laboratory analysis upon controlled substances included in Schedules I through V within this state shall obtain a license issued by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(2)(a)(ii): The division shall issue each license under this chapter in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.  The division may by rule extend or shorten a renewal period by as much as one year to stagger the renewal cycles it administers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(2)(b): Persons licensed to manufacture, produce, distribute, prescribe, dispense, administer, conduct research with, or perform laboratory analysis upon controlled substances in Schedules I through V within this state may possess, manufacture, produce, distribute, prescribe, dispense, administer, conduct research with, or perform laboratory analysis upon those substances to the extent authorized by their license and in conformity with this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(2)(c): The following persons are not required to obtain a license and may lawfully possess controlled substances included in Schedules II through V under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(2)(c)(i): an agent or employee, except a sales representative, of any registered manufacturer, distributor, or dispenser of any controlled substance, if the agent or employee is acting in the usual course of the agent or employee's business or employment; however, nothing in this subsection shall be interpreted to permit an agent, employee, sales representative, or detail man to maintain an inventory of controlled substances separate from the location of the person's employer's registered and licensed place of business;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(2)(c)(ii): a motor carrier or warehouseman, or an employee of a motor carrier or warehouseman, who possesses a controlled substance in the usual course of the person's business or employment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(2)(c)(iii): an ultimate user, or a person who possesses any controlled substance pursuant to a lawful order of a practitioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(2)(d): The division may enact rules waiving the license requirement for certain manufacturers, producers, distributors, prescribers, dispensers, administrators, research practitioners, or laboratories performing analysis if waiving the license requirement is consistent with public health and safety.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(2)(e): A separate license is required at each principal place of business or professional practice where the applicant manufactures, produces, distributes, dispenses, conducts research with, or performs laboratory analysis upon controlled substances.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(2)(f): The division may enact rules providing for the inspection of a licensee or applicant's establishment, and may inspect the establishment according to those rules.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(3): (3)(a)(i); (3)(a); (3)(a); (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(3)(a): (3)(a)(i); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(3)(a)(i): Upon proper application, the division shall license a qualified applicant to manufacture, produce, distribute, conduct research with, or perform laboratory analysis upon controlled substances included in Schedules I through V, unless it determines that issuance of a license is inconsistent with the public interest.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(3)(a)(ii): (3)(a)(i) The division may not issue a license to any person to prescribe, dispense, or administer a Schedule I controlled substance except under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(3)(a)(iii): (3)(a) In determining public interest under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(3)(a)(iii)(A): maintained effective controls against diversion of controlled substances and any Schedule I or II substance compounded from any controlled substance into channels other than legitimate medical, scientific, or industrial channels;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(3)(a)(iii)(B): complied with applicable state and local law;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(3)(a)(iii)(C): been convicted under federal or state laws relating to the manufacture, distribution, or dispensing of substances;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(3)(a)(iii)(D): past experience in the manufacture of controlled dangerous substances;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(3)(a)(iii)(E): established effective controls against diversion; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(3)(a)(iii)(F): complied with any other factors that the division establishes that promote the public health and safety.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(3)(b): (3)(a) Licenses granted under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(3)(c): (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(3)(c)(i): Practitioners shall be licensed to administer, dispense, or conduct research with substances in Schedules II through V if they are authorized to administer, dispense, or conduct research under the laws of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(3)(c)(ii): The division need not require a separate license for practitioners engaging in research with nonnarcotic controlled substances in Schedules II through V where the licensee is already licensed under this chapter in another capacity.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(3)(c)(iii): With respect to research involving narcotic substances in Schedules II through V, or where the division by rule requires a separate license for research of nonnarcotic substances in Schedules II through V, a practitioner shall apply to the division prior to conducting research.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(3)(c)(iv): (4) Licensing for purposes of bona fide research with controlled substances by a practitioner considered qualified may be denied only on a ground specified in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(3)(c)(v): Practitioners registered under federal law to conduct research in Schedule I substances may conduct research in Schedule I substances within this state upon providing the division with evidence of federal registration.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(3)(d): Compliance by manufacturers, producers, and distributors with the provisions of federal law respecting registration, excluding fees, entitles them to be licensed under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(3)(e): The division shall initially license those persons who own or operate an establishment engaged in the manufacture, production, distribution, dispensation, or administration of controlled substances prior to April 3, 1980, and who are licensed by the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4): (2); (3); Title 58, Chapter 1, Division of Professional Licensing Act; (4)(c); (4); (4)(a)(iv)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(a): (2); (3) Any license issued pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(a)(i): materially falsified any application filed or required pursuant to this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(a)(ii): been convicted of an offense under this chapter or any law of the United States, or any state, relating to any substance defined as a controlled substance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(a)(iii): been convicted of a felony under any other law of the United States or any state within five years of the date of the issuance of the license;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(a)(iv): had a federal registration or license denied, suspended, or revoked by competent federal authority and is no longer authorized to manufacture, distribute, prescribe, or dispense controlled substances;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(a)(v): had the licensee's license suspended or revoked by competent authority of another state for violation of laws or regulations comparable to those of this state relating to the manufacture, distribution, or dispensing of controlled substances;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(a)(vi): violated any division rule that reflects adversely on the licensee's reliability and integrity with respect to controlled substances;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(a)(vii): refused inspection of records required to be maintained under this chapter by a person authorized to inspect them; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(a)(viii): prescribed, dispensed, administered, or injected an anabolic steroid for the purpose of manipulating human hormonal structure so as to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(a)(viii)(A): increase muscle mass, strength, or weight without medical necessity and without a written prescription by any practitioner in the course of the practitioner's professional practice; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(a)(viii)(B): improve performance in any form of human exercise, sport, or game.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(b): The division may limit revocation or suspension of a license to a particular controlled substance with respect to which grounds for revocation or suspension exist.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(c): Title 58, Chapter 1, Division of Professional Licensing Act; (4)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(c)(i): Title 58, Chapter 1, Division of Professional Licensing Act Proceedings to deny, revoke, or suspend a license shall be conducted pursuant to this section and in accordance with the procedures set forth in
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(c)(ii): (4)(c) Nothing in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(d)(i): The division may suspend any license simultaneously with the institution of proceedings under this section if it finds there is an imminent danger to the public health or safety.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(d)(ii): Suspension shall continue in effect until the conclusion of proceedings, including judicial review, unless withdrawn by the division or dissolved by a court of competent jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(e): (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(e)(i): (4) If a license is suspended or revoked under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(e)(ii): Disposition may not be made of substances under seal until the time for taking an appeal has lapsed, or until all appeals have been concluded, unless a court, upon application, orders the sale of perishable substances and the proceeds deposited with the court.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(e)(iii): If a revocation order becomes final, all controlled substances shall be forfeited.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(f): The division shall notify promptly the Drug Enforcement Administration of all orders suspending or revoking a license and all forfeitures of controlled substances.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(4)(g): (4)(a)(iv) If an individual's Drug Enforcement Administration registration is denied, revoked, surrendered, or suspended, the division shall immediately suspend the individual's controlled substance license, which shall only be reinstated by the division upon reinstatement of the federal registration, unless the division has taken further administrative action under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(5): (2); (3); (5)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(5)(a): (2); (3) A person licensed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(5)(b): (5)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(5)(b)(i): A physician, dentist, naturopathic physician, veterinarian, practitioner, or other individual who is authorized to administer or professionally use a controlled substance shall keep a record of the drugs received by the individual and a record of all drugs administered, dispensed, or professionally used by the individual otherwise than by a prescription.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(5)(b)(ii): (5)(b) An individual using small quantities or solutions or other preparations of those drugs for local application has complied with this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(6): Controlled substances in Schedules I through V may be distributed only by a licensee and pursuant to an order form prepared in compliance with division rules or a lawful order under the rules and regulations of the United States.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7): 58-17b-303; 58-17b-304; (7)(a); (7)(d); (7)(d); (2); (7)(f); (7)(f)(iii)(A); (7)(f)(iii); (7); 58-1-307(1)(c); 78B-3-406; (7)(h); 80-1-102
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(a): An individual may not write or authorize a prescription for a controlled substance unless the individual is:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(a)(i): a practitioner authorized to prescribe drugs and medicine under the laws of this state or under the laws of another state having similar standards; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(a)(ii): licensed under this chapter or under the laws of another state having similar standards.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(b): 58-17b-303; 58-17b-304 An individual other than a pharmacist licensed under the laws of this state, or the pharmacist's licensed intern, as required by Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(c): (7)(a); (7)(d); (7)(d)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(c)(i): A controlled substance may not be dispensed without the written prescription of a practitioner, if the written prescription is required by the federal Controlled Substances Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(c)(ii): (7)(a); (7)(d) That written prescription shall be made in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(c)(iii): In emergency situations, as defined by division rule, controlled substances may be dispensed upon oral prescription of a practitioner, if reduced promptly to writing on forms designated by the division and filed by the pharmacy.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(c)(iv): (7)(d) Prescriptions reduced to writing by a pharmacist shall be in conformity with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(d): Except for emergency situations designated by the division, an individual may not issue, fill, compound, or dispense a prescription for a controlled substance unless the prescription is signed by the prescriber in ink or indelible pencil or is signed with an electronic signature of the prescriber as authorized by division rule, and contains the following information:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(d)(i): the name, address, and registry number of the prescriber;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(d)(ii): the name, address, and age of the person to whom or for whom the prescription is issued;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(d)(iii): the date of issuance of the prescription; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(d)(iv): the name, quantity, and specific directions for use by the ultimate user of the controlled substance.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(e): (2) A prescription may not be written, issued, filled, or dispensed for a Schedule I controlled substance unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(e)(i): (2) the individual who writes the prescription is licensed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(e)(ii): the prescribed controlled substance is to be used in research.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(f): (7)(f); (7)(f)(iii)(A); (7)(f)(iii) Except when administered directly to an ultimate user by a licensed practitioner, controlled substances are subject to the restrictions of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(f)(i): A prescription for a Schedule II substance may not be refilled.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(f)(ii): A Schedule II controlled substance may not be filled in a quantity to exceed a one-month's supply, as directed on the daily dosage rate of the prescriptions.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(f)(iii): (7)(f)(iii)(A); (7)(f)(iii)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(f)(iii)(A): A prescription for a Schedule II or Schedule III controlled substance that is an opiate and that is issued for an acute condition shall be completely or partially filled in a quantity not to exceed a seven-day supply as directed on the daily dosage rate of the prescription.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(f)(iii)(B): (7)(f)(iii)(A) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(f)(iii)(C): (7)(f)(iii) A pharmacist is not required to verify that a prescription is in compliance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(f)(iv): A Schedule III or IV controlled substance may be filled only within six months of issuance, and may not be refilled more than six months after the date of its original issuance or be refilled more than five times after the date of the prescription unless renewed by the practitioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(f)(v): All other controlled substances in Schedule V may be refilled as the prescriber's prescription directs, but they may not be refilled one year after the date the prescription was issued unless renewed by the practitioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(f)(vi): Any prescription for a Schedule II substance may not be dispensed if it is not presented to a pharmacist for dispensing by a pharmacist or a pharmacy intern within 30 days after the date the prescription was issued, or 30 days after the dispensing date, if that date is specified separately from the date of issue.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(f)(vii): A practitioner may issue more than one prescription at the same time for the same Schedule II controlled substance, but only under the following conditions:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(f)(vii)(A): no more than three prescriptions for the same Schedule II controlled substance may be issued at the same time;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(f)(vii)(B): no one prescription may exceed a 30-day supply; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(f)(vii)(C): a second or third prescription shall include the date of issuance and the date for dispensing.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(g): (7); 58-1-307(1)(c) An order for a controlled substance in Schedules II through V for use by an inpatient or an outpatient of a licensed hospital is exempt from all requirements of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(g)(i): 58-1-307(1)(c) issued or made by a prescribing practitioner who holds an unrestricted registration with the federal Drug Enforcement Administration, and an active Utah controlled substance license in good standing issued by the division under this section, or a medical resident who is exempted from licensure under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(g)(ii): authorized by the prescribing practitioner treating the patient and the prescribing practitioner designates the quantity ordered;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(g)(iii): entered upon the record of the patient, the record is signed by the prescriber affirming the prescriber's authorization of the order within 48 hours after filling or administering the order, and the patient's record reflects the quantity actually administered; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(g)(iv): filled and dispensed by a pharmacist practicing the pharmacist's profession within the physical structure of the hospital, or the order is taken from a supply lawfully maintained by the hospital and the amount taken from the supply is administered directly to the patient authorized to receive it.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(h): 78B-3-406; (7)(h); 80-1-102 A practitioner licensed under this chapter may not prescribe, administer, or dispense a controlled substance to a child, without first obtaining the consent required in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(i): A practitioner licensed under this chapter may not prescribe or administer dosages of a controlled substance in excess of medically recognized quantities necessary to treat the ailment, malady, or condition of the ultimate user.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(j): A practitioner licensed under this chapter may not prescribe, administer, or dispense any controlled substance to another person knowing that the other person is using a false name, address, or other personal information for the purpose of securing the controlled substance.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(k): A person who is licensed under this chapter to manufacture, distribute, or dispense a controlled substance may not manufacture, distribute, or dispense a controlled substance to another licensee or any other authorized person not authorized by this license.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(l): A person licensed under this chapter may not omit, remove, alter, or obliterate a symbol required by this chapter or by a rule issued under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(m): A person licensed under this chapter may not refuse or fail to make, keep, or furnish any record notification, order form, statement, invoice, or information required under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(n): A person licensed under this chapter may not refuse entry into any premises for inspection as authorized by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(7)(o): A person licensed under this chapter may not furnish false or fraudulent material information in any application, report, or other document required to be kept by this chapter or willfully make any false statement in any prescription, order, report, or record required by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(8): (7)(k); (o); (10); 58-1-106; 58-1-108; (8)(a)(i); 58-37f-502(1); (7)(h); (j); (10); (7)(k); (o)

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(8)(a)(ii): (8)(a)(i); 58-37f-502(1) The division shall deposit all penalties collected under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(8)(a)(iii): The director may collect a penalty that is not paid by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(8)(a)(iii)(A): referring the matter to a collection agency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(8)(a)(iii)(B): bringing an action in the district court of the county where the person against whom the penalty is imposed resides or in the county where the office of the director is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(8)(a)(iv): A county attorney or the attorney general of the state shall provide legal assistance and advice to the director in an action to collect a penalty.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(8)(a)(v): A court shall award reasonable attorney fees and costs to the prevailing party in an action brought by the division to collect a penalty.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(9): Any information communicated to any licensed practitioner in an attempt to unlawfully procure, or to procure the administration of, a controlled substance is not considered to be a privileged communication.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(11)(a): (11); 58-37f-201 As used in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(11)(a)(i): "High risk prescription" means a prescription for an opiate or a benzodiazepine that is written to continue for longer than 30 consecutive days.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(11)(a)(ii): 58-37f-201 "Database" means the controlled substance database created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(11)(b): A practitioner who issues a high risk prescription to a patient shall, before issuing the high risk prescription to the patient, verify in the database that the patient does not have a high risk prescription from a different practitioner that is currently active.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(11)(c): (11)(c)(i) If the database shows that the patient has received a high risk prescription that is currently active from a different practitioner, the practitioner may not issue a high risk prescription to the patient unless the practitioner:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(11)(c)(i): contacts and consults with each practitioner who issued a high risk prescription that is currently active to the patient;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(11)(c)(ii): (11)(c)(i) documents in the patient's medical record that the practitioner made contact with each practitioner in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6(11)(c)(iii): documents in the patient's medical record the reason why the practitioner believes that the patient needs multiple high risk prescriptions from different practitioners.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6.5 Continuing education for controlled substance prescribers.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6.5(1): Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act For the purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6.5(1)(a): "Controlled substance prescriber" means an individual, other than a veterinarian, who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6.5(1)(a)(i): is licensed to prescribe a controlled substance under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6.5(1)(a)(ii): possesses the authority, in accordance with the individual's scope of practice, to prescribe schedule II controlled substances and schedule III controlled substances that are applicable to opioid narcotics, hypnotic depressants, or psychostimulants.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6.5(1)(b): Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act "D.O." means an osteopathic physician and surgeon licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6.5(1)(c): "FDA" means the United States Food and Drug Administration.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6.5(1)(d): Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act "M.D." means a physician and surgeon licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6.5(1)(e): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "SBIRT" means the Screening, Brief Intervention, and Referral to Treatment approach used by the federal Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration or defined by the division, in consultation with the Office of Substance Use and Mental Health, by administrative rule, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6.5(2): (3); (4); (2)(b)(i); (3); 26B-3-131; 49-20-416
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6.5(2)(a): (3) Beginning with the licensing period that begins after January 1, 2014, as a condition precedent for license renewal, each controlled substance prescriber shall complete at least 3.5 continuing education hours per licensing period that satisfy the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6.5(2)(b): (4); (2)(b)(i); (3); 26B-3-131; 49-20-416

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6.5(2)(b)(ii): (2)(b)(i); (3) Completion of the SBIRT-training class, in compliance with Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6.5(4): A controlled substance prescribing class shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6.5(4)(a): satisfy the division's requirements for the continuing education required for the renewal of the controlled substance prescriber's respective license type;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6.5(4)(b): be delivered by an accredited or approved continuing education provider recognized by the division as offering continuing education appropriate for the controlled substance prescriber's respective license type; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6.5(4)(c): include a postcourse knowledge assessment.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6.5(6)(a): the scope of the controlled substance abuse problem in Utah and the nation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-6.5(6)(b): all elements of the FDA Blueprint for Prescriber Education under the FDA's Extended-Release and Long-Acting Opioid Analgesics Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy, as published July 9, 2012, or as it may be subsequently revised;

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7 Labeling and packaging controlled substance -- Informational pamphlet for opiates -- Naloxone education and offer to dispense.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(1): A person licensed pursuant to this act may not distribute a controlled substance unless it is packaged and labeled in compliance with the requirements of Section 305 of the Federal Comprehensive Drug Abuse Prevention and Control Act of 1970.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(2): No person except a pharmacist for the purpose of filling a prescription shall alter, deface, or remove any label affixed by the manufacturer.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(3): Whenever a pharmacy sells or dispenses any controlled substance on a prescription issued by a practitioner, the pharmacy shall affix to the container in which the substance is sold or dispensed:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(3)(a): a label showing the:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(3)(a)(i): pharmacy name and address;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(3)(a)(ii): serial number; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(3)(a)(iii): date of initial filling;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(3)(b): the prescription number, the name of the patient, or if the patient is an animal, the name of the owner of the animal and the species of the animal;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(3)(c): the name of the practitioner by whom the prescription was written;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(3)(d): any directions stated on the prescription; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(3)(e): any directions required by rules and regulations promulgated by the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(4): 26B-4-501; 26B-4-501; 26B-4-510 Whenever a pharmacy sells or dispenses a Schedule II or Schedule III controlled substance that is an opiate, the pharmacy shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(4)(a): affix a warning to the container or the lid for the container in which the substance is sold or dispensed that contains the following text:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(4)(a)(i): "Caution: Opioid. Risk of overdose and addiction"; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(4)(a)(ii): any other language that is approved by the Department of Health and Human Services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(4)(b): 26B-4-501; 26B-4-501; 26B-4-510 beginning January 1, 2024:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(4)(b)(i): 26B-4-501 offer to counsel the patient or the patient's representative on the use and availability of an opioid antagonist as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(4)(b)(ii): 26B-4-501; 26B-4-510 offer to dispense an opioid antagonist as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(4)(b)(ii)(A): receives a single prescription for 50 morphine milligram equivalents or more per day, calculated in accordance with guidelines developed by the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(4)(b)(ii)(B): is being dispensed an opioid and the pharmacy dispensed a benzodiazepine to the patient in the previous 30 day period; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(4)(b)(ii)(C): is being dispensed a benzodiazepine and the pharmacy dispensed an opioid to the patient in the previous 30 day period.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(5): 26B-4-514; (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(5)(a): 26B-4-514 A pharmacy who sells or dispenses a Schedule II or Schedule III controlled substance that is an opiate shall, if available from the Department of Health and Human Services, prominently display at the point of sale the informational pamphlet developed by the Department of Health and Human Services under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(5)(b): The board and the Department of Health and Human Services shall encourage pharmacies to use the informational pamphlet to engage in patient counseling regarding the risks associated with taking opiates.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(5)(c): (5)(a) The requirement in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(6): A person may not alter the face or remove any label so long as any of the original contents remain.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(7)(a): An individual to whom or for whose use any controlled substance has been prescribed, sold, or dispensed by a practitioner and the owner of any animal for which any controlled substance has been prescribed, sold, or dispensed by a veterinarian may lawfully possess it only in the container in which it was delivered to the individual by the person selling or dispensing it.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-7(7)(b): It is a defense to a prosecution under this subsection that the person being prosecuted produces in court a valid prescription for the controlled substance or the original container with the label attached.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8 Prohibited acts -- Penalties.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(1): Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; Chapter 37d, Clandestine Drug Lab Act; Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; Chapter 37d, Clandestine Drug Lab Act; (1)(a); 58-37-4.2; (1)(a)(ii); (iii); 76-10-501; (1)(a)(iv); (1)(a)(iv)(B); (1)(d)(i)(B); (1)(a) Prohibited acts A -- Penalties and reporting:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(1)(a): Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; Chapter 37d, Clandestine Drug Lab Act; Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; Chapter 37d, Clandestine Drug Lab Act Except as authorized by this chapter, it is unlawful for a person to knowingly and intentionally:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(1)(a)(i): produce, manufacture, or dispense, or to possess with intent to produce, manufacture, or dispense, a controlled or counterfeit substance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(1)(a)(ii): distribute a controlled or counterfeit substance, or to agree, consent, offer, or arrange to distribute a controlled or counterfeit substance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(1)(a)(iii): possess a controlled or counterfeit substance with intent to distribute; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(1)(a)(iv): Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; Chapter 37d, Clandestine Drug Lab Act; Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; Chapter 37d, Clandestine Drug Lab Act engage in a continuing criminal enterprise where:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(1)(a)(iv)(A): Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; Chapter 37d, Clandestine Drug Lab Act the person participates, directs, or engages in conduct that results in a violation of this chapter,
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(1)(a)(iv)(B): Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; Chapter 37d, Clandestine Drug Lab Act the violation is a part of a continuing series of two or more violations of this chapter,
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(1)(b): (1)(a); 58-37-4.2 A person convicted of violating Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(1)(b)(i): a substance or a counterfeit of a substance classified in Schedule I or II, a controlled substance analog, or gammahydroxybutyric acid as listed in Schedule III is guilty of a second degree felony, punishable by imprisonment for not more than 15 years, and upon a second or subsequent conviction is guilty of a first degree felony;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(1)(b)(ii): 58-37-4.2 a substance or a counterfeit of a substance classified in Schedule III or IV, or marijuana, or a substance listed in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(1)(b)(iii): a substance or a counterfeit of a substance classified in Schedule V is guilty of a class A misdemeanor and upon a second or subsequent conviction is guilty of a third degree felony.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(3)(a): It is unlawful for a person knowingly and intentionally:

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(3)(a)(iii): to make a false or forged prescription or written order for a controlled substance, or to utter the same, or to alter a prescription or written order issued or written under the terms of this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(3)(a)(iv): to make, distribute, or possess a punch, die, plate, stone, or other thing designed to print, imprint, or reproduce the trademark, trade name, or other identifying mark, imprint, or device of another or any likeness of any of the foregoing upon any drug or container or labeling so as to render a drug a counterfeit controlled substance.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(5): A violation of this chapter for which no penalty is specified is a class B misdemeanor.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(6)(a): (1); (2); Title 77, Chapter 2a, Pleas in Abeyance For purposes of penalty enhancement under Subsections

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(6)(b)(ii): from a conviction that is separate from any other conviction used to enhance the current charge.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(7): A person may be charged and sentenced for a violation of this section, notwithstanding a charge and sentence for a violation of any other section of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(8)(a): A penalty imposed for violation of this section is in addition to, and not in lieu of, a civil or administrative penalty or sanction authorized by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(8)(b): When a violation of this chapter violates a federal law or the law of another state, conviction or acquittal under federal law or the law of another state for the same act is a bar to prosecution in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(9): In any prosecution for a violation of this chapter, evidence or proof that shows a person or persons produced, manufactured, possessed, distributed, or dispensed a controlled substance or substances, is prima facie evidence that the person or persons did so with knowledge of the character of the substance or substances.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(10): This section does not prohibit a veterinarian, in good faith and in the course of the veterinarian's professional practice only and not for humans, from prescribing, dispensing, or administering controlled substances or from causing the substances to be administered by an assistant or orderly under the veterinarian's direction and supervision.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(11): Civil or criminal liability may not be imposed under this section on:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(11)(a): a person registered under this chapter who manufactures, distributes, or possesses an imitation controlled substance for use as a placebo or investigational new drug by a registered practitioner in the ordinary course of professional practice or research;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(11)(b): a law enforcement officer acting in the course and legitimate scope of the officer's employment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(11)(c): a healthcare facility, substance use harm reduction services program, or drug addiction treatment facility that temporarily possesses a controlled or counterfeit substance to conduct a test or analysis on the controlled or counterfeit substance to identify or analyze the strength, effectiveness, or purity of the substance for a public health or safety reason.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(16)(a)(i): reasonably believes that the person or another person is experiencing an overdose event due to the ingestion, injection, inhalation, or other introduction into the human body of a controlled substance or other substance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(16)(a)(ii): 26B-4-101; (16) reports, or assists a person who reports, in good faith the overdose event to a medical provider, an emergency medical service provider as defined in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(16)(a)(iv): remains at the location of the person experiencing the overdose event until a responding law enforcement officer or emergency medical service provider arrives, or remains at the medical care facility where the person experiencing an overdose event is located until a responding law enforcement officer arrives;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(16)(a)(v): cooperates with the responding medical provider, emergency medical service provider, and law enforcement officer, including providing information regarding the person experiencing the overdose event and any substances the person may have injected, inhaled, or otherwise introduced into the person's body; and

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8 Prohibited acts -- Penalties.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(1): Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; Chapter 37d, Clandestine Drug Lab Act; Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; Chapter 37d, Clandestine Drug Lab Act; (1)(a); 58-37-4.2; (1)(a)(ii); (iii); 76-10-501; (1)(a)(iv); (1)(a)(iv)(B); (1)(d)(i)(B); (1)(a) Prohibited acts A -- Penalties and reporting:

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(1)(a)(ii): distribute a controlled or counterfeit substance, or to agree, consent, offer, or arrange to distribute a controlled or counterfeit substance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(1)(a)(iii): possess a controlled or counterfeit substance with intent to distribute; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(1)(a)(iv): Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; Chapter 37d, Clandestine Drug Lab Act; Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; Chapter 37d, Clandestine Drug Lab Act engage in a continuing criminal enterprise where:

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(7): A person may be charged and sentenced for a violation of this section, notwithstanding a charge and sentence for a violation of any other section of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(8)(a): A penalty imposed for violation of this section is in addition to, and not in lieu of, a civil or administrative penalty or sanction authorized by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(8)(b): When a violation of this chapter violates a federal law or the law of another state, conviction or acquittal under federal law or the law of another state for the same act is a bar to prosecution in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(9): In any prosecution for a violation of this chapter, evidence or proof that shows a person or persons produced, manufactured, possessed, distributed, or dispensed a controlled substance or substances, is prima facie evidence that the person or persons did so with knowledge of the character of the substance or substances.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(10): This section does not prohibit a veterinarian, in good faith and in the course of the veterinarian's professional practice only and not for humans, from prescribing, dispensing, or administering controlled substances or from causing the substances to be administered by an assistant or orderly under the veterinarian's direction and supervision.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(11): Civil or criminal liability may not be imposed under this section on:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(11)(a): a person registered under this chapter who manufactures, distributes, or possesses an imitation controlled substance for use as a placebo or investigational new drug by a registered practitioner in the ordinary course of professional practice or research;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(11)(b): a law enforcement officer acting in the course and legitimate scope of the officer's employment;or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8(11)(c): a healthcare facility, substance use harm reduction services program, or drug addiction treatment facility that temporarily possesses a controlled or counterfeit substance to conduct a test or analysis on the controlled or counterfeit substance to identify or analyze the strength, effectiveness, or purity of the substance for a public health or safety reason.
