Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-8.5 Applicability of Title 76 prosecutions under this chapter.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Unless specifically excluded in or inconsistent with the provisions of this chapter, the provisions of

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-9 Investigators -- Status of peace officers.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Investigators for the Department of  Commerce shall for the purpose of enforcing the provisions of this chapter have the status of peace officers.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10 Search warrants -- Administrative inspection warrants -- Inspections and seizures of property without warrant.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(1): Search warrants relating to offenses involving controlled substances may be authorized pursuant to the Utah Rules of Criminal Procedure.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(2): 58-37-9 Issuance and execution of administrative inspection warrants shall be as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(2)(a): Any judge or magistrate of this state within his jurisdiction upon proper oath or affirmation showing probable cause, may issue warrants for the purpose of conducting administrative inspections authorized by this act or regulations thereunder and seizures of property appropriate to such inspections.  Probable cause for purposes of this act exists upon showing a valid public interest in the effective enforcement of the act or rules promulgated thereunder sufficient to justify administrative inspection of the area, premises, building, or conveyance in the circumstances specified in the application for the warrant.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(2)(b): 58-37-9 A warrant shall issue only upon an affidavit of an officer or employee duly designated and having knowledge of the facts alleged sworn to before a judge or magistrate which establish the grounds for issuing the warrant.  If the judge or magistrate is satisfied that grounds for the application exist or that there is probable cause to believe they exist, he shall issue a warrant identifying the area, premises, building, or conveyance to be inspected, the purpose of the inspection, and if appropriate, the type of property to be inspected, if any.  The warrant shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(2)(b)(i): state the grounds for its issuance and the name of each person whose affidavit has been taken to support it;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(2)(b)(ii): 58-37-9 be directed to a person authorized by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(2)(b)(iii): command the person to whom it is directed to inspect the area, premises, building, or conveyance identified for the purpose specified and if appropriate, direct the seizure of the property specified;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(2)(b)(iv): identify the item or types of property to be seized, if any; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(2)(b)(v): direct that it be served during normal business hours and designate the judge or magistrate to whom it shall be returned.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(2)(c): A warrant issued pursuant to this section must be executed and returned within 10 days after its date unless, upon a showing of a need for additional time, the court instructs otherwise in the warrant.  If property is seized pursuant to a warrant, the person executing the warrant shall give to the person from whom or from whose premises the property was taken a copy of the warrant and a receipt for the property taken or leave the copy and receipt at the place where the property was taken.  Return of the warrant shall be made promptly and be accompanied by a written inventory of any property taken.  The inventory shall be made in the presence of the person executing the warrant and of the person from whose possession or premises the property was taken, if they are present, or in the presence of at least one credible person other than the person executing the warrant.  A copy of the inventory shall be delivered to the person from whom or from whose premises the property was taken and to the applicant for the warrant.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(2)(d): The judge or magistrate who issued the warrant under this section shall attach a copy of the return and all other papers to the warrant and file them with the court.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(3): 58-37-9; 58-37-9; (3)(e) The department is authorized to make administrative inspections of controlled premises in accordance with the following provisions:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(3)(a): For purposes of this section only, "controlled premises" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(3)(a)(i): Places where persons licensed or exempted from licensing requirements under this act are required to keep records.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(3)(a)(ii): Places including factories, warehouses, establishments, and conveyances where persons licensed or exempted from licensing requirements are permitted to possess, manufacture, compound, process, sell, deliver, or otherwise dispose of any controlled substance.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(3)(b): 58-37-9 When authorized by an administrative inspection warrant a law enforcement officer or employee designated in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(3)(c): 58-37-9; (3)(e) When authorized by an administrative inspection warrant, a law enforcement officer or employee designated in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(3)(c)(i): To inspect and copy records required by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(3)(c)(ii): (3)(e) To inspect within reasonable limits and a reasonable manner, the controlled premises and all pertinent equipment, finished and unfinished material, containers, and labeling found, and except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(3)(c)(iii): To inventory and take stock of any controlled substance and obtain samples of any substance.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(3)(d): This section shall not be construed to prevent the inspection of books and records without a warrant pursuant to an administrative subpoena issued by a court or the department nor shall it be construed to prevent entries and administrative inspections including seizures of property without a warrant:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(3)(d)(i): with the consent of the owner, operator, or agent in charge of the controlled premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(3)(d)(ii): in situations presenting imminent danger to health or safety;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(3)(d)(iii): in situations involving inspection of conveyances where there is reasonable cause to believe that the mobility of the conveyance makes it impracticable to obtain a warrant;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(3)(d)(iv): in any other exceptional or emergency circumstance where time or opportunity to apply for a warrant is lacking; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(3)(d)(v): in all other situations where a warrant is not constitutionally required.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-10(3)(e): No inspection authorized by this section shall extend to financial data, sales data, other than shipment data, or pricing data unless the owner, operator, or agent in charge of the controlled premises consents in writing.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-11 District court jurisdiction to enjoin violations -- Jury trial.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-11(1): The district courts of this state shall have jurisdiction in proceedings in accordance with the rules of those courts to enjoin violations of this act.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-11(2): If an alleged violation of an injunction or restraining order issued under this section occurs, the accused may demand a jury trial in accordance with the rules of the district courts.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-12 Enforcement -- Coordination and cooperation of federal and state agencies -- Powers.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The department and all law enforcement agencies charged with enforcing this act shall cooperate with federal and other state agencies in discharging their responsibilities concerning traffic in controlled substances and in suppressing the abuse of controlled substances.  To this end, they are authorized to:Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-12(1): Arrange for the exchange of information between governmental officials concerning the use and abuse of dangerous substances.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-12(2): Coordinate and cooperate in training programs in controlled substance law enforcement at the local and state levels.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-12(3): Cooperate with the United States Department of Justice and the Utah Department of Public Safety by establishing a centralized unit which will receive, catalog, file, and collect statistics, including records of drug-dependent persons and other controlled substance law offenders within the state, and make the information available for federal, state, and local law enforcement purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-12(4): Conduct programs of eradication aimed at destroying the wild or illicit growth of plant species from which controlled substances may be extracted.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-14 Resort for illegal use or possession of controlled substances deemed common nuisance -- District court power to suppress and enjoin.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-14(1): Any store, shop, warehouse, dwelling house, building, vehicle, boat, aircraft, or other place to which users or possessors of any controlled substances, listed in schedules I through V, resort or where use or possession of any substances violates this act, or which is used for illegal keeping, storing, or selling any substances listed as controlled substances in schedules I through V shall be deemed a common nuisance. No person shall open, keep, or maintain any such place.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-14(2): The district court has the power to make any order necessary or reasonable to suppress any nuisance and to enjoin any person or persons from doing any act calculated to cause, or permit the continuation of a nuisance.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-15 Burden of proof in proceedings on violations -- Enforcement officers exempt from liability.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-15(1): It is not necessary for the state to negate any exemption or exception set forth in this act in any complaint, information, indictment or other pleading or trial, hearing, or other proceeding under this act, and the burden of proof of any exemption or exception is upon the person claiming its benefit.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-15(2): In absence of proof that a person is the duly authorized holder of an appropriate license, registration, order form, or prescription issued under this act, he shall be presumed not to be the holder of a license, registration, order form, or prescription, and the burden of proof is upon him to rebut the presumption.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-15(3): No liability shall be imposed upon any duly authorized state or federal officer engaged in the enforcement of this act who is engaged in the enforcement of any law, municipal ordinance, or regulation relating to controlled substances.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-17 Judicial review.
-----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-17(1): Any person aggrieved by a department's final order may obtain judicial review.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-17(2): Venue for judicial review of informal adjudicative proceedings is in the district court of Salt Lake County.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-18 Prior prosecutions and proceedings continued -- Uniform construction.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-18(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-18(1)(a): Prosecution for violation of any law or offense occurring prior to the effective date of this act shall not be affected by this act; provided, that sentences imposed after the effective date of this act may not exceed the maximum terms specified and the judge has discretion to impose any minimum sentence.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-18(1)(b): Civil seizures, forfeitures, and injunctive proceedings commenced prior to the effective date of this act shall not be affected by this act.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-18(1)(c): All administrative proceedings pending before any agency or court on the effective date of this act shall be continued and brought to final determination in accordance with laws and regulations in effect prior to the effective date of this act. Drugs placed under control prior to enactment of this act which are not listed within schedules I through V shall be automatically controlled and listed in the appropriate schedule without further proceedings.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-18(2): This act does not affect rights and duties that mature, penalties that are incurred, and proceedings that are begun before its effective date.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-18(3): This act shall be construed to effectuate its general purpose to make uniform the law of those states which enact it where laws are similar to this act.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19 Opiate prescription consultation -- Prescription for opioid antagonist required.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(1): 26B-4-501 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(1)(a): "Initial opiate prescription" means a prescription for an opiate to a patient who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(1)(a)(i): has never previously been issued a prescription for an opiate; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(1)(a)(ii): was previously issued a prescription for an opiate, but the date on which the current prescription is being issued is more than one year after the date on which an opiate was previously prescribed or administered to the patient.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(1)(b): 26B-4-501 "Opioid antagonist" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(1)(c): "Prescriber" means an individual authorized to prescribe a controlled substance under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(2): (3) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(2)(a): the risks of addiction and overdose associated with opiate drugs;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(2)(b): the dangers of taking opiates with alcohol, benzodiazepines, and other central nervous system depressants;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(2)(c): the reasons why the prescription is necessary;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(2)(d): alternative treatments that may be available; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(2)(e): other risks associated with the use of the drugs being prescribed.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(3): (2); 26B-2-201 Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(3)(a): a patient who is currently in active treatment for cancer;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(3)(b): 26B-2-201 a patient who is receiving hospice care from a licensed hospice as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(3)(c): a medication that is being prescribed to a patient for the treatment of the patient's substance abuse or opiate dependence.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(4): (4)(a); (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(4)(a): Beginning January 1, 2024, a prescriber shall offer to prescribe or dispense an opioid antagonist to a patient if the patient receives an initial opiate prescription for:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(4)(a)(i): 50 morphine milligram equivalents or more per day, calculated in accordance with guidelines developed by the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(4)(a)(ii): any opiate if the practitioner is also prescribing a benzodiazepine to the patient.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(4)(b): (4)(a) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(4)(b)(i): is administered directly to an ultimate user by a licensed practitioner; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(4)(b)(ii): is for a three-day supply or less.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-19(4)(c): (4) This Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-22 Electronic prescriptions for controlled substances.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-22(1): 26B-2-201; 58-31b-102; 64-13-1; Chapter 28, Veterinary Practice Act Beginning January 1, 2022, each prescription issued for a controlled substance shall be transmitted electronically as an electronic prescription unless the prescription is:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-22(1)(a): 26B-2-201; 58-31b-102; 64-13-1 for a patient residing in an assisted living facility as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-22(1)(b): Chapter 28, Veterinary Practice Act issued by a veterinarian licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-22(1)(c): dispensed by a Department of Veterans Affairs pharmacy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-22(1)(d): issued during a temporary technical or electronic failure at the practitioner's or pharmacy's location; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-22(1)(e): issued in an emergency situation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-22(2): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(d); (1)(e); (1) The division, in collaboration with the appropriate boards that govern the licensure of the licensees who are authorized by the division to prescribe or to dispense controlled substances, shall make rules in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-22(2)(a): (1)(d) require that controlled substances prescribed or dispensed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-22(2)(b): (1)(e) define an emergency situation for purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-22(2)(c): establish additional exemptions to the electronic prescription requirements established in this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-22(2)(d): (1) establish guidelines under which a prescribing practitioner or a pharmacy may obtain an extension of up to two additional years to comply with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-22(2)(e): establish a protocol to follow if the pharmacy that receives the electronic prescription is not able to fill the prescription; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-22(2)(f): establish requirements that comply with federal laws and regulations for software used to issue and dispense electronic prescriptions.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-22(3): Beginning July 1, 2024, a pharmacy software program for receiving an electronic prescription for a controlled substance shall be capable of electronically transferring a prescription to a different pharmacy:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-22(3)(a): upon the request of the patient or the practitioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-22(3)(b): with the approval of a pharmacist at the originating pharmacy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-22(3)(c): if the prescription is unfilled.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-23 Methadone orders authorized.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-23(1): 58-17b-102; 26B-2-201; 58-17b-102; 58-17b-102 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-23(1)(a): 58-17b-102 "Emergency medical order" means a medical order as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-23(1)(b): 26B-2-201 "General acute hospital" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-23(1)(c): 58-17b-102; 58-17b-102 "Qualified pharmacy" means a pharmacy that is located on the premises of a general acute hospital that is licensed as a:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-23(1)(c)(i): 58-17b-102 class A pharmacy as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-23(1)(c)(ii): 58-17b-102 class B pharmacy as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-23(1)(d): "Qualified practitioner" means a practitioner who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-23(1)(d)(i): is registered with the United States Drug Enforcement Administration to issue an emergency medical order; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-23(1)(d)(ii): is working at a general acute hospital.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-23(2): A qualified practitioner may issue an emergency medical order to a qualified pharmacy to dispense up to a 72-hour supply of methadone on behalf of the qualified practitioner:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-23(2)(a): to relieve acute withdrawal symptoms while the qualified practitioner makes arrangements to refer the patient for substance use disorder treatment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37-23(2)(b): in accordance with 21 C.F.R. Sec. 1306.07 and applicable regulation or guidance issued by the United States Drug Enforcement Administration regarding an emergency medical order.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 37a - Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act
**************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-1 Short title.
-------------------------------------------
This chapter shall be known and may be cited as the "Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-2 Purpose.
---------------------------------------
It is the intent of this chapter to discourage the use of narcotics by eliminating paraphernalia designed for processing, ingesting, or otherwise using a controlled substance.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3 "Drug paraphernalia" defined.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(1): Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act As used in this chapter, "drug paraphernalia" means any equipment, product, or material used, or intended for use, to plant, propagate, cultivate, grow, harvest, manufacture, compound, convert, produce, process, prepare, test, analyze, package, repackage, store, contain, conceal, inject, ingest, inhale, or to otherwise introduce a controlled substance into the human body in violation of
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2): (3); 58-37a-5 "Drug paraphernalia" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(a): kits used, or intended for use, in planting, propagating, cultivating, growing, or harvesting any species of plant which is a controlled substance or from which a controlled substance can be derived;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(b): kits used, or intended for use, in manufacturing, compounding, converting, producing, processing, or preparing a controlled substance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(c): isomerization devices used, or intended for use, to increase the potency of any species of plant which is a controlled substance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(d): (3) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(e): scales and balances used, or intended for use, in weighing or measuring a controlled substance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(f): diluents and adulterants, such as quinine hydrochloride, mannitol, mannited, dextrose and lactose, used, or intended for use to cut a controlled substance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(g): separation gins and sifters used, or intended for use to remove twigs, seeds, or other impurities from marihuana;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(h): blenders, bowls, containers, spoons and mixing devices used, or intended for use to compound a controlled substance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(i): capsules, balloons, envelopes, and other containers used, or intended for use to package small quantities of a controlled substance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(j): containers and other objects used, or intended for use to store or conceal a controlled substance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(k): 58-37a-5 hypodermic syringes, needles, and other objects used, or intended for use to parenterally inject a controlled substance into the human body, except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(l): objects used, or intended for use to ingest, inhale, or otherwise introduce a controlled substance into the human body, including but not limited to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(l)(i): metal, wooden, acrylic, glass, stone, plastic, or ceramic pipes with or without screens, permanent screens, hashish heads, or punctured metal bowls;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(l)(ii): water pipes;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(l)(iii): carburetion tubes and devices;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(l)(iv): smoking and carburetion masks;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(l)(v): roach clips: meaning objects used to hold burning material, such as a marihuana cigarette, that has become too small or too short to be held in the hand;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(l)(vi): miniature cocaine spoons and cocaine vials;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(l)(vii): chamber pipes;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(l)(viii): carburetor pipes;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(l)(ix): electric pipes;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(l)(x): air-driven pipes;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(l)(xi): chillums;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(l)(xii): bongs; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(2)(l)(xiii): ice pipes or chillers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(3): "Drug paraphernalia" does not include a testing product or equipment, including a fentanyl test strip, used or intended for use to determine whether a substance contains:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(3)(a): a controlled substance that can cause physical harm or death; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-3(3)(b): a chemical or compound that can cause physical harm or death.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-4 Considerations in determining whether object is drug paraphernalia.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
In determining whether an object is drug paraphernalia, the trier of fact, in addition to all other logically relevant factors, should consider:Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-4(1): statements by an owner or by anyone in control of the object concerning its use;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-4(2): prior convictions, if any, of an owner, or of anyone in control of the object, under any state or federal law relating to a controlled substance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-4(3): the proximity of the object, in time and space, to a direct violation of this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-4(4): the proximity of the object to a controlled substance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-4(5): the existence of any residue of a controlled substance on the object;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-4(6): instructions whether oral or written, provided with the object concerning its use;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-4(7): descriptive materials accompanying the object which explain or depict its use;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-4(8): national and local advertising concerning its use;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-4(9): the manner in which the object is displayed for sale;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-4(10): whether the owner or anyone in control of the object is a legitimate supplier of like or related items to the community, such as a licensed distributor or dealer of tobacco products;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-4(11): direct or circumstantial evidence of the ratio of sales of the object to the total sales of the business enterprise;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-4(12): the existence and scope of legitimate uses of the object in the community;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-4(13): 58-37a-5 whether the object is subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-4(14): expert testimony concerning its use.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-5 Unlawful acts.
---------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-5(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-5(1)(a): It is unlawful for any person to use, or to possess with intent to use, drug paraphernalia to plant, propagate, cultivate, grow, harvest, manufacture, compound, convert, produce, process, prepare, test, analyze, pack, repack, store, contain, conceal, inject, ingest, inhale or otherwise introduce a controlled substance into the human body in violation of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-5(1)(b): (1)(a) Any person who violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-5(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-5(2)(a): It is unlawful for any person to deliver, possess with intent to deliver, or manufacture with intent to deliver, any drug paraphernalia, knowing that the drug paraphernalia will be used to plant, propagate, cultivate, grow, harvest, manufacture, compound, convert, produce, process, prepare, test, analyze, pack, repack, store, contain, conceal, inject, ingest, inhale, or otherwise introduce a controlled substance into the human body in violation of this act.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-5(2)(b): (2)(a) Any person who violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-5(3): Any person 18 years of age or older who delivers drug paraphernalia to a person younger than 18 years of age and who is three years or more younger than the person making the delivery is guilty of a third degree felony.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-5(4): (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-5(4)(a): It is unlawful for any person to place in this state in any newspaper, magazine, handbill, or other publication any advertisement, knowing that the purpose of the advertisement is to promote the sale of drug paraphernalia.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-5(4)(b): (4)(a) Any person who violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-5(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-5(5)(a): A person may not be charged with distribution of hypodermic syringes as drug paraphernalia if at the time of sale or distribution the syringes are in a sealed sterile package and are for a legitimate medical purpose, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-5(5)(a)(i): injection of prescription medications as prescribed by a practitioner; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-5(5)(a)(ii): the prevention of disease transmission.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-5(5)(b): A person may not be charged with possession of hypodermic syringes as drug paraphernalia if the syringe is unused and is in a sealed sterile package.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-5(6): A person may be charged and sentenced for a violation of this section, notwithstanding a charge and sentence for a violation of any other section of this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-6 Seizure -- Forfeiture -- Property rights.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Drug paraphernalia is subject to seizure and forfeiture in accordance with the procedures and substantive protections of

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-7 Sentencing requirements for minors.
------------------------------------------------------------------
If a minor who is under 18 years of age is found by a court to have violated this chapter, the court may order the minor to complete:Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-7(1): 41-6a-501 a screening as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-7(2): 41-6a-501 an assessment as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37a-7(3): 41-6a-501 an educational series as defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 37b - Imitation Controlled Substances Act
**********************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37b-1 Short title.
-------------------------------------------
This act shall be known and may be cited as the "Imitation Controlled Substances Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37b-2 Definitions.
-------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 58-37b-2(1): 58-37-2 "Controlled substance" has the same meaning as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37b-2(2): "Distribute" means the actual, constructive, or attempted sale, transfer, delivery, or dispensing to another of an imitation controlled substance.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37b-2(3): 58-37-2(1)(i)(ii) "Imitation controlled substance" means a substance designed or packaged to substantially resemble any legally or illegally manufactured controlled substance, but that is not:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37b-2(3)(a): a controlled substance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37b-2(3)(b): 58-37-2(1)(i)(ii) represented to be any legally or illegally manufactured controlled substance under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37b-2(4): "Manufacture" means the production, preparation, compounding, processing, encapsulating, tableting, packaging or repackaging, labeling or relabeling, of an imitation controlled substance.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37b-4 Manufacture, distribution or possession of substance unlawful -- Penalty.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
It is unlawful for any person to manufacture, distribute, or possess with intent to distribute, an imitation controlled substance.  Any person who violates this section is guilty of a class A misdemeanor.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37b-6 Use of substance unlawful -- Penalty.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
It is unlawful for any person to use, or to possess with intent to use, an imitation controlled substance.  Any person who violates this section is guilty of a class C misdemeanor.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37b-7 Advertisement of substance unlawful -- Penalty.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
It is unlawful for any person to place any newspaper, magazine, handbill, or other publication, or to post or distribute in any public place, any advertisement or solicitation with reasonable knowledge that the purpose of the advertisement or solicitation is to promote the distribution of imitation controlled substances.  Any person who violates this section is guilty of a class A misdemeanor.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37b-8 Exemption of persons registered under Controlled Substances Act.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
No civil or criminal liability shall be imposed by virtue of this act on any person registered under the Controlled Substances Act who manufactures, distributes, or possesses an imitation controlled substance for use as a placebo or investigational new drug by a registered practitioner in the ordinary course of professional practice or research or on any law enforcement officer acting in the course and legitimate scope of that employment.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37b-9 Sentencing requirements for minors.
------------------------------------------------------------------
If a minor who is under 18 years of age is found by a court to have violated this chapter, the court may order the minor to complete:Utah Code Annotated § 58-37b-9(1): 41-6a-501 a screening as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37b-9(2): 41-6a-501 an assessment as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37b-9(3): 41-6a-501 an educational series as defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 37c - Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act
**************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-1 Short title.
-------------------------------------------
This act shall be known as the "Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-2 Purpose.
---------------------------------------
The purpose of this act is to provide for the licensure of regulated distributors and regulated purchasers engaged in regulated transactions of listed controlled substance precursor chemicals as they are identified in the act or rules adopted pursuant to the act, to provide for maintaining of records and submission of reports with respect to regulated transactions, to provide for reasonable and necessary regulation of defined types of transactions, to provide that violation of the provisions of this act shall be unlawful and unprofessional conduct, and to provide for criminal and administrative actions for that conduct.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3 Definitions.
-------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1): (1)(a); (gg); 58-37c-19.7; 58-37c-19.9; 58-37c-14; 58-37c-14 "Controlled substance precursor" includes a chemical reagent and means any of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(a): Phenyl-2-propanone;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(b): Methylamine;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(c): Ethylamine;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(d): D-lysergic acid;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(e): Ergotamine and its salts;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(f): Diethyl malonate;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(g): Malonic acid;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(h): Ethyl malonate;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(i): Barbituric acid;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(j): Piperidine and its salts;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(k): N-acetylanthranilic acid and its salts;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(l): Pyrrolidine;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(m): Phenylacetic acid and its salts;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(n): Anthranilic acid and its salts;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(o): Morpholine;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(p): Ephedrine;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(q): Pseudoephedrine;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(r): Norpseudoephedrine;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(s): Phenylpropanolamine;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(t): Benzyl cyanide;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(u): Ergonovine and its salts;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(v): 3,4-Methylenedioxyphenyl-2-propanone;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(w): propionic anhydride;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(x): Insosafrole;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(y): Safrole;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(z): Piperonal;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(aa): N-Methylephedrine;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(bb): N-ethylephedrine;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(cc): N-methylpseudoephedrine;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(dd): N-ethylpseudoephedrine;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(ee): Hydriotic acid;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(ff): gamma butyrolactone (GBL), including butyrolactone, 1,2 butanolide, 2-oxanolone, tetrahydro-2-furanone, dihydro-2(3H)-furanone, and tetramethylene glycol, but not including gamma aminobutric acid (GABA);
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(gg): 1,4 butanediol;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(hh): (1)(a); (gg) any salt, isomer, or salt of an isomer of the chemicals listed in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(ii): Crystal iodine;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(jj): Iodine at concentrations greater than 1.5% by weight in a solution or matrix;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(kk): 58-37c-19.7 Red phosphorous, except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(ll): 58-37c-19.9 anhydrous ammonia, except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(mm): 58-37c-14 any controlled substance precursor listed under the provisions of the Federal Controlled Substances Act which is designated by the director under the emergency listing provisions set forth in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(1)(nn): 58-37c-14 any chemical which is designated by the director under the emergency listing provisions set forth in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(2): "Deliver," "delivery," "transfer," or "furnish" means the actual, constructive, or attempted transfer of a controlled substance precursor.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(3): "Matrix" means something, as a substance, in which something else originates, develops, or is contained.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(4): "Person" means any individual, group of individuals, proprietorship, partnership, joint venture, corporation, or organization of any type or kind.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(5): "Practitioner" means a physician, dentist, podiatric physician, veterinarian, pharmacist, scientific investigator, pharmacy, hospital, pharmaceutical manufacturer, or other person licensed, registered, or otherwise permitted to distribute, dispense, conduct research with respect to, administer, or use in teaching or chemical analysis a controlled substance in the course of professional practice or research in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(6)(a): "Regulated distributor" means a person within the state who provides, sells, furnishes, transfers, or otherwise supplies a listed controlled substance precursor chemical in a regulated transaction.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(6)(b): "Regulated distributor" does not include any person excluded from regulation under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(7)(a): "Regulated purchaser" means any person within the state who receives a listed controlled substance precursor chemical in a regulated transaction.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(7)(b): "Regulated purchaser" does not include any person excluded from regulation under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(8): "Regulated transaction" means any actual, constructive or attempted:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(8)(a): transfer, distribution, delivery, or furnishing by a person within the state to another person within or outside of the state of a threshold amount of a listed precursor chemical; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(8)(b): purchase or acquisition by any means by a person within the state from another person within or outside the state of a threshold amount of a listed precursor chemical.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(9): "Retail distributor" means a grocery store, general merchandise store, drug store, or other entity or person whose activities as a distributor are limited almost exclusively to sales for personal use:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(9)(a): in both number of sales and volume of sales; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(9)(b): either directly to walk-in customers or in face-to-face transactions by direct sales.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(10): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Threshold amount of a listed precursor chemical" means any amount of a controlled substance precursor or a specified amount of a controlled substance precursor in a matrix; however, the division may exempt from the provisions of this chapter a specific controlled substance precursor in a specific amount and in certain types of transactions which provisions for exemption shall be defined by the division by rule adopted pursuant to
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(11): 58-1-501 "Unlawful conduct" as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(11)(a): engaging in a regulated transaction without first being appropriately licensed or exempted from licensure under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(11)(b): acting as a regulated distributor and selling, transferring, or in any other way conveying a controlled substance precursor to a person within the state who is not appropriately licensed or exempted from licensure as a regulated purchaser, or selling, transferring, or otherwise conveying a controlled substance precursor to a person outside of the state and failing to report the transaction as required;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(11)(c): acting as a regulated purchaser and purchasing or in any other way obtaining a controlled substance precursor from a person within the state who is not a licensed regulated distributor, or purchasing or otherwise obtaining a controlled substance precursor from a person outside of the state and failing to report the transaction as required;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(11)(d): engaging in a regulated transaction and failing to submit reports and keep required records of inventories required under the provisions of this chapter or rules adopted pursuant to this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(11)(e): making any false statement in any application for license, in any record to be kept, or on any report submitted as required under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(11)(f): with the intent of causing the evasion of the recordkeeping or reporting requirements of this chapter and rules related to this chapter, receiving or distributing any listed controlled substance precursor chemical in any manner designed so that the making of records or filing of reports required under this chapter is not required;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(11)(g): failing to take immediate steps to comply with licensure, reporting, or recordkeeping requirements of this chapter because of lack of knowledge of those requirements, upon becoming informed of the requirements;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(11)(h): presenting false or fraudulent identification where or when receiving or purchasing a listed controlled substance precursor chemical;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(11)(i): creating a chemical mixture for the purpose of evading any licensure, reporting or recordkeeping requirement of this chapter or rules related to this chapter, or receiving a chemical mixture created for that purpose;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(11)(j): if the person is at least 18 years of age, employing, hiring, using, persuading, inducing, enticing, or coercing another person under 18 years of age to violate any provision of this chapter, or assisting in avoiding detection or apprehension for any violation of this chapter by any federal, state, or local law enforcement official; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(11)(k): obtaining or attempting to obtain or to possess any controlled substance precursor or any combination of controlled substance precursors knowing or having a reasonable cause to believe that the controlled substance precursor is intended to be used in the unlawful manufacture of any controlled substance.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(12): 58-1-102 "Unprofessional conduct" as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(12)(a): violation of any provision of this chapter, the Controlled Substance Act of this state or any other state, or the Federal Controlled Substance Act; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-3(12)(b): refusing to allow agents or representatives of the division or authorized law enforcement personnel to inspect inventories or controlled substance precursors or records or reports relating to purchases and sales or distribution of controlled substance precursors as such records and reports are required under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-5 Responsibility of Department of Commerce -- Delegation to the Division of Professional Licensing -- Rulemaking authority of the division.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-5(1): Responsibility for the enforcement of the licensing and reporting provisions of this chapter shall be with the Department of Commerce.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-5(2): The executive director shall delegate specific responsibility within the department to the Division of Professional Licensing.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-5(3): The division shall make, adopt, amend, and repeal rules necessary for the proper administration and enforcement of this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-6 Division duties.
-----------------------------------------------
The division shall be responsible for the licensing and reporting provisions of this chapter and those duties shall include:Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-6(1): providing for a system of licensure of regulated distributors and regulated purchasers;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-6(2): refusing to renew a license or revoking, suspending, restricting, placing on probation, issuing a private or public letter of censure or reprimand, or imposing other appropriate action against a license;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-6(3): with respect to the licensure and reporting provisions of this chapter, investigating or causing to be investigated any violation of this chapter by any person and to cause, when necessary, appropriate administrative action with respect to the license of that person;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-6(4): presenting evidence obtained from investigations conducted by appropriate county attorneys and the Office of the Attorney General for civil or criminal prosecution or for administrative action against a licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-6(5): Title 58, Chapter 1, Division of Professional Licensing Act; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act conducting hearings for the purpose of revoking, suspending, placing on probation, or imposing other appropriate administrative action against the license of regulated distributors or regulated purchasers in accordance with the provisions of
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-6(6): assisting all other law enforcement agencies of the state in enforcing all laws regarding controlled substance precursors;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-6(7): specifying reports, frequency of reports, and conditions under which reports are to be submitted and to whom reports are to be submitted by regulated distributors and regulated purchasers with respect to transactions involving threshold amounts of controlled substance precursors; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-6(8): performing all other functions necessary to fulfill division duties and responsibilities as outlined under this chapter or rules adopted pursuant to this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-7 Controlled substance precursor license.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-7(1): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The division shall issue to persons qualified under the provisions of this chapter and rules adopted pursuant to
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-7(2): It is unlawful for a person to engage in the distribution, sale, or transfer, or in the purchase or obtaining of a controlled substance precursor in a regulated transaction without being licensed or excepted from licensure under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-8 License -- Exceptions from licensure or regulation.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-8(1): 58-37c-7 A person engaged in a regulated transaction under this chapter shall hold a controlled substance precursor license issued under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-8(2): The division shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-8(2)(a): establish the form of application for a license, the requirements for licensure, and fees for initial licensure and renewal; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-8(2)(b): identify required information to be contained in the application as a condition of licensure.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-8(3): A practitioner who holds a Utah Controlled Substance License and a Controlled Substance Registration issued by the Drug Enforcement Administration of the U.S. Government is excepted from licensure under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-8(4): 58-37c-20.5 The purchase, sale, transfer, furnishing, or receipt of a drug intended for lawful use in the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment, or prevention of disease in man or other animals, which contains ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, norpseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine, if the drug is lawfully purchased, sold, transferred, or furnished as an over-the-counter medication without prescription pursuant to the federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act, 21 USC, Sec. 301 et seq., or regulations adopted under that act, are excepted from licensure, reporting, and recordkeeping under this chapter, except that products containing ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine are subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-8(5): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The purchase, sale, transfer, receipt, or manufacture of dietary supplements, vitamins, minerals, herbs, or other similar substances, including concentrates or extracts, which are not otherwise prohibited by law, and which may contain naturally occurring amounts of chemicals or substances listed in this chapter, or in rules adopted pursuant to
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-8(6): 58-37c-18 A purchaser of two ounces or less of crystal iodine in a single transaction is not required to be licensed as a regulated purchaser if the transaction complies with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-8(7): 58-37c-3(1)(ff); (gg) The purchase, sale, transfer, receipt, or manufacture of a product that contains a precursor chemical listed in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-9 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-9(1): Each license issued under this chapter shall be issued in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.  A renewal period may be extended or shortened by as much as one year to maintain established renewal cycles or to change an established renewal cycle.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-9(2): 58-1-308 Each license automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless renewed by the licensee in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-10 Reporting and recordkeeping.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-10(1): 58-37c-8(3); (4) Any person who engages in a regulated transaction, unless excepted under the provisions of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-10(2): The division shall provide reporting forms upon which regulated transactions shall be reported.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-10(3): The division shall furnish copies of reports of transactions under this section to appropriate law enforcement agencies.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-10(4): The division shall adopt rules regulating:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-10(4)(a): records which shall be maintained and reports which shall be submitted by regulated distributors and regulated purchasers with respect to listed controlled substance precursors obtained, distributed, and held in inventory;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-10(4)(b): records which shall be maintained and reports which shall be submitted by regulated distributors and regulated purchasers with respect to extraordinary or unusual regulated transactions and a requirement that in such cases the report must be received at least three working days prior to transfer of the listed controlled substance precursor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-10(4)(c): identification which must be presented by a purchaser of any listed controlled substance precursor before the sale or transfer can be completed and recordkeeping requirements related to such identification presented;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-10(4)(d): filing by each licensee the identification of all locations where any listed controlled substance precursor is held in inventory or stored and amending such filing when any change in location is made;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-10(4)(e): reports and actions which must be taken by a regulated distributor or regulated purchaser in the event of any theft, loss, or shortage of a listed controlled substance precursor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-10(4)(f): reports and actions which must be taken by a regulated distributor relating to a regulated transaction with an out-of-state purchaser;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-10(4)(g): reports and actions which must be taken by a regulated purchaser relating to a regulated transaction with an out-of-state distributor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-10(4)(h): regulated transactions to the extent such regulation is reasonable and necessary to protect the public health, safety, or welfare.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-10(5): 53-3-207; (4)(c) A person who engages in a regulated transaction may not accept a driving privilege card issued in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-12 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for refusal to issue a license to an applicant, for refusal to renew the license of a licensee, to revoke, suspend, restrict, or place on probation the license of a licensee, to issue a public or private reprimand to a licensee, and to issue cease and desist orders shall be in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-13 License does not authorize possession of controlled substances.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Nothing in the provisions of this chapter shall authorize persons not licensed under provisions of

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-14 Emergency listing provision.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-14(1): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act Upon a written finding of cause by the director that the listing of a chemical as a controlled substance precursor is necessary to protect the public health, safety, or welfare, the director may make an emergency listing of that chemical as a controlled substance precursor by adopting a rule pursuant to the provisions of
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-14(2): Such listing shall have effect until the close of the next immediately succeeding regular session of the Legislature.  In the event the Legislature adopts the chemical as a controlled precursor by amendment to this chapter, the chemical shall remain listed under emergency provisions until the effective date of the amendment.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-14(3): Any violation of this chapter dealing with a controlled substance precursor listed under the emergency listing provisions of this section shall constitute a violation subject only to civil or administrative penalties.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-15 Civil forfeiture.
-------------------------------------------------
The following shall be subject to forfeiture in accordance with the procedures and substantive protections ofUtah Code Annotated § 58-37c-15(1): all listed controlled substance precursor chemicals regulated under the provisions of this chapter which have been distributed, possessed, or are intended to be distributed or otherwise transferred in violation of any felony provision of this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-15(2): all property used by any person to facilitate, aid, or otherwise cause the unlawful distribution, transfer, possession, or intent to distribute, transfer, or possess a listed controlled substance precursor chemical in violation of any felony provision of this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-16 Civil penalties.
------------------------------------------------
Any person who is a regulated distributor or a regulated purchaser who acts in violation of the provisions of Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-17 Inspection authority.
-----------------------------------------------------
For the purpose of inspecting, copying, and auditing records and reports required under this chapter and rules adopted pursuant thereto, and for the purpose of inspecting and auditing inventories of listed controlled substance precursors, the director, or his authorized agent, and law enforcement personnel of any federal, state, or local law enforcement agency is authorized to enter the premises of regulated distributors and regulated purchasers during normal business hours to conduct administrative inspections.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-18 Recordkeeping requirements for sale of crystal iodine.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-18(1): 58-37c-10 Any person licensed to engage in a regulated transaction and who sells crystal iodine to another person shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-18(1)(a): 58-37c-10 comply with the recordkeeping requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-18(1)(b): require photo identification of the purchaser;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-18(1)(c): obtain from the purchaser a signature on a certificate of identification provided by the seller; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-18(1)(d): obtain from the purchaser a legible fingerprint, preferably of the right thumb, which shall be placed on the certificate next to the purchaser's signature.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-18(2): (1) Any failure to comply with Subsection

---------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19(2)(a): possesses more than two ounces of crystal iodine; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19(2)(b): offers to sell, sells, or distributes crystal iodine to another person.
