Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5 Iodine solution greater than 1.5% -- Prescription or permit required -- Penalties.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(1): As used in this section, "iodine matrix" means iodine at concentrations greater than 1.5% by weight in a matrix or solution.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(2): 4-1-109 A person may offer to sell, sell, or distribute an iodine matrix only:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(2)(a): as a prescription drug, pursuant to a prescription issued by a veterinarian or physician licensed within the state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(2)(b): 4-1-109 to a person who is actively engaged in the legal practice of animal husbandry of livestock, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(3): Title 58, Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act Prescriptions issued under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(3)(a): shall provide for a specified number of refills;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(3)(b): Title 58, Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act may be issued by electronic means, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(3)(c): may be filled by a person other than the veterinarian or physician issuing the prescription.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(4): A retailer offering iodine matrix for sale:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(4)(a): shall store the iodine matrix so that the public does not have access to the iodine matrix without the direct assistance or intervention of a retail employee;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(4)(b): shall keep a record, which may consist of sales receipts, of each person purchasing iodine matrix; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(4)(c): may, if necessary to ascertain the identity of the purchaser, ask for proof of identification from the purchaser.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(5): (2); 58-37d-4(1)(c); (2); (7) A person engaging in a regulated transaction under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(5)(a): (2) does not present a prescription or is not engaged in animal husbandry, as required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(5)(b): (7) is not excepted under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(6): 58-37c-3(11)(k); 58-37d-4(1)(a); (2); (2) A person is guilty of a class A misdemeanor who, under circumstances not amounting to a violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(6)(a): (2) possesses an iodine matrix without proof of obtaining the solution in compliance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(6)(b): (2) offers to sell, sells, or distributes an iodine matrix in violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(7): (6)(a); Title 58, Chapter 28, Veterinary Practice Act Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(7)(a): a chemistry or chemistry-related laboratory maintained by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(7)(a)(i): a public or private regularly established secondary school; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(7)(a)(ii): a public or private institution of higher education that is accredited by a regional or national accrediting agency recognized by the United States Department of Education;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(7)(b): Title 58, Chapter 28, Veterinary Practice Act a veterinarian licensed to practice under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(7)(c): a general acute hospital; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.5(7)(d): a veterinarian, physician, pharmacist, retail distributor, wholesaler, manufacturer, warehouseman, or common carrier, or an agent of any of these persons who possesses an iodine matrix in the regular course of lawful business activities.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.7 Red phosphorus is a precursor -- Affirmative defense.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.7(1): 58-37c-3(11)(k); 58-37d-4(1)(a) A person is guilty of a class A misdemeanor who is not licensed to engage in a regulated transaction and is not excepted from licensure who, under circumstances not amounting to a violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.7(2): (1) It is an affirmative defense to a charge under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.7(2)(a): is conducting a licensed business that involves red phosphorus in the manufacture of any of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.7(2)(a)(i): the striking surface used for lighting matches, which is sometimes referred to as the striker plate;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.7(2)(a)(ii): flame retardant in polymers; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.7(2)(a)(iii): fireworks, for which the person or entity possesses a federal license to manufacture explosives as required under 27 CFR Chapter II, Part 555, Commerce in Explosives; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.7(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.7(2)(b)(i): is a wholesaler, manufacturer, warehouseman, or common carrier handling red phosphorus, or is an agent of any of these persons; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.7(2)(b)(ii): possesses the substances in the regular course of lawful business activities.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.7(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.7(3)(a): A defendant shall provide written notice of intent to claim an affirmative defense under this section as soon as practicable, but not later than 10 days prior to trial.  The court may waive the notice requirement in the interest of justice for good cause shown, if the prosecutor is not unfairly prejudiced by the lack of timely notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.7(3)(b): The notice shall include the specifics of the affirmative defense.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.7(3)(c): The defendant shall establish the affirmative defense by a preponderance of the evidence.  If the defense is established, it is a complete defense to the charges.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.7(4): (1) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.7(4)(a): a chemistry or chemistry-related laboratory maintained by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.7(4)(a)(i): a public or private regularly established secondary school; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.7(4)(a)(ii): a public or private institution of higher education that is accredited by a regional or national accrediting agency recognized by the United States Department of Education; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.7(4)(b): a retail distributor, wholesaler, manufacturer, warehouseman, or common carrier, or an agent of any of these persons who possesses red phosphorus in the regular course of lawful business activities.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.9 Anhydrous ammonia is a precursor -- Requirements regarding purposes and containers.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.9(1): (2); 58-37c-3(11)(k); 58-37d-4(1)(a) A person is guilty of a class A misdemeanor who is not licensed to engage in a regulated transaction and is not excepted from licensure or exempted under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.9(2): (1); 59-2-502 A person who possesses anhydrous ammonia has an affirmative defense to a charge under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.9(2)(a): 59-2-502 directly involved in or actively operating land in agricultural use as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.9(2)(b): a retail distributor, wholesaler, manufacturer, warehouseman, or common carrier, or an agent of any of these persons, who possesses anhydrous ammonia in the regular course of lawful business activities;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.9(2)(c): directly involved in or actively operating a business or other lawful activity providing or using anhydrous ammonia for refrigeration applications; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-19.9(2)(d): directly involved in or actively operating a lawful business enterprise, including an industrial enterprise, that uses anhydrous ammonia in the regular course of its business activities.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20 Possession of ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine  -- Penalties.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20(1): 58-37c-3(11)(k); 58-37d-4(1)(a) A person is guilty of a class A misdemeanor:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20(1)(a): who is not licensed to engage in regulated transactions and is not excepted from licensure; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20(1)(b): 58-37c-3(11)(k); 58-37d-4(1)(a) who, under circumstances not amounting to a violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20(2): (1); 58-37-2 It is an affirmative defense to a charge under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20(2)(a)(i): is a physician, pharmacist, retail distributor, wholesaler, manufacturer, warehouseman, or common carrier, or an agent of any of these persons; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20(2)(a)(ii): possesses the substances in the regular course of lawful business activities; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20(2)(b): 58-37-2 possesses the substance pursuant to a valid prescription as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20(3)(a): A defendant shall provide written notice of intent to claim an affirmative defense under this section as soon as practicable, but not later than 10 days prior to trial.  The court may waive the notice requirement in the interest of justice for good cause shown, if the prosecutor is not unfairly prejudiced by the lack of timely notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20(3)(b): The notice shall include the specifics of the asserted defense.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20(3)(c): The defendant shall establish the affirmative defense by a preponderance of the evidence.  If the defense is established, it is a complete defense to the charges.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20(4): This section does not apply to dietary supplements, herbs, or other natural products, including concentrates or extracts, which:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20(4)(a): are not otherwise prohibited by law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20(4)(b): may contain naturally occurring ephedrine, ephedrine alkaloids, or pseudoephedrine, or their salts, isomers, or salts of isomers, or a combination of these substances, that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20(4)(b)(i): are contained in a matrix of organic material; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20(4)(b)(ii): do not exceed 15% of the total weight of the natural product.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5 Pseudoephedrine products -- Limitations on retail sale.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"WARNING: Section 1001 of Title 18, United States Code, states that whoever, with respect to the information to be provided in this log, knowingly and willfully falsifies, conceals, or covers up by any trick, scheme, or device a material fact, or makes any materially false, fictitious, or fraudulent statement or representation, or makes or uses any false writing or document, knowing the same to contain any materially false, fictitious, or fraudulent statement or entry, shall be fined not more than $250,000 if an individual or $500,000 if an organization, imprisoned for not more than five years, or both."Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(1)(a): "Mobile retail vendor" means a person or entity that sells product at retail from a stand that is intended to be temporary, or that is capable of being moved from one location to another, whether the stand is located within or on the premises of a fixed facility or is located on unimproved real estate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(1)(b): "Product" means any product, mixture, or preparation, or any combination of products that contain ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine, their salts or isomers, or salts of optical isomers, or a combination of any of these substances.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(2): A retail distributor or a mobile retail vendor may not distribute or sell any product that exceeds the threshold amount of 3.6 grams of ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine, or any combination of these, regardless of the number of transactions, during any 24-hour period.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(3): A mobile retail vendor may not distribute or sell any product that exceeds the threshold amount of 7.5 grams of ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine, regardless of the number of transactions, during any 30-day period.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(4): (5); (5)(d) A retail distributor or a mobile retail vendor may not distribute or sell any product, unless the retail distributor or mobile retail vendor:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(4)(a): stores the product in an area not accessible to customers prior to the sale, which area may include a locked cabinet to display the product in an area accessible to customers, if the locked cabinet may be opened only by the retail distributor or mobile retail vendor or its employees;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(4)(b): stores all nonliquid scheduled listed chemical products in packaging containing blister packs, with each blister containing no more than two dosage units;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(4)(c): requires the purchaser of the product to provide photo identification issued by a governmental agency and that includes the purchaser's date of birth;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(4)(d): (5) maintains a written or electronic log under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(4)(e): (5)(d) provides a notice concerning federal penalties for making false statements or misrepresentations, as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(5): (5)(a); (b); (5) Each retail distributor or mobile retail vendor shall maintain an electronic or written log that contains the following information regarding each person to whom product is distributed or sold under this section.  The log shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(5)(a): the following information, provided or written in the log by the purchaser:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(5)(a)(i): the purchaser's name, address, and date of birth, as demonstrated by a form of personal identification issued by the state or the federal government and that provides an identifying photograph of the person;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(5)(a)(ii): the date and time of the transaction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(5)(a)(iii): the purchaser's signature; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(5)(b): the following information verified or written in by the retail distributor or the mobile retail vendor:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(5)(b)(i): verification of the identity of the purchaser as indicated by the form of identification presented by the purchaser;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(5)(b)(ii): verification that the date and time of the transaction as entered in the log is correct; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(5)(b)(iii): entry of the brand name and the quantity of the product sold in the transaction.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(5)(c): (5)(a); (b) The retail distributor or the mobile retail vendor shall maintain the information required to be recorded in a log under Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(5)(d): (5) In addition to the log information required under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(6): (6)(b); (6)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(6)(a): (6)(b) A person may not knowingly and intentionally use, release, publish, or otherwise make available to any person or entity any information in or obtained from a log maintained by a retail distributor or a mobile retail vendor under this section for any purpose other than those specified in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(6)(b): The retail distributor or its designee shall make information in the log available only to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(6)(b)(i): federal, state, and local law enforcement authorities engaged as a duty of their employment in enforcing laws regulating controlled substances; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(6)(b)(ii): an individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(6)(b)(ii)(A): whose request is for records in the log of that individual's purchase or receipt of product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(6)(b)(ii)(B): who has provided evidence satisfactory to the retail distributor that the individual is in fact the person regarding whom the requested log entry is made.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(6)(c): (6) Any person who knowingly and intentionally releases or modifies any information in the log in violation of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(7): (7)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(7)(a): A person may not purchase product that exceeds the threshold amount of 3.6 grams of ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine, or any combination of these, regardless of the number of transactions, during any 24-hour period.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(7)(b): A person may not purchase product that exceeds the threshold amount of 9 grams of ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine, or any combination of these, regardless of the number of transactions, during any 30-day period.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(7)(c): (7) A violation of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(8): 58-37-2 This section does not apply to any quantity of product possessed by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(8)(a): a physician, pharmacist, veterinarian, retail distributor, wholesaler, manufacturer, warehouseman, or common carrier, or any agent of these persons, who possess the product in the regular course of lawful business activities; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(8)(b): 58-37-2 a person who possesses the product pursuant to a valid prescription as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(9): This section does not apply to dietary supplements, herbs, or other natural products, including concentrates or extracts, which:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(9)(a): are not otherwise prohibited by law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(9)(b): may contain naturally occurring ephedrine, ephedrine alkaloids, or pseudoephedrine, or their salts, isomers, or salts of isomers, or a combination of these substances, that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(9)(b)(i): are contained in a matrix of organic material; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(9)(b)(ii): do not exceed 15% of the total weight of the natural product.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(10): This section does not apply to an individual sales transaction in which the purchaser purchases a single package containing no more than 60 mg of pseudoephedrine.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(11): Title 77, Chapter 2a, Pleas in Abeyance
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(11)(a): A violation of this section is a class B misdemeanor, and a second or subsequent violation of this section is a class A misdemeanor.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-20.5(11)(b): Title 77, Chapter 2a, Pleas in Abeyance For purposes of this section, a plea of guilty or no contest to a violation of this section which is held in abeyance under


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-21 Department of Public Safety enforcement authority.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-21(1): 53-10-103 As used in this section, "division" means the Criminal Investigations and Technical Services Division of the Department of Public Safety, created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-21(2): 58-1-103 The division has authority to enforce this chapter.  To carry out this purpose, the division may:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-21(2)(a): inspect, copy, and audit records, inventories of controlled substance precursors, and reports required under this chapter and rules adopted under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-21(2)(b): enter the premises of regulated distributors and regulated purchasers during normal business hours to conduct administrative inspections;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-21(2)(c): assist the law enforcement agencies of the state in enforcing this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-21(2)(d): conduct investigations to enforce this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-21(2)(e): present evidence obtained from investigations conducted in conjunction with appropriate county and district attorneys and the Office of the Attorney General for civil or criminal prosecution or for administrative action against a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37c-21(2)(f): 58-1-103 work in cooperation with the Division of Professional Licensing, created under Section


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 37d - Clandestine Drug Lab Act
***********************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-1 Short title.
-------------------------------------------
This act shall be known as the "Clandestine Drug Lab Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-2 Purpose.
---------------------------------------
The clandestine production of methamphetamine, other amphetamines, phencyclidine, narcotic analgesic analogs, so-called "designer drugs," various hallucinogens, concentrated tetrahydrocannabinols, counterfeit opioids, cocaine and methamphetamine, base "crack" cocaine and methamphetamine "ice" respectively, has increased dramatically throughout the western states and Utah.  These highly technical illegal operations create substantial dangers to the general public and environment from fire, explosions, and the release of toxic chemicals.  By their very nature these activities often involve a number of persons in a conspiratorial enterprise to bring together all necessary components for clandestine production, to thwart regulation and detection, and to distribute the final product.  Therefore, the Legislature enacts the following Utah Clandestine Laboratory Act for prosecution of specific illegal laboratory operations.  With regard to the controlled substances specified herein, this act shall control, notwithstanding the prohibitions and penalties in

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3 Definitions.
-------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1): Title 58, Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; 58-37c-3(1)(kk); (ll); (1)(d)(i); Title 58, Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act; 58-37f-303; 58-37-3.6 As used in this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(a)(i): "Booby trap" means a concealed or camouflaged device designed to cause bodily injury when triggered by the action of a person making contact with the device.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(a)(ii): "Booby trap" includes guns, ammunition, or explosive devices attached to trip wires or other triggering mechanisms, sharpened stakes, nails, spikes, electrical devices, lines or wires with hooks attached, and devices for the production of toxic fumes or gases.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(b): "Clandestine laboratory operation" means the:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(b)(i): purchase or procurement of chemicals, supplies, equipment, or laboratory location for the illegal manufacture of specified controlled substances;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(b)(ii): transportation or arranging for the transportation of chemicals, supplies, or equipment for the illegal manufacture of specified controlled substances;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(b)(iii): setting up of equipment or supplies in preparation for the illegal manufacture of specified controlled substances;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(b)(iv): activity of compounding, synthesis, concentration, purification, separation, extraction, or other physical or chemical processing of a substance, including a controlled substance precursor, or the packaging, repackaging, labeling, or relabeling of a container holding a substance that is a product of any of these activities, when the substance is to be used for the illegal manufacture of specified controlled substances;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(b)(v): illegal manufacture of specified controlled substances; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(b)(vi): distribution or disposal of chemicals, equipment, supplies, or products used in or produced by the illegal manufacture of specified controlled substances.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(c): Title 58, Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; 58-37c-3(1)(kk); (ll) "Controlled substance precursor" means those chemicals designated in
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(d): (1)(d)(i) "Counterfeit opioid" means an opioid or container or labeling of an opioid that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(d)(i): (1)(d)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(d)(i)(A): without authorization bears the trademark, trade name, or other identifying mark, imprint, number, device, or any likeness of them, of a manufacturer, distributor, or dispenser other than the person or persons who in fact manufactured, distributed, or dispensed the substance which falsely purports to be an opioid distributed by another manufacturer, distributor, or dispenser; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(d)(i)(B): (1)(d)(i) a reasonable person would believe to be an opioid distributed by an authorized manufacturer, distributor, or dispenser based on the appearance of the substance as described under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(d)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(d)(ii)(A): is falsely represented to be any legally or illegally manufactured opioid; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(d)(ii)(B): a reasonable person would believe to be a legal or illegal opioid.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(e): "Disposal" means the abandonment, discharge, deposit, injection, dumping, spilling, leaking, or placing of hazardous or dangerous material into or on property, land, or water so that the material may enter the environment, be emitted into the air, or discharged into any waters, including groundwater.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(f): "Hazardous or dangerous material" means a substance that because of its quantity, concentration, physical characteristics, or chemical characteristics may cause or significantly contribute to an increase in mortality, an increase in serious illness, or may pose a substantial present or potential future hazard to human health or the environment when improperly treated, stored, transported, disposed of, or otherwise improperly managed.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(g): Title 58, Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act "Illegal manufacture of specified controlled substances" means in violation of
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(g)(i): compounding, synthesis, concentration, purification, separation, extraction, or other physical or chemical processing for the purpose of producing methamphetamine, other amphetamine compounds as listed in Schedule I of the Utah Controlled Substances Act, phencyclidine, narcotic analgesic analogs as listed in Schedule I of the Utah Controlled Substances Act, lysergic acid diethylamide, mescaline, tetrahydrocannabinol, or counterfeit opioid;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(g)(ii): conversion of cocaine or methamphetamine to their base forms; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(g)(iii): extraction, concentration, or synthesis of tetrahydrocannabinol.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(h): 58-37f-303 "Opioid" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(1)(i): 58-37-3.6 "Tetrahydrocannabinol" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-3(2): 58-37-2 Unless otherwise specified, the definitions in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-4 Prohibited acts -- Second degree felony.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-4(1): Title 58, Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act; Title 58, Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act It is unlawful for any person to knowingly or intentionally:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-4(1)(a): possess a controlled substance or a controlled substance precursor with the intent to engage in a clandestine laboratory operation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-4(1)(b): possess laboratory equipment or supplies with the intent to engage in a clandestine laboratory operation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-4(1)(c): sell, distribute, or otherwise supply a controlled substance, controlled substance precursor, laboratory equipment, or laboratory supplies, knowing or having reasonable cause to believe any of these items will be used for a clandestine laboratory operation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-4(1)(d): Title 58, Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act evade the recordkeeping provisions of
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-4(1)(e): conspire with or aid another to engage in a clandestine laboratory operation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-4(1)(f): Title 58, Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act produce or manufacture, or possess with intent to produce or manufacture a controlled or counterfeit substance except as authorized under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-4(1)(g): transport or convey a controlled or counterfeit substance with the intent to distribute or to be distributed by the person transporting or conveying the controlled or counterfeit substance or by another person regardless of whether the final destination for the distribution is within this state or another location; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-4(1)(h): engage in compounding, synthesis, concentration, purification, separation, extraction, or other physical or chemical processing of any substance, including a controlled substance precursor, or the packaging, repackaging, labeling, or relabeling of a container holding a substance that is a product of any of these activities, knowing or having reasonable cause to believe that the substance is a product of any of these activities and will be used in the illegal manufacture of specified controlled substances.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-4(2): (1) A person who violates Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-5 Prohibited acts -- First degree felony.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-5(1): 58-37d-4(1)(a); (b); (e); (f); (h) A person who violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-5(1)(a): possession of a firearm;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-5(1)(b): use of a booby trap;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-5(1)(c): illegal possession, transportation, or disposal of hazardous or dangerous material or while transporting or causing to be transported materials in furtherance of a clandestine laboratory operation, there was created a substantial risk to human health or safety or a danger to the environment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-5(1)(d): intended laboratory operation was to take place or did take place within 500 feet of a residence, place of business, church, or school;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-5(1)(e): clandestine laboratory operation actually produced any amount of a specified controlled substance or a counterfeit opioid; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-5(1)(f): intended clandestine laboratory operation was for the production of cocaine base or methamphetamine base.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-5(2): (1)(a); (f) If the trier of fact finds that two or more of the conditions listed in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-5(2)(a): probation shall not be granted;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-5(2)(b): the execution or imposition of sentence shall not be suspended; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-5(2)(c): the court shall not enter a judgment for a lower category of offense.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-6 Legal inference of intent -- Illegal possession of a controlled substance precursor or clandestine laboratory equipment.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The trier of fact may infer that a defendant intended to engage in a clandestine laboratory operation if the defendant:Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-6(1): is in illegal possession of a controlled substance precursor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-6(2): illegally possesses or attempts to illegally possess a controlled substance or controlled substance precursor and is in possession of any one of the following pieces of equipment:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-6(2)(a): glass reaction vessel;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-6(2)(b): separatory funnel;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-6(2)(c): glass condenser;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-6(2)(d): analytical balance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-6(2)(e): heating mantle;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-6(2)(f): pill press machine or similar device;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-6(2)(g): closed loop extraction system;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-6(2)(h): extraction tube; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-6(2)(i): rotary evaporator.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-7 Seizure and forfeiture.
------------------------------------------------------
Chemicals, equipment, supplies, vehicles, aircraft, vessels, and personal and real property used in furtherance of a clandestine laboratory operation are subject to seizure and forfeiture under the procedures and substantive protections of

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-8 Applicability of Title 76 prosecutions under this chapter.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Unless specifically excluded in or inconsistent with the provisions of this chapter, the provisions of

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-9 Department of Public Safety enforcement authority.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-9(1): 53-10-103 As used in this section, "division" means the Criminal Investigations and Technical Services Division of the Department of Public Safety, created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-9(2): 58-1-103 The division has authority to enforce this chapter.  To carry out this purpose, the division may:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-9(2)(a): assist the law enforcement agencies of the state in enforcing this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-9(2)(b): conduct investigations to enforce this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-9(2)(c): present evidence obtained from investigations conducted in conjunction with appropriate county and district attorneys and the Office of the Attorney General for civil or criminal prosecution or for administrative action against a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37d-9(2)(d): 58-1-103 work in cooperation with the Division of Professional Licensing, created under Section


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 37e - Drug Dealer's Liability Act
**************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-1 Title.
-------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Drug Dealer's Liability Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-2 Definitions.
-------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-2(1): "Illegal drug" means a drug or controlled substance whose distribution is a violation of state law.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-2(2): "Illegal drug market" means the support system of illegal drug-related operations, from production to retail sales, through which an illegal drug reaches the user.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-2(3): 58-37e-7 "Illegal drug market target community" is the area described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-2(4): "Individual drug user" means the individual whose illegal drug use is the basis of an action brought under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-2(5): "Level 1 offense" means possession of 16 ounces or more or distribution of four ounces or more of a mixture containing a specified illegal drug or possession of 16 pounds or more or 100 plants or more or distribution of 10 pounds or more of marijuana.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-2(6): "Level 2 offense" means possession of eight ounces or more, but less than 16 ounces, or distribution of two ounces or more, but less than four ounces, of a mixture containing a specified illegal drug or possession of eight pounds or more or 75 plants or more, but less than 16 pounds or 100 plants, or distribution of more than five pounds, but less than 10 pounds of marijuana.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-2(7): "Level 3 offense" means possession of four ounces or more, but less than eight ounces, or distribution of one ounce or more, but less than two ounces, of a mixture containing a specified illegal drug or possession of four pounds or more or 50 plants or more, but less than eight pounds or 75 plants, or distribution of more than one pound, but less than five pounds of marijuana.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-2(8): "Level 4 offense" means possession of 1/4 ounce or more, but less than four ounces, or distribution of less than one ounce of a mixture containing a specified illegal drug or possession of one pound or more or 25 plants or more, but less than four pounds or 50 plants, or distribution of less than one pound of marijuana.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-2(9): "Participate in the illegal drug market" means to distribute, possess with an intent to distribute, commit an act intended to facilitate the marketing or distribution of, or agree to distribute, possess with an intent to distribute, or commit an act intended to facilitate the marketing and distribution of an illegal drug.  "Participate in the illegal drug market" does not include the purchase or receipt of an illegal drug for personal use only.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-2(10): "Period of illegal drug use" means, in relation to the individual drug user, the time of the individual's first use of an illegal drug to the accrual of the cause of the action.  The period of illegal drug use is presumed to commence two years before the cause of action accrues unless the defendant proves otherwise by clear and convincing evidence.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-2(11): "Person" means an individual, governmental entity, corporation, firm, trust, partnership, or incorporated or unincorporated association, existing under or authorized by the laws of this state, another state, or foreign country.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-2(12): "Place of illegal drug activity" means, in relation to the individual drug user, each county in which the individual possesses or uses an illegal drug or in which the individual resides, attends school, or is employed during the period of the individual's illegal drug use, unless the defendant proves otherwise by clear and convincing evidence.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-2(13): "Place of participation" means, in relation to a defendant in an action brought under this chapter, each county in which the person participates in the illegal drug market or in which the person resides, attends school, or is employed during the period of the person's participation in the illegal drug market.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-2(14): "Specified illegal drug" means cocaine, heroin, or methamphetamine and any other controlled substance the distribution of which is a violation of state law.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-3 Liability for participation in the illegal drug market.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-3(1): A person who knowingly participates in the illegal drug market within this state is liable for civil damages as provided in this chapter.  A person may recover damages under this chapter for injury resulting from an individual's use of an illegal drug.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-3(2): A law enforcement officer or agency, the state, or a person acting at the direction of a law enforcement officer or agency or the state is not liable for participating in the illegal drug market, if the participation is in furtherance of an official investigation.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-4 Recovery of damages.
---------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-4(1): One or more of the following persons may bring an action for damages caused by an individual's use of an illegal drug:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-4(1)(a): a parent, legal guardian, child, spouse, or sibling of the individual drug user;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-4(1)(b): an individual who was exposed to an illegal drug in utero;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-4(1)(c): an employer of the individual drug user;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-4(1)(d): a medical facility, insurer, governmental entity, employer, or other entity that funds a drug treatment program or employee assistance program for the individual drug user or that otherwise expended money on behalf of the individual drug user; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-4(1)(e): a person injured as a result of the willful, reckless, or negligent actions of an individual drug user.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-4(2): A person entitled to bring an action under this section may seek damages from one or more of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-4(2)(a): a person who knowingly distributed, or knowingly participated in the chain of distribution of, an illegal drug that was actually used by the individual drug user;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-4(2)(b): a person who knowingly participated in the illegal drug market if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-4(2)(b)(i): the place of illegal drug activity by the individual drug user is within the illegal drug market target community of the defendant;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-4(2)(b)(ii): the defendant's participation in the illegal drug market was connected with the same type of illegal drug used by the individual drug user; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-4(2)(b)(iii): the defendant participated in the illegal drug market at any time during the individual drug user's period of illegal drug use.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-4(3): A person entitled to bring an action under this section may recover all of the following damages:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-4(3)(a): economic damages, including the cost of treatment and rehabilitation, medical expenses, loss of economic or educational potential, loss of productivity, absenteeism, support expenses, accidents or injury, and any other pecuniary loss proximately caused by the illegal drug use;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-4(3)(b): noneconomic damages, including physical and emotional pain, suffering, physical impairment, emotional distress, mental anguish, disfigurement, loss of enjoyment, loss of companionship, services and consortium, and other nonpecuniary losses proximately caused by an individual's use of an illegal drug;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-4(3)(c): exemplary damages;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-4(3)(d): reasonable attorney's fees; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-4(3)(e): costs of suit, including reasonable expenses for expert testimony.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-5 Limited recovery of damages.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-5(1): An individual drug user may not bring an action for damages caused by the use of an illegal drug, except as otherwise provided in this section.  An individual drug user may bring an action for damages caused by the use of an illegal drug only if all of the following conditions are met:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-5(1)(a): the individual personally discloses to narcotics enforcement authorities, more than six months before filing the action, all of the information known to the individual regarding all that individual's sources of illegal drugs;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-5(1)(b): the individual has not used an illegal drug within the six months before filing the action; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-5(1)(c): the individual continues to remain free of the use of an illegal drug throughout the pendency of the action.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-5(2): A person entitled to bring an action under this section may seek damages only from a person who distributed, or is in the chain of distribution of, an illegal drug that was actually used by the individual drug user.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-5(3): A person entitled to bring an action under this section may recover only the following damages:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-5(3)(a): economic damages, including the cost of treatment, rehabilitation, and medical expenses, loss of economic or educational potential, loss of productivity, absenteeism, accidents or injury, and any other pecuniary loss proximately caused by the person's illegal drug use;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-5(3)(b): reasonable attorney's fees; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-5(3)(c): costs of suit, including reasonable expenses for expert testimony.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-6 Third party cases.
-------------------------------------------------
A third party may not pay damages awarded under this chapter, or provide a defense or money for a defense, on behalf of an insured under a contract of insurance or indemnification.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-7 Illegal drug market target community.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
A person whose participation in the illegal drug market constitutes the following level offense shall be considered to have the following illegal drug market target community:Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-7(1): Level 4: the county in which the defendant's place of participation is situated;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-7(2): (1) Level 3: the target community described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-7(3): (2) Level 2: the target community described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-7(4): Level 1: the state.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-8 Joinder of parties.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-8(1): Two or more persons may join in one action under this chapter as plaintiffs if their respective actions have at least one place of illegal drug activity in common and if any portion of the period of illegal drug use overlaps with the period of illegal drug use for every other plaintiff.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-8(2): Two or more persons may be joined in one action under this chapter as defendants if those persons are liable to at least one plaintiff.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-8(3): A plaintiff need not be interested in obtaining and a defendant need not be interested in defending against all the relief demanded.  Judgment may be given for one or more plaintiffs according to their respective rights to relief and against one or more defendants according to their respective liabilities.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-9 Comparative responsibility.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-9(1): An action by an individual drug user is governed by the principles of comparative responsibility.  Comparative responsibility attributed to the plaintiff does not bar recovery but diminishes the award of compensatory damages proportionally, according to the measure of responsibility attributed to the plaintiff.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-9(2): The burden of proving the comparative responsibility of the plaintiff is on the defendant, which shall be shown by clear and convincing evidence.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-9(3): Comparative responsibility may not be applied in an action brought by a third party who was not an individual drug user.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-10 Contribution among and recovery from multiple defendants.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A person subject to liability under this chapter has a right of action for contribution against another person subject to liability under this chapter.  Contribution may be enforced either in the original action or by a separate action brought for that purpose.  A plaintiff may seek recovery in accordance with this chapter and existing law against a person whom a defendant has asserted a right of contribution.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-11 Standard of proof -- Effect of criminal drug conviction.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-11(1): Proof of participation in the illegal drug market in an action brought under this chapter shall be shown by clear and convincing evidence.  Except as otherwise provided in this chapter, other elements of the cause of action shall be shown by a preponderance of the evidence.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-11(2): A person against whom recovery is sought who has a criminal conviction pursuant to state drug laws or the Comprehensive Drug Abuse Prevention and Control Act of 1970, Pub. L. 91-513, 84 Stat. 1236, codified at 21 U.S.C. Sec. 801 et seq., is estopped from denying participation in the illegal drug market.  A conviction is also prima facie evidence of the person's participation in the illegal drug market during the two years preceding the date of an act giving rise to a conviction.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-11(3): The absence of a criminal drug conviction of a person against whom recovery is sought does not bar an action against that person.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-12 Prejudgment attachment and execution on judgments.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-12(1): (3) A plaintiff under this chapter, subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-12(2): A person against whom a judgment has been rendered under this chapter is not eligible to exempt any property, of whatever kind, from process to levy or process to execute on the judgment, unless the property is exempt by operation of law.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-12(3): Any assets sought to satisfy a judgment under this chapter that are named in a forfeiture action or have been seized for forfeiture by any state or federal agency may not be used to satisfy a judgment unless and until the assets have been released following the conclusion of the forfeiture action or released by the agency that seized the assets.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-13 Statute of limitations.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-13(1): Except as otherwise provided in this section, a claim under this chapter may not be brought more than two years after the cause of action accrues.  A cause of action accrues under this chapter when a person who may recover has reason to know of the harm from illegal drug use that is the basis for the cause of action and has reason to know that the illegal drug use is the cause of the harm.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-13(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-13(2)(a): For a plaintiff, the statute of limitations under this section is tolled while the individual potential plaintiff is incapacitated by the use of an illegal drug to the extent that the individual cannot reasonably be expected to seek recovery under this chapter or as otherwise provided by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-13(2)(b): For a defendant, the statute of limitations under this section is tolled until six months after the individual potential defendant is convicted of a criminal drug offense or as otherwise provided by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-13(3): The statute of limitations under this chapter for a claim based on participation in the illegal drug market that occurred prior to the effective date of this chapter does not begin to run until the effective date of this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-14 Representation of governmental entities -- Stay of action.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-14(1): A county attorney, district attorney, or city attorney may represent any political subdivision of the state, and the attorney general may represent the state in an action brought under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37e-14(2): On motion by a governmental agency involved in a drug investigation or prosecution, an action brought under this chapter shall be stayed until the completion of the criminal investigation or prosecution that gave rise to the motion for a stay of the action.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 37f - Controlled Substance Database Act
********************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Controlled Substance Database Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-102(1): 58-37-2 The definitions in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-102(2)(a): 58-17b-201 "Board" means the Utah State Board of Pharmacy created in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-102(2)(c): 58-37f-201 "Database" means the controlled substance database created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-102(2)(d): "De-identified" is as defined in 45 C.F.R. 164.502(d) and 164.514(a), (b), and (c).
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-102(2)(e): 26B-2-201 "Health care facility" is as defined in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-102(2)(h)(ii): (2)(h)(i) the practitioner described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-102(2)(i): 26B-2-101 "Substance abuse treatment program" is as defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-201 Controlled substance database -- Creation -- Purpose.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-201(1): There is created within the division a controlled substance database.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-201(2): The division shall administer and direct the functioning of the database in accordance with this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-201(3): The division may, under state procurement laws, contract with another state agency or a private entity to establish, operate, or maintain the database.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-201(4): The division shall, in collaboration with the board, determine whether to operate the database within the division or contract with another entity to operate the database, based on an analysis of costs and benefits.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-201(5): 58-37f-203; 26B-2-225; 41-6a-502(5); 41-6a-502.5(5)(b); 58-37-8(1)(e); 58-37-8(2)(g); Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act The purpose of the database is to contain:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-201(5)(a): 58-37f-203 the data described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-201(5)(b): 26B-2-225 data reported to the division under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-201(5)(c): 41-6a-502(5); 41-6a-502.5(5)(b) data reported to the division under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-201(5)(d): 58-37-8(1)(e); 58-37-8(2)(g); Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act data reported to the division under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-201(6): Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act The division shall maintain the database in an electronic file or by other means established by the division to facilitate use of the database for identification of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-201(6)(a): prescribing practices and patterns of prescribing and dispensing controlled substances;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-201(6)(b): practitioners prescribing controlled substances in an unprofessional or unlawful manner;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-201(6)(c): individuals receiving prescriptions for controlled substances from licensed practitioners, and who subsequently obtain dispensed controlled substances from a drug outlet in quantities or with a frequency inconsistent with generally recognized standards of dosage for that controlled substance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-201(6)(d): individuals presenting forged or otherwise false or altered prescriptions for controlled substances to a pharmacy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-201(6)(e): individuals admitted to a general acute hospital for poisoning or overdose involving a prescribed controlled substance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-201(6)(f): Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act individuals convicted for:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-201(6)(f)(i): driving under the influence of a prescribed controlled substance that renders the individual incapable of safely operating a vehicle;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-201(6)(f)(ii): driving while impaired, in whole or in part, by a prescribed controlled substance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-201(6)(f)(iii): Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act certain violations of


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-202 Duties of board in relation to the database.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The board shall advise the division regarding:Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-202(1): establishing, maintaining, and operating the database;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-202(2): access to the database and how access is obtained; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-202(3): control of information contained in the database.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-301 Access to database.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-301(1): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The division shall make rules, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-301(1)(a): effectively enforce the limitations on access to the database as described in this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-301(1)(b): establish standards and procedures to ensure accurate identification of individuals requesting information or receiving information without request from the database.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-301(2): 58-4a-103(1); Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act; 26B-3-202; (2)(i); (3)(a); (2)(h); (2)(h)(i); (ii); 58-37f-203(7); (2)(h); 58-37f-203(7); (7); 26B-3-104; (2)(o)(i)(A); (2)(o)(i)(A); (2)(o)(i)(A); (2)(o); (2)(p); (2); Title 63A, Chapter 13, Part 2, Office and Powers; Title 34A, Chapter 2, Workers' Compensation Act; Title 34A, Chapter 3, Utah Occupational Disease Act; 34A-2-601; 31A-1-301; 31A-22-605(7) The division shall make information in the database and information obtained from other state or federal prescription monitoring programs by means of the database available only to the following individuals, in accordance with the requirements of this chapter and division rules:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-301(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-301(2)(a)(i): personnel of the division specifically assigned to conduct investigations related to controlled substance laws under the jurisdiction of the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-301(2)(a)(ii): the following law enforcement officers, but the division may only provide nonidentifying information, limited to gender, year of birth, and postal ZIP code, regarding individuals for whom a controlled substance has been prescribed or to whom a controlled substance has been dispensed:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-301(2)(a)(ii)(A): a law enforcement agency officer who is engaged in a joint investigation with the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-301(2)(a)(ii)(B): a law enforcement agency officer to whom the division has referred a suspected criminal violation of controlled substance laws;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-301(2)(b): authorized division personnel engaged in analysis of controlled substance prescription information as a part of the assigned duties and responsibilities of their employment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-301(2)(c): a board member if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-301(2)(c)(i): the board member is assigned to monitor a licensee on probation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-301(2)(c)(ii): the board member is limited to obtaining information from the database regarding the specific licensee on probation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-301(2)(d): 58-4a-103(1); Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act a person the division authorizes to obtain that information on behalf of the Utah Professionals Health Program established in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-301(2)(f)(ii)(D): are conducted in a research facility, as defined by division rule, that is associated with a university or college accredited by one or more regional or national accrediting agencies recognized by the United States Department of Education;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-301(2)(f)(iii): the designee protects the information as a business associate of the Department of Health and Human Services; and

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-302 Other restrictions on access to database.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-302(1): A person who is a relative of a deceased individual is not entitled to access information from the database relating to the deceased individual based on the fact or claim that the person is:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-302(1)(a): related to the deceased individual; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-302(1)(b): subrogated to the rights of the deceased individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-302(2): (3); (4) Except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-302(3): (2); 58-37f-301(2)(g); (2) The restrictions described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-302(3)(a): to enforce the provisions of this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-302(3)(b): 58-37f-301(2)(g); (2) against a managed care organization, as defined in 42 C.F.R. Sec. 438.2, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-302(3)(b)(i): the action is related to Medicaid coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-302(3)(b)(ii): 58-37f-301(2)(g) the managed care organization has entered into a written agreement with the Department of Health as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-302(3)(b)(iii): (2) the division and the Department of Health agree in writing not to apply the restrictions described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-302(4): (4); (4); (4); (4)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-302(4)(a): (4); (4) Subject to the requirements of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-302(4)(a)(i): order the release of information contained in the database if the court determines good cause has been shown in accordance with Rule 16, Utah Rules of Criminal Procedure; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-302(4)(a)(ii): (4) at any time order that information released under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-302(4)(b): (4); (4)(c) Upon the motion of a defendant, a court may only issue an order compelling the production of database information under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-302(4)(c): A motion by a defendant for database information pertaining to a victim shall be served by the defendant on:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-302(4)(c)(i): the prosecutor and on counsel for the victim or victim's representative; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-302(4)(c)(ii): the prosecutor if the victim is unrepresented by counsel.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-302(4)(d): Upon a defendant's motion for database information pertaining to a victim, if the court determines that good cause exists to order release of database information pertaining to the victim, the court shall conduct an in camera review of the database information and may only disclose to the defense and prosecution those portions of database information that are relevant to the state criminal proceeding.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-303(1): 58-17b-102; 58-37f-301(3)(c); 58-37f-301(5)(c); 58-17b-102; 58-37-4(2)(b)(i); (2)(b)(ii); 58-17b-102; 58-37-2; 58-37-6; 58-17b-102 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-303(1)(a): 58-17b-102 "Dispense" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-303(1)(b): 58-37f-301(3)(c); 58-37f-301(5)(c) "EDS user":
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-303(1)(b)(i): 58-37f-301(3)(c) means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-303(1)(b)(i)(A): a prescriber;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-303(1)(b)(i)(B): a pharmacist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-303(1)(b)(i)(C): a pharmacy intern;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-303(1)(b)(i)(D): a pharmacy technician; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-303(1)(b)(i)(E): 58-37f-301(3)(c) an individual granted access to the database under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-303(1)(b)(ii): 58-37f-301(5)(c) does not mean an individual whose access to the database has been revoked by the division pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-303(1)(c): 58-17b-102 "Electronic data system" means a software product or an electronic service used by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-303(1)(c)(i): a prescriber to manage electronic health records; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-303(1)(c)(ii): 58-17b-102 a pharmacist, pharmacy intern, or pharmacy technician working under the general supervision of a licensed pharmacist, for the purpose of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-303(1)(c)(ii)(A): managing the dispensing of prescription drugs; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-303(1)(c)(ii)(B): 58-17b-102 providing pharmaceutical care as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-303(1)(d): 58-37-4(2)(b)(i); (2)(b)(ii) "Opioid" means any substance listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-303(1)(e): 58-17b-102 "Pharmacist" means the same as that term is defined in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-304 Database utilization.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-304(1): 58-17b-303; 58-17b-304; 58-17b-305; Title 58, Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act; Title 58, Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act; 58-37-4(2)(b)(i); (2)(b)(ii); 58-37-4(2)(c) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-304(1)(a): 58-17b-303; 58-17b-304; 58-17b-305; Title 58, Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act "Dispenser" means a licensed pharmacist, as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-304(1)(b): "Outpatient" means a setting in which an individual visits a licensed healthcare facility or a healthcare provider's office for a diagnosis or treatment but is not admitted to a licensed healthcare facility for an overnight stay.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-304(1)(c): Title 58, Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act "Prescriber" means an individual authorized to prescribe a controlled substance under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-304(1)(d): 58-37-4(2)(b)(i); (2)(b)(ii) "Schedule II opioid" means those substances listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-304(1)(e): 58-37-4(2)(c) "Schedule III opioid" means those substances listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-304(2): (2)(a); 58-37f-301(2)(i); (j); (2)(a); (b); 58-37f-301; (2)(a); (b); (2)(a); (b); (2); 58-37f-301
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-304(2)(a): A prescriber shall check the database for information about a patient before the first time the prescriber gives a prescription to a patient for a Schedule II opioid or a Schedule III opioid.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-304(2)(b): If a prescriber is repeatedly prescribing a Schedule II opioid or Schedule III opioid to a patient, the prescriber shall periodically review information about the patient in:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-304(2)(b)(i): the database; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-304(2)(b)(ii): other similar records of controlled substances the patient has filled.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-304(2)(c): (2)(a); 58-37f-301(2)(i); (j) A prescriber may assign the access and review required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-304(2)(d): (2)(a); (b); 58-37f-301

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402 Online tutorial and test relating to the database -- Fees -- Rulemaking authority -- Continuing professional education credit.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(1): The division shall develop an online tutorial and an online test for registration to use the database that provides instruction regarding, and tests, the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(1)(a): the purpose of the database;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(1)(b): how to access and use the database;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(1)(c): the law relating to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(1)(c)(i): the use of the database; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(1)(c)(ii): the information submitted to, and obtained from, the database; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(1)(d): basic knowledge that is important for all people who prescribe controlled substances to know in order to help ensure the health and safety of an individual to whom a controlled substance is prescribed.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(2): The division shall design the test described in this section as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(2)(a): an individual shall answer all of the questions correctly in order to pass the test;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(2)(b): an individual shall be permitted to immediately retake the portion of the test that the individual answers incorrectly as many times as necessary for the individual to pass the test; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(2)(c): after an individual takes the test, the test software shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(2)(c)(i): immediately inform the individual of the number of questions that were answered incorrectly;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(2)(c)(ii): provide the correct answers;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(2)(c)(iii): replay the portion of the tutorial that relates to the incorrectly answered questions; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(2)(c)(iv): ask the individual the incorrectly answered questions again.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(3): The division shall design the tutorial and test so that it is possible to take the tutorial and complete the test in 20 minutes or less, if the individual answers all of the questions correctly on the first attempt.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(4): The division shall ensure that the tutorial and test described in this section are fully functional and available for use online on or before November 1, 2010.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(5): 63J-1-504 The division shall impose a fee, in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(5)(a): develop, implement, and administer the tutorial and test described in this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(5)(b): fulfill the other duties imposed on the division under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(6): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The division may make rules, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(6)(a): develop, implement, and administer the tutorial and test described in this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(6)(b): fulfill the other duties imposed on the division under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-402(7): (1)(d) The Department of Health shall assist the division in developing the portion of the test described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-501 Costs of operating database and recording and submitting data.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-501(1): All department and division costs necessary to establish and operate the database shall be funded by appropriations from:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-501(1)(a): the Commerce Service Account; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-501(1)(b): the General Fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-501(2): All costs associated with recording and submitting data as required in this chapter shall be assumed by the submitting pharmacy.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-602 Failure by pharmacist to submit information -- Penalties.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-602(1): 58-37f-203; 58-1-401; 58-37f-203 The failure of a pharmacist-in-charge, a pharmacy, or a third party under contract with a pharmacist-in-charge to submit information to the database in accordance with the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-602(1)(a): refuse to issue a license to the pharmacist-in-charge or the pharmacy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-602(1)(b): refuse to renew the license of the pharmacist-in-charge or the pharmacy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-602(1)(c): revoke, suspend, restrict, or place on probation the license of the pharmacist-in-charge or the pharmacy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-602(1)(d): issue a public reprimand to the pharmacist-in-charge or the pharmacy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-602(1)(e): issue a cease and desist order to the pharmacist-in-charge, the pharmacy, or the third party; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-37f-602(1)(f): 58-37f-203 impose a civil penalty on the pharmacist-in-charge, the pharmacy, or the third party of up to $1,000 for each dispensed prescription regarding which the required information is not submitted in accordance with the requirements of Section
