Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304 Exemptions from licensure.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1): 58-1-307; Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act; Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act; Chapter 44a, Nurse Midwife Practice Act; Chapter 24b, Physical Therapy Practice Act; Chapter 24b, Physical Therapy Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; Chapter 73, Chiropractic Physician Practice Act; Chapter 40a, Athletic Trainer Licensing Act; Chapter 71, Naturopathic Physician Practice Act; Chapter 42a, Occupational Therapy Practice Act; Chapter 42a, Occupational Therapy Practice Act In addition to the exemptions from licensure in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(a): Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act a physician or surgeon licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(b): Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act a physician assistant licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(c): Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act; Chapter 44a, Nurse Midwife Practice Act a nurse licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(d): Chapter 24b, Physical Therapy Practice Act a physical therapist licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(e): Chapter 24b, Physical Therapy Practice Act a physical therapist assistant licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(f): Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act an osteopathic physician or surgeon licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(g): Chapter 73, Chiropractic Physician Practice Act a chiropractic physician licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(h): a hospital staff member employed by a hospital, who practices massage as part of the staff member's responsibilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(i): Chapter 40a, Athletic Trainer Licensing Act an athletic trainer licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(j): a student in training enrolled in a massage therapy school approved by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(k): Chapter 71, Naturopathic Physician Practice Act a naturopathic physician licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(l): Chapter 42a, Occupational Therapy Practice Act; Chapter 42a, Occupational Therapy Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(l)(i): Chapter 42a, Occupational Therapy Practice Act an occupational therapist licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(l)(ii): Chapter 42a, Occupational Therapy Practice Act an occupational therapy assistant licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(m): an individual performing gratuitous massage; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(n): an individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(n)(i): certified by or through, and in good standing with, an industry organization that is recognized by the division and that represents a profession with established standards and ethics:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(n)(i)(A): who is certified to practice reflexology and whose practice is limited to the scope of practice of reflexology;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(n)(i)(B): who is certified to practice a type of zone therapy, including foot zone therapy, and whose practice is limited to the scope of practice for which the individual is certified;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(n)(i)(C): who is certified to practice ortho-bionomy and whose practice is limited to the scope of practice of ortho-bionomy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(n)(i)(D): who is certified to practice bowenwork and whose practice is limited to the scope of practice of bowenwork; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(n)(i)(E): who is certified to practice a type of brain integration and whose practice is limited to the scope of practice for which the individual is certified;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(n)(ii): whose clients remain fully clothed from the shoulders to the knees; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(1)(n)(iii): whose clients do not receive gratuitous massage from the individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(2): (1) An individual described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(3): This chapter may not be construed to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(3)(a): authorize any individual licensed under this chapter to engage in any manner in the practice of medicine as defined by the laws of this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(3)(b): require insurance coverage or reimbursement for massage therapy or limited massage therapy from third party payors; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-304(3)(c): prevent an insurance carrier from offering coverage for massage therapy or limited massage therapy.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-305 State and local jurisdiction.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-305(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-305(1)(a): The division is the only agency authorized to license individuals to engage in the practice of massage therapy or the practice of limited massage therapy within the state or any of the state's political subdivisions.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-305(1)(b): This chapter does not prevent any political subdivision of the state from enacting:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-305(1)(b)(i): ordinances governing the operation of establishments offering massages; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-305(1)(b)(ii): ordinances regulating the practice of massage therapy or the practice of limited massage therapy, if the ordinances are not less stringent than this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-305(2): This chapter does not prohibit any political subdivision of the state from prosecuting:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-305(2)(a): an unlicensed individual who is engaged in the practice of massage therapy or the practice of limited massage therapy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-305(2)(b): a licensed individual who is engaged in unlawful conduct.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-306 Required signage and disclosures.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-306(1): As used in this section, "massage establishment" means an establishment in which an individual lawfully engages in the practice of massage therapy or the practice of limited massage therapy.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-306(2): If a massage assistant or massage assistant in-training engages in the practice of limited massage therapy at a massage establishment, the massage establishment shall prominently display to the public a sign that indicates certain massage services offered at the massage establishment are performed by a massage assistant or a massage assistant in-training.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-306(3): If an individual requests a massage service that is performed by a massage assistant or a massage assistant in-training, the licensee performing or the massage therapy supervisor supervising the massage service shall ensure that the individual is notified before scheduling or agreeing to the massage service that the massage service is performed by a massage assistant or massage assistant in-training.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-401 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for the following actions regarding a license under this chapter are in accordance with SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-47b-401(1): refusal to issue a license to an applicant;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-401(2): refusal to renew the license of a licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-401(3): revocation, suspension, restriction, or placement on probation of a license;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-401(4): issuance of a public or private reprimand to a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-401(5): issuance of a cease and desist order.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-501 Unlawful conduct.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-501(1): (2) "Unlawful conduct" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-501(1)(a): practicing, engaging in, or attempting to practice or engage in the practice of massage therapy without holding a current license as a massage therapist or a massage apprentice under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-501(1)(b): advertising or representing oneself as engaging in the practice of massage therapy when not licensed to do so;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-501(1)(c): practicing, engaging in, or attempting to practice or engage in the practice of limited massage therapy without holding a current license as a massage therapist, massage apprentice, massage assistant, or massage assistant in-training under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-501(1)(d): advertising or representing oneself as engaging in the practice of limited massage therapy when not licensed to do so; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-501(1)(e): (2) massaging, touching, or applying any instrument or device by a licensee in the course of engaging in the practice of massage therapy or the practice of limited massage therapy to the:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-501(1)(e)(i): genitals;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-501(1)(e)(ii): anus; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-501(1)(e)(iii): (2) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-501(2): (1)(e)(iii); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (2)(b); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-501(2)(a): (1)(e)(iii); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (2)(b) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-501(2)(a)(i): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act requests breast massage, as may be further defined by division rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-501(2)(a)(ii): (2)(b) subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-501(2)(b): (2)(a) If the female patron is a minor, the female patron's parent or legal guardian shall sign the written consent form described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-502 Unprofessional conduct.
--------------------------------------------------------
"Unprofessional conduct" includes the following and may be further defined by division rule made in accordance withUtah Code Annotated § 58-47b-502(1): maintaining, operating, or assisting in the establishment or operation of any place of business for the purpose of performing the practice of massage therapy or the practice of limited massage therapy without first obtaining a business license, if a license is required;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-502(2): failing to comply with any applicable ordinances relating to the regulation of massage establishment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-502(3): failing to comply with all applicable state and local health or sanitation codes;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-502(4): failing to properly supervise a massage apprentice, massage assistant, or massage assistant in-training;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-502(5): failing to maintain mechanical or electrical equipment in a safe operating condition;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-502(6): failing to adequately monitor patrons utilizing steam rooms, dry heat cabinets, or water baths;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-502(7): prescribing or administering medicine or drugs;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-502(8): engaging in any act or practice in a professional capacity that is outside of the practice of massage therapy or the practice of limited massage therapy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-502(9): engaging in any act or practice in a professional capacity for which the licensee is not competent to perform through training or experience.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-503 Penalties.
-------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-503(1): (2); 58-47b-501 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-47b-503(2): 58-47b-501; Title 76, Utah Criminal Code; Title 76, Utah Criminal Code Sexual conduct that violates Section


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 49 - Dietitian Certification Act
*************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-2 Definitions.
------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-49-2(1): "Certified dietitian" means a person who is certified by the division as meeting the certification requirements provided in this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-2(2): "Commission on Dietetic Registration" means the credentialing component of the American Dietetic Association.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-2(3): "Dietetics" means the integration and application of principles derived from the sciences of food for the development, management, and provision of dietary services for individuals and groups for meeting their health care needs.  "Dietetics" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-2(3)(a): the evaluation of a person's dietary status;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-2(3)(b): the advising and education of persons on dietary needs; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-2(3)(c): the evaluation of needs, implementation of systems to support needs, and maintenance of appropriate standards of quality in food and dietary service for individuals, groups, or patients in licensed institutional facilities or in private office settings.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-2(4): 58-1-501 "Unprofessional conduct" as defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-4 Qualifications for certification -- Fee.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Each applicant for certification under this chapter shall provide proof satisfactory to the division that the applicant:Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-4(1): holds a baccalaureate or post-baccalaureate degree conferred by a college or university approved by the division at the time the degree was conferred with a major course of study in the sciences of food, dietetics, food systems management, or an equivalent major course of study;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-4(2): has completed an internship or preplanned professional baccalaureate or post-baccalaureate experience in a dietetic program under the supervision of a certified dietitian who is certified under this chapter or certified, registered, or licensed under the laws of another state or territory of the United States;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-4(3): has satisfactorily passed a competency examination, approved by or given at the direction of the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-4(4): has paid the appropriate fees determined by the Department of Commerce.  The fee assessed by the Department of Commerce shall be fair and reasonable and shall reflect the cost of services provided.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-5 Certification of persons currently qualified.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
The requirements of Subsections

Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-6 Certification of persons qualified in other jurisdictions.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Upon receipt of an application and application fee the division may waive the examination requirement for an applicant who, at the time of application:Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-6(1): holds a valid dietitian license or certificate issued by another state or territory of the United States, provided his qualifications meet the requirements of this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-6(2): is registered by the Commission on Dietetic Registration.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-7 Certificates -- Display -- Surrender.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-7(1): Any person who meets the certification qualifications of this chapter shall receive a certificate stating that he has met these qualifications.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-7(2): Each certified dietitian shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-7(2)(a): display the certificate in an appropriate, conspicuous, and public manner; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-7(2)(b): keep the division informed of his current address.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-7(3): A certificate issued by the division is the property of the division and shall be surrendered on demand.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-8 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-8(1): Each license issued under this chapter shall be issued in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.  A renewal period may be extended or shortened by as much as one year to maintain established renewal cycles or to change an established renewal cycle.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-8(2): 58-1-308 Each license automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless renewed by the licensee in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-9 Use of titles by uncertified person.
------------------------------------------------------------------
No person, without first being certified under this chapter may:Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-9(1): assume or use the title or designation "dietitian," "certified dietitian," "registered dietitian," "registered dietitian nutritionist," the letters "C.D.," the letter "D.," or any other title, words, letters, abbreviations, or insignia indicating or implying that the person is a certified dietitian, including by using any of the preceding terms with the alternative spelling "dietician"; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-9(2): represent in any way, whether orally, in writing, in print, or by signature, directly or by implication, that the person is a certified dietitian.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-10 Violation -- Misdemeanor.
--------------------------------------------------------
The violation of any provision of this chapter is a class B misdemeanor.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-49-11 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for refusal to issue a license to an applicant, for refusal to renew the license of a licensee, to revoke, suspend, restrict, or place on probation the license of a licensee, to issue a public or private reprimand to a licensee, and to issue cease and desist orders shall be in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 50 - Private Probation Provider Licensing Act
**************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-1 Short title.
------------------------------------------
This chapter shall be known as the "Private Probation Provider Licensing Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-2 Definitions.
------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-50-2(1): 58-50-3 "Board" means the Private Probation Provider Licensing Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-2(2): "Court" means the particular court that orders probation in a case.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-2(3): 77-18-105(6)(a)(vii) "Private probation" means the preparation of presentence investigation reports and the performance of supervision services by a private probation provider and funded by a court-ordered fee, to be paid by the defendant, in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-2(4): 77-18-105
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-2(4)(a): 77-18-105 "Private probation provider" means any private individual preparing presentence investigation reports or providing probation supervision in accordance with a court order under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-2(4)(b): A private probation provider does not have the authority of a peace officer.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-2(5): 58-1-501; 58-50-9 "Unprofessional conduct" as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-2(5)(a): failure to disclose any financial or personal interest or prior relationship with parties that affects the private probation provider's impartiality or otherwise constitutes a conflict of interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-2(5)(b): providing contract probation services when any financial or personal interest or prior relationship with parties affects the private probation provider's impartiality or otherwise constitutes an actual conflict of interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-2(5)(c): failure to clearly define to the offender the services provided by the private probation provider, the rules of conduct, the criteria used, and the fees charged;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-2(5)(d): failure to provide adequate supervision, or supervision as ordered by the court, as determined by the division in collaboration with the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-2(5)(e): 58-50-9 failure to comply with the standards specified in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-3 Board -- Membership -- Duties.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-3(1): There is created the Private Probation Provider Licensing Board. The board shall consist of five members as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-3(1)(a): one member representing the administrative office of the courts;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-3(1)(b): one member representing the Department of Corrections;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-3(1)(c): two members licensed as private probation providers; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-3(1)(d): one member from the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-3(2): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed by the governor and serve in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-3(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203 The duties and responsibilities of the board shall be in accordance with Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-4 License required -- License classifications.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-4(1): An individual may not engage in practice as a private probation provider unless licensed or exempted from licensure under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-4(2): The division shall issue to a person qualified for licensure under the provisions of this chapter a license as a private probation provider.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-5 Qualifications for licensure.
-----------------------------------------------------------
An applicant for licensure as a private probation provider shall:Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-5(1): have a baccalaureate degree in a program approved by the division in collaboration with the board or have a combination of equivalent education and training as determined by the division in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-5(2): submit evidence that a business license to engage in private probation has been issued by the political subdivision of the state in which the applicant intends to establish his business office or offices; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-5(3): apply for licensure and pay the required fees.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-6 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-6(1): Each license issued under this chapter shall be issued in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.  A renewal period may be extended or shortened by as much as one year to maintain established renewal cycles or to change an established renewal cycle.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-6(2): At the time of renewal the licensee shall show satisfactory evidence of completion of continuing education as required under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-6(3): 58-1-308 Each license automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless renewed by the licensee in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-7 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for refusal to issue a license to an applicant, for refusal to renew the license of a licensee, to revoke, suspend, restrict, or place on probation the license of a licensee, to issue a public or private reprimand to a licensee, and to issue cease and desist orders shall be in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9 Standards of conduct for private probation providers -- Contracts -- Reports.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(1): 26B-2-101 As used in this section, "licensee" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(2): 77-18-105; 78A-1-101 The private probation provider:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(2)(a): shall maintain impartiality toward all parties;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(2)(b): shall ensure that all parties understand the nature of the process, the procedure, the particular role of the private probation provider, and the parties' relationship to the private probation provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(2)(c): shall maintain confidentiality or, in cases where confidentiality is not protected, the private probation provider shall so advise the parties;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(2)(d): shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(2)(d)(i): disclose any circumstance that may create or give the appearance of a conflict of interest and any circumstance that may reasonably raise a question as to the private probation provider's impartiality; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(2)(d)(ii): if the contract probation supervisor perceives or believes a conflict of interest to exist, the contract probation supervisor shall refrain from entering into those probation services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(2)(e): shall adhere to the standards regarding private probation services adopted by the licensing board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(2)(f): shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(2)(f)(i): comply with orders of court and perform services as directed by judges in individual cases; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(2)(f)(ii): notify the court that the private probation provider is providing supervision services to a defendant;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(2)(g): 77-18-105 shall perform duties established under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(2)(h): beginning July 1, 2022, may not provide private probation in a county where an agency of local government provides probation services unless the private probation provider has entered into a contract with the agency of local government;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(2)(i): shall provide a report each month to each county sheriff where the private probation provider provides private probation identifying:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(2)(i)(i): each individual currently supervised in the county by the private probation provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(2)(i)(ii): the crimes each individual supervised committed;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(2)(i)(iii): the level of supervision that is being provided for each individual; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(2)(i)(iv): any other information related to the provision of private probation that the county sheriff determines is relevant; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(2)(j): 78A-1-101 may not solicit defendants as supervision clients on any property that operates as a court of justice as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(3): (3)(a) If, after conducting a screening of a defendant's risk and needs, a private probation provider determines that a defendant requires a specific assessment, treatment, or other services, the private probation provider shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(3)(a): provide the defendant a list of all available licensees that provide the assessment, treatment, or other services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(3)(b): (3)(a) permit the defendant to select a licensee described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(4): (4)(b); (4)(a); (4)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(4)(a): (4)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(4)(a)(i): mental health therapy services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(4)(a)(ii): education services; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(4)(a)(iii): rehabilitation services.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(4)(b): (4)(a) A private probation provider that is a licensee may simultaneously provide private probation services and other services as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(4)(b)(i): no other licensees that provide the services are located within 50 miles of the defendant's residence; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-9(4)(b)(ii): the private probation provider obtains the defendant's written informed consent.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-10 Exceptions from licensure.
---------------------------------------------------------
In addition to the exemptions from licensure in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-50-10(1): employees of the Department of Corrections while performing probation services as part of their normal duties and responsibilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-10(2): members of the armed forces and employees, agents, or representatives of the federal government while acting in their official capacity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-50-10(3): 77-18-105 agencies of local government in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 53 - Landscape Architects Licensing Act
********************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Landscape Architects Licensing Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-53-102(1): 58-53-201 "Board" means the Landscape Architects Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-102(2): 58-53-103 "Fund" means the Landscape Architects Education and Enforcement Fund created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-102(3): "Practice of landscape architecture" means rendering or offering to render any of the following services:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-102(3)(a): production of a site plan which may include the design of any of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-102(3)(a)(i): sprinkler irrigation systems;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-102(3)(a)(ii): landscape grading and drainage plans; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-102(3)(a)(iii): parking lots;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-102(3)(b): design of any of the following structures incidental to the production of a site plan:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-102(3)(b)(i): retaining walls; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-102(3)(b)(ii): raised platforms, decks, and walkways;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-102(3)(c): design of any of the following structures incidental to the production of a site plan when the structure does not exceed 1,000 square feet:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-102(3)(c)(i): covered pavilions;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-102(3)(c)(ii): gazebos;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-102(3)(c)(iii): restrooms;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-102(3)(c)(iv): storage and maintenance facilities; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-102(3)(c)(v): other accessory structures; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-102(3)(d): collaboration with architects and professional engineers in the design of roads, bridges, buildings, and structures with respect to the functional and aesthetic requirements of the area in which they are to be placed.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-102(4): "Principal" means a licensed landscape architect having responsible charge of a landscape architectural practice.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-102(5): "Supervision" with respect to the supervision of an employee of a landscape architect, means that a licensed landscape architect is responsible for and personally reviews, corrects when necessary, and approves work performed by any employee under the direction of the landscape architect, and may be further defined by rule of the division in collaboration with the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-102(6): 58-1-501; 58-53-501 "Unlawful conduct" is as defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-102(7): 58-1-501 "Unprofessional conduct" is as defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-103 Education and enforcement fund.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-103(1): There is created an expendable special revenue fund known as the "Landscape Architects Education and Enforcement Fund."
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-103(2): 63J-1-504 The fund consists of money from:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-103(2)(a): 63J-1-504 a surcharge placed on application fees for initial, renewal, and reinstatement licensure under this chapter, in an amount established by the division with the collaboration of the board in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-103(2)(b): administrative penalties collected pursuant to this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-103(3): The fund shall earn interest, and all interest earned on fund money shall be deposited into the fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-103(4): The director may, with concurrence of the board, make distributions from the fund for the following purposes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-103(4)(a): education and training of licensees under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-103(4)(b): education and training of the public or other interested persons in matters concerning landscape architectural laws and practices; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-103(4)(c): enforcement of this chapter by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-103(4)(c)(i): investigating unprofessional or unlawful conduct; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-103(4)(c)(ii): providing legal representation to the division when the division takes legal action against a person engaging in unprofessional or unlawful conduct.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-103(5): If the balance in the fund exceeds $100,000 at the close of any fiscal year, the excess shall be transferred to the General Fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-103(6): The division shall report annually to the appropriate appropriations subcommittee of the Legislature concerning the fund.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-201 Creation of board -- Duties.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-201(1): There is created the Landscape Architects Board consisting of four landscape architects and one member of the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-201(2): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed and serve in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-201(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203 The duties and responsibilities of the board shall be in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-201(4): The board shall designate one of its member on a permanent or rotating basis to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-201(4)(a): assist the division in reviewing complaints concerning the unlawful or unprofessional conduct of a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-201(4)(b): advise the division in its investigation of these complaints.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-201(5): (4) A board member who has, under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-301 Licensure required--License classification.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-301(1): 58-1-307; 58-53-304 A license is required to engage in the practice of landscape architecture except as specifically provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-301(2): The division shall issue a license under this chapter to a qualified person in the classification of landscape architecture.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-302 Qualifications for licensure.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-302(1): 63J-1-504; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act Each applicant for licensure as a landscape architect shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-302(1)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-302(1)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee as determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-302(1)(c): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-302(1)(c)(i): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act have graduated and received an earned bachelors or masters degree from a landscape architecture program meeting criteria established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board and in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-302(1)(c)(ii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act have completed not less than eight years of supervised practical experience in landscape architecture which meets the requirements established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board and in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-302(1)(d): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act have successfully passed examinations established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board and in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-302(2): (1)(c)(i); (1)(c)(ii) Satisfactory completion of each year of a landscape architectural program described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-303 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-303(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-303(1)(a): The division shall issue each license under this chapter in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-303(1)(b): The division may by renewal extend or shorten a license expiration date by as much as one year to stagger the renewal cycles it administers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-303(2): 58-1-308 Each license automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless renewed by the licensee in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-303(3): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act Each person holding a current license issued under this chapter shall complete in each period of licensure a program of qualifying continuing professional education in accordance with standards defined by division rule made in accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-304 Exemptions from licensure.
----------------------------------------------------------
In addition to the exemptions from licensure in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-53-304(1): 58-53-102(3) a person preparing a site plan as defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-304(2): Title 58, Chapter 55, Utah Construction Trades Licensing Act a person designing sprinkler irrigation systems when licensed as a landscape contractor under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-304(3): Title 58, Chapter 22, Professional Engineers and Professional Land Surveyors Licensing Act a person licensed to practice professional engineering or professional structural engineering under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-304(4): Title 58, Chapter 3a, Architects Licensing Act a person licensed to practice architecture under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-304(5): 58-53-102(3) unlicensed employees of a person licensed under this chapter while preparing site plans as defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-304(6): an organization engaged in the practice of landscape architecture, provided that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-304(6)(a): the organization employs a principal; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-304(6)(b): all individuals employed by the organization, who are engaged in the practice of landscape architecture, are licensed or exempt from licensure under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-401 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for refusing to issue a license to an applicant, for refusing to renew the license of a licensee, for revoking, suspending, restricting, or placing on probation the license of a licensee, for issuing a public or private reprimand to a licensee, and for issuing cease and desist orders shall be in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-501 Unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------
"Unlawful conduct" includes:Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-501(1): using the title landscape architect or any other description, words, letters, or abbreviation indicating that the person is a landscape architect if the person has not been licensed under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-501(2): 58-1-307; 58-53-304 engaging in or representing oneself as engaging in the practice of landscape architecture as a corporation, proprietorship, partnership, or limited liability company unless exempted from licensure under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502 Citations -- Penalty for unlawful conduct.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(1): 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-53-501; 58-53-603; 58-53-501; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-53-501; 58-53-501; (1)(i); 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-53-501; 58-53-501; 58-53-401; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; (1)(a); (1)(a); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(1)(a): 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-53-501; 58-53-603; 58-53-501; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-53-501; 58-53-501; (1)(i); 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-53-501; 58-53-501; 58-53-401 If upon inspection or investigation, the division concludes that a person has violated Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(1)(a)(i): 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-53-501; 58-53-501; (1)(i); 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-53-501; 58-53-501 A person who violates Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(1)(a)(ii): 58-53-401 Except for a cease and desist order, the licensure sanctions cited in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(1)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act A citation shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(1)(b)(i): be in writing;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(1)(b)(ii): describe with particularity the nature of the violation, including a reference to the provision of the chapter, rule, or order alleged to have been violated;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(1)(b)(iii): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act clearly state that the recipient must notify the division in writing within 20 calendar days of service of the citation if the recipient wishes to contest the citation at a hearing conducted under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(1)(b)(iv): clearly explain the consequences of failure to timely contest the citation or to make payment of any fines assessed by the citation within the time specified in the citation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(1)(c): The division may issue a notice in lieu of a citation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(1)(d): Each citation issued under this section, or a copy of each citation, may be served upon any person whom a summons may be served in accordance with the Utah Rules of Civil Procedure and may be made personally or upon the person's agent by a division investigator or by any person specially designated by the director or by mail.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(1)(e): If within 20 calendar days from the service of the citation, the person to whom the citation was issued fails to request a hearing to contest the citation, the citation becomes the final order of the division and is not subject to further agency review.  The period to contest a citation may be extended by the division for cause.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(1)(f): The division may refuse to issue or renew, suspend, revoke, or place on probation the license of a licensee who fails to comply with a citation after it becomes final.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(1)(g): The failure of an applicant for licensure to comply with a citation after it becomes final is a ground for denial of license.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(1)(h): No citation may be issued under this section after the expiration of one year following the date on which the violation that is the subject of the citation is reported to the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(1)(i): (1)(a); (1)(a); (1)(a) The director or the director's designee shall assess fines according to the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(1)(i)(i): (1)(a) for a first offense handled pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(1)(i)(ii): (1)(a) for a second offense handled pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(1)(i)(iii): (1)(a) for any subsequent offense handled pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(2): An action initiated for a first or second offense which has not yet resulted in a final order of the division does not preclude initiation of any subsequent action for a second or subsequent offense during the pendency of any preceding action.  The final order on a subsequent action shall be considered a second or subsequent offense, respectively, provided the preceding action resulted in a first or second offense, respectively.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(3)(a): The director may collect a penalty that is not paid by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(3)(a)(i): referring the matter to a collection agency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(3)(a)(ii): bringing an action in the district court of the county where the person against whom the penalty is imposed resides or in the county where the office of the director is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(3)(b): A county attorney or the attorney general of the state shall provide legal assistance and advice to the director in an action to collect a penalty.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-502(3)(c): A court shall award reasonable attorney fees and costs to the prevailing party in an action brought by the division to collect a penalty.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-601 Seal -- Design and implementation.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Every landscape architect shall have a seal, the design and implementation of which shall be established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-602 Site plans to be sealed.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-602(1): 58-53-304; Title 58, Chapter 22, Professional Engineers and Professional Land Surveyors Licensing Act; Title 58, Chapter 3a, Architects Licensing Act; Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act Any site plan prepared in this state shall bear the seal of a landscape architect licensed under this chapter, except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-602(2): 58-53-304 Any final site plan prepared by or under the supervision of the licensed landscape architect shall bear the seal of the landscape architect when submitted to a client, or when submitted to a building official for the purpose of obtaining a building permit, even if the practice is exempt from licensure under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-603 Seal -- Authorized use.
-------------------------------------------------------
A landscape architect may only affix the landscape architect's seal to a site plan when the site plan:Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-603(1): was personally prepared by the landscape architect;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-603(2): was prepared by an employee, subordinate, associate, or drafter under the supervision of a licensee, provided the licensee or a principal affixing the seal assumes responsibility;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-603(3): was prepared by a licensed landscape architect in this state or any other state provided that the licensee in this state affixing the seal:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-603(3)(a): performs a thorough review of all work for compliance with all applicable laws and rules and the standards of the profession; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-603(3)(b): makes any necessary corrections before submitting the final site plan:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-603(3)(b)(i): to a building official for the purpose of obtaining a building permit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-603(3)(b)(ii): to a client who has contracted with a landscape architect for the production of a site plan, when the landscape architect represents, or could reasonably expect the client to consider, the site plan to be complete and final;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-603(4): was prepared by a person exempt from licensure as a landscape architect,  provided that the licensee in this state affixing the seal:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-603(4)(a): performs a thorough review for compliance with all applicable laws and rules and the standards of the profession; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-603(4)(b): makes any necessary corrections before submitting the final site plan:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-603(4)(b)(i): to a building official for the purpose of obtaining a building permit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-603(4)(b)(ii): to a client who has contracted with a landscape architect for the production of a site plan, when the landscape architect represents, or could reasonably expect the client to consider, the site plan to be complete and final; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-53-603(5): meets any additional requirements established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 54 - Radiologic Technologist, Radiologist Assistant, and Radiology Practical Technician Licensing Act
**********************************************************************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Radiologic Technologist, Radiologist Assistant, and Radiology Practical Technician Licensing Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In addition to the definition in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(1): "Board" means the Radiologic Technologist Licensing Board established under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(2): "Critical access hospital" means a hospital in a rural or medically underserved area that is recognized by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services as meeting the conditions of participation specified in 42 C.F.R. 485.601-647.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(3): "General supervision" means the supervising radiologist is available to provide immediate communication with the supervised person and is aware of the procedure before it is performed.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(4): "Indirect supervision" means the supervising radiologist:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(4)(a): has given either written or verbal instructions to the person being supervised;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(4)(b): is present in the facility in which the person being supervised is providing services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(4)(c): is available to provide immediate face-to-face communications with the person being supervised.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(5): "Practice of radiologic technology" means using radiation from a radioactive substance, radiology equipment, or any other source, in amounts beyond normal background levels, for diagnostic or therapeutic purposes on humans.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(6): "Practice of radiologist assistant" means the performance of non-invasive and minimally invasive radiological procedures:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(6)(a): delegated to a radiologist assistant by a radiologist; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(6)(b): performed under the indirect supervision of a radiologist.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(7): "Radiologic technologist" means a person licensed under this chapter to engage in the practice of radiologic technology under the general supervision of a radiologist or radiology practitioner including the administration of parenteral contrast media, radionuclides, and other medications incidental to radiology procedures provided the administrations are under the direct supervision of a qualified physician and the technologist is currently certified in cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) and appropriate patient care procedures.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(8): "Radiologist" means a physician certified by the American Board of Radiology, the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology, the British Royal College of Radiology, or the Canadian College of Physicians and Surgeons.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(9): "Radiologist assistant" means a person licensed under this chapter to engage in the practice of a radiologist assistant.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(10): "Radiology equipment" means any medical radiation device that emits ionizing or nonionizing radiation or detects that radiation for the purpose or intended purpose of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(10)(a): diagnosing disease or other medical conditions in humans; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(10)(b): treating, curing, mitigating, or preventing disease in humans.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(11): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Radiology practical technician" means a person licensed under this chapter to engage in a practice of radiologic technology performing limited diagnostic radiology procedures:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(11)(a): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act as defined and permitted by rule in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(11)(b): under the supervision of a radiologist or radiology practitioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(12): "Radiology practitioner" means any person or individual licensed in this state as a physician and surgeon, osteopathic physician, podiatric physician, chiropractic physician, dentist, dental hygienist, or a physician's assistant, nurse practitioner, or nurse specialist practicing under the supervision of an approved supervising physician and in accordance with an approved protocol and utilization plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(13): 58-1-501; 58-54-501 "Unlawful conduct" is as defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-102(14): 58-1-501; 58-54-501 "Unprofessional conduct" is as defined in Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201 Board created -- Membership -- Duties.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(1): There is created a Radiologic Technologist Licensing Board consisting of nine members as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(1)(a): three licensed radiologic technologists;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(1)(b): one licensed radiology practical technician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(1)(c): one licensed radiologist assistant;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(1)(d): two radiologists;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(1)(e): one physician licensed under this title who is not a radiologist, and who uses radiologic services in the physician's practice; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(1)(f): one member from the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(2): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203 The duties and responsibilities of the board shall be in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(4): 58-1-203(1)(f); 26B-2-201 In accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(4)(a): one licensed physician and surgeon who is not a radiologist and who uses radiology equipment in a rural office-based practice, appointed from among recommendations of the Physicians Licensing Board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(4)(b): one licensed physician and surgeon who is not a radiologist and who uses radiology equipment in an urban office-based practice, appointed from among recommendations of the Physicians Licensing Board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(4)(c): one licensed physician and surgeon who is a radiologist practicing in radiology, appointed from among recommendations of the Physicians Licensing Board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(4)(d): one licensed osteopathic physician, appointed from among recommendations of the Osteopathic Physicians Licensing Board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(4)(e): one licensed chiropractic physician, appointed from among recommendations of the Chiropractors Licensing Board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(4)(f): one licensed podiatric physician, appointed from among recommendations of the Podiatric Physician Board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(4)(g): one representative of the state agency with primary responsibility for regulation of sources of radiation, recommended by that agency; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(4)(h): 26B-2-201 one representative of a general acute hospital, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(5): (5)(b); (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(5)(a): (5)(b) Except as required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(5)(b): (5)(a) Notwithstanding the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(5)(c): When a vacancy occurs in the membership for any reason, the replacement shall be appointed for the unexpired term.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(6): 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107; 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107 A member may not receive compensation or benefits for the member's service, but may receive per diem and travel expenses in accordance with:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(6)(a): 63A-3-106 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(6)(b): 63A-3-107 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(6)(c): 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107 rules made by the Division of Finance pursuant to Sections
