Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(7)(a): 58-1-202; 58-1-203 to advise the board with respect to the board's fulfillment of its duties, functions, and responsibilities under Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-201(7)(b): 58-54-302 to advise the division with respect to the examination the division is to adopt by rule, by which a radiology practical technician may qualify for licensure under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-301 License required.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-301(1): An individual may not engage in the practice of radiologic technology or the practice of a radiologist assistant unless licensed or exempted from licensure under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-301(2): The division shall issue to persons qualified under this chapter a license in the classification of radiologic technologist, radiologist assistant, or radiology practical technician.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-301(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-301(3)(a): A license shall be issued without regard to any area of practice specialty as a radiologic technologist.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-301(3)(b): A license for a radiology practical technician may be issued certifying the practical technician for a specialty type or limited practice.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-302 Requirements for licensure.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-302(1): 63J-1-504 Each applicant for licensure as a radiologic technologist, radiology assistant, or radiology practical technician shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-302(1)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division in collaboration with the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-302(1)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee as determined by the department pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-302(2): (1) Each applicant for licensure as a radiologic technologist shall, in addition to the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-302(2)(a): be a graduate of an accredited educational program in radiologic technology or certified by the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists or any equivalent educational program approved by the division in collaboration with the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-302(2)(b): have passed an examination approved by the division in collaboration with the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-302(3): (1) Each applicant for licensure as a radiology practical technician shall, in addition to the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-302(4): (4)(b); (1); (2); (4)(a)(i); (iii); (4)(a)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-302(4)(a): (4)(b); (1); (2) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-302(4)(a)(i): (1); (2) meet the requirements of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-302(4)(a)(ii): have a Bachelor of Science degree; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-302(4)(a)(iii): be certified as:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-302(4)(a)(iii)(A): a radiologist assistant by the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-302(4)(a)(iii)(B): a radiology practitioner assistant by the Certification Board of Radiology Practitioner Assistants.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-302(4)(b): (4)(a)(i); (iii); (4)(a)(ii) An individual who meets the requirements of Subsections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-303 Supervision and prescription required -- Imaging ordered by physical therapists.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-303(1): The practice of radiologic technology by a radiologic technologist licensed under this chapter shall be under the general supervision of a radiologist or radiology practitioner and may be performed only upon the order of a radiologist or radiology practitioner acting within the scope of the radiologist's or radiology practitioner's license and experience within the scope of practice of a radiology practitioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-303(2): (1); (2)(a)(i); (2)(a); (2)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-303(2)(a): (1); (2)(a)(i) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-303(2)(a)(i): the physical therapist designates a physician to receive the results of the plain radiographs or magnetic resonance imaging; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-303(2)(a)(ii): (2)(a)(i) the physician designated in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-303(2)(b): (2)(a) A physical therapist who orders plain radiographs or magnetic resonance imaging under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-303(2)(b)(i): communicate with the patient's physician to ensure coordination of care; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-303(2)(b)(ii): refer a patient to an appropriate provider when the findings of the imaging that was ordered by the physical therapist indicate that the services that are needed exceed the physical therapist's experience and scope of practice.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-303(2)(c): (2)(b)(i) A physical therapist is not subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-303(2)(c)(i): a radiologist has read the image and has not identified a significant finding;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-303(2)(c)(ii): the patient does not have a primary care physician; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-303(2)(c)(iii): the patient was not referred to the physical therapist for health care services by another health care provider.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-304 Scope of practice for radiologist assistant.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-304(1): (2) The scope of practice for a radiologist assistant includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-304(1)(a): determination of whether a patient has been appropriately prepared for the radiologic procedure;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-304(1)(b): assessment and evaluation of the physiologic responsiveness of a patient undergoing a radiologic procedure;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-304(1)(c): assessment and evaluation of possible contraindications to a procedure;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-304(1)(d): (2) obtaining informed consent from the patient as specified by a Delegation of Services Agreement between the radiologic assistant and the supervising radiologist in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-304(1)(e): evaluation of image quality and communication of initial image observations only to the supervising radiologist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-304(1)(f): administration of contrast media or other medications prescribed by the supervising radiologist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-304(1)(g): performance of radiologic procedures under the indirect supervision of a radiologist; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-304(1)(h): performance of radiologic procedures under the general supervision of a radiologist only if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-304(1)(h)(i): the radiologist assistant is practicing in a critical access hospital; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-304(1)(h)(ii): the supervising radiologist has the necessary privileges for the procedure to be performed by the radiologist assistant.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-304(2): The radiologist assistant and supervising radiologist shall enter into a Delegation of Services Agreement identifying radiologic procedures to be performed by the radiologist assistant and establishing a regular review process by the supervising radiologist for all work performed by and records kept by the radiologist assistant.  The Delegation of Services Agreement shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-304(2)(a): be kept at the place of practice at which the radiologist assistant is performing delegated services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-304(2)(b): be consistent with radiologist assistant practice guidelines developed by the American College of Radiology, as supplemented by recognized radiology organizations such as the American Society of Radiologic Technologists and the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-304(3): The radiologist assistant shall not interpret images, provide diagnosis, or prescribe medications or therapies.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-305 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-305(1): Each license issued under this chapter shall be issued in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.  A renewal period may be extended or shortened by as much as one year to maintain established renewal cycles or to change an established renewal cycle.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-305(2): At the time of renewal, licensees shall show satisfactory evidence of each of the following renewal requirements:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-305(2)(a): 24 hours of approved professional education during a two-year period, as defined by administrative rule, before renewal of a radiologic technologist license;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-305(2)(b): 10 hours of approved professional education during a two-year period, as defined by administrative rule, before renewal of a radiology practical technician license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-305(2)(c): 50 hours of approved professional education during a two-year period, as defined by administrative rule, before renewal of a radiologist assistant license.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-305(3): 58-1-308 Each license automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless renewed by the licensee in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-306 Exemption from licensure.
---------------------------------------------------------
A person may engage in the practice of radiologic technology without being licensed under this chapter if:Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-306(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-306(1)(a): the person is filling a new or existing position as an employee performing the duties of a radiology practical technician when a licensed radiology practical technician is not available to begin in the new position or continue filling the existing position;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-306(1)(b): the total period in which the position is filled by the unlicensed person is not more than 90 days;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-306(1)(c): the unlicensed person at all times performs services as a radiology practical technician under the direct on-premises supervision of a radiology practitioner; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-306(1)(d): the employee position filled by an unlicensed person under this section is an existing position and was filled by a person licensed under this chapter immediately prior to employment of the unlicensed person;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-306(2): 58-69-201 the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-306(2)(a): performs services in a dental facility under the supervision of a dentist licensed to practice in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-306(2)(b): 58-69-201 has completed a radiology course approved by the Dentists and Dental Hygienists Board created under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-306(3): 58-5a-201 the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-306(3)(a): performs services in a medical facility under the supervision of a podiatric physician licensed to practice in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-306(3)(b): 58-5a-201 has completed a radiology course approved by the Podiatric Physician Board created under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-401 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for refusal to issue a license to an applicant, for refusal to renew the license of a licensee, to revoke, suspend, restrict, or place on probation the license of a licensee, to issue a public or private reprimand to a licensee, and to issue cease and desist orders shall be in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-501 Unlawful and unprofessional conduct.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-501(1): "Unlawful conduct" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-501(1)(a): using any of the following titles if not licensed as a radiology technologist under this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-501(1)(a)(i): radiology practical technician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-501(1)(a)(ii): radiologic technologist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-501(1)(a)(iii): medical radiographer;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-501(1)(a)(iv): radiation therapist; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-501(1)(a)(v): nuclear medicine technologist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-501(1)(b): using the title "radiology practical technician" if not licensed as a radiology practical technician under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-501(1)(c): using the title "radiologist assistant" if not licensed as a radiologist assistant under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-501(2): "Unprofessional conduct" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-501(2)(a): any act or omission by a person licensed under this chapter that is contrary to the instructions of the radiologist or radiology practitioner responsible for supervising the licensee and which does or reasonably could pose a threat to the health, safety, or welfare of a patient or any other person;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-501(2)(b): operating any radiology equipment that is known to be unsafe or not in compliance with all applicable state requirements regulating radiology equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-501(2)(c): permitting any person to operate any radiology equipment who is not permitted to do so under provisions of law or who is incompetent to operate radiology equipment for any reason;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-501(2)(d): revealing to any unauthorized person any information considered confidential or privileged regarding any patient;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-501(2)(e): the use of any controlled substance as defined by the statutes of this state except to the extent the controlled substance is lawfully prescribed to the licensee and used in accordance with the instructions of the prescribing practitioner; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-54-501(2)(f): willfully and intentionally or negligently making any false statement or entry on any patient record or upon any record used to facilitate payment for radiology services.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 55 - Utah Construction Trades Licensing Act
************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-101 Short title.
--------------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Utah Construction Trades Licensing Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(1): (1)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(1)(a): (1)(b) "Alarm business" or "alarm company" means a person engaged in the sale, installation, maintenance, alteration, repair, replacement, servicing, or monitoring of an alarm system, except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(1)(b): "Alarm business" or "alarm company" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(1)(b)(i): a person engaged in the manufacture or sale of alarm systems unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(1)(b)(i)(A): that person is also engaged in the installation, maintenance, alteration, repair, replacement, servicing, or monitoring of alarm systems;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(1)(b)(i)(B): the manufacture or sale occurs at a location other than a place of business established by the person engaged in the manufacture or sale; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(1)(b)(i)(C): the manufacture or sale involves site visits at the place or intended place of installation of an alarm system; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(1)(b)(ii): an owner of an alarm system, or an employee of the owner of an alarm system who is engaged in installation, maintenance, alteration, repair, replacement, servicing, or monitoring of the alarm system owned by that owner.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(2): (2)(b) "Alarm company agent":
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(2)(a): (2)(b) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(2)(b): does not include an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(2)(b)(i): is not engaged in the sale, installation, maintenance, alteration, repair, replacement, servicing, or monitoring of an alarm system; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(2)(b)(ii): does not, during the normal course of the individual's employment with an alarm business, use or have access to sensitive alarm system information.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(3): 48-3a-102; 16-10a-830; 48-2e-102; 48-1d-102 "Alarm company officer" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(3)(a): 48-3a-102 a governing person, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(3)(b): 16-10a-830 an individual appointed as an officer of an alarm company that is a corporation in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(3)(c): 48-2e-102 a general partner, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(3)(d): 48-1d-102 a partner, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(4): 16-10a-102 "Alarm company owner" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(4)(a): 16-10a-102 a shareholder, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(4)(a)(i): is a corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(4)(a)(ii): is not publicly listed or traded; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(4)(b): an individual who owns directly, or indirectly through an entity controlled by the individual, 5% or more of the equity of an alarm company that is not a corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(5): "Alarm company proprietor" means the sole proprietor of an alarm company that is registered as a sole proprietorship with the Division of Corporations and Commercial Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(6): "Alarm company trustee" means an individual with control of or power of administration over property held in trust.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(7)(a): "Alarm system" means equipment and devices assembled for the purpose of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(7)(a)(i): detecting and signaling unauthorized intrusion or entry into or onto certain premises; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(7)(a)(ii): signaling a robbery or attempted robbery on protected premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(7)(b): "Alarm system" includes a battery-charged suspended-wire system or fence that is part of and interfaces with an alarm system for the purposes of detecting and deterring unauthorized intrusion or entry into or onto certain premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(8): "Apprentice electrician" means a person licensed under this chapter as an apprentice electrician who is learning the electrical trade under the immediate supervision of a master electrician, residential master electrician, a journeyman electrician, or a residential journeyman electrician.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(9): "Apprentice plumber" means a person licensed under this chapter as an apprentice plumber who is learning the plumbing trade under the immediate supervision of a master plumber, residential master plumber, journeyman plumber, or a residential journeyman plumber.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(10): 58-55-302.5(2) "Approved continuing education" means instruction provided through courses under a program established under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(11): 58-55-302(1)(e)(iii); 58-55-302(1)(e)(iii)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(11)(a): 58-55-302(1)(e)(iii) "Approved prelicensure course provider" means a provider that is the Associated General Contractors of Utah, the Utah Chapter of the Associated Builders and Contractors, or the Utah Home Builders Association, and that meets the requirements established by rule by the commission with the concurrence of the director, to teach the 25-hour course described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(11)(b): 58-55-302(1)(e)(iii) "Approved prelicensure course provider" may only include a provider that, in addition to any other locations, offers the 25-hour course described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(12): 58-55-201 "Board" means the Electrician Licensing Board, Alarm System Security and Licensing Board, or Plumbers Licensing Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(13): "Combustion system" means an assembly consisting of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(13)(a): piping and components with a means for conveying, either continuously or intermittently, natural gas from the outlet of the natural gas provider's meter to the burner of the appliance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(13)(b): the electric control and combustion air supply and venting systems, including air ducts; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(13)(c): components intended to achieve control of quantity, flow, and pressure.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(14): 58-55-103 "Commission" means the Construction Services Commission created under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(15): 15A-1-302 "Construction trade" means any trade or occupation involving:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(15)(a): 15A-1-302
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(15)(a)(i): construction, alteration, remodeling, repairing, wrecking or demolition, addition to, or improvement of any building, highway, road, railroad, dam, bridge, structure, excavation or other project, development, or improvement to other than personal property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(15)(a)(ii): 15A-1-302 constructing, remodeling, or repairing a manufactured home or mobile home as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(15)(b): installation or repair of a residential or commercial natural gas appliance or combustion system.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(16): "Construction trades instructor" means a person licensed under this chapter to teach one or more construction trades in both a classroom and project environment, where a project is intended for sale to or use by the public and is completed under the direction of the instructor, who has no economic interest in the project.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(17): (17)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(17)(a): (17) "Contractor" means any person who for compensation other than wages as an employee undertakes any work in the construction, plumbing, or electrical trade for which licensure is required under this chapter and includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(17)(a)(i): a person who builds any structure on the person's own property for the purpose of sale or who builds any structure intended for public use on the person's own property;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(17)(a)(ii): (17) any person who represents that the person is a contractor, or will perform a service described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(17)(a)(iii): any person engaged as a maintenance person, other than an employee, who regularly engages in activities set forth under the definition of "construction trade";
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(17)(a)(iv): any person engaged in, or offering to engage in, any construction trade for which licensure is required under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(17)(a)(v): a construction manager, construction consultant, construction assistant, or any other person who, for a fee:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(17)(a)(v)(A): performs or offers to perform construction consulting;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(17)(a)(v)(B): performs or offers to perform management of construction subcontractors;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(17)(a)(v)(C): provides or offers to provide a list of subcontractors or suppliers; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(17)(a)(v)(D): provides or offers to provide management or counseling services on a construction project.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(17)(b): "Contractor" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(17)(b)(i): an alarm company or alarm company agent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(17)(b)(ii): a material supplier who provides consulting to customers regarding the design and installation of the material supplier's products.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(18): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(18)(a): "Electrical trade" means the performance of any electrical work involved in the installation, construction, alteration, change, repair, removal, or maintenance of facilities, buildings, or appendages or appurtenances.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(18)(b): "Electrical trade" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(18)(b)(i): transporting or handling electrical materials;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(18)(b)(ii): preparing clearance for raceways for wiring;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(18)(b)(iii): work commonly done by unskilled labor on any installations under the exclusive control of electrical utilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(18)(b)(iv): work involving cable-type wiring that does not pose a shock or fire-initiation hazard; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(18)(b)(v): work involving class two or class three power-limited circuits as defined in the National Electrical Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(19): 34A-7-202 "Elevator" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(20): "Elevator contractor" means a sole proprietor, firm, or corporation licensed under this chapter that is engaged in the business of erecting, constructing, installing, altering, servicing, repairing, or maintaining an elevator.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(21): "Elevator mechanic" means an individual who is licensed under this chapter as an elevator mechanic and who is engaged in erecting, constructing, installing, altering, servicing, repairing, or maintaining an elevator under the immediate supervision of an elevator contractor.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(22): "Employee" means an individual as defined by the division by rule giving consideration to the definition adopted by the Internal Revenue Service and the Department of Workforce Services.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(23): "Engage in a construction trade" means to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(23)(a): engage in, represent oneself to be engaged in, or advertise oneself as being engaged in a construction trade; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(23)(b): use the name "contractor" or "builder" or in any other way lead a reasonable person to believe one is or will act as a contractor.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(24): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(24)(a): "Financial responsibility" means a demonstration of a current and expected future condition of financial solvency evidencing a reasonable expectation to the division and the board that an applicant or licensee can successfully engage in business as a contractor without jeopardy to the public health, safety, and welfare.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(24)(b): Financial responsibility may be determined by an evaluation of the total history concerning the licensee or applicant including past, present, and expected condition and record of financial solvency and business conduct.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(25): "Gas appliance" means any device that uses natural gas to produce light, heat, power, steam, hot water, refrigeration, or air conditioning.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(26): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(26)(a): "General building contractor" means a person licensed under this chapter as a general building contractor qualified by education, training, experience, and knowledge to perform or superintend construction of structures for the support, shelter, and enclosure of persons, animals, chattels, or movable property of any kind or any of the components of that construction except plumbing, electrical work, mechanical work, work related to the operating integrity of an elevator, and manufactured housing installation, for which the general building contractor shall employ the services of a contractor licensed in the particular specialty, except that a general building contractor engaged in the construction of single-family and multifamily residences up to four units may perform the mechanical work and hire a licensed plumber or electrician as an employee.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(26)(b): The division may by rule exclude general building contractors from engaging in the performance of other construction specialties in which there is represented a substantial risk to the public health, safety, and welfare, and for which a license is required unless that general building contractor holds a valid license in that specialty classification.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(27): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(27)(a): "General electrical contractor" means a person licensed under this chapter as a general electrical contractor qualified by education, training, experience, and knowledge to perform the fabrication, construction, and installation of generators, transformers, conduits, raceways, panels, switch gear, electrical wires, fixtures, appliances, or apparatus that uses electrical energy.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(27)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The scope of work of a general electrical contractor may be further defined by rules made by the commission, with the concurrence of the director, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a): "General engineering contractor" means a person licensed under this chapter as a general engineering contractor qualified by education, training, experience, and knowledge to perform or superintend construction of fixed works or components of fixed works requiring specialized engineering knowledge and skill in any of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(i): irrigation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(ii): drainage;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(iii): water power;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(iv): water supply;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(v): flood control;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(vi): an inland waterway;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(vii): a harbor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(viii): a railroad;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(ix): a highway;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(x): a tunnel;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(xi): an airport;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(xii): an airport runway;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(xiii): a sewer;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(xiv): a bridge;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(xv): a refinery;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(xvi): a pipeline;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(xvii): a chemical plant;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(xviii): an industrial plant;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(xix): a pier;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(xx): a foundation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(xxi): a power plant; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(a)(xxii): a utility plant or installation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(b): A general engineering contractor may not perform or superintend:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(b)(i): construction of a structure built primarily for the support, shelter, and enclosure of persons, animals, and chattels; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(b)(ii): performance of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(b)(ii)(A): plumbing work;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(b)(ii)(B): electrical work; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(28)(b)(ii)(C): mechanical work.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(29): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(29)(a): "General plumbing contractor" means a person licensed under this chapter as a general plumbing contractor qualified by education, training, experience, and knowledge to perform the fabrication or installation of material and fixtures to create and maintain sanitary conditions in a building by providing permanent means for a supply of safe and pure water, a means for the timely and complete removal from the premises of all used or contaminated water, fluid and semi-fluid organic wastes and other impurities incidental to life and the occupation of such premises, and a safe and adequate supply of gases for lighting, heating, and industrial purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(29)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The scope of work of a general plumbing contractor may be further defined by rules made by the commission, with the concurrence of the director, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(30): "Immediate supervision" means reasonable direction, oversight, inspection, and evaluation of the work of a person:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(30)(a): as the division specifies in rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(30)(b): by, as applicable, a qualified electrician or plumber;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(30)(c): as part of a planned program of training; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(30)(d): to ensure that the end result complies with applicable standards.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(31): "Individual" means a natural person.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(32): "Journeyman electrician" means a person licensed under this chapter as a journeyman electrician having the qualifications, training, experience, and knowledge to wire, install, and repair electrical apparatus and equipment for light, heat, power, and other purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(33): "Journeyman plumber" means a person licensed under this chapter as a journeyman plumber having the qualifications, training, experience, and technical knowledge to engage in the plumbing trade.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(34): "Master electrician" means a person licensed under this chapter as a master electrician having the qualifications, training, experience, and knowledge to properly plan, layout, and supervise the wiring, installation, and repair of electrical apparatus and equipment for light, heat, power, and other purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(35): "Master plumber" means a person licensed under this chapter as a master plumber having the qualifications, training, experience, and knowledge to properly plan and layout projects and supervise persons in the plumbing trade.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(36): "Person" means a natural person, sole proprietorship, joint venture, corporation, limited liability company, association, or organization of any type.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(37): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(37)(a): "Plumbing trade" means the performance of any mechanical work pertaining to the installation, alteration, change, repair, removal, maintenance, or use in buildings, or within three feet beyond the outside walls of buildings, of pipes, fixtures, and fittings for the:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(37)(a)(i): delivery of the water supply;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(37)(a)(ii): discharge of liquid and water carried waste;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(37)(a)(iii): building drainage system within the walls of the building; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(37)(a)(iv): delivery of gases for lighting, heating, and industrial purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(37)(b): "Plumbing trade" includes work pertaining to the water supply, distribution pipes, fixtures and fixture traps, soil, waste and vent pipes, the building drain and roof drains, and the safe and adequate supply of gases, together with their devices, appurtenances, and connections where installed within the outside walls of the building.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(38): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Ratio of apprentices" means the number of licensed plumber apprentices or licensed electrician apprentices that are allowed to be under the immediate supervision of a licensed supervisor as established by the provisions of this chapter and by rules made by the commission, with the concurrence of the director, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(39): "Residential and small commercial contractor" means a person licensed under this chapter as a residential and small commercial contractor qualified by education, training, experience, and knowledge to perform or superintend the construction of single-family residences, multifamily residences up to four units, and commercial construction of not more than three stories above ground and not more than 20,000 square feet, or any of the components of that construction except plumbing, electrical work, mechanical work, and manufactured housing installation, for which the residential and small commercial contractor shall employ the services of a contractor licensed in the particular specialty, except that a residential and small commercial contractor engaged in the construction of single-family and multifamily residences up to four units may perform the mechanical work and hire a licensed plumber or electrician as an employee.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(40): "Residential building," as it relates to the license classification of residential journeyman plumber and residential master plumber, means a single or multiple family dwelling of up to four units.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(41): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(41)(a): "Residential electrical contractor" means a person licensed under this chapter as a residential electrical contractor qualified by education, training, experience, and knowledge to perform the fabrication, construction, and installation of services, disconnecting means, grounding devices, panels, conductors, load centers, lighting and plug circuits, appliances, and fixtures in a residential unit.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(41)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The scope of work of a residential electrical contractor may be further defined by rules made by the commission, with the concurrence of the director, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(42): "Residential journeyman electrician" means a person licensed under this chapter as a residential journeyman electrician having the qualifications, training, experience, and knowledge to wire, install, and repair electrical apparatus and equipment for light, heat, power, and other purposes on buildings using primarily nonmetallic sheath cable.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(43): "Residential journeyman plumber" means a person licensed under this chapter as a residential journeyman plumber having the qualifications, training, experience, and knowledge to engage in the plumbing trade as limited to the plumbing of residential buildings.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(44): "Residential master electrician" means a person licensed under this chapter as a residential master electrician having the qualifications, training, experience, and knowledge to properly plan, layout, and supervise the wiring, installation, and repair of electrical apparatus and equipment for light, heat, power, and other purposes on residential projects.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(45): "Residential master plumber" means a person licensed under this chapter as a residential master plumber having the qualifications, training, experience, and knowledge to properly plan and layout projects and supervise persons in the plumbing trade as limited to the plumbing of residential buildings.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(46): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(46)(a): "Residential plumbing contractor" means a person licensed under this chapter as a residential plumbing contractor qualified by education, training, experience, and knowledge to perform the fabrication or installation of material and fixtures to create and maintain sanitary conditions in residential buildings by providing permanent means for a supply of safe and pure water, a means for the timely and complete removal from the premises of all used or contaminated water, fluid and semi-fluid organic wastes and other impurities incidental to life and the occupation of such premises, and a safe and adequate supply of gases for lighting, heating, and residential purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(46)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The scope of work of a residential plumbing contractor may be further defined by rules made by the commission, with the concurrence of the director, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(47): "Residential project," as it relates to an electrician or electrical contractor, means buildings primarily wired with nonmetallic sheathed cable, in accordance with standard rules and regulations governing this work, including the National Electrical Code, and in which the voltage does not exceed 250 volts line to line and 125 volts to ground.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(48): "Responsible management personnel" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(48)(a): a qualifying agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(48)(b): an operations manager; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(48)(c): a site manager.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(49): "Sensitive alarm system information" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(49)(a): a pass code or other code used in the operation of an alarm system;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(49)(b): information on the location of alarm system components at the premises of a customer of the alarm business providing the alarm system;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(49)(c): information that would allow the circumvention, bypass, deactivation, or other compromise of an alarm system of a customer of the alarm business providing the alarm system; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(49)(d): any other similar information that the division by rule determines to be information that an individual employed by an alarm business should use or have access to only if the individual is licensed as provided in this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(50): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(50)(a): "Specialty contractor" means a person licensed under this chapter under a specialty contractor classification established by rule, who is qualified by education, training, experience, and knowledge to perform those construction trades and crafts requiring specialized skill, the regulation of which are determined by the division to be in the best interest of the public health, safety, and welfare.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(50)(b): A specialty contractor may perform work in crafts or trades other than those in which the specialty contractor is licensed if they are incidental to the performance of the specialty contractor's licensed craft or trade.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(51): "Unincorporated entity" means an entity that is not:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(51)(a): an individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(51)(b): a corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(51)(c): publicly traded.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(52): 58-1-501; 58-55-501 "Unlawful conduct" means the same as that term is defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(53): 58-1-501; 58-55-502 "Unprofessional conduct" means the same as that term is defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-102(54): "Wages" means amounts due to an employee for labor or services whether the amount is fixed or ascertained on a time, task, piece, commission, or other basis for calculating the amount.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103 Construction Services Commission created -- Functions -- Appointment -- Qualifications and terms of members -- Vacancies -- Expenses -- Meetings -- Concurrence.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(1): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 63J-1-504; 38-11-207; 58-55-503; 58-1-401
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(1)(a): There is created within the division the Construction Services Commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(1)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 63J-1-504; 38-11-207; 58-55-503; 58-1-401 The commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(1)(b)(i): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act with the concurrence of the director, make reasonable rules under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(1)(b)(i)(A): licensing of various licensees;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(1)(b)(i)(B): examination requirements and administration of the examinations, to include approving and establishing a passing score for applicant examinations;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(1)(b)(i)(C): standards of supervision for students or persons in training to become qualified to obtain a license in the trade they represent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(1)(b)(i)(D): standards of conduct for various licensees;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(1)(b)(ii): 63J-1-504 approve or disapprove fees adopted by the division under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(1)(b)(iii): except where the boards conduct them, conduct all administrative hearings not delegated to an administrative law judge relating to the licensing of any applicant;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(1)(b)(iv): 38-11-207; 58-55-503; 58-1-401 except as otherwise provided in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(1)(b)(v): advise the director on the administration and enforcement of any matters affecting the division and the construction industry;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(1)(b)(vi): advise the director on matters affecting the division budget;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(1)(b)(vii): advise and assist trade associations in conducting construction trade seminars and industry education and promotion; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(1)(b)(viii): perform other duties as provided by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(2)(a): Initially the commission shall be comprised of the five members of the Contractors Licensing Board and two of the three chair persons from the Plumbers Licensing Board, the Alarm System Security and Licensing Board, and the Electricians Licensing Board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(2)(b): The terms of office of the commission members who are serving on the Contractors Licensing Board shall continue as they serve on the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(2)(c): Beginning July 1, 2004, the commission shall be comprised of nine members appointed by the executive director with the approval of the governor from the following groups:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(2)(c)(i): one member shall be a licensed general engineering contractor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(2)(c)(ii): one member shall be a licensed general building contractor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(2)(c)(iii): two members shall be licensed residential and small commercial contractors;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(2)(c)(iv): three members shall be the three chair persons from the Plumbers Licensing Board, the Alarm System Security and Licensing Board, and the Electricians Licensing Board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(2)(c)(v): two members shall be from the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(3): (3)(b); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(3)(a): (3)(b) Except as required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(3)(b): (3)(a) Notwithstanding the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(3)(c): A commission member may not serve more than two consecutive terms.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(4): The commission shall elect annually one of its members as chair, for a term of one year.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(5): When a vacancy occurs in the membership for any reason, the replacement shall be appointed for the unexpired term.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(6): 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107; 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107 A member may not receive compensation or benefits for the member's service, but may receive per diem and travel expenses in accordance with:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(6)(a): 63A-3-106 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(6)(b): 63A-3-107 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(6)(c): 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107 rules made by the Division of Finance pursuant to Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(7)(a): The commission shall meet at least monthly unless the director determines otherwise.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(7)(b): The director may call additional meetings at the director's discretion, upon the request of the chair, or upon the written request of four or more commission members.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(8)(a): Five members constitute a quorum for the transaction of business.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(8)(b): If a quorum is present when a vote is taken, the affirmative vote of commission members present is the act of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(9): Title 13, Chapter 1, Department of Commerce; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act The commission shall comply with the procedures and requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(10): (10); (10)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(10)(a): (10) For purposes of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(10)(b): If a provision of this chapter requires concurrence between the director or division and the commission and no concurrence can be reached, the director or division has final authority.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(10)(c): (10)(c) When this chapter requires concurrence between the director or division and the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(10)(c)(i): the director or division shall report to and update the commission on a regular basis related to matters requiring concurrence; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(10)(c)(ii): (10)(c) the commission shall review the report submitted by the director or division under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(10)(c)(ii)(A): provide a reason for not concurring with the report; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-103(10)(c)(ii)(B): provide recommendations to the director or division.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-104 Electrician Education Fund.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-104(1): There is created an expendable special revenue fund known as the Electrician Education Fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-104(2): 63J-1-504 The fund consists of money from a surcharge fee, established by the division in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-104(3): (2) The surcharge fee described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-104(4): The fund shall earn interest and all interest earned on fund money shall be deposited into the fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-104(5): The director may, with the concurrence of the commission, make distributions from the fund for the following purposes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-104(5)(a): education and training of licensees under this chapter who are practicing in the electrical trade; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-104(5)(b): education and training of other licensees under this chapter or the public in matters concerning electrical laws and practices.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-104(6): If the balance in the fund is more than $100,000 at the end of any fiscal year, the excess amount shall be transferred to the General Fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-104(7): The division shall report annually to the Business, Economic Development, and Labor Appropriations Subcommittee regarding the balance in the fund and how the fund is being used.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-105 Plumber Education Fund.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-105(1): There is created an expendable special revenue fund known as the Plumber Education Fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-105(2): 63J-1-504 The fund consists of money from a surcharge fee, established by the division in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-105(3): (2) The surcharge fee described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-105(4): The fund shall earn interest and all interest earned on fund money shall be deposited into the fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-105(5): (2) The director may, with the concurrence of the commission, make distributions from the fund for the following purposes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-105(5)(a): (2) education and training of licensees under this chapter who are licensed in the professions described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-105(5)(b): education and training of other licensees under this chapter or the public in matters concerning plumbing laws and practices.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-105(6): If the balance in the fund is more than $100,000 at the end of any fiscal year, the excess amount shall be transferred to the General Fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-105(7): The division shall report annually to the Business, Economic Development, and Labor Appropriations Subcommittee regarding the balance in the fund and how the fund is being used.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-106 Surcharge fee.
----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-106(1): 63J-1-504 In addition to any other fees authorized by this chapter or by the division in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-106(2): The surcharge fee shall be deposited in the General Fund as a dedicated credit to be used by the division to provide each licensee under this chapter with access to an electronic reference library that provides web-based access to national, state, and local building codes and standards.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201 Boards created -- Duties.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(1): There is created the Plumbers Licensing Board consisting of seven members as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(1)(a): three members shall be licensed from among the license classifications of master or journeyman plumber, of whom at least one shall represent a union organization and at least one shall be selected having no union affiliation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(1)(b): three members shall be licensed plumbing contractors, of whom at least one shall represent a union organization and at least one shall be selected having no union affiliation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(1)(c): one member shall be from the public at large with no history of involvement in the construction trades.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(2): (2)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(2)(a): There is created the Alarm System Security and Licensing Board consisting of five members as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(2)(a)(i): three individuals who are officers or owners of a licensed alarm business;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(2)(a)(ii): one individual from among nominees of the Utah Peace Officers Association; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(2)(a)(iii): one individual representing the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(2)(b): The Alarm System Security and Licensing Board shall designate one of its members on a permanent or rotating basis to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(2)(b)(i): assist the division in reviewing complaints concerning the unlawful or unprofessional conduct of a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(2)(b)(ii): advise the division in its investigation of these complaints.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(2)(c): (2)(c) A board member who has, under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(3): There is created the Electricians Licensing Board consisting of seven members as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(3)(a): three members shall be licensed from among the license classifications of master or journeyman electrician, of whom at least one shall represent a union organization and at least one shall be selected having no union affiliation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(3)(b): three members shall be licensed electrical contractors, of whom at least one shall represent a union organization and at least one shall be selected having no union affiliation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(3)(c): one member shall be from the public at large with no history of involvement in the construction trades or union affiliation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(4): (1); (3) The duties, functions, and responsibilities of each board described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(4)(a): recommending to the commission appropriate rules;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(4)(b): recommending to the commission policy and budgetary matters;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(4)(c): approving and establishing a passing score for applicant examinations;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(4)(d): overseeing the screening of applicants for licensing, renewal, reinstatement, and relicensure;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(4)(e): assisting the commission in establishing standards of supervision for students or persons in training to become qualified to obtain a license in the occupation or profession the board represents; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-201(4)(f): acting as presiding officer in conducting hearings associated with the adjudicative proceedings and in issuing recommended orders when so authorized by the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301 License required -- License classifications.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(1): 58-1-307; 58-55-305
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(1)(a): 58-1-307; 58-55-305 A person engaged in the construction trades licensed under this chapter, as a contractor regulated under this chapter, as an alarm business or company, or as an alarm company agent, shall become licensed under this chapter before engaging in that trade or contracting activity in this state unless specifically exempted from licensure under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(1)(b): The license issued under this chapter and the business license issued by the local jurisdiction in which the licensee has its principal place of business shall be the only licenses required for the licensee to engage in a trade licensed by this chapter, within the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(1)(c): Neither the state nor any of its political subdivisions may require of a licensee any additional business licenses, registrations, certifications, contributions, donations, or anything else established for the purpose of qualifying a licensee under this chapter to do business in that local jurisdiction, except for contract prequalification procedures required by state agencies, or the payment of any fee for the license, registration, or certification established as a condition to do business in that local jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2): The division shall issue licenses under this chapter to qualified persons in the following classifications:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(a): general engineering contractor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(b): general building contractor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(c): residential and small commercial contractor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(d): elevator contractor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(e): general plumbing contractor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(f): residential plumbing contractor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(g): general electrical contractor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(h): residential electrical contractor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(i): specialty contractor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(j): master plumber;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(k): residential master plumber;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(l): journeyman plumber;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(m): apprentice plumber;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(n): residential journeyman plumber;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(o): master electrician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(p): residential master electrician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(q): journeyman electrician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(r): residential journeyman electrician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(s): apprentice electrician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(t): construction trades instructor:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(t)(i): general engineering classification;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(t)(ii): general building classification;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(t)(iii): electrical classification;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(t)(iv): plumbing classification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(t)(v): mechanical classification;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(u): alarm company;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(v): alarm company agent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(2)(w): elevator mechanic.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(3)(a): An applicant may apply for a license in one or more classification or specialty contractor subclassification.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(3)(b): A license shall be granted in each classification or subclassification for which the applicant qualifies.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-301(3)(c): A separate application and fee must be submitted for each license classification or subclassification.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302 Qualifications for licensure.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1): 63J-1-504; (1)(e)(iii); (1)(e)(iv); 58-55-304; (2)(a); (1)(e)(iii); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act Each applicant for a license under this chapter shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(a): submit an application prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee as determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(c): (1)(e)(iii); (1)(e)(iv); 58-55-304 meet the examination requirements established by this section and by rule by the commission with the concurrence of the director, which requirements include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(c)(i): for licensure as an apprentice electrician, apprentice plumber, or specialty contractor, no division-administered examination is required;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(c)(ii): (1)(e)(iii); (1)(e)(iv) for licensure as a general building contractor, general engineering contractor, residential and small commercial contractor, general plumbing contractor, residential plumbing contractor, general electrical contractor, or residential electrical contractor, the only required division-administered examination is a division-administered examination that covers information from the 25-hour course described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(c)(iii): 58-55-304 if required in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(d): if an apprentice, identify the proposed supervisor of the apprenticeship;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(e): (2)(a); (1)(e)(iii); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act if an applicant for a contractor's license:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(e)(i): produce satisfactory evidence of financial responsibility, except for a construction trades instructor for whom evidence of financial responsibility is not required;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(e)(ii): (2)(a) produce satisfactory evidence of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(e)(ii)(A): (2)(a) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(e)(ii)(B): knowledge of the principles of the conduct of business as a contractor, reasonably necessary for the protection of the public health, safety, and welfare;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(e)(iii): except as otherwise provided by rule by the commission with the concurrence of the director, complete a 25-hour course established by rule by the commission with the concurrence of the director, which is taught by an approved prelicensure course provider, and which course may include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(e)(iii)(A): construction business practices;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(e)(iii)(B): bookkeeping fundamentals;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(e)(iii)(C): mechanics lien fundamentals;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(e)(iii)(D): other aspects of business and construction principles considered important by the commission with the concurrence of the director; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(e)(iii)(E): for no additional fee, a provider-administered examination at the end of the 25-hour course;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(e)(iv): (1)(e)(iii) complete a five-hour business and law course established by rule by the commission with the concurrence of the director, which is taught by an approved prelicensure course provider, if an applicant for licensure as a general building contractor, general engineering contractor, residential and small commercial contractor, general plumbing contractor, residential plumbing contractor, general electrical contractor, or residential electrical contractor, except that if the 25-hour course described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(e)(v): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(e)(v)(A): be a licensed master electrician if an applicant for an electrical contractor's license or a licensed master residential electrician if an applicant for a residential electrical contractor's license;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(e)(v)(B): be a licensed master plumber if an applicant for a plumbing contractor's license or a licensed master residential plumber if an applicant for a residential plumbing contractor's license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(e)(v)(C): be a licensed elevator mechanic and produce satisfactory evidence of three years experience as an elevator mechanic if an applicant for an elevator contractor's license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(e)(vi): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act when the applicant is an unincorporated entity, provide a list of the one or more individuals who hold an ownership interest in the applicant as of the day on which the application is filed that includes for each individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(e)(vi)(A): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act the individual's name, address, birth date, and social security number or other satisfactory evidence of the applicant's identity permitted under rules made by the division in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(e)(vi)(B): whether the individual will engage in a construction trade; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(1)(f): if an applicant for a construction trades instructor license, satisfy any additional requirements established by rule.
