Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(a): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (3)(a); 58-55-303; (3)(a); 58-55-303; (3)(a); 58-55-303
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(a)(i): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act A master plumber shall produce satisfactory evidence that the applicant:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(a)(i)(A): has been a licensed journeyman plumber for at least two years and had two years of supervisory experience as a licensed journeyman plumber in accordance with division rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(a)(i)(B): has received at least an associate of applied science degree or similar degree following the completion of a course of study approved by the division and had one year of supervisory experience as a licensed journeyman plumber in accordance with division rule; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(a)(i)(C): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act meets the qualifications for expedited licensure as established by rules made by the commission, with the concurrence of the director, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(a)(ii): (3)(a); 58-55-303 An individual holding a valid Utah license as a journeyman plumber, based on at least four years of practical experience as a licensed apprentice under the supervision of a licensed journeyman plumber and four years as a licensed journeyman plumber, in effect immediately prior to May 5, 2008, is on and after May 5, 2008, considered to hold a current master plumber license under this chapter, and satisfies the requirements of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(a)(iii): (3)(a); 58-55-303; (3)(a); 58-55-303 An individual holding a valid plumbing contractor's license or residential plumbing contractor's license, in effect immediately prior to May 5, 2008, is on or after May 5, 2008:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(a)(iii)(A): (3)(a); 58-55-303 considered to hold a current master plumber license under this chapter if licensed as a plumbing contractor and a journeyman plumber, and satisfies the requirements of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(a)(iii)(B): (3)(a); 58-55-303 considered to hold a current residential master plumber license under this chapter if licensed as a residential plumbing contractor and a residential journeyman plumber, and satisfies the requirements of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act A master residential plumber applicant shall produce satisfactory evidence that the applicant:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(b)(i): has been a licensed residential journeyman plumber for at least two years and had two years of supervisory experience as a licensed residential journeyman plumber in accordance with division rule; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(b)(ii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act meets the qualifications for expedited licensure as established by rules made by the commission, with the concurrence of the director, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(c): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act A journeyman plumber applicant shall produce satisfactory evidence of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(c)(i): successful completion of the equivalent of at least four years of full-time training and instruction as a licensed apprentice plumber under supervision of a licensed master plumber or journeyman plumber and in accordance with a planned program of training approved by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(c)(ii): at least eight years of full-time experience approved by the division in collaboration with the Plumbers Licensing Board; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(c)(iii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act meeting the qualifications for expedited licensure as established by rules made by the commission, with the concurrence of the director, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(d): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act A residential journeyman plumber shall produce satisfactory evidence of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(d)(i): completion of the equivalent of at least three years of full-time training and instruction as a licensed apprentice plumber under the supervision of a licensed residential master plumber, licensed residential journeyman plumber, or licensed journeyman plumber in accordance with a planned program of training approved by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(d)(ii): completion of at least six years of full-time experience in a maintenance or repair trade involving substantial plumbing work; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(d)(iii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act meeting the qualifications for expedited licensure as established by rules made by the commission, with the concurrence of the director, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(e): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The conduct of licensed apprentice plumbers and their licensed supervisors shall be in accordance with the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(e)(i): while engaging in the trade of plumbing, a licensed apprentice plumber shall be under the immediate supervision of a licensed master plumber, licensed residential master plumber, licensed journeyman plumber, or licensed residential journeyman plumber;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(e)(ii): beginning in a licensed apprentice plumber's fourth year of training, a licensed apprentice plumber may work without supervision for a period not to exceed eight hours in any 24-hour period; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(e)(iii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act rules made by the commission, with the concurrence of the director, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(f): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act A master electrician applicant shall produce satisfactory evidence that the applicant:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(f)(i): is a graduate electrical engineer of an accredited college or university approved by the division and has one year of practical electrical experience as a licensed apprentice electrician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(f)(ii): is a graduate of an electrical trade school, having received an associate of applied sciences degree following successful completion of a course of study approved by the division, and has two years of practical experience as a licensed journeyman electrician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(f)(iii): has four years of practical experience as a journeyman electrician; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(f)(iv): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act meets the qualifications for expedited licensure as established by rules made by the commission, with the concurrence of the director, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(g): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act A master residential electrician applicant shall produce satisfactory evidence that the applicant:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(g)(i): has at least two years of practical experience as a residential journeyman electrician; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(g)(ii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act meets the qualifications for expedited licensure as established by rules made by the commission, with the concurrence of the director, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(h): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act A journeyman electrician applicant shall produce satisfactory evidence that the applicant:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(h)(i): has successfully completed at least four years of full-time training and instruction as a licensed apprentice electrician under the supervision of a master electrician or journeyman electrician and in accordance with a planned training program approved by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(h)(ii): has at least eight years of full-time experience approved by the division in collaboration with the Electricians Licensing Board; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(h)(iii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act meets the qualifications for expedited licensure as established by rules made by the commission, with the concurrence of the director, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(i): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act A residential journeyman electrician applicant shall produce satisfactory evidence that the applicant:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(i)(i): has successfully completed two years of training in an electrical training program approved by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(i)(ii): has four years of practical experience in wiring, installing, and repairing electrical apparatus and equipment for light, heat, and power under the supervision of a licensed master, journeyman, residential master, or residential journeyman electrician; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(i)(iii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act meets the qualifications for expedited licensure as established by rules made by the commission, with the concurrence of the director, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(j): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The conduct of licensed apprentice electricians and their licensed supervisors shall be in accordance with the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(j)(i): A licensed apprentice electrician shall be under the immediate supervision of a licensed master, journeyman, residential master, or residential journeyman electrician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(j)(ii): beginning in a licensed apprentice electrician's fourth year of training, a licensed apprentice electrician may work without supervision for a period not to exceed eight hours in any 24-hour period;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(j)(iii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act rules made by the commission, with the concurrence of the director, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(j)(iv): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act a licensed supervisor may have up to three licensed apprentice electricians on a residential project, or more if established by rules made by the commission, in concurrence with the director, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(k): 58-55-302.1; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (3)(k)(ii); Title 35A, Chapter 4, Employment Security Act An alarm company applicant shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(k)(i): have a qualifying agent who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(k)(i)(A): is an alarm company officer, alarm company owner, alarm company proprietor, an alarm company trustee, or other responsible management personnel;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(k)(i)(B): demonstrates 6,000 hours of experience in the alarm company business;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(k)(i)(C): demonstrates 2,000 hours of experience as a manager or administrator in the alarm company business or in a construction business; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(k)(i)(D): passes an examination component established by rule by the commission with the concurrence of the director;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(k)(ii): 58-55-302.1; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act provide the name, address, date of birth, social security number, fingerprint card, and consent to a background check in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(k)(iii): (3)(k)(ii) document that none of the persons described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(k)(iii)(A): have been declared by any court of competent jurisdiction incompetent by reason of mental defect or disease and not been restored; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(k)(iii)(B): are currently suffering from habitual drunkenness or from drug addiction or dependence;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(k)(iv): Title 35A, Chapter 4, Employment Security Act file and maintain with the division evidence of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(k)(iv)(A): comprehensive general liability insurance in form and in amounts to be established by rule by the commission with the concurrence of the director;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(k)(iv)(B): workers' compensation insurance that covers employees of the applicant in accordance with applicable Utah law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(k)(iv)(C): Title 35A, Chapter 4, Employment Security Act registration as is required by applicable law with the:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(k)(iv)(C)(I): Division of Corporations and Commercial Code;

Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(k)(iv)(C)(III): State Tax Commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(k)(iv)(C)(IV): Internal Revenue Service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(k)(v): meet with the division and board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(l): 63J-1-504; 58-55-302.1; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act Each applicant for licensure as an alarm company agent shall:

Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(m): 58-1-203; (3)(m)(ii)(A); (3)(m)(ii)(A)(II); 63J-1-504
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(m)(i): 58-1-203 Each applicant for licensure as an elevator mechanic shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(m)(i)(A): provide documentation of experience and education credits of not less than three years work experience in the elevator industry, in construction, maintenance, or service and repair; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(m)(i)(B): 58-1-203 satisfactorily complete a written examination administered by the division established by rule under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(m)(i)(C): provide certificates of completion of an apprenticeship program for elevator mechanics, having standards substantially equal to those of this chapter and registered with the United States Department of Labor Bureau Apprenticeship and Training or a state apprenticeship council.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(m)(ii): (3)(m)(ii)(A); (3)(m)(ii)(A)(II); 63J-1-504
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(m)(ii)(A): (3)(m)(ii)(A) If an elevator contractor licensed under this chapter cannot find a licensed elevator mechanic to perform the work of erecting, constructing, installing, altering, servicing, repairing, or maintaining an elevator, the contractor may:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(m)(ii)(A)(I): notify the division of the unavailability of licensed personnel; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(m)(ii)(A)(II): (3)(m)(ii)(A) request the division issue a temporary elevator mechanic license to an individual certified by the contractor as having an acceptable combination of documented experience and education to perform the work described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(m)(ii)(B): (3)(m)(ii)(A)(II); 63J-1-504
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(m)(ii)(B)(I): (3)(m)(ii)(A)(II); 63J-1-504 The division may issue a temporary elevator mechanic license to an individual certified under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(3)(m)(ii)(B)(II): The division shall specify the time period for which the license is valid and may renew the license for an additional time period upon its determination that a shortage of licensed elevator mechanics continues to exist.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(4): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 58-55-302.1 In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(5): (5)(a)(ii)(B); (5)(a)(ii)(B)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(5)(a): (5)(a)(ii)(B) An application for licensure under this chapter shall be denied if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(5)(a)(i): the applicant has had a previous license, which was issued under this chapter, suspended or revoked within two years before the date of the applicant's application;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(5)(a)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(5)(a)(ii)(A): the applicant is a partnership, corporation, or limited liability company; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(5)(a)(ii)(B): any corporate officer, director, shareholder holding 25% or more of the stock in the applicant, partner, member, agent acting as a qualifier, or any person occupying a similar status, performing similar functions, or directly or indirectly controlling the applicant has served in any similar capacity with any person or entity which has had a previous license, which was issued under this chapter, suspended or revoked within two years before the date of the applicant's application;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(5)(a)(iii): (5)(a)(ii)(B)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(5)(a)(iii)(A): the applicant is an individual or sole proprietorship; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(5)(a)(iii)(B): (5)(a)(ii)(B) any owner or agent acting as a qualifier has served in any capacity listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(5)(a)(iv): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(5)(a)(iv)(A): the applicant includes an individual who was an owner, director, or officer of an unincorporated entity at the time the entity's license under this chapter was revoked; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(5)(a)(iv)(B): the application for licensure is filed within 60 months after the revocation of the unincorporated entity's license.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(5)(b): (5)(a)(ii)(B) An application for licensure under this chapter shall be reviewed by the appropriate licensing board prior to approval if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302(5)(b)(i): the applicant has had a previous license, which was issued under this chapter, suspended or revoked more than two years before the date of the applicant's application;

Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.1 Criminal background check.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.1(1): An applicant for licensure under this chapter who requires a criminal background check shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.1(1)(a): submit fingerprint cards in a form acceptable to the division at the time the license application is filed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.1(1)(b): consent to a fingerprint background check conducted by the Bureau of Criminal Identification and the Federal Bureau of Investigation regarding the application.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.1(2): 53-10-108; (2)(a); 53-10-108 The division shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.1(2)(a): 53-10-108 in addition to other fees authorized by this chapter, collect from each applicant submitting fingerprints in accordance with this section the fee that the Bureau of Criminal Identification is authorized to collect for the services provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.1(2)(b): (2)(a) submit from each applicant the fingerprint card and the fees described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.1(2)(c): 53-10-108 obtain and retain in division records a signed waiver approved by the Bureau of Criminal Identification in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.1(3): 53-10-108; (2)(b) The Bureau of Criminal Identification shall, in accordance with the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.1(3)(a): (2)(b) check the fingerprints submitted under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.1(3)(b): forward the fingerprints to the Federal Bureau of Investigation for a national criminal history background check; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.1(3)(c): provide the results from the state, regional, and nationwide criminal history background checks to the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.1(4): Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 2, Bureau of Criminal Identification For purposes of conducting a criminal background check required under this section, the division shall have direct access to criminal background information maintained under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.1(5): The division may not disseminate outside of the division any criminal history record information that the division obtains from the Bureau of Criminal Identification or the Federal Bureau of Investigation under the criminal background check requirements of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.1(6): 58-55-302; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; 58-55-302; (6)(b); Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.1(6)(a): 58-55-302 A new license issued under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.1(6)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; 58-55-302 Notwithstanding
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.1(6)(c): (6)(b) A person whose conditional license has been revoked under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.7 Continuing education requirements for electricians, elevator mechanics, and plumbers.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.7(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.7(1)(a): "Licensed electrician" means an individual licensed under this chapter as an apprentice electrician, journeyman electrician, master electrician, residential journeyman electrician, or residential master electrician.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.7(1)(b): "Licensed elevator mechanic" means an individual licensed under this chapter as an elevator mechanic.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.7(1)(c): "Licensed plumber" means an individual licensed under this chapter as an apprentice plumber, journeyman plumber, master plumber, residential journeyman plumber, or residential master plumber.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.7(2): 58-55-303(1) Beginning December 1, 2010, during each two-year renewal cycle established by rule under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.7(2)(a): a licensed electrician shall complete 16 hours of continuing education under the continuing education program established under this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.7(2)(b): a licensed plumber shall complete 12 hours of continuing education under the continuing education program established under this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.7(2)(c): a licensed elevator mechanic shall complete eight hours of continuing education under the continuing education program established under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.7(3): The commission shall, with the concurrence of the division, establish by rule:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.7(3)(a): a continuing education program for licensed electricians;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.7(3)(b): a continuing education program for licensed elevator mechanics; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.7(3)(c): a continuing education program for licensed plumbers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.7(4): (2) The division may contract with a person to establish and maintain a continuing education registry to include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.7(4)(a): an online application for a continuing education course provider to apply to the division for approval of the course for inclusion in the continuing education program;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.7(4)(b): a list of courses that the division has approved for inclusion in the continuing education program; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.7(4)(c): (2) a list of courses that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.7(4)(c)(i): a licensed electrician, licensed elevator mechanic, or licensed plumber has completed under the continuing education program; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.7(4)(c)(ii): (2) the licensed electrician, licensed elevator mechanic, or licensed plumber may access to monitor compliance with the continuing education requirement under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-302.7(5): 63J-1-504 The division may charge a fee, established by the division under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304 Licensee names -- License number use -- License qualifier.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(1): No license may be issued by the division in a name that is identical to or so resembles the name of another licensee that the division determines that it may result in confusion or mistake.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(2): The contractor's license number shall be made a part of all permit applications, contracts, agreements, or bids when a license is required.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(3): The division may issue a license in the name of an individual or the name of a business entity for which the individual acts as a qualifier, in accordance with the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(3)(a): An individual shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(3)(a)(i): submit an application in the individual's name;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(3)(a)(ii): demonstrate the individual's own financial responsibility; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(3)(a)(iii): pass the required examination and meet all other requirements of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(3)(b): A business entity shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(3)(b)(i): submit the application in the name of and on behalf of the business entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(3)(b)(ii): list the individual as the qualifier;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(3)(b)(iii): demonstrate financial responsibility of the business entity if applying for a contractor's license;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(3)(b)(iv): provide evidence that the individual qualifier has passed the required examination; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(3)(b)(v): meet all other requirements of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(4): A person acting as a qualifier for a business entity licensee must demonstrate to the division that the individual is an owner, officer, or manager within that business entity who exercises material authority in the conduct of that business entity's contracting business by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(4)(a): making substantive technical and administrative decisions relating to the work performed for which a license is required under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(4)(b): hiring, promoting, transferring, laying off, disciplining, directing, or discharging employees of the licensee either by himself or through others; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(4)(c): not being involved in any other employment or activity which conflicts with the individual's duties and responsibilities to ensure the licensee's performance of work regulated under this chapter does not jeopardize the public health, safety, and welfare.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(5): (5)(b); (c); 58-55-101; 58-55-604; (5)(b); 58-55-101; 58-55-604; (5)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(5)(a): (5)(b); (c) Except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(5)(b): 58-55-101; 58-55-604; (5)(b) If a licensee business entity has maintained its license and has not violated the requirements of this chapter or Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(5)(c): 58-55-101; 58-55-604; (5)(c) If a plumbing or electrical business entity has maintained its license and has not violated the requirements of this chapter or Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(6): (4) If an individual qualifying on behalf of a business entity issued a license under this chapter ceases association with that entity as required in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-304(7): (6) Failure to notify the division of cessation of association or employment of a qualifier as required in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305 Exemptions from licensure.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1): 58-1-307; 73-3-25; (1)(e); (1)(e); (1)(d); (1)(e); 58-1-401(2); 58-55-501; 58-55-502; (1)(h)(i); (1)(h)(i); (1)(h)(ii)(A)(I); (1)(h)(i); 58-55-308(2); 58-55-308(2)(d); 58-55-308(3); (1)(h)(i); (1)(h)(i); (1)(h)(i); 15A-1-202; (1)(e); (1)(k)(i); 58-55-102 In addition to the exemptions from licensure in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1)(a): an authorized representative of the United States government or an authorized employee of the state or any of its political subdivisions when working on construction work of the state or the subdivision, and when acting within the terms of the person's trust, office, or employment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1)(b): 73-3-25 a person engaged in construction or operation incidental to the construction and repair of irrigation and drainage ditches of regularly constituted irrigation districts, reclamation districts, and drainage districts or construction and repair relating to farming, dairying, agriculture, livestock or poultry raising, metal and coal mining, quarries, sand and gravel excavations, well drilling, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1)(c): public utilities operating under the rules of the Public Service Commission on work incidental to their own business;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1)(d): (1)(e) a sole owner of property engaged in building:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1)(d)(i): (1)(e) no more than one residential structure per year on the sole owner's property and no more than three residential structures per five years on the sole owner's property for the sole owner's noncommercial, nonpublic use, except that a person other than the property owner or a person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1)(d)(ii): structures on the sole owner's property for the sole owner's noncommercial, nonpublic use that are incidental to a residential structure on the property, including a shed, carport, or detached garage;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1)(e): (1)(e); (1)(d); (1)(e)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1)(e)(i): a person engaged in construction or renovation of a residential building for noncommercial, nonpublic use if that person:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1)(e)(i)(A): works without compensation other than token compensation that is not considered salary or wages; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1)(e)(i)(B): works under the direction of the property owner who engages in building the structure; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1)(e)(ii): (1)(e); (1)(d); (1)(e) as used in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1)(e)(ii)(A): minimal in value when compared with the fair market value of the services provided by the person;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1)(e)(ii)(B): not related to the fair market value of the services provided by the person; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1)(e)(ii)(C): is incidental to the providing of services by the person including paying for or providing meals or refreshment while services are being provided, or paying reasonable transportation costs incurred by the person in travel to the site of construction;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1)(f): a person engaged in the sale or merchandising of personal property that by its design or manufacture may be attached, installed, or otherwise affixed to real property who has contracted with a person, firm, or corporation licensed under this chapter to install, affix, or attach that property;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1)(g): a contractor submitting a bid on a federal aid highway project, if, before undertaking construction under that bid, the contractor is licensed under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1)(h): 58-1-401(2); 58-55-501; 58-55-502; (1)(h)(i); (1)(h)(i); (1)(h)(ii)(A)(I); (1)(h)(i); 58-55-308(2); 58-55-308(2)(d); 58-55-308(3); (1)(h)(i); (1)(h)(i); (1)(h)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1)(h)(i): 58-1-401(2); 58-55-501; 58-55-502 subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1)(h)(ii): (1)(h)(i); (1)(h)(i); (1)(h)(ii)(A)(I); (1)(h)(i); 58-55-308(2); 58-55-308(2)(d); 58-55-308(3); (1)(h)(i); (1)(h)(i); (1)(h)(i) notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1)(h)(ii)(A): (1)(h)(i); (1)(h)(ii)(A)(I) work in the plumbing and electrical trades on a Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-305(1)(h)(ii)(A)(II): (1)(h)(ii)(A)(I) may be performed by a licensed journeyman electrician or plumber or an individual referred to in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-306 Financial responsibility.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-306(1): An applicant for licensure as a contractor, and a licensee applying for renewal or reinstatement of a contractor's license shall demonstrate to the division and the commission the applicant's or licensee's financial responsibility before the issuance of or the renewal or reinstatement of a license by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-306(1)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-306(1)(a)(i): completing a questionnaire developed by the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-306(1)(a)(ii): signing the questionnaire, certifying that the information provided is true and accurate; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-306(1)(b): submitting a bond in an amount and form determined by the commission with the concurrence of the director.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-306(2): A licensee, including an individual who holds an ownership interest in an unincorporated entity licensee, shall maintain financial responsibility throughout the period of licensure.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-306(3): The division may audit the financial responsibility of an applicant or licensee on a random basis or upon finding of a reasonable need.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-306(4): The burden to demonstrate financial responsibility is upon the applicant, licensee, or owner of an unincorporated entity licensee, as the case may be.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-306(5): (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-306(5)(a): (1) In determining the financial responsibility of an applicant or licensee described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-306(5)(a)(i): shall consider the personal financial information of each individual who holds an ownership interest in the unincorporated entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-306(5)(a)(ii): may, at any time:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-306(5)(a)(ii)(A): audit the personal financial information of any individual who holds an ownership interest in the unincorporated entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-306(5)(a)(ii)(B): request and obtain a credit report on the individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-306(5)(b): If, based on the personal financial information of one or more individuals who hold an ownership interest in the unincorporated entity, the division determines that the applicant or licensee lacks financial responsibility to engage successfully in business as a contractor, the division may:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-306(5)(b)(i): prohibit the individual or individuals from engaging in a construction trade;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-306(5)(b)(ii): prohibit the applicant or licensee from engaging in a construction trade, unless the individual or individuals dissociate from the applicant or licensee within 10 days after the division makes the determination of a lack of financial responsibility; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-306(5)(b)(iii): require the individual or individuals, applicant, or licensee to submit a bond that is in a form determined by the commission with the concurrence of the director and in an amount that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-306(5)(b)(iii)(A): determined by the commission with the concurrence of the director; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-306(5)(b)(iii)(B): 20% of the annual gross distributions from the unincorporated entity to its owners and that includes coverage for unpaid obligations incurred by the licensee contractor and any failure of the licensee contractor owners to pay income taxes and self-employment taxes on the gross distributions from the unincorporated entity to its owners.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-307(1)(a): Title 63G, Chapter 2, Government Records Access and Management Act constitute protected records under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-307(1)(b): (1)(a); Title 52, Chapter 4, Open and Public Meetings Act notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-307(2): Title 63G, Chapter 2, Government Records Access and Management Act; (1) Notwithstanding the provisions of

Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1 Definitions -- Installation of natural gas facilities -- Scope of practice.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1): 54-2-1; (1)(c)(i)(A); (B) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(a): 54-2-1 "Gas corporation" is as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(b): "Minimum system" means the minimum natural gas facilities necessary to serve each intended consumer, as determined by a gas corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(c): (1)(c)(i)(A); (B)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(c)(i): (1)(c)(i)(A); (B) "Natural gas facilities" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(c)(i)(A): one or more natural gas mains;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(c)(i)(B): one or more natural gas service lines; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(c)(i)(C): (1)(c)(i)(A); (B) a combination of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(c)(ii): "Natural gas facilities" includes any necessary appurtenant facilities.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(d)(i): "Natural gas main" means a natural gas distribution pipeline that delivers natural gas to another natural gas distribution supply line or to a natural gas service line.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(d)(ii): "Natural gas main" does not include a natural gas service line.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(e): "Natural gas service line" means a natural gas pipeline that carries natural gas from a natural gas main to a meter for use by the ultimate consumer.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(f): "Natural gas tariff specifications" means the standards and specifications:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(f)(i): for the construction of natural gas facilities; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(f)(ii): that are:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(f)(ii)(A): established by a gas corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(f)(ii)(B): included in the gas corporation's tariff that is approved by the Public Service Commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(g): "Qualifying installer" means a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(g)(i): a gas corporation approves to install natural gas facilities; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(g)(ii): is:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(g)(ii)(A): licensed under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(1)(g)(ii)(B): authorized to install natural gas facilities within the person's scope of practice as established by statute or administrative rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(2): A qualifying installer may install natural gas facilities.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(3): (3)(b); (c)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(3)(a): (3)(b); (c) Except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(3)(b): A gas corporation shall pay the costs of the following services related to natural gas facilities installed by a qualifying installer:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(3)(b)(i): engineering;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(3)(b)(ii): inspection;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(3)(b)(iii): mapping; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(3)(b)(iv): locating.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(3)(c): If a gas corporation requires a qualifying installer to install natural gas facilities that are greater than the minimum system, the gas corporation shall pay any difference in cost between the required natural gas facilities and the minimum system.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(4): A gas corporation shall inspect and test natural gas facilities that a qualifying installer installs to verify that the natural gas facilities comply with applicable federal, state, and local law and natural gas tariff specifications.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-308.1(5): A gas corporation is not required to supply natural gas to or accept ownership of natural gas facilities until the gas corporation completes all necessary inspections and testing to verify that the natural gas facilities have been installed and tested in compliance with applicable federal, state, and local law and natural gas tariff specifications.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-310 Requirements when working for political subdivision or state agency.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Each political subdivision and agency of the state and each board of education which requires the issuance of a permit or license as a precondition to the construction, alteration, improvement, demolition, or other repairs for which a contractor's license is also required under this chapter shall:Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-310(1): require that each applicant for a permit or license file a signed statement that the applicant has a current contractor's license with the license number included in the application;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-310(2): require that any representation of exemption from the contractor's licensing law be included in the signed statement and that if that exempt person, firm, corporation, association, or other organization intends to hire a contractor to perform any work under the permit or license, that the license number of that contractor be included in the application, but if a contractor has not been selected at the time of the application for a permit or license, the permit or license shall be issued only on the condition that a currently licensed contractor will be selected and that the license number of the contractor will be given to the issuing public body and displayed on the permit or license;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-310(3): require that, upon issuance of a permit or license, the contractor affix the contractor's license number to that permit or license for public display; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-310(4): require the contractor to provide proof that the contractor provides workers' compensation insurance, pays into the unemployment insurance fund, provides health insurance as required under federal or state law, and withholds applicable taxes from worker pay.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-311 Evidence of licensure.
------------------------------------------------------
An individual licensed as an alarm company agent shall:Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-311(1): carry a copy of the individual's license on the individual's person at all times while acting as a licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-311(2): display the license upon the request of a peace officer, a representative of the division, or a representative of a customer of the alarm company.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-312 Interim and temporary permits for alarm company agents.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-312(1): 58-55-302; (3) Upon receipt of a complete application for licensure in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-312(1)(a): an interim permit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-312(1)(b): (3) subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-312(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-312(2)(a): Each interim permit shall expire 90 days after it is issued or on the date on which the applicant is issued a license, whichever is earlier.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-312(2)(b): The division may reissue an interim permit if the delay in approving a license is beyond the control or influence of the interim permit holder.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-312(3): (3)(a)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-312(3)(a): (3)(a)(ii) The division may issue a temporary permit to an applicant for a license as an alarm company agent if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-312(3)(a)(i): the division has received a background check on the applicant from the Bureau of Criminal Identification;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-312(3)(a)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-312(3)(a)(ii)(A): the applicant is or will be employed at a call center, office, or administrative facility of an alarm company; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-312(3)(a)(ii)(B): the applicant's only contact with a customer or potential customer of the alarm company is:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-312(3)(a)(ii)(B)(I): from the call center, office, or administrative facility; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-312(3)(a)(ii)(B)(II): by telephone or other remote communication method; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-312(3)(a)(iii): (3)(a)(ii) the alarm company by which the applicant is or will be employed affirms in writing to the division that the applicant, if issued a temporary license, will act only within the scope of the temporary license, as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-312(3)(b): A temporary license under this section expires the earliest of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-312(3)(b)(i): 90 days after it is issued;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-312(3)(b)(ii): the date on which the individual to whom the temporary license is issued leaves the employment of the alarm company that employs the individual at the time the temporary license is issued; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-312(3)(b)(iii): the date on which the division issues a regular license to the applicant or denies the applicant's application.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-312(4): An interim permit holder may engage in the scope of an alarm company agent.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-401(1)(a): refuse to issue a license to an applicant;

Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-401(1)(f): issue a cease and desist order.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-401(2)(a): the applicant or licensee is an unincorporated entity; and

Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-402 Investigation of regulated activity.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-402(1): The division shall be responsible for the investigation of persons and activities in violation of the provisions of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-402(2): (2)(b); Title 72, Chapter 7, Part 5, Utah Outdoor Advertising Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-402(2)(a): Investigation by the division shall include investigations of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-402(2)(a)(i): licensees engaged in unlawful or unprofessional conduct; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-402(2)(a)(ii): unlicensed persons engaged in the conduct of activity or work regulated under this chapter and for which a license is required.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-402(2)(b): (2)(b); Title 72, Chapter 7, Part 5, Utah Outdoor Advertising Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-402(2)(b)(i): (2)(b); Title 72, Chapter 7, Part 5, Utah Outdoor Advertising Act As used in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-402(2)(b)(i)(A): means a sign installation contractor or nonelectrical outdoor advertising sign contractor, as classified and defined in division rules; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-402(2)(b)(i)(B): Title 72, Chapter 7, Part 5, Utah Outdoor Advertising Act does not include a sign installation contractor or nonelectrical outdoor advertising sign contractor, as classified and defined in division rules, that is subject to
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-402(2)(b)(ii): The division shall maintain a record of the number of unlicensed persons found to have engaged each year in the conduct of activity or work regulated under this chapter for which a license as a sign contractor is required, including the location where a violation occurred.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-402(3): The division shall decline to proceed with investigation of the violation of any provisions of this chapter if the division finds there is no apparent material jeopardy to the public health, safety, and welfare.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-402(4): 58-1-501(2)(a)(vii); 58-55-502(2); (3); (4); 58-55-501(16) The division shall have no responsibility for the inspection of construction work performed in the state to determine compliance with applicable codes, or industry and workmanship standards, except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-402(5): Authorized representatives of the division shall be permitted to enter upon the premises or site of work regulated under this chapter for the purpose of determining compliance with the provisions of this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-403 Minimum time for division action.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
The division has at least five working days after receiving an application for licensure to determine whether to issue a license under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501 Unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------
Unlawful conduct includes:Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(1): engaging in a construction trade, acting as a contractor, an alarm business or company, or an alarm company agent, or representing oneself to be engaged in a construction trade or to be acting as a contractor in a construction trade requiring licensure, unless the person doing any of these is appropriately licensed or exempted from licensure under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(2): acting in a construction trade, as an alarm business or company, or as an alarm company agent beyond the scope of the license held;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(3): hiring or employing a person who is not licensed under this chapter to perform work on a project, unless the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(3)(a): is an employee of a person licensed under this chapter for wages; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(3)(b): is not required to be licensed under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(4): applying for or obtaining a building permit either for oneself or another when not licensed or exempted from licensure as a contractor under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(5): issuing a building permit to any person for whom there is no evidence of a current license or exemption from licensure as a contractor under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(6): applying for or obtaining a building permit for the benefit of or on behalf of any other person who is required to be licensed under this chapter but who is not licensed or is otherwise not entitled to obtain or receive the benefit of the building permit;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(7): failing to obtain a building permit when required by law or rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(8): submitting a bid for any work for which a license is required under this chapter by a person not licensed or exempted from licensure as a contractor under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(9): willfully or deliberately misrepresenting or omitting a material fact in connection with an application to obtain or renew a license under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(10): allowing one's license to be used by another except as provided by statute or rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(11): doing business under a name other than the name appearing on the license, except as permitted by statute or rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(12): if licensed as a contractor in the electrical trade or plumbing trade, journeyman plumber, residential journeyman plumber, journeyman electrician, master electrician, or residential electrician, failing to directly supervise an apprentice under one's supervision or exceeding the number of apprentices one is allowed to have under the contractor's supervision;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(13): if licensed as a contractor or representing oneself to be a contractor, receiving any funds in payment for a specific project from an owner or any other person, which funds are to pay for work performed or materials and services furnished for that specific project, and after receiving the funds to exercise unauthorized control over the funds by failing to pay the full amounts due and payable to persons who performed work or furnished materials or services within a reasonable period of time;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(14): 58-1-307 employing an unlicensed alarm business or company or an unlicensed individual as an alarm company agent, except as permitted under the exemption from licensure provisions under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(15): if licensed as an alarm company or alarm company agent, filing with the division fingerprint cards for an applicant which are not those of the applicant, or are in any other way false or fraudulent and intended to mislead the division in its consideration of the applicant for licensure;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(16): if licensed under this chapter, willfully or deliberately disregarding or violating:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(16)(a): the building or construction laws of this state or any political subdivision;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(16)(b): the safety and labor laws applicable to a project;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(16)(c): any provision of the health laws applicable to a project;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(16)(d): the workers' compensation insurance laws of the state applicable to a project;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(16)(e): the laws governing withholdings for employee state and federal income taxes, unemployment taxes, Social Security payroll taxes, or other required withholdings; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(16)(f): reporting, notification, and filing laws of this state or the federal government;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(17): Title 38, Chapter 11, Residence Lien Restriction and Lien Recovery Fund Act engaging in the construction trade or as a contractor for the construction of residences of up to two units when not currently registered or exempt from registration as a qualified beneficiary under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(18): 38-11-102; 38-11-108 failing, as an original contractor, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(19): 38-1a-308 wrongfully filing a preconstruction or construction lien in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(20): 58-55-302.5 if licensed as a contractor, not completing the approved continuing education required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(21): 58-55-312; 58-55-312(3)(a)(ii) an alarm company allowing an employee with a temporary license under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(22): 58-55-312; 58-55-312(3)(a)(ii) an alarm company agent under a temporary license under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(23): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(23)(a): an unincorporated entity licensed under this chapter having an individual who owns an interest in the unincorporated entity engage in a construction trade in Utah while not lawfully present in the United States; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(23)(b): an unincorporated entity providing labor to an entity licensed under this chapter by providing an individual who owns an interest in the unincorporated entity to engage in a construction trade in Utah while not lawfully present in the United States;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(24): Title 34A, Chapter 2, Workers' Compensation Act; Title 34A, Chapter 3, Utah Occupational Disease Act; (24)(a)(i); Title 35A, Chapter 4, Employment Security Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act an unincorporated entity failing to provide the following for an individual who engages, or will engage, in a construction trade in Utah for the unincorporated entity, or for an individual who engages, or will engage, in a construction trade in Utah for a separate entity for which the unincorporated entity provides the individual as labor:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(24)(a): Title 34A, Chapter 2, Workers' Compensation Act; Title 34A, Chapter 3, Utah Occupational Disease Act; (24)(a)(i) workers' compensation coverage:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(24)(a)(i): Title 34A, Chapter 2, Workers' Compensation Act; Title 34A, Chapter 3, Utah Occupational Disease Act to the extent required by
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(24)(a)(ii): (24)(a)(i) that would be required under the chapters listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(24)(b): Title 35A, Chapter 4, Employment Security Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act unemployment compensation in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(25): the failure of a sign installation contractor or nonelectrical outdoor advertising sign contractor, as classified and defined in division rules, to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(25)(a): display the contractor's license number prominently on a vehicle that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(25)(a)(i): the contractor uses; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(25)(a)(ii): displays the contractor's business name; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(25)(b): carry a copy of the contractor's license in any other vehicle that the contractor uses at a job site, whether or not the vehicle is owned by the contractor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(26): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(26)(a): an unincorporated entity licensed under this chapter having an individual who owns an interest in the unincorporated entity engage in a construction trade in the state while the individual is using a Social Security number that does not belong to that individual; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(26)(b): an unincorporated entity providing labor to an entity licensed under this chapter by providing an individual, who owns an interest in the unincorporated entity, to engage in a construction trade in the state while the individual is using a Social Security number that does not belong to that individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(27): 58-55-310 a contractor failing to comply with a requirement imposed by a political subdivision, state agency, or board of education under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-501(28): 58-55-605 failing to timely comply with the requirements described in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502 Unprofessional conduct.
-------------------------------------------------------
Unprofessional conduct includes:Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(1): failing to establish, maintain, or demonstrate financial responsibility while licensed as a contractor under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(2): disregarding or violating through gross negligence or a pattern of negligence:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(2)(a): the building or construction laws of this state or any political subdivision;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(2)(b): the safety and labor laws applicable to a project;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(2)(c): any provision of the health laws applicable to a project;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(2)(d): the workers' compensation insurance laws of this state applicable to a project;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(2)(e): the laws governing withholdings for employee state and federal income taxes, unemployment taxes, Social Security payroll taxes, or other required withholdings; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(2)(f): any reporting, notification, and filing laws of this state or the federal government;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(3): any willful, fraudulent, or deceitful act by a licensee, caused by a licensee, or at a licensee's direction which causes material injury to another;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(4): 38-11-207; 38-11-108; 38-11-204 contract violations that pose a threat or potential threat to the public health, safety, and welfare including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(4)(a): willful, deliberate, or grossly negligent departure from or disregard for plans or specifications, or abandonment or failure to complete a project without the consent of the owner or the owner's duly authorized representative or the consent of any other person entitled to have the particular project completed in accordance with the plans, specifications, and contract terms;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(4)(b): failure to deposit funds to the benefit of an employee as required under any written contractual obligation the licensee has to the employee;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(4)(c): failure to maintain in full force and effect any health insurance benefit to an employee that was extended as a part of any written contractual obligation or representation by the licensee, unless the employee is given written notice of the licensee's intent to cancel or reduce the insurance benefit at least 45 days before the effective date of the cancellation or reduction;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(4)(d): 38-11-207 failure to reimburse the Residence Lien Recovery Fund as required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(4)(e): 38-11-108 failure to provide, when applicable, the information required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(4)(f): 38-11-204 willfully or deliberately misrepresenting or omitting a material fact in connection with an application to claim recovery from the Residence Lien Recovery Fund under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(5): 58-55-304 failing as an alarm company to notify the division of the cessation of performance of its qualifying agent, or failing to replace its qualifying agent as required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(6): 58-55-311 failing as an alarm company agent to carry or display a copy of the licensee's license as required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(7): 58-55-308 failing to comply with operating standards established by rule in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(8): an unincorporated entity licensed under this chapter having an individual who owns an interest in the unincorporated entity engage in a construction trade in Utah while not lawfully present in the United States;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(9): Title 34A, Chapter 2, Workers' Compensation Act; Title 34A, Chapter 3, Utah Occupational Disease Act; Title 35A, Chapter 4, Employment Security Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act an unincorporated entity failing to provide the following for an individual who engages, or will engage, in a construction trade in Utah for the unincorporated entity:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(9)(a): Title 34A, Chapter 2, Workers' Compensation Act; Title 34A, Chapter 3, Utah Occupational Disease Act workers' compensation coverage to the extent required by
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(9)(b): Title 35A, Chapter 4, Employment Security Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act unemployment compensation in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(10): the failure of an alarm company or alarm company agent to inform a potential customer, before the customer's purchase of an alarm system or alarm service from the alarm company, of the policy of the county, city, or town within which the customer resides relating to priority levels for responding to an alarm signal transmitted by the alarm system that the alarm company provides the customer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-502(11): 58-55-302(2) failing to continuously maintain insurance and registration as required under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(5)(a)(i): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act If upon inspection or investigation, the division concludes that a person has committed a qualifying violation or violated any rule or order issued with respect to a qualifying violation, and that disciplinary action is appropriate, the director or the director's designee from within the division shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(5)(a)(i)(A): promptly issue a citation to the person according to this chapter and any pertinent rules;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(5)(a)(i)(B): attempt to negotiate a stipulated settlement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(5)(a)(i)(C): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act notify the person to appear before an adjudicative proceeding conducted under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(5)(a)(ii): A person who committed a qualifying violation, as evidenced by an uncontested citation, a stipulated settlement, or by a finding of violation in an adjudicative proceeding, may be assessed a fine and may, in addition to or in lieu of, be ordered to cease and desist from engaging in the qualifying violation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(5)(a)(iii): 58-55-401 Except for a cease and desist order, the licensure sanctions cited in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(5)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act A citation shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(5)(b)(i): be in writing and describe with particularity the nature of the violation, including a reference to the provision of the chapter, rule, or order alleged to have been violated;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(5)(b)(ii): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act clearly state that the recipient must notify the division in writing within 20 calendar days after the day on which the citation is served if the recipient wishes to contest the citation at a hearing conducted under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(5)(b)(iii): clearly explain the consequences of failure to timely contest the citation or to make payment of any fines assessed by the citation within the time specified in the citation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(5)(c): A citation issued under this section, or a copy of a citation, may be served upon a person upon whom a summons may be served:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(5)(c)(i): in accordance with the Utah Rules of Civil Procedure;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(5)(c)(ii): personally or upon the person's agent by a division investigator or by a person specially designated by the director; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(5)(c)(iii): by mail.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(5)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(5)(d)(i): If within 20 calendar days after the day on which a citation is served, the person to whom the citation was issued fails to request a hearing to contest the citation, the citation becomes the final order of the division and is not subject to further agency review.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(5)(d)(ii): The period to contest a citation may be extended by the division for cause.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(5)(e): The division may refuse to issue or renew, suspend, revoke, or place on probation the license of a licensee who fails to comply with a citation after the citation becomes final.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(5)(f): The failure of an applicant for licensure to comply with a citation after the citation becomes final is a ground for denial of license.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(5)(g): A citation may not be issued under this section after the expiration of one year after the date on which the violation that is the subject of the citation is reported to the division.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(8)(a): (5); 13-1-2 A penalty imposed by the director under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(8)(b): A penalty that is not paid may be collected by the director by either referring the matter to a collection agency or bringing an action in the district court of the county in which the person against whom the penalty is imposed resides or in the county where the office of the director is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(8)(c): A county attorney or the attorney general of the state shall provide legal assistance and advice to the director in an action to collect a penalty.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-503(8)(d): In an action brought to collect a penalty, the court shall award reasonable attorney fees and costs to the prevailing party.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-504 Crane operators -- Required certification -- Penalty for violation.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-504(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-504(1)(a): "Commercial construction projects" means construction, alteration, repair, demolition, or excavation projects that do not involve:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-504(1)(a)(i): single family detached housing;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-504(1)(a)(ii): multifamily attached housing up to and including a fourplex; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-504(1)(a)(iii): commercial construction of not more than two stories above ground.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-504(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-504(1)(b)(i): "Crane operator" means an individual engaged in operating a crane, which for purposes of this section is a power-operated hoisting machine used in construction, demolition, or excavation work that has a power-operated winch, load-line, and boom moving laterally by the rotation of the machine on a carrier.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-504(1)(b)(ii): It does not include operating a fork lift, digger derrick truck, aircraft, bucket truck, knuckle boom, side boom, mechanic's truck, or a vehicle or machine not using a power-operated winch and load-line.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-504(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-504(2)(a): In order to operate a crane on commercial construction projects, an individual shall be certified as a crane operator by the National Commission for the Certification of Crane Operators or any other organization determined by the division to offer an equivalent testing and certification program that meets the requirements of the American Society of Mechanical Engineers ASME B 30.5 and the accreditation requirements of the National Commission for Certifying Agencies.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-504(2)(b): (2)(a) An individual who violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-504(3): (2)(a) An individual engaged in construction or operation incidental to petroleum refining or electrical utility construction or maintenance is exempt from the crane operator certification requirement of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-601 Payment -- Account designated.
--------------------------------------------------------------
When making any payment to a materialman, supplier, contractor, or subcontractor with whom he has a running account, or with whom he has more than one contract, or to whom he is otherwise indebted, the contractor shall designate the contract under which the payment is made or the items of account to which it is to be applied.  When a payment for materials or labor is made to a subcontractor or materialman, the subcontractor or materialman shall demand of the person making the payment a designation of the account and the items of account to which the payment is to apply.  In cases where a lien is claimed for materials furnished or labor performed by a subcontractor or materialman, it is a defense to the claim that a payment was made by the owner to the contractor for the materials and was so designated and paid over to the subcontractor or materialman, if when the payment was received by the subcontractor or materialman, he did not demand a designation of the account and of the items of account to which the payment was to be applied.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-602 Payment of construction funds -- Interest.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-602(1): 13-8-5 All unpaid construction funds are payable to the contractor as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-602(2): On projects involving multiple buildings, each building shall be considered individually in determining the amount to be paid the contractor.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-602(3): Partial occupancy of a building requires payment in direct proportion to the value of the part of the building occupied.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-602(4): 13-8-5 If any payment is retained or withheld, it shall be retained or withheld and released as provided in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-603 Payment to subcontractors and suppliers.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-603(1): When a contractor receives any construction funds from an owner or another contractor for work performed and billed, he shall pay each of his subcontractors and suppliers in proportion to the percentage of the work they performed under that billing, unless otherwise agreed by contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-603(2): If, under this section and without reasonable cause, or unless otherwise agreed by contract, the contractor fails to pay for work performed by his subcontractors or suppliers within 30 consecutive days after receiving construction funds from the owner or another contractor for work performed and billed, or after the last day payment is due under the terms of the billing, whichever is later, he shall pay to the subcontractor or supplier, in addition to the payment, interest in the amount of 1% per month of the amount due, beginning on the day after payment is due, and reasonable costs of any collection and attorney's fees.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-603(3): (1); (2) When a subcontractor receives any construction payment under this section, Subsections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-604 Proof of licensure to maintain or commence action.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A contractor or alarm business or company may not act as agent or commence or maintain any action in any court of the state for collection of compensation for performing any act for which a license is required by this chapter without alleging and proving that the licensed contractor or alarm business or company was appropriately licensed when the contract sued upon was entered into, and when the alleged cause of action arose.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-605 Pay statement required.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-605(1): On the day on which a person licensed under this chapter pays an individual for work that the individual performed, the person shall give the individual a written or electronic pay statement that states:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-605(1)(a): the individual's name;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-605(1)(b): the individual's base rate of pay;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-605(1)(c): the dates of the pay period for which the individual is being paid;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-605(1)(d): if paid hourly, the number of hours the individual worked during the pay period;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-605(1)(e): the amount of and reason for any money withheld in accordance with state or federal law, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-605(1)(e)(i): state and federal income tax;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-605(1)(e)(ii): Social Security tax;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-605(1)(e)(iii): Medicare tax; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-605(1)(e)(iv): court-ordered withholdings; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-605(1)(f): the total amount paid to the individual for that pay period.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-605(2): (1); (1) A person licensed under this chapter shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-605(2)(a): (1) comply with the requirements described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-605(2)(b): (1) retain a copy of each pay statement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-605(2)(c): upon request, make the pay statement records described in this section available to the division for inspection.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-701 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part, "licensed contractor" means a person licensed under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-702 Construction Business Registry.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-702(1): The division shall establish and maintain the Construction Business Registry as described in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-702(2): The Construction Business Registry shall consist of a database of contact information for licensed contractors.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-702(3): 58-55-301 Beginning January 1, 2023, the division shall ensure that the Construction Business Registry:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-702(3)(a): is accessible to the public through an Internet website; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-702(3)(b): 58-55-301 is indexed by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-702(3)(b)(i): the name of the licensed contractor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-702(3)(b)(ii): the name of the licensed contractor's licensed business;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-702(3)(b)(iii): 58-55-301 the classification of the licensed contractor, as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-702(3)(b)(iv): any other identifier that the division considers reasonably appropriate.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-702(4): Title 38, Chapter 1a, Part 2, State Construction Registry The division may link or otherwise associate the Construction Business Registry with the State Construction Registry under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-702(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-702(5)(a): The division shall establish a process for a licensed contractor to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-702(5)(a)(i): before entry into the Construction Business Registry, specify the licensed contractor's contact information that the licensed contractor wants included in the Construction Business Registry;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-702(5)(a)(ii): opt out of participation in the Construction Business Registry at any time; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-702(5)(a)(iii): amend the licensed contractor's contact information in the Construction Business Registry at any time.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-55-702(5)(b): If a licensed contractor does not specify the licensed contractor's contact information for the Construction Business Registry, the division shall include in the Construction Business Registry only public contact information for the licensed contractor.
