Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 56 - Building Inspector and Factory Built Housing Licensing Act
********************************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-1 Title.
------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Building Inspector and Factory Built Housing Licensing Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-2 Chapter administration.
-----------------------------------------------------
The provisions of this chapter shall be administered by the Division of Professional Licensing.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-3 Definitions.
------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-56-3(1): 15A-1-102 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-3(2): 15A-1-202 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-3(3): 15A-1-302 Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-3.5 Surcharge fee.
----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-3.5(1): 63J-1-504 In addition to any other fees authorized by this chapter or by the division in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-3.5(2): The surcharge fee shall be used by the division to provide each licensee under this chapter with access to an electronic reference library that provides web-based access to national, state, and local building codes and standards.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-8.5 Building Inspector Licensing Board.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-8.5(1): There is created a Building Inspector Licensing Board consisting of four building inspectors and one member of the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-8.5(2): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed and serve in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-8.5(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203 The duties and responsibilities of the board shall be in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-8.5(3)(a): assist the division in reviewing complaints concerning the unlawful or unprofessional conduct of a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-8.5(3)(b): advise the division in its investigation of these complaints.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-8.5(4): (3) A board member who has, under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9 Qualifications of inspectors -- Contract for inspection services.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9(1): An inspector employed by a local regulator, state regulator, or compliance agency to enforce the codes shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9(1)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9(1)(a)(i): meet minimum qualifications as established by the division in collaboration with the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9(1)(a)(ii): be certified by a nationally recognized organization which promulgates construction codes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9(1)(a)(iii): pass an examination developed by the division in collaboration with the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9(1)(b): be currently licensed by the division as meeting those minimum qualifications; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9(1)(c): be subject to revocation or suspension of the inspector's license or being placed on probation if found guilty of unlawful or unprofessional conduct.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9(2): A local regulator, state regulator, or compliance agency may contract for the services of a licensed inspector not regularly employed by the regulator or agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9(3): 58-1-401 In accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9(3)(a): refuse to issue a license to an applicant;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9(3)(b): refuse to renew the license of a licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9(3)(c): revoke, suspend, restrict, or place on probation the license of a licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9(3)(d): issue a public or private reprimand;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9(3)(e): issue a citation to a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9(3)(f): issue a cease and desist order.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.1 Unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------
Unlawful conduct is as defined in SubsectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.1(1): 58-56-16 engaging in the sale of factory built housing without being registered with the division as a dealer, unless the sale is exempt under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.1(2): 58-56-17 selling factory built housing within the state as a dealer without collecting and remitting to the division the fee required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.1(3): acting as a building inspector or representing oneself to be acting as a building inspector, unless licensed or exempted from licensure under this chapter or using the title building inspector or any other description, words, letters, or abbreviation indicating that the person is a building inspector if the person has not been licensed under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.1(4): acting as a building inspector beyond the scope of the license held under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.1(5): hiring or employing in any manner an unlicensed person as a building inspector, unless exempted from licensure under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.3 Unprofessional conduct.
-------------------------------------------------------
Unprofessional conduct is as defined in SubsectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.3(1): knowingly failing to inspect or issue correction notices for code violations which when left uncorrected would constitute a hazard to the public health and safety and knowingly failing to require that correction notices are complied with as a building inspector;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.3(2): the use of alcohol or the illegal use of drugs while performing duties as a building inspector or at any time to the extent that the inspector is physically or mentally impaired and unable to effectively perform the duties of an inspector;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.3(3): gross negligence in the performance of official duties as a building inspector;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.3(4): the personal use of information or knowingly revealing information to unauthorized persons when that information has been obtained by a building inspector as a result of the inspector's employment, work, or position as an inspector;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.3(5): unlawful acts or practices which are clearly unethical under generally recognized standards of conduct of a building inspector;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.3(6): engaging in fraud or knowingly misrepresenting a fact relating to the performance of duties and responsibilities as a building inspector;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.3(7): a building inspector knowingly failing to require that all plans, specifications, drawings, documents, and reports be stamped by architects, professional engineers, or both as established by law;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.3(8): Title 58, Chapter 55, Utah Construction Trades Licensing Act a building inspector knowingly failing to report to the division an act or omission of a licensee under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.3(9): Title 58, Chapter 55, Utah Construction Trades Licensing Act a building inspector knowingly failing to report to the division unlicensed practice persons who are required to be licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.3(10): a building inspector's approval of work which materially varies from approved documents that have been stamped by an architect, professional engineer, or both unless authorized by the licensed architect, professional engineer, or both;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.3(11): a building inspector failing to produce verification of current licensure and current certifications for the codes upon request of the division, a compliance agency, or a contractor or property owner whose work is being inspected;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.3(12): a building inspector requiring work that materially varies from the building codes adopted by the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.3(13): nondelivery of goods or services by a registered dealer which constitutes a breach of contract by the dealer;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.3(14): the failure of a registered dealer to pay a subcontractor or supplier any amounts to which that subcontractor or supplier is legally entitled; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.3(15): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act any other activity which is defined as unprofessional conduct by division rule in accordance with the provisions of


Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.4 Investigation of regulated activity.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.4(1): The division is responsible for the investigation of a person or an activity that violates the provisions of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.4(2): 15A-1-207 An investigation by the division may include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.4(2)(a): 15A-1-207 a requirement that potential administrative appeals described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.4(2)(b): an investigation of a person engaged in unlawful or unprofessional conduct; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.4(2)(c): a referral to the Uniform Building Code Commission to review a dispute involving an application or interpretation of a building code or construction law by a licensee.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.5(3)(a)(iii): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act notify the person to appear before an adjudicative proceeding conducted under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.5(3)(b): 58-56-9.1; 58-56-9.3; (3)(b); (2)(a); 58-56-9(1)(c)

Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.5(3)(c)(ii): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act The citation shall clearly state that the recipient must notify the division in writing within 20 calendar days of service of the citation if the recipient wishes to contest the citation at a hearing conducted under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.5(3)(c)(iii): The citation shall clearly explain the consequences of failure to timely contest the citation or to make payment of any fines assessed by the citation within the time specified in the citation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.5(3)(d): Each citation issued under this section, or a copy of each citation, may be served upon any person upon whom a summons may be served:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.5(3)(d)(i): in accordance with the Utah Rules of Civil Procedure;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.5(3)(d)(ii): personally or upon the person's agent by a division investigator or by any person specially designated by the director; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.5(3)(d)(iii): by mail.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.5(3)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.5(3)(e)(i): If within 20 calendar days from the service of a citation, the person to whom the citation was issued fails to request a hearing to contest the citation, the citation becomes the final order of the division and is not subject to further agency review.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.5(3)(e)(ii): The period to contest a citation may be extended by the division for cause.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.5(3)(f): The division may refuse to issue or renew, suspend, revoke, or place on probation the license of a licensee who fails to comply with a citation after it becomes final.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.5(3)(g): The failure of an applicant for licensure to comply with a citation after it becomes final is a ground for denial of a license.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.5(3)(h): No citation may be issued under this section after the expiration of one year following the date on which the violation that is the subject of the citation is reported to the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.5(3)(i): 58-56-9.1; 58-56-9.3; (3) The director or the director's designee may assess fines for violations of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.5(3)(i)(i): (3) for a first offense determined under this Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.5(3)(i)(iii): for any subsequent offense, a fine of up to $2,000 for each day of continued offense.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-9.5(3)(j): (3)(i); 58-56-9.1; (3)(j)(ii)(A); (3)(j)(ii)(A); 58-56-9.1; (3)(j)(ii)(C); (3)(j)(ii)(A) For the purposes of issuing a final order under this section and assessing a fine under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-15.1 Factory built housing set-up contractor license.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-15.1(1): The scope of the work included under a factory built housing set-up contractor license includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-15.1(1)(a): the placement or securing, or both placement and securing, of the factory built housing on a permanent or temporary foundation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-15.1(1)(b): securing units together, if required; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-15.1(1)(c): connection of the utilities to a factory built housing unit.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-15.1(2): The scope of work included under a factory built housing set-up contractor license does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-15.1(2)(a): site preparation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-15.1(2)(b): construction of a permanent foundation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-15.1(2)(c): construction of utility services to the near proximity of the factory built housing unit.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-56-15.1(3): Title 58, Chapter 55, Utah Construction Trades Licensing Act If a dealer is not licensed as a factory built housing set-up contractor, that individual must subcontract the connection services to an individual who is licensed by the division to perform those specific functions under

Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 57 - Respiratory Care Practices Act
****************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-1 Short title.
------------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Respiratory Care Practices Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2 Definitions.
------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(1): 58-57-3 "Board" means the Respiratory Care Licensing Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(2): "Health care facility" means any facility or institution in which health care services are performed or furnished and includes a hospital, clinic, or emergency care center.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(3): "Practice of respiratory care":
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(3)(a): means the treatment, operation of equipment, management, diagnostic testing, and care of any human disease, deficiency, pain, injury, or other physical condition associated with the cardiopulmonary system under the qualified medical direction or supervision of a practitioner who has training and knowledge in the diagnosis, treatment, and assessment of respiratory problems;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(3)(b): includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(3)(b)(i): accepting and carrying out a practitioner's written, verbal, or telephonic prescription or order specifically relating to respiratory care in a hospital or other health care setting and includes consultation with licensed nurses, as appropriate;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(3)(b)(ii): administering respiratory care during transportation of a patient and under other circumstances where an emergency requires immediate respiratory care;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(3)(b)(iii): serving as a resource to other health care professionals and hospital administrators in relation to the technical aspects of, and the safe and effective methods for, administering respiratory care;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(3)(b)(iv): functioning in situations of patient contact requiring individual judgment in administering respiratory care under the general supervision of a qualified practitioner; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(3)(b)(v): supervising, directing, or teaching personnel in the performance of respiratory care modalities as part of a respiratory care education program; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(3)(c): does not include a person who delivers, installs, or maintains respiratory related durable medical equipment and who gives instructions regarding the use of that equipment as long as that person does not perform clinical evaluation or treatment of the patient.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(4): "Practitioner" means an individual currently licensed, registered, or otherwise authorized by the appropriate jurisdiction to prescribe and administer drugs and order respiratory care in the course of professional practice.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(5): "Respiratory care practitioner" means any person licensed to practice respiratory care under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(6): "Respiratory related durable medical equipment" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(6)(a): medical grade oxygen;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(6)(b): equipment and supplies related to medical gases;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(6)(c): apnea monitors;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(6)(d): oximeters;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(6)(e): noninvasive positive pressure generators, except those with back-up respiratory rate or when used invasively;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(6)(f): bilirubin lights;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(6)(g): suctioning equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(6)(h): large volume nebulizers with compressors, except when used invasively in conjunction with an artificial airway;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(6)(i): medication nebulizers;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(6)(j): enteral nutrition equipment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(6)(k): other respiratory related equipment intended for use in the home as defined by the division by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(7): 58-1-501; 58-57-14 "Unlawful conduct" is defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(8): 58-1-501 "Unprofessional conduct" as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(8)(a): acting contrary to the instructions of the practitioner responsible for supervising the licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(8)(b): knowingly operating any respiratory care equipment that is unsafe or not in compliance with standards of condition or operation consistent with the patient's safety;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(8)(c): permitting any person to operate respiratory care equipment who is not competent or not allowed to operate the equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(8)(d): revealing to any unauthorized person confidential or privileged information about a patient;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(8)(e): using any controlled substance, unless the controlled substance is prescribed by a practitioner and used in accordance with the practitioner's instructions; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-2(8)(f): making any statement that is incorrect due to negligence, willfulness, or intent to provide false information or entry on any patient record or other record that is used for payment of respiratory care services.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-3 Board created -- Membership -- Duties.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-3(1): There is created a five-member Respiratory Care Licensing Board consisting of the following persons:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-3(1)(a): one physician who is a member of either the American Society of Anesthesiologists, the American College of Chest Physicians, the American Thoracic Society, or the American Academy of Pediatrics;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-3(1)(b): three licensed respiratory care practitioners who have practiced respiratory care for a period of not less than three years immediately preceding their appointment to the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-3(1)(c): one member from the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-3(2): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed and serve in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-3(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203 The duties and responsibilities of the board shall be in accordance with Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-4 Qualifications for a license.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-4(1): The division shall issue a respiratory care practitioner license to an applicant who meets the requirements specified in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-4(2): 63J-1-504 An applicant seeking licensure as a respiratory care practitioner shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-4(2)(a): submit an application on a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-4(2)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee as determined by the department pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-4(2)(c): possess a high school education or its equivalent, as determined by the division in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-4(2)(d): have completed a respiratory care practitioner educational program that is accredited by a nationally accredited organization acceptable to the division as defined by rule; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-4(2)(e): pass an examination approved by the division in collaboration with the board.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-5 Licensure by endorsement.
-------------------------------------------------------
If an applicant has completed a respiratory care practitioner education program that is approved by the board and accredited by a nationally accredited organization acceptable to the division, as defined by rule, the board may recommend that the division issue a license without examination to any applicant currently licensed by another state as a respiratory care practitioner or its equivalent, if the requirements for licensing in that state are at least as stringent as the requirements under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-6 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-6(1): Each license issued under this chapter shall be issued in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule. A renewal period may be extended or shortened by as much as one year to maintain established renewal cycles or to change an established renewal cycle.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-6(2): 58-1-308 Each license automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless renewed by the licensee in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-7 Exemptions from licensure.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-7(1): (2)(b); (2)(f); (g)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-7(1)(a): (2)(b) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-7(1)(b): (2)(f); (g) For purposes of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-7(1)(b)(i): a practitioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-7(1)(b)(ii): a respiratory therapist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-7(1)(b)(iii): a Diplomate of the American Board of Sleep Medicine; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-7(1)(b)(iv): a registered polysomnographic technologist.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-7(2): 58-1-307; Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 1, Utah Emergency Medical Services System; 58-57-2(3); (6) In addition to the exemptions from licensure in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-7(2)(a): any person who provides gratuitous care for a member of his immediate family without representing himself as a licensed respiratory care practitioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-7(2)(b): any person who is a licensed or qualified member of another health care profession, if this practice is consistent with the accepted standards of the profession and if the person does not represent himself as a respiratory care practitioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-7(2)(c): any person who serves in the Armed Forces of the United States or any other agency of the federal government and is engaged in the performance of his official duties;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-7(2)(d): Title 26B, Chapter 4, Part 1, Utah Emergency Medical Services System any person who acts under a certification issued pursuant to
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-7(2)(e): 58-57-2(3); (6) any person who delivers, installs, or maintains respiratory related durable medical equipment and who gives instructions regarding the use of that equipment in accordance with Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-7(2)(f): any person who is working in a practitioner's office, acting under supervision; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-7(2)(g): a polysomnographic technician or trainee, acting under supervision, as long as the technician or trainee administers the following only in a sleep lab, sleep center, or sleep facility:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-7(2)(g)(i): oxygen titration; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-7(2)(g)(ii): positive airway pressure that does not include mechanical ventilation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-7(3): Nothing in this chapter permits a respiratory care practitioner to engage in the unauthorized practice of other health disciplines.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-8 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for refusal to issue a license to an applicant, for refusal to renew the license of a licensee, to revoke, suspend, restrict, or place on probation the license of a licensee, to issue a public or private reprimand to a licensee, and to issue cease and desist orders shall be in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-10 Use of title or designation.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-10(1): Only a respiratory care practitioner may use the following titles or designations in this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-10(1)(a): respiratory care practitioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-10(1)(b): respiratory therapist; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-10(1)(c): respiratory technician.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-10(2): Any person who violates this section is guilty of a class A misdemeanor.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-11 Provision for current practitioners.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Any person who is engaged in the practice of respiratory care as defined in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-12 Independent practice prohibited.
---------------------------------------------------------------
A respiratory care practitioner may not:Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-12(1): practice independently of a practitioner or of a health care facility while under the supervision of a practitioner; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-12(2): charge a fee for his services independently of a practitioner or health care facility.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-14 Unlawful conduct -- Penalty.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-14(1): Beginning January 1, 2007, "unlawful conduct" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-14(1)(a): using the following titles, names, or initials, if the user is not properly licensed under this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-14(1)(a)(i): respiratory care practitioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-14(1)(a)(ii): respiratory therapist; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-14(1)(a)(iii): respiratory technician; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-14(1)(b): using any other name, title, or initials that would cause a reasonable person to believe the user is licensed under this chapter if the user is not properly licensed under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-14(2): 58-1-501(1)(a) Any person who violates the unlawful conduct provision specifically defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-14(3): 58-1-501(1)(b); (f); (1) Any person who violates any of the unlawful conduct provisions specifically defined in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-57-14(4): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; Title 58, Chapter 1, Division of Professional Licensing Act After a proceeding pursuant to


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 60 - Mental Health Professional Practice Act
*************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Mental Health Professional Practice Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(1): "Client" or "patient" means an individual who consults or is examined or interviewed by an individual licensed under this chapter who is acting in the individual's professional capacity.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(2): "Confidential communication" means information obtained by an individual licensed under this chapter, including information obtained by the individual's examination of the client or patient, which is:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(2)(a)(i): transmitted between the client or patient and an individual licensed under this chapter in the course of that relationship; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(2)(a)(ii): transmitted among the client or patient, an individual licensed under this chapter, and individuals who are participating in the diagnosis or treatment under the direction of an individual licensed under this chapter, including members of the client's or patient's family; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(2)(b): made in confidence, for the diagnosis or treatment of the client or patient by the individual licensed under this chapter, and by a means not intended to be disclosed to third persons other than those individuals:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(2)(b)(i): present to further the interest of the client or patient in the consultation, examination, or interview;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(2)(b)(ii): reasonably necessary for the transmission of the communications; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(2)(b)(iii): participating in the diagnosis and treatment of the client or patient under the direction of the mental health therapist.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(3): "Hypnosis" means, when referring to individuals exempted from licensure under this chapter, a process by which an individual induces or assists another individual into a hypnotic state without the use of drugs or other substances and for the purpose of increasing motivation or to assist the individual to alter lifestyles or habits.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(4): "Individual" means a natural person.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(5): 58-70a-501.1 "Mental health therapist" means an individual who is practicing within the scope of practice defined in the individual's respective licensing act and is licensed under this title as:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(5)(a): a physician and surgeon, or osteopathic physician engaged in the practice of mental health therapy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(5)(b): an advanced practice registered nurse, specializing in psychiatric mental health nursing;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(5)(c): an advanced practice registered nurse intern, specializing in psychiatric mental health nursing;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(5)(d): a psychologist qualified to engage in the practice of mental health therapy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(5)(e): a certified psychology resident qualifying to engage in the practice of mental health therapy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(5)(f): 58-70a-501.1 a physician assistant specializing in mental health care under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(5)(g): a clinical social worker;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(5)(h): a certified social worker;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(5)(i): a marriage and family therapist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(5)(j): an associate marriage and family therapist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(5)(k): a clinical mental health counselor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(5)(l): an associate clinical mental health counselor.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(6): (5) "Mental illness" means a mental or emotional condition defined in an approved diagnostic and statistical manual for mental disorders generally recognized in the professions of mental health therapy listed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(7): (5); (5); (5) "Practice of mental health therapy" means treatment or prevention of mental illness, whether in person or remotely, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(7)(a): (5) conducting a professional evaluation of an individual's condition of mental health, mental illness, or emotional disorder consistent with standards generally recognized in the professions of mental health therapy listed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(7)(b): (5) establishing a diagnosis in accordance with established written standards generally recognized in the professions of mental health therapy listed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(7)(c): prescribing a plan for the prevention or treatment of a condition of mental illness or emotional disorder; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(7)(d): (5) engaging in the conduct of professional intervention, including psychotherapy by the application of established methods and procedures generally recognized in the professions of mental health therapy listed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(8): "Remotely" means communicating via Internet, telephone, or other electronic means that facilitate real-time audio or visual interaction between individuals when they are not physically present in the same room at the same time.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(9): 58-1-501; 58-60-109 "Unlawful conduct" is as defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-102(10): 58-1-501; 58-60-110 "Unprofessional conduct" is as defined in Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103 Licensure required.
---------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103(1): Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act; Chapter 61, Psychologist Licensing Act; Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act; (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103(1)(a): Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act; Chapter 61, Psychologist Licensing Act; Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act An individual shall be licensed under:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103(1)(a)(i): this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103(1)(a)(ii): Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103(1)(a)(iii): Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103(1)(a)(iv): Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103(1)(a)(v): Chapter 61, Psychologist Licensing Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103(1)(a)(vi): Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103(1)(a)(vii): exempted from licensure under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103(1)(b): (1)(a) Only an individual described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103(1)(b)(i): engage in, or represent that the individual will engage in, the practice of mental health therapy, clinical social work, certified social work, marriage and family therapy, or clinical mental health counseling; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103(1)(b)(ii): practice as, or represent that the individual is, a mental health therapist, clinical social worker, certified social worker, marriage and family therapist, clinical mental health counselor, psychiatrist, psychologist, registered psychiatric mental health nurse specialist, certified psychology resident, associate marriage and family therapist, or associate clinical mental health counselor.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103(2): An individual shall be licensed under this chapter or exempted from licensure under this chapter in order to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103(2)(a): engage in, or represent that the individual is engaged in, practice as a social service worker; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103(2)(b): represent that the individual is, or use the title of, a social service worker.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103(3): An individual shall be licensed under this chapter or exempted from licensure under this chapter in order to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103(3)(a): engage in, or represent that the individual is engaged in, practice as a substance use disorder counselor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103(3)(b): represent that the individual is, or use the title of, a substance use disorder counselor.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103(4): 58-1-307(1)(c); Part 3, Marriage and Family Therapist Licensing Act; Part 4, Clinical Mental Health Counselor Licensing Act Notwithstanding the provisions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103(4)(a): Part 3, Marriage and Family Therapist Licensing Act a marriage and family therapist under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103(4)(b): Part 4, Clinical Mental Health Counselor Licensing Act a clinical mental health counselor under


Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103.1 Criminal background check.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103.1(1): An applicant for licensure under this chapter who requires a criminal background check shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103.1(1)(a): submit fingerprint cards in a form acceptable to the division at the time the license application is filed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103.1(1)(b): consent to a fingerprint background check conducted by the Bureau of Criminal Identification and the Federal Bureau of Investigation regarding the application.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103.1(2): 53-10-108; (2)(a); 53-10-108 The division shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103.1(2)(a): 53-10-108 in addition to other fees authorized by this chapter, collect from each applicant submitting fingerprints in accordance with this section the fee that the Bureau of Criminal Identification is authorized to collect for the services provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103.1(2)(b): (2)(a) submit from each applicant the fingerprint card and the fees described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103.1(2)(c): 53-10-108 obtain and retain in division records a signed waiver approved by the Bureau of Criminal Identification in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103.1(3): 53-10-108; (2)(b) The Bureau of Criminal Identification shall, in accordance with the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103.1(3)(a): (2)(b) check the fingerprints submitted under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103.1(3)(b): forward the fingerprints to the Federal Bureau of Investigation for a national criminal history background check; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103.1(3)(c): provide the results from the state, regional, and nationwide criminal history background checks to the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103.1(4): Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 2, Bureau of Criminal Identification For purposes of conducting a criminal background check required under this section, the division shall have direct access to criminal background information maintained under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103.1(5): Chapter 60a, Counseling Compact The division may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103.1(5)(a): disseminate outside of the division any criminal history record information that the division obtains from the Bureau of Criminal Identification or the Federal Bureau of Investigation under the criminal background check requirements of this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-103.1(5)(b): Chapter 60a, Counseling Compact issue a letter of qualification to participate in the Counseling Compact under


Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-104 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-104(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-104(1)(a): The division shall issue each license under this chapter in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by division rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-104(1)(b): The division may by rule extend or shorten a renewal cycle by as much as one year to stagger the renewal cycles it administers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-104(2): At the time of renewal the licensee shall show satisfactory evidence of renewal requirements as required under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-104(3): 58-1-308 Each license expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless renewed by the licensee in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-105 Continuing education.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-105(1): 58-1-203 By rule made under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-105(2): 58-60-104 If a renewal cycle is extended or shortened under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-105(3): (1) The division shall, in addition to a continuing education requirement the division establishes under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-106 Status of licenses held on the effective date of this chapter.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
An individual holding a valid Utah license as a clinical social worker, certified social worker, social service worker, or marriage and family therapist under any licensing or practice acts in this title in effect immediately prior to July 1, 1994, is on and after July 1, 1994, considered to hold a current license under this chapter in the comparable classification as a clinical social worker, certified social worker, social service worker, or marriage and family therapist.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107 Exemptions from licensure.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(1): 58-60-103; 58-1-307 Except as modified in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2): 58-1-307; Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act; Chapter 61, Psychologist Licensing Act; Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act; 58-70a-501.1; 58-60-102(5); 58-60-102(5); 58-1-307(1)(b) In addition to the exemptions from licensure in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(a): Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act; Chapter 61, Psychologist Licensing Act; Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act; 58-70a-501.1 the following when practicing within the scope of the license held:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(a)(i): Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act a physician and surgeon or osteopathic physician and surgeon licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(a)(ii): Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act an advanced practice registered nurse, specializing in psychiatric mental health nursing, licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(a)(iii): Chapter 61, Psychologist Licensing Act a psychologist licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(a)(iv): Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act; 58-70a-501.1 a physician assistant licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(b): 58-60-102(5) a recognized member of the clergy while functioning in a ministerial capacity as long as the member of the clergy does not represent that the member of the clergy is, or use the title of, a license classification in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(c): an individual who is offering expert testimony in a proceeding before a court, administrative hearing, deposition upon the order of a court or other body having power to order the deposition, or a proceeding before a master, referee, or alternative dispute resolution provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(d): 58-60-102(5) an individual engaged in performing hypnosis who is not licensed under this title in a profession which includes hypnosis in its scope of practice, and who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(d)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(d)(i)(A): induces a hypnotic state in a client for the purpose of increasing motivation or altering lifestyles or habits, such as eating or smoking, through hypnosis;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(d)(i)(B): consults with a client to determine current motivation and behavior patterns;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(d)(i)(C): prepares the client to enter hypnotic states by explaining how hypnosis works and what the client will experience;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(d)(i)(D): tests clients to determine degrees of suggestibility;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(d)(i)(E): applies hypnotic techniques based on interpretation of consultation results and analysis of client's motivation and behavior patterns; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(d)(i)(F): trains clients in self-hypnosis conditioning;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(d)(ii): 58-60-102(5) may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(d)(ii)(A): engage in the practice of mental health therapy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(d)(ii)(B): 58-60-102(5) use the title of a license classification in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(d)(ii)(C): use hypnosis with or treat a medical, psychological, or dental condition defined in generally recognized diagnostic and statistical manuals of medical, psychological, or dental disorders;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(e): 58-1-307(1)(b) an individual's exemption from licensure under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(f): an individual holding an earned doctoral degree or master's degree in social work, marriage and family therapy, or clinical mental health counseling, who is employed by an accredited institution of higher education and who conducts research and teaches in that individual's professional field, but only if the individual does not engage in providing or supervising professional services regulated under this chapter to individuals or groups regardless of whether there is compensation for the services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(g): an individual in an on-the-job training program approved by the division while under the supervision of qualified persons;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(h): an individual providing general education in the subjects of alcohol, drug use, or substance use disorders, including prevention;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(i): an individual providing advice or counsel to another individual in a setting of their association as friends or relatives and in a nonprofessional and noncommercial relationship, if there is no compensation paid for the advice or counsel; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(j): an individual who is licensed, in good standing, to practice mental health therapy or substance use disorder counseling in a state or territory of the United States outside of Utah may provide short term transitional mental health therapy remotely or short term transitional substance use disorder counseling remotely to a client in Utah if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(j)(i): the individual is present in the state or territory where the individual is licensed to practice mental health therapy or substance use disorder counseling;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(j)(ii): the client relocates to Utah;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(j)(iii): the client is a client of the individual immediately before the client relocates to Utah;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(j)(iv): the individual provides the short term transitional mental health therapy or short term transitional substance use disorder counseling remotely to the client only during the 90 day period beginning on the day on which the client relocates to Utah;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(j)(v): within one day after the day on which the individual first provides mental health therapy or substance use disorder counseling remotely to the client in Utah, the individual provides written notice to the division of the individual's intent to provide short term transitional mental health therapy or short term transitional substance use disorder counseling remotely to the client; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(2)(j)(vi): the individual does not engage in unlawful conduct or unprofessional conduct.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(3): (3); 58-17b-102; 58-17b-102; (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(3)(a): (3); 58-17b-102; 58-17b-102 As used in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(3)(a)(i): 58-17b-102 "Prescribe" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(3)(a)(ii): 58-17b-102 "Prescription drug" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(3)(b): (3) Except as otherwise provided in an interstate compact enacted under this title, an individual who is licensed, in good standing, to practice mental health therapy or substance use disorder counseling in a state or territory of the United States outside of Utah, and who provides mental health therapy remotely or substance use disorder counseling remotely to a client in Utah:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(3)(b)(i): may not prescribe a prescription drug for a client in Utah unless the individual is licensed in Utah to prescribe the prescription drug;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(3)(b)(ii): shall, before providing mental health therapy remotely or substance use disorder counseling remotely to a client in Utah, be aware of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(3)(b)(ii)(A): how to access emergency services and resources in Utah; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(3)(b)(ii)(B): all applicable laws and rules regarding the required or permitted reporting or disclosing of confidential client communications;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(3)(b)(iii): (3) shall, within one day after the day on which the individual first provides mental health therapy remotely or substance use disorder counseling remotely to a client in Utah, submit to the division a signed notice, in the form required by the division, notifying the division that the individual is providing therapy or counseling under the exemption in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(3)(b)(iv): shall obtain a Utah license:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(3)(b)(iv)(A): within nine months after the day on which the individual first provides mental health therapy remotely or substance use disorder counseling remotely to a client in Utah; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(3)(b)(iv)(B): if at any time the individual provides mental health therapy remotely or substance use disorder counseling remotely to more than one client in Utah.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-107(4): (3) The division shall report to the Health and Human Services Interim Committee at or before the committee's October 2026 meeting regarding the exemption described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-108 Grounds for action regarding license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-108(1): (2); 58-1-401 Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-108(2): The division may not refuse, revoke, suspend, or in any way restrict an applicant or licensee's license under this chapter solely because the applicant or licensee seeks or participates in mental health or substance abuse treatment.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109 Unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter, "unlawful conduct" includes:Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(1): practice of the following unless licensed in the appropriate classification or exempted from licensure under this title:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(1)(a): mental health therapy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(1)(b): clinical social work;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(1)(c): certified social work;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(1)(d): marriage and family therapy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(1)(e): clinical mental health counselor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(1)(f): practice as a social service worker; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(1)(g): substance use disorder counselor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(2): 58-61-304(1)(e) practice of mental health therapy by a licensed psychologist who has not acceptably documented to the division the licensed psychologist's completion of the supervised training in mental health therapy required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(3): (4) representing oneself as, or using the title of, the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(3)(a): unless currently licensed in a license classification under this title:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(3)(a)(i): psychiatrist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(3)(a)(ii): psychologist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(3)(a)(iii): registered psychiatric mental health nurse specialist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(3)(a)(iv): mental health therapist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(3)(a)(v): clinical social worker;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(3)(a)(vi): certified social worker;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(3)(a)(vii): marriage and family therapist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(3)(a)(viii): clinical mental health counselor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(3)(a)(ix): social service worker;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(3)(a)(x): substance use disorder counselor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(3)(a)(xi): associate clinical mental health counselor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(3)(a)(xii): associate marriage and family therapist; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(3)(b): (4) unless currently in possession of the credentials described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-109(4)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 58-1-203 a doctoral degree that contains a clinical social work concentration and practicum approved by the division, by rule, in accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-110 Unprofessional conduct.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-110(1): 58-60-114; 58-60-509 As used in this chapter, "unprofessional conduct" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-110(1)(a): using or employing the services of any individual to assist a licensee in any manner not in accordance with the generally recognized practices, standards, or ethics of the profession for which the individual is licensed, or the laws of the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-110(1)(b): failure to confine practice conduct to those acts or practices:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-110(1)(b)(i): in which the individual is competent by education, training, and experience within limits of education, training, and experience; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-110(1)(b)(ii): which are within applicable scope of practice laws of this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-110(1)(c): 58-60-114; 58-60-509 disclosing or refusing to disclose any confidential communication under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-110(1)(d): a pattern of failing to offer a patient the opportunity to waive the patient's privacy rights under the Standards for Privacy of Individually Identifiable Health Information, 45 C.F.R., Parts 160 and 164.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-110(2): "Unprofessional conduct" under this chapter may be further defined by division rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-110(3): 58-1-401; (1)(d) Notwithstanding Section

An individual who commits any act of unlawful conduct as defined in:Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-111(1): 58-60-109(1); (2) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-111(2): 58-60-109(3) Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-112 Reporting of unprofessional or unlawful conduct -- Immunity from liability -- Reporting conduct of court-appointed therapist.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-112(1): 58-60-102 Upon learning of an act of unlawful or unprofessional conduct as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-112(1)(a): a licensed health care facility or organization in which an individual licensed under this chapter engages in practice;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-112(1)(b): an individual licensed under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-112(1)(c): a professional society or organization whose membership is individuals licensed under this chapter and which has the authority to discipline or expel a member for acts of unprofessional or unlawful conduct.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-112(2): Any individual reporting acts of unprofessional or unlawful conduct by an individual licensed under this chapter is immune from liability arising out of the disclosure to the extent the individual furnishes the information in good faith and without malice.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-112(3): (3); Title 30, Chapter 3, Divorce; Title 30, Chapter 4, Separate Maintenance; Title 30, Chapter 5, Grandparents; Title 30, Chapter 5a, Custody and Visitation for Individuals Other than Parents Act; Title 78B, Chapter 7, Protective Orders and Stalking Injunctions; Title 78B, Chapter 13, Utah Uniform Child Custody Jurisdiction and Enforcement Act; Title 78B, Chapter 15, Utah Uniform Parentage Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-112(3)(a): (3); Title 30, Chapter 3, Divorce; Title 30, Chapter 4, Separate Maintenance; Title 30, Chapter 5, Grandparents; Title 30, Chapter 5a, Custody and Visitation for Individuals Other than Parents Act; Title 78B, Chapter 7, Protective Orders and Stalking Injunctions; Title 78B, Chapter 13, Utah Uniform Child Custody Jurisdiction and Enforcement Act; Title 78B, Chapter 15, Utah Uniform Parentage Act As used in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-112(3)(a)(i): "Court-appointed therapist" means a mental health therapist ordered by a court to provide psychotherapeutic treatment to an individual, a couple, or a family in a domestic case.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-112(3)(a)(ii): Title 30, Chapter 3, Divorce; Title 30, Chapter 4, Separate Maintenance; Title 30, Chapter 5, Grandparents; Title 30, Chapter 5a, Custody and Visitation for Individuals Other than Parents Act; Title 78B, Chapter 7, Protective Orders and Stalking Injunctions; Title 78B, Chapter 13, Utah Uniform Child Custody Jurisdiction and Enforcement Act; Title 78B, Chapter 15, Utah Uniform Parentage Act "Domestic case" means a proceeding under:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-112(3)(a)(ii)(A): Title 30, Chapter 3, Divorce
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-112(3)(a)(ii)(B): Title 30, Chapter 4, Separate Maintenance
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-112(3)(a)(ii)(C): Title 30, Chapter 5, Grandparents
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-112(3)(a)(ii)(D): Title 30, Chapter 5a, Custody and Visitation for Individuals Other than Parents Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-112(3)(a)(ii)(E): Title 78B, Chapter 7, Protective Orders and Stalking Injunctions
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-112(3)(a)(ii)(F): Title 78B, Chapter 13, Utah Uniform Child Custody Jurisdiction and Enforcement Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-112(3)(a)(ii)(G): Title 78B, Chapter 15, Utah Uniform Parentage Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-112(3)(b): If a court appoints a court-appointed therapist in a domestic case, a party to the domestic case may not file a report against the court-appointed therapist for unlawful or unprofessional conduct during the pendency of the domestic case, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-112(3)(b)(i): the party has requested that the court release the court-appointed therapist from the appointment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-112(3)(b)(ii): the court finds good cause to release the court-appointed therapist from the appointment.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-113 Evidentiary privilege.
------------------------------------------------------
Evidentiary privilege for mental health therapists regarding admissibility of any confidential communication in administrative, civil, or criminal proceedings is in accordance with Rule 506 of the Utah Rules of Evidence.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-114 Confidentiality -- Exemptions.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-114(1): Title 63G, Chapter 2, Government Records Access and Management Act Notwithstanding
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-114(1)(a): the client or patient;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-114(1)(b): the parent or legal guardian of a minor client or patient; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-114(1)(c): a person authorized to consent to the disclosure of the confidential communication by the client or patient in a written document:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-114(1)(c)(i): that is signed by the client or the patient; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-114(1)(c)(ii): in which the client's or the patient's signature is reasonably verifiable.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-114(2): (1); Title 26B, Chapter 6, Part 2, Abuse, Neglect, or Exploitation of a Vulnerable Adult; Title 80, Chapter 2, Part 6, Child Abuse and Neglect Reports; Title 78B, Chapter 3, Part 5, Limitation of Therapist's Duty to Warn; 26B-7-206 A mental health therapist under this chapter is not subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-114(2)(a): Title 26B, Chapter 6, Part 2, Abuse, Neglect, or Exploitation of a Vulnerable Adult; Title 80, Chapter 2, Part 6, Child Abuse and Neglect Reports; Title 78B, Chapter 3, Part 5, Limitation of Therapist's Duty to Warn; 26B-7-206 the mental health therapist is permitted or required by state or federal law, rule, regulation, or order to report or disclose any confidential communication, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-114(2)(a)(i): Title 26B, Chapter 6, Part 2, Abuse, Neglect, or Exploitation of a Vulnerable Adult reporting under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-114(2)(a)(ii): Title 80, Chapter 2, Part 6, Child Abuse and Neglect Reports reporting under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-114(2)(a)(iii): Title 78B, Chapter 3, Part 5, Limitation of Therapist's Duty to Warn reporting under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-114(2)(a)(iv): 26B-7-206 reporting of a communicable disease as required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-114(2)(b): the disclosure is part of an administrative, civil, or criminal proceeding and is made under an exemption from evidentiary privilege under Rule 506, Utah Rules of Evidence; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-114(2)(c): the disclosure is made under a generally recognized professional or ethical standard that authorizes or requires the disclosure.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-115 License by endorsement.
-------------------------------------------------------
The division shall issue a license by endorsement under this chapter to a person who:Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-115(1): submits an application on a form provided by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-115(2): 63J-1-504 pays a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-115(3): provides documentation of current licensure in good standing in a state, district, or territory of the United States to practice in the profession for which licensure is being sought;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-115(4): (5) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-115(5): if applying for a license to practice as a licensed substance use disorder counselor, provides documentation that the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-115(5)(a): has engaged in the lawful practice of the profession for at least 4,000 hours; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-115(5)(b): has passed an examination approved by the division, by rule, to establish proficiency in the profession;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-115(6): has passed the profession specific jurisprudence examination if required of a new applicant; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-115(7): is of good professional standing, and has no disciplinary action pending or in effect against the applicant's license in any jurisdiction.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-115.2 Pre-existing license by endorsement.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
A person who, on May 11, 2010, has a valid license by endorsement under SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-60-115.2(1): the lawful practice of the person's profession, including mental health therapy, for not less than 4,000 hours during the three years immediately preceding the date of application for licensure in Utah; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-115.2(2): the lawful practice of the profession for which licensure is sought for not less than 4,000 hours, of which 1,000 hours are in mental health therapy.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-117 Externship licenses.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-117(1): Part 2, Social Worker Licensing Act; Part 3, Marriage and Family Therapist Licensing Act; Part 4, Clinical Mental Health Counselor Licensing Act; Part 2, Social Worker Licensing Act; Part 3, Marriage and Family Therapist Licensing Act; Part 4, Clinical Mental Health Counselor Licensing Act; 63J-1-504 The division shall issue a temporary license under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-117(1)(a): Part 2, Social Worker Licensing Act; Part 3, Marriage and Family Therapist Licensing Act; Part 4, Clinical Mental Health Counselor Licensing Act submits an application for licensure under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-117(1)(b): 63J-1-504 pays a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-117(1)(c): holds an earned doctoral degree or master's degree in a discipline that is a prerequisite for practice as a mental health therapist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-117(1)(d): has a deficiency, as defined by division rule, in course work;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-117(1)(e): provides mental health therapy as an employee of a public or private organization, which provides mental health therapy, while under the supervision of a person licensed under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-117(1)(f): has no disciplinary action pending or in effect against the applicant in connection with the practice of mental health therapy, in any jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-117(2): A temporary license issued under this section shall expire upon the earlier of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-117(2)(a): issuance of the license applied for; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-117(2)(b): unless the deadline is extended for good cause as determined by the division, three years from the date the temporary license was issued.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-117(3): The temporary license issued under this section is an externship license.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-201 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Social Worker Licensing Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionsUtah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(1): 58-60-203 "Board" means the Social Worker Licensing Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(2)(a): "Practice as a social service worker" means performance of general entry level services under general supervision of a mental health therapist through the application of social work theory, methods, and ethics in order to enhance the social or psychosocial functioning of an individual, a couple, a family, a group, or a community, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(2)(a)(i): conducting:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(2)(a)(i)(A): a non-clinical psychosocial assessment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(2)(a)(i)(B): a home study;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(2)(a)(ii): collaborative planning and goal setting;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(2)(a)(iii): ongoing case management;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(2)(a)(iv): progress monitoring;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(2)(a)(v): supportive counseling;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(2)(a)(vi): information gathering;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(2)(a)(vii): making referrals; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(2)(a)(viii): engaging in advocacy.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(2)(b): "Practice as a social service worker" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(2)(b)(i): diagnosing or treating mental illness; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(2)(b)(ii): providing psychotherapeutic services to an individual, couple, family, group, or community.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(3): "Practice of clinical social work" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(3)(a): the practice of mental health therapy by observation, description, evaluation, interpretation, intervention, and treatment to effect modification of behavior by the application of generally recognized professional social work principles, methods, and procedures for the purpose of preventing, treating, or eliminating mental or emotional illness or dysfunction, the symptoms of any of these, or maladaptive behavior;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(3)(b): the application of generally recognized psychotherapeutic and social work principles and practices requiring the education, training, and clinical experience of a clinical social worker; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(3)(c): supervision of the practice of a certified social worker or social service worker as the supervision is required under this chapter and as further defined by division rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(4): "Practice of certified social work" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(4)(a): the supervised practice of mental health therapy by a clinical social worker by observation, description, evaluation, interpretation, intervention, and treatment to effect modification of behavior by the application of generally recognized professional social work principles, methods, and procedures for the purpose of preventing, treating, or eliminating mental or emotional illness or dysfunctions, the symptoms of any of these, or maladaptive behavior;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(4)(b): the supervised or independent and unsupervised application of generally recognized professional social work principles and practices requiring the education, training, and experience of a certified social worker; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(4)(c): supervision of the practice of a social service worker as the supervision is required under this chapter and as further defined by division rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(5): "Program accredited by the Council on Social Work Education" means a program that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(5)(a): was accredited by the Council on Social Work Education on the day on which the applicant for licensure satisfactorily completed the program; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(5)(b): was in candidacy for accreditation by the Council on Social Work Education on the day on which the applicant for licensure satisfactorily completed the program.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-202(6): "Supervision of a social service worker" means supervision conducted by an individual licensed as a mental health therapist under this title in accordance with division rules made in collaboration with the board.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-203 Board.
--------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-203(1): There is created the Social Worker Licensing Board consisting of one certified social worker, three clinical social workers, two social service workers, and one member from the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-203(2): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed, serve terms, and be compensated in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-203(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203 The duties and responsibilities of the board are under Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-203(3)(a): designate one of its members on a permanent or rotating basis to assist the division in review of complaints concerning unlawful or unprofessional practice by a licensee in any profession regulated by the board and to advise the division regarding the conduct of investigations of the complaints; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-203(3)(b): disqualify any member from acting as presiding officer in any administrative procedure in which that member has previously reviewed the complaint or advised the division.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-204 License classifications.
--------------------------------------------------------
The division shall issue licenses and certifications to individuals qualified under this part in the classifications:Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-204(1): clinical social worker;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-204(2): certified social worker; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-204(3): social service worker.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205 Qualifications for licensure or certification as a clinical social worker, certified social worker, and social service worker.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(1): 63J-1-504; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 58-1-203; 58-1-203; (1)(c); (1)(d); (1)(d)(i); 58-1-203; 58-1-203; Chapter 60a, Counseling Compact; 58-60-103.1; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act An applicant for licensure as a clinical social worker shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(1)(a): submit an application on a form provided by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(1)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(1)(c): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 58-1-203 produce certified transcripts from an accredited institution of higher education recognized by the division in collaboration with the board verifying satisfactory completion of an education and an earned degree as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(1)(c)(i): a master's degree in a social work program accredited by the Council on Social Work Education or by the Canadian Association of Schools of Social Work; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(1)(c)(ii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 58-1-203 a doctoral degree that contains a clinical social work concentration and practicum approved by the division, by rule, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(1)(d): 58-1-203 have completed a minimum of 3,000 hours of clinical social work training as defined by division rule under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(1)(d)(i): under the supervision of a supervisor approved by the division in collaboration with the board who is a:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(1)(d)(i)(A): clinical mental health counselor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(1)(d)(i)(B): psychiatrist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(1)(d)(i)(C): psychologist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(1)(d)(i)(D): registered psychiatric mental health nurse practitioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(1)(d)(i)(E): marriage and family therapist; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(1)(d)(i)(F): clinical social worker; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(1)(d)(ii): including a minimum of two hours of training in suicide prevention via a course that the division designates as approved;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(1)(e): (1)(c); (1)(d); (1)(d)(i) document successful completion of not less than 1,000 hours of supervised training in mental health therapy obtained after completion of the education requirement in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(1)(f): 58-1-203 have completed a case work, group work, or family treatment course sequence with a clinical practicum in content as defined by rule under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(1)(g): 58-1-203 pass the examination requirement established by rule under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(1)(h): Chapter 60a, Counseling Compact; 58-60-103.1; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act if the applicant is applying to participate in the Counseling Compact under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(2): 63J-1-504; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 58-1-203 An applicant for licensure as a certified social worker shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(2)(a): submit an application on a form provided by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(2)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(2)(c): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 58-1-203 produce certified transcripts from an accredited institution of higher education recognized by the division in collaboration with the board verifying satisfactory completion of an education and an earned degree as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-60-205(2)(c)(i): a master's degree in a social work program accredited by the Council on Social Work Education or by the Canadian Association of Schools of Social Work; or
