Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-302(4)(k): shall meet with the division and board if requested by the division or the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-302(5): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act In accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-302.1 Criminal background check.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-302.1(1): An applicant for licensure under this chapter who requires a criminal background check shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-302.1(1)(a): submit fingerprint cards in a form acceptable to the division at the time the license application is filed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-302.1(1)(b): consent to a fingerprint background check conducted by the Bureau of Criminal Identification and the Federal Bureau of Investigation regarding the application.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-302.1(2): 53-10-108; (2)(a); 53-10-108 The division shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-302.1(2)(a): 53-10-108 in addition to other fees authorized by this chapter, collect from each applicant submitting fingerprints in accordance with this section the fee that the Bureau of Criminal Identification is authorized to collect for the services provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-302.1(2)(b): (2)(a) submit from each applicant the fingerprint card and the fees described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-302.1(2)(c): 53-10-108 obtain and retain in division records a signed waiver approved by the Bureau of Criminal Identification in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-302.1(3): 53-10-108; (2)(b) The Bureau of Criminal Identification shall, in accordance with the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-302.1(3)(a): (2)(b) check the fingerprints submitted under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-302.1(3)(b): forward the fingerprints to the Federal Bureau of Investigation for a national criminal history background check; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-302.1(3)(c): provide the results from the state, regional, and nationwide criminal history background checks to the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-302.1(4): Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 2, Bureau of Criminal Identification For purposes of conducting a criminal background check required under this section, the division shall have direct access to criminal background information maintained under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-302.1(5): The division may not disseminate outside of the division any criminal history record information that the division obtains from the Bureau of Criminal Identification or the Federal Bureau of Investigation under the criminal background check requirements of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-302.1(6): 58-63-302; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; 58-63-302; (6)(b); Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-302.1(6)(a): 58-63-302 A new license issued under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-302.1(6)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; 58-63-302 Notwithstanding
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-302.1(6)(c): (6)(b) A person whose conditional license has been revoked under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-302.1(6)(d): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act The division shall conduct a postrevocation hearing in accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-303 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-303(1): The division shall issue each license under this chapter in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.  The division may by rule extend or shorten a renewal period by as much as one year to stagger the renewal cycles it administers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-303(2): 58-1-308 Each license automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless the licensee renews it in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-304 Exemptions from licensure.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-304(1): 58-1-307; (2) In addition to the exemptions from licensure in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-304(1)(a): (2) a peace officer employed by a contract security company as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-304(1)(b): employed by a contract security company for the sole purpose of operating or staffing security apparatus, including a magnetometer, magnetometer wand, x-ray viewing device, or other device approved by rule of the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-304(2): A peace officer may only engage in off-duty employment as a security officer if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-304(2)(a): the law enforcement agency employing the peace officer has a written policy regarding peace officer employees working while off duty as a security officer and the written policy addresses the issue of financial responsibility;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-304(2)(b): the agency's chief administrative officer, or that officer's designee, provides written authorization for an off-duty peace officer to work as a security officer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-304(2)(c): the business or entity employing the off-duty peace officer to work as a security officer complies with state and federal income reporting and withholding requirements regarding the off-duty officer's wages.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-304(3): 58-1-307 In addition to the exemptions from licensure in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-304(4): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(b) In accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-305 Status of licenses held on the effective date of this chapter.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
An individual holding a valid Utah license as a contract security company, armed private security officer, or unarmed private security officer underUtah Code Annotated § 58-63-305(1): on or after July 1, 1995, considered to hold a current license under this chapter in the comparable classification of contract security company, armed private security officer, or unarmed private security officer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-305(2): subject to this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-306 Replacement of qualifying agent.
----------------------------------------------------------------
If the qualifying agent of an armored car company or a contract security company ceases to perform the agent's duties on a regular basis, the licensee shall:Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-306(1): notify the division in writing within 15 days; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-306(2): replace the qualifying agent within 60 days after the time required for notification to the division.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-307 Use of firearms.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-307(1): An individual licensed as an armored car security officer or an armed private security officer may carry a firearm only while acting as an armored car security officer or an armed private security officer in accordance with this chapter and rules made under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-307(2): 76-10-505; Title 53, Chapter 5, Part 7, Concealed Firearm Act An individual licensed as an armored car security officer or an armed private security officer is exempt from the provisions of Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-308 Evidence of licensure.
------------------------------------------------------
An individual licensed as an armed private security officer, armored car security officer, or unarmed private security officer shall:Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-308(1): carry a copy of the individual's license on the individual's person at all times while acting as a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-308(2): display the license upon the request of a peace officer, a representative of the division, or a member of the public.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-309 Operating standards -- Rulemaking.
------------------------------------------------------------------
The division in collaboration with the board shall establish by rule operating standards that shall apply to the conduct of licensees under this chapter, including rules relating to use of uniforms, badges, insignia, designations, and representations used by or associated with a licensees practice under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-310 Interim permits.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-310(1): 58-63-302 The division may issue an interim permit to an applicant for licensure as an armed private security officer, armored car security officer, or unarmed private security officer upon receipt of a complete application for licensure in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-310(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-310(2)(a): Each interim permit expires 90 days after it is issued or on the date on which the applicant is issued a license, whichever is earlier.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-310(2)(b): The division may reissue an interim permit if the delay in approving a license is beyond the control or influence of the interim permit holder.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-310(3): An interim permit holder may engage in the scope of practice defined for the license classification that the interim permit holder is seeking.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-401 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for refusing to issue a license to an applicant, for refusing to renew the license of a licensee, for revoking, suspending, restricting, or placing on probation the license of a licensee, for issuing a public or private reprimand to a licensee, and for issuing a cease and desist order shall be in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-501 Unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------
"Unlawful conduct" includes:Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-501(1): 58-63-304; 58-63-310 a contract security company employing the services of an unlicensed armed private security officer or unarmed private security officer, except as provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-501(2): 58-63-304; 58-63-310 an armored car company employing the services of an unlicensed armored car security officer, except as provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-501(3): filing with the division fingerprint cards for an applicant that are not those of the applicant, or are in any other way false or fraudulent and intended to mislead the division in its consideration of the qualifications of the applicant for licensure;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-501(4): 58-63-304; 58-63-310 practicing or engaging in, or attempting to practice or engage in, activity for which a license is required under this chapter, unless the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-501(4)(a): holds the appropriate license under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-501(4)(b): 58-63-304; 58-63-310 is exempted from licensure as provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-501(5): knowingly employing another person to engage in or practice or attempt to engage in or practice an occupation or profession licensed under this chapter, if the employee:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-501(5)(a): is not licensed to do so under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-501(5)(b): is not exempt from licensure.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-502 Unprofessional conduct.
-------------------------------------------------------
"Unprofessional conduct" includes:Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-502(1): 58-63-306 failing as an armored car company or a contract security company to notify the division of the cessation of performance of its qualifying agent or failing to replace its qualifying agent, as required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-502(2): 58-63-308 failing as an armed private security officer, armored car security officer, or unarmed private security officer, to carry or display a copy of the licensee's license as required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-502(3): employment by an armored car company or a contract security company of a qualifying agent, armed private security officer, armored car security officer, or unarmed private security officer knowing that the individual has engaged in conduct that is inconsistent with the duties and responsibilities of a licensee under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-502(4): failing to comply with operating standards established by rule.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-503(4)(d): A court shall award reasonable attorney fees and costs to the prevailing party in an action brought by the division to collect a penalty.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-601 State preemption of local regulation.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-601(1): A political subdivision of this state may not enact any legislation, code, or ordinance, or make any rules relating to the licensing, training, or regulation of contract security companies or persons functioning as armed or unarmed private security officers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-63-601(2): Any legislation, code, ordinance, or rules made by any political subdivision of this state, relating to the licensing, training, or regulation of contract security companies or individuals functioning as an armed or unarmed private security officers are superseded by this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 64 - Deception Detection Examiners Licensing Act
*****************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Deception Detection Examiners Licensing Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-64-102(1): "Deception detection examination" means the use of an instrument, or software application designed for detecting deception, on an individual for the purpose of detecting whether that individual is engaged in deception.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-102(2): "Deception detection examination administrator" means an individual who engages in or represents that the individual is engaged in:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-102(2)(a): conducting or administering a deception detection examination using a software application designed for detecting deception without intervention from the examination administrator; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-102(2)(b): the interpretation of deception detection examination results derived from a software application designed for detecting deception.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-102(3): "Deception detection examiner" means an individual who engages in or represents that the individual is engaged in conducting or performing deception detection examinations or in the interpretation of deception detection examinations.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-102(4): "Deception detection intern" means an individual who engages in deception detection examinations under the supervision and control of a deception detection examiner for the purpose of training and qualification as a deception detection examiner.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-102(5): "Instrument" means a polygraph, voice stress analyzer, ocular-motor test, or any other device or software application that records the examinee's cardiovascular patterns, respiratory patterns, galvanic skin response, cognitive response, eye behavior, memory recall, or other physiologic characteristics of the examinee for the purpose of monitoring factors relating to whether the examinee is truthful or engaged in deception.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-102(6): 58-1-501; 58-64-501 "Unlawful conduct" means the same as that term is defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-102(7): 58-1-501; 58-64-502 "Unprofessional conduct" means the same as that term is defined in Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-301 Licensure required -- License classifications.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-301(1): 58-64-304; 58-1-307 A license is required to engage in the practice of deception detection, except as specifically provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-301(2): The division shall issue to an individual who qualifies under this chapter a license in the classifications of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-301(2)(a): deception detection examiner;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-301(2)(b): deception detection intern; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-301(2)(c): deception detection examination administrator.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302 Qualifications for licensure.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(1): 63J-1-504; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(f)(i); (1)(f)(ii); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 58-64-302.1; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act Each applicant for licensure as a deception detection examiner:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(1)(a): shall submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(1)(b): 63J-1-504 shall pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(1)(c): may not have been convicted of a felony or any other crime that when considered with the duties and responsibilities of a deception detection examiner is considered by the division to indicate that the best interests of the public will not be served by granting the applicant a license;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(1)(d): may not have been declared by any court of competent jurisdiction incompetent by reason of mental defect or disease and not been restored;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(1)(e): may not be currently suffering from habitual drunkenness or from drug addiction or dependence;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(1)(f): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(f)(i); (1)(f)(ii) shall have completed one of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(1)(f)(i): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act have earned a bachelor's degree from a four year university or college meeting standards established by the division by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(1)(f)(ii): have completed not less than 8,000 hours of investigation experience approved by the division; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(1)(f)(iii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(f)(i); (1)(f)(ii) have completed a combination of university or college education and investigation experience, as defined by rule made by the division in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(1)(g): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act shall have successfully completed a training program in detection deception meeting criteria established by rule made by the division in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(1)(h): 58-64-302.1; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act shall submit to and pass a background check in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(1)(i): shall have performed satisfactorily as a licensed deception detection intern for a period of not less than one year and shall have satisfactorily conducted not less than 100 deception detection examinations under the supervision of a licensed deception detection examiner.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(2): 63J-1-504; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (2)(f)(i); (2)(f)(ii); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 58-64-302.1; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act Each applicant for licensure as a deception detection intern:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(2)(a): shall submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(2)(b): 63J-1-504 shall pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(2)(c): may not have been convicted of a felony or any other crime that when considered with the duties and responsibilities of a deception detection intern is considered by the division to indicate that the best interests of the public will not be served by granting the applicant a license;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(2)(d): may not have been declared by any court of competent jurisdiction incompetent by reason of mental defect or disease and not been restored;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(2)(e): may not be currently suffering from habitual drunkenness or from drug addiction or dependence;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(2)(f): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (2)(f)(i); (2)(f)(ii) shall have completed one of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(2)(f)(i): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act have earned a bachelor's degree from a four year university or college meeting standards established by the division by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(2)(f)(ii): have completed not less than 8,000 hours of investigation experience approved by the division; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(2)(f)(iii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (2)(f)(i); (2)(f)(ii) have completed a combination of university or college education and investigation experience, as defined by rule made by the division in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(2)(g): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act shall have successfully completed a training program in detection deception meeting criteria established by rule made by the division in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(2)(h): 58-64-302.1; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act shall submit to and pass a background check in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(2)(i): shall provide the division with an intern supervision agreement in a form prescribed by the division under which:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(2)(i)(i): a licensed deception detection examiner agrees to supervise the intern; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(2)(i)(ii): the applicant agrees to be supervised by that licensed deception detection examiner.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(3): 63J-1-504; 58-64-302.1; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act Each applicant for licensure as a deception detection examination administrator:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(3)(a): shall submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(3)(b): 63J-1-504 shall pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(3)(c): may not have been convicted of a felony or any other crime that when considered with the duties and responsibilities of a deception detection examination administrator is considered by the division to indicate that the best interests of the public will not be served by granting the applicant a license;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(3)(d): may not have been declared by a court of competent jurisdiction incompetent by reason of mental defect or disease and not been restored;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(3)(e): may not be currently suffering from habitual drunkenness or from drug addiction or dependence;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(3)(f): shall have earned an associate degree from a state-accredited university or college or have an equivalent number of years' work experience;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(3)(g): 58-64-302.1; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act shall submit to and pass a background check in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302(3)(h): shall have successfully completed a training program and have obtained certification in deception detection examination administration provided by the manufacturer of a scientific or technology-based software application solution that is approved by the director.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302.1 Criminal background check.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302.1(1): An applicant for licensure under this chapter who requires a criminal background check shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302.1(1)(a): submit fingerprint cards in a form acceptable to the division at the time the license application is filed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302.1(1)(b): consent to a fingerprint background check conducted by the Bureau of Criminal Identification and the Federal Bureau of Investigation regarding the application.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302.1(2): 53-10-108; (2)(a); 53-10-108 The division shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302.1(2)(a): 53-10-108 in addition to other fees authorized by this chapter, collect from each applicant submitting fingerprints in accordance with this section the fee that the Bureau of Criminal Identification is authorized to collect for the services provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302.1(2)(b): (2)(a) submit from each applicant the fingerprint card and the fees described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302.1(2)(c): 53-10-108 obtain and retain in division records a signed waiver approved by the Bureau of Criminal Identification in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302.1(3): 53-10-108; (2)(b) The Bureau of Criminal Identification shall, in accordance with the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302.1(3)(a): (2)(b) check the fingerprints submitted under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302.1(3)(b): forward the fingerprints to the Federal Bureau of Investigation for a national criminal history background check; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302.1(3)(c): provide the results from the state, regional, and nationwide criminal history background checks to the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302.1(4): Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 2, Bureau of Criminal Identification For purposes of conducting a criminal background check required under this section, the division shall have direct access to criminal background information maintained under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302.1(5): The division may not disseminate outside of the division any criminal history record information that the division obtains from the Bureau of Criminal Identification or the Federal Bureau of Investigation under the criminal background check requirements of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302.1(6): 58-64-302; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; 58-64-302; (6)(b); Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302.1(6)(a): 58-64-302 A new license issued under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302.1(6)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; 58-64-302 Notwithstanding
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-302.1(6)(c): (6)(b) A person whose conditional license has been revoked under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-303 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-303(1): The division shall issue each license under this chapter in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule. The division may by rule extend or shorten a renewal period by as much as one year to stagger the renewal cycles it administers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-303(2): At the time of renewal, the licensee shall show satisfactory evidence of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-303(2)(a): having performed not less than 25 deception detection examinations during the two years immediately preceding the date of the renewal notice; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-303(2)(b): obtaining recertification within the past two years from the manufacturer of a scientific or technology-based software solution, if the licensee is renewing a deception detection examination administrator license.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-303(3): 58-1-308 Each license automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless the licensee renews it in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-304 Exemptions from licensure.
----------------------------------------------------------
In addition to the exemptions from licensure described in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-64-304(1): has completed the manufacturer's training course and is certified by the manufacturer to operate the voice stress analyzer or software application designed for detecting deception; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-304(2): 58-64-601 is operating the voice stress analyzer or software application designed for detecting deception in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-305 Status of licenses held on the effective date of this chapter.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
An individual holding a valid Utah license as a deception detection examiner or detection examiner intern underUtah Code Annotated § 58-64-305(1): on or after July 1, 1995, considered to hold a current license under this chapter in the comparable classification of deception detection examiner or deception detection intern; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-305(2): subject to this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-401 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for refusing to issue a license to an applicant, for refusing to renew the license of a licensee, for revoking, suspending, restricting, or placing on probation the license of a licensee, for issuing a public or private reprimand to a licensee, and for issuing a cease and desist order shall be in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-501 Unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------
"Unlawful conduct" includes:Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-501(1): a licensee conducting a deception detection examination:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-501(1)(a): outside of the physical presence of the subject of the examination;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-501(1)(b): on the subject of the examination by use of any electronic means, including the telephone; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-501(1)(c): through any surreptitious means when the subject of the examination is not aware of the examination; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-501(2): conducting a deception detection examination if the individual performing the deception detection examinations is located outside of the state and performs a deception detection examination by any electronic means upon a person located within the state.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-502 Unprofessional conduct.
-------------------------------------------------------
"Unprofessional conduct" includes:Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-502(1): using any deception detection instrument that does not meet criteria and standards established by rule by the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-502(2): 58-64-601 using any deception detection instrument that does not make a permanent recording as required under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-601 Deception detection instruments.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-601(1): Instruments or software applications used in performing deception detection examinations shall be those that are generally recognized in the profession or, if approved by the director, those with results published in peer-reviewed, scientific journals generally recognized by the scientific community.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-601(2): An instrument or software application used for deception detection shall have a permanent recording or written report produced by the instrument or software application for objective analysis by the examiner or the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-601(3): A written interpretation by an examiner while conducting a deception detection examination does not satisfy the requirements of a permanent recording.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-701 State preemption of local regulation.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-701(1): A political subdivision of the state may not enact legislation, ordinances, or rules relating to the licensing, training, or regulation of deception detection examiners, deception detection interns, or deception detection examination administrators.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-64-701(2): Any legislation, ordinances, or rules made by a political subdivision of the state relating to the licensing, training, or regulation of deception detection examiners, deception detection interns, or deception detection examination administrators is superseded by this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 67 - Utah Medical Practice Act
***********************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Utah Medical Practice Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(1)(a): "Ablative procedure" means a procedure that is expected to excise, vaporize, disintegrate, or remove living tissue, including the use of carbon dioxide lasers and erbium: YAG lasers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(1)(b): "Ablative procedure" does not include hair removal.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(2): "ACGME" means the Accreditation Council for Graduate Medical Education of the American Medical Association.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(3): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act "Administrative penalty" means a monetary fine or citation imposed by the division for acts or omissions determined to constitute unprofessional or unlawful conduct, in accordance with a fine schedule established by the division in collaboration with the board, as a result of an adjudicative proceeding conducted in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(4): 58-67-302.8 "Associate physician" means an individual licensed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(5): "Attempted sex change" means an attempt or effort to change an individual's body to present that individual as being of a sex or gender that is different from the individual's biological sex at birth.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(6): "Biological sex at birth" means an individual's sex, as being male or female, according to distinct reproductive roles as manifested by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(6)(a): sex and reproductive organ anatomy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(6)(b): chromosomal makeup; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(6)(c): endogenous hormone profiles.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(7): 58-67-201 "Board" means the Physicians Licensing Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(8): 58-67-302 "Collaborating physician" means an individual licensed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(9): 58-67-807 "Collaborative practice arrangement" means the arrangement described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(10): (10)(a); (10)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(10)(a): "Cosmetic medical device" means tissue altering energy based devices that have the potential for altering living tissue and that are used to perform ablative or nonablative procedures, such as American National Standards Institute (ANSI) designated Class IIIb and Class IV lasers, intense pulsed light, radio frequency devices, and lipolytic devices, and excludes ANSI designated Class IIIa and lower powered devices.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(10)(b): (10)(a); (10)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(11): "Cosmetic medical procedure":
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(11)(a): includes the use of cosmetic medical devices to perform ablative or nonablative procedures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(11)(b): does not include a treatment of the ocular globe such as refractive surgery.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(12): (12)(a); (12)(a); (12)(a) "Diagnose" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(12)(a): to examine in any manner another person, parts of a person's body, substances, fluids, or materials excreted, taken, or removed from a person's body, or produced by a person's body, to determine the source, nature, kind, or extent of a disease or other physical or mental condition;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(12)(b): (12)(a) to attempt to conduct an examination or determination described under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(12)(c): (12)(a) to hold oneself out as making or to represent that one is making an examination or determination as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(12)(d): (12)(a) to make an examination or determination as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(13): "LCME" means the Liaison Committee on Medical Education of the American Medical Association.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(14): 58-67-305(6) "Medical assistant" means an unlicensed individual who may perform tasks as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(15): "Medically underserved area" means a geographic area in which there is a shortage of primary care health services for residents, as determined by the Department of Health and Human Services.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(16): "Medically underserved population" means a specified group of people living in a defined geographic area with a shortage of primary care health services, as determined by the Department of Health and Human Services.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(17): (17)(a)(i); 58-1-102
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(17)(a): (17)(a)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(17)(a)(i): "Nonablative procedure" means a procedure that is expected or intended to alter living tissue, but is not intended or expected to excise, vaporize, disintegrate, or remove living tissue.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(17)(a)(ii): (17)(a)(i) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(17)(b): 58-1-102 "Nonablative procedure" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(17)(b)(i): 58-1-102 a superficial procedure as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(17)(b)(ii): the application of permanent make-up; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(17)(b)(iii): the use of photo therapy and lasers for neuromusculoskeletal treatments that are performed by an individual licensed under this title who is acting within the individual's scope of practice.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(18): 58-67-301; 58-68-301 "Physician" means both physicians and surgeons licensed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(19): (19)(a)(i); (ii); (19)(b)(ii); (19)(a)(i); 58-67-501(2)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(19)(a): (19)(a)(i); (ii) "Practice of medicine" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(19)(a)(i): to diagnose, treat, correct, administer anesthesia, or prescribe for any human disease, ailment, injury, infirmity, deformity, pain or other condition, physical or mental, real or imaginary, including to perform cosmetic medical procedures, or to attempt to do so, by any means or instrumentality, and by an individual in Utah or outside the state upon or for any human within the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(19)(a)(ii): when a person not licensed as a physician directs a licensee under this chapter to withhold or alter the health care services that the licensee has ordered;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(19)(a)(iii): (19)(a)(i); (ii) to maintain an office or place of business for the purpose of doing any of the acts described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(19)(a)(iv): to use, in the conduct of any occupation or profession pertaining to the diagnosis or treatment of human diseases or conditions in any printed material, stationery, letterhead, envelopes, signs, or advertisements, the designation "doctor," "doctor of medicine," "physician," "surgeon," "physician and surgeon," "Dr.," "M.D.," or any combination of these designations in any manner which might cause a reasonable person to believe the individual using the designation is a licensed physician and surgeon, and if the party using the designation is not a licensed physician and surgeon, the designation must additionally contain the description of the branch of the healing arts for which the person has a license, provided that an individual who has received an earned degree of doctor of medicine degree but is not a licensed physician and surgeon in Utah may use the designation "M.D." if it is followed by "Not Licensed" or "Not Licensed in Utah" in the same size and style of lettering.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(19)(b): (19)(b)(ii); (19)(a)(i); 58-67-501(2) The practice of medicine does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(19)(b)(i): (19)(b)(ii); (19)(a)(i) except for an ablative medical procedure as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(19)(b)(ii): an ablative cosmetic medical procedure if the scope of practice for the person performing the ablative cosmetic medical procedure includes the authority to operate or perform a surgical procedure; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(19)(b)(iii): 58-67-501(2) conduct under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(20): "Prescription device" means an instrument, apparatus, implement, machine, contrivance, implant, in vitro reagent, or other similar or related article, and any component part or accessory, which is required under federal or state law to be prescribed by a practitioner and dispensed by or through a person or entity licensed under this chapter or exempt from licensure under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(21): "Prescription drug" means a drug that is required by federal or state law or rule to be dispensed only by prescription or is restricted to administration only by practitioners.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(22): (22)(a)(i); (ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(22)(a): (22)(a)(i); (ii) "Primary sex characteristic surgical procedure" means any of the following if done for the purpose of effectuating or facilitating an individual's attempted sex change:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(22)(a)(i): for an individual whose biological sex at birth is male, castration, orchiectomy, penectomy, vaginoplasty, or vulvoplasty;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(22)(a)(ii): for an individual whose biological sex at birth is female, hysterectomy, oophorectomy, metoidioplasty, or phalloplasty; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(22)(a)(iii): (22)(a)(i); (ii) any surgical procedure that is related to or necessary for a procedure described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(22)(b): "Primary sex characteristic surgical procedure" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(22)(b)(i): surgery or other procedures or treatments performed on an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(22)(b)(i)(A): is born with external biological sex characteristics that are irresolvably ambiguous;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(22)(b)(i)(B): is born with 46, XX chromosomes with virilization;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(22)(b)(i)(C): is born with 46, XY chromosomes with undervirilization;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(22)(b)(i)(D): has both ovarian and testicular tissue; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(22)(b)(i)(E): has been diagnosed by a physician, based on genetic or biochemical testing, with a sex development disorder characterized by abnormal sex chromosome structure, sex steroid hormone production, or sex steroid hormone action for a male or female; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(22)(b)(ii): removing a body part:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(22)(b)(ii)(A): because the body part is cancerous or diseased; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(22)(b)(ii)(B): for a reason that is medically necessary, other than to effectuate or facilitate an individual's attempted sex change.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(23): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(23)(a): "Secondary sex characteristic surgical procedure" means any of the following if done for the purpose of effectuating or facilitating an individual's attempted sex change:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(23)(a)(i): for an individual whose biological sex at birth is male, breast augmentation surgery, chest feminization surgery, or facial feminization surgery; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(23)(a)(ii): for an individual whose biological sex at birth is female, mastectomy, breast reduction surgery, chest masculinization surgery, or facial masculinization surgery.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(23)(b): "Secondary sex characteristic surgical procedure" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(23)(b)(i): surgery or other procedures or treatments performed on an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(23)(b)(i)(A): is born with external biological sex characteristics that are irresolvably ambiguous;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(23)(b)(i)(B): is born with 46, XX chromosomes with virilization;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(23)(b)(i)(C): is born with 46, XY chromosomes with undervirilization;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(23)(b)(i)(D): has both ovarian and testicular tissue; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(23)(b)(i)(E): has been diagnosed by a physician, based on genetic or biochemical testing, with a sex development disorder characterized by abnormal sex chromosome structure, sex steroid hormone production, or sex steroid hormone action for a male or female; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(23)(b)(ii): removing a body part:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(23)(b)(ii)(A): because the body part is cancerous or diseased; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(23)(b)(ii)(B): for a reason that is medically necessary, other than to effectuate or facilitate an individual's attempted sex change.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-102(24): "SPEX" means the Special Purpose Examination of the Federation of State Medical Boards.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-201 Board.
--------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-201(1): There is created the Physicians Licensing Board consisting of nine physicians and surgeons and two members of the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-201(2): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed and serve in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-201(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203; Chapter 70b, Anesthesiologist Assistant Licensing Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-201(3)(a): 58-1-202; 58-1-203; Chapter 70b, Anesthesiologist Assistant Licensing Act In addition to any duty or responsibility described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-201(3)(b): The board may also designate one of the board's members on a permanent or rotating basis to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-201(3)(b)(i): assist the division in reviewing complaints concerning the unlawful or unprofessional conduct of a licensee the board regulates; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-201(3)(b)(ii): advise the division in the division's investigation of these complaints.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-201(4): (3) A board member who has, under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-301 Licensure required -- License classifications.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-301(1): 58-1-307; 58-67-305 A license is required to engage in the practice of medicine, on or for any person in Utah, as a physician and surgeon, except as specifically provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-301(2): The division shall issue to a person who qualifies under this chapter a license in the classification of physician and surgeon.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302 Qualifications for licensure.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1): (2); 63J-1-504; Chapter 67b, Interstate Medical Licensure Compact; 58-67-302.1; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(d); Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act An applicant for licensure as a physician and surgeon, except as set forth in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division, which may include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(a)(i): submissions by the applicant of information maintained by practitioner data banks, as designated by division rule, with respect to the applicant;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(a)(ii): a record of professional liability claims made against the applicant and settlements paid by or on behalf of the applicant; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(a)(iii): authorization to use a record coordination and verification service approved by the division in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(c): Chapter 67b, Interstate Medical Licensure Compact; 58-67-302.1; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act if the applicant is applying to participate in the Interstate Medical Licensure Compact under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(d): provide satisfactory documentation of having successfully completed a program of professional education preparing an individual as a physician and surgeon, as evidenced by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(d)(i): having received an earned degree of doctor of medicine from an LCME accredited medical school or college; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(d)(ii): if the applicant graduated from a medical school or college located outside the United States or its territories, submitting a current certification by the Educational Commission for Foreign Medical Graduates or any successor organization approved by the division in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(e): (1)(d); Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act satisfy the division and board that the applicant:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(e)(i): has successfully completed 24 months of progressive resident training in a program approved by the ACGME, the Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons, the College of Family Physicians of Canada, or any similar body in the United States or Canada approved by the division in collaboration with the board; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(e)(ii): (1)(d); Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(e)(ii)(A): (1)(d) has successfully completed 12 months of resident training in an ACGME approved program after receiving a degree of doctor of medicine as required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(e)(ii)(B): has been accepted in and is successfully participating in progressive resident training in an ACGME approved program within Utah, in the applicant's second or third year of postgraduate training; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(e)(ii)(C): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act has agreed to surrender to the division the applicant's license as a physician and surgeon without any proceedings under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(f): pass the licensing examination sequence required by division rule made in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(g): be able to read, write, speak, understand, and be understood in the English language and demonstrate proficiency to the satisfaction of the board if requested by the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(h): meet with the board and representatives of the division, if requested, for the purpose of evaluating the applicant's qualifications for licensure;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(i): designate:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(i)(i): a contact person for access to medical records in accordance with the federal Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(i)(ii): an alternate contact person for access to medical records, in the event the original contact person is unable or unwilling to serve as the contact person for access to medical records; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(1)(j): establish a method for notifying patients of the identity and location of the contact person and alternate contact person, if the applicant will practice in a location with no other persons licensed under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(2): (1)(a); (d); (1)(e)(i); (1)(g); (j); (1)(f); (2) An applicant for licensure as a physician and surgeon by endorsement who is currently licensed to practice medicine in any state other than Utah, a district or territory of the United States, or Canada shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(2)(a): be currently licensed with a full unrestricted license in good standing in any state, district, or territory of the United States, or Canada;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(2)(b): have been actively engaged in the legal practice of medicine in any state, district, or territory of the United States, or Canada for not less than 6,000 hours during the five years immediately preceding the date of application for licensure in Utah;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(2)(c): (1)(a); (d); (1)(e)(i); (1)(g); (j) comply with the requirements for licensure under Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(2)(d): (1)(f) have passed the licensing examination sequence required in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(2)(e): not have any investigation or action pending against any health care license of the applicant, not have a health care license that was suspended or revoked in any state, district or territory of the United States, or Canada, and not have surrendered a health care license in lieu of a disciplinary action, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(2)(e)(i): the license was subsequently reinstated as a full unrestricted license in good standing; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(2)(e)(ii): the division in collaboration with the board determines to its satisfaction, after full disclosure by the applicant, that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(2)(e)(ii)(A): the conduct has been corrected, monitored, and resolved; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(2)(e)(ii)(B): a mitigating circumstance exists that prevents its resolution, and the division in collaboration with the board is satisfied that, but for the mitigating circumstance, the license would be reinstated;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(2)(f): submit to a records review, a practice history review, and comprehensive assessments, if requested by the division in collaboration with the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(2)(g): (2) produce satisfactory evidence that the applicant meets the requirements of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(3): Title 26B, Chapter 2, Part 2, Health Care Facility Licensing and Inspection; (2) An applicant for licensure by endorsement may engage in the practice of medicine under a temporary license while the applicant's application for licensure is being processed by the division, provided:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(3)(a): the applicant submits a complete application required for temporary licensure to the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(3)(b): Title 26B, Chapter 2, Part 2, Health Care Facility Licensing and Inspection the applicant submits a written document to the division from:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(3)(b)(i): Title 26B, Chapter 2, Part 2, Health Care Facility Licensing and Inspection a health care facility licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(3)(b)(i)(A): invitation of the health care facility; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(3)(b)(i)(B): the general supervision of a physician practicing at the facility; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(3)(b)(ii): two individuals licensed under this chapter, whose license is in good standing and who practice in the same clinical location, both stating that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(3)(b)(ii)(A): the applicant is practicing under the invitation and general supervision of the individual; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(3)(b)(ii)(B): the applicant will practice at the same clinical location as the individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(3)(c): (2) the applicant submits a signed certification to the division that the applicant meets the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(3)(d): the applicant does not engage in the practice of medicine until the division has issued a temporary license;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(3)(e): the temporary license is only issued for and may not be extended or renewed beyond the duration of one year from issuance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(3)(f): the temporary license expires immediately and prior to the expiration of one year from issuance, upon notification from the division that the applicant's application for licensure by endorsement is denied.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(4): (3); (3) The division shall issue a temporary license under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(5): The division may not require  the following requirements for licensure:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(5)(a): a post-residency board certification; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(5)(b): a cognitive test when the physician reaches a specified age, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(5)(b)(i): the screening is based on evidence of cognitive changes associated with aging that are relevant to physician performance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(5)(b)(ii): the screening is based on principles of medical ethics;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(5)(b)(iii): physicians are involved in the development of standards for assessing competency;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(5)(b)(iv): guidelines, procedures, and methods of assessment, which may include cognitive screening, are relevant to physician practice and to the physician's ability to perform the tasks specifically required in the physician's practice environment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(5)(b)(v): the primary driver for establishing assessment results is the ethical obligation of the profession to the health of the public and patient safety;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(5)(b)(vi): the goal of the assessment is to optimize physician competency and performance through education, remediation, and modifications to a physician's practice environment or scope;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(5)(b)(vii): a credentialing committee determines that public health or patient safety is directly threatened, the screening permits a physician to retain the right to modify the physician's practice environment to allow the physician to continue to provide safe and effective care;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(5)(b)(viii): guidelines, procedures, and methods of assessment are transparent to physicians and physicians' representatives, if requested by a physician or a physician's representative, and physicians are made aware of the specific methods used, performance expectations and standards against which performance will be judged, and the possible outcomes of the screening or assessment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(5)(b)(ix): education or remediation practices that result from screening or assessment procedures are:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(5)(b)(ix)(A): supportive of physician wellness;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(5)(b)(ix)(B): ongoing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(5)(b)(ix)(C): proactive; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302(5)(b)(x): procedures and screening mechanisms that are distinctly different from for cause assessments do not result in undue cost or burden to senior physicians providing patient care.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.1 Qualifications for licensure -- Criminal background check.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.1(1): Chapter 67b, Interstate Medical Licensure Compact An applicant for participation in the Interstate Medical Licensure Compact under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.1(1)(a): submit fingerprint cards in a form acceptable to the division at the time the license application is filed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.1(1)(b): consent to a fingerprint background check conducted by the Bureau of Criminal Identification and the Federal Bureau of Investigation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.1(2): 53-10-108; (2)(a); 53-10-108 The division shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.1(2)(a): 53-10-108 in addition to other fees authorized by this chapter, collect from each applicant submitting fingerprints in accordance with this section the fee that the Bureau of Criminal Identification is authorized to collect for the services provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.1(2)(b): (2)(a) submit from each applicant the fingerprint card and the fees described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.1(2)(c): 53-10-108 obtain and retain in division records a signed waiver approved by the Bureau of Criminal Identification in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.1(3): 53-10-108; (2)(b) The Bureau of Criminal Identification shall, in accordance with the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.1(3)(a): (2)(b) check the fingerprints submitted under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.1(3)(b): forward the fingerprints to the Federal Bureau of Investigation for a national criminal history background check; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.1(3)(c): provide the results from the state, regional, and nationwide criminal history background checks to the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.1(4): Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 2, Bureau of Criminal Identification For purposes of conducting a criminal background check required under this section, the division shall have direct access to criminal background information maintained under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.1(5): The division may not disseminate outside of the division any criminal history record information that the division obtains from the Bureau of Criminal Identification or the Federal Bureau of Investigation under the criminal background check requirements of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.1(6): The division may not issue a letter of qualification to participate in the Interstate Medical Licensure Compact until the criminal background check described in this section is completed.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.5 Licensing of graduates of foreign medical schools.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.5(1): 58-67-302(1); 58-67-302(1)(d); 58-67-302(1)(e)(i) Notwithstanding any other provision of law to the contrary, an individual enrolled in a medical school outside the United States, its territories, the District of Columbia, or Canada is eligible for licensure as a physician and surgeon in this state if the individual has satisfied the following requirements:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.5(1)(a): 58-67-302(1); 58-67-302(1)(d) meets all the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.5(1)(b): has studied medicine in a medical school located outside the United States which is recognized by an organization approved by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.5(1)(c): has completed all of the formal requirements of the foreign medical school except internship or social service;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.5(1)(d): has attained a passing score on the educational commission for foreign medical graduates examination or other qualifying examinations such as the United States Medical Licensing Exam parts I and II, which are approved by the division or a medical school approved by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.5(1)(e): has satisfactorily completed one calendar year of supervised clinical training under the direction of a United States medical education setting accredited by the liaison committee for graduate medical education and approved by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.5(1)(f): 58-67-302(1)(e)(i) has completed the postgraduate hospital training required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.5(1)(g): has passed the examination required by the division of all applicants for licensure.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.5(2): (1); 58-67-302(1)(d) Satisfaction of the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.5(2)(a): the completion of any foreign internship or social service requirements; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.5(2)(b): 58-67-302(1)(d) the certification required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.5(3): (1)(a); (g) Individuals who satisfy the requirements of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.5(4): (1)(c) A document issued by a medical school located outside the United States shall be considered the equivalent of a degree of doctor of medicine for the purpose of licensure as a physician and surgeon in this state if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.5(4)(a): the foreign medical school is recognized by an organization approved by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.5(4)(b): the document granted by the foreign medical school is issued after the completion of all formal requirements of the medical school except internship or social service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.5(4)(c): (1)(c) the foreign medical school certifies that the person to whom the document was issued has satisfactorily completed the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.5(5): 58-67-302(5)(b)(i); (x) The division may not require as a requirement for licensure a cognitive test when the physician reaches a specified age, unless the test reflects the standards described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.5(6): The provisions for licensure under this section shall be known as the "fifth pathway program."


Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7 Licensing of physician-educators.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(1)(a): "Foreign country" means a country other than the United States, its territories, or Canada.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(1)(b): "Foreign medical school" means a medical school that is outside the United States, its territories, and Canada.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2): 63J-1-504 Notwithstanding any provision of law to the contrary, an individual may receive a type I foreign teaching license if the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(a): submits an application in a form prescribed by the division, which may include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(a)(i): submission by the applicant of information maintained in a practitioner data bank, as designated by division rule, with respect to the applicant;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(a)(ii): a record of professional liability claims made against the applicant and settlements paid by or on behalf of the applicant; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(a)(iii): the applicant's curriculum vitae;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(b): is a graduate of a foreign medical school that is accepted for certification by the Educational Commission for Foreign Medical Graduates;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(c): is licensed in good standing in a foreign country, the United States, its territories, or Canada;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(d): does not have an investigation or action pending against the physician's healthcare license, does not have a healthcare license that was suspended or revoked, and has not surrendered a healthcare license in lieu of disciplinary action, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(d)(i): the license was subsequently reinstated in good standing; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(d)(ii): the division in collaboration with the board determines to its satisfaction, after full disclosure by the applicant and full consideration by the division in collaboration with the board, that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(d)(ii)(A): the conduct has been corrected, monitored, and resolved; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(d)(ii)(B): a mitigating circumstance exists that prevents resolution, and the division in collaboration with the board is satisfied that but for the mitigating circumstance, the license would be reinstated;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(e): submits documentation of legal status to work in the United States;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(f): meets at least three of the following qualifications:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(f)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(f)(i)(A): published original results of clinical research, within 10 years before the day on which the application is submitted, in a medical journal listed in the Index Medicus or an equivalent scholarly publication; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(f)(i)(B): submits the publication to the Board in English or in a foreign language with a verifiable, certified English translation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(f)(ii): held an appointment at a medical school approved by the LCME or at any medical school listed in the World Health Organization directory at the level of associate or full professor, or its equivalent, for at least five years;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(f)(iii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(f)(iii)(A): developed a treatment modality, surgical technique, or other verified original contribution to the field of medicine within 10 years before the day on which the application is submitted; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(f)(iii)(B): has the treatment modality, surgical technique, or other verified original contribution attested to by the dean of an LCME accredited school of medicine in Utah;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(f)(iv): actively practiced medicine cumulatively for 10 years; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(f)(v): is board certified in good standing of a board of the American Board of Medical Specialities or equivalent specialty board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(g): is able to read, write, speak, understand, and be understood in the English language and demonstrates proficiency to the satisfaction of the division in collaboration with the board, if requested;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(h): is invited by an LCME accredited medical school in Utah to serve as a full-time member of the medical school's academic faculty, as evidenced by written certification from:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(h)(i): the dean of the medical school, stating that the applicant has been appointed to a full-time faculty position, that because the applicant has unique expertise in a specific field of medicine the medical school considers the applicant to be a valuable member of the faculty, and that the applicant is qualified by knowledge, skill, and ability to practice medicine in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(h)(ii): the head of the department to which the applicant is to be appointed, stating that the applicant will be under the direction of the head of the department and will be permitted to practice medicine only as a necessary part of the applicant's duties, providing detailed evidence of the applicant's qualifications and competence, including the nature and location of the applicant's proposed responsibilities, reasons for any limitations of the applicant's practice responsibilities, and the degree of supervision, if any, under which the applicant will function;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(i): 63J-1-504 pays a licensing fee set by the division under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(2)(j): has practiced medicine for at least 10 years as an attending physician.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(3): (2)(a); (e); (g); (i); (2)(h) Notwithstanding any provision of law to the contrary, an individual may receive a type II foreign teaching license if the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(3)(a): (2)(a); (e); (g); (i) satisfies the requirements of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(3)(b): has delivered clinical care to patients cumulatively for five years after graduation from medical school; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(3)(c): (2)(h)

Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(4): (2); 58-67-303 After an initial term of one year, a type I license may be renewed for periods of two years if the licensee continues to satisfy the requirements described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(6)(c)(iv): (2)(h) the day on which employment at the medical school described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(7): (8); (2) A person who holds a type I license for five consecutive years may apply for licensure as a physician and surgeon in this state and shall be licensed if the individual satisfies the requirements described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(8): (2)(h); (4); (5); 58-67-302(1)(a); (c); (h); (i) An individual who holds a type I or type II license for five consecutive years is eligible for licensure as a physician and surgeon in this state if the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(8)(a): worked an average of at least 40 hours per month at the level of an attending physician during the time the individual held the type I or type II license;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(8)(b): (2)(h) holds the rank of associate professor or higher at the medical school described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(8)(c): obtains certification from the Educational Commission for Foreign Medical Graduates or any successor organization approved by the division in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(8)(d): (4); (5) spent a cumulative 20 hours per year while holding a type I or type II license:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(8)(d)(i): teaching or lecturing to medical students or house staff;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(8)(d)(ii): participating in educational department meetings or conferences that are not certified to meet the continuing medical education license renewal requirement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(8)(d)(iii): (4); (5) attending continuing medical education classes in addition to the requirements for continuing education described in Subsections

Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(8)(f): 58-67-302(1)(a); (c); (h); (i) satisfies the requirements described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(9): (8) If a person who holds a type II license fails to obtain licensure as a physician and surgeon in this state after applying under the procedures described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(9)(a): reapply for or renew a type II license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(9)(b): apply for a type I license.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(10): The division or the board may require an applicant for licensure under this section to meet with the board and representatives of the division for the purpose of evaluating the applicant's qualifications for licensure.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.7(11): The division in collaboration with the board may withdraw a license under this section at any time for material misrepresentation or unlawful or unprofessional conduct.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-67-302.8(1)(c): is not currently enrolled in and has not completed a residency program.
