Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-801 Disclosure of financial interest by licensee.  
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-801(1): Licensees under this chapter may not refer patients, clients, or customers to any clinical laboratory, ambulatory or surgical care facilities, or other treatment or rehabilitation services such as physical therapy, cardiac rehabilitation, radiology services, dispensing optical lens facility, or lithotripsy, in which the licensee or a member of the licensee's immediate family has any financial relationship as that term is described in 42 U.S.C.  1395nn, unless the licensee at the time of making the referral discloses that relationship, in writing, to the patient, client, or customer.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-801(2): (1) The written disclosure under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-802 Form of practice.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-802(1): An osteopathic physician and surgeon licensed under this chapter may engage in practice as an osteopathic physician and surgeon or in the practice of osteopathic medicine only as an individual licensee, but as an individual licensee, he may be:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-802(1)(a): an individual operating as a business proprietor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-802(1)(b): an employee of another person;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-802(1)(c): a partner in a lawfully organized partnership;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-802(1)(d): a lawfully formed professional corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-802(1)(e): a lawfully organized limited liability company;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-802(1)(f): a lawfully organized business corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-802(1)(g): any other form of organization recognized by the state and not prohibited by division rule made in collaboration with the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-802(2): 58-68-301; 58-67-301 Regardless of the form in which a licensee engages in the practice of osteopathic medicine, the licensee may only permit the practice of medicine in that form of business practice to be conducted by an individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-802(2)(a): 58-68-301; 58-67-301 licensed in Utah as an osteopathic physician and surgeon under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-802(2)(b): who is able to lawfully and competently engage in the practice of medicine to direct or interfere in the licensee's practice of medicine.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-803 Medical records -- Electronic records.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-803(1): Medical records maintained by a licensee shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-803(1)(a): meet the standards and ethics of the profession; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-803(1)(b): be maintained in accordance with division rules made in collaboration with the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-803(2): (1) Medical records under this section may be maintained by an electronic means if the records comply with Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-804 Consumer access to provider charges.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Beginning January 1, 2011, an osteopathic physician licensed under this chapter shall, when requested by a consumer:Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-804(1): make a list of prices charged by the osteopathic physician available for the consumer which includes the osteopathic physician's 25 most frequently performed:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-804(1)(a): clinic procedures or clinic services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-804(1)(b): out-patient procedures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-804(1)(c): in-patient procedures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-804(2): provide the consumer with information regarding any discount available for:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-804(2)(a): services not covered by insurance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-804(2)(b): prompt payment of billed charges.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-805 Supervision of cosmetic medical procedures.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-805(1): (2); Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-805(2): Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act A physician may delegate to an advanced practice registered nurse with an unrestricted license under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-805(2)(a): prescribes that specific procedure for the patient who is to receive the procedure;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-805(2)(b): ensures that the advanced practice registered nurse performs the procedure under the indirect supervision of the physician; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-805(2)(c): verifies that the advanced practice registered nurse is qualified to perform the procedure by having received at least 50 hours of training specific to the procedure to be performed and the laser to be used.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-806 Representation of medical specialization.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-806(1): (2) A physician may not represent to another person that the physician is certified in a medical specialty or certified by a particular board unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-806(1)(a): the physician includes in the representation the name of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-806(1)(a)(i): the certification board or entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-806(1)(a)(ii): the medical specialty or procedure for which the physician is certified; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-806(1)(b): (2) the board or certification entity meets the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-806(2): (1) A certification entity or board under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-806(2)(a): be included in the American Board of Medical Specialties or an American Osteopathic Association Certifying Board; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-806(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-806(2)(b)(i): require an Accreditation Council for Graduate Medical Education or American Osteopathic Association approved post-graduate training program that provides complete training in the specialty or sub-specialty; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-806(2)(b)(ii): be certified or had prior certification by the member board of the American Board of Medical Specialties or an American Osteopathic Association Certifying Board.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807 Collaborative practice arrangement.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(b)(iv)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1)(a): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The division, in consultation with the board, shall make rules in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1)(b): (1)(b)(iv) The division shall require a collaborative practice arrangement to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1)(b)(i): limit the associate physician to providing primary care services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1)(b)(ii): be consistent with the skill, training, and competence of the associate physician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1)(b)(iii): specify jointly agreed-upon protocols, or standing orders for the delivery of health care services by the associate physician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1)(b)(iv): provide complete names, home and business addresses, zip codes, and telephone numbers of the collaborating physician and the associate physician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1)(b)(v): (1)(b)(iv) list all other offices or locations besides those listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1)(b)(vi): require at every office where the associate physician is authorized to prescribe in collaboration with a physician a prominently displayed disclosure statement informing patients that patients may be seen by an associate physician and have the right to see the collaborating physician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1)(b)(vii): specify all specialty or board certifications of the collaborating physician and all certifications of the associate physician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1)(b)(viii): specify the manner of collaboration between the collaborating physician and the associate physician, including how the collaborating physician and the associate physician shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1)(b)(viii)(A): engage in collaborative practice consistent with each professional's skill, training, education, and competence;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1)(b)(viii)(B): maintain geographic proximity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1)(b)(viii)(C): provide oversight of the associate physician during the absence, incapacity, infirmity, or emergency of the collaborating physician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1)(b)(ix): describe the associate physician's controlled substance prescriptive authority in collaboration with the collaborating physician, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1)(b)(ix)(A): a list of the controlled substances the collaborating physician authorizes the associate physician to prescribe; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1)(b)(ix)(B): documentation that the authorization to prescribe the controlled substances is consistent with the education, knowledge, skill, and competence of the associate physician and the collaborating physician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1)(b)(x): list all other written practice arrangements of the collaborating physician and the associate physician; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1)(b)(xi): specify the duration of the written practice arrangement between the collaborating physician and the associate physician.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1)(c): An associate physician and the collaborating physician may modify a collaborative practice arrangement, but the changes to the collaborative practice arrangement are not binding unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1)(c)(i): the associate physician notifies the division within 10 days after the day on which the changes are made; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(1)(c)(ii): the division approves the changes.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(2): An associate physician:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(2)(a): shall clearly identify himself or herself as an associate physician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(2)(b): is permitted to use the title "doctor" or "Dr."; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(2)(c): if authorized under a collaborative practice arrangement to prescribe Schedule III through V controlled substances, shall register with the United States Drug Enforcement Administration as part of the drug enforcement administration's mid-level practitioner registry.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(3): 58-68-302; 58-68-302.5; (3)(c)(i)(C)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(3)(a): 58-68-302; 58-68-302.5 A physician or surgeon licensed and in good standing under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(3)(b): A physician or surgeon may not enter into a collaborative practice arrangement with more than three full-time equivalent associate physicians.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(3)(c): (3)(c)(i)(C)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(3)(c)(i): No contract or other agreement shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(3)(c)(i)(A): require a physician to act as a collaborating physician for an associate physician against the physician's will;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(3)(c)(i)(B): deny a collaborating physician the right to refuse to act as a collaborating physician, without penalty, for a particular associate physician; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(3)(c)(i)(C): limit the collaborating physician's ultimate authority over any protocols or standing orders or in the delegation of the physician's authority to any associate physician.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(3)(c)(ii): (3)(c)(i)(C) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(3)(d): A collaborating physician is responsible at all times for the oversight of the activities of, and accepts responsibility for, the primary care services rendered by the associate physician.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(4): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The division shall makes rules, in consultation with the board, the deans of medical schools in the state, and primary care residency program directors in the state, and in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(4)(a): an associate physician shall complete throughout the duration of the collaborative practice arrangement;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(4)(b): shall facilitate the advancement of the associate physician's medical knowledge and capabilities; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-68-807(4)(c): may lead to credit toward a future residency program.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 69 - Dentist and Dental Hygienist Practice Act
***************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is the "Dentist and Dental Hygienist Practice Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(1): "Asynchronous technology" means store-and-forward technology that allows a licensed dental professional to transmit a patient's health information to a dentist for viewing at a later time.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(2): 58-69-201 "Board" means the Dentist and Dental Hygienist Licensing Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(3): "Dental assistant" means an unlicensed individual who engages in, directly or indirectly, supervised acts and duties as defined by division rule made in collaboration with the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(4): "Direct supervision" means the supervising dentist is present and available for face-to-face communication with the person being supervised when and where professional services are being provided.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(5): "General supervision" means that the supervising dentist is available for consultation regarding work the supervising dentist has authorized, without regard as to whether the supervising dentist is located on the same premises as the person being supervised.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(6): "Indirect supervision" means that the supervising dentist is present within the facility in which the person being supervised is providing services and is available to provide immediate face-to-face communication with the person being supervised.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(7): 58-69-801 "Practice of dental hygiene" means, regarding humans:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(7)(a): 58-69-801 under the general supervision of a dentist, or under a written agreement with a dentist licensed under this chapter, as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(7)(a)(i): perform preliminary clinical examination of human teeth and gums;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(7)(a)(ii): make preliminary instrumental examination of patients' teeth;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(7)(a)(iii): expose dental radiographs;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(7)(a)(iv): assess dental hygiene status and collaborate with the supervising dentist regarding a dental hygiene treatment plan for a patient;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(7)(a)(v): remove deposits, accumulations, calculus, and concretions from the surfaces of human teeth;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(7)(a)(vi): remove toxins and debris from subgingival surfaces;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(7)(a)(vii): provide dental hygiene care in accordance with a dentist's treatment plan for a patient;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(7)(a)(viii): take impressions of teeth or jaws except for impressions or registrations to supply artificial teeth as substitutes for natural teeth; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(7)(a)(ix): engage in other practices of dental hygiene as defined by division rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(7)(b): under the indirect supervision of a dentist to administer in accordance with standards and ethics of the professions of dentistry and dental hygiene:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(7)(b)(i): local anesthesia; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(7)(b)(ii): nitrous oxide analgesia;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(7)(c): to represent oneself by any title, degree, or in any other way as being a dental hygienist; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(7)(d): to direct a dental assistant when the supervising dentist is not on the premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(8): "Practice of dentistry" means the following, regarding humans:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(8)(a): to offer, undertake, or represent that a person will undertake by any means or method, including teledentistry, to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(8)(a)(i): examine, evaluate, diagnose, treat, operate, or prescribe therapy for any disease, pain, injury, deficiency, deformity, or any other condition of the human teeth, alveolar process, gums, jaws, or adjacent hard and soft tissues and structures in the maxillofacial region;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(8)(a)(ii): take an appropriate history and physical consistent with the level of professional service to be provided and the available resources in the facility in which the service is to be provided;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(8)(a)(iii): take impressions or registrations;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(8)(a)(iv): supply artificial teeth as substitutes for natural teeth;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(8)(a)(v): remove deposits, accumulations, calculus, and concretions from the surfaces of teeth; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(8)(a)(vi): correct or attempt to correct malposition of teeth;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(8)(b): to administer anesthetics necessary or proper in the practice of dentistry only as allowed by an anesthesia permit obtained from the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(8)(c): to administer and prescribe drugs related to and appropriate in the practice of dentistry;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(8)(d): to supervise the practice of a dental hygienist or dental assistant as established by division rule made in collaboration with the board; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(8)(e): to represent oneself by any title, degree, or in any other way that one is a dentist.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(9): "Public health setting" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(9)(a): an individual's residence, if the individual is unable to leave the residence;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(9)(b): a school, as part of a school-based program;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(9)(c): a nursing home;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(9)(d): an assisted living or long-term care facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(9)(e): a community health center;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(9)(f): a federally-qualified health center; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(9)(g): a mobile dental health program that employs a dentist who is licensed under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(10): "Supervising dentist" means a licensed dentist who has agreed to provide supervision of a dental hygienist or unlicensed individual in accordance with the provisions of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(11): "Synchronous technology" means two-way audiovisual technology that allows a licensed dental professional to see and communicate in real time with a patient who is located in a different physical location.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(12): "Teledentistry" means the practice of dentistry using synchronous or asynchronous technology.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(13): 58-1-501; 58-69-501 "Unlawful conduct" means the same as that term is defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-102(14): 58-1-501; 58-69-502 "Unprofessional conduct" means the same as that term is defined in Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-201 Board.
--------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-201(1): There is created the Dentist and Dental Hygienist Licensing Board, consisting of six licensed dentists, two licensed dental hygienists, and one member of the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-201(2): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed and serve in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-201(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-201(3)(a): 58-1-202; 58-1-203 The duties and responsibilities of the board shall be in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-201(3)(b): In addition, the board shall designate one of its members on a permanent or rotating basis to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-201(3)(b)(i): assist the division in reviewing complaints concerning the unlawful or unprofessional conduct of a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-201(3)(b)(ii): advise the division with respect to the conduct of investigations of these complaints.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-201(4): (3) A board member who has, under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-201(5): 58-69-302 Board members may serve as examiners for licensing examinations established under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-201(6): 58-1-201(4) Board members serving as examiners shall be compensated in accordance with Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-301 License required -- License classifications -- Anesthesia and analgesia permits.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-301(1): 58-69-306; 58-1-307 A license is required to engage in the practice of dentistry, including teledentistry, or dental hygiene except as specifically provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-301(2): The division shall issue to individuals qualified under the provisions of this chapter a license in the classification:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-301(2)(a): dentist; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-301(2)(b): dental hygienist.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-301(3): A permit is required to engage in administration of anesthesia or analgesia in the practice of dentistry or dental hygiene.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-301(4): The division in collaboration with the board shall establish by rule:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-301(4)(a): the classifications of anesthesia and analgesia permits and the scope of practice permitted under each permit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-301(4)(b): the qualifications for each classification of anesthesia and analgesia permit.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302 Qualifications -- Licensure as a dentist -- Licensure as a dental hygienist.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(1): (2); 63J-1-504; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act An applicant for licensure as a dentist, except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(1)(a): submit an application in a form as prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(1)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee as determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(1)(c): provide satisfactory documentation of having successfully completed a program of professional education preparing an individual as a dentist as evidenced by having received an earned doctor's degree in dentistry from a dental school accredited by the Commission on Dental Accreditation of the American Dental Association;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(1)(d): pass the National Board Dental Examinations as administered by the Joint Commission on National Dental Examinations of the American Dental Association;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(1)(e): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act pass any regional dental clinical licensure examination approved by division rule made in collaboration with the board and in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(1)(f): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act pass any other examinations regarding applicable law, rules, or ethics as established by division rule made in collaboration with the board and in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(1)(g): be able to read, write, speak, understand, and be understood in the English language and demonstrate proficiency to the satisfaction of the board if requested by the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(1)(h): meet with the board if requested by the board or division for the purpose of examining the applicant's qualifications for licensure.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(2): 58-1-302; 58-1-302; (1); (1)(c) An applicant for licensure as a dentist qualifying under the endorsement provision of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(2)(a): 58-1-302 be currently licensed in good standing with an unrestricted license in another jurisdiction described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(2)(b): (1); (1)(c) document having met all requirements for licensure under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(2)(c): document having been successfully engaged in clinical practice as a dentist for not less than 6,000 hours in the five years immediately preceding the date of application for licensure.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(3): (4); 63J-1-504 An applicant for licensure as a dental hygienist, except as set forth in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(3)(a): submit an application in a form as prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(3)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee as determined by the department pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(3)(c): be a graduate holding a certificate or degree in dental hygiene from a school accredited by the Commission on Dental Accreditation of the American Dental Association;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(3)(d): pass the National Board Dental Hygiene Examination as administered by the Joint Commission on National Dental Examinations of the American Dental Association;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(3)(e): pass an examination consisting of practical demonstrations in the practice of dental hygiene and written or oral examination in the theory and practice of dental hygiene as established by division rule made in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(3)(f): pass any other examinations regarding applicable law, rules, and ethics as established by rule by division rule made in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(3)(g): be able to read, write, speak, understand, and be understood in the English language and demonstrate proficiency to the satisfaction of the board if requested by the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(3)(h): meet with the board if requested by the board or division for the purpose of examining the applicant's qualifications for licensure.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(4): 58-1-302; 58-1-302; (3) An applicant for licensure as a dental hygienist qualifying under the endorsement provision of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(4)(a): 58-1-302 be currently licensed in another jurisdiction set forth in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(4)(b): (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(4)(b)(i): (3) document having met all requirements for licensure under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(4)(b)(ii): document having obtained licensure in another state or jurisdiction upon which licensure by endorsement is based by meeting requirements which were equal to licensure requirements in Utah at the time the applicant obtained licensure in the other state or jurisdiction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-302(4)(c): document having been successfully engaged in practice as a dental hygienist for not less than 2,000 hours in the two years immediately preceding the date of application for licensure.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-303 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-303(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-303(1)(a): The division shall issue each license and permit under this chapter in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by division rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-303(1)(b): The division may by rule extend or shorten a renewal period by as much as one year to stagger the renewal cycles it administers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-303(2): At the time of renewal, the licensee shall show compliance with continuing education renewal requirements.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-303(3): 58-1-308 Each license expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless renewed in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-304 Continuing education.
-----------------------------------------------------
During each two-year licensure cycle or other cycle defined by rule, a licensee under this chapter shall complete qualified continuing professional education requirements established by division rule made in collaboration with the board.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-306 Exemptions from licensure.
----------------------------------------------------------
In addition to the exemptions from licensure in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-69-306(1): an individual performing mechanical work on inert matter in a laboratory pursuant to a written prescription from a licensed dentist may engage in acts and practices included in the practice of dentistry or dental hygiene without being licensed under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-306(2): an individual licensed in good standing as a dentist in another state, with no licensing action pending and no less than two years of professional experience, may engage in the practice of dentistry without being licensed under this chapter if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-306(2)(a): the services are rendered as a public service and for a noncommercial purpose;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-306(2)(b): no fee or other consideration of value is charged, received, expected, or contemplated for the services rendered beyond an amount necessary to cover the proportionate cost of malpractice insurance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-306(2)(c): the individual does not otherwise engage in unlawful or unprofessional conduct; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-306(3): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act an individual who is appointed to a faculty position at an accredited dental school may practice dentistry within the scope of the individual's employment at the accredited dental school or at a hospital or clinic affiliated with the accredited dental school if the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-306(3)(a): holds a license to practice dentistry in another jurisdiction;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-306(3)(b): is permitted to the work in the United States under federal immigration law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-306(3)(c): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-306(3)(c)(i): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-306(3)(c)(i)(A): successfully completes Part I and Part II of the National Board Dental Examination; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-306(3)(c)(i)(B): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act holds a degree in a dental specialty area, as defined by the division by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-306(3)(c)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-306(3)(c)(ii)(A): holds a certificate, master's degree, or doctorate degree from an accredited higher education or dental education institution in an area that supports dental education; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-306(3)(c)(ii)(B): practices only under the supervision of an individual licensed as a dentist under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-306(3)(c)(iii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-306(3)(c)(iii)(A): has established expertise in an area of dentistry that is recognized by a United States higher education or dental education institution or by a national professional board or association; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-306(3)(c)(iii)(B): practices only under the supervision of an individual licensed as a dentist under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-307 Status of licenses held on the effective date of this chapter.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
An individual holding a current license or permit as a dentist or dental hygienist that was issued under any prior state law is considered to hold a current license or permit in the same classification under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-401 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for division action regarding the following are under SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-69-401(1): refusing to issue a license to an applicant or refusing to renew the license of a licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-401(2): revoking, suspending, restricting, or placing on probation the license of a licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-401(3): issuing a public or private reprimand to a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-401(4): issuing a cease and desist order.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-501 Unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------
"Unlawful conduct" includes, in addition to the definition in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-69-501(1): administering anesthesia or analgesia in the practice of dentistry or dental hygiene if the individual does not hold a current permit issued by the division authorizing that individual to administer the type of anesthesia or analgesia used;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-501(2): practice of dental hygiene by a licensed dental hygienist when not under the supervision of a dentist, or under a written agreement with a dentist who is licensed under this chapter and who is a Utah resident, in accordance with the provisions of this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-501(3): directing or interfering with a licensed dentist's judgment and competent practice of dentistry.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-502 Unprofessional conduct.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-502(1): 58-1-501; (1)(a); (d); 58-1-501(1) "Unprofessional conduct" includes, in addition to the definition in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-502(1)(a): sharing professional fees with an unlicensed person or paying any person for sending or referring a patient;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-502(1)(b): making an unsubstantiated claim of superiority in training or skill as a dentist or dental hygienist or in the performance of professional services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-502(1)(c): refusing authorized agents of the division or state or local health authorities access to the facilities related to the practice of dentistry or dental hygiene during normal business hours for the purpose of inspection;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-502(1)(d): failing to maintain facilities, instruments, equipment, supplies, appliances, or other property or conditions related to the practice of dentistry in a sanitary condition consistent with the standards and ethics of the professions of dentistry or dental hygiene; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-502(1)(e): (1)(a); (d); 58-1-501(1) falsely making an entry in, or altering, a medical record with the intent to conceal:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-502(1)(e)(i): a wrongful or negligent act or omission of an individual licensed under this chapter or an individual under the direction or control of an individual licensed under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-502(1)(e)(ii): (1)(a); (d); 58-1-501(1) conduct described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-502(2): (1)(b) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-502(2)(a): includes for the practice of dentistry:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-502(2)(a)(i): advertising or otherwise holding oneself out to the public as practicing a dental specialty in which the dentist has not successfully completed the education specified for the dental specialty as defined by the American Dental Association; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-502(2)(a)(ii): using the following words in advertising "Endodontist," "Orthodontist," "Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeon," "Specialist," "Board Certified," "Diplomat," "Practice Limited to," "Pediatric Dentist," "Periodontist," or "Limited to Specialty of" when the dentist has not successfully completed the education specified for the dental specialty as defined by the American Dental Association; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-502(2)(b): does not include a dentist who advertises as being qualified in a recognized specialty area of dental practice so long as each such advertisement, regardless of form, contains a prominent disclaimer that the dentist is licensed as a general dentist or that the specialty services will be provided by a general dentist.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-503 Penalty for unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-503(1): 58-1-501(1)(a); 58-69-501 Any person who violates the unlawful conduct provisions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-503(2): 58-1-501(1)(a) Any person who violates the unlawful conduct provisions of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601 Mentally incompetent or incapacitated dentist or dental hygienist.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(1): 75-1-201; 26B-5-301 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(1)(a): 75-1-201 "Incapacitated person" means a person who is incapacitated, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(1)(b): 26B-5-301 "Mental illness" is as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(2): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act If a court of competent jurisdiction determines a dentist or dental hygienist is an incapacitated person or that the dentist or hygienist has a mental illness and is unable to safely engage in the practice of dentistry or dental hygiene, the director shall immediately suspend the license of the dentist or dental hygienist upon the entry of the judgment of the court, without further proceedings under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(3): 58-1-109; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(3)(a): If the division and a majority of the board find reasonable cause to believe a dentist or dental hygienist, who is not determined judicially to be an incapacitated person or to have a mental illness, is incapable of practicing dentistry or dental hygiene with reasonable skill regarding the safety of patients, because of illness, excessive use of drugs or alcohol, or as a result of any mental or physical condition, the board shall recommend that the director file a petition with the division, and cause the petition to be served upon the dentist or dental hygienist with a notice of hearing on the sole issue of the capacity of the dentist or dental hygienist to competently and safely engage in the practice of dentistry or dental hygiene.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(3)(b): 58-1-109; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; (4) The hearing shall be conducted under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(4): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(4)(a): Every dentist or dental hygienist who accepts the privilege of being licensed under this chapter gives consent to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(4)(a)(i): submitting at the dentist or dental hygienist's own expense to an immediate mental or physical examination when directed in writing by the division and a majority of the board to do so; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(4)(a)(ii): the admissibility of the reports of the examining practitioner's testimony or examination, and waives all objections on the ground the reports constitute a privileged communication.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(4)(b): The examination may be ordered by the division, with the consent of a majority of the board, only upon a finding of reasonable cause to believe:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(4)(b)(i): the dentist or dental hygienist has a mental illness, is incapacitated, or otherwise unable to practice dentistry or dental hygiene with reasonable skill and safety; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(4)(b)(ii): immediate action by the division and the board is necessary to prevent harm to the dentist's or dental hygienist's patients or the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(4)(c): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(4)(c)(i): Failure of a dentist or dental hygienist to submit to the examination ordered under this section is a ground for the division's immediate suspension of the dentist's or dental hygienist's license by written order of the director.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(4)(c)(ii): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act The division may enter the order of suspension without further compliance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(5): (2); (3); 58-1-108; 58-1-109
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(5)(a): (2); (3) A dentist or dental hygienist whose license is suspended under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(5)(b): 58-1-108; 58-1-109 The hearing held under this subsection shall be conducted in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(6): A dentist or dental hygienist whose license is revoked, suspended, or in any way restricted under this section may request the division and the board to consider, at reasonable intervals, evidence presented by the dentist or dental hygienist, under procedures established by division rule, regarding any change in the dentist's or dental hygienist's condition, to determine whether:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(6)(a): the dentist or dental hygienist is or is not able to safely and competently engage in the practice of dentistry or dental hygiene; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-601(6)(b): the dentist or dental hygienist is qualified to have the dentist or dental hygienist's licensure to practice under this chapter restored completely or in part.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801 Dental hygienist -- Limitations on practice.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
A dental hygienist licensed under this chapter may only practice dental hygiene:Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(1): in an accredited dental or dental hygienist school to teach and demonstrate the practice of dental hygiene;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(2): for a public health agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(3): (3) under the supervision of a dentist, for an employee leasing company or temporary personnel service company providing employees to a dentist or other person lawfully providing dental services:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(3)(a): under the indirect supervision of a dentist licensed under this chapter at any time the dental hygienist is administering an anesthetic or analgesia as permitted under this chapter or division rules made under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(3)(b): under the general supervision of a dentist licensed under this chapter within the office of the supervising dentist and upon patients of record of the supervising dentist; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(3)(c): (3) under the general supervision of a dentist licensed under this chapter, and the practice is conducted outside of the office of the supervising dentist, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(3)(c)(i): the dental hygiene work performed is authorized by the supervising dentist as a part of and in accordance with the supervising dentist's current treatment plan for the patient;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(3)(c)(ii): no anesthetic or analgesia is used;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(3)(c)(iii): the supervising dentist has determined the patient's general health and oral health are so that the dental hygiene work can be performed under general supervision and with an acceptable level of risk or injury as determined by the supervising dentist;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(3)(c)(iv): the supervising dentist accepts responsibility for the dental hygiene work performed under general supervision; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(3)(c)(v): (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(3)(c)(v)(A): the dental hygienist's work is performed on a patient who is homebound or within a hospital, nursing home, or public health agency or institution; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(3)(c)(v)(B): (3) the patient is the supervising dentist's patient of record and the dentist has examined the patient within six months prior to the patient's receiving treatment from a dental hygienist under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(4): under a written agreement with a dentist who is licensed under this chapter and who is a Utah resident if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(4)(a): the dental hygienist practices in a public health setting;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(4)(b): the dentist is available in person, by phone, or by electronic communication;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(4)(c): the agreement provides that the dental hygienist shall refer a patient with a dental need beyond the dental hygienist's scope of practice to a licensed dentist; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(4)(d): the dental hygienist obtains from each patient an informed consent form that provides that treatment by a dental hygienist is not a substitute for a dental examination by a dentist; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(5): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter, without general supervision and without a collaborative practice agreement with a dentist if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(5)(a): the dental hygienist engages in the practice of dental hygiene in a public health setting;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(5)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act prior to engaging in the practice of dental hygiene in a public health setting, the dental hygienist notifies the division on a one-time basis in accordance with rules made by the division in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(5)(c): the dental hygienist assumes liability for the work done by the dental hygienist while engaging in the practice of dental hygiene in a public health setting;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(5)(d): the dental hygienist has liability insurance for the work done by the dental hygienist while engaging in the practice of dental hygiene in a public health setting; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(5)(e): the dental hygienist:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(5)(e)(i): refers to a licensed dentist any patient with a dental need beyond the dental hygienist's scope of practice encountered while engaging in the practice of dental hygiene in a public health setting; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-801(5)(e)(ii): sends to the licensed dentist all dental records for the patient generated by the dental hygienist.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-802 Practice within limits of law, education, training, experience, and competency -- Standard of care.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-802(1): Each individual licensed under this chapter shall confine his practice to those acts or practices:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-802(1)(a): permitted by law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-802(1)(b): in which the individual is competent by education, training, and experience.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-802(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-802(2)(a): The standard of dental care a licensed dental professional provides through teledentistry is the same as the standard of dental care a licensed dental professional provides in a traditional physical setting.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-802(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-802(2)(b)(i): A treating dentist may use teledentistry to collaborate with a dental hygienist within the relevant applicable scopes of practice and under the appropriate level of dentist supervision, in accordance with existing supervision laws.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-802(2)(b)(ii): A dental hygienist, other dental auxiliary, or any other teledentistry provider may not carry out any duties through teledentistry that require the in-person supervision of a dentist licensed under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-802(2)(c): A dentist may not conduct a dental examination using teledentistry if the standard of care necessitates a traditional physical dental examination.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-803 Use of unlicensed individuals.
--------------------------------------------------------------
The standards regulating the use of unlicensed individuals as dental assistants shall be established by division rule made in collaboration with the board.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-804 Form of practice.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-804(1): A dentist licensed under this chapter may engage in practice as a dentist, or in the practice of dentistry only as an individual licensee, but as an individual licensee, he may be:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-804(1)(a): an individual operating as a business proprietor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-804(1)(b): an employee of another person;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-804(1)(c): a partner in a lawfully organized partnership;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-804(1)(d): a lawfully formed professional corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-804(1)(e): a lawfully organized limited liability company;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-804(1)(f): a lawfully organized business corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-804(1)(g): any other form of organization recognized by the state which is not prohibited by rule adopted by division rules made in collaboration with the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-804(2): Regardless of the form in which a licensee engages in the practice of dentistry, the licensee may not permit another person who is not licensed in Utah as a dentist and is not otherwise competent to engage in the practice of dentistry to direct, or in any other way participate in, or interfere in the licensee's practice of dentistry.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-805 Disclosure of financial interest by licensee.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-805(1): Licensees under this chapter may not refer patients to any clinical laboratory or health care facility in which the licensee or a member of the licensee's immediate family has any financial relationship as that term is described in 42 U.S.C.  1395nn, unless the licensee at the time of making the referral discloses that relationship, in writing, to the patient.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-805(2): (1) The written disclosure under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-806 Consumer access to provider charges.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Beginning January 1, 2011, a dentist licensed under this chapter shall, when requested by a consumer:Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-806(1): make a list of prices charged by the dentist available for the consumer which includes the dentist's 25 most frequently performed:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-806(1)(a): clinic procedures or clinic services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-806(1)(b): out-patient procedures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-806(1)(c): in-patient procedures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-806(2): provide the consumer with information regarding any discount available for:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-806(2)(a): services not covered by insurance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-806(2)(b): prompt payment of billed charges.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-807 Use of teledentistry -- Informed consent -- Rulemaking.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-807(1): A dentist may provide dental services using teledentistry, including the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-807(1)(a): collaborating with a licensed dental professional in the completion of the following at a public health setting, generally with a written collaborative agreement, directly, or indirectly, in accordance with this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-807(1)(a)(i): gathering diagnostic information to be used by the dentist at a remote location to form a tentative basic treatment plan and provide appropriate preventive or urgent prescriptions;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-807(1)(a)(ii): perform preventive dental procedures;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-807(1)(a)(iii): provide oral health education; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-807(1)(a)(iv): perform any palliative or interim treatment or caries arresting treatment outlined in the dentist's treatment plan and authorized by the dentist, in accordance with this chapter and rules made in accordance with this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-807(1)(b): at a remote location, using records and diagnostic information that a dental hygienist provides to form a tentative treatment plan for basic dental procedures.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-807(2): A licensed dental professional or any entity employing a licensed dental professional may not require a patient to sign an agreement that limits the patient's ability to file a complaint with the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-807(3): When a licensed dental professional uses teledentistry, the licensed dental professional shall ensure informed consent covers the following additional information:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-807(3)(a): a description of the types of dental care services provided through teledentistry, including limitations on services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-807(3)(b): the name, contact information, licensure, credentials, and qualifications of all dentists and dental hygienists involved in the patient's dental care; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-807(3)(c): precautions and protocols for technological failures or emergency situations.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-807(4): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The division shall make rules, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-807(4)(a): transparency, disclosure, and informed consent;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-807(4)(b): standard of care;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-807(4)(c): proper documentation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-807(4)(d): supervision and scope of practice;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-807(4)(e): patient complaints; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-69-807(4)(f): protocols for referrals.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 70a - Utah Physician Assistant Act
***************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Utah Physician Assistant Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-70a-102(1): 58-70a-201 "Board" means the Physician Assistant Licensing Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-102(2): "Competence" means possessing the requisite cognitive, non-cognitive, and communicative abilities and qualities to perform effectively within the scope of practice of the physician assistant's practice while adhering to professional and ethical standards.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-102(3): 26B-2-201 "Health care facility" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-102(4): 58-60-102 "Mental health therapist" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-102(5): 58-67-102 "Physician" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-102(6): "Physician assistant" means an individual who is licensed to practice under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-102(7): "Practice as a physician assistant" means the professional activities and conduct of a physician assistant, also known as a PA, in diagnosing, treating, advising, or prescribing for any human disease, ailment, injury, infirmity, deformity, pain, or other condition under the provisions of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-102(8): 58-60-102 "Practice of mental health therapy" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-102(9): 58-1-501; 58-70a-502 "Unlawful conduct" means the same as that term is defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-102(10): 58-1-501; 58-70a-503 "Unprofessional conduct" means "unprofessional conduct":
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-102(10)(a): 58-1-501; 58-70a-503 as defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-102(10)(b): as further defined by the division by rule.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-201 Board.
---------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-201(1): There is created the Physician Assistant Licensing Board, which consists of seven members:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-201(1)(a): three licensed physicians, including at least one board certified psychiatrist, who currently work or have previously worked collaboratively with a physician assistant;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-201(1)(b): three physician assistants, one of whom is involved in the administration of an approved physician assistant education program within the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-201(1)(c): one person from the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-201(2): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed and serve in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-201(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-201(3)(a): 58-1-202; 58-1-203 The duties and responsibilities of the board are in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-201(3)(b): The board shall designate one of its members on a permanent or rotating basis to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-201(3)(b)(i): assist the division in reviewing complaints concerning the unlawful or unprofessional conduct of a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-201(3)(b)(ii): advise the division in the division's investigation of these complaints.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-201(4): (3); (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-201(4)(a): (3) A board member who has, under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-201(4)(b): (4)(a) The board member described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-201(4)(b)(i): on the member's own motion, due to actual or perceived bias or lack of objectivity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-201(4)(b)(ii): upon challenge for cause raised on the record by any party to the adjudicative proceeding.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-301 Licensure required -- License classifications.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-301(1): 58-70a-305; 58-1-307 A license is required to engage in practice as a physician assistant, except as specifically provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-301(2): The division shall issue to an individual who qualifies under this chapter a license in the classification of physician assistant.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-301.1 Criminal background check.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-301.1(1): An applicant for licensure under this chapter who requires a criminal background check shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-301.1(1)(a): submit fingerprint cards in a form acceptable to the division at the time the license application is filed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-301.1(1)(b): consent to a fingerprint background check conducted by the Bureau of Criminal Identification and the Federal Bureau of Investigation regarding the application.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-301.1(2): 53-10-108; (2)(a); 53-10-108 The division shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-301.1(2)(a): 53-10-108 in addition to other fees authorized by this chapter, collect from each applicant submitting fingerprints in accordance with this section the fee that the Bureau of Criminal Identification is authorized to collect for the services provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-301.1(2)(b): (2)(a) submit from each applicant the fingerprint card and the fees described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-301.1(2)(c): 53-10-108 obtain and retain in division records a signed waiver approved by the Bureau of Criminal Identification in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-301.1(3): 53-10-108; (2)(b) The Bureau of Criminal Identification shall, in accordance with the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-301.1(3)(a): (2)(b) check the fingerprints submitted under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-301.1(3)(b): forward the fingerprints to the Federal Bureau of Investigation for a national criminal history background check; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-301.1(3)(c): provide the results from the state, regional, and nationwide criminal history background checks to the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-301.1(4): Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 2, Bureau of Criminal Identification For purposes of conducting a criminal background check required under this section, the division shall have direct access to criminal background information maintained under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-301.1(5): Chapter 70c, PA Licensure Compact The division may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-301.1(5)(a): disseminate outside of the division any criminal history record information that the division obtains from the Bureau of Criminal Identification or the Federal Bureau of Investigation under the criminal background check requirements of this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-301.1(5)(b): Chapter 70c, PA Licensure Compact issue a letter of qualification to participate in the PA Licensure Compact under


Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-302 Qualifications for licensure.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Each applicant for licensure as a physician assistant shall:Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-302(1): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-302(2): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-302(3): have successfully completed a physician assistant program accredited by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-302(3)(a): the Accreditation Review Commission on Education for the Physician Assistant; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-302(3)(b): if prior to January 1, 2001, either the:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-302(3)(b)(i): Committee on Accreditation of Allied Health Education Programs; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-302(3)(b)(ii): Committee on Allied Health Education and Accreditation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-302(4): have passed the licensing examinations required by division rule made in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-302(5): meet with the board and representatives of the division, if requested, for the purpose of evaluating the applicant's qualifications for licensure; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-302(6): Chapter 70c, PA Licensure Compact; 58-70a-301.1; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act if the applicant is applying to participate in the PA Licensure Compact under


Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-303 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-303(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-303(1)(a): The division shall issue each license under this chapter in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by division rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-303(1)(b): The division may by rule extend or shorten a renewal period by as much as one year to stagger the renewal cycles it administers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-303(2): At the time of renewal, the licensee shall show compliance with continuing education renewal requirements.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-303(3): 58-1-308 Each license issued under this chapter expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless renewed in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-70a-303(4): (2); 26B-4-204 The division shall accept and apply toward an hour requirement that the division establishes under Subsection
