Utah Code Annotated § 58-72-501(2)(b): "Doctor of acupuncture" or "oriental medical doctor" may be used if the term is commensurate with the degree in acupuncture received by the practitioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-72-501(3): Medical doctors or chiropractic physicians who choose to practice acupuncture shall represent themselves as medical doctors or chiropractic physicians practicing acupuncture and not as licensed acupuncturists.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-72-502 Penalty for unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-72-502(1): 58-1-501(1)(a) Any person who violates the unlawful conduct provision defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-72-502(2): 58-1-501(1)(b); (e) Any person who violates any of the unlawful conduct provisions defined in Subsections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-72-503 Unprofessional conduct.
-------------------------------------------------------
Unprofessional conduct includes the failure to transmit records in the English language to the division, the patient's practitioner, or a third party insurance payor upon request.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-72-601 Acupuncture license not authorizing medical practice -- Insurance payments.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Nothing in this chapter may be construed to permit the practice of medicine nor require direct payment from third party insurers directly to a person engaged in the practice of acupuncture.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-72-701 Procurement and administration authority.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-72-701(1): 58-72-102(2)(a); (b); 58-72-102(2) A licensee who has received the necessary training to practice injection therapy, including having obtained a clean needle technique certificate from the National Commission for the Certification of Acupuncture and Oriental Medicine (NCCAOM):
Utah Code Annotated § 58-72-701(1)(a): 58-72-102(2)(a); (b) has authority to procure and administer prescriptive substances described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-72-701(1)(b): 58-72-102(2) may obtain substances described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-72-701(2): An entity that provides any substance to a licensee in accordance with this chapter, and relies in good faith on license information provided by the licensee, is not liable for providing the substance.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 73 - Chiropractic Physician Practice Act
*********************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Chiropractic Physician Practice Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(1): "Adjustment of the articulation of the spinal column" means performance by a chiropractic physician by the use of passive movements directed toward the goal of restoring joints to their proper physiological relationship of motion and related function, releasing adhesions, or stimulating joint receptors using one or more of the following techniques:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(1)(a): impulse adjusting or the use of sudden, high velocity, short amplitude thrust of a nature that the patient cannot prevent the motion, commencing where the motion encounters the elastic barrier of resistance and ends at the limit of anatomical integrity;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(1)(b): instrument adjusting, utilizing instruments specifically designed to deliver sudden, high velocity, short amplitude thrust;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(1)(c): light force adjusting utilizing sustained joint traction or applied directional pressure, or both, which may be combined with passive motion to restore joint mobility; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(1)(d): long distance lever adjusting utilizing forces delivered at some distance from the dysfunctional site and aimed at transmission through connected structures to accomplish joint mobility.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(2): 58-73-201 "Board" means the Chiropractic Physician Licensing Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(3): "Chiropractic assistant" means an individual who performs activities related to the practice of chiropractic under the supervision of a licensed chiropractic physician in accordance with division rule established in collaboration with the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(4): "Chiropractic physician" means an individual who has been licensed under this chapter to practice chiropractic.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(5): "Diagnosis of the articulation of the spinal column" means to examine the articulations of the spinal column of another human to determine the source, nature, kind, or extent of a disease, vertebral subluxation, or other physical condition, and to make a determination of the source, nature, kind, or extent of a disease or other physical condition.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(6): "Elastic barrier" means the point at which the patient cannot move a joint by his own means and through which movement is obtained or caused by a practitioner's skillful treatment using the practitioner's hands in a manipulation of a joint by thrust of sudden, high velocity, short amplitude so the patient cannot prevent the motion.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(7): "Incisive surgery" means any procedure having the power or quality of cutting of a patient for the purpose of treating disease, injury, or deformity, and includes the use of laser.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(8): "Manipulate the articulation of the spinal column" means use by a practitioner of a skillful treatment using the practitioner's hands in a manipulation of a joint as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(8)(a): by thrust of sudden, high velocity, short amplitude so the patient cannot prevent the motion;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(8)(b): the movement of the joint is by force beyond its active limit of motion;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(8)(c): the manipulation commences where mobilization ends and specifically begins when the elastic barrier of resistance is encountered and ends at the limit of anatomical integrity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(8)(d): the manipulation is directed to the goal of restoring joints to their proper physiological relationship of motion and related function, releasing adhesions, or stimulating joint receptors.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(9): 58-73-601; (9); 58-28-307(12) "Practice of chiropractic" means a practice of a branch of the healing arts:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(9)(a): the purpose of which is to restore or maintain human health, in which patient care or first aid, hygienic, nutritional, or rehabilitative procedures are administered;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(9)(b): which places emphasis upon specific vertebral adjustment, manipulation, and treatment of the articulation and adjacent tissues of the spinal column, musculoskeletal structure of the body, and nervous system;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(9)(c): 58-73-601 that involves examining, diagnosing, treating, correcting, or prescribing treatment for any human disease, ailment, injury, infirmity, deformity, pain, or other condition, or the attempt to do so, in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(9)(d): that involves diagnosing, prescribing treatment, or making a determination of treatment necessity for another person's condition by means of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(9)(d)(i): a physical examination of the person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(9)(d)(ii): a determination based upon or derived from information supplied directly or indirectly by a third person; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(9)(e): (9); 58-28-307(12) that includes the practice described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(9)(e)(i): 58-28-307(12) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(9)(e)(ii): the provisions of this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(9)(e)(iii): division rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-102(10): "Therapeutically position the articulation of the spinal column" means to adjust or manipulate the articulation of the spinal column.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-201 Board.
--------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-201(1): There is created the Chiropractic Physician Licensing Board consisting of four chiropractic physicians and one member from the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-201(2): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed and serve in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-201(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203 The duties and responsibilities of the board are in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-201(3)(a): assist the division in reviewing complaints concerning the unlawful or unprofessional conduct of a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-201(3)(b): advise the division in its investigation of these complaints.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-201(4): (3) A board member who has, under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-301 Licensure required -- License classifications.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-301(1): 58-73-304 A license is required to engage in the practice of chiropractic, except as specifically provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-301(2): The division shall issue to a person who qualifies under this chapter a license in the classification of chiropractic physician.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302 Qualifications for licensure.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(1): 63J-1-504 Each applicant for licensure as a chiropractic physician, other than those applying for a license based on licensure as a chiropractor or chiropractic physician in another jurisdiction, shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(1)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(1)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(1)(c): demonstrate satisfactory completion of at least two years of general study in a college or university;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(1)(d): demonstrate having earned a degree of doctor of chiropractic from a chiropractic college or university that at the time the degree was conferred was accredited by the Council on Chiropractic Education, Inc., or an equivalent chiropractic accrediting body recognized by the United States Department of Education and by the division rule made in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(1)(e): demonstrate successful completion of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(1)(e)(i): the National Chiropractic Boards:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(1)(e)(i)(A): Parts I and II;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(1)(e)(i)(B): Written Clinical Competency Examination; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(1)(e)(i)(C): Physiotherapy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(1)(e)(ii): the Utah Chiropractic Law and Rules Examination; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(1)(e)(iii): a practical examination approved by the division in collaboration with the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(1)(f): meet with the board, if requested, for the purpose of reviewing the applicant's qualifications for licensure.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(2): 63J-1-504 Each applicant for licensure as a chiropractic physician based on licensure as a chiropractor or chiropractic physician in another jurisdiction shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(2)(a): submit an application in the form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(2)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(2)(c): demonstrate having obtained licensure as a chiropractor or chiropractic physician in another state under education requirements which were equivalent to the education requirements in this state to obtain a chiropractor or chiropractic physician license at the time the applicant obtained the license in the other state;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(2)(d): demonstrate successful completion of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(2)(d)(i): the Utah Chiropractic Law and Rules Examination; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(2)(d)(ii): the Special Purposes Examination for Chiropractic (SPEC) of the National Board of Chiropractic Examiners;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(2)(e): have been actively engaged in the practice of chiropractic for not less than two years immediately preceding application for licensure in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-302(2)(f): meet with the board, if requested, for the purpose of reviewing the applicant's qualifications for licensure.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-303 Terms of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-303(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-303(1)(a): The division shall issue each license under this chapter in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-303(1)(b): The division may by rule extend or shorten a renewal period by as much as one year to stagger the renewal cycles it administers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-303(2): At the time of renewal, the licensee shall show satisfactory evidence of completion of continuing education as defined by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-303(3): 58-1-308 Each license expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless the licensee renews it in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-304 Exemptions from licensure.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-304(1): (2); 58-1-307 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-304(2): 58-1-307(1)(b); (c) With regard to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-304(2)(a): performing the duties and activities which are part of the approved program of education and training of a college or university accredited by the Council on Chiropractic Education; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-304(2)(b): under a form of supervision approved by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-304(3): (1); (2) In addition to the exemptions provided in Subsections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings -- Limitation on division actions.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(1): 58-1-401 Grounds for the following are in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(1)(a): refusing to issue a license to an applicant;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(1)(b): refusing to renew the license of a licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(1)(c): revoking, suspending, restricting, or placing on probation the license of a licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(1)(d): issuing a public or private reprimand to a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(1)(e): issuing a cease and desist order.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(2): If a court of competent jurisdiction determines a chiropractic physician is incompetent, mentally incompetent, incapable, or has a mental illness, the director shall suspend the license of that chiropractic physician, even if an appeal is pending.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(3): (3)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(3)(a): If it appears to the board there is reasonable cause to believe a chiropractic physician who has not been judicially determined to be incompetent, mentally incompetent, incapable, or to have a mental illness, is unable to practice chiropractic with reasonable skill and safety to patients by reason of illness, drunkenness, excessive use of drugs, narcotics, chemicals, or any other substance, or as a result of any mental or physical condition, a petition shall be served upon that chiropractic physician for a hearing on the sole issue of the capacity of the chiropractic physician to conduct properly the practice of the chiropractic physician.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(3)(b): Every chiropractic physician licensed by this state is considered to have:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(3)(b)(i): agreed to submit to a mental or physical examination upon receipt of a written direction given by the division with the approval of the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(3)(b)(ii): waived all objections to the admissibility of the examining chiropractic physician's or other practitioner's testimony or examination reports on the ground they constitute a privileged communication.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(3)(c): (3)(b) Failure of a chiropractic physician to submit to an examination under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(3)(d): A chiropractic physician whose license is suspended under this section shall, at reasonable intervals, be afforded the opportunity to demonstrate the chiropractic physician can resume the competent practice of chiropractic with reasonable skill and safety to patients.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(3)(e): Neither the proceedings of the board nor the action taken by it under this section may be used against a chiropractic physician in any other proceedings.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(4): The terms of revocation, suspension, or probation under this chapter may include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(4)(a): revoking the license to practice either permanently or with a stated date before which the individual may not apply for licensure;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(4)(b): suspending, limiting, or restricting the license to practice chiropractic for up to five years, including limiting the practice of the person to, or excluding from the person's practice, one or more specific branches of medicine, including any limitation on practice within the specified branches;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(4)(c): requiring the license holder to submit to care, counseling, or treatment by physicians approved by or designated by the board, as a condition for licensure;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(4)(d): requiring the license holder to participate in a program of education prescribed by the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(4)(e): requiring the license holder to practice under the direction of a physician designated by the board for a specified period of time; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-401(4)(f): other appropriate terms and conditions determined by the division in collaboration with the board to be necessary to protect the public health, safety, or welfare.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-501 Unprofessional conduct.
-------------------------------------------------------
Unprofessional conduct is as defined in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-73-501(1): engaging in practice as a chiropractic physician after electing to place his license on inactive status, without having established with the board that he has initiated or completed continuing education necessary to reinstate active status of his license;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-501(2): failing to complete required continuing professional education;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-501(3): 58-73-601 violating any of the scope of practice standards set forth in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-501(4): failing to maintain patient records in sufficient detail to clearly substantiate a diagnosis, all treatment rendered to the patient in accordance with the recognized standard of chiropractic care, and fees charged for professional services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-501(5): refusing to divulge to the division on demand the means, methods, device, or instrumentality used in the treatment of a disease, injury, ailment, or infirmity, unless that information is protected by the physician-patient privilege of Utah and the patient has not waived that privilege;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-501(6): refusing the division or the division's employees access to his office, instruments, laboratory equipment, appliances, or supplies at reasonable times for purposes of inspection;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-501(7): fraudulently representing that curable disease, sickness, or injury can be cured in a stated time, or knowingly making any false statement in connection with the practice of chiropractic;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-501(8): offering, undertaking, or agreeing to cure or treat a disease, injury, ailment, or infirmity by a secret means, method, device, or instrumentality;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-501(9): willfully and intentionally making any false statement or entry in any chiropractic office records or other chiropractic records or reports;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-501(10): knowingly engaging in billing practices which are abusive and represent charges which are fraudulent or grossly excessive for services rendered;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-501(11): performing, procuring, or agreeing to procure or perform, or advising, aiding in or abetting, or offering or attempting to procure or aid or abet in the procuring of a criminal abortion;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-501(12): willfully betraying or disclosing a professional confidence or violation of a privileged communication, except:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-501(12)(a): as required by law; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-501(12)(b): to assist the division by fully and freely exchanging information concerning applicants or licensees with the licensing or disciplinary boards of other states or foreign countries, the Utah chiropractic associations, their component societies, or chiropractic societies of other states, countries, districts, territories, or foreign countries;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-501(13): directly or indirectly giving or receiving any fee, commission, rebate, or other compensation for professional services not actually rendered or supervised, but this subsection does not preclude the legal relationships within lawful professional partnerships, corporations, or associations;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-501(14): knowingly failing to transfer a copy of pertinent and necessary medical records or a summary of them to another physician when requested to do so by the subject patient or his designated representative;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-501(15): (1); (14); 58-1-501(1) making a false entry in, or altering, a medical record with the intent to conceal:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-501(15)(a): a wrongful or negligent act or omission of an individual licensed under this chapter or an individual under the direction or control of an individual licensed under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-501(15)(b): (1); (14); 58-1-501(1) conduct described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-501(16): sharing professional fees with a person who is not licensed under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-501(17): paying a person for a patient referral.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-502 Unlawful conduct -- Penalties.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-502(1): 58-1-501 "Unlawful conduct" includes, in addition to the definition in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-502(1)(a): buying, selling, or fraudulently obtaining any chiropractic diploma, license, certificate, or registration;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-502(1)(b): aiding or abetting the buying, selling, or fraudulently obtaining of any chiropractic diploma, license, certificate, or registration; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-502(1)(c): substantially interfering with a licensee's lawful and competent practice of chiropractic in accordance with this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-502(2): (1) Any person who violates any provision of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601 Scope of practice for a chiropractic physician.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(1): 58-73-102 A chiropractic physician licensed under this chapter may engage in the practice of chiropractic as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2): (2) A chiropractic physician may:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(a): (2) examine, diagnose, and treat only within the scope of chiropractic as described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(b)(i): use x-ray for diagnostic purposes only; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(b)(ii): order, for diagnostic purposes only:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(b)(ii)(A): ultrasound;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(b)(ii)(B): magnetic resonance imaging; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(b)(ii)(C): computerized tomography;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(c): administer:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(c)(i): physical agents, including light, heat, cold, water, air, sound, compression, electricity, and electromagnetic radiation except gamma radiation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(c)(ii): physical activities and devices, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(c)(ii)(A): exercise with and without devices;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(c)(ii)(B): joint mobilization;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(c)(ii)(C): mechanical stimulation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(c)(ii)(D): postural drainage;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(c)(ii)(E): traction;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(c)(ii)(F): positioning;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(c)(ii)(G): wound debridement, cleansing, and dressing changes;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(c)(ii)(H): splinting;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(c)(ii)(I): training in locomotion and other functional activities with and without assistance devices; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(c)(ii)(J): correction of posture, body mechanics, and gait;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(d): administer the following topically applied medicinal agents, including steroids, anesthetics, coolants, and analgesics for wound care and for musculoskeletal treatment, including their use by iontophoresis or phonophoresis;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(e): treat pain incident to major or minor surgery, cancer, obstetrics, or x-ray therapy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(f): utilize immobilizing appliances, casts, and supports for support purposes, but may not set displaced bone fractures;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(g): inform the patient of possible side effects of medication and recommend referral to the prescribing practitioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(h): provide instruction in the use of physical measures, activities, and devices for preventive and therapeutic purposes;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(i): provide consulting, educational, and other advisory services for the purposes of reducing the incidence and severity of physical disability, movement dysfunctions, bodily malfunction, and pain;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(j): treat a human being to assess, prevent, correct, alleviate, and limit physical disability, movement dysfunction, bodily malfunction, and pain resulting from disorders, congenital and aging conditions, injury, and disease; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(2)(k): administer, interpret, and evaluate tests.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(3): (2)(d) A chiropractic physician may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(3)(a): perform incisive surgery;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(3)(b): (2)(d) administer drugs or medicines for which an authorized prescription is required by law except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(3)(c): treat cancer;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(3)(d): practice obstetrics;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(3)(e): prescribe or administer x-ray therapy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(3)(f): set displaced fractures.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(4): A chiropractic physician shall assume responsibility for his examinations, diagnoses, and treatment.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(5): (2)(d); Title 58, Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act; Title 58, Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act Nothing in this section authorizes a chiropractic physician to prescribe, possess for dispensing, dispense, purchase without a prescription written by a licensed and authorized practitioner, or administer, except under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-601(6): Only primary health care providers licensed under this title as osteopathic physicians, physicians and surgeons, naturopaths, and chiropractic physicians, may diagnose, adjust, manipulate, or therapeutically position the articulation of the spinal column to the extent permitted by their scopes of practice.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-602 Division regulation -- Quality of care -- Complaints.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-602(1): To enable the division and the board to license applicants for licensure and regulate individuals licensed under this chapter, the division and board shall endeavor to obtain information concerning the quality and adequacy of chiropractic care rendered to patients.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-602(2): Chiropractic physicians licensed under this chapter shall furnish information requested by the division on recommendation of the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-602(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-602(3)(a): The board shall designate committees composed of chiropractic physicians licensed by this state to advise the division and the board regarding the quality and adequacy of chiropractic care rendered to patients by chiropractic physicians licensed under this chapter and to recommend the division initiate investigations on chiropractic physicians who may be acting in violation of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-602(3)(b): If it appears to the committee there is reasonable cause to believe that a chiropractic physician licensed under this chapter has failed to provide adequate chiropractic care to patients, a complaint shall be made to the division outlining the statement of reasonable cause.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-603 Consumer access to provider charges.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Beginning January 1, 2011, a chiropractic physician licensed under this chapter shall, when requested by a consumer:Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-603(1): make a list of professional charges available for the consumer which includes the chiropractic physician's 25 most frequently performed:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-603(1)(a): clinical procedures or clinical services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-603(1)(b): out-patient procedures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-603(1)(c): in-patient procedures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-603(2): provide the consumer with information regarding any discount available for:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-603(2)(a): services not covered by insurance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-603(2)(b): prompt payment of billed charges.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-701 Persons immune from liability.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-701(1): Employees of the division, members of the board or its committees, and professional consultants serving the division or the board, are not subject to civil damages, when acting under the authority of this chapter for any act or omission performed in good faith within the scope of their functions as an employee of the division or member of the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-701(2): Employees, board members, committee members, and professional consultants are indemnified by the state.  The state has full responsibility for providing legal and financial protection for employees, board members, committee members, and consultants to the board or division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-73-701(3): Title 63G, Chapter 7, Governmental Immunity Act of Utah Nothing in this section may be construed to adversely limit any provision of


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 74 - State Certification of Court Reporters Act
****************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "State Certification of Court Reporters Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-74-102(1): "Practice of court reporting" means the making of a verbatim record, by stenography or voice writing, of any trial, legislative public hearing, state agency public hearing, deposition, examination before trial, hearing or proceeding before any grand jury, referee, board, commission, master or arbitrator, or other sworn testimony given under oath.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-102(2): "State certified court reporter" means a person who engages in the practice of court reporting and has met the requirements for state certification as a state certified court reporter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-102(3): 58-1-501; 58-74-501 "Unlawful conduct" means the same as that term is defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-102(4): 58-1-501; 58-74-502 "Unprofessional conduct" means the same as that term is defined in Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-301 State certification required.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-301(1): State certification as a state certified court reporter is required to engage in the practice of court reporting.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-301(2): The division shall grant state certification as a state certified court reporter to any person who meets the requirements described in this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-302 Qualifications for state certification.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-302(1): 63J-1-504 Each applicant for state certification as a state certified court reporter under this chapter shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-302(1)(a): be at least 18 years of age;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-302(1)(b): be a citizen of the United States and a resident of the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-302(1)(c): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-302(1)(d): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-302(1)(e): possess a high degree of skill and ability in the art of court reporting; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-302(1)(f): submit evidence that the applicant has completed and passed the Registered Professional Reporter Examination of the National Court Reporters Association or the Certified Verbatim Reporter Examination of the National Verbatim Reporters Association.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-302(2): A person granted a certificate to practice as a state certified court reporter may use the abbreviation "C.C.R." or "C.V.R." as long as the person's certificate is current and valid.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-303 Term of state certification -- Expiration -- Renewal.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-303(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-303(1)(a): The division shall issue each state certification under this chapter in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-303(1)(b): The division may by rule extend or shorten a renewal cycle by as much as one year to stagger the renewal cycles it administers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-303(2): Each applicant shall, at the time of applying for renewal, demonstrate compliance with continuing education requirements established by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-303(3): 58-1-308 Each state certification automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the state certification unless the applicant renews it in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-401 Grounds for denial of state certification -- Disciplinary proceedings.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for refusing to issue a state certification to an applicant, for refusing to renew the state certification of an applicant, for revoking, suspending, restricting, or placing on probation the state certification of a state certified court reporter, for issuing a public or private reprimand to a state certified court reporter, and for issuing a cease and desist order shall be in accordance with Sections

Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-501 Unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-501(1): It is unlawful for any person who does not have state certification in accordance with this chapter to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-501(1)(a): assume the title state certified court reporter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-501(1)(b): assume the title or use the abbreviation C.C.R. or C.V.R. or any other similar words, letters, figures, or abbreviation to indicate that the person using that title or abbreviation is a state certified court reporter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-501(2): Violation of this provision is a class A misdemeanor.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-502 Unprofessional conduct.
-------------------------------------------------------
"Unprofessional conduct" includes:Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-502(1): conduct unbecoming a state certified court reporter or which is detrimental to the interests of the public;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-502(2): willful or negligent betrayal or disclosure of confidential information about which a state certified court reporter becomes knowledgeable as a result of or incidental to the person's practice as a state certified court reporter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-502(3): false or deceptive representation of a a state certified court reporter's skills, competence, capability, or resources as a state certified court reporter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-502(4): offering, undertaking, or agreeing to undertake an assignment as a state certified court reporter for which the state certified court reporter is not qualified, cannot complete the assignment in a timely manner, or does not have the resources to complete the assignment as agreed in a professional manner;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-502(5): the use of any chemical, drug, or alcohol in any unlawful manner or in any manner which negatively affects the ability of a state certified court reporter to competently practice as a state certified court reporter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-502(6): willfully and intentionally making any false or fraudulent record in the performance of a state certified court reporter's duties as a state certified court reporter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-502(7): any conduct contrary to the recognized standards and ethics of the profession of a state certified court reporter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-502(8): gross incompetence in practice as a state certified court reporter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-502(9): 78A-2-404 violation of any provision of this chapter, Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-502(10): conviction of a felony or any other crime which is considered by the division to represent activity detrimental to the public interest as that interest is reflected in a state certified court reporter continuing to practice as a state certified court reporter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-74-502(11): attesting to or "signing off" on the transcript of any recorded proceeding unless that proceeding was recorded by that person while physically present at the proceeding or was personally transcribed by that person from an electronically recorded process.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 75 - Genetic Counselors Licensing Act
******************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-75-102(1): "Genetic counselor" means a person licensed under this chapter to engage in the practice of genetic counseling.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-102(2): "Practice of genetic counseling" means the communication process which deals with the human problems associated with the occurrence, or the risk of occurrence, of a genetic disorder in a family, including the provision of services to help an individual or family:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-102(2)(a): comprehend the medical facts, including the diagnosis, probable cause of the disorder, and the available management;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-102(2)(b): appreciate the way heredity contributes to the disorder and the risk of occurrence in specified relatives;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-102(2)(c): understand the alternatives for dealing with the risk of occurrence;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-102(2)(d): choose the course of action which seems appropriate to them in view of their risk, their family goals, and their ethical and religious standards, and to act in accordance with that decision; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-102(2)(e): make the best possible psychosocial adjustment to the disorder in an affected family member or to the risk of occurrence of that disorder.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-102(3): 58-1-501; 58-75-501 "Unlawful conduct" is as defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-102(4): 58-1-501; 58-75-502; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Unprofessional conduct" is as defined in Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-301 Licensure required -- Issuance of licenses -- Effect on insurers.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-301(1): 58-1-307; 58-75-304 Beginning January 1, 2002, and except as provided in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-301(2): The division shall issue to any person who qualifies under this chapter a license to practice genetic counseling.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-301(3): Nothing in this chapter shall be construed to require payment from insurers for genetic counseling services.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-302 Qualifications for licensure -- Temporary license.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-302(1): (2); 63J-1-504 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-302(1)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-302(1)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-302(1)(c): provide satisfactory documentation of having earned:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-302(1)(c)(i): a master's degree from a genetic counseling training program that is accredited by the American Board of Genetic Counseling or an equivalent as determined by the division; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-302(1)(c)(ii): a doctoral degree from a medical genetics training program that is accredited by the American Board of Medical Genetics or an equivalent as determined by the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-302(1)(d): meet the examination requirement for certification as:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-302(1)(d)(i): a genetic counselor by the American Board of Genetic Counseling or the American Board of Medical Genetics; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-302(1)(d)(ii): a medical geneticist by the American Board of Medical Genetics.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-302(2): 58-1-303; (1)(d) The division may issue a temporary license, in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-303 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-303(1): The division shall issue each license under this chapter in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.  The division may by rule extend or shorten a renewal cycle by as much as one year to stagger the renewal cycles it administers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-303(2): Each licensee shall, at the time of applying for renewal, demonstrate compliance with continuing education requirements established by rule by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-303(3): 58-1-308 Each license automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless the licensee renews it in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-304 Exemptions from licensure.
----------------------------------------------------------
In addition to the exemptions from licensure set forth in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-75-304(1): Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act an individual licensed as a physician and surgeon or osteopathic physician and surgeon under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-304(2): a commissioned physician or surgeon serving in the armed forces of the United States or other federal agency; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-304(3): Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act an individual licensed as a physician assistant under


Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-401 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for refusing to issue a license to an applicant, for refusing to renew the license of a licensee, for revoking, suspending, restricting, or placing on probation the license of a licensee, for issuing a public or private reprimand to a licensee, and for issuing a cease and desist order shall be in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-501 Unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------
"Unlawful conduct" includes, in addition to the definition in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-502 Unprofessional conduct.
-------------------------------------------------------
"Unprofessional conduct" includes, in addition to the definition in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-75-502(1): engaging in any act or practice in a professional capacity which the licensee is not competent to perform through training or experience;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-502(2): failing to refer a client to other competent professionals when the licensee is unable or unwilling to adequately support or serve the client;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-502(3): failing to maintain the confidentiality of any information received from a client, unless released by the client or otherwise authorized or required by law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-75-502(4): exploiting a client for personal advantage, profit, or interest.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 76 - Professional Geologist Licensing Act
**********************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Professional Geologist Licensing Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-76-102(1): 58-76-201 "Board" means the Professional Geologist Licensing Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-102(2): "Geology" means the science, which treats the study of the earth in general, the earth's processes and history, investigation of the earth's crust and the rocks and other materials of which it is composed, and the applied science of utilizing knowledge of the earth's history, processes, constituent rocks, minerals, liquids, gases, and other materials for the use of mankind.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-102(3): "Practice of geology before the public" means the performance of geology including but not limited to consultation, investigation, evaluation, planning, geologic mapping, interpretation of geologic data, preparation of geologic reports, geologic cross-sections and geologic maps, inspection of geological work, and the responsible supervision thereof, the performance of which is relevant to public welfare or the safeguarding of life, health, property, and the environment, except as otherwise specifically provided by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-102(4): "Professional geologist" means a person licensed under this chapter to engage in the practice of geology before the public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-102(5): "Responsible charge" means the independent control and direction by use of initiative, skill, and independent judgment of geological work or the supervision of the work.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-102(6): "Subordinate" means any individual who practices geology or assists a professional geologist in the practice of geology before the public without assuming the responsible charge for the work.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-102(7): 58-1-501; 58-76-501 "Unlawful conduct" is as defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-102(8): 58-1-501 "Unprofessional conduct" is as defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-103 Professional Geologist Education and Enforcement Account.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-103(1): There is created a restricted account within the General Fund known as the "Professional Geologist Education and Enforcement Account."
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-103(2): 63J-1-504 The restricted account shall consist of money from:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-103(2)(a): 63J-1-504 a surcharge fee established by the department in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-103(2)(b): administrative penalties collected pursuant to this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-103(2)(c): interest earned on money in the account.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-103(3): Money in the account may be appropriated by the Legislature for the following purposes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-103(3)(a): education and training of licensees under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-103(3)(b): education and training of the public or other interested persons in matters concerning geology laws and practices;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-103(3)(c): enforcement of this chapter by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-103(3)(c)(i): investigating unprofessional or unlawful conduct;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-103(3)(c)(ii): providing legal representation to the division when legal action is taken against a person engaging in unprofessional or unlawful conduct; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-103(3)(c)(iii): monitoring compliance of renewal requirements; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-103(3)(d): education and training of board members.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-201 Board.
--------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-201(1): There is created the Professional Geologist Licensing Board consisting of five members as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-201(1)(a): three professional geologists;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-201(1)(b): the Utah state geologist; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-201(1)(c): one member representing the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-201(2): 58-1-201 Except for the Utah state geologist, the board shall be appointed and serve in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-201(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203 The duties and responsibilities of the board are in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-201(3)(a): designate one of its members on a permanent or rotating basis to assist the division in reviewing complaints concerning the unlawful or unprofessional conduct of professional geologists; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-201(3)(b): advise the division in its investigation of these complaints.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-201(4): (3) A board member who has, under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-301 License required -- License classification.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-301(1): 58-1-307; 58-76-304 After January 1, 2003, a license is required to engage in the practice of geology before the public except as specifically provided in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-301(2): The division shall issue to a person who qualifies under the provisions of this chapter a license in the classification of professional geologist.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-302 Qualifications for licensure.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Each applicant for licensure as a professional geologist shall:Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-302(1): submit an application in a form as prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-302(2): 63J-1-504 pay a fee as determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-302(3): provide satisfactory evidence of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-302(3)(a): a bachelors or graduate degree in the geosciences granted through an institution of higher education that is accredited by a regional or national accrediting agency with a minimum of 30 semester or 45 quarter hours of course work in the geosciences; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-302(3)(b): completion of other equivalent educational requirements as determined by the division in collaboration with the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-302(4): provide satisfactory evidence of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-302(4)(a): with a bachelors degree, a specific record of five years of active professional practice in geological work of a character satisfactory to the division, indicating the applicant is competent to be placed in a responsible charge of the work;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-302(4)(b): with a masters degree, a specific record of three years of active professional practice in geological work of a character satisfactory to the division, indicating the applicant is competent to be placed in a responsible charge of the work; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-302(4)(c): with a doctorate degree, a specific record of one year of active professional practice in geological work of a character satisfactory to the division, indicating the applicant is competent to be placed in a responsible charge of the work; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-302(5): after January 1, 2004, meet the examination requirement established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-303 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-303(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-303(1)(a): Each license issued under this chapter shall be issued in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-303(1)(b): A renewal period may be extended or shortened by as much as one year to maintain established renewal cycles or to change an established renewal cycle.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-303(2): 58-1-308 Each license automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless renewed by the licensee in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-304 Exemption from licensure.
---------------------------------------------------------
In addition to the exemptions from licensure in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-76-304(1): (1); (2) an employee or subordinate of a professional geologist licensed under this chapter, or any employee of an individual exempted from licensure under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-304(2): Title 58, Chapter 22, Professional Engineers and Professional Land Surveyors Licensing Act qualified engineers and land surveyors, licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-304(3): an individual, individual practitioner, or regular full-time employee of a firm, partnership, association, corporation, or other business entity engaged in the exploration for and development of coal, uranium, oil, natural gas, geothermal or other energy resources, precious and nonprecious metals and minerals, and industrial and other minerals, including sand, gravel, and aggregate if the geological work is performed solely for internal use within the company and is not offered directly to the public;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-304(4): an individual engaged in teaching or research in the physical or natural sciences who is not otherwise engaged in practicing geology before the public;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-304(5): an individual providing agricultural or agronomic soils analyses, sampling, or laboratory testing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-304(6): an employee of a communications, utility, railroad, mining, petroleum, or manufacturing company, or an affiliate of such a company, if the geological work is performed solely for internal use within the company and is not offered directly to the public.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-401 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Division grounds for refusal to issue a license to an applicant, for refusal to renew the license of a licensee, to revoke, suspend, restrict, or place on probation the license of a licensee, to issue a public or private reprimand to a licensee, and to issue cease and desist orders are in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-501 Unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------
In addition to the definition in SubsectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-76-501(1): using the title "Professional Geologist" or any other words, letters, abbreviations, or designations, which represent recognized professional geological disciplines indicating that the person using them is a professional geologist, unless the person holds a valid license issued under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-501(2): as a corporation, proprietorship, partnership, or limited liability company, engaging in or representing that the entity is engaging in the practice of geology before the public, unless at least one individual employee of the entity holds a valid license issued under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502 Penalty for unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(1): 58-76-501; 58-76-501; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-76-501; 58-76-501; (1); 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-76-501; 58-76-401; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; (1)(a); (1)(a); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(1)(a): 58-76-501; 58-76-501; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-76-501; 58-76-501; (1); 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-76-501; 58-76-401 If, upon inspection or investigation, the division concludes that a person has violated Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(1)(a)(i): 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-76-501; 58-76-501; (1); 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-76-501 A person who violates Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(1)(a)(ii): 58-76-401 Except for a cease and desist order, the licensure sanctions cited in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(1)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act A citation shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(1)(b)(i): be in writing;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(1)(b)(ii): describe with particularity the nature of the violation, including a reference to the provision of the chapter, rule, or order alleged to have been violated;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(1)(b)(iii): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act clearly state that the recipient must notify the division in writing within 20 calendar days of service of the citation if the recipient wishes to contest the citation at a hearing conducted under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(1)(b)(iv): clearly explain the consequences of failure to timely contest the citation or to make payment of any fines assessed by the citation within the time specified in the citation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(1)(c): The division may issue a notice in lieu of a citation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(1)(d): Each citation issued under this section, or a copy of each citation, may be served upon any person upon whom a summons may be served in accordance with the Utah Rules of Civil Procedure and may be made personally or upon the person's agent by a division investigator or by any person specially designated by the director or by mail.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(1)(e): If within 20 calendar days from the service of the citation, the person to whom the citation was issued fails to request a hearing to contest the citation, the citation becomes the final order of the division and is not subject to further agency review.  The period to contest a citation may be extended by the division for cause.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(1)(f): The division may refuse to issue or renew, suspend, revoke, or place on probation the license of a licensee who fails to comply with a citation after it becomes final.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(1)(g): The failure of an applicant for licensure to comply with a citation after it becomes final is a ground for denial of license.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(1)(h): No citation may be issued under this section after the expiration of one year following the date on which the violation that is the subject of the citation is reported to the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(1)(i): (1)(a); (1)(a); (1)(a) The director or the director's designee shall assess fines according to the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(1)(i)(i): (1)(a) for a first offense handled pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(1)(i)(ii): (1)(a) for a second offense handled pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(1)(i)(iii): (1)(a) for any subsequent offense handled pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(2): An action initiated for a first or second offense which has not yet resulted in a final order of the division shall not preclude initiation of any subsequent action for a second or subsequent offense during the pendency of any preceding action.  The final order on a subsequent action shall be considered a second or subsequent offense, respectively, provided the preceding action resulted in a first or second offense, respectively.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(3)(a): The director may collect a penalty that is not paid by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(3)(a)(i): referring the matter to a collection agency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(3)(a)(ii): bringing an action in the district court of the county where the person against whom the penalty is imposed resides or in the county where the office of the director is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(3)(b): A county attorney or the attorney general of the state shall provide legal assistance and advice to the director in an action to collect a penalty.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-502(3)(c): A court shall award reasonable attorney fees and costs to the prevailing party in an action brought by the division to collect a penalty.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-601 Seal -- Design and implementation.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Every professional geologist shall have a seal, the design and implementation of which shall be established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-602 Geologic maps, cross-sections, reports, and documents to be sealed.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-602(1): 58-76-304 Any final geologic map, cross-section, or report prepared in this state shall bear the seal of a professional geologist licensed under this chapter, except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-602(2): 58-76-304 Any final geologic map, cross-section, sketch, drawing, plan, or report prepared by, or under the supervision of, a professional geologist shall bear the seal of the professional geologist when submitted to a client or when filed with public authorities, even if the practice is exempt from licensure under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-603 Seal -- Authorized use.
-------------------------------------------------------
A professional geologist may only affix the licensee's seal to a geologic map, cross-section, sketch, drawing, plan, or report if the geologic map, cross-section, sketch, drawing, plan, or report:Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-603(1): was personally prepared by the licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-603(2): was prepared by an employee, subordinate, associate, or drafter under the supervision of a licensee, provided the licensee or a principal affixing his seal assumes responsibility;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-603(3): was prepared by a licensed professional geologist in this state or any other state provided:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-603(3)(a): the licensee in this state affixing the seal performs a thorough review of all work for compliance with all applicable laws and rules and the standards of the profession; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-603(3)(b): makes any necessary corrections before submitting the final plan, specification, or report:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-603(3)(b)(i): to a public authority; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-603(3)(b)(ii): to a client who has contracted with a professional geologist for the geologic map, cross-section, or report to be complete and final;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-603(4): was prepared in part by a licensed professional geologist in this state or any other state provided:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-603(4)(a): the licensee in this state clearly identifies that portion of the geologic map, cross-section, or report for which the licensee is responsible;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-603(4)(b): the licensee in this state affixing the seal performs a thorough review of that portion of the geologic map, cross-section, or report for which the licensee is responsible for compliance with the standards of the profession; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-603(4)(c): makes any necessary corrections before submitting the final geologic map, cross-section, or report for which the licensee is responsible:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-603(4)(c)(i): to a public authority; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-603(4)(c)(ii): to a client who has contracted with a professional geologist for the geologic map, cross-section, or report to be complete and final;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-603(5): was prepared by a person exempt from licensure as a professional geologist provided that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-603(5)(a): the licensee in this state affixing the seal performs a thorough review for compliance with all applicable laws and rules and the standards of the profession; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-603(5)(b): makes any necessary corrections before submitting the final geologic map, cross-section, or report:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-603(5)(b)(i): to a public authority; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-603(5)(b)(ii): to a client who has contracted with a professional geologist for the geologic map, cross-section, or report to be complete and final; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-76-603(6): meets any additional requirements established by rule by the division in collaboration with the board.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 77 - Direct-Entry Midwife Act
**********************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Direct-entry Midwife Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(1): Title 58, Chapter 44a, Nurse Midwife Practice Act "Certified nurse-midwife" means a person licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(2): "Client" means a woman and her fetus or newborn baby under the care of a direct-entry midwife.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(3): "Direct-entry midwife" means an individual who is engaging in the practice of direct-entry midwifery.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(4): "Licensed direct-entry midwife" means a person licensed under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(5): "Low risk" means a labor and delivery and postpartum, newborn, and interconceptual care that does not include a condition that requires a mandatory transfer under administrative rules adopted by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(6): "Physician" means an individual licensed as a physician and surgeon, osteopathic physician, or naturopathic physician.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7): (7)(f); (7)(l) "Practice of direct-entry midwifery" means the practice of providing the necessary supervision, care, and advice to a client during essentially normal pregnancy, labor, delivery, postpartum, and newborn periods that is consistent with national professional midwifery standards and that is based upon the acquisition of clinical skills necessary for the care of a pregnant woman and a newborn baby, including antepartum, intrapartum, postpartum, newborn, and limited interconceptual care, and includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(a): obtaining an informed consent to provide services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(b): obtaining a health history, including a physical examination;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(c): developing a plan of care for a client;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(d): evaluating the results of client care;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(e): consulting and collaborating with and referring and transferring care to licensed health care professionals, as is appropriate, regarding the care of a client;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(f): (7)(f); (7)(l) obtaining medications, as specified in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(f)(i): prescription vitamins;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(f)(ii): Rho D immunoglobulin;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(f)(iii): sterile water;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(f)(iv): one dose of intramuscular oxytocin after the delivery of a baby to minimize a client's blood loss;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(f)(v): an additional single dose of oxytocin if a hemorrhage occurs, in which case the licensed direct-entry midwife must initiate transfer if a client's condition does not immediately improve;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(f)(vi): oxygen;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(f)(vii): (7)(l) local anesthetics without epinephrine used in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(f)(viii): vitamin K to prevent hemorrhagic disease of a newborn baby;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(f)(ix): as required by law, eye prophylaxis to prevent opthalmia neonatorum; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(f)(x): any other medication approved by a licensed health care provider with authority to prescribe that medication;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(g): obtaining food, food extracts, dietary supplements, as defined by the federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, homeopathic remedies, plant substances that are not designated as prescription drugs or controlled substances, and over-the-counter medications to administer to clients;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(h): obtaining and using appropriate equipment and devices such as a Doppler, a blood pressure cuff, phlebotomy supplies, instruments, and sutures;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(i): obtaining appropriate screening and testing, including laboratory tests, urinalysis, and ultrasound scans;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(j): managing the antepartum period;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(k): managing the intrapartum period, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(k)(i): monitoring and evaluating the condition of a mother and a fetus;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(k)(ii): performing an emergency episiotomy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(k)(iii): delivering a baby in any out-of-hospital setting;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(l): managing the postpartum period, including the suturing of an episiotomy and the suturing of first and second degree natural perineal and labial lacerations, including the administration of a local anesthetic;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(m): managing the newborn period, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(m)(i): providing care for a newborn baby, including performing a normal newborn baby examination; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(m)(ii): resuscitating a newborn baby;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(n): providing limited interconceptual services in order to provide continuity of care, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(n)(i): breastfeeding support and counseling;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(n)(ii): family planning, limited to natural family planning, cervical caps, and diaphragms; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(n)(iii): pap smears, where each client with an abnormal result is to be referred to an appropriate licensed health care provider; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(7)(o): executing the orders of a licensed health care professional, if the orders are within the education, knowledge, and skill of the direct-entry midwife.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(8): 58-1-501; 58-77-501 "Unlawful conduct" means the same as that term is defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-102(9): 58-1-501; 58-77-502 "Unprofessional conduct" means the same as that term is defined in Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-301 Licensure.
------------------------------------------
The division shall issue to a person who qualifies under this chapter a license as a licensed direct-entry midwife.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-302 Qualifications for licensure.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Each applicant for licensure as a licensed direct-entry midwife shall:Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-302(1): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-302(2): 63J-1-504 pay a fee as determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-302(3): hold a Certified Professional Midwife certificate in good standing with the North American Registry of Midwives or equivalent certification approved by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-302(4): hold current adult and infant CPR and newborn resuscitation certifications through an organization approved by the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-302(5): provide documentation of successful completion of an approved pharmacology course as defined by division rule.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-303 Term of license -- Expiration -- Renewal.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-303(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-303(1)(a): The division shall issue each license under this chapter in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-303(1)(b): The division may by rule extend or shorten a renewal period by as much as one year to stagger the renewal cycles it administers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-303(2): 58-1-308 Each license automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless the individual renews it in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-303(3): 58-77-302 At the time of renewal, the licensed direct-entry midwife shall be in current compliance with the requirements of Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-304 Parents' rights.
------------------------------------------------
Nothing in this chapter abridges, limits, or changes in any way the right of parents to deliver their baby where, when, how, and with whom they choose, regardless of licensure under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-401 Grounds for denial of license -- Disciplinary proceedings.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for refusing to issue a license to an applicant, for refusing to renew a license, for revoking, suspending, restricting, or placing on probation a license, for issuing a public or private reprimand, and for issuing a cease and desist order shall be in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-501 Unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-501(1): 58-1-501(1); (1)(c) In addition to the conduct that constitutes unlawful conduct under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-501(1)(a): represent or hold out that the individual is a licensed direct-entry midwife;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-501(1)(b): administer a prescription medication, except oxygen, in the practice of direct-entry midwifery;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-501(1)(c): before engaging in the practice of midwifery with a client, fail to obtain from the client an informed consent statement that includes the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-501(1)(c)(i): a description of the individual's midwifery education, training, continuing education, and experience;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-501(1)(c)(ii): a statement that the individual is not licensed by the state as a direct-entry midwife;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-501(1)(c)(iii): a statement that it is unlawful for the individual to administer to the client a prescription medication, except oxygen, in the practice of direct-entry midwifery;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-501(1)(c)(iv): a written plan to address medical issues the client may experience during pregnancy, labor, or childbirth, which plan shall address transfer of the client to a licensed health care provider or facility, if necessary;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-501(1)(c)(v): the name and signature of the individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-501(1)(c)(vi): the name and signature of the client;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-501(1)(c)(vii): the date the individual signed the statement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-501(1)(c)(viii): the date the client signed the statement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-501(1)(d): (1)(c) fail to retain for at least 4 years a signed statement from a client described by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-501(2): (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-501(2)(a): (1) Except for conduct that constitutes unlawful conduct under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-501(2)(b): The practice of direct-entry midwifery is not considered the practice of medicine, nursing, or nurse-midwifery.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-502 Unprofessional conduct.
-------------------------------------------------------
In addition to the definition in SubsectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-77-502(1): 58-77-601(1) failing to obtain informed consent as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-502(2): disregarding a client's dignity or right to privacy as to her person, condition, possessions, or medical record;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-502(3): failing to file or record any medical report as required by law, impeding, or obstructing the filing or recording of the report, or inducing another to fail to file or record the report;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-502(4): breaching a statutory, common law, regulatory, or ethical requirement of confidentiality with respect to a person who is a client, unless ordered by the court;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-502(5): inappropriately delegating direct-entry midwifery duties;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-502(6): using advertising or an identification statement that is false, misleading, or deceptive;
