Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-502(7): using in combination with the term "midwife" the term "nurse" or another title, initial, or designation that falsely implies that the direct-entry midwife is licensed as a certified nurse midwife, registered nurse, or licensed practical nurse; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-502(8): submitting a birth certificate known by the person to be false or fraudulent.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-503 Penalty for unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------------------
A person who violates the unlawful conduct provisions defined in this chapter is guilty of a class A misdemeanor.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601 Standards of practice.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(1)(a): Prior to providing any services, a licensed direct-entry midwife must obtain an informed consent from a client.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(1)(b): The consent must include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(1)(b)(i): the name and license number of the direct-entry midwife;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(1)(b)(ii): the client's name, address, telephone number, and primary care provider, if the client has one;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(1)(b)(iii): the fact, if true, that the licensed direct-entry midwife is not a certified nurse midwife or a physician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(1)(b)(iv): a description of the licensed direct-entry midwife's education, training, continuing education, and experience in midwifery;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(1)(b)(v): a description of the licensed direct-entry midwife's peer review process;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(1)(b)(vi): the licensed direct-entry midwife's philosophy of practice;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(1)(b)(vii): a promise to provide the client, upon request, separate documents describing the rules governing licensed direct-entry midwifery practice, including a list of conditions indicating the need for consultation, collaboration, referral, transfer or mandatory transfer, and the licensed direct-entry midwife's personal written practice guidelines;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(1)(b)(viii): a medical back-up or transfer plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(1)(b)(ix): a description of the services provided to the client by the licensed direct-entry midwife;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(1)(b)(x): the licensed direct-entry midwife's current legal status;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(1)(b)(xi): the availability of a grievance process;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(1)(b)(xii): client and licensed direct-entry midwife signatures and the date of signing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(1)(b)(xiii): whether the licensed direct-entry midwife is covered by a professional liability insurance policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(2): (2)(a)(ii); (2)(a)(i) A licensed direct-entry midwife shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(2)(a): (2)(a)(ii); (2)(a)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(2)(a)(i): (2)(a)(ii) limit the licensed direct-entry midwife's practice to a normal pregnancy, labor, postpartum, newborn and interconceptual care, which for purposes of this section means a normal labor:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(2)(a)(i)(A): that is not pharmacologically induced;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(2)(a)(i)(B): that is low risk at the start of labor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(2)(a)(i)(C): that remains low risk through out the course of labor and delivery;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(2)(a)(i)(D): in which the infant is born spontaneously in the vertex position between 37 and 43 completed weeks of pregnancy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(2)(a)(i)(E): (2)(a)(ii) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(2)(a)(ii): (2)(a)(i) the limitation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(2)(a)(ii)(A): intrauterine fetal demise; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(2)(a)(ii)(B): a fetal anomaly incompatible with life; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(2)(b): appropriately recommend and facilitate consultation with, collaboration with, referral to, or transfer or mandatory transfer of care to a licensed health care professional when the circumstances require that action in accordance with this section and standards established by division rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(3): If after a client has been informed that she has or may have a condition indicating the need for medical consultation, collaboration, referral, or transfer and the client chooses to decline, then the licensed direct-entry midwife shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(3)(a): terminate care in accordance with procedures established by division rule; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(3)(b): continue to provide care for the client if the client signs a waiver of medical consultation, collaboration, referral, or transfer.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(4): If after a client has been informed that she has or may have a condition indicating the need for mandatory transfer, the licensed direct-entry midwife shall, in accordance with procedures established by division rule, terminate the care or initiate transfer by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(4)(a): calling 911 and reporting the need for immediate transfer;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(4)(b): immediately transporting the client by private vehicle to the receiving provider; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(4)(c): contacting the physician to whom the client will be transferred and following that physician's orders.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(5): The standards for consultation and transfer are the minimum standards that a licensed direct-entry midwife must follow.  A licensed direct-entry midwife shall initiate consultation, collaboration, referral, or transfer of a patient sooner than required by administrative rule if in the opinion and experience of the licensed direct-entry midwife, the condition of the client or infant warrant a consultation, collaboration, referral, or transfer.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-601(6): This chapter does not mandate health insurance coverage for midwifery services.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-602 Immunity and liability.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-602(1): If a direct-entry midwife seeks to consult with, refer, or transfer a client to a licensed health care provider or facility, the responsibility of the provider or facility for the client does not begin until the client is physically within the care of the provider or facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-602(2): A licensed health care provider who examines a direct-entry midwife's client is only liable for the actual examination and cannot be held accountable for the client's decision to pursue an out-of-hospital birth or the services of a direct-entry midwife.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-602(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-602(3)(a): A licensed health care provider may, upon receiving a briefing data from a direct-entry midwife, issue a medical order for the direct-entry midwife's client, without that client being an explicit patient of the provider.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-602(3)(b): Regardless of the advice given or order issued, the responsibility and liability for caring for the client is that of the direct-entry midwife.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-602(3)(c): The provider giving the order is responsible and liable only for the appropriateness of the order given the data received.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-602(3)(d): The issuing of an order for a direct-entry midwife's client does not constitute a delegation of duties from the other provider to the direct-entry midwife.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-602(4): 58-77-603; 58-77-601(3)(b) A licensed health care provider may not be held civilly liable for rendering emergency medical services that arise from prohibited conduct in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-602(5): A licensed direct-entry midwife shall be solely responsible for the use of medications under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-603 Prohibited practices.
-----------------------------------------------------
A direct-entry midwife may not:Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-603(1): administer a prescription drug to a client in a manner that violates this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-603(2): effect any type of surgical delivery except for the cutting of an emergency episiotomy;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-603(3): administer any type of epidural, spinal, or caudal anesthetic, or any type of narcotic analgesia;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-603(4): use forceps or a vacuum extractor;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-603(5): manually remove the placenta, except in an emergency that presents an immediate threat to the life of the client; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-77-603(6): 76-7-302; 76-7a-201 perform or induce an abortion in violation of the requirements of Section


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 78 - Vocational Rehabilitation Counselors Licensing Act
************************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Vocational Rehabilitation Counselors Licensing Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-78-102(1): 58-78-201 "Board" means the Vocational Rehabilitation Counselors Licensing Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-102(2): "Licensed vocational rehabilitation counselor" means an individual licensed under this chapter who is engaged in the practice of providing vocational rehabilitation services.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-102(3): "Practice of providing vocational rehabilitation services" means rendering or offering to an individual, group, organization, or the general public vocational rehabilitation services:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-102(3)(a): in public or private practice;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-102(3)(b): for compensation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-102(3)(c): involving the application of principles, methods, or procedures of the vocational rehabilitation counseling profession, which include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-102(3)(c)(i): vocational assessment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-102(3)(c)(ii): vocational rehabilitation counseling and guidance;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-102(3)(c)(iii): vocational and other training services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-102(3)(c)(iv): self-employment plans;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-102(3)(c)(v): job analysis; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-102(3)(c)(vi): job placement.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-201 Board.
--------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-201(1): There is created the Vocational Rehabilitation Counselors Licensing Board consisting of four licensed vocational rehabilitation counselors and one individual representing the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-201(2): 58-1-201 The board shall be appointed and serve in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-201(3): 58-1-202; 58-1-203
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-201(3)(a): 58-1-202; 58-1-203 The duties and responsibilities of the board shall be in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-201(3)(b): The board may also designate one of its members on a rotating or permanent basis to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-201(3)(b)(i): assist the division in reviewing complaints concerning unlawful or unprofessional conduct of a licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-201(3)(b)(ii): advise the division in its investigation of these complaints.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-201(4): (3) A board member who has, under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-301 License required.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-301(1): 58-1-307; 58-78-304 Beginning January 1, 2010, and except as provided in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-301(2): The division shall issue to an individual who qualifies under this chapter a license to practice vocational rehabilitation counseling.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-302 Qualifications for licensure -- Licensure by credential.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-302(1): (2); 63J-1-504; (2) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-302(1)(a): submit an application in a form as prescribed by the division;

Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-302(2): The division may issue a license under this chapter to an individual who is licensed in another state or jurisdiction to practice vocational rehabilitation counseling if the division finds that the other state or jurisdiction has substantially the same or higher licensure requirements as this state.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-303(1): The division shall issue each license under this chapter in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-303(2): 58-1-308 Each license automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless renewed by the licensee in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-303(3): Each person holding a license under this chapter as a vocational rehabilitation counselor shall complete in each period of licensure a program of qualifying continuing professional education in accordance with standards defined by rule.

---------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 58-78-304(2): a priest, rabbi, or minister of the gospel of any religious denomination.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 79 - Hunting Guides and Outfitters Registration Act
********************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Hunting Guides and Outfitters Registration Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-79-102(1): "Compensation" means anything of economic value in excess of $100 that is paid, loaned, granted, given, donated, or transferred to a hunting guide or outfitter for or in consideration of personal services, materials, or property.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-102(2): "Hunting" means to locate, pursue, chase, catch, capture, trap, or kill wildlife.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-102(3): "Hunting guide" means an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-102(3)(a): offers or provides hunting guide services on public lands for compensation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-102(3)(b): is retained for compensation by an outfitter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-102(4): "Hunting guide services" means to guide, lead, or assist an individual in hunting wildlife.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-102(5): "Outfitter" means an individual who offers or provides outfitting or hunting guide services for compensation to another individual for hunting wildlife on public lands.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-102(6): Title 23A, Wildlife Resources Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-102(6)(a): "Outfitting services" means providing, for hunting wildlife on public lands:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-102(6)(a)(i): transportation of people, equipment, supplies, or wildlife to or from a location;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-102(6)(a)(ii): packing, protecting, or supervising services; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-102(6)(a)(iii): hunting guide services.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-102(6)(b): Title 23A, Wildlife Resources Act "Outfitting services" does not include activities undertaken by the Division of Wildlife Resources or its employees, associates, volunteers, contractors, or agents under authority granted in
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-102(7): 23A-7-204(5)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-102(7)(a): "Public lands" means any lands owned by the United States, the state, or a political subdivision or independent entity of the state that are open to the public for purposes of engaging in a wildlife related activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-102(7)(b): 23A-7-204(5) "Public lands" does not include lands owned by the United States, the state, or a political subdivision or independent entity of the state that are included in a cooperative wildlife management unit under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-102(8): 23A-1-101(6) "Wildlife" means cougar, bear, and big game animals as defined in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-103 Hunting guide and outfitter rules.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-301(2)(a): hunting guide; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-301(2)(b): outfitter.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-303(2): 58-1-308 Each registration automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the registration unless the registrant renews the registration in the same manner as a licensee renews a license under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-304 Exemptions from registration.
-------------------------------------------------------------
The exemptions from registration under this chapter are limited to:Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-304(1): 58-1-307 those set forth for a licensee in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-304(2): an employee or subordinate of a hunting guide or outfitter if the employee or subordinate does not use the title of hunting guide or outfitter or is not directly represented to the public to be legally qualified to engage in the practice of being a hunting guide or outfitter before the public in this state.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-401 Grounds for denial of registration -- Disciplinary proceedings.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-401(1): 58-1-401 Grounds for refusing to issue a registration to an applicant, for refusing to renew the registration of a registrant, for revoking, suspending, restricting, or placing on probation the registration of a registrant, for issuing a public or private reprimand to a registrant, and for issuing a cease and desist order under this chapter shall be in accordance with the provisions applicable to a licensee under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-401(2): Title 23A, Wildlife Resources Act; Title 23A, Wildlife Resources Act; Title 23A, Wildlife Resources Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-401(2)(a): Title 23A, Wildlife Resources Act The division shall refuse to issue a registration to an applicant and shall refuse to renew or shall revoke the registration of a registrant during the time period the Division of Wildlife Resources suspends the applicant's or registrant's privilege to hunt or fish under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-401(2)(b): Title 23A, Wildlife Resources Act If the Division of Wildlife Resources suspends the privilege to hunt or fish under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-401(2)(c): Title 23A, Wildlife Resources Act If the Division of Wildlife Resources suspends the privilege to hunt or fish under


Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-501 Unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------
"Unlawful conduct" includes, in addition to the definition in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-502 Unprofessional conduct.
-------------------------------------------------------
"Unprofessional conduct" includes, in addition to the definition in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-79-502(1): engaging in an activity that would place a registrant's client, prospective client, or third party's safety at risk, recognizing the inherent risks associated with hunting wildlife and the activity engaged in being above and beyond those inherent risks;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-502(2): using false, deceptive, or misleading advertising related to providing services as a hunting guide or outfitter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-502(3): misrepresenting services, outcomes, facilities, equipment, or fees to a client or prospective client; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-79-502(4): failing to provide the division with active and current contact information within 30 days of any changes to the registrant's contact information that was provided to the division during registration or the renewal of registration as a hunting guide or outfitter.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 80a - Medical Language Interpreter Act
*******************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Medical Language Interpreter Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(1): "Certified medical language interpreter" means a medical language interpreter who has received a certificate from the division under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(2): Title 58, Chapter 5a, Podiatric Physician Licensing Act; Title 58, Chapter 16a, Utah Optometry Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 24b, Physical Therapy Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 31e, Nurse Licensure Compact - Revised; Title 58, Chapter 31d, Advanced Practice Registered Nurse Compact; Title 58, Chapter 44a, Nurse Midwife Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 57, Respiratory Care Practices Act; Title 58, Chapter 60, Mental Health Professional Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 61, Psychologist Licensing Act; Title 58, Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 69, Dentist and Dental Hygienist Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act; Title 58, Chapter 71, Naturopathic Physician Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 73, Chiropractic Physician Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 77, Direct-Entry Midwife Act "Health care provider" means a person licensed under:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(2)(a): Title 58, Chapter 5a, Podiatric Physician Licensing Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(2)(b): Title 58, Chapter 16a, Utah Optometry Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(2)(c): Title 58, Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(2)(d): Title 58, Chapter 24b, Physical Therapy Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(2)(e): Title 58, Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(2)(f): Title 58, Chapter 31e, Nurse Licensure Compact - Revised
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(2)(g): Title 58, Chapter 31d, Advanced Practice Registered Nurse Compact
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(2)(h): Title 58, Chapter 44a, Nurse Midwife Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(2)(i): Title 58, Chapter 57, Respiratory Care Practices Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(2)(j): Title 58, Chapter 60, Mental Health Professional Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(2)(k): Title 58, Chapter 61, Psychologist Licensing Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(2)(l): Title 58, Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(2)(m): Title 58, Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(2)(n): Title 58, Chapter 69, Dentist and Dental Hygienist Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(2)(o): Title 58, Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(2)(p): Title 58, Chapter 71, Naturopathic Physician Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(2)(q): Title 58, Chapter 73, Chiropractic Physician Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(2)(r): Title 58, Chapter 77, Direct-Entry Midwife Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(3): "Medical language interpreter" means a person who, for compensation, performs verbal language interpretation services between a health care provider who speaks English and another person for the purpose of assisting the person in seeking or obtaining medical advice, diagnoses, or treatment.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(4): "National certification organization" means one of the following national organizations that certifies medical interpreters:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(4)(a): the National Board of Certification for Medical Interpreters; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(4)(b): the Certification Commission for Healthcare Interpreters.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-102(5): "National standards of practice" means the National Standards of Practice, published by the National Council on Interpreting in Health Care.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-201 Certified Medical Language Interpreter Advisory Board.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The division shall notify the Health and Human Services Interim Committee if it determines that there is a need to create, by statute, a Certified Medical Language Interpreter Advisory Board.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-301 Certification.
-----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-301(1): The division shall issue to a person who qualifies under this chapter a certificate as a certified medical language interpreter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-301(2): (1) A certificate described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-301(3): (1) This chapter prohibits a person from representing or holding oneself out as a certified medical language interpreter if the person does not have a certificate described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-302 Certification is voluntary.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-302(1): The certification provided under this chapter is voluntary.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-302(2): 58-80a-301(1) This chapter does not prohibit a person from acting as a medical language interpreter, if the person does not have a certificate described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-303 Qualifications for certification.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-303(1): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 58-80a-305 An individual qualifies as a tier 1 certified medical language interpreter if the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-303(1)(a): acts  as a medical language interpreter between English and at least one other language;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-303(1)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act passes an oral and written examination:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-303(1)(b)(i): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act administered by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-303(1)(b)(i)(A): the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-303(1)(b)(i)(B): a person under contract with the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-303(1)(b)(i)(C): a national certification organization; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-303(1)(b)(i)(D): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act a person approved by the division by rule, made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-303(1)(b)(ii): that tests:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-303(1)(b)(ii)(A): basic language fluency with respect to the language for which the individual applies for certification;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-303(1)(b)(ii)(B): basic medical terminology with respect to the language for which the individual applies for certification, including the ability to name human body parts, name internal human organs, describe basic medical symptoms, and describe basic medical instructions, including dosage amounts and frequency;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-303(1)(b)(ii)(C): basic cultural competency relating to medical care beliefs and practices that are common to people who speak the language for which the individual applies for certification;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-303(1)(b)(ii)(D): knowledge and understanding of the national standards of practice; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-303(1)(b)(ii)(E): a basic understanding of medical confidentiality requirements, including the confidentiality requirements of the federal Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-303(1)(c): signs a statement agreeing to abide by the national standards of practice; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-303(1)(d): 58-80a-305 pays the fee described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-303(2): (1)(b); (1)(b); (1) If an oral examination under Subsection

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-401 Grounds for denial of certification -- Disciplinary proceedings.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for refusing to issue a certification to an applicant, for refusing to renew the certification of a certified medical language interpreter, for revoking, suspending, restricting, or placing on probation the certification of a certified medical language interpreter, for issuing a public or private reprimand to a certified medical language interpreter, and for issuing a cease and desist order shall be in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-501 Unlawful conduct.
--------------------------------------------------
In addition to the definition in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-502 Penalty for unlawful conduct.
--------------------------------------------------------------
A person who violates the unlawful conduct provisions described in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-503 Unprofessional conduct.
--------------------------------------------------------
"Unprofessional conduct" includes:Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-503(1): conduct which is detrimental to the interests of the public;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-503(2): willful or negligent betrayal or disclosure of confidential information about which the certified medical language interpreter becomes knowledgeable as a result of or incidental to the certified medical language interpreter's practice as a certified medical language interpreter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-503(3): false or deceptive representation of a certified medical language interpreter's skills, competence, capability, or resources as a certified medical language interpreter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-503(4): offering, undertaking, or agreeing to undertake an assignment as a certified medical language interpreter for which the certified medical language interpreter is not qualified or which the certified medical language interpreter cannot complete as agreed in a professional manner;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-503(5): the use of any chemical, drug, or alcohol in any unlawful manner or in any manner which negatively affects the ability of the certified medical language interpreter to competently practice as a certified medical language interpreter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-503(6): willfully and intentionally making any false or fraudulent interpretation, statement, or representation in the performance of the certified medical language interpreter's duties;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-503(7): any conduct contrary to the recognized standards and ethics of the profession of a certified medical language interpreter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-503(8): gross incompetence in practice as a certified medical language interpreter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-503(9): violation of any provision of this chapter or rules promulgated to regulate the practice of certified medical language interpreters; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-503(10): conviction of a felony or any other crime which is considered by the division to represent activity detrimental to the public interest as that interest is reflected in the person continuing to practice as a certified medical language interpreter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-80a-601 Priority for certified medical language interpreter.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Department of Health and Human Services may give priority to contracting with companies that use certified medical language interpreters.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 81 - Retired Volunteer Health Care Practitioner Act
********************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Retired Volunteer Health Care Practitioner Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
For purposes of this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(1): (2) "Board" means the state licensing board created for each of the health care practitioners included in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(2): Chapter 5a, Podiatric Physician Licensing Act; Chapter 24b, Physical Therapy Practice Act; Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act; Chapter 40, Recreational Therapy Practice Act; Chapter 42a, Occupational Therapy Practice Act; Chapter 44a, Nurse Midwife Practice Act; Chapter 60, Mental Health Professional Practice Act; Chapter 61, Psychologist Licensing Act; Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; Chapter 69, Dentist and Dental Hygienist Practice Act; Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act; Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act; Chapter 16a, Utah Optometry Practice Act; Chapter 72, Acupuncture Licensing Act "Health care practitioner" includes:

Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(2)(h): Chapter 61, Psychologist Licensing Act a psychologist licensed under

Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(3): "Qualified location" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(3)(a): a clinic, hospital, church, or organization whose primary purpose is to sponsor, promote, or organize uncompensated health care services for people unable to pay for health care services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(3)(b): is a location approved by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(4): 58-13-3 "Remuneration or compensation" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(5): "Supervising professional" means a health care practitioner:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(5)(a): who has an active license in the state in good standing;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(5)(b): with a scope of practice that is appropriate for supervising the applicant as determined by the division and board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(5)(c): who is practicing at the qualified location.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(6): Chapter 60, Mental Health Professional Practice Act; Chapter 69, Dentist and Dental Hygienist Practice Act; Chapter 40, Recreational Therapy Practice Act; Chapter 42a, Occupational Therapy Practice Act; (2)(a); (m); (5)(a); 58-81-103(2) "Supervision" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(6)(a): Chapter 60, Mental Health Professional Practice Act; Chapter 69, Dentist and Dental Hygienist Practice Act; Chapter 40, Recreational Therapy Practice Act; Chapter 42a, Occupational Therapy Practice Act the level of supervision required for:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(6)(a)(i): Chapter 60, Mental Health Professional Practice Act a social service worker in
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(6)(a)(ii): Chapter 69, Dentist and Dental Hygienist Practice Act a dental hygienist in
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(6)(a)(iii): Chapter 40, Recreational Therapy Practice Act a recreational therapist technician in
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(6)(a)(iv): Chapter 42a, Occupational Therapy Practice Act an occupational technician assistant in
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(6)(b): (2)(a); (m); (5)(a); 58-81-103(2) for the health care practitioners listed in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(6)(b)(i): 58-81-103(2) entering into a delegation of service agreement with a supervising professional in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(6)(b)(ii): having the ability to contact the supervising professional during the time the volunteer is providing volunteer services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(6)(b)(iii): for every 40 hours of volunteer service hours, meeting with the supervising professional.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(7): "Volunteer" means the individual health care practitioner:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(7)(a): will devote the health care practitioner's practice exclusively to providing care to the needy and indigent in the state:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(7)(a)(i): within:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(7)(a)(i)(A): the practitioner's scope of practice; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(7)(a)(i)(B): the delegation of service agreement between the volunteer and the supervising professional; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(7)(a)(ii): at a qualified location;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(7)(b): will agree to donate professional services in a qualified location; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-102(7)(c): will not receive remuneration or compensation for the health care practitioner's services.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-103 Eligibility for volunteer health care practitioner license -- Delegation of service agreement.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-103(1): A health care practitioner is eligible to apply to the division and board for a volunteer health care practitioner license if the health care practitioner:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-103(1)(a): certifies to the division and board that the applicant will be engaged exclusively in volunteer health care services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-103(1)(b): completes an application for a volunteer health care practitioner license, which includes documentation:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-103(1)(b)(i): of professional education, exams passed, and graduation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-103(1)(b)(ii): of practice history;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-103(1)(b)(iii): of a qualified location for which the health care practitioner will be practicing;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-103(1)(b)(iv): identifying the supervising health care practitioner and the supervising health care practitioner's delegation of service agreement with the volunteer practitioner; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-103(1)(b)(v): that the applicant has:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-103(1)(b)(v)(A): previously been issued an unrestricted license to practice in Utah, another state of the United States, or a district or territory of the United States;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-103(1)(b)(v)(B): never been the subject of any significant disciplinary action in any jurisdiction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-103(1)(b)(v)(C): is in good health and does not have a condition which would impair the health care practitioner's ability to practice with reasonable skill and safety to patients.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-103(2): 58-81-102(6) A health care provider who has agreed to be a supervising professional for a volunteer at a qualified location shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-103(2)(a): enter into a delegation of service agreement with the volunteer health care practitioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-103(2)(b): 58-81-102(6) agree to provide the level of supervision required in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-103(2)(c): determine with the volunteer whether the volunteer's scope of practice or ability to prescribe controlled substances will be limited by the delegation of service agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-103(2)(d): include in the delegation of service agreement that the volunteer may not prescribe a controlled substance to himself, the volunteer's family, or a staff member of the qualified location; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-103(2)(e): forward the delegation of service agreement to the division.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-104 Volunteer health care practitioner license -- Waiver of fees -- Rulemaking authority.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-104(1): 58-81-103 The division and board shall issue a volunteer health care practitioner license to an applicant who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-104(1)(a): 58-81-103 completes an application under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-104(1)(b): meets the requirements of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-104(2): (2)(a) A license issued under this chapter shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-104(2)(a): comply with the scope of practice for a similarly situated licensed practitioner, except that the license shall limit the health care practitioner's practice to the qualified location;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-104(2)(b): permit the health care practitioner to apply for a controlled substance license as permitted for other similarly situated licensed practitioners; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-104(2)(c): (2)(a) state that the license is a volunteer health care practitioner license and is subject to the restriction of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-104(3): The division and board shall waive all division fees, including application fees, examination fees, and annual renewal fees for an applicant who applies for a volunteer health care practitioner license and who otherwise meets licensure requirements.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-104(4): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 58-81-102 The division and board may adopt rules in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-104(4)(a): 58-81-102 approve the charity locations that qualify under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-104(4)(b): develop standards for the information that must be included in a delegation of service agreement, including a standard form that a supervising professional may use; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-104(4)(c): implement the provisions of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-104(5): 58-13-3 A health care practitioner who is licensed as a volunteer health care practitioner under this chapter is entitled to qualified immunity for charity care if the health care practitioner meets the requirements of Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-81-105 Grounds for denial of license.
--------------------------------------------------------------
The division may not refuse, revoke, suspend, or in any way restrict the license of a health care practitioner, as defined in Subsections

Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 84 - State Certification of Music Therapists Act
*****************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "State Certification of Music Therapists Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-84-102(1): "Practice of music therapy" means the clinical and evidence-based use of music interventions to accomplish individualized goals within a therapeutic relationship.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-102(2): "State certification" means a designation granted by the division on behalf of the state to an individual who has met the requirements for state certification related to an occupation or profession described in this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-102(3): "State certified" means, when used in conjunction with an occupation or profession described in this chapter, a title that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-102(3)(a): may be used by a person who has met the state certification requirements related to that occupation or profession described in this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-102(3)(b): may not be used by a person who has not met the state certification requirements related to that occupation or profession described in this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-103 Rulemaking.
-------------------------------------------
When exercising rulemaking authority under this chapter, the division shall comply with the requirements of

Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-201 Qualifications for state certification.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-201(1): The division shall grant state certification to a person who qualifies under this chapter to engage in the practice of music therapy as a state certified music therapist.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-201(2): 63J-1-504 Each applicant for state certification as a state certified music therapist shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-201(2)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-201(2)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-201(2)(c): provide satisfactory documentation that the applicant is board certified by, and in good standing with, the Certification Board for Music Therapists, or an equivalent board as determined by division rule.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-202 Term of state certification.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-202(1): The division shall grant state certification under this chapter in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by division rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-202(2): At the time of renewal, an applicant for renewal shall provide satisfactory documentation that the applicant is board certified by, and in good standing with, the Certification Board for Music Therapists, or an equivalent board as determined by division rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-202(3): If the board certification of a state certified music therapist required for obtaining or renewing state certification under this chapter is suspended, placed on probation, revoked, or has expired for any reason, the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-202(3)(a): shall suspend using the title state certified music therapist in connection with the person's name or business;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-202(3)(b): shall suspend representing to others that the person is a state certified music therapist; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-202(3)(c): shall inform the division within two weeks of the suspension, probation, revocation, or expiration of the board certification.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-202(4): 58-84-201 When the division learns that the board certification of a state certified music therapist required for obtaining or renewing state certification under this chapter is suspended, placed on probation, revoked, or has expired for any reason, that person's state certification shall be revoked and may not be reinstated unless the person meets the requirements and again applies for state certification as described in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-203 Limitation of state certification.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Nothing in this chapter shall be construed to prevent a person from lawfully engaging in the practice of music therapy without state certification.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-301 Unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-301(1): It is unlawful for a person who is not a state certified music therapist to use the title state certified music therapist, or represent that the person is a state certified music therapist, in connection with the person's name or business.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-84-301(2): It is unlawful for a state certified person whose board certification is suspended, placed on probation, revoked, or has expired for any reason to use the title state certified music therapist, or represent that the person is a state certified music therapist, in connection with the person's name or business.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 85 - Utah Right to Try Act
*******************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Utah Right to Try Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-102(1): "Eligible patient" means an individual who has been diagnosed with a terminal illness by a physician.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-102(2): 31A-1-301 "Insurer" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-102(3): "Investigational device" means a device that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-102(3)(a): meets the definition of "investigational device" in 21 C.F.R. Sec. 812.3; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-102(3)(b): has successfully completed the United States Food and Drug Administration Phase 1 testing for an investigational device described in 21 C.F.R. Part 812.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-102(4): "Investigational drug" means a drug that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-102(4)(a): meets the definition of "investigational new drug" in 21 C.F.R. Sec. 312.3; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-102(4)(b): has successfully completed the United States Food and Drug Administration Phase 1 testing for an investigational new drug described in 21 C.F.R. Part 312.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-102(5): 58-37-3.6 "Medicinal dosage form" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-102(6): Title 58, Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act "Physician" means an individual who is licensed under:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-102(6)(a): Title 58, Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-102(6)(b): Title 58, Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-102(7): "Terminal illness" means a condition of a patient that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-102(7)(a): as determined by a physician:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-102(7)(a)(i): is likely to pose a greater risk to the patient than the risk posed to the patient by treatment with an investigational drug or investigational device; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-102(7)(a)(ii): will inevitably lead to the patient's death; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-102(7)(b): presents the patient, after the patient has explored conventional therapy options, with no treatment option that is satisfactory or comparable to treatment with an investigational drug or device.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-103 Right to request investigational drug or device.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-103(1): An eligible patient may obtain an investigational drug through an agreement with the investigational drug's manufacturer and the eligible patient's physician that provides:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-103(1)(a): for the transfer of the investigational drug from the manufacturer to the physician; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-103(1)(b): that the physician will administer the investigational drug to the patient.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-103(2): An eligible patient may obtain an investigational device through an agreement with the investigational device's manufacturer and the eligible patient's physician that provides:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-103(2)(a): for the transfer of the investigational device from the manufacturer to the physician; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-103(2)(b): that the physician will use the investigational device to treat the patient.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-103(3): (1); (2); 58-85-105 An agreement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-103(3)(a): describes the possible positive and negative outcomes the eligible patient could experience if the physician treats the eligible patient with the investigational drug or investigational device, including that the investigational drug or investigational device could increase the possibility of death;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-103(3)(b): states that an insurer is not required to cover the cost of providing the investigational drug or investigational device to the patient;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-103(3)(c): 58-85-105 states that, subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-103(3)(d): states that the patient may be liable for all expenses caused by the physician treating the patient with the investigational drug or investigational device, unless the agreement provides otherwise.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-103(4): (1); (2) A physician or an eligible patient shall notify the eligible patient's insurer of the day on which the physician treated an eligible patient with an investigational drug or investigational device, and the investigational drug or device used, under an agreement described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-104 Standard of care -- Medical practitioners not liable -- No private right of action.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-104(1): It is not a breach of the applicable standard of care for a physician, other licensed health care provider, or hospital to treat an eligible patient with an investigational drug or investigational device under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-104(2): Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; Title 26B, Chapter 2, Part 2, Health Care Facility Licensing and Inspection A physician, other licensed health care provider, or hospital that treats an eligible patient with an investigational drug or investigational device under this chapter may not, for any harm done to the eligible patient by the investigational drug or device, be subject to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-104(2)(a): civil liability;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-104(2)(b): criminal liability; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-104(2)(c): Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; Title 26B, Chapter 2, Part 2, Health Care Facility Licensing and Inspection licensure sanctions under:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-104(2)(c)(i): Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act for a physician:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-104(2)(c)(i)(A): Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-104(2)(c)(i)(B): Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-104(2)(c)(ii): for the other licensed health care provider, the act governing the other licensed health care provider's license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-104(2)(c)(iii): Title 26B, Chapter 2, Part 2, Health Care Facility Licensing and Inspection for the hospital,
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-104(3): This chapter does not:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-104(3)(a): require a manufacturer of an investigational drug or investigational device to agree to make an investigational drug or investigational device available to an eligible patient or an eligible patient's physician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-104(3)(b): require a physician to agree to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-104(3)(b)(i): administer an investigational drug to an eligible patient under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-104(3)(b)(ii): treat an eligible patient with an investigational device under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-104(3)(c): create a private right of action for an eligible patient:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-104(3)(c)(i): against a physician or hospital, for the physician's or hospital's refusal to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-104(3)(c)(i)(A): administer an investigational drug to an eligible patient under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-104(3)(c)(i)(B): treat an eligible patient with an investigational device under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-104(3)(c)(ii): against a manufacturer, for the manufacturer's refusal to provide an eligible patient with an investigational drug or an investigational device under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-105 Insurance coverage.
---------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-105(1): This chapter does not:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-105(1)(a): require an insurer to cover the cost of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-105(1)(a)(i): administering an investigational drug under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-105(1)(a)(ii): treating a patient with an investigational device under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-105(1)(b): prohibit an insurer from covering the cost of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-105(1)(b)(i): administering an investigational drug under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-105(1)(b)(ii): treating a patient with an investigational device under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-105(2): (3) Except as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-105(3): (2) An insurer may not deny coverage to an eligible patient under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-105(3)(a): the eligible patient's preexisting condition;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-105(3)(b): benefits that commenced before the day on which the eligible patient is treated with the investigational drug or investigational device; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-105(3)(c): palliative or hospice care for an eligible patient that has been treated with an investigational drug or device, but is no longer receiving curative treatment with the investigational drug or device.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106 Use of investigational drugs and devices during a major public health emergency -- Limitations -- Immunity.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(1): 53-2a-206; 78B-3-403; 31A-22-634; 58-67-102 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(1)(a): 53-2a-206 "Declared major public health emergency" means a state of emergency declared by the governor under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(1)(b): 78B-3-403 "Health care provider" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(1)(c): 31A-22-634 "Insurer" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(1)(d): "Major public health emergency" means an occurrence of imminent threat of an illness or health condition that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(1)(d)(i): is believed to be caused by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(1)(d)(i)(A): bioterrorism;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(1)(d)(i)(B): the appearance of a novel or previously controlled or eradicated infectious agent or biological toxin;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(1)(d)(i)(C): a natural disaster;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(1)(d)(i)(D): a chemical attack or accidental release; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(1)(d)(i)(E): a nuclear attack or accident; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(1)(d)(ii): poses a high probability of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(1)(d)(ii)(A): a large number of deaths in the affected population;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(1)(d)(ii)(B): a large number of serious or long-term disabilities in the affected population; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(1)(d)(ii)(C): widespread exposure to an infectious or toxic agent that poses a significant risk of substantial future harm to a large number of people in the affected population.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(1)(e): 58-67-102 "Physician" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(1)(f): "Qualified patient" means a patient who has been diagnosed with a condition that has resulted in a declared major public health emergency.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(2): (2)(a); (b); (5)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(2)(a): To the extent permitted under federal law, a qualified patient may obtain an investigational drug through an agreement with the investigational drug's manufacturer and the qualified patient's physician that provides:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(2)(a)(i): for the transfer of the investigational drug from the manufacturer to the physician; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(2)(a)(ii): that the physician will administer the investigational drug to the qualified patient.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(2)(b): To the extent permitted under federal law, a qualified patient may obtain an investigational device through an agreement with the investigational device's manufacturer and the qualified patient's physician that provides:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(2)(b)(i): for the transfer of the investigational device from the manufacturer to the physician; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(2)(b)(ii): that the physician will use the investigational device to treat the qualified patient.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(2)(c): (2)(a); (b); (5) The agreement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(2)(c)(i): describes the possible positive and negative outcomes the qualified patient could experience if the physician treats the qualified patient with the investigational drug or investigational device;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(2)(c)(ii): states that an insurer is not required to cover the cost of providing the investigational drug or investigational device to the qualified patient;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(2)(c)(iii): (5) states that, subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(2)(c)(iv): states that the qualified patient may be liable for all expenses caused by the physician treating the patient with the investigational drug or investigational device, unless the agreement provides otherwise.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(3): (2) The physician of a qualified patient shall notify the qualified patient's insurer of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(3)(a): the day on which the physician treated the qualified patient with an investigational drug or investigational device; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(3)(b): (2) the investigational drug or investigational device used under an agreement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(4)(a): It is not a breach of the applicable standard of care for a health care provider to treat a qualified patient with an investigational drug or investigational device under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(4)(b): A health care provider that treats a qualified patient with an investigational drug or investigational device in accordance with this section is not subject to civil liability, criminal liability, or sanctions against the health care provider's license for any harm to the qualified patient resulting from the qualified patient's use of the investigational drug or device.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5): (5)(d); (5)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5)(a): This section does not:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5)(a)(i): require a manufacturer of an investigational drug or investigational device to agree to make an investigational drug or investigational device available to a qualified patient or a qualified patient's physician;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5)(a)(ii): require a physician to agree to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5)(a)(ii)(A): administer an investigational drug to a qualified patient under this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5)(a)(ii)(B): treat a qualified patient with an investigational device under this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5)(a)(iii): create a private right of action for a qualified patient against a health care provider for the health care provider's refusal to:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5)(a)(iii)(A): administer an investigational drug to a qualified patient under this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5)(a)(iii)(B): treat a qualified patient with an investigational device under this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5)(a)(iv): create a private right of action for a qualified patient against a manufacturer for the manufacturer's refusal to provide a qualified patient with an investigational drug or an investigational device under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5)(b): This section does not:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5)(b)(i): require an insurer to cover the cost of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5)(b)(i)(A): administering an investigational drug under this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5)(b)(i)(B): treating a patient with an investigational device under this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5)(b)(ii): prohibit an insurer from covering the cost of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5)(b)(ii)(A): administering an investigational drug under this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5)(b)(ii)(B): treating a patient with an investigational device under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5)(c): (5)(d) Except as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5)(d): (5)(c) An insurer may not deny coverage to a qualified patient under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5)(d)(i): the qualified patient's preexisting condition;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5)(d)(ii): benefits that commenced before the day on which the qualified patient was treated with the investigational drug or investigational device; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-85-106(5)(d)(iii): palliative or hospice care for a qualified patient that has been treated with an investigational drug or investigational device but is no longer receiving curative treatment with the investigational drug or investigational device.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 86 - State Certification of Commercial Interior Designers Act
******************************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-101 Title and scope.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-101(1): This chapter is known as the "State Certification of Commercial Interior Designers Act."
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-101(2): 58-86-102 Except for those practices specifically described in the definition of practice of commercial interior design in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-101(3): Title 58, Chapter 3a, Architects Licensing Act; Title 58, Chapter 22, Professional Engineers and Professional Land Surveyors Licensing Act This chapter does not limit the scope of practice of a person licensed to practice:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-101(3)(a): Title 58, Chapter 3a, Architects Licensing Act architecture under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-101(3)(b): Title 58, Chapter 22, Professional Engineers and Professional Land Surveyors Licensing Act professional engineering under


Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In addition to the definitions in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(1): Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act "Building" means an enclosed structure, including the structural, mechanical, and electrical systems, utility services, and other facilities required for the structure, that has human occupancy or habitation as its principal purpose and is subject to the State Construction Code or an approved code under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(2): 15A-2-103 "International Building Code" means the edition of the International Building Code, issued by the International Code Council, most recently adopted by the state in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(3): Title 58, Chapter 3a, Architects Licensing Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(3)(a): Title 58, Chapter 3a, Architects Licensing Act "Practice of commercial interior design" means, in relation to obtaining a building permit independent of an architect licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(3)(b): "Practice of commercial interior design" only includes the preparation of a plan or specification for, or the supervision of new construction, alteration, or repair of, a building to be used for the following occupancy groups as described in the International Building Code:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(3)(b)(i): B; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(3)(b)(ii): M.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(3)(c): "Practice of commercial interior design" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(3)(c)(i): providing commercial construction documents, independent of a licensed architect, for a space that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(3)(c)(i)(A): does not already have base building life safety components installed or designed and permitted, including required exit stairs and enclosures, paths of travel, ramps, horizontal exit passageways, disabled access, fire alarm systems, and base building fire suppression systems; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(3)(c)(i)(B): is undergoing a change of occupancy classification as described in the International Building Code; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(3)(c)(ii): changes to or the addition of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(3)(c)(ii)(A): foundations, beams, trusses, columns, or other primary structural framing members or seismic systems;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(3)(c)(ii)(B): structural concrete slabs, floor and roof framing structures, or bearing and shear walls;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(3)(c)(ii)(C): openings in roofs, floors, exterior walls, or bearing and shear walls;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(3)(c)(ii)(D): exterior doors, windows, awnings, canopies, sunshades, signage, or similar exterior building elements;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(3)(c)(ii)(E): as described in the International Building Code, life safety equipment, including smoke, fire, or carbon dioxide sensors or detectors, or other overhead building elements;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(3)(c)(ii)(F): as described in the International Building Code, partial height partitions with mounted or anchored casework, shelving, or equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(3)(c)(ii)(G): as described in the International Building Code, bracing for partial height partitions if the top of the partition is more than eight feet above the floor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(3)(c)(ii)(H): heating, ventilating, or air conditioning equipment or distribution systems, building management systems, high or medium voltage electrical distribution systems, standby or emergency power systems or distribution systems, plumbing or plumbing distribution systems, fire alarm systems, fire sprinklers systems, security or monitoring systems, or related building systems.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(4): "State certification" means a designation granted by the division on behalf of the state to an individual who has met the requirements for state certification related to an occupation or profession described in this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(5): "State certified" means, when used in conjunction with an occupation or profession described in this chapter, a title that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(5)(a): may be used by a person who has met the state certification requirements related to that occupation or profession described in this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(5)(b): may not be used by a person who has not met the state certification requirements related to that occupation or profession described in this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-102(6): 58-1-501; 58-86-301 "Unlawful conduct" means the same as that term is defined in Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-103 Rulemaking.
-------------------------------------------
When exercising rulemaking authority under this chapter, the division shall comply with the requirements of

Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-201 State certification required.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-201(1): 58-1-307; 58-86-206 State certification is required to engage in the practice of commercial interior design except as specifically provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-201(2): The division shall grant state certification to a person who qualifies under this chapter to engage in the practice of commercial interior design as a state certified commercial interior designer.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-202 Qualifications for state certification.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Each applicant for state certification as a state certified commercial interior designer shall:Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-202(1): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-202(2): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-202(3): provide satisfactory evidence of having qualified to take and having passed the examination of the National Council for Interior Design Qualification, or an equivalent body as determined by division rule.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-203 Term of state certification -- Expiration -- Renewal.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-203(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-203(1)(a): The division shall grant state certification under this chapter in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-203(1)(b): The division may by rule extend or shorten a renewal period by as much as one year to stagger the renewal cycles it administers.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-203(2): 63J-1-504; 58-86-204 At the time of renewal, an applicant for renewal shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-203(2)(a): submit an application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-203(2)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-203(2)(c): 58-86-204 provide satisfactory evidence of having completed the continuing education requirements described in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-204 Continuing education.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-204(1): As a condition for the renewal of state certification under this chapter, a state certified commercial interior designer, during each two-year state certification cycle, shall complete 20 hours of continuing education that is offered or approved by the Interior Design Continuing Education Council, or another entity as determined by division rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-204(2): (1) At least 10 of the continuing education hours described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-204(3): 58-86-203 If a renewal cycle is extended or shortened under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-205 Grounds for denial of state certification -- Disciplinary proceedings.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grounds for refusing to issue state certification to an applicant, for refusing to renew state certification to an applicant, for revoking, suspending, restricting, or placing on probation the state certification of an individual certified under this chapter, for issuing a public or private reprimand to an individual certified under this chapter, and for issuing a cease and desist order shall be in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-206 Exemptions from state certification.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
In addition to the exemptions from licensure in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 58-86-206(1): Title 58, Chapter 3a, Architects Licensing Act a person licensed to practice architecture under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-206(2): 58-3a-304; 58-22-305 a person providing permit drawings, if allowed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-206(3): a person providing construction related documents not required for a building permit.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-301 Unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------
"Unlawful conduct" includes:Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-301(1): using the title "state certified commercial interior designer" if the person is not a state certified commercial interior designer in good standing under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-301(2): 58-1-307; 58-86-206 engaging in the practice of commercial interior design unless exempted from licensure or state certification under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302 Penalty for unlawful conduct.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(1): 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-86-301; 58-86-301; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act If upon inspection or investigation the division concludes that a person has violated Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(1)(a): issue a citation to the person according to this chapter and any pertinent rules;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(1)(b): attempt to negotiate a stipulated settlement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(1)(c): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act notify the person to appear at an adjudicative proceeding conducted under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(2): 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-86-301; 58-86-301; 58-1-501(1)(a); (d); 58-86-301; 58-86-301 A person who violates Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(3): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act A citation issued under this chapter shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(3)(a): be in writing;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(3)(b): describe with particularity the nature of the violation, including a reference to the provision of the chapter, rule, or order alleged to have been violated;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(3)(c): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act clearly state that the recipient must notify the division in writing within 20 calendar days of service of the citation if the recipient wishes to contest the citation at a hearing conducted under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(3)(d): clearly explain the consequences of failure to timely contest the citation or to make payment of any fines assessed by the citation within the time specified in the citation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(4): The division may issue a notice in lieu of a citation.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(5): A citation issued under this section, or a copy of the citation, may be served upon a person upon whom a summons may be served in accordance with the Utah Rules of Civil Procedure and may be made by mail or may be made personally or upon the person's agent by a division investigator or by a person specially designated by the director.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(6)(a): If within 20 calendar days from the service of the citation the person to whom the citation was issued fails to request a hearing to contest the citation, the citation becomes the final order of the division and is not subject to further agency review.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(6)(b): The period to contest a citation may be extended by the division for cause.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(7): The division may refuse to issue or renew or may suspend, revoke, or place on probation the state certification of a state certified commercial interior designer who fails to comply with a citation after the citation becomes final.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(8): The failure of an applicant for state certification to comply with a citation after the citation becomes final is a ground for denial of state certification.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(9): No citation may be issued under this section after the expiration of one year following the date on which the violation that is the subject of the citation is reported to the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(10): The director or the director's designee shall assess fines according to the following:
