Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(10)(a): for a first offense handled pursuant to this section, a fine of up to $1,000;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(10)(b): for a second offense handled pursuant to this section, a fine of up to $2,000; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(10)(c): for any subsequent offense handled pursuant to this section, a fine of up to $2,000 for each day of continued offense.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(11): An action initiated for a first or second offense that has not yet resulted in a final order of the division does not preclude initiation of a subsequent action for a second or subsequent offense during the pendency of a preceding action.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(12): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(12)(a): A penalty that is not paid may be collected by the director by either referring the matter to a collection agency or by bringing an action in the district court of the county in which the person against whom the penalty is imposed resides or in the county where the office of the director is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(12)(b): A county attorney or the attorney general of the state shall provide legal assistance and advice to the director in an action to collect the penalty.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-302(12)(c): In an action brought to enforce the provisions of this section, reasonable attorney fees and costs shall be awarded to the division.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-401 State certification number and signature.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-401(1): The division shall provide each state certified commercial interior designer with a certificate number.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-401(2): A final plan or specification for the construction of a commercial interior design within a newly constructed or existing building that is prepared by or under the supervision of a state certified commercial interior designer shall bear the signature and the certificate number of the state certified commercial interior designer when submitted to a client or a building official for the purpose of obtaining a building permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-401(3): A state certified commercial interior designer may only include the designer's signature and certificate number on a final plan or specification that is within the scope of practice of commercial interior design and when the plan or specification:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-401(3)(a): is personally prepared by the certified interior designer;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-401(3)(b): is prepared by an employee, subordinate, associate, or drafter under the direct supervision of the state certified commercial interior designer and the state certified commercial interior designer assumes responsibility for the plan or specification; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-401(3)(c): is prepared by another state certified commercial interior designer in the state or similarly qualified designer in another state provided that the state certified commercial interior designer attaching the designer's signature and certificate number:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-401(3)(c)(i): performs a thorough review of all work for compliance with all applicable laws, rules, and standards of the profession; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-401(3)(c)(ii): makes any necessary corrections before submitting the final plan or specification:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-401(3)(c)(ii)(A): to a building official for the purpose of obtaining a building permit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-86-401(3)(c)(ii)(B): to a client, when the certified commercial interior designer represents, or can reasonably expect the client to consider, the plan or specification to be complete and final.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 87 - Revised Uniform Athlete Agents Act
********************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Revised Uniform Athlete Agents Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(1): "Agency contract" means an agreement in which a student athlete authorizes a person to negotiate or solicit on behalf of the athlete a professional-sports-services contract or an endorsement contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(2)(a): "Athlete agent" means an individual, whether or not registered under this chapter, who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(2)(a)(i): directly or indirectly recruits or solicits a student athlete to enter into an agency contract or, for compensation, procures employment or offers, promises, attempts, or negotiates to obtain employment for a student athlete as a professional athlete or member of a professional sports team or organization;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(2)(a)(ii): for compensation or in anticipation of compensation related to a student athlete's participation in athletics:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(2)(a)(ii)(A): serves the athlete in an advisory capacity on a matter related to finances, business pursuits, or career management decisions, unless the individual is an employee of an educational institution acting exclusively as an employee of the institution for the benefit of the institution; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(2)(a)(ii)(B): manages the business affairs of the athlete by providing assistance with bills, payments, contracts, or taxes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(2)(a)(iii): in anticipation of representing a student athlete for a purpose related to the athlete's participation in athletics:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(2)(a)(iii)(A): gives consideration to the student athlete or another person;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(2)(a)(iii)(B): serves the athlete in an advisory capacity on a matter related to finances, business pursuits, or career management decisions; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(2)(a)(iii)(C): manages the business affairs of the athlete by providing assistance with bills, payments, contracts, or taxes.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(2)(b): "Athlete agent" does not include an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(2)(b)(i): acts solely on behalf of a professional sports team or organization; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(2)(b)(ii): is a licensed, registered, or certified professional and offers or provides services to a student athlete customarily provided by members of the profession, unless the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(2)(b)(ii)(A): also recruits or solicits the athlete to enter into an agency contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(2)(b)(ii)(B): also, for compensation, procures employment or offers, promises, attempts, or negotiates to obtain employment for the athlete as a professional athlete or member of a professional sports team or organization; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(2)(b)(ii)(C): receives consideration for providing the services calculated using a different method than for an individual who is not a student athlete.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(3): "Athletic director" means the individual responsible for administering the overall athletic program of an educational institution or, if an educational institution has separately administered athletic programs for male students and female students, the athletic program for males or the athletic program for females, as appropriate.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(4): "Educational institution" includes a public or private elementary school, secondary school, technical or vocational school, community college, college, and university.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(5): "Endorsement contract" means an agreement under which a student athlete is employed or receives consideration to use on behalf of the other party any value that the student athlete may have because of publicity, reputation, following, or fame obtained because of athletic ability or performance.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(6): "Enrolled" means registered for courses and attending athletic practice or class. "Enrolls" has a corresponding meaning.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(7): "Intercollegiate sport" means a sport played at the collegiate level for which eligibility requirements for participation by a student athlete are established by a national association that promotes or regulates collegiate athletics.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(8): "Interscholastic sport" means a sport played between educational institutions that are not community colleges, colleges, or universities.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(9): "Licensed, registered, or certified professional" means an individual licensed, registered, or certified as an attorney, dealer in securities, financial planner, insurance agent, real estate broker or sales agent, tax consultant, accountant, or member of a profession, other than that of athlete agent, who is licensed, registered, or certified by the state or a nationally recognized organization that licenses, registers, or certifies members of the profession on the basis of experience, education, or testing.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(10): "Person" means an individual, estate, business or nonprofit entity, public corporation, government or governmental subdivision, agency, or instrumentality, or other legal entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(11): "Professional-sports-services contract" means an agreement under which an individual is employed as a professional athlete or agrees to render services as a player on a professional sports team or with a professional sports organization.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(12): "Record" means information that is inscribed on a tangible medium or that is stored in an electronic or other medium and is retrievable in perceivable form.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(13): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(13)(a): "Recruit or solicit" means attempting to influence the choice of an athlete agent by a student athlete or, if the athlete is a minor, a parent or guardian of the athlete.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(13)(b): "Recruit or solicit" does not include giving advice on the selection of a particular agent in a family, coaching, or social situation unless the individual giving the advice does so because of the receipt or anticipated receipt of an economic benefit, directly or indirectly, from the agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(14): "Registration" means registration as an athlete agent under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(15): "Sign" means, with present intent to authenticate or adopt a record:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(15)(a): to execute or adopt a tangible symbol; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(15)(b): to attach to or logically associate with the record an electronic symbol, sound, or process.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(16): "State" means a state of the United States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, the United States Virgin Islands, or any territory or insular possession subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(17): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(17)(a): "Student athlete" means an individual who is eligible to attend an educational institution and engages in, is eligible to engage in, or may be eligible in the future to engage in, any interscholastic or intercollegiate sport.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-102(17)(b): "Student athlete" does not include an individual permanently ineligible to participate in a particular interscholastic or intercollegiate sport for that sport.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-103 Administration -- Rulemaking -- Service of process.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-103(1): Chapter 1, Division of Professional Licensing Act; Chapter 1, Division of Professional Licensing Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-103(1)(a): Chapter 1, Division of Professional Licensing Act; Chapter 1, Division of Professional Licensing Act This chapter shall be administered by the division and is subject to the requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-103(1)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-103(2): By acting as an athlete agent in this state, a nonresident individual appoints the director of the division as the individual's agent for service of process in any civil action in this state related to the individual acting as an athlete agent in this state.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-201 Athlete agents -- Registration required -- Void contracts.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-201(1): (2) Except as otherwise provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-201(2): Before being issued a certificate of registration under this chapter an individual may act as an athlete agent in this state for all purposes except signing an agency contract, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-201(2)(a): a student athlete or another person acting on behalf of the student athlete initiates communication with the individual; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-201(2)(b): no later than seven days after an initial act that requires the individual to register as an athlete agent, the individual submits an application for registration as an athlete agent in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-201(3): An agency contract resulting from conduct in violation of this section is void and the athlete agent shall return any consideration received under the contract.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202 Registration as an athlete agent -- Form -- Requirements.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1): Title 63G, Chapter 2, Government Records Access and Management Act; (2); (3); (1)(g); (1)(g); (1)(g); (1)(g); (1)(g); (1)(g); (1)(g); (1)(g); (1)(g) An applicant for registration shall submit an application for registration as an athlete agent to the division in a form prescribed by the division.  An application filed under this section is a public record under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(a): the name and date and place of birth of the applicant and the following contact information for the applicant:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(a)(i): the address of the applicant's principal place of business;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(a)(ii): work and mobile telephone numbers; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(a)(iii): any means of communicating electronically, including a facsimile number, email address, and personal and business or employer websites;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(b): the name of the applicant's business or employer, if applicable, including for each business or employer, its mailing address, telephone number, organization form, and the nature of the business;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(c): each social-media account with which the applicant or the applicant's business or employer is affiliated;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(d): each business or occupation in which the applicant engaged within five years before the date of the application, including self-employment and employment by others, and any professional or occupational license, registration, or certification held by the applicant during that time;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(e): a description of the applicant's:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(e)(i): formal training as an athlete agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(e)(ii): practical experience as an athlete agent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(e)(iii): educational background relating to the applicant's activities as an athlete agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(f): the name of each student athlete for whom the applicant acted as an athlete agent within five years before the date of the application or, if the student athlete is a minor, the name of the parent or guardian of the minor, together with the athlete's sport and last-known team;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(g): the name and address of each person that:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(g)(i): is a partner, member, officer, manager, associate, or profit sharer or directly or indirectly holds an equity interest of 5% or greater of the athlete agent's business if it is not a corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(g)(ii): is an officer or director of a corporation employing the athlete agent or a shareholder having an interest of 5% or greater in the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(h): (1)(g) a description of the status of any application by the applicant, or any person named under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(i): (1)(g) whether the applicant, or any person named under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(i)(i): the crime;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(i)(ii): the law-enforcement agency involved; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(i)(iii): if applicable, the date of the conviction and the fine or penalty imposed;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(j): (1)(g) whether, within 15 years before the date of application, the applicant, or any person named under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(k): (1)(g) whether the applicant, or any person named under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(l): (1)(g) whether, within 10 years before the date of application, the applicant, or any person named under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(m): (1)(g) whether there has been any administrative or judicial determination that the applicant, or any person named under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(n): (1)(g) each instance in which conduct of the applicant, or any person named under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(o): (1)(g) each sanction, suspension, or disciplinary action taken against the applicant, or any person named under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(p): (1)(g) whether there has been a denial of an application for, suspension or revocation of, refusal to renew, or abandonment of, the registration of the applicant, or any person named under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(q): each state in which the applicant currently is registered as an athlete agent or has applied to be registered as an athlete agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(r): if the applicant is certified or registered by a professional league or players association:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(r)(i): the name of the league or association;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(r)(ii): the date of certification or registration, and the date of expiration of the certification or registration, if any; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(r)(iii): if applicable, the date of any denial of an application for, suspension or revocation of, refusal to renew, withdrawal of, or termination of, the certification or registration or any reprimand or censure related to the certification or registration; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(1)(s): any additional information required by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(2): (1) Instead of proceeding under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(2)(a): a copy of the application for registration in the other state;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(2)(b): a statement that identifies any material change in the information on the application or verifies there is no material change in the information, signed under penalty of perjury; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(2)(c): a copy of the certificate of registration from the other state.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(3): (2) The division shall issue a certificate of registration to an individual who applies for registration under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(3)(a): the application and registration requirements of the other state are substantially similar to or more restrictive than this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(3)(b): the registration has not been revoked or suspended and no action involving the individual's conduct as an athlete agent is pending against the individual or the individual's registration in any state.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(4): (3) For purposes of implementing Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(4)(a): cooperate with national organizations concerned with athlete agent issues and agencies in other states that register athlete agents to develop a common registration form and determine which states have laws that are substantially similar to or more restrictive than this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-202(4)(b): exchange information, including information related to actions taken against registered athlete agents or their registrations, with those organizations and agencies.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-203 Certificate of registration -- Issuance or denial -- Renewal.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-203(1): (2); 58-87-202(1) Except as otherwise provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-203(2): 58-87-202(1); 58-87-401 The division may refuse to issue a certificate of registration to an applicant for registration under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-203(2)(a): pleaded guilty or no contest to, has been convicted of, or has charges pending for, a crime that would involve moral turpitude or be a felony if committed in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-203(2)(b): made a materially false, misleading, deceptive, or fraudulent representation in the application or as an athlete agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-203(2)(c): engaged in conduct that would disqualify the applicant from serving in a fiduciary capacity;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-203(2)(d): 58-87-401 engaged in conduct prohibited by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-203(2)(e): had a registration as an athlete agent suspended, revoked, or denied in any state;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-203(2)(f): been refused renewal of registration as an athlete agent in any state;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-203(2)(g): engaged in conduct resulting in imposition of a sanction, suspension, or declaration of ineligibility to participate in an interscholastic, intercollegiate, or professional athletic event on a student athlete or a sanction on an educational institution; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-203(2)(h): engaged in conduct that adversely reflects on the applicant's credibility, honesty, or integrity.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-203(3): (2) In making a determination under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-203(3)(a): how recently the conduct occurred;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-203(3)(b): the nature of the conduct and the context in which it occurred; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-203(3)(c): other relevant conduct of the applicant.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-203(4): (1) An athlete agent registered under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-203(5): 58-87-202(2); (4) An athlete agent registered under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-203(5)(a): the registration requirements of the other state are substantially similar to or more restrictive than this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-203(5)(b): the renewed registration has not been suspended or revoked and no action involving the individual's conduct as an athlete agent is pending against the individual or the individual's registration in any state.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-203(6): A certificate of registration or a renewal of a registration is valid for two years.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-204 Suspension, revocation, or refusal to renew registration.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-204(1): 58-87-203(1); 58-87-203(2) The division may limit, suspend, revoke, or refuse to renew a registration of an individual registered under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-204(2): 58-87-202(2); 58-87-203(5); 58-87-203(2) The division may suspend or revoke the registration of an individual registered under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-205 Temporary registration.
-------------------------------------------------------
The division may issue a temporary certificate of registration as an athlete agent while an application for registration or renewal of registration is pending.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-206 Registration and renewal fees.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-206(1): 63J-1-504 An application for registration or renewal of registration shall be accompanied by a fee in an amount determined by the division in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-206(2): The division shall establish fees for:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-206(2)(a): an initial application for registration;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-206(2)(b): an application for registration based upon a certificate of registration or licensure issued by another state;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-206(2)(c): an application for renewal of registration; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-206(2)(d): an application for renewal of registration based upon an application for renewal of registration submitted in another state.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-301 Required form of contract.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-301(1): An agency contract must be in a record signed by the parties.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-301(2): An agency contract must contain:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-301(2)(a): a statement that the athlete agent is registered as an athlete agent in this state and a list of any other states in which the agent is registered as an athlete agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-301(2)(b): the amount and method of calculating the consideration to be paid by the student athlete for services to be provided by the agent under the contract and any other consideration the agent has received or will receive from any other source for entering into the contract or providing the services;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-301(2)(c): the name of any person not listed in the agent's application for registration or renewal of registration which will be compensated because the athlete signed the contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-301(2)(d): a description of any expenses the athlete agrees to reimburse;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-301(2)(e): a description of the services to be provided to the athlete;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-301(2)(f): the duration of the contract; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-301(2)(g): the date of execution.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-301(3): (7) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-301(4): An agency contract must be accompanied by a separate record signed by the student athlete or, if the athlete is a minor, the parent or guardian of the athlete acknowledging that signing the contract may result in the loss of the athlete's eligibility to participate in the athlete's sport.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-301(5): A student athlete or, if the athlete is a minor, the parent or guardian of the athlete may void an agency contract that does not conform to this section. If the contract is voided, any consideration received from the athlete agent under the contract to induce entering into the contract is not required to be returned.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-301(6): (4) At the time an agency contract is executed, the athlete agent shall give the student athlete or, if the athlete is a minor, the parent or guardian of the athlete a copy in a record of the contract and the separate acknowledgment required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-301(7): (3) If a student athlete is a minor, an agency contract must be signed by the parent or guardian of the minor and the notice required by Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-302 Notice to educational institution.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-302(1): As used in this section, "communicating or attempting to communicate" means contacting or attempting to contact by an in-person meeting, a record, or any other method that conveys or attempts to convey a message.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-302(2): Not later than 72 hours after entering into an agency contract or before the next scheduled athletic event in which the student athlete may participate, whichever occurs first, the athlete agent shall give notice in a record of the existence of the contract to the athletic director of the educational institution at which the athlete is enrolled or at which the agent has reasonable grounds to believe the athlete intends to enroll.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-302(3): Not later than 72 hours after entering into an agency contract or before the next scheduled athletic event in which the student athlete may participate, whichever occurs first, the athlete shall inform the athletic director of the educational institution at which the athlete is enrolled that the athlete has entered into an agency contract and the name and contact information of the athlete agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-302(4): If an athlete agent enters into an agency contract with a student athlete and the athlete subsequently enrolls at an educational institution, the agent shall notify the athletic director of the institution of the existence of the contract not later than 72 hours after the agent knew or should have known the athlete enrolled.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-302(5): If an athlete agent has a relationship with a student athlete before the athlete enrolls in an educational institution and receives an athletic scholarship from the institution, the agent shall notify the institution of the relationship not later than ten days after the enrollment if the agent knows or should have known of the enrollment and:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-302(5)(a): the relationship was motivated in whole or part by the intention of the agent to recruit or solicit the athlete to enter an agency contract in the future; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-302(5)(b): the agent directly or indirectly recruited or solicited the athlete to enter an agency contract before the enrollment.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-302(6): An athlete agent shall give notice in a record to the athletic director of any educational institution at which a student athlete is enrolled before the agent communicates or attempts to communicate with:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-302(6)(a): the athlete or, if the athlete is a minor, a parent or guardian of the athlete, to influence the athlete or parent or guardian to enter into an agency contract; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-302(6)(b): another individual to have that individual influence the athlete or, if the athlete is a minor, the parent or guardian of the athlete to enter into an agency contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-302(7): If a communication or attempt to communicate with an athlete agent is initiated by a student athlete or another individual on behalf of the athlete, the agent shall notify in a record the athletic director of any educational institution at which the athlete is enrolled. The notification must be made not later than 10 days after the communication or attempt.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-302(8): An educational institution that becomes aware of a violation of this chapter by an athlete agent shall notify the division and any professional league or players association with which the institution is aware the agent is licensed or registered of the violation.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-303 Student athlete's right to cancel.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-303(1): A student athlete or, if the athlete is a minor, the parent or guardian of the athlete may cancel an agency contract by giving notice in a record of cancellation to the athlete agent not later than 14 days after the contract is signed.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-303(2): A student athlete or, if the athlete is a minor, the parent or guardian of the athlete may not waive the right to cancel an agency contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-303(3): If a student athlete, parent, or guardian cancels an agency contract, the athlete, parent, or guardian is not required to pay any consideration under the contract or return any consideration received from the athlete agent to influence the athlete to enter into the contract.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-304 Required records.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-304(1): An athlete agent shall create and retain for five years records of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-304(1)(a): the name and address of each individual represented by the agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-304(1)(b): each agency contract entered into by the agent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-304(1)(c): the direct costs incurred by the agent in the recruitment or solicitation of each student athlete to enter into an agency contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-304(2): (1) Records described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-401 Prohibited conduct.
---------------------------------------------------
An athlete agent may not intentionally:Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-401(1): give a student athlete or, if the athlete is a minor, a parent or guardian of the athlete materially false or misleading information or make a materially false promise or representation with the intent to influence the athlete, parent, or guardian to enter into an agency contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-401(2): furnish anything of value to a student athlete or another individual, if to do so may result in loss of the athlete's eligibility to participate in the athlete's sport, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-401(2)(a): the agent notifies the athletic director of the educational institution at which the athlete is enrolled or at which the agent has reasonable grounds to believe the athlete intends to enroll, not later than 72 hours after giving the thing of value; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-401(2)(b): the athlete or, if the athlete is a minor, a parent or guardian of the athlete acknowledges to the agent in a record that receipt of the thing of value may result in loss of the athlete's eligibility to participate in the athlete's sport;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-401(3): initiate contact, directly or indirectly, with a student athlete or, if the athlete is a minor, a parent or guardian of the athlete to recruit or solicit the athlete, parent, or guardian to enter into an agency contract unless registered under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-401(4): 58-87-304 fail to create, retain, or permit inspection of the records required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-401(5): 58-87-201 fail to register when required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-401(6): provide materially false or misleading information in an application for registration or renewal of registration;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-401(7): predate or postdate an agency contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-401(8): fail to notify a student athlete or, if the athlete is a minor, a parent or guardian of the athlete before the athlete, parent, or guardian signs an agency contract for a particular sport that the signing may result in loss of the athlete's eligibility to participate in the athlete's sport;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-401(9): (1); (8) encourage another individual to do any of the acts described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-401(10): (1); (8) encourage another individual to assist any other individual in doing any of the acts described in Subsections


Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-402 Criminal penalties.
---------------------------------------------------
An athlete agent who violates Section

Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-403 Civil remedies.
-----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-403(1): An educational institution or student athlete may bring an action for damages against an athlete agent if the institution or athlete is adversely affected by an act or omission of the agent in violation of this chapter. An educational institution or student athlete is adversely affected by an act or omission of the agent only if, because of the act or omission, the institution or an individual who was a student athlete at the time of the act or omission and enrolled in the institution:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-403(1)(a): is suspended or disqualified from participation in an interscholastic or intercollegiate sports event by or under the rules of a state or national federation or association that promotes or regulates interscholastic or intercollegiate sports; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-403(1)(b): suffers financial damage.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-403(2): A plaintiff that prevails in an action under this section may recover damages, costs, and reasonable attorney fees. An athlete agent found liable under this section forfeits any right of payment for anything of benefit or value provided to the student athlete and shall refund any consideration paid to the agent by or on behalf of the athlete.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-403(3): This chapter does not restrict rights, remedies, or defenses of any person under law or equity.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-404 Civil and administrative penalty.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-404(1): The division may assess a civil penalty against an athlete agent not to exceed $25,000 for a violation of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-404(2): (1); 13-1-2 An administrative penalty collected under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-501 Uniformity of application and construction.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
In applying and construing this uniform act, consideration shall be given to the need to promote uniformity of the law with respect to its subject matter among states that enact it.

Utah Code Annotated § 58-87-502 Electronic Signatures in Global and National Commerce Act.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The provisions of this chapter modify, limit, or supersede the Electronic Signatures in Global and National Commerce Act, 15 U.S.C. Sec. 7001 et seq., but do not modify, limit, or supersede 15 U.S.C. Sec. 7001(c) or authorize electronic delivery of any of the notices described in 15 U.S.C. Sec. 7003(b).

Utah Code Annotated - Title 58 - Chapter 88 - General Health Professions
************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-201 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-201(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-201(1)(a): "Dispense" means the delivery by a prescriber of a prescription drug or device to a patient, including the packaging, labeling, and security necessary to prepare and safeguard the drug or device for supplying to a patient.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-201(1)(b): "Dispense" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-201(1)(b)(i): prescribing or administering a drug or device; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-201(1)(b)(ii): delivering to a patient a sample packaged for individual use by a licensed manufacturer or re-packager of a drug or device.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-201(2): Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; 58-31b-301(2)(d); Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act "Dispensing practitioner" means an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-201(2)(a): Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; 58-31b-301(2)(d); Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act is currently licensed as:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-201(2)(a)(i): Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act a physician and surgeon under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-201(2)(a)(ii): Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act an osteopathic physician and surgeon under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-201(2)(a)(iii): 58-31b-301(2)(d) an advanced practice registered nurse under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-201(2)(a)(iv): Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act a physician assistant under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-201(2)(b): is authorized by state law to prescribe and administer drugs in the course of professional practice; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-201(2)(c): practices at a licensed dispensing practice.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-201(3): 58-17b-102 "Drug" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-201(4): 26B-2-201 "Health care practice" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-201(4)(a): 26B-2-201 a health care facility as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-201(4)(b): the offices of one or more private prescribers, whether for individual or group practice.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-201(5): 58-88-202 "Licensed dispensing practice" means a health care practice that is licensed as a dispensing practice under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202 Dispensing practice -- Drugs that may be dispensed -- Limitations and exceptions.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(1): 58-17b-302; Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act Notwithstanding Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(1)(a): Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act packaged in a fixed quantity per package by:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(1)(a)(i): the drug manufacturer;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(1)(a)(ii): a pharmaceutical wholesaler or distributor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(1)(a)(iii): Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act a pharmacy licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(1)(b): dispensed:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(1)(b)(i): at a licensed dispensing practice at which the dispensing practitioner regularly practices; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(1)(b)(ii): under a prescription issued by the dispensing practitioner to the dispensing practitioner's patient;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(1)(c): for a condition that is not expected to last longer than 30 days; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(1)(d): for a condition for which the patient has been evaluated by the dispensing practitioner on the same day on which the dispensing practitioner dispenses the drug.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(2): 58-37-2; 58-88-205(2) A dispensing practitioner may not dispense:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(2)(a): 58-37-2 a controlled substance as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(2)(b): 58-88-205(2) a drug or class of drugs that is designated by the division under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(2)(c): gabapentin; or
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(2)(d): a supply of a drug under this part that exceeds a 30-day supply.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(3): A dispensing practitioner may not make a claim against workers' compensation or automobile insurance for a drug dispensed under this part for outpatient use unless the dispensing practitioner is contracted with a pharmacy network established by the claim payor.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(4): When a dispensing practitioner dispenses a drug to the patient under this part, a dispensing practitioner shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(4)(a): disclose to the patient verbally and in writing that the patient is not required to fill the prescription through the licensed dispensing practice and that the patient has a right to fill the prescription through a pharmacy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(4)(b): if the patient will be responsible to pay cash for the drug, disclose:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(4)(b)(i): that the patient will be responsible to pay cash for the drug; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(4)(b)(ii): the amount that the patient will be charged by the licensed dispensing practice for the drug.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(5): Chapter 17b, Part 8, Dispensing Medical Practitioner and Dispensing Medical Practitioner Clinic Pharmacy; 58-17b-102; 58-1-501.3; 58-17b-610; 58-17b-610.5; Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act This part does not:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(5)(a): require a dispensing practitioner to dispense a drug under this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(5)(b): Chapter 17b, Part 8, Dispensing Medical Practitioner and Dispensing Medical Practitioner Clinic Pharmacy limit a health care prescriber from dispensing under
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(5)(c): 58-17b-102; 58-1-501.3; 58-17b-610; 58-17b-610.5; Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act apply to a physician who dispenses:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(5)(c)(i): 58-17b-102; 58-1-501.3; 58-17b-610 a drug sample, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(5)(c)(ii): 58-17b-610.5 a prescription drug or device to a patient for a patient's immediate need in an emergency department in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-202(5)(c)(iii): Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act a drug in an emergency situation as defined by the division in rule under


Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203 Application for licensure as a licensed dispensing practice -- Requirements -- Notification -- Dispensing.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(1): 63J-1-504 An applicant for licensure as a dispensing practice shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(1)(a): submit a written application in the form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(1)(b): 63J-1-504 pay a fee as determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(1)(c): provide any additional information required by the division by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(2)(a): A dispensing practice shall designate at least one responsible dispensing practitioner who is responsible for all activities of the licensed dispensing practice related to the dispensing of drugs under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(2)(b): A responsible dispensing practitioner for the licensed dispensing practice shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(2)(b)(i): be currently licensed to prescribe and administer drugs in the course of professional practice;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(2)(b)(ii): practice at the licensed dispensing practice;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(2)(b)(iii): accept responsibility for the operation of the licensed dispensing practice related to the dispensing of drugs under this part and in accordance with all laws and rules relating to the dispensing of drugs at the licensed dispensing practice; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(2)(b)(iv): be personally in full and actual charge of the operation of the licensed dispensing practice related to the dispensing of drugs under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(2)(c): Whenever an applicable statute or rule requires or prohibits action by a licensed dispensing practice, the responsible dispensing practitioner or practitioners and the owner of the licensed dispensing practice shall be responsible for all activities of the licensed dispensing practice, regardless of the form of the business or entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(3): 58-1-308
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(3)(a): Each license issued under this section shall be issued for a single, specific address, and is not transferable or assignable.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(3)(b): Each license issued under this section shall be issued in accordance with a two-year renewal cycle established by the division by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(3)(c): The division may extend or shorten a renewal period for a period of up to one year to maintain established renewal cycles or to change an established renewal cycle.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(3)(d): 58-1-308 Each license automatically expires on the expiration date shown on the license unless the license is renewed by the licensee in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(4): (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(4)(a): A licensed dispensing practice shall report in writing to the division not later than 10 business days before the date of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(4)(a)(i): a permanent closure of the licensed dispensing practice;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(4)(a)(ii): a change of name or ownership of the licensed dispensing practice;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(4)(a)(iii): a change of location of the licensed dispensing practice; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(4)(a)(iv): any matter or occurrence that the division requires by rule to be reported.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(4)(b): As defined by the division by rule, a licensed dispensing practice shall report in writing to the division:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(4)(b)(i): theft of a drug, immediately after the licensed dispensing practice is aware that theft has occurred; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(4)(b)(ii): a disaster, accident, or emergency that may affect the purity or labeling of a drug, medication, device, or other material used in the diagnosis or treatment of injury, illness, or disease immediately upon the occurrence of the disaster, accident, or emergency.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-203(4)(c): (4) A reporting licensed dispensing practice shall maintain a copy of any notification required by this Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-204 Administrative inspections of a dispensing practice -- Penalties.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-204(1): The division shall conduct audits and inspections of licensed dispensing practices in accordance with standards established by the division by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-204(2): 58-1-502 Penalties for a violation of this part, including fines and citations, shall be issued by the division under:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-204(2)(a): 58-1-502 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-204(2)(b): the dispensing practitioner's respective licensing chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-205 Operating standards -- Rulemaking.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-205(1): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The division shall make rules in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-205(1)(a): security;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-205(1)(b): labeling;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-205(1)(c): storage;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-205(1)(d): supervision;
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-205(1)(e): inventory control; and
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-205(1)(f): patient counseling.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-205(2): The division may designate individual medications and classes of medications that may not be dispensed at a licensed dispensing practice under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-205(3): 58-67-201; 58-17b-201 When making rules under this part, the division shall consult with a group consisting of:
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-205(3)(a): 58-67-201 two members of the Physicians Licensing Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 58-88-205(3)(b): 58-17b-201 two members of the Utah State Board of Pharmacy created in Section
